reviews.review: a true disappointment. Too expensive, too crowded, not unusual or interestingly curated. Repetitious, disappointing. The most well-tended aspect was the inevitable gift shop.

Great place to visit with the kids. We have been here twice now, it's a lovely aquarium with a good selection of exhibits and popular with both adults and children. Very good value compared to some other aquariums and you can buy tickets online in advance. Good location as you can have a nice walk along the riverfront as well, and it is near the metro and shopping centre.
Diving into the oceans of the world. a very good concept with a huge main tank and four peripheric tanks/galleries, showing the huge variations of life in the ocean around the globe.
SUN FISH!!!!. Great place for a couple of hours visit! You can see all the different oceans' species. The Sun Fish is definitely the main attraction!

Wonders of the underwater world.. It was just so surreal. The colorful marine world is simply incredible and you just don't want to leave this place. You just can't help your mind wandering over underwater fairy tales. Definitely will go back to this place again.

Great place to visit. We were here in October and not so crowded so it was a fantastic time for us to visit. Really not sure what it would be like in peak season so I am basing my review when we were there. Lines were short and quick. The various aquariums housing the many different species of fish around the world is incredible. Go slow and get the full experience with all the creatures that you will probably never get to see again unless going to remote untouched Islands. The Sunfish was my highlight. Easy to get to by train. After the Oceanarium why not stop off at the shopping Centre. It's huge. Make a whole day of it. Remember, you are on holidays so bring your friend "Patience" with you. No rush, just love it.
See the Sea. If you love animals and ocean life this is the place for you. With a wide range of ocean life this Oceanarium is one of the best I've been to by far.
One of the best places for visit in Lisbon. Very,very interesting area and attraction for all tipe tourists. I never see the same similar place in Europe. Enjoy

Excellent - pay extra for temporary exhibition. This was one of the best aquariums that we have visited on our travels. As a Physicist and an IT specialist this is not our usual area of science but there was something restful about the place and the temporary exhibit- sea gardens by a Japanese architect was stunning.

The wonder of the marine life. One of the best aquarium of the world. Inaugurated in 1998 for the world exposition of Lisbon. The size of it, the variety of fish from all the oceans, the care and maintenence that it involves, the varity of food for each single fish, makes us surprised

Absolutely not worth the money you have to pay. for the ticket. 17 euros for permanent and temporary exhibits is just too much as they are not that amazing. Maybe if you don't expect too much, you'll be satisfied.
Super aquarium!. Fantastic tanks and variety of species. Great for families or people just visiting. The large tank has many habitats and the smaller tanks have rare species. Price is reasonable.

An amazing experience. This is huge, with the biggest range of fishes and other sea creatures that we have ever seen. It is cleverly constructed so that most of the exhibits can be viewed from different angles.
Allow yourself at least two hours to do it justice.

Truly emmersive! You feel like you are walking in the ocean.. We had visited with our oldest son back in 1998. After 18 years we went back with our youngest and it was surprisingly new to all of us. It was as impressive and immersive has in the first time. Great at any time but specially pleasant on a Lisbon hot sunny day.

Great hour to spend . If you haven't been in an aquarium before them its a must. Coming from Ireland where the aquarium in bray is the best we have then this blows you away. Just don't bother with any extra tour add ons as it's a rip off just choose the permanent exhibit which is the main aquarium and a family ticket is about €40.

Magnificent underwater sights. We visited the Oceanarium on a rainy day last winter. Ordering tickets in advance online is recommended as there was a pretty long line outside. Once inside, however, the site had more than enough capacity to absorb all visitors. The Oceanarium offers a huge central aquarium, surrounded by other exhibits. The clever layout makes sure that there are always new nooks and crannies to see, without ever sacrificing the feeling of being absorbed by the greatness of the seas. If you are curious about sealife, Oceanarium is a must.

Nature is Beautiful. I had been in the Lisbon Oceanarium before a couple of times, maybe last time I went there was a decade ago. I am always impressed with the variety species held there, the animals seem happy and the recreation of their natural environment is astonishing. It's always full of people but in a week day you can walk at ease and appreciate the sharks, see the enormous sunfish, the devil rays, otters, and others. The price it can be considered a bit high, but you have to remind that in order to maintain a piece of nature that size for us to see it's expensive and requires so much effort, that I can say the price is fair. You can take your children with you. Another very important thing about this Oceanarium is that they work together with WWF in a perspective to save our oceans. It's a great place were you can spend easily more than 2 hours wandering.

Amazing time!. My husband and I went there on a Tuesday morning - perfect timing! It wasn't crowded, so there wasn't a long line to buy tickets. The aquarium is awesome. There are many species to appreciate. We loved to see them so close! Although we don't have kids, we saw that the kids there were having a great time. There were also some groups of seniors having a blast. Thus, we can say it's appealing to all ages.

Wow it's like you're swimming with the fish!. The oceanarium is located in the area that had been developed years ago for a worlds fair. It is in a park like setting with large modern buildings apartments shopping mall and casino. The area is on the water and the oceanarium seems to be sitting in the water. There is a huge two story tank in the middle that you walk around while seeing everything and the fish include large stingrays, sharks, barracudas and others. You can sit on benches and watch the fish swimming. It is great for kids. The Orient metro station is about a 10 minute walk to the aquarium.
Nice place to visit with kids. Nice place to visit but I don't think is a "must". Kids can enjoy it. Recommend to get the tickets online to avoid queues.

not the best. Having been to several oceanrariums this is not the best
I like the ecological aspect but you do not get up close and personal

This is one of the most beautiful aquariums I've ever experienced.. My husband and I took our two young grandchildren to the oceanarium. It was wonderful. There were many, many exhibits that were very well kept and educational. There were signs and descriptions in English so that we could learn about all of the fish and animals on display. It was a wonderful experience!

Good way to spend a few hours learning about the sealife. Knowing the oceanarium has one central aquarium I was not expecting much. I was surprised to see it is well-incorporated, you can walk around on two levels to see the inner life but all the open surface aquariums are gorgeaus. We saw as the staff fed the otters, looking for the inhabitants in terrariums and the fact and stories of the animals makes the whole visit more enjoyable, especially if you are with kids.

Good but can be better . Very good place to spend the afternoon with your girl or kids. They have very different species and it's well organized If the place has more entertainment to childrens it could be better

Nice place to go on a rainy day. It was raining the day we went to the aquarium we had been in Sintra in the morning and returned to Lisbon due to rain. It is a nice aquarium with interesting species.

Pleasant way to pass an hour. Nice aquarium , with a large selection of sea creatures.Avoid the shop and cafe on the way out as the prices are crazy.Apart from that it's well laid out with plenty to see and hear
Beautiful, worth the visit!. It was a very nice aquarium zoo! Really beautiful and we enjoyed it very much. Really worth a visit when you are in Lisbon.
I love it. I have been to Lisbon Oceanarium many times and are never bored. I love the beauty, interaction and watching the children watching the exhibits. A lovely place which is never boring.

Wonderful experience. To my mind this is one of the best things in Lisbon. After the negative reviews I had seen here I wasn't expecting much. Nevertheless, I can admit I loved it a lot. Especially I appreciated the fact that the penguins were free so that one can see them very closely.
Amazing experience. An interesting walk through the world of the sea. Lots of interesting and informative facts and figures to take in.

Wonderful place to take the Children. The Oceanario de Lisboa is one of the finest aquariums in the world.Built for EXPO 98, this huge aquarium is a marvel of conception, and a mandatory visit to every child (and adults also). More than the large collection of sea inhabitants :-) , covering all the world, the way it is reproduced the environmental conditions of each species, it's almost perfect. The Oceanario is open daily from 10am to 8pm. It closes at 7pm during the winter months.
Expensive. 17 euro per person, and very small, only need 30mins you can finish the visit. inside only one big tank, nothing special.

Stunning. Amazing oceanarium with a central tank that features a large variety of fish including shark, barracuda, sting rays etc. What was fun, were the various rooms you could walk into which had animals - the room with penguins and sea birds was particularly fun with a game of tag running between the penguins diving for fish and the sea birds chasing them.Would really recommend the temporary exhibit which we found truly amazing and moving.However, at all costs, avoid the awful restaurant/ The menu del dia was possibly - no definately - the most awful meal we had ever experienced anywhere in an attraction of this kind.

A good aquarium. Because we have visited so many great aquariums on our travels, we would not have gone out of our way to visit this one. However, because we ended our day nearby, we decided to visit it. Certainly it was worth our time but not as outstanding as it is made out to be.

Amazing day out. My friends and I had the best time at the Lisbon Ocenarium. There are a lot of things to see and do so it's best if you have at least half a day reserved for this activity. There's cafes and restaurants around if you want to make it a full day activity. I would especially recommend the otter exhibit - we caught them at feeding time (noon-ish) and it was the cutest thing I've ever seen.There's also a gondola life next to the Ocenarium that provides some really nice views of the city. This is a must see in Lisbon in my opinion :)
Brilliant for family tyrip. What a place two Sun Fish and sharks, Rays and crabs the size of small cars. Really well laid out with different sea areas, Pengins and all sorts,
A day well spent with the animals. It is a nice place to spend a big part of the day with your family enjoying the big and small animals of our oceans.The price is a bit expensive though.

A must see in your travel to Lisbon!. Oceanarium was built for Expo 98 to educate people about the maritime environments and their inhabitants. Both the big tank as well as the smaller ones for specific habitats are well worth the visit. It is a very nice place to visit regularly; I find it very relaxing to stay and just looks at the fishes in the big tank.There are temporary exhibitions that are worth a visit too, as the Underwater Forest.
Great attractions . The oceanarium had some great displays, including sharks, penguins and otters. I recommend going during the week as it fills with families and kids on the weekends.
Relax on a saturday. Went there to see a Takashi Amano exhibition and enjoy the opportunity to see all the Oceanarium... had a good and relaxing time. Ideal for kids.

This is well worth visiting.. The experience was great - the collection of fish and birds and animals are well worth spending a couple of hours looking at. The main tank is viewed from the top, middle and bottom and the fish are spectacular. There are lots of smaller tanks with various other fish from different parts of the world, so from the Indian ocean and the Pacific which is complementary to the Atlantic main tank. The sun fish are spectacular. Outside the penguins were being fed at the time we visited and that was fun to watch as an adult, but the children thought it was wonderful. Definitely worth the entry fee.

Best in europe. One of the best aquariums in Europe.The central tank is amazing and i could stay hours looking at it.Now have a temporary exposition with a Amano's fresh water planted aquarium that´s the second wonder in the Oceanarium...One of the best places for animal lovers

Time well spent. It´s full of beautiful animals. Children love it. Wear confortable shoes, don´t have many places to seat down. People seat on the floor to watch the fishes in the big tanks, it´s really good.
Amazingly Beautiful!!!. Amazing place to discover. The aquariums have all different kinds of fishes, plants, and corals illuminated in different colors.

The Best of Aquariums. It's rated as the best aquarium in Europe, but I think it's the best in the world. The "temporary" exhibition of Forests Underwater is most certainly the world's largest "nature aquarium. It is 40 meters long with 46 species of aquatic plants in exquisitely artful arrangement with 10,000 freshwater tropical fish of 40 different species. This took my breath away.The permanent exhibition is no slouch either. A huge central 5,000,000 liter seawater tank visible from two levels is surrounded on four corners by marine ecosystems for each of the North Atlantic, Antarctica, Pacific, and Indian oceans. I could spend all week in this place.

Impressive and fun. This is a wonderful collection of sea animals who seem very happy in their lovely habitats. Explanatory exhibits in English and Portuguese. Special kids' area, though the kids I saw were mainly interested in the animals. Emphasis on protecting the environment. Strongly recommended.
ATRACTIVE. A different aquarium. We visited when there was also a temporary exhibition of Japanese photographer Takashi Amano - a forest underwater. Amazing.

A Fish Out of Water. Good large aquarium, many types of fish and divers among them feeding and cleaning. The emphasis is on conversation and the importance of looking after our oceans, and this attraction clearly does just that, they also have bird life and mammals ie otters in the surface areas

Simply the Best!. We went primarily for our 10 year old son - he loved it and so did we. I have visited many similar places all over the world and found nowhere to compare with the Oceanarium. A long way from the center of Lisbon but well worth the effort. Stunning displays of fish and sea creatures in almost natural surroundings - so much thought and care went into the design and the way the creatures are cared for is truly outstanding. Thank you for a wonderful visit.

Nice and educational . Great aquarium with a least a few hours good family entertainment. Next to a big mall, ocean front promenade and experimentation, so it's easy to spend a whole day in Parque de nascos.
Enjoyable . Brought our kids here very enjoyable great tanks and viewing of all the fish. Would recommend if the weather is bad

A trip through the oceans. wonderful! We are invited to a realistic stroll to the ocean world, appreciating wide life in a close proximity and in scenarios tha recreate with detail the real habitays. Instructive for adults and children and, in some cases, pure magic.
Brilliant. A wonderful place, one of the highlights of our trip to Lisbon. Especially good value to use your hop on hop off ticket for discount.

World Class Acquarium. This is a must see in Lisbon. It is a cab ride to get there but the facility is wonderful. The building is raised and built around an extremely large main "ocean" which you view from various perspectives as you walk around. Due to the size there are very large sharks, rays and other sensational animals to see.Very kid friendly and lots of room to see the panoramas regardless of age or height .Several exhibits such as penguins have external exhibits where you get close to the animals above water and then later see them underwater.Area is near a restaurant complex so you can take a lunch break and then return for more.

A very nice stop. We took a day to relax and this was the place. Right along the ocean you get to witness the second largest tank in the world. It is a great place to relax after spending a few days on the go sightseeing.

Highly enjoyable. We visited the Oceanarium and were so impressed! The large tank is truly amazing with a huge variety of fish, large and small. We were captivated by the display and even more so as we watched children enraptured and excited.There are signs all the way along the entry way, reminding us of how deeply important the sea is to all of us and the necessity of doing a good job of being stewards of our earth, suggesting ways each of us can help. It was very impactful and effective.So, all in all, but entertaining and educational.

1st time in Lisbon . Definitely worth the visit. Very unique and well planned out facility right on the water near plenty of restaurants. Easy to get to by metro Avoid lines and crowds by arriving early and purchase tickets ahead of time online or at hotel if they offer them.

Excellent Variety of Fish from Around the World!. A beautifully designed oceanarium which maximises the indoor experience essentially. There are no shows, no external viewing areas. Like most oceanariums, it has a large central tank with lots of varieties of fish including sharks. It has a lot of viewing areas available to view the central tank. It has smaller exhibits of fish from very ocean and region from around the world. It has an antarctic penguin exhibit that is excellent. Overall a great way to spend a couple of hours in the late afternoon. It is best to visit between 4pm and 7pm when it is much quieter and not as crowded.

Nice for an afternoon visit!. Very nice, but a little bit small. The variety of animals was really big, but we still missed certain interesting species. TIP: Make sure to buy your ticket online, to avoid huge lines to buy tickets.

Amazing. Spent a good 4 hours here. Very relaxing although my legs were aching from the walking. The fishes and animals were so worth it though!The feeding times were a bit confusing so we didn't really catch any.

Worth visiting!. I've visited the oceanarium at the beginning of October. The entrance fee is 14 euro/adult. There's a main large aquarium in the center and other smaller aquariums around it, divided by habitats from tropical waters to arctic ocean. The information displayed is very useful and easy to understand and read for all ages. I particularly enjoyed the film where they were explaining how they take care of the fishes and the tank, as well as the little sea dragon. Plan a 1-2h visit and enjoy a very relaxing visit right by the river's shore.
Great aquarium. We had a great time here with the kids. Large central tank with lots of side tanks to visit. Strongly recommended, especially if its a rainy or hot day.
amazing. how they make the main tank have so many fish in is truly fantastic, we didn't have kids but spent 2 plus hours looking at this amazing Oceanarium

Wonderful place, something for everyone. We chose this as our first visit in Lisbon and were not disappointed. We were all suffering jet lag so we all did our own thing enjoying fish from various parts of the world. We all fell in love with the giant sunfish! and the penguins. Surprised to see a puffin in captivity. It is really worth the effort, though the entry fees are a little steep.
Amazing. What can we say it's an amazing place to visit - huge water pools where it can get up close and not feel you gave to move on too quickly - definitely a place to visit in Lisbon
Very nice collection. The oceanarium has a very nice collection and a great setup, where you Salk arose the main tank looking at many sharks, rays and a couple of Moon fishes. A great visit.
a mus visit. you can see all the sea creatures. nothing special. just like any other sea aqauarium if you have seen in any other city.

A good afternoon spent!. Great option for an indoor afternoon with kids. Get there at 2.30 and around 3.00 ish they feed the otters and the other sea creatures that's fun to watch. Also fantastic is their central tank and their tropical fish

Nothing special. Not sure why this place is ranked number 1 on Tripadvisor for things to do in Lisbon. Even on a weekday in October there was still a long queue to buy tickets and then had to shuffle round all the tanks waiting our turn to get to the front to see the marine life. A lot of the walkways are dark so not great. Although the central aquarium can be seen from all the zones (Pacific, Atlantic, Indian and Antarctic) it's really the same fishes you see each time. I enjoyed the penguins, starfish, jellyfish, garden eels and smaller creatures more than the bigger fish in the central aquarium. Although each tank had signage there were no touch pools or feeding times or any interactive activities for children. We spent two hours at the attraction but that was moving slowly with the crowds. Not the best value even with the yellowbus discount making entrance Euro 11.20 each. Think I would have preferred to spend my time visiting the more traditional fado or azulejo museum.

Huge aquarium and lots of species. Very big aquarium, well maintained. Many species of fishes, some truly incredible. The oceonarium is quite full of people in August, even during the week, but it kind of 'flows'. Amazing temporary expo on submarine plant worlds from a talented Japanese artist (sorry I forgot his name).
Mesmerising. One of the most wonderful experiences in Lisbon. It's like being in the ocean with weird and wonderful fish all around

Beautiful but don't rush there with a toddler. What a beautiful experience only marred slightly when my 20 month old started screaming with boredom after 15 minutes of loving all the fishies! Such an intuitive beautiful layout - even with the squalling brat - I managed to appreciate and enjoy the experience.
Ok. Great pleace for kids. Worth to see despite of big quues. Tickets are little bit too expensive. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!

Aquarium visit. Really nice aquarium. We love to visit aquariums on our trips.. One big tank with multiple views... Some large sun fish.. Pretty archaic and large. Near the airport , we did this on the 1st day after we slept off some of our jet lag. Nicely laid out... Good visitor experience
Nice but not as big as they want you to believe. I spent about 35 minutes in there and was done. It is not expensive so if you have some time to kill might be worth

Better than expected. Really surprised by this aquarium. Thought of as the worlds second largest, it really did impress with the main tank and surrounding smaller tanks wth fish from all seas. If anything though, it lacked a little interactivity for kids/grown up kids.
Worth visiting. So much to see. The educational parts of the exhibits are especially meaningfully done, but the sea otters alone are worth the trip.

Great place for a half day. Good for a half day visit.Children loved being about to interact with the rays.There are 4 climate zones for different creatures, and yes the white stuff where the penguins are is reals snow and ice. The main tank is really big and deep so there are some large fish and lots of sharks in here. Smaller aquariums are around the edges with smaller creatures, the octopus tank is mesmerizing, you could watch it for hours. Quite expensive by Portuguese standards but worth a visit especially for a rainy day where you don't want to be outside.There is lots of parking but check if the pay and display machines are active. I think the parking is free on bank holidays and Sundays, as a lot of things are in Portugal.

One of the Best European Oceanariums. Go through the full experience of natural sea life representing the all world. See it above and under the sea going around the full space with different ambience in each of the four corners. At same time delight yourself with the huge "tank" in the middle.

So fun!!. 14 Euros each for adults, easy to reach on train, not too crowded - we had a great time!! They have two Sun Fish/MolaMola which are super unusual! There's a section where they show a short video about caring for/feeding the fish - we saw lots of people skipping it, but it was really good!
Does size matters?. Well, apparently no! I was charmed by the fact this is one if the biggest aquariums in the world, but is quite boring.
Great place, good fun!. We loved the place. It is very professionally done. We learned a lot and are very impressed. It is great with kids, they really enjoyed it.
Beautiful . We had a great time with the kids, the main aquarium is awesome!!! Showing some sharks, moon fish, and other beautiful fish.

Very good place. Wonderful place for children.
Excellent tanks for fishes.
Little too crowded that time but very well organized.
Beautiful aquarium. A beautiful aquarium in a beautiful place. The building has a magnificent architectur. The área is also a beautiful place.

Wonderful oceanarium. We enjoyed every bit of this event. The large tank was magnificent and we saw two divers in there cleaning the window. Enjoyed the information and displays on the different oceans. We also like the temporary exhibit of Japanes underwater forests. Very good use of our time.
Amazing . You will fall in love with this place! I recommend to visit! It's amazing for kids and adults ❤️ but no 🐬

Wow !!!! Incredible. I wasn’t sure if it was worth visiting the Oceanario de Lisboa. It did not get much of a write up in my guide book. The maps in the book did not even cover Oriente, where it is located. This only goes to show just how bad some guide book are. This was the best aquarium I have ever seen. It is stupendous. You can get there on the Metro. On leaving the Metro you will have to follow your paper or Google map because there are no signs until you practically arrive there. It is only a 10 or 1 minute walk. The entire area is worth visiting. Oriente was built for Expo 98. It is beautiful, with lots of well-designed modern buildings. The Oceanario is built on a pier jutting out from the promenade. You can either buy your tickets at a machine or you can queue. The machine is a faster option. Tickets costs: Adult: €13; Child (4-12) €9; Senior (65+) €9. Kids below the age of 3 go free. Kids love the Oceanario. It is the second largest aquarium in Europe. It exhibits more than 15,000 living creatures - 450 different species. The Oceanario has a number of floors. The upper most floor houses a temporary exhibition ‘Submerged Forests’. It does not feel like a temporary exhibition at all. Like everything else at the Oceanario it is splendid.The next two floors house the huge central aquarium. The floors surround this gigantic tank. In the centre there is the main aquarium filled with hundreds of fish, mainly pelagic fish, i.e. fish which live neither close to the bottom nor near the shore. Kids love the sharks and rays. On each floor there are smaller aquariums displaying additional marine species. Many of these are technicoloured species found on reefs. On the upper floor there are surface animals too, such as penguins, sea otters, birds and plants. The sea otters, in particular, are delightful. You should allow at least two hours to get around the Oceanario. The Oceanario does a few unexpected things. There are guided tours. There are sleep-overs for kids – wake up with the sharks (don’t tell them or they will pester you to death); concerts for babies; they also do birthday parties. You will probably have to drag your kids away..

OK, but needs a refresh. As aquariums go it's OK, but not great like those in Singapore or west coast US gems. You can certainly spend a good half day here and if with kids, then they usually love seeing sharks and big fish that are plentiful. Also some sea otters and penguins. It's just a little tired.
The sea otters are very entertaining. Enjoyable visit, seeing the fish and aquatic life in each of the worlds oceans. good value at about 9 euros each or less.
Too crowded to enjoy properly. Excellent facility, the only problem being it's actually too popular and you can't always get to see the smaller (and some of the larger ones) exhibits due to crowding.

Wonderful! A MUST-SEE! Very entertaining!. A very memorable experience for people of any age. This is a really top-notch Oceanarium and we thought all the displays/tanks, etc. were really well done. The huge tank in the center is so cool because you keep seeing it from different angles and from the two different levels. The penguins/puffins were adorable and fun to watch...I could have watched the cute sea lions for hours. I've been to many aquariums and this is the best in my opinion. Don't miss it.
Nicee. Loved it. Great area. Great scenarium. Lovely people. The variety of fish are super interesring and other species

A morning well spent. One of the best aquariums I have been to, in particular I loved the addition of the Underwater Forests exhibit (temporary). It's a great spot for all ages, not just kids. We went in the morning, around 10.30am, and it was starting to get really busy by the time we left at 12pm, so I'd recommend going early or late.

Moonfish!. Lisbon's aquarium is a nice one, the central tank contains an interesting variety of fish, and as you follow the way around the aquarium you can view the fish from all sorts of different angles. The Moonfish was the highlight for me, huge and imposing. There are information boards up all over describing the different fish in English and Portuguese. I also enjoyed the poetry posted around and about.Outside of the main tank there is not a huge variety of life. There are some penguins, some puffins, some (gorgeous) otters. The aquarium isn't very large in comparison with other aquariums but it is worth a visit.

I found Nemo AND Dory.... Winnig. My girlfriend and I try to go to an aquarium in every city we go to. This was not a disappointment! Though not many come close to Chicago's Shed Aquarium, This has a vast variety and is very interesting and informative. I deducted a point because it was a super busy and smelt odd. Otherwise. Its awesome.

Special place. We visited this September and it was not crowded. If you have Lisbon Card you get discount. We started our tour and it was great. There is a big central aquarium which is huge, there is so many animals inside. Oceanarium is divided by oceans, I saw penguins, they were so cute. We stayed there for full 2 hours and we could stay even more.

Terrific . With our three days in Lisbon, the one spot I wanted to make sure we got to see is the Oceanarium. Fairly quick and inexpensive cab ride from the Novotel and well worth the visit. I believe it is rated as one of the best aquariums in Europe and deservedly so.

Great getaway in Lisbon. We had a great time visiting Lisbon Oceanarium this summer. We were here in the middle of July, so it was pretty hot. The Oceanarium was a great getaway and there is a lot to see, both for the children and grown ups alike. Here you can see all kinds of fish and sea animals. The sharks were especially fascinating and our youngest still talk vividly about the shark that was so long he had to take two separate photos to capture its full length :)

Most Beautiful Oceanarium Ever!. They say its Europe's biggest aquarium. My 5 year old son went crazy here. He loved seeing all the aquatic life and insisted on visiting this place every single day of our stay in Lisbon. We thought an aquarium is not the kind of place that would interest us adults but we were proven wrong. The "permanent exhibit" is marvellous and informative! It opened my life to the serious problem of sea pollution and need for conserving our oceans and sea life. Everything is explained beautifully, we learnt so much! The exhibition wasn't crowded and we didn't have to wait in long queues for the tickets or to see the sea life. If you are in Lisbon you must visit this place and make sure you go with atleast 2-3 hours on hand. Once you come out there is a lovely cafe within the premise serving a wonderful selection of coffees you. I has a large open space for kids to run around an play while you sit outside sipping you coffee. A great place to spend an afternoon in lisbon. Highly recommended!

Great way to spend a few hours. Really good aquarium with lots to see. Well worth the price, and located in a good area with lots more to do. Would definitely not recommend the current temporary exhibition! But apart from that it was great.

A magic moment. Beautiful. The sea otters, the sea dragons, the moon fishes: 2h of discovery that were perfect for our 1,5 and 4 boys. We were there on a Monday morning in October and it was not too crowed.
Fishy world of wonder. Excellent place and carefully thought through. Well worth a visit, you cannot fail to be captivated by the creatures, be it the cuddly sea otters or the scary sharks

Superb Oceanarium in Lisbon. A world class aquarium and oceanarium for all to visit and so close to the Metro station it is simple to get there. Cant recommend this enough as it is so relaxing to see such mighty marine habitats with such interesting fish in them.

Massive inside, great experience. The aquarium was great and well priced for how long you could actually spend there. Everything seems to be well restored and there is enough here for most people to enjoy. The only thing I would say is when you get further on downstairs it is almost complete darkness walking around and it's hard to make your way round without bumping into pushchairs or what not.

It is worth it!. To be honest we struggled a little to find it, maybe we didn’t go the right way, but the signals are not easy to see! However once inside you will be captured by the huge central aquarium; this place has two floors and is divided depending on the oceans and the type of fish.I recommend the late afternoon hours, which are less crowded. the price is probably a little excessive (14 €) with 15% discount for holders of the Lisboa Card

Massive main aquarium!. The aquaria were clean and well displayed. The fish (and penguins, crabs etc) were easy to observe. The large central tank contained so many interesting species, especially large ones.

Recent visit. This is an overrated attraction.There is a single large tank and you go round it looking at it from various angles. I dont think that visitors realise that they are loking at the same thing. There are also various small tanks with other fish but nothing spectacular.
Highly recommended!. Wonderful experience. Nice arranged, beautiful underwaterworlds to see would go a 3rd time and a 4th also. But its not that cheap
Very interesting. Amazing experience. You can literally spend hours there.You can book the tockets on line to escape waiting in a lineAmazing world amd amazing presentation.

Worth the trip to Parque das Nacoes. We were a little bit disappointed with Parques das Nacoes because it felt a bit run down in places but the Oceanarium made up for this. It is housed in an interesting very well designed building which features different environments on 2 levels which are sited around a massive central tank with > 400 different species of fish including massive Sunfish which I'd never seen before in any aquarium. Overall it is very well thought out and presented, it also heavily stresses the way we are slowly destroying our oceans and must urgently do something to address this problem. However I've got to say that the sea otters are so cute it's worth visiting just to see them, you can easily pass an hour just watching their antics.

Really good but leave enough time or go early to enjoy the area. One main tank that you view from many different angles. Feeding time is fun and the side rooms and smaller tanks offer everyone of all ages plenty to anjoy. Free Audio experience was good and the restaurant offers good food at reasonable prices too. At €17 plus lunch and travel a good day out with a outdoor coffee shop offering great cakes to finish off the day. Shopping centre nearby too for those that would rather shop.

Brilliant!. After a bit of confusion as to where the entrance of this place was, once there, it was fantastic! There are enclosures (if that's the right word) where there are sea birds, including penguins, swimming and flying around with a rocky backdrop - and you are there with them.The central "tank" holds 5million litres, if I remember correctly, and that is BIG. You view it from several windows aroud the circumference, on ground floor level, or on the first floor. There is a big shoal of fish swimming, I don't know what they were, but they are a blue haze constantly moving in the background. There are lots of other smaller aquariums. The lion fish are huge. The blue tangs and other coral fish are beautiful. I love the camouflaged dragon fish - those guys are so cool, they don't bother to swim, just go with the flow. I took a video of the jellyfish and can't believe how such delicate creatures can survive the oceans.It's excellent value for money. My local Sealife Centre is more expensive, and after this, seems like a pond in comparison.It's very dark inside, but roomy enough not to trip over things, which I've done in my local one.I wanted to go back again next day! It's a must for all lovers of nature. The cafe's ok too.
One of the best aquariums I have ever been too!. This is located in what was the old expo park which I visited in 1998. A truly amazing aquarium and well with the visit! Huge huge tanks
Super interesting aquarium . Very interesting location, use vendor machines in order to avoid queuing in front of ticket office. Great aquarium !

Tour the world's oceans under one roof.. This place is fantastic. A huge aquarium is located in the middle of the building with two floors of exhibits on the outside walls. The interpretive signs are in both Portuguese and English, which really added to our experience. You have a chance to glimpse at life in almost all of the world's oceans. It is really a special place.

A winner. Just a short taxi ride from the centre of Lisbon, and certainly worth the expedition. You can of course go by tube with a short walk but the taxi is good value especially when there are four of you. The whole area around the Oceanarium is on the up with a pleasing feeling of regeneration. The exhibition itself has definitely had recent investment and is an excellent destination. On the day we visited it was busy but not so crowded the tank was obscured with visitors. It's all very clearly described and gives a strong message about the demise of our oceans fish stocks. Whether a visit here will change peoples attitudes to eating sustainable fish I can't say but it was a joy to watch the well stocked aquarium. Allow a good 2 or 3 hours as there's plenty to see and keep your interest.

Loved this place !. It was a welcome option given the heat to spend a few hours here. We opted for a taxi ride there and back which is about 7 euros from downtown, and admission is 17 each. It really is a world class set up, and the Sea Otters for me were worth the admission price alone. Could imagine it could be a bit tedious if really busy to see stuff, thankfully not so the day we visited.
How to go to Lisbon Oceanarium. can anyone help me to tell how to reach Lisbon Oceanarium from cascais .Planning to visit tomorrow ..
Good oceonarium. The central aquarium was really impressive with manta, shark and the strange mola-mola. On the side you can see otters and penguin.
Oceanarium in Lisbon. It is a place where you and your children will have a great time! There are a lot of fish species but also other marine animals from all over the world.
Great. First time here and was amazing. It is worth a longer visit with time to apreciate and read all information. A litle bit expensive por Potuguese standard

Thrilling! Maybe the best Aquarium I have ever visited.. The main tank is the biggest I have ever seen. The Sun Fish are thrilling - I have never seen one in captivity before. The sharks are very big and menacing in that zombie-automaton way. The peripheral exhibits are interesting but typical, and not as enthralling as the main tank, which is truly vast and viewable from many different windows. The chilled penguin and puffin enclosures are delightful, as is the tropical area. There is a good cafe just outside near the water-fall sculpture. The exterior architecture with the vista of the water and the teleferique frame the place beautifully. My tip is, if you are there for more than a week, become a member. It is great value, especially if you have children and more than pays for itself in two visits. You just need a photo ID.

Excellent place to visit.. Easy to get to via metro. Plenty to look at. I liked the layout which led you through different displays but kept bringing you back to the main tank from different angles and levels so that you got a different perspective of the sea life inside. Slightly disappointed that we missed feeding time for the Penguins, even though we were there at the correct time. Would have liked more information to be shown about what was in the various tanks, but apart from that it was an excellent way to spend a couple of hours.

First rate aquarium. We really enjoyed this multi- leveled aquarium which is not only beautifully arranged, but offers a learning experience for its' visitors, children and adults. I have been to many aquariums and rate this just below the Monterrey Aquarium in California.

Top attraction- well worth it. Lots of fun- very interesting. The kids we saw seemed quite fascinated. It is very well run and it's obvious they work hard to keep it up and take care of the living things. No line-ups when we were there and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Beautiful area surrounding so leave time for a walk as the surrounding area is immaculate

Must see! Best attraction in Lisbon. Very good attraction. Must see. The children were very excited.The ocenarium is well organized with good English speaking crew. The ocenarium has a big variety of fish life. It may take even a half a day to walk through.
Impressing! . I've been to many aquariums but this was certainly the most impressive. Not only the big tank but also the nice way of arranging smaller habitats.

Really worth a visit . After seeing so many aquariums around the world, I was not interested to visit this aquarium. But after reading its reviews & seeing its rating on trip advisor, I gave it a try & I m not at all regretful of my decision. My kids really loved the different aquatics & were not ready to leave. The setup is really good. We got to some species that I had not Seen before. It was also baby trolley friendly. Highly recommended for all ages.

Spectacular . The place is amazing If you want something different you must visit this activity In the center is a big aquarium with big fishes and surround are smaller aquariums with different species from around world Is definitely a must

Fabulously relaxing environment. Oceanarium situated on old Expo'98 site, which has been developed into really good area for many activities (shopping/walking/running etc) The aquarium is well laid out and you could spend the whole time just looking at main tank which is huge. However all the other displays are great too, but be warned if you don't like flying birds as the Inca terns fly free in the penguin area. They are beautiful birds which land just about everywhere including barrier by pedestrian walkway, so be warned!!!!

A great way to spend a morning. They say it is world class and it truly isA cheap cab far from diwnriwn Lisbon that is worth the time and moneyThe focus is the sea life of the Atlantic ocean and the presentation is greatFish from North to South and East to West covers the Atlantic ocean marine life Well worth the trip
good. places were good and eye catching, i had great time here and next time again i am going to visit with more friends and colleagues.

By the Sea!. The Lisbon Aquarium is located in the new area of Lisbon, and it is a wonder to behold. You move through two stories of the building to see the huge tanks at different levels. Be aware that the bottom floor is very dark to give you a good view of the fish. Best place for a quick bite is the Cafe and Te shop as you walk in to the ticket line. A must see!
Fantastic. A wonderful way of presenting the world of the oceans both the creatures that swim as well as those who live on the ocean floor and the birds and mammals who live with it.

The best!. Amazing aquarium; fascinating for kids of all ages. We visited twice and still felt like we skipped a bunch of exhibits. Don't miss the interactive playground located past the ticket office near the water. We recommend getting there right at opening (much less crowded; less jostling of the littles in front of the exhibit). We would also suggest bringing a picnic lunch and eating on the shaded benches along the waterfront. Food choices are pretty dire in the immediate vicinity.

Rivaling Barcelona and Valencia. Having already visited Barcelona and Valencia and the aquariums there, I did not regret at all spending several hours in the Oceanarium as well. Nicely set exhibition of nature's beauty!

Nice place to escape the heat. 2-floor building with nice exposition, not too big. Quite interesting, especially for the children. There are few nice cafe around and a lot of space for the kids to run and have some fun.

Even better than I remembered. First visited during Expo 98........ Visited on Saturday 1st October, and was even more thrilled with the oceanic exhibition this visit, far better than I remembered.... Possible to take photos without flash, but sadly missed the opportunity as forgot camera. Good value for money and great for all ages.
Excellent . An excellent Aquarium in an impressive location. An amazing collection, easy to navigate and not too big. Highly recommended for people of all ages.

Great aquarium. The oceanarium is really good with lots of interesting fish and animals. Don't bother with the audio guide though as it gives no information on the animals, just on the type of habitat which is very dull and a bit pointless.
Superb. A very nice experience, if you go to Lisbon you should visit the place. It made me feel like a child again. Around it is a beautiful panorama of the sea and of the Vasco da Gama bridge.

A “Must See” in Lisbon – vibrant colours, bizarre creatures, peaceful atmosphere. When we were there was the Permanent Exhibition (the Oceanarium) and a Temporary Exhibition (Ocean Forrests). We saw both.The Oceanarium is a huge cylindrical tank more than two stories high and covering some 1,000 sq metres on the surface, full of hundreds of species of marine life. You can get some idea of its size from the attached photo where you can see a couple of divers carrying out routine maintenance. You ”follow the arrows” around the exhibition, starting at the top of the aquarium (where you see Marine Otters and Penguins ) and then gradually getting lower so at the end you are on the same level as the floor of the aquarium, some 25 metres below. Around the central tank tare four more aquariums with different marine habitats such as Atlantic, Pacific, Tropical. So, all the way round you see, on your left, scores of fascinating different fish, including sharks and huge rays. Meanwhile, on your right are a series of smaller tanks devoted to the different types of marine life such as coral, starfish, sea urchins, and many, many more. The whole thing is beautifully lit so that some of the vibrant colours are truly startling. All accompanied by serene music. The Temporary Exhibition is less impressive perhaps but still worth a visit. It is a 40 metre long aquarium with brilliantly lit ocean greenery set in a darkened room, creating a relaxing and calming environment. The accompanying music was specially written for the exhibition. We spent 45 minutes just gazing at the beautiful scenes with hundreds of tiny colourful fish. It was quite a shock to get back into the noisy world outside.

Truly world-class - deserves to be even better known than it is .... I've been to several of the world's great aquaria, and this one is my current favourite. It has something for everyone, with a new wonder at every turn. Not the easiest to get to; but absolutely worth it. An added bonus at the moment is the truly astonishingly beautiful temporary exhibition by the late, great, Takashi Amano, called 'Forests Underwater' - it is just that, and yet much much more.
Amazing for kids. nice and great place to visit. to have fun, to see the hapiness on your kids face. one of my favorites places in lisbon to go with my kids

Really impressive . I really liked the concept of one big tank that you can see from different angles. Each time you can discover something new. We had a great time in the aquarium, definitely a recommendation.

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit. The tickets are €17 or €14. The cheaper one is to see the bigger aquarium and the other to see both. To be honest the smaller one is not worth a penny. So just get the €14. The main aquarium is definitely worth a visit. Really amazing. I would definitely go back
Nice Oceanarium. This is the perfect place to take the kids when in Lisbon. They have penguins, different types of fish and interactive activities for the little ones.

An excellent aquarium!!! . A must visit if you go to Lisbon especially if you have kids. A well organized aquarium with a main tank with sharks and other fish and with areas simulating areas in the world like the Antarctica where you can see tropical animals like penguins. Make sure to bring a jacket with you as the simulating areas are cold enough.
Great spot for the kids...... This is a world class aquarium that the kids will love. It is accessible by subway, although it is about 15 minutes on foot from the closest station.
Relaxing activity. A very interesting, relaxing activity. Would be fun with friends too, but was a perfect solo afternoon to relax and think! Well worth it.
Fishes. It has been so fantastic to watch all the fishes. There were so many different ones and even sharks or penguins! The fishes do have enough space to live!

Best Ocenarium. We visit this Oceanarium on our last day, it was amazing. Lots of fish, very nice displays. Is just amazing how the time is flying inside, you spend lot of time here.The location is just a short walk from the Metro station and very easy to reach.It was busy regarding it was school holiday.I would recommend to everybody to visit this beautiful place.

Great Activity. I was surprised that the Oceanarium was #1 in Lisbon as a tourist attraction, but after visiting, I can understand why the rating is so high. It had so many different varieties of sea animals to see. And what was great was that there were so many windows / places to see the animals/ fish. We went in the late afternoon on a weekday and it wasn’t busy at all, so we were able to get up close and personal pictures. We bought tickets online so that we could skip any potential lines and that was a great amenity they have. It was very easy to catch the Metro from the center of Lisbon and it was a few block walk to the Oceanarium – of which you walk along a beautiful river and go thru a shopping mall.
Amaizing. I and my friends stayed for more than four hours and didn't realize how time had pass. It is amaizing, it is wonderful, it is a little copy of the world, worth to be seen.
AMAZING IMPRESSION. had a great experience with hundreds of species on show. Near the metro and should visit there if you enjoy sea creatures...

A beautiful view of the ocean's contents. The oceanarium is a huge saltwater tank with fish and sea flora from the Atlantic, including sharks, tuna and whole schools of smaller species, a tank surrounded by several other smaller (but still large) tanks with different biotypes: cold - including penguins (that you can watch from below 'flying' in the water) - tropical and temperate. And also exhibitions and smaller aquaria.Kids love it and I don't mind seeing it at least once a year.

Unforgettable impressions. Good to reach with the Metro ( red line, Oriente Station)) and then 5-10 walk.You can bye your tickets at the ticket machine next to the entrance and avoid standing in long lines. Visit it at 10.00 am! There are few visitors and you have a better view on the acuarium.Very nice also to walk along the promenade between Oceanario and the Metro Station.

Very large clection. This is the second large ocenarium in the World whit hunderts different species divided in five groups, according to the five oceans. We spent half a day contemplating the colorful underwater life. It is a must to visit when kids are with you.
Stunning!. The Lisbon Oceanarium's large central tank gets you up close and personal from many points of view. Kids seemed to have loved it. It's the best we have seen so far!
Fun day. Excellent day out, would highly recommend to go and visit especially if you have a young child or family.
Lots of Fish. I cannot rate this experience highly enough, it is wonderful, very easy to get to from Metro, don't think you will zip around in 30 minutes take your time.

Fantastic Place. We have been to many aquariums but this is by far the best. We are so glad we decided to go. What a great idea a huge tank in the middle, you start at the top an walk around going lower on each floor, each part of the tank shows different fish, ones I have never seen before, my favourite the sun fish. On the other side of the aquarium are smaller tanks with all different kinds of sea life. I learnt many new things about sea life. Saw penguins swimming under water, otters playing and wonderful jelly fish that never dissapoint

good for a visit.... it has a good variety of animals, it's cool to see all the different animals and to spend quality 2 hours inside.. we were unfortunate to share a visit with a school group which was quite loud and creating lots of crowd in front of the animals..
Wonderful. Very good, I dint't expected anything else from the largest aquarium in Europe.It has a stunning variety of sea life from fish, to octopus and even sharks!Really worth's it.

Unexpected surprise in Lisbon. I'm an aquarium fanatic and was in Lisbon for vacation. Found this fantastic and well done aquarium designed in similar fashion to the famous Monterey in California. There is a large central tank with mostly predator fish including several shark species, rays, grouper and 2 impressive sun fish. But around this tank are little coves with various reef fish, anemones, star fish and urchins. There is an otter and penguin display. Crowds were manageable even for weekend. Very enjoyable.

Great place. I had a really nice time at the Lisbon Oceanarium. The aquarium and the different fishes were all really cool and special. They had all sorts of stuff: penguins, sea otters, sharks, stingrays and more. I just thought the place would be a bit bigger.

a great aquarium with rare species. was busy, but the place is big enough. a large amount of sea life, including the rare sun fish! the guest exhibition was not impressive unfortunately, compared to the main exhibits. very educational and entertaining.

Wonderful day at the Aquarium!. We had a magical day at the Lisbon Aquarium today. We found street parking easily and walked up the day of,no pre-order required, but they do offer online tickets. We purchased the permanent exhibit, as we weren't interested in the temporary exhibition.My kids and for that matter, my wife and I were simply enthralled with the giant tank windows, sharks, puffins, penguins, and otters. It's amazing! You could spend a full day there...but my youngest got tired out and 3/4 through. We would gladly go back...it sets the bar high for other aquariums!
Long queue but worth the wait!. large displays and fantastic underwater experience. I enjoy marine life and the bio diversity this place has is no doubt the largest in Europe! Love it!
Great Aquarium. This is a fantastic aquarium. The building is relatively new and extremely well designed. Price was reasonable, easy to see the exhibits in a hour and a half. Well worth the visit.

Excellent quality, variation and well worth a visit. Highly recommend visiting this well organised and high quality venue. Superb central viewing areas, backed up by good but not too pushy environmental education with some really good species content. We were pleasantly surprised. Massive Sunfish and a Manta Ray. Also the largest Spider Crab we've ever seen!And yes......The pair of beautiful Sea Otters enjoying their environment (and almost in touching distance) make the entry price worth it!We're lucky ourselves in that we regularly see Puffins, Razorbills and the other sea birds in the wild, due to our regular visits to my parents, who live on Flamborough Head, which is close to Bempton Cliffs in the UK but, if you haven't, they are also worth seeing too.We enjoyed our visit, thank you.

Good but I have seen better!. Excellent variety of deep water fish and species. One big central tank is the main feature, there was a great Antarctic penguin exhibition but there are no shows , no larger fish exhibitions with dolphins however it has a varieties of fish from all the oceans.It is a pleasant 2 hours. I would recommend it for a late afternoon visit with kids.

Worth seeing!!. Loved it. Very informative. Everything in Portuguese and English. Loved how they have the aquarium in the middle and everything around it. Only thing they didn't have was sea turtles but they have some very interesting fish I'd never seen before.

Mesmerizing. Stunning, beautiful, well organised and planned out aquarium. I apploud the people who created it. A must see for aquarium lovers, or anyone in general. The sun fish is a highlight, there are also jacks, manta rays, giant pacific octopus and many more wonderful creatures.

Great design and presentation. Thoroughly enjoyed the layout and displays in the oceanarium and recommend it highly. The only downside was the lack of crowd control with young people just hanging out in some areas while other visitors were trying to see the displays. Fantastic array of sea life.

Enjoyable.. We visited the Oceanarium on our last day before heading out to the airport. We bought our tickets on line which were cheaper and also you skip the queue on the way in. The main tank is massive. You can see this tank from various levels on the way round giving you different views. They have sharks, rays, ugly looking stone fish and loads of other different fish in there. Also you can see penguins and puffins. Beautiful tropical fish amongst corals. They have smaller tanks with lovely spotted jelly fish. There's plenty of other creatures to see too. At the end of the visit is a gift shop and a coffee shop alongside. A very enjoyable visit.
Wonderful experience!. Oceanarium is a place worth to visit! Beautiful experience, well organized and managed place! I would be glad to have a chance to visit it again!
Great place. Really enjoyed this and the gondola next to it. It's second largest aquarium in EuropeVery interesting and worth a visit All signs in English. Fantastic central tank
Spectacular. A must see place in Lisbon. I went with family, and my 2 years daughter was so excited there. Amazing place for family tour

Brilliant . Loved this! Plenty to do round about it like the cable cars and Nations park. The aquarium is well set out with plenty of windows to see underwater. Also there are seating areas so you can be there for as long as you want. Educational films explain how they look after the fish and thought the idea of getting children to sleep with the sharks was brilliant.

Interesting . A very well laid out oceanarium centering around a main tank that is viewable from many viewpoints and both levels of the building. Fabulous tank display with some impressive fish like giraffe sharks, Diablo rays and sun fish. Another highlight are the two adorable sea otters. Definitely worth a trip if you have some free time in Lisbon.

Better than expected . Great family outing where everyone was enthusiastic about this educational experience. Beautiful and immense aquarium with small, big and huge fishes. Even sharks can be admired. Go there you won't be disappointed.
Oceanarium to visit. Easy to reach by Metro train this is well worth a trip. The tank displays are amazing, the fish life and collection one of the best we have ever seen.
Must see in Lisbon. Had been there with my wife. Well organized, beautifull species. Also great for families. The surrounding area is also beautifull, with modern buildings.
Well done...... A trek to get to but very informative & nicely designed. Lots of kids. If you see a sea otter wearing sunglasses, they belong to my clumsy husband.

Worth The Visit. Plenty of sea life on view, which all centred around a large fish tank that was pretty spectacular in terms of the number and size of fish inside. Plenty of other smaller tanks and exhibits to see too.

Quite small - not what I expected . It is very difficult to beat the quality of aquarium / oceanariums we have in SA.We were told this is the biggest Oceanarium in Europe and we were disappointedThe cost was €17 each to see the temporary (which has been around since Jan 15) and permanent aquariums.the entire aquarium consists of one large (yes indeed this tank was pretty enormous) Centre tank and then maybe 10/12 smaller tanks on the outside. It took us roughly 30/45 minutes to walk the entire thing. There was very little informative information on the tanks in some sections and it just all seemed very disappointing. I wouldn't encourage it to anyone else as a "must see"

Lisbon aquiriam. Absolutely worth a visit.The whole thing is centred around a very large tank.There are penguins,otters,anemones, crabs and a great variety of tropical fish.There are plenty of seats around the main tank to just sit and watch the divers interacting with the fish.We spent a whole afternoon here well worth the price

The most creative and interesting aquarium!. As a marine biologist I have been to several aquariums and I can tell you this is the most creative and interesting aquarium I have ever visited. It is difficult to describe so you may just have to trust me when I say it is incredible and a must-see!We paid to visit the temporary exhibition as well as the main permanent aquarium. Completely worth the money! The exhibition at the moment is by a Japanese nature photographer and is like nothing I have ever seen. He created enormous tanks filled with 10000 freshwater fish from the amazon. It is a complete sensory experience. As well as being amazing visually, there are opportunities to hear sounds of the amazon rain forest, to learn about the amazon's resources and also see how the exhibition was made and how it will change over time. The main aquarium was just as amazing. The whole aquarium is centred around one huge tank that stretches across two floors. It is filled with large species such as sharks and rays and also smaller schooling fish. There are several viewing points all the way round. There is even a sofa by one of the viewing points and I could have sat there mesmerised for hours. As well as the main tank, there are also areas where you go outside to see the penguins and other birds, there are tanks that you can see in the top of and then later see inside on the lower levels. And there were so many different species. I would suggest you need at least 2 but more likely 3 hours to fully experience the place. When visiting Lisbon, definitely go here whoever you are!

The place is fantastic. I think it is a goal that should not be missed if you go in Lisbon. Children will surely be fascinated by the many colorful fish and creatures. Of course sharks are the attraction. You can spend many time there on. And also nutritious and carers movie about living things is very educational. And finally you can learn even environmental education. The place is fantastic

Well worth it. Not just about the impressive centre piece that is the larger aquarium. The vast array of species within the smaller side exhibits are brilliant. Go at a quiet time of day though as it does get busy.

Day trip. Great day adventure. Lots of sea life and it was fun to watch the Penguins get fed. The eye catcher is definitely the massive fish tank full of sharks, eels, school fish and much more! Def worth the trip if you enjoy aquariums.

A fascinating place. Not too much to say! I was a bit skeptical when my boyfriend suggested to go there! But then wow! It s so much interesting and fascinating! Full of good information to get cultured about the sea world which is around us! It s highly recommended for families with children because I think it s very formative!:)

Don't miss it. Amazing perspective of the world oceans this is a sure bet that you wont regret no mater your age.Surrounded by the Expo98 buildings in from of Tejo river this "live" sea exhibit is one of the most beautiful Oceanariums in the world.Don't miss it!
Meet the Penguins .. The best ever. try to start early and begin your day with its visit ..charge your camera full charge..and prepare to meet the penguin.

Beautiful . When deciding to visit Lisbon we had looked at things to do and this was up there with the top places to visit. We are so glad we did, such a lovely place. We could of spent hours just sitting peacefully watching the fish it was so relaxing. A must visit place.

Definitely the Best Aquarum in Europe. Though it is quite far from city center, we are happy to make this visit. Our 3 yr old Daughter was excited throughout the 2 hours we spent there. The highlight of the aquarium is a huge huge huge tank where different variety of fishes swim together. Its two floors huge. The views could be enjoyed from multiple locations. We could spend hours watching it.
Impressive. Great ship models. Many ancient canons. It takes about 2 hour to see everything. Its near the port and other attractions.

Mesmerizing Experience. The Lisboa Oceanarium is worth the trek to this neighborhood just north of the airport. There are plenty of different exhibits showcasing the various aquatic environments. The building is essentially built around a huge and tall aquarium that you can view on many levels from the top down to the seabed with plenty of little nooks and crannies to curl up and just watch the sealife. With a focus on conservation efforts, this is an amazing way to be awed and educated at the same time. Definitely worth the price. Advice: go to their website and purchase tickets directly. You don't have to choose a specific date as it is good for 120 days after the purchase date leaving you with a good window of time and flexibility on your trip. My favorite creature was the Manta Ray. Rare to have in captivity.

Day trip out. This is apparently the second largest aquarium in the world. Maybe I'm wrong but I assume Seaworld to be the largest, and this one is just as good. It's in a really lovely "new-build" part of Lisbon, really beautifully done.The place itself is beautifully built and maintained and the staff are helpful. It's well worth a trip if you like sea life.

Really fantastic. You could spend hours and hours looking around the Oceanarium. The main tank is incredible and the Sea Otters are super cute. Great for kids and big kids.We went on a Friday afternoon, we bought tickets when we arrived and there were no queues.

Nice to visit if you have few days in Lisboa. Lisbon Oceanarium is in a nice part of Lisbon. I spent one afternoon there - Oceanarium and buildings around it. Very easy to find. I expected it to be much bigger but it was nice and had interesting animals. There were many other visitors but it wasn't too crowded. It's nice to see it, but It's not too bad if you miss it. The ticket is cheper if you buy it on the internet.
Mesmerized . It is one of the biggest oceanorium in Europe.. They have a big variety of fish and other see staff.. It was a wonderful day! We learn about the ocean so much
A glance to the ocean life. Not very big or diverse, but still worth a visit! 15 euros online, no queue. And you will find Nemo there
Must visit while in Lisbon. Oceanarium is magnificent. It has several aquariums two of which are huge and allow easy observations of various species of fish including big sharks and penguins.

So much to see. I'm not usually keen on aquariums but this was a really enjoyable visit. There is an extremely large tank with various other smaller tanks and exhibits. The journey through is well put together and it's worth visiting if you're in the area.

One of the best. I've done aquariums all over the world - can't get enough of them - and this is one of the best. It's not as big in terms of the number of displays as others, but the themed areas - especially the Indian Ocean - bring it to life.

Very enjoyable trip. Visited here on my daughter's recommendation, and we really enjoyed it. We bought tickets in advance as cheaper and saves time queuing. As well as usual exhibits they had some unusual ones and the penguins and sea otters are so cute. Kids would love this place.

Amazing Sun Fish. My husband and I visited here last week. I could not believe how long we actually stayed there. The aquarium was fascinating and I loved hoe they actually showed how it was assembled. The main fish tank is amazing and I went back every opportunity I could to see what else I could see. I also loved the sea otters. Well worth a visit
Amazing. It is realy a wonderful show of marin life in reality. Lots of different fishes in their habitat. Wonderful for chidren ...and grown ups.

Bravo, well done. This is worth a visit even if you've been to Okinawa's aquarium or Monterrey Bay aquarium. Displays explain the importance of oceans and divide into 4 oceans of the world.Buy your tickets online, we got a 10% discount.Note: If taking the bus 728 to get here, get prepared. We experienced irregular service and waited nearly an hour for a "standing room only" full bus.

Top drawer attraction.. A very high quality attraction with something for every member of the family. Probably the best oceanarium I have visited. The highlight for me was "Forests Underwater" by Takeshi Amano. The installation is quite spectacular, World Class I would say.If you have taken any of the bus tours around Lisbon keep your tickets. They will get you a discount on entry. The on-site restaurants are not bad either and not expensive.

Not the number one attraction in Lisbon by a long shot!. My girlfriend and I popped in to the Oceanarium on the way back to the airport, because it had such high ratings on this site that we felt we should see what the fuss was about, but to me it seemed like a pretty standard aquarium. One big tank with lots of fish circling aimlessly for their entire lives, then a load of specialised smaller tanks around the outside for the more antisocial animals, including the ever-shy octopus which every aquarium in the world seems to have but nobody ever sees.We went on a Sunday afternoon which in retrospect was an obvious mistake due to the sheer number of excited (noisy, pushy) kids.Highlights included the otters, puffins, sunfish and giant crabs - but as with all of these types of exhibits, the sense of wonder is tinged with sadness at imprisoned creatures who are not in their natural habitat. At least this aquarium seems to be emphasising the environmental issues facing the world, with lots of information on how much destruction we are causing to the underwater ecosystem.
Fabulous Aquarium . Great spot to enjoy and kill time in Lisbon. You can save a few bucks by ordering on line. One tip is that if you go by subway be prepared to do a fair bit of walking.
Not enthusiast. It's a beautiful building, but I 'm not sure the pool are big enough for that amount of fish. And frankly €17 is a bit too much for the tour. Not convinced.

good variety well displayed. This is a little out of town needing a metro trip plus then a good 20 minute walk. The crowds are enormous and if unlucky expect to have a long wait to enter. The variety of sea life on display is huge. A great entertainment for kids. I little pricey entry fee.
The best oceanarium in Europe. If you want to see ocean life in a single place, this is your must visit place. Amazing interior with attractive exposition!

First day in Lisbon. The ocenarium is an excellent place to visit especially on hot or rainy days! The displays are excellent although the overall aquarium is not that large so an hour to two hours is plenty. If you can get your tickets on-line and avoid the lines to purchase tickets at the aquarium.

Thoroughly enjoyable afternoon. We really enjoyed our trip to Oceanarium. There was so much to see. We particularly liked the way the Penguins habitat seemed so lifelike, with birds flying overhead and ice on the rocks. They seemed very well cared for. The sea otters were just adorable!We were amazed by the size of the tanks giving such a brilliant view of all the fish and marine creatures. There was something for everyone whether you were young or old and we spent a thoroughly enjoyable afternoon here.

Don't miss the temporary exhibit "forests under water". Terrific aquariums with very exotic fish! But for now there is a temporary exhibit which I thought was really unique. An underwater forest constructed in a large u shaped aquarium. It was so beautiful and so meditative!!

Worth it. Was contemplating on whether I should come to the aquarium and I am so glad that I did. The main aquarium tank had the coolest aquatic animals. I spent around 2 hours inside (3 floors - 1 temporary, 1 lower permanent, and 1 upper permanent floor). To get here, you need to take the bus. Lisbon is going through some construction, so make sure you ask around so you can find the right bus stop! 17 euros to get in.

Everyone loves it here. You don't have to have kids to visit the oceanarium! It's a beautiful place, a must see in Lisbon.I keep going back and I could stare at the otters for hours. They are adorable!
Amazing experience. The temporary exhibition of Takashi Amano's river world is just breathtaking, the giant aquarium as well. Have to see it to understand.
Nice Aquarium . Awesome place!!!!Children will love it.they have provided good information about the collection.We enjoyed it thoroughly.The telecable is just behind this place.
Amazing!. Great place to spend a day indoors (especially on a hot day). Fantastic for adults and families. Wheelchair assessable and very easy to negotiate

Another large aquarium . Yes it is the largest indoor aquarium of Europe and yes the sea otters Amalia and Eusebio are cute, but in the end an aquarium is an aquarium and I would struggle to say why this one is better or different from Genova
Good awsome. Very beautiful and great place to visit with children and adults as well the lights and the animals the best!
Outstanding experience. Definitely worth a to visit especially if you are traveling with kids. Very well organized and can enjoy the telecabin next to it
Visit. Awesome for kids and families. Hope to be here next year with my family and friends. I really enjoy it

Enjoyable and relaxing. Perfect option to spend some enjoyable time with kids, your partner or even alone. Place of wonder for anyone who anyone able to admire nature's creation. Quite good connection with the city center by bus.
Excellent. Spent a fascinating morning here. Best of its type I have ever been to. Large central aquarium full of different fish manta rays and sharks.
Aziz. The biggest I have seen & amazing. They have the biggest Sun fish I ever seen & more. The aquarium is the largest indoor I Europ..must visit.
Trip to Oceanarium. It's a place worth visiting. Good few hours spent there. Every one enjoyed, so many species and variety

Sealife at it's best. The Oceanarium is right up at the top of the aquariums we had visited before, definitely worth a visit. Take the metro to oriente train station and after a short walk you will be right at the Oceanarium.
Travel beneath the sea!. So amazing. Worth the metro ride. It is one of the best I've ever been to. No Shamu. Come prepared to take photos.
Oceanarium Lisboa. First time we went to a Oceanarium. We were overwealth by this place . Never saw such nice fishes and other water animals in one place.

Really enjoyable afternoon in the sea. I went here with my partner and we had a lovely afternoon. The oceanarium was beautifully structured to represent the different oceans on the planet and it was a truly magical experience being so close to all the beautiful sea creatures. I would definitely recommend this if you like nature and care about the planet. Tge otters were my personal highlight as we caught them at feeding time.
Had a great time. This was a fun activity, we had a blast. Just make sure you factor in the trip going and coming back as it's not located in the epicenter of the city

Stunning Oceanarium! Definitely worth the visit!. This is a really impressive Oceanarium. I've visited it countless times and I'm always amazed with the amount of different species and in particular the amazing main tank! Worth a visit if you're ever in Lisbon with time to spare.

Superb activity in Lisbon. Located north of town, the Oceanarium of Lisbon is easily accessible by public transportation or taxi. I chose to use a taxi (14 Euros with tip). You should count about 3 hours to visit and a little more if you want to see the animals fed.There is no need to go back to Lisbon for lunch. There are many great restaurants located just north of the Oceanarium along the Tage River.

Great day out!. My wife and I visited the Lisbon Oceanarium as part of our recent visit! It is accessible using the metro, which has 24 hour passes for 6 euro! The Oceanarium has over 8000 creatures. There is a huge central tank containing a large variety of fish ? There are 3 floors, packed with a huge variety of exhibits. Everything is well laid out and well lit. We spent nearly 3 hours there and the time flew. Admission was 14 euro but for a full half day's entertainment , it was great value!

An exceptional must see in Lisbon. This was out second time here and it does not become any less interesting. Huge aquarium with lots of sea and ocean species sorted out by the type of an ocean or part of the world with lots of info support. Very well maintained and educational. You can easily spend here up to 2 hours. If tired, a mere watching the tons of azure water over your head and all those graceful creatures floating by is a great and relaxing meditation.
