Best thing in Europe. I can't comment this on level of Lisbon only. This is one of the best places in Europe.So great building, so well organized. You can see so many fishes and learn a lot. Great for the kids. Amazing for adults.It is a bit far from the city center, but is is worth the visit.

enjoying every moment. for a 2 year old this is heaven. Learning to say shark and beeing able to se all the fishes even though you are just a small kid. perfect when you try to get away from the heat outside!
Still great. Excellent place to spend some time, I will give 5 stars but I feel that some attention to details and maintenance are lacking. Take your kids.
Fantastic Day. When I visited Lisbon also spent the Expo98 , and went to the Oceanarium , see the most varied marine species.Spectacular for those who want to spend a nice day with the family.

I did have some reservations about going to Lisbon Oceanarium....BUT..... I did have some reservations about going to Lisbon Oceanarium after seeing very poor conditions for sea mammals who lived in at Valencia and Barcelona aquariums, BUT I am really glad to say this wasn't like that. In fact the only mammals I did see was two 'very happy' sea otters.  It's a very well thought out 'oceanarium', very clean & safe for us human while also and more importantly very close to the environment for the sea life and birds it enclosed, with ice and real growing plants. Great for adults and kids, also you get the environmental message.  Again as mentioned before there's the temporary exhibition by Takashi Amano's, do go to it because it's just wonderful to sit and watch, lose yourself into water-weeds and fish.... Again, part of an environmental message, and an important one. What a shame he died so young, but what a message he left.
Excellent quality. Very good atraction located in a very nice place. Very close to an important mall and nice vews. Easy public transport.

Definitely worth the visit!. In Sept. the temporary exhibit itself made the trip worthwhile (underwater forests and information about the building of the exhibit by a Japanese aquarium architect). The aquarium itself is also phenomenal. Divided by ocean, you can walk around two stories of under and above water life for a truly immersive experience. Would 100% recommend to people of all ages.

Fantastic aquarium. We enjoyed visiting this museum which is quite easy to access from public transit from downtown. There are penguins, otters, sharks and many many fish all intermingling in the stunning ecosystems the oceanarium created. This is how all aquariums should be.

Recomended. The Oceanarium is such a nice place. The building itself is astounding and is located in the harbour surrounded of water. Fantastic aqaurium with fishes from all over the world. Your should definitely go here if your are visiting Lisbon.

Fantastic Day Out. Visited thinking that it would take an hour - so fascinating that we spent over three hours looking at all the sea creatures. Very well laid out, staff great, discount for over 65's. Very interesting place to visit.

A very original aquarium. There are many and very good ones all over the world.
But this one is a totally different aquarium, mainly in the outdoor sections, in the way you go through continents, looking at different scenarios and even feeling the different temperatures of local climates. Super!

oceanarium. This was a difficult place to get to as it is quite a way out of town. It was worth the visit. It is a large aquarium with different exhibitions around it. It is very dark inside. The feeding of the penguins and the otters was the highlight of our trip. The staff were friendly and helpful and the restaurant served delicious fresh fish (??). This area of Lisbon has some great buildings and next to the aquarium is a cable car and shopping centre.
Very interesting. Large aquarium with quite a number of species. Expected a little bit more due to its reputation,though. A little far from the city centre but worth the visit.

Absolutely amazing. The central aquarium is just amazing as well as all the others! It is an incredibly experience and the price is not that high as well! Totally recommend it! And very well located too!
Not only sharks!. A lot of tiny and unusual marine creatures, sounds and mystery of all oceans life are depicted with love and by sure devotion

Worth a visit. The aquarium offers a different activity in Lisbon and you can easily spend a few hours wandering around. There's lots to see including puffins, sea otters and fish. Quite busy but worth the entrance fee. Temporary exhibition also very good.

Simply stunning. I have been to Lisbon Oceanarium for the first time in 1999 or there about. I loved it. Today I went there again and I still consider it the best acquarium I have been to. The central water 'tank' over two floors is impressive. You can just sit and contemplate for hours. I am not such a fan of the penguin areas but everything else is a must visit. The small tanks at the lower level are beautiful.A must see is the temporary exhibition. It cost a few more euros but well worth it. The recreation of a underwater forest is now full grown. Beautiful, relaxing, informative,... just go!
Oceanarium Lisbon . Superb. Worth it along with the cable car.. Fabulous weather, excellent collection of sea world. Must see attractions in Lisbon.
a nust visit. be ready to be amazed, sights and sea life in abundance, while in that location try the cable car ride, very near this location.

Wonderful place!. Lovely place... You can either go to learn or just to relax. Sit a little bit in the darkness and just watch the fish moving around... You may go alone, with family or friends and it will always be marvellous! It

Amazing place to visit in Lisbon. Created in 1998 for 20th World Fair/EXPO 98 with Oceans as the principal theme.A "Heritage for the Future", it has hundreds of species of the oceans world, temporary exhibitions, and plenty of activities. Its is a must in Lisbon, not only for those interested in Biology and Oceanography, its beautiful and fun, for specialists and families. The Oceanário has been granted a number of international awards, including for its architecture, and deserves a not too short visit.

Best Oceanarium in Europe. Built for the International exhibition of 1998 this Oceranarium is the best and more complete I've seen around Europe. I've been able to visit it at least 1 time per year and observe how the several lifeforms have evolved since. All oceans habitats are present. You can move from the artic to the Indica Ocean just by changing rooms. When visiting Lisbon please take 2 to 3 hours to get a walk around. Good spot to hide from the rain for a couple of hours or to recover from sunny lisbon summer highs :-)

Amazing place and a well spent afternoon with the children !. Take some time to go there at least 2 hours. It's amazing the variety of species and what you can learn from it. In summer time it's crowded with turist and weekends. Nice coffe shop and merchandising.

Must see. A must see for those who have never been to oceanarium before. A very good organized place. The fishes are just amazing and you can watch them from every level and side. Buy a ticket online if you want to skip the line. Go visit in the morning or before closing hours otherwise is crowded.

It was okay!. By reading reviews in various forums and a good reputation about it , we expected more out of it. The place can be fascinating for kids. But 17 euro tickets doesn't do justice. It is nice to visit this place, but if you are shortage of time while visiting Lisbon, you can skip it and will not regret much.

water all around. really nice experience. I have been a few times but always feel in awe there. the main, central tank is amazing and I can't get enough of it, lot's of fish (including sharks) in there. the smaller aquariums around are also quite nice.

A bit of a way out but well worth it!. The Oceanarium is one of the best aquariums I have been too and I've been to San Diego, Vancouver and Georgia in Atlanta. The displays are amazing and information about all the fish is accessible. The best exhibit is getting up close and personal with the terns and puffins! It is a bit of a way out from central Lisbon but once there you will have a great time.

Had a visit. We enjoyed our visit but did think there would be more. If coming by metro there is a really nice shopping centre that you walk through and nice by the water to just sit and a cable car ride if you want.

Average. It has been long since I've been looking for the right opportunity to visit the Lisbon Oceanarium. In fact I had already read many reviews and seen some TV shows on the beautiful place so that when the chance has finally arisen off I went to at long last catch up with it. But I was quite unimpressed with the facility, it is certainly a pleasant one and one can see that everything is well kept. But it is definitely miles away from the best in the world. An average attraction, needs some investment to enhance its strengths and cure some weaknesses (a lack of variety and some startling absences) in order to rank with the best. The location is outstanding, though.

Great but seen better. This may be the largest aquarium in Europe but it's not the best one I've been to. My partner and I spent over an hour searching for this aquarium after coming out of the nearby shopping mall. I suggest researching what the outside looks like before you go so you know what you're looking for. We wandered around with an older couple for a while, following sign posts that lead us near the sea and the walk along the prom, but not near the actual aquarium. The aquarium basically has one big circular tank in it, that you walk around and see from all different angles, with a few smaller separate tanks. It's a magnificent building and was worth the money. I love aquariums and had a nice afternoon out. There is disabled access, lockers (for a euro, if you don't want to carry your bag) and a cafe. Although we had a lovely time I must say the Blue Planet Aquarium near Chester, In the UK is a much better day out! I'd recommend going to the one in Lisbon if you're looking for something to do, it's suitable for all ages.

Very nice . I was there with my wife . It was my first visit in Portugal. The place is amasing. It was a litle bit crouded. In all it was excelent. One nice thing to do in Lisbon. I will tell all my friends ho will visit Lisbon to go there.

Beautiful experience. My first time at an aquarium and I must say I wasn't disappointed. Great range of exhibits and the staff seem to really care about the fish. There were lots of members of staff dotted around who repeatedly had to tell tourists to stop using flash on their cameras (everyone was told when they came in not to use flash as some of the fish are from deep in the ocean and light is damaging). It's amazing how ignorant people can be but good to see staff stopping them. My favourite exhibits were the sea otters, dragon fish and jelly fish. We ate in the canteen and had a really nice meat pasta dish. Definitely worth the entrance fee and only a short walk from the tube station and shopping arcade.

Excellent day out. Not easy to get to but worth the effort. This is a magnificent oceanarium. Very well laid out on two levels with information in both portuguese and english. Fascinating reading about this habitat and seeing the magnificent creatures that have been brought together under one roof. The cafe wasn't up to much but that was a small thing in contrast the wonderful exhibits. Don't miss the sea otters and penguins. Probably the best oceanarium I have ever been to - and I have been to quite a few.
Trip to Lisbon. We took the time to visit this site and while it was a little expensive, 68 Euros for the 4 of us, we had a good time. Lots to see, especially good for kids.

Fantastic! . Definitely worth the admission. The exhibits center piece is a huge tank with dozens of different beautiful fish. Don't forget about the temporary exhibits as well. Don't think too much about it, just go.

Great and wonderful . I've been to 'Oceanário de Lisboa' previously. But this time I took the family. They found it amazing and the kids loved the huge aquarium and the areas representing different oceans with all the animals and even the little indoor kid games. Not to miss whether alone or with children

It's a big tank!. Lisbon Oceanarium is a very large tankSurrounded by other exhibits.Better than at Disney (or others Yank)It’s one of Lisbon’s best visits.Most specimens are fairly well litAnd the large tank is viewed from all sidesAnd on two floors, it’s really a hit.Unlike others, there are here no rides,Just sea life very well displayedSharks, octopus: whatever you wantIt was crowded on a SundayBut there’s a very good restaurantWhere one can eat some of the sea life(And I did – so did my wife).

a visual living treat. A must see for the whole family, it has a spectacular display that is a feast for the eyes. undersea creatures that float past ones face, bringing the secrets of the sea to within your touch...almost! Don't miss it!!

The Temporary Exhibition. You should take a moment to have a seat within the temporary exhibition :) it is about the sea forests ... a very well done installation with great music in the background :)

Great visit. A really excellent aquarium that's well worth a visit. Situated in a nice waterfront location near a large shopping mall (great for food & drinks) this is well worth a visit. The otters were a special favourite of ours !

It is not the biggest but..... Having been to the Monterrey aquarium at Cannery Row, we have been spoilt. Howevever this is a good aquarium and some fantastic displays, but there is a lack of interactivity. signage is in Portuguese and English and the printed guide is in Portuguese. To my mind there is a lack of connecting with the visitor

If you like fishes to look at...go go. Great experience , certainly with kids !!! We loved it very much !
The central is so great , you can look for hours

Absolutely wonderful showcase of marine life. The huge central tank at the aquarium is visible from two levels and lots of different viewing points as you follow the signposted path around it. There are also lots of other 'rooms' exhibiting creatures from different habitats as well as many other smaller tanks displaying an amazing variety of fish and invertebrates.
Wake-up call and Relaxing at the same time. Made me think, made me feel happy... I just wanted to swim!!! I wanted to stay there forever. Loved the penguins and the seals.
i expected more!. i have to be honest i expected more from this visit and i think that the price of ticket is quite high for what it offers. above all i expected a wider variety of animals.

Stunningly Awesome. A absolute treat to wonder around the permanent display, it's huge housing a wide variety of sharks, Rays, skate, and tropical fish, a must for any lover of the ocean and our environment.

Beautiful Temporary Exhibition "Forests Underwater". The temporary exhibition is something else. Takashi Amano's perfectly arranged plant underwater wonderland was truly touching. Highly recommended if you like to go deeper.
Great for families. Excellent aquarium with a huge central tank/pool! Crowded in the main season, but definitely worth a family visit.

Great place to visit. I was overwhelmed by the oceanarium! I have nothing to compare but I liked it a lot. A big water tank inside is full of interesting fish (baracuda, sunfish, ...). Visit takes about 2-3 hours. We were lucky enough to see feeding of sea otters which was absolutely the funniest part!!! Our kids loved it!

Well laid out and lovely building. Spent a few hours there and really enjoyed it. The only strange thing is that the building looks inward, in on itself and seems to ignore the surrounding water which moats around it. This area is ideal for fish, and exhibits as its a public space next to the sea, Instead its dirty and a "dead" space
Fun Place in Lisbon. Always like to mingle with the locals. The Oceanarium is just right place because you don't have to understand the language to enjoy it.

Special structure make it worthwile. This oceanarium has a very different concept from other oceanariums. They have the second biggest aguarium in the centre, with some extentions around. You walk towards the big building in the harbour and begin a circle around the tank above and then on a lower level. All types of fish are here, just as some sea otters, pinquins, frogs and birds. This oceanarium is darker inside than most, which made us stumble against walls. So pay attention when walking around. Altough we've seen quite some oceanariums, this one is quite nice mainly because of it's setup. It's worth going to. At the entrance you can pay for a ticket to go the 'permanent' or 'permanent + temporary exhibit'. We've only been to the permanent exhibit, it that was enough since it took a few hours to see, after that we were quite done with the fishies.

Great day out!. Went here to escape the 40 degree sun and had a great time learning about the various ocean life, systems and the impact of humans. I particularly liked how it was structured, it took you around the world showing you life in different areas. Much better than aquariums I have been to in the UK. Very good temporary exhibition at the end. Glad we went.

Great experience. The oceanarium is a great aquarium that offers wonderful views of many varieties of fish and other marine life. The exhibits are not the largest, but they are well laid out and extremely nice. The penguin and sea otter exhibits are wonderful and they put on a good show during feeding. The oceanarium can become quite crowded if there are numerous school tours there, but otherwise, it was a wonderful time

Great Stop on a Hot Day. We hit Lisbon when it was 39c...so hot. Thought the aquarium might be a good choice. It was a great choice!! The temporary exhibition was a lovely start and got even better for the permanet exhibition. Feeding times were 10.30 and 3.30, but the guys that stole the show for me were the otters....could have watched them all day, they were so entertaining

Don't miss it!. This is a lovely Aquarium. We spent a couple of hours enjoying beautiful Ocean species. It's great for both kids and adults. Plan to go a couple of hours before they close doors as it does need some time. We easily spent a little over 3.5 hours there.

Loved it!. What a wonderful afternoon we had at the Oceanarium! We especially loved the temporary aquarium, stunning! Also really enjoyed watching the process of how it all came together on the video they had playing there. Overall experience is great - very captivating and informative. Being August, of course it was super busy, but don't feel rushed - take your time and explore the amazing Oceanarium.

Brilliant, a must see. Definitely put Oceanarium on your things to do list. Excellent layout, fantastic building, leave the world outside for a couple of hours and relax. A must see for kids & adults alike.

Prepare to be amazed!. Breathtaking, serene, poignant, meditative, thought-provoking.
Be ready to spend an unforgettable day!
Good place. Very good place, took hop on hop off and saw the whole city. Loved this oceanarium and must visit with children

Lisbon Oceanarium. It was an unique experience. It was very crowded at the entrance, but if you buy a ticket at the ticket machine you will be in in a minute. Maybe a tip to wear earplugs against the cries of many children.

Too crowded. The fish and plants were nice, and the big tank was really cool! But it was just overcrowded, and 80% were screaming and pushing children, no matter the hour of the day you choose to visit. This often made it hard to see. PS: the birds in the penguin-room WILL poop on your head.

a must do experience in Lisbon. Oceanario is one of the world leading Aquariums. Once you enter you are submerged in the world of marine species.
Great exhibition and the building itself is a must!
Must go!. The children loved it! Don't miss the temporary exhibition it is breathless! If you can book in advance try to see the "Music for baby's"!

Loved it! Great for all ages!. Really enjoyed our trip to the Oceanarium! We booked online and received a 10% discount. The experience was very informational and we liked the focus on conservation. We especially loved seeing the penguins and we enjoyed the calming and theraputic atmosphere.

Greta place to visit with the kids. The oceanarium revolves around one huge tank in the centre of the building. You can admire the fish from many large windows around the tank on two separate levels. There are also small tanks dotted around the corridors as well as enclosures for penguins. It can get really crowded, and small kids have to fight their way though the wall of adults to get closer to the glass walls to see anything. There were almost no queues for the tickets, still you can skip them completely by purchasing tickets online.

Some interesting creatures in the sea. Bigger than it appears on the surface, this was such an eye-opener into the world that lives beyond what we can see in the oceans. Definitely on a to-do list while in Lisbon.
Alright. We checked this out after having to stay an extra day in Lisbon due to an airport strike. Good place to take kids.

To love the oceans even more. This place is absolutely the most beautiful celebration of the oceans i have ever seem. A temporary show of a Japanese eco artist shows pieces of river banks. It's incredibly beautiful. Too bad it won't stay long there.

Lisbon top attraction for kids. I went there with my two year old daughter and we enjoyed it very much. It saves you some time and money if you buy your tickets online in advance, especially if you are planning to go there on the weekend.
must go in Lisbon. have child? so don't dare to miss this one , it is a magical place that your children would remember

If in Lisbon you must not miss this!!!. I went there because a local had recommended it and said that was excellent and so it was!!! It was a very hot afternoon so I figure it would be perfect to be indoors. The entire place recreates oceans and seas from the entire world. The main tank is beyond belief...it is huge!!! ...and it is contained by the entire main building on four different stories. It is very well presented, the variety of fish is huge among one of the more remarkable is a very large Moon Fish and of course the Sharks and Manta Rays. Please try not to miss this Aquarium!!! PS. Right at the exit there a street vendor that specializes in freshly-pressed juices run by this lovely couple, its name is "Frua" and you must all try their delicious juices!!!

Great Place to take your children while in Lisbon (on a hot day!). The Ocenario is not centrally located but is worth going there if you have infant and todddlers in your family. We took our two year old son there to beat the hot Lisbon heat, and I must say, it was worth it. The entrace fee is a little on the steep side, but when you have a child who can not bare the heat, it is well worth it. This place has a penguine exihibit, an exihibits of all oceans (all air conditioned or cool rooms). Your child will love seeing the large aquarium, which contains a bevy of different ocean life. In essence a great place to escape the heat and keep your child entertained!

Great way to spend a hot afternoon.. This is a really great aquarium with a lot of different exhibits. You could easily spend an entire afternoon here, especially if you take your time at all the viewing points for the large central tank.I definitely recommend this aquarium, plus it's a great way to get out of the sun for a few hours!

Best Ever!!!. Can't say enough about this. Been to aquariums all over the world, and this one tops them all. Incredible array of sea life and the huge tank in the middle is just awesome. Love that we get different views of it as we walk thru, along with great additions like sea otters and penguins. If you only see one thing in Lisbon, go here.

Best in Europe. . I have been to many aquariums. By far this is the best I have seen in both design and diversity. Many species I had never seen before like a guitar fish. And an ocean sunfish that has no tail.

So much fun! . Whether you're a passionate aquarist or are just curious about ocean dwellers, this place will leave you in awe. We spent 4+ hours inside, wowing in front of all exhibits and taking hundreds of pictures and videos. What's more, it seemed all guests were in this excited state, whether they were 5years old, 35 y.o. or 70+. The entire establishment was very clean, well structured to flow the visitors without crowding places and overall a cool getaway from the scorching Portuguese summer outside. The coffee places in and around the Oceanarium seemed a bit overpriced, but that's a really minor detail. Should you ever visit Lisbon, the oceanarium is definitely a must see!

Impressive Oceanarium. The kids generally can struggle with these places but this was a well designed place in a newish part of Lisbon. It was good value if compared to some of the US counterparts. It is definitly worth a half day trip and a nice way to get out of the sun. You will feel calmed and relaxed after a few hours there,
An amazing underwater adventure without getting wet!. This oceanarium is one of the best I have ever been. It is beautifully done and very informative. Worth a visit.
We loved it. Great activity with A/C during August. We spent there around 2 hours.Kids were really interested in all the animals.

Isn't nature amazing?. An exceptional place to enjoy some of the most beautiful sea life. It's a great experience for kids or nature lovers. The temporary exhibit is remarkable. If you buy the tickets online you have a discount.

Amazing! We found Dory and a lot more.... We had an amazing time at the Oceanario in Lisbon. The kids were so excited to see so many species it was a very fun day for the whole family. We truly recommend it.

Very good. The animals all looked happy, if fish can look happy? Very good well kept environments. Thought it was a little pricey at first but then was proven wrong, worth every Penney. Only thing was, lots of children running around exited everywhere.

Great selection of aquatic life...but problems.. So this is the second time I've visited the Oceanarium. We love all the creatures and the variety.The negative points are:- cramped inside and not ideal for pushing buggies- long bridge uphill to the aquarium difficult on little ones legs- no air conditioning inside the building and so becomes stuff and overwhelming especially when busy- very expensive for a small aquariumWe enjoyed ourselves but probably last time we'll go.
Beautiful place. this was my sixth visit to Oceanarium, and I loved it again...everyone should visit this incredible place...

Awesome. Whilst in lisbon the oceanarium is a must see attraction beautifully laid out over two levels and is worth the €17 paid to get in. This attraction is suitable for families as well as couples this is like no other sea life type visit i have ever been to it was out of this world
Great place to go with the kids. A great program to do with the kids, its expensive but one of the most beautifull Oceanarium of Europe. Go early and take the ticket to the temporary exposition too.

fantastic day out. this was recommended by our hotel receptionist and we weren't disappointed... we spent a lot of time here just wandering around and viewing the large variety of animals from lots of various viewing places. its best to purchase your tickets before arriving to avoid the large queue to gain entrance. the kids will love this. a visit to the gift shop won't break the bank
Nice. It is not very big, but it could be interesting for a first visit at an Oceanarium... nice for kids!

Nice place for 2-hours visit. Interesting collection of marine species. I'd advice to buy tickets online or ask for them at the reception of Your hotel-You'll avoid long waiting time at ticket office. Definitely worth those 15-17€ You'll have to pay.

One of the highlights of a trip to Lisbon. Went with my daughter and we both thought it was wonderful. We were overwhelmed by how much there was to see. We particularly enjoyed the central deep aquarium home to tuna, sun fish, sea otters, sharks and many other types of fish. We also liked the miniature sea worlds with different climates that had been created in a circle around the main aquarium and the beautiful tanks of jelly fish moving gracefully up and down - my daughter captured these on video - they look like they have been choreographed. If you like the natural world and want to see close up sea creatures that would be hard to see in the wild this is highly recommended. Its very popular in the holiday season so go early to avoid queues for tickets and a very crowded experience (we went at peak time!). We stopped off in the cafe on the way out and that was good too. Easy to get to on public transport. Its not cheap but it is value for money. So i would go for half a day and see everything including the videos. We also went to the temporary exhibition by a japanese artist who makes underwater worlds - it was okay but not amazing like the aquarium. This must be one of the best aquariums in the world. Its also very accessible for people in wheel chairs, children in buggys but i would avoid crowded times if you are slow on foot or use a stick. If you are taking small children just bear in mind there is a lot to see and they will probably have had enough earlier than their parents / older siblings and that its also visually very intense/overwhelming and possibly frightening for some children. There is a not very nice parade of cafes just outside the oceanarium selling by portuguese standards quite junky foods like icecreams with zillions of sugary toppings. The cafe inside is better value for money, quite large and sells better food/drinks.

amazing palce to visit with friends or family!!!!. We were specchless looking at the moon fish in the main tank of the oceanarium!!!It worths every cent we pay to visit this placeA must for those who visit Lisbon!!!

The surrounding area is also a great spot to walk around.. The location, right on the water offers beautiful views. The exhibition of marine and fresh water species was great. A must go for families with kids and teens.

my kids loved it. The best is to go early to avoid the crowds. Kids had time to enjoy the place. This is a place to visit with kids, there are many things to do around. Cabins, gardens, nice walk, rent a bike, small playground...

Okay. I usually like this sort of thing but there were too many unruly children. The sea otters were cute and I liked the Penguins. But overall disappointing really. The usual- sharks, fish, sea horses, jelly fish.Bit out of town with not much else around. Preferred being around the old town. Just not for me.

The big fish tank! Oh my god!. We had two hours before having to catch our train to Algarve, so that is just enough time to visit the museum. The big fish tank that is huge and you walk around it the whole time you are there... is just amazing and beautiful. I could have looked at it the whole time even if we saw many other interesting animals also.

Amazing . Huge variety of marine life, bit scary as it turned out for our baby tho! She didn't love the transition from face-to-face with fish to face-to-face with penguins. She liked the otters though. I would agree it's one of the best aquariums in Europe. Would definitely go back!
Largest oceanarium in Europe. Lovely, clean, beautifully planned facility with everything in the world inside. Amazing experience and a wonderful way to spend more than the few hours we were there.
Huge fishtank. A little bit expensive, it was either way entertaining and fun. The otters were really cute. The big fish tank in the middle is truty beautiful.

Loved it. Far bigger than expected modern building clean and well staffed. Ideal visit for any kind of weather. Queues to get in but lots of ticket windows open moves quickly. Didn't really know what to expect but the huge main aquarium first viewing area was busy but as you go around crowds thin out. It was busy but that didn't detract from the overall experience. Set out in different ocean sections. Lots to see loved the two cute otters. Also saw puffins really close up and the endangerared Australian Weedy Sea Dragon. They have a short film about the aquarium which is well worth viewing gives insight into what your entrance fee goes to very informative. Despite it being busy just take your time the crowds ebb and flow in fact found it very relaxing. Spent a good two and half hours looking around. Def worth entrance feeOutside there are plenty of places to eat and drink. Set in a nice walking area.
Must see in lisbon . Easy review, must see in lisbon., easy to find and easy to get along in the place, very easy to get from the city

Busy but enjoyabel. We visited the oceanarium as part of a hop on hop off bus ticket deal. It was on our list of things to do, and the bus took us almost to the door, although it can also be reached on the red metro line (oriente).Upon arriving I was glad we had pre-paid the ticket as the queues were long. We headed for the entrance and were taken to a side office and given our tickets, skipping the queue and heading in almost immediately. First stop was the restaurant for a drink and Nata before we tackled the main tanks, good Nata but already we could see this was a very school child oriented place by he large group having lunch. As we expected the main oceanarium was packed with visitors, with large groups of kids and plenty families and couples. We shuffled around each of the exhibits and if you hang around long enough and let the groups pass you can then enjoy the tanks and displays in peace before the next group arrives .We initially missed the sea otters but headed back to where they were signposted and were lucky enough to see then come out and swim by... A lovely site but over very quickly. We hung around for a good 20 mins but only saw them swim out a few times and each time it was once around the small tank and then back under the rocks. Still a beautiful site and again worth hanging around for a quieter time to see these wonderful animals up close.We spent a good couple of hours wandering and enjoying both the permanent large tanks and the temporary exhibit of the underwater forest. Although it was very busy we were still able to see everything up close and enjoyed our visit. Worth taking the cable car over the expo park after your trip, we got off at the other end and had a lovely lunch in one of the many restaurants.
Lovely distraction on a rainy day. Enjoyed a lovely afternoon here.plenty to see and well laid out.Close to a shopping centre , lovely day out

Sunfish!!!!!!. The only place in Europe where you can see a sunfish. Previously there was one in Valencia - but it has passed away.Nice activities for kids. Sadly feeding times in our guidebook did not match the venue - check with the venue in advance.

Fantastic!. My visit was with my family, quite a while ago. It was a very rainy day, and we travelled quite far, so we didn't know where to go. We ended up choosing to go here because we heard so many good things from it. I must say, it did not disappoint at all. It's a world inside of it, and a pretty huge one. I definitely recommend it!

Beautiful big blue just for You. Like everything else in Parque das Nações, famous neighborhood on the river Tejo, beautiful Lisbon Oceanarium was built for 20th Century's last World Fair in 1998. The fact that this is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe speaks for itself. In Oceanarium you can spend hours (and hours and hours) without feeling how time really flies... I will not write about large collection of marine species you can find there, it is up to you to discover, but I'll tell you that you will meet Eusebio and Amalia (famous footballer and fado singer) if you visit Lisbon Oceanarium. How? Check for yourself!
AMAZING!!. One of the most mind-blowing experiences in my life! One of the two greatest sealife facilities I've ever been to!
Huge aquarium. What a brilliant place! We went here en route to the airport and only wished we had allowed ourselves more time.

Nice morning spent at the aquarium. Very easily done in two floors. My family (with teenagers) liked it. It was nice. The best - not by a long shot. The penguins and otters were the best part. Good time.
beatufull. We traveled to Oceanario with the lift. The view is amazing! The oceanario is very interesting place.

Very Nice Aquarium. Very large aquarium with plenty of different viewing points on several hights.
Besides the big tank, there also pinguins, a reef and several other tanks containing marine life.
All tanks are in prefect, well maintained condition.

Pleasantly surprised . We have visited many aquariums throughout North America and this one had a great selection of unique fish that will be hard to find in other places. We are talking fish and species from South Africa, those native to Portugal and their islands, and many from India as well as from Antarctica.It can get busy at times so just be prepared to see a decent amount of people if you come in the late afternoon. Come for feeding time! 12-12:30 and 3-3:30 if memory serves me right.

Great spot, extra packed though . Went there first thing in the morning while I waited to access my accommodation later in the dat. Really nice, giant aquarium in the middle of the building ; saw species I'd never think I'd see! It was extra packed though, and apparently it was a "normal day"; so if you're not fond of touristy spots, don't go.
Huge. Very large aquarium with lots of large, small, tropical, cool water etc etc fish. Plenty to see. Otters a hit with the kids.

Cool educational day. A massive Oceanarium, a very impressive display of ocean creatures.The area is quite nice for a day out, a walk by the river with some nice food outlets.The experience is very smooth, the crew are quite helpful and available.The place is very Dark at places so you'll have to take good care of the little ones.Everything is clean and well maintained.This is a must see for a family.

Nice place to visit. This oceanario is nice, but you can see it was built 20years ago. Worth to go during feeding time.Highly reco of buying tickets on-line - it is 10%discount, you dont have to print and you dont wait in the line.

Very interesting. We got by metro to Oriente station and then a fifteen minutes walk on Av. Dom João. When we arrived there are two long queues, one for buying ticket at the desk and another at the self-service machines (credit-card only), we choose that one at the self-service machine.The Oceanarium is very interesting, huge and it hosts a lot of fish species. We feel like being under the sea.
Great for kids and ok for parents . We went here as a feeling to kids. But it was even ok for adults. Ocenareum is new and nice made. So we send almost two hours. Kids were very excited!

Mostly for kids. Had fun, nice scenery of different oceans and its natural inhabitants but rathat poor variety of animals.. The main tank is the center display and showd from many angles in a rather dulll fashion.. Expected more for its cost (17€). Pretty nice for kids
A must go!. This is one of the best places you can visit in Lisbon. It is amazing, with probably the largest aquarium in Europe. Wonderful, for kids and adults :-)

Impressive and educational. A truly impressive aquarium- a joy to visit with kids/teens - well structured; an enjoyable half day at least
Indeed a top aquarium in Europe- not to be missed
Under the Sea. This was a very enjoyable and beautiful experience !! Saw some fish I never knew existed. Went away saying to myself, I am really glad I saw the Oceanarium.

To busy. I think its an interesting oceanarium , but its far to busy.. it looks like moneymaking is very important here , because there seems to be no limitation in the amount of people they let in and the big tank is nice , but its also a bit sad to see all these fish , especially the big ones, held captive in a relatively small place.

More crowd control required.. We visited in August, which I anticipated to be a busy time, however this really was a bit silly.We waited for well over an hour outside the oceanarium itself and when we got inside were like sardines in a tin.My wife gave up entirely trying to see anything due to the fact so many people were so rude - elbowing, pushing & shoving. The sheer amount of people inside was ridiculous.I picked my 5 year old son up in my arms and had to battle my way for him to see anything.The oceanarium itself would have been great had it not been for the amount of other visitors.I would have rather waited longer outside and actually been able to see something inside.I fully appreciate school holidays are a busy time to visit anything, but this was just not worth while due to the amount people battling to see every animal.

Awesome aquarium. I loved how much this aquarium promoted enviromental awareness everywhere you looked! The aquarium looked well taken care of, always an important thing to me. The only downside was the location, a little out of the way. About a 20min walk from the closest metro.

Great attraction. This is well worth a vist, it is differant to the normal sea life centres. The variety of fish was amazing, we spent a couple of hours there even though it was busy. Children will love it.

Recommend for families. We spent about 2 hours at the oceanarium. We were concerned that the older kids (12 and 15) would not enjoy the attraction but it turned out they enjoyed it as much as the 7 and 10 years old. It was a change from the sightseeing we had been doing. There is a cafe in the oceanarium that offers basic menu at reasonable prices. I would recommend families with children to visit.
Having as much fun as the children!. If you have an extra few hours you should visit this place! Sit on the floor and just watch through the glass!

Beautiful with happy animals. I'm completely against zoo's, but these animals were in a more natural state. They looked content in their environment. We loved every minute of it with our 14 month old.

Good variety of sea life but very crowded. My partner and I spent a good afternoon at the aquarium and were not disappointed. There is a great variety of sea life and perfect information to back it all up but the place was very crowded and found it difficult to see at times. The shop at the end as expected (in other aquariums) was a bit pricey but overall a good experience.

Amazing aquarium and exhibits. This is the first Oceanarium I have ever visited. The central tank was fantastic, as can be viewed at both levels from many sides so plenty of viewing opportunities.The exhibits take you through each area of the watery world, and are amazing. Just enough written information to take in some interesting facts about the animals on display.Top tip is to book tickets in advance online and print out. This meant we walked straight in to the Oceanarium without queuing.On site cafes and restaurants are good value.A great place to visit with all ages, especially with a cable car trip too.
Visit. We heard a lot about it and aren't disappointed, great experience ! You definitely should go there for sure !
Full of nature. We visited the Oceanarium in july 2016 with our ten years old son. He enjoyed the variety and information about the fishes. Great place. Worth the visit.
Had a great time. Went with family and we enjoyed our stay. A little expensive. We used 2 hours and it was enough time for us.

Better than expected. Went to the Oceanarium expecting to be there about an hour and wanting to see the surrounding modern area. Spent about 3.5 hours inside. It was really fabulous how everything was exhibited and explained. Really informative and interesting as well as magnificent main aquarium with large array of fish, from tropical reef fish to open Ocean fish. really amazing! Outside the whole area is worth a walk around as the modern architecture in some parts is really grabbing! Also had large shopping centre attached which was fun for a bit of retail therapy latter before heading back. Definitely put a part of a 3 plus day itinerary.

Very disappointing visit. After visiting beautiful aquariums in Barcelona and Singapore, we had higher expectations for the one here in Lisbon. The aquarium is basically one bigger tank (mediocore size compared to the ones in Singapore and Barcelona) surrounded by nearly household size aquariums. There were also two open pond-like rooms for penguins and otters. One guest got bird feces on her from the other birds flying around in the penguin area. The extra exhibit was a 4 minute walk-through.The area around the aquarium had also seen its best days and was somewhat sad to stroll around.

Magico ma non indimenticaile. Lisbon Oceanarium is for sure one the things that has to be done while staying in Lisbon for more than three days. If not, in my opinion it doesn't represent a must-do because it's really amazing but to me nothing that couldn't be found in other parts of the world. Knowing the magic of Lisbon, if you don't have enough time to spend, I think you better enjoy the town.

Best aquarium I've been too.... By far the best aquarium/oceanarium I've ever been to, with such a diverse range of sea life as well as informative detail. Completely recommend visiting as part of your trip in Lisbon.

A great visit. Ir has the most outstanding collection of
Sea creatures. For children and grown ups. It is worth a long visit.
Overrated.. Lacking a few bigger fish that excite the thrill seekers and To be honest fairly underwhelmed by the whole experience. Overrated.
Sea world . Great place to spend a few hours but go early , my partner and I had to queue for almost any hour in the baking sun , but once inside great variety of sea life,but very busy.

One of the best oceanariums in the world!. We have visited twice and will probably return again! It really is spectacular. You can also see penguins being fed, have birds flying above you catching their food, walk through a mini rain forest, the jelly fish were breathtaking and the size of the octopus- wow, etc..........top tip: book your tickets online to avoid the huge queues. Next tip:Buy something in the 1st shop to obtain a voucher for a bigger discount in the 2nd shop (much bigger). A stunning oceanarium!

Awesome!. Beware, every Oceanarium is packed with tourists and little kids and this one is no exception. It's really huge and tons of opportunity for photos. There is an automatic trolley that you can stand on and it'll move you (like the ones in airports).

Has the wow factor. A definite if you're visiting Lisbon.. This is our second visit to the Oceanarium, and it still takes your breath away. Very well organised displays, and the central deep pool has some stunning sharks, rays and sunfish. Leading on you enter into different zones; with puffins and penguins above and sea otters and of course fish below. Then its becomes more tropical in the next zone. My favourite were the strange seahorses and jellyfish, imaginatively displayed so they glow in the dark.

lack of security was a concern in these troubled times. Firstly, the Oceanarium is excellent and was worth the 58 euro entry fee we paid for 3 adults and 1 child. We had to queue for 15 minutes in hot sun to buy the ticket. Staff were on hand to advise people which ticket - very useful - BUT I was concerned that there were no bag checks or security, which is a concern in these troubled times. The cafe was Excellent and very good value, unlike so many similar places that rip you off, so well done on that. The aquarium - fantastic!!!

Fishtastic Family Attraction. We have been to many variants of sea-life centre, often as a rainy day activity. However, the Oceanarium came so highly recommended that we sacrificed a few hours of sunshine. Set in the Expo park, with free parking, the Oceanarium is an impressive building. Entertainers have been employed to amuse those queuing for tickets, and when we arrived the queue was very long, but we were paid and through after less than 20 minutes of beach-ball football. The fee was 36Euro for a family of 4, with children under 12.When we walked into the first room of the Oceanarium we were greeted by a giant tank filled with sharks, rays and many more varieties of sea life. The tank is the depth of the building and is designed to give a realistic understanding of ocean life; the ground floor is at sea-bed level and each floor provides a view of the fish that live at that level of the sea. The whole building wraps around the tank so it can be seen throughout your visit.The site is split into different areas depicting the seas and oceans and the wildlife that live next to them - there are even penguins and sea birds. The children were constantly discovering a new wonder and they visited every exhibit without any coaxing to carry on a little bit longer. My only - perhaps obvious - observation would be that due to the numbers of people there were queues to get to look at all of the displays and as it is quite dark in some areas, the children felt a little unsettled.Overall, this was a brilliant attraction and good value for money.
Very good. It is awesome. Best on its kind. A lot of sea species and very famiñy friendly environment. Definetely worth the visit

Probably one of the best of the world. Is a place you need to go!!! A very must also because it has so many things to do around that you can spend the day in the area, where it was made the Expo in 98, and the space is just great!
Entrance for adults is 14€ but believe me, worth every penny
Great experience, a must!. It is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe, lots of animals to see! it makes a perfect day to go with friends or family
Great place to visit on an afternoon is Lisbon. This place is such a fine example of a metropolitan oceanarium. I highly recommend it if you're interested in spending value added time in Lisbon
Cooler than walking round the zoo on a hot day. Its a great way to spend a morning or afternoon before a late flight, although I wouldn't cut into my stay in Lisbon by visiting it.
The kids loved it and so the adults.. The place is very nice and peasant. The staff very nice. The animals and aquarium were clean. The kids can see a lot of animals very close and see to feed them.
Amazing aquarium. Best aquarium I've seen. Huge variety of sea life from all the oceans on the planet. Very educational and entertaining. Superb design.
Amazing for kids and adults . Amazing place amazing conditions, very good aquariums and quality of the species, the temporarily exposition are always very good, this one now amazed me allot

Lovely exhibits. Some of the exhibits are among the best I've seen for sea life. It was fairly crowded though and my two children 4 and 7 found it difficult to see. It would have been nice if there was more to stimulate then. Apart from that, very pleased

Great for kids!. Book your tickets online to save 10% and have line by-pass when you arrive!
Our 1 year old LOVED seeing the fishes, pointing to them, babbling to them, and got so excited he was waving his arms and waving to the fish! Crowded but manageable. Penguins were cute to watch.
An amazing aquarium!. What a place to visit! Such an interesting, informative aquarium full of fantastic sea life. It was great fun (even for us 30-odds!).

Under water wonders. It is a "must" when you visit Lisbon for at least five days - and certainly, when you are travelling with children! Situated in the beautiful Parc of the Nations, you enter this aircraft carrier like building and step into a different world. It is the biggest aquarium in Europe and allows you to meet a wide range of marine species - sharks, rays, sea otters, sea horses, jelly fish, corals, star fish, penguins . . . . The huge tanks give you a feeling of swimming inside yourself. We spent a whole day there, having a pleasant lunch in the Oceanarium's cafe and when we finally left, we had the feeling of not having done justice to it all.
Amazing. Huge, with loads of opportunity to see the main attractions all the way through the complex. Kids loved it.
Beautiful oceanarium. Big oceanarium just outside the center of Lisbon. Lots to see with a nice diversity of different animals. Best to go there during the weekdays to avoid big crowds.
Best Ozean museum. So many species to watch. You can just sit there and see sharks, one huge moonfish and rays. We loved the seaotter.
Expensive but worth the visit. Many areas with different exhibits. Also check the shows !!! You will need at least an hour on the run to see all (but not the shows)

View the ocean from inside. An amazing place and the whole family learnt so much! Long queues though so book your tickets on-line if you can. All the animals look so healthy and happy and I never thought I'd be able to say that about fish!! Certainly one of the hi-lights of our Lisbon holiday.

Amazing experience. #1 acquarium in europe#2 in the world!I rest my case! :)))This is an amzing, entertaining and educational place to go and visit.Plus the quality of the place makes it an unique experience.I keep going back and there is always something new to see and learn!!!
Can't miss it. With one of the biggest aquariums in the world, you'll for sure be impressed with what you will experience in side this building

Nice way to spend two hours. This was my firs visit to an aquarium so was new to me. It wasn't too busy and was nice to wander around and in the peace and quiet. It was extremely tranquil . It is a little out of the way so have a taxi number for journey home or else you'll spend some time walking and trying to flag one down.

Excellent aquarium. This is a top notch aquarium and worth a visit. Very well done and lots of variety to keep my 2 year old engaged. It was quite busy, but lots of ticket sales is likely why they are able to keep it great!
Awesome. What a cool oceanium its a must see in Lissabon. It was cool to see al those animals someone are very big like the crab. And the sharks comes really close to the bassin

Not just for children. Expect your visit to last longer than you plan. There is a lot to see from toddler- eye- level, upwards and from rhe central tank with my favourite the rays to the small wall exhibits with individual species. My grandchildren both loved their visits.

Amazing!!. Some really amazing animals. Some of which I never knew existed.
Can be a little expensive during the peak holiday periods but it all goes to a good cause as it is a conservation project and all funds raised are put towards the protection of these amazing creatures.
Would 100% recommend anyone to visit.

Amazing Oceanarium even the second time - HIGHLY recommended!!!. The Lisbon Oceanarium is the best one I've seen, my kids loved it and we did too. We sat right in front of the HUGE window and tried to take it all in.

Great experience . I rely enjoyed my time at the oceanarium it took me about 2 1/2 hours to do the whole aquarium and temporary exhibit, I loved the temporary exhibit it was so peaceful and beautiful. I also liked how it had strong messages on all the information boards about conservation of our oceans, reduction of carbon emissions and sustainable fishing. Because if we don't change the aquarium will be the only place with these fish.

Fun for the children. This was a fun way to spend the evening. A great range of fish and birds. The otters are beautiful. Unfortunately it was very busy when we were there but we still enjoyed our visit.
Exciting. A grezt variety of fish, but also birds and anemones.A bit crowded in agust, even in a week day. but I still highly recommend it for the sea lovers

Small . We came here as it highly rated on trip advisor. It was nice to see and I really enjoyed the Penguins however I felt it was quite small and only took around 20 mins to get round. Also very busy but I understand it is holiday season.

A perfect destination on a rainy (or too hot) day. I took a while before they could convince me to visit the oceanarium. i was wrong. It is really inpressive and the vast variety of sea specimen they have is amazing. A very nice thing to do on a rainy or a too hot day. Enjoy !
Great!. An amazing experience with brilliant exhibits and a lot of cool stuff to see. Just be prepared for heavy crowds and lots of bratty, screaming kids!!

Awesome!. The Lisbon Oceanarium is an awesome place to visit! The main tank is absolutely amazing with lots of different species (including sharks!)! Try to go outside of vacations period (in the winter, for example) because in the summer it may be crowded.

Lisbon Oceanarium. Even though it wasn't that crowded with people, it was hard to see the scenes through the big windows.I've been to better Aquariums ie Shed in Chicago and Ripley's in Toronto. However, you get to see a modern build-up area of Lisbon beside the water. You can walk along the water, see the huge stadium close by and discover another part of Lisbon. Kids would have fun.
Amazing..must see!!!. Wonderful experience. Wide variety of living species. Very interesting to watch all Lisbon Oceanarium has to offer. Must see!!!

Great escape drom the heat. Very beautiful and educational place with an amazing variety and I was told Europe's biggest aquarium and second biggest worldwide.Besides the aquarium they have otters, penguins and so on but the aquarium is the absolute stunner!!!

Top Aquarium. You cannot find a better place to take your kids with you! The Oceanario is fantastic place to go every year. I prefer the winter and the rainy days to be inside of the building watching wonderful fishes and marine animals!

Well worth a visit. The Oceanário is well worth a visit, specially in those hot Summer days in Lisbon! Very educative for children of all ages and even for adults too. I think it has species from every single ocean in the World.
Sea life. Terrific place to spend the morning or afternoon. Lots of diferent sea species, fishes. Good acesses.

Quite disappointing. After an excellent start, the expectation for the Oceanarium raised pretty quickly.We have been disappointed with the limited exposition compared to other similar structures: Genova and Barcellona.Overall not worth the price in my opinion.
worth going. good fun, not to expensive and well laid-out. Good for an hour or two with children, set in a great place.

Pacifying Experience. This was my first visit of oceanarium ever . The variety of species was enormous . Fishes , sharks , penguins, puffins ... amazing art of nature. Only reproach was a crowd of people and plenty of children all around the place.
Amazing. Really nice and visual! Each animal is described well and in English :P The whole aquarium is like a maze but its really easy to move around

I like turtles. . There were no turtles.
Buy your passes online. 10% off. No waiting in long lines on arrival.
Great aquarium with a huge central tank. Spectacular sun fish, sharks and rays. No turtles.

Great, even on a third visit. Been to the oceanarium every time in Lisbon in past 10 years. It takes my breath away every time. The main tank is huge and you can spend hours being mesmerised just watching all the fish etc glide around but there is so much more with the otters and penguins etc and the other permanent exhibits.This time though the exhibition from the Japanese artist is breathtakingly beautiful, totally breathtakingly gorgeous

Go early!. We were there by 10am and queued for only a few minutes. On our way out at lunchtime the queue was enormous.Interesting enough inside, but to compare two, I believe the one in Brest, France is much better.

Great!. It is a must to see if you're staying in Lisbon for some days! It's really great however we got unlucky when we went there because there was really a lot of people inside but it's well designed so we could fully enjoy it!

Nice day out. Children enjoyed and it was quite big. Nice restaurants around the to have lunch. We booked online so it saved us spending time queuing, it was a long queue when you got there, so glad we booked before.

Amazing; lots of screaming kids. An amazing spot. My girlfriend and I are big fans. The mola mola sunfish was a highlight of our visit.The one major downside is the number of screaming children and families - I'd strongly recommend that the aquarium starts using time-limited tickets to restrict the number of visitors at a given time.

Fantastic place for everyone. We spent the whole day visiting this place. Unforgettable views and experience. Flora and fauna from all oceans. Sharks and mantas were beautiful. The place especially recommended for kids from educational reasons.

Good but could be better. It was a little pricey considering there wasn't actually much there, however what was there was very interesting and nice. The layout of the oceanarium was very easy to follow and the staff are great :)

Lovely way to spend an afternoon. We spent a very enjoyable afternoon in the aquarium. It is very well laid out and easy to walk around. The main tank is very large with lots of different sea creatures. There was lots to see in the aquarium and I would definitely recommend a visit.
Great afternoon. If you love the sea, it will be your favourite venue in Lisbon. Especially if you are accompanied by kids, they will love it.

Way too crowded. I've visited a lot of aquariums, and this is far from the best. Really crowded and hard to walk or see anything. Maybe it's better during a different time of the day. Many fishes and clean tanks, but nothing special. If you want to give it a try I recommend to buy the tickets online. Seemed to be a really long wait to buy them at the Ocenarium, while we got in at 5 seconds.

Good to do if you have time. Traveled as a family with a 10 and 6 year old. At the end of the trip the kids were all "cast and churched" out. We have been to the Monterey Aquarium in Monterey Ca many times so we'd thought we'd compare. The central tank is outstanding. the Sharks, the Rays, the Sun fish, and much more were amazing to see so close up. Overall, we think we Monterey slightly edges out Lisbon, but only slightly.

Book in advance. It is a Lovely place and there's lots to see but I'd advice booking online and going early, it gets so busy, you can't get to see all of the attractions and there's a lot of pushing and shoving as people are trying to get in front of and past you

A lovely day out, informative and enjoyable. I think you can guess what this attraction is going to be, if you have ever been to a Sea life centre or large Aquarium then you won't be surprised or disappointed. As a family we enjoyed this and wiled away a pleasant few hours here. My particular favourite was the room with the penguins, this was a large rocky are with frozen sections housing not only penguins but a large collection of birds which occasionally flew (quite closely) over head. Watching the birds interact and totally ignore the tourists was quite relaxing and entertaining and the ice kept the room nicely chilled which was welcome in the 35degree heat outside. As an aside the little canteen was quite reasonable as well for drinks and meals with a set menu for lunch if you wanted. Would recommend booking online because you get 10% discount and avoid any queue at the entrance. You just show the tickets on your phone so you don't need to print anything off

Visit the ocean world. Really nice experience. We spend 3 hours there on a friday. It was a bit crowded( with many kids) but still nice. I recommend buyibg tickets on line because otherwise we had to wait at least an hour. We recommend!

Nice place . We visited the Oceanarium with our 10-month-old baby who loved to watch the big windows with many different fishes. It took us one hour to see to whole place, so it was a bit expensive for our needs.

This Place is Awesome. I purchased tickets online for this attraction and was really looking forward to it.I only wish I had more time for my visit, I could have easily spent the whole day here, relaxing away from the hot sun.The temporary exhibition was a bonus I wasn't expecting too.The layout and variety of the exhibits is superb, I will most likely visit again one day.

What an aquarium!. First time at Oceanario and loved the experience. It is filled with beautiful and very diverse sea creatures. One thing I wish was to have more information available on the different fish we saw. A must if you have children over 4!

Nice way to spend an afternoon. We visited this place on the second day of our trip to Lisbon, it is relatively easy to get to using the metro as we did. Book online if you can - the price is cheaper and you can use queue jump. Wonderful variety of fish and other animals there - they look happy and healthy and the views you can get through the glass are breathtaking sometimes, for me especially the Sharks and the Rays. Don't eat here if you can help it - bland food and steep prices but obviously that isn't what draws people here.
Reserve the whole day! Too much to see!. Great place for family and kids! Please reserve the whole day!!! If you arrive early in the summer you will have the rest of the day for more fun!

Amazing experience. We visited in August when we knew it would be busy but short queues for buying tickets and the kids loved the waterfall outside. Inside there is so much to see but it was crowded in parts and you have to do the full circuit - no options for cutting the tour short if your little one has had enough! Fortunately our children loved it and would definitely recommend it

Immersion. Lisbon Oceanarium upper floor holds four different habitats, one on each corner. You can see penguins, other kind of birds, otters... on a very well simulated natural environment. The temperature is so cold you can almost feel you're close to it in a real environment.Lower floors hold a big water tank on the center with many fish species, so you keep walking around it and you see it from different angles with slightly on the environment. Around it, on the corners you will see different expositions with small fishes, jellys, frogs, seahorses...Overall it's a good experience, but the price might be too high. Its 17€ per adult (15,30€ online).

Crowded - not worth it!!!. If you like to take your time while travelling and look at stuff at your own pace, then DON'T GO TO THIS "point of interest". It's full of people who don't understand the basic concepts of how society works and leave their kids climb everywhere, scream and incomodate other viewers. The tickets are too pricey for what you are going to see: thousands of sea creatures stuffed in a small aquarium. Would recommend to visit the counterpart in Valencia and save yourself some money and time (oh yeah, the queue is big) here in Lisbon.

Great with kids or to unwind from a busy day. Learning & having fun at the same time, the visit of the Oceanarium is great for kids. The central aquarium inside holds fish from all oceans conveying also a meaningful message to all visitors.
Nice. Big aquarium with big fish. Buy tickets în on-line as te ques can last for 1 hr. It can ne visited in about 1hr and a half!
Amazing. A great way to pass a couple of hours but it does get very busy. Quite a way out of the city but taxis are plentiful.

A Beautiful Aquarium. We spent a few hours here on our last day in Lisbon. It is a lovely facility with many varieties of fish. I don't think I have ever seen a sunfish before, but it is pretty awesome to see. The Oceanario would be a great place for kids.
Great experience . Great place lots of views in a newly generated area , the expeierence it's self is next to none it gives you an underwater experience

VERY NICE PLACE. If possible take ticket online, we didn't buy online we have to wait on the very long queue. Our 7.5 years old son enjoyed a lot. It wasn't offer very different kind fishes than the other aquarium, but kids will enjoy. I like shopping center of the aquarium.
Lovely. A nice air conditioned and calming environment to spend a day. Try and avoid summer holidays (if you don't have kids)
Pretty nice. It's a great experience, went there twice in three years and the second time was still pretty nice ! It feels like you're inside a little ocean

Wonderful day with family!. I already visited many Acquariums in Europe and was not expecting such a great place. Very pleasant, the big acquarium is huge and interactive, children were so impressed and amused!
Definitly suggest for all families visiting Lisbon. Expo area is one of the most beautiful parks in the city.

This is something different (and amazing!). Forget what you think about oceanariums, this is something entirely different and amazing! All the animals, fish, sharks, rays, seat otters, penguins, everybody is in the same pool, and there are gazillions of them! I think with kids it is a must if you are in Lisbon, but adults also enjoy it, it's truly amazing.

Super good attraction. I love visiting aquariums and was impressed with this particular one. The way it is structured is efficient. You go through the aquarium as a one-way so it is very organized. It doesn't get crowded this way and there is lots to see. Their little mascot is adorable too.

Must visit with the kids. This is a must see if you are in town with the kids.
Very well maintained.
Lots of fish species.
Huge fish tank with see through windows all around it on two floors.

Well there are these little things..... The ticket for permanent + temporary exhibition costs 17euros.The oceanarium was beautiful but it wasn't a good idea to go there in the middle of the day.There were too many people and most of them children who didn't know how to behave and their parents couldn't care less.There was so much screaming and noise that my head wanted to explode. So instead of enjoying the place and taking it in we just went through it as fast as we could and tried to escape the horror of noise.

Day trip. Well I must admit I was not over keen the go as I thought it would be another aquarium, But go if you can , I loved it, excellent viewing Windows amazing amount and types of fish, and while your in the area go on the cable cars

Visit the main venue not the temporary exhibit. My husband just went to the ticket counter and got tickets. Unknowingly, we got charged $3 or $4 for a temporary exhibition that lasted a grand total of 3 minutes... I wish staff had asked if we wanted tickets for ALL the facility or just the MAIN VENUE. Had a bad taste on my mouth for this but it is undeniable that this place is WELL WORTH the entrance money. Beautiful unique creatures that we had never seen (seadragon, exotic jellyfish, big ugly fish, etc). I did not want to go in as I wanted to explore the Vasco de Gama mall but I sure am glad I did. This is a fantastic attraction for the young and older. Enjoy !

AMAZING! A MUST!. I was with my family in Lisbon, and our teens were interested in visiting the Oceanarium. Very accessible by Metro (just on the East shore of Tajo River from the Metro Oriente), we had an amazing visit. This Oceanarium is the second largest in the world after the one in Osaka (built by same architect). It contains a HUGE reservoir where you can see amazing fish and sea life that we had never seen before. Around it, reproduction of 4 Oceans where their flore and animal life is recreated. A real beauty to see. We have amazing pictures of fish and plants. Tons of very insightful information about the Oceans, their animal life and their preservation. We loved the fact that this Center was recreated to inform us about Oceans, and educate us to preserve them by changing our life habits. A MUST see if you are in Lisbon! We were there on a Sunday, but would have been better to go on a week day, as it was quite crowded. A bit expensive (62 Euros for 4), but it was worth every penny!

Must see in Lisbon. Even if you are an adult!. Most guide books suggest this attraction in the pages dedicated to "things to do with children". This is so wrong! Europe's best acquarium will leave you breathless no matter what. Extra tip: Book online in order to avoid the queues!
Great experiene. Great experience for adults and kid. Huge central aquarium is spectacular. We spent there 3 hours and it just flew by. The biggest natural water aquarium absolutely amazing.
not impressed. it was very busy and way to many push prams alot of pushing not great for small kids as they were getting pushed a lot

Amazing place. Me and my best friend (2 25 year olds) went here on a spare sightseeing day. It had plenty to see. Unfortunately there are a lot of children but the otters make up for that. The area outside the aquarium is also beautiful. Modern and clean and very different to Lisbon central. Recommend to any ages!!

Exceeds expectations. Amazing what they did with the place, much larger than expected, really beautiful.
Avoyd the queue by buying the ticket online from the website - they will scan the barcode on your phone

Very busy but great aquarium. I've been to many aquariums so wasn't sure we needed to add this to our Lisbon trip but my kids (ages 9 & 11) loved it. The giant tank in the center of the building is wonderful to view from many angles as you tour the exhibits. The other exhibits are well laid out, and interesting. The cafe and the gift shop were great. It was very, very crowded but we went in the middle of August in high season.

Educational and very interesting. Not a fan of visiting zoos or aquariums but had the extra time and read positive reviews about this place. The temporary exhibition was the world's largest aquarium by a Japanese aquarium architect and was interesting. One of the benefits of this aquarium is they're really passionate about educating visitors about the state of the ecological system in the world and if you take the time to read the species and area descriptions you can learn a lot.Seeing the sharks, manta rays, huge fish and all was really cool. Downside (inevitable) of the trip was kids running all over the place and being completely oblivious about adults walking around given there are some dark areas as you work your way through all the sections of the aquarium.Tip: There's a bus from Cais de Sodre (among other stops including Santa Apolonia) that drops you off a 2 minute walk to the aquarium - not hard to get to at all given the stop is named after the aquarium. Also, if you can buy your tickets online to avoid the queue.
Beautiful. Very well organized aquarium. Takes about 2 to 3 hours max. Lots of kids though but can't help that.

A great place to spend an afternoon. Not the biggest aquarium I've ever visited but it had the best layout. Each corner represented a different ocean and was stocked accordingly, the information displayed was interesting instead of overwhelming. My favourites were definitely the sea otters, I could have stayed there all day to watch them play!

A must-visit. Lisbon Oceanarium is probably the highlight of our two-week long stay in the city.It was reasonably priced, compared to other European tourist attractions, and very easily accessible from the nearby Metro station.The cafeteria was good and ideal for a drink midway or after you've completed your journey around the Oceanarium, which itself offers displays of exotic fish and ocean life.We loved the otters and the giant tank in the middle, which acts as a centrepiece.Very popular with children, the Oceanarium is enlightening with signs in a variety of languages to make sure all tourists understand and can learn more about the wonderful creatures.

Good experience . Very nice structure, good customer journey, better to buy tickets on line to avoid queuing on site. Excellent for children.
Special care to the temporary expo, the Japanese aquatic garden is an amazing experience !

Pleasantly surprised . We visited Lisbon on the cruise ship and thought we would go the the Oceanarium, it's advertised as the largest aquarium in Europe. The large main tank was very big with many viewing windows on two levels it seemed to be a centre point with many other attractions around it. It had sharks, stingray, and very large ocean sunfish that I'd never seen before. They had a good selection on jelly fish, Octopi. They also had penguins in a nice cool rocky area no snow. They had sea otter and a rainforest with many species of coloured poisonous and non poisonous little frogs, really pretty.I think this place which has many other things that I haven't mentioned, is well worth a visit, families and children of all ages will be fascinated and encouraged to enjoy and protect our treasured wildlife.
Great time. My family has had a great time visiting the oceanario. For my daughter it was the highlight of the visit to Lisbon.

Most impressive oceanarium so far. The oceanarium of Lisbon is hard to discribe in words. You must see it. Propably the best thing was, that from every window you looked inside, you saw magnificant underwater life.

Just .... fantastic. The Lisbon Oceanarium is beyond doubt one of the best and most spectacular aquariums in the world. The respect for nature is always present; the variety of marine life is excellent; the facilities are great. Worth a visit.

Amazing!. The oceanarium is such an amazing experience for children and adults will enjoy it just as well.I think they should be very proud of what they accomplished and how well the place is organized. Even the architecture is impressive. It is separated to different oceans of the world and the variety of fish in each. A massive aquarium in the middle mimicking the vast seas.There is plenty of room to view and take photos (no flash!) even at a busy Sunday. I think it's a very educational experience as the kids kept talking about what they've seen and asking more questions for days.The oceanarium is wheelchair and stroller accessible. Restrooms were spot clean.And.. It's cheap compared to other oceanariums I've been to. 46€ for a family ticket (2 adults, 2 children). Baby was free (<3).

Busy but interesting . We went here in the afternoon and it was extremely busy, so not sure if a morning visit would be better... However it is a very interesting and well planned out aquarium, a highlight for me was the temporary exhibit 'Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano' which was beautiful. Nice coffee and custard tarts in the cafe too!
fun even for adults. I went here with my mother and we both loved seeing the wonderful main aquarium and the sea otters. definitely worthwhile.
Worth doing . Definitely worth doing. It's a bit of a trip from the main square but is an enjoyable way to spend half a day in Lisbon Recommended
Very nice. Must see.. The best Oceanarium in Europe we've ever seen. Many species, nice design. Really worth seeing. Recommended for all famillies.

They do respect the environment!. We just loved this place, beautifully organized and full of respect for the sea creatures they display - and this is less usual than you'd expect. We loved the clear explanations, the fact that we could see the fish and the animals very well, but that there was no "show" during which they would be treated like circus creatures, the very interesting documentary explaining how they are cared for. And we adored the enthusiastic puffins, as well as the cute sea otters. Other oceanariums should take notice!
