Beautiful but crowdy (buy tickets online!). Excellent attraction presenting many different species living in all three oceans. Beautiful displays of flora and fauna. Extremely busy during high season. Buy tickets online to avoid queuing!

Nothing special. We've booked a eTicket, so we get an direct entrance with no waiting time. Inside you see a big Pool with many fishes inside. The Highlight is the big sunfish. Infact that lisbon is on the atlantic, the collection of fishes was very limited.

Best 4 hours I spent at an aquarium!. The Oceanarium's layout is perfect for viewing above ground and below the water animals in all four oceans. The current temporary exhibit, "Forests Under the Water" by Takashi Amano, is exquisite! I believe it should remain permanently. The view of the fish swimming within the greenery and the music made for a relaxing stop.

The Oceanorium is worth it!. I wanted to do it badly, and I loved itFor this weirdest ugliest moon fish and ray and shark as well and cutest otters, frogs and penguins as wellwonderful photo opportunitiesAlso quite refreshing in steaming hot august too ;-)))

Best aquarium I've ever visited. This is better than SeaWorld in Orlando. The main tank is massive, the enclosures feel very open, the animals are some of the most exotic for an aquarium and most importantly, they look happy and healthy. Do visit here and also try the nearby cable car and many restaurants!
Fishy day!!. Lovely day out for the kids and all. Very unusual fish and very cleverly designed. Worth a visit and also surrounding area is lovely too.
Good, but very crowded . Very nice but very crowded.Very nice with kids and ... If you are looking for fresh air as there is some areas with penguins which needs iced water.

Wonderful time!. Great time watching all the fish types. At first I thought maybe it's a waste of money and that it's too expensive. But the oceanarium has a lot of offer and gives you a lot to see. Enjoyed every second.

Spectacular. We visited on a hot August day and had a queue for about an hour to buy tickets and enter. It was worth it. The exhibits are from all regions of the world, from penguins and puffins to tropical fish. The main tank is impressive with many large fish, sharks etc and can be viewed at numerous places on both levels. If going at a busy time, best to book tickets online in advance.Whilst there have a walk along the riverfront or take the gondola to Vasco da Gama tower and see the impressive bridge.
Kids love it . Very nice aquarium but if traveling without kids and have been to other big aquariums before then it has nothing new to offer.

WOW. I hear it's the biggest aquarium in Lisbon. I was impressed with the level of interaction we can have with some of the birds, as well as by the diversity of marine life. Not to be missed, and quite affordable.
Amazing. Best aquarium I have ever been to. Main tanks are awesome, complimented by a stunning temporary exhibition and the addition of penguins and sea otters. Simply stunning.

An excellent educational visit. Located a short walk from Oriente metro station, the Lisbon Oceanarium is a must see for all visitors to Lisbon. Although it looks small from outside, the sheer amount of exhibits belies it's size. The fish, otters, frogs and many other animals have plenty of space though and it's only as you work your way through the building that you realise how they have managed to fit so much in.You could sit and watch the central tank for hours!

Exceptional. builded for the International fair, one of the largest aquarium in the world! Enjoy the incredible window facing sharks twice your size... my nephews are still impressed whith what they saw...

Good to beat the heat, could use some improvements. After a couple busy and very hot days traipsing about Lisbon, we all needed a place with air conditioning! The Oceanarium won. It was, indeed, considerably cooler than anything else we could do with 2 seniors, 2 adults, and 2 children in tow. There were a lot of fun exhibits: the puffins and otters are memorable. However, the biggest concern that ALL six of us noted is the lack of adequate lighting. This aquarium is dark, really dark inside. I bumped into a few people's feet because I couldn't see them. Yes, the aquatic environments are lit but the rest of the place appears to be in a blackout.Also, signage is lacking. This was seen continually throughout the country so may be less of an Oceanarium thing but more of a country-specific concern. Finding the WC within the building required finding an employee (not an easy task, maybe it was just really busy that day?) and asking. When they direct you to the WC, it is a single room so there is inevitably a line of 12 people ahead of you. Fine...I head on to the next WC which yields the same issue. My advice is to use the WC on the lower level near the gift shop. There is likely a line but there are numerous stalls so it should go quickly.We were able to spend about 2-2.5 hours there which fit the bill but some easy improvements could be made to make it better.

Excellent Aquarium. Def worth a visit, especially with kids. The huge aquarium tank is the centerpiece and it is beautiful. Kids loved it and despite the fact that the Rotterdam Blijdorp zoo also has a beautiful aquarium (Oceanium), we enjoyed it a lot as the set up is great and the exhibits were on beautiful display with respect for the sea life creatures.

Great Place to go with kids. The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of my kids favourite programs. There are a lot of things to see and to explore, my kids love to go there, especially on those rainy days when you cannot be outside.
Visit@oceanario. Great experience for everyone, but it most certainly is the right place for families with children. The gift shop is really expensive,though.
Really great. A place you must visit in Lisbon, specially if you have kids. Meet creatures from the 4 oceans and have a great day in a wonderfull and well located place in Lisbon.

Perfect for children. The Lisbon Oceanarium is a perfect place to go with children. The main aquarium in the centre is amazing and you can stay there sitting for hours. It's perfect because the children love to play near the aquarium and of course see all the other atractions and even touch some of the animals like the rays. I reccomend that you go on a quiet day out of the high season and the weekends because if there is lot of people you won't enjoy as much.

Good family treat . The attraction is very well presented with some really good exhibits. Oriente Metro station is only five minutes away so it's easy and cheap to get to. Loads of fish. Charming otters. Lots of information boards in dual languages. Stunning sun fish which looks like a swimming rock! My two sub 10 boys loved it. We ate there which was fine but there are some really interesting restraints five mins or so along the waterside and I wished we had tried those. We arrived in August on a weekend and queued 5 mins to get in. About forty pounds for the four of us on a family ticket. Two hours to amble through. One can book on line but not sure it's cheaper or that much faster given one has to queue for the automated tickets. Lastly don't be drawn in to the gift shop on the first floor to spend the spending money. There is a much bigger gift shop on the ground floor.
An amazing place!. The arrangements and variety of sea life is remarkably it is a must see. It is close to the Oriente Metro Station and there are many other interesting attractions close by.

All the oceans in one place, it gives an all new prospect. The best oceanarium ever!. Fantastic place, great for going alone, with your family or your mate. You can see all the different oceans and an enormous in the middle with all kind of beautiful fishes. It takes 2 hours to see it all. Check the feeding hours for the pinguins and otters, it's worth the wait. You can buy the tickets on the net or on self-service kiosks.

Excellent . Very nice oceanarium We loved it. Inspite of the fact that I have two teenagers who " know everything " they really enjoyed it. It's set in a nice location and has wonderful fishes, well organized and one could easily spend 3 hrs walking around. It was close to the Metro station which is convenient. Was airconditioned therefore a nice activity to be done in the heat of the afternoon in summer. We have been to many aquariums when the kids were young and I would rate this near the top on that list

Highly recommended. Try to book your tickets in advance to beat the queues and get there early if you travel during summer school holidays. Very well structured enormous fish tank. Went there with both kids 3 and 5 year old and they loved it. The little cafe/restaurant is not worth trying, better to hop in an Uber and get to the center of town where there are lots of way better food options. The Oceanarium is a must see attraction for adults and children alike.

Great visit and well done!. Great exhibit at the old 1998 Expo site. Line ups not too long, lots of variety and education. Our teenagers enjoyed it. Took about two to three hours to get through. On the Metro line, and short walk through Vasco Da Gama Mall.

The best oceanarium I have ever visited!. It is huge! Great contemplation spaces that you can see a bunch of different sharks, large rays and fishes. Please don't skip the temporary exhibit, it is a work of art. Tip: if you buy something in the temporary exhibit store, you will get 15% off in the main store ;)
Relaxing visit. There could be a bigger variety of sea life, there are too many persons but it's really interesting and relaxing.Also very enjoyable for the children

Worth a visit, but crowded! . Pros = Highly entertaining, well looked after animals, very clean, easy to get to, reasonable tour for the price. Cons = Long ques to buy tickets, busy during peak times. Overall a good day out that last about 1hr and 30mins. Would definitely recommend this place outside of peak hours!

Over priced! . We paid €17 to visit the aquarium. You have two choices €14 for the standard and €17 for standard + an extra exhibition. Stick to standard as the exhibition is a waste of money even if it is only €3 Euros! The aquarium is pretty much one massive tank in the middle with very small tanks around it with different fish. I had a better experience at Madrid Zoo that has a aquarium it was more enjoyable. Although what we did see in this aquarium was nice just don't think it justifies the price.

Stop and read and watch. Took the train in from Sintra to Oriente which is a 10 min walk from here, transport links are fantastic.Queued for a while so if you have a chance to buy tickets online first I would do it to save time.Entrance for adult is €17 including the temporary exhibition which is worth seeing. The main event is a classic large pool in the middle with your mapped out around the edge, plus some other tanks on outer walls. It takes you through the different oceans and is really interesting. If you actually stop and read the signs (all in English and Portuguese) it makes it a lot better and about half way round down stairs there is a very informative DVD run which tells you loads about behind the scenes which is so interesting and puts a lot into context about how they create and control the environment within the tank itself, which is pretty amazing. They grow they're own life effectively. The coral reef is amazing and so colourful and the Sharks, sun fish ( weirdest looking thing!) and jellyfish are just beautiful.Have read a few reviews that state it's not very organised or informative. I think you get out what you put in.We had two teenagers there, they were well entertained and the area around the Parc Expo is so well developed now that there is so much to do.

Excellent aquarium, one of the best we have visited. The Oceanarium is well worth a visit, it has a massive centre tank with lots of viewing windows where you can sit and fish watch. Our children loved the rays and the sharks. It also has a topical and an artic tank with really natural looking habitats (e.g. real ice in the artic area).A family ticket (2 adults and 2 children) is only 20E

Not that impressed ... . My boyfriend and I ventured out to the oceanarium based on all the good reviews it had received however I felt it was slightly overrated . The oceanarium itself is based around one very large tank ( which is beautiful ) but once you have seen it there's not much else going on ! I unfortunately regret wasting half a day of our holiday here .

Amazing . It works out a lot cheaper if you buy your tickets on their official website. Plus, that also means you don't need to queue for ages outside and you can go straight into the aquarium. The permanent exhibition is great, the temporary exhibition is pure art and also worth the visit.

Sharks and Sting-rays. The Lisbon Oceanarium at the Expo is suprisingly big inside. A huge aquarium in the center with a wide variety of fish to see that you walk around. The sharks and sting rays are the stars of the show.On the upper floor of the Oceanarium are temporary exhibitions on display - some of the interesting, others not so much.Rather expensive tickets for Lisbon standards (15€) but it is worth it.
Lovely otters!. Decent sized aquarium with lovely range of sea creatures. Would love to see more sharks in the tank. Great for family with kids.

Huge Tank. It is placed at the heart of Parque das Nacoes (on the red metro line). One walks through a wonderful shopping centre - Vasco da Gama and then has another 10m to the Oceanarium. It is expensive at first sight but once you see the number of fish, and the size of the main tank it actually is a pleasure to help pay and maintain this. One can easily spend 3h in there. If it is a really hot day and and you need a break from the sun, this place is a wonderful.
Short visit . I thought it would be bigger. There is only one big tank and few smaller. It took us about an hour to see it all. It is good idea on a rainy day. Although everything is very clean.

A must-see for families (with kids or not). This was a good surprise for us in Lisbon - one of the largest aquaria in the world, where all sorts of fish and sharks are sharing one space. Next to it, there is the new cable car over the city's northern district and the river so that pays off for the visit to oceanarium. TIP: buy the tickets online, it will save you at least 45 minutes in the queue. Even if you forgot, buy them online right at the entrance - we connected to the wifi and jumped the line.
Lots of sealife. Spent 4 hours inside the aquarium and wasnt enough. The main aquarium is beautifull with sharks and the amazing moon fish. Gigantic!! The best choice for either rainy or suny days
Expensive. It may bigger than most around the world, but is also one of the most expensive to visit. Not worth the price.
Must visit!. Great to Visit! I love the dragons - cool looking seahorses. Don't recommend the auxiliary exhibition - not worth the extra money. Great aquarium!

Fish tank. There is a lot promised from the adverts and impression of the building from the outside. 'Largest indoor oceanarium in Europe' they said. A large fish tank.I, presumably like everyone else, am not fussed about your average fish. Show me a great white, dare I say a killer whale. I got the great White's runt and a couple of nemo looking fishies. Cheers, same stuff as Dobbies the garden centre. Everything else, and everything cool is in Lisbon. Don't promise me cool fish and don't show me stuff Robson Greene does not class as extreme.Btw, I wouldn't take children younger than 8yrs cca...just for the fact thatthe corridors are really dark and therefore lots of children scared and crying.... but it must me a nice day out for them if they area bit older. Avoid peak hours.
So -so. Interesting experience but IMHO lacks planning..the visit direction is haphazard. Price is quite high , located quite far from the metro station
Just Amazing. Absolutely breathtaking, so much to see. Wonderful experience for kids and adults. Must do in Lisbon. Would highly recommend.

Fishy experience. Got there using hop on hop off bus. Very good layout and interesting to see different fish and coral. Takes about 2 hours to get round as you want to look at everything.Very big tanks and you get to see fish at different levels.

It's OK. It's undeniably breathtaking to watch all the different fish in the Oceanario, but as my 10 year old put it after 20 minutes of walking around and watching the 'tank': "Is this it?". I have to agree with her. I mean, it's great to walk around and see but it does get a bit tiresome after a bit. It wasn't enough to capture her attention and definitely not for our friend's 5 year old either.

Wonderful. A unique experience to visit the oceanarium, it leaves you without breath. I liked the many walking levels so you can see the central aquarium from top to bottom. The Takashi Amano planted aquarium leaves you with no words. It's a place to sit in front and enjoy for hours.
Worth a visit. If you like aquariums this is worth a visit, although a little on the expensive side at €17,50 per person. Located in the modern part of the city.

Great place to see. Easily Accessible from metro orient. So much to see from the giant sting rays to the exotic Invertebrates. Sea otters are so cute. The exhibition seems to go on and on . Well worth a visit . You can buy tickets on line to beat the cue and there is plenty of places to eat on site and at the orient station which is more like a shopping mall

Great visit . Visited and exceeds expectations. This is nothing like a sea life centre There are penguins and otters that are really close Everything is centred around main tank and as you walk round you get many different aspects. Entry fee was reasonable 17 Eurostar each and this also included the temporary exhibition.

Beautiful aquarium. We enjoyed a few hours here on our trip to Lisbon. Although it was quite crowded, we still enjoyed the stillness of watching the various species making their way around the large aquarium. Children seemed especially captivated.

Extremely well organised exebition. The tickets are not cheap for Portuguese standards but this is one of Lisbon's attractions that you should not miss.The route through the Oceanarium spirals around the main giant aquarium (I believe the biggest in Europe) with many fish from different types of shark to a couple of Sun fish. Just this aquarium would be worth the visit however surrounding the main aquarium there are additional ones representing several other oceans or seas (from penguins - antarctic to tropical ones).Expect to take a couple of hours - if you have kids even longer.

A must. The Aquarium was absolutely stunning. All of the adults and especially the toddlers really enjoyed it. We loved everything about it. Could have done with more information about some of the creatures though. Its a beautiful building too, really well designed and the sights around the aquarium are worth visiting....Shopping mall next door worth visiting...
Beautiful design for gorgeous waterspicies. Do not hesitate to visit this Ocenarium. Design is absolutely fabolous. Waterspicies are beautiful. Swim with the jellyfish!

the msot amazing place to visit. we had such a great time here - with two teenage kids that isn't easy to achieve but we were here for nearly 4 hours and could have stayed longer. the collection is incredible and such a clever layout that you get to see everything from many angles. Don't worry about stopping at the first window to the aquarium, you'll have so many better angles to see from and the windows become far less crowded if you wait until you've passed a couple. Stay for the feeding time with the otters - that was great fun, and the penguins are very entertaining too. A really special day out and a great place to hand outside and sit in the sun afterwards.

A day well spen with no doubt. If you like the sea life, you'll not regreted.Has a complete and amazing aquarium as well as other sea animals.Its situated in a newish part of Lisbon (where the Expo 98 took Place) that has a lot of bars and restaurantes and where you can enjoy long walks by the Riverside, ride the cable car and enjoy all the amazing view.This is, definitely a place not to miss

Great afternoon visit . We visited here with my seven year-old after a long visit to Portugal. Like most attractions, be sure book tickets online and print them. We ordered via phone and printed at the hotel. As a result, we skipped the lines and went right in. The permanent exhibition was great - large, well kept tanks with a great deal of Information (in English as well as Portuguese). Even though it was crowded, we still saw everything easily and moved through the buildings easily. The temporary exhibit "Forests Underwater" by Takeshi Amano was amazingly beautiful and not to be missed. We had a pleasant and inexpensive lunch in the cafe and walked around the waterfront for awhile before easily finding a cab back to the center of Lisbon. We spend about four hours, and made our little guy very happy (the sea lions and sharks were great!).

Good family day out but crowded . Great aquarium with a beautiful sea forest exhibition. Buy tickets online as the queues are long. You receive an email with PDF tickets you can save and show on your phone. As expected in August, the aquarium was very busy and this made it difficult to enjoy some parts. The main tank is very good and you can see from so many different spots. I wouldn't bother with the first viewing sits as the later ones are less crowded. The views from the lowest floor are particularly good.
Very average.. Nothing great. If you've been to Dubai you'd see much more. Aquariums are somehow small. Just one huge aquarium and the rest are kind of average.

Good but crowded . A lack of sign posts from the shopping centre was bemusing but we got there via the boardwalk over the sea. Very helpful assistants enabled us to use the automatic machines - so much wicket than the ticket booths . The large central tank is fabulous - an array of fish - sharks , tuna and the like . A massive sun fish dominates the place likes brooding presence! Extraordinary . The other displays are good ( puffins , penguins and sea otters especially good ). Crowded however and that limits your views . Quite expensive too . An enjoyable couple of hours and then onto retail therapy afterwards !

Fantastic and mystic,watch out,-pickpockets. I go there each visit to lisbon, cant have enough of the mystic athmosphere,feeling like in an underwater expedition.Long waiting line for tickets,which are not cheap but worth it.Take enough time,you need at least 2-3 hours.The shop has great tshirts with the logo of the ocenarium.This year there is a tempory exhibit of takashis underwater forests,I think its 17 euro as a combined ticket for an adult.Keep your wallet in a save place.The oceanarium has lots of dark spaces which they appreciate...

Fascinating Marine Center. This sea life centre is really great and has lots of fantastic tanks full of fascinating marine life. The staff here are excellent and it really is the stand out place to go in the old glc building complex. The Penguins toward the end are fantastic. Try and time your visit with feeding time. It's well worth the effort

An excellent aquarium. It's an excellent aquarium and entertaining for all age groups. We visited with a group of 12 on our first of 10 days in Lisbon. All enjoyed the experience. It's quite large, so plan for at least 90 minutes to go through. It seemed difficult to avoid the natural flow past every exhibit.The exhibits themselves are great. The main tank is enormous and contains a wide variety of fascinating aquatic creatures. There is information on most of the species available in both English and Portuguese. The attraction was quite crowded mid-afternoon on a Friday in July, but that's probably to be expected. The crowds and time to wait get a good view of the exhibits probably increased the amount of time we spent there. The location is not central to the main tourist area, about a 8 Euro cab ride away from Restaudores Square.All in all, it was a good time for our group of 12 between 9 month and 63. Would recommend for groups with kids or those with plenty of time to explore Portugal. I'm not sure if I would plan into a trip if time in the area is limited.

A fantastic ocean experience!. I've been to plenty of underwater aquariums and I always enjoy them, however I have to say that the Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the best I have been too. The exhibits are beautifully presented and the most is made of the limited space. Well worth a visit.
Aquarium. A place to stop by for several hours. Relaxing time. Very informative and a must-see attraction since it is the second largest aquarium. I would go here again.

Great experience. The second biggest Oceanarium in Europe, worth a visit. It's location is not the best, far from the city centre (near to Oriente railway station). Lots of animals can be found there, the visit requires at least 2 hours (maybe 3). The tickets are 14 euros each, the queue was a bit long on a Thursday afternoon, we had to wait approximately 20 minutes, but if you buy your tickets online, it is more expensive (15,40 euros each). Anyway, really recommended.

Fantastic day out. One of the must do if you go to Vasco da Gama. We went there with the kids (9&11) and they absolutely loved it. Fantastic exhibits, good information for the kids to read & interact with. Good diverse species of fish, sea birds and Atlantic otters. It will take you at least a couple of hours if you take your time. Some places to sit down and take in some breathtaking views into the tanks.
Fantastic Aquarium. My three year old loved it. The main tank had multi levels and was fantastic. I have been to several aquariums and this was he best I ever have been to.
Interesting and Exciting. Good for family tour and kids will enjoy this oceanarium . good value for Money and get good discount if you buy online

Well worth a visit. A lot of thought and expertise has gone into this and it shows. A huge central tank representing the ocean with a vast collection of sea creatures. Plus external Arctic, Tropical areas.

Wonderful aquarium!. This is one of the best aquariums we have ever been to around the world. Well worth a visit. The central tank is fascinating - we spent at least an hour just wandering round that tank. So much to see.
Amazing. real great place to visit either alone, in a couple or especially with klids. They will really love to get to know all the kinds of fishes and see all kinds of giant fish and aquariums

Well worth the entry fee . Great 3hrs spent at the oceanarium. Th central tank Is fantastic. The otters and penguins are also a nice addition. Book tickets on line though. We did and got 10% off, we also didn't have to que to buy tickets. The que was quite long. I'd recommend a trip here to anyone in Lisbon. Make sure you go see both exhibitions.

Largest Aquarium in Europe. Spent half the day here... the kids loved it and while the one back home in Toronto is also very large and impressive, this one blows it out of the water. Great place to see for both adults and children.

Very nice aquarium on the edge of the sea. Absolutely well worth a visit whilst in Lisbon. The aquarium is located on the harbour front on Parque das Nações - with stunning views og the Vasco da Gama bridge crossing the river Talo. The nearest metro stop is Oriente, from there it's a 10 minutes walk to the aquarium. You can also take the cable car (Telecabine Lisboa) from Passeio das Tágides (North Station) to the Aquarium (South Station).Tickets can be bought from the Aquariums homepage, which is recommendable in several ways.Firstly because you circumvent the ticket booth lines, secondly because the ticket is valid for a period, i.e. you do not have to plan a specific day, but can go any day of the period where the ticket is valid - this does of cause not entitle you to more than one visit.The displays are stunning and well designed, you can valk around the entire centre tank and see the animals from many different angles. Actually the Aquarium is quite big - we used about 3 hours there, including much needed stop in the small movie theater showing a movie of the Aquarium behind the curtains - quite interesting.The kids were absolutely stunned by the two sea otters, which are almost unbearable cute, spending almost half an hour there.Aside of the main Aquarium, there are many more displays with inverterbrae, amphibians and plants.The Aquarium shop is quite nice and well stocked - worth a short visit as well.All in all the Aquarium is highly recommendable!

Fantastic main tank. The main tank is beautiful and it can be seen in many different directions and from two floors. There are several smaller tanks and also sea otters and penguins and other birds. This is a good place to see for anyone regardless of age.I recommend that you skip the queue by buying tickets online in advance!

Don't miss the temporary exhibit. This is an impressive oceanarium with a huge central tank and many small tanks around in the corners additional exhibits. The central tank has many types of fish including eye-catching sharks and rays. Most unique to me were a couple of Mola mola fish (Ocean Sunfish). The only complaints that I found the organization a bit strange and not all animals in a tank were described.The temporary exhibit, which has been there for a while, is worth a trip by itself! Takashi Amano (d. 2015) is a water landscape artist. He designed and built a 40-meter zen aquascape. It is a meditative piece, an ikebana in the water. I so enjoyed the use of space, shape, and color. There are hundreds of fish in the exhibit, though they are all small. cardinal tetras, rasboras, and other small new world fish. And small ghost shrimp crawling on the gravel.
Blup. Went when I was little with my family, also went to a friend's birthday party there. Was fun. I find it is best now visiting solo or with few people.
Very very nice! . We had an amazing time. The kids loved it. Make sure you take a stroller with you if you have small kids cause you can't rent one there.

Good aquarium - good visit for about two hours. Very good aquarium centred around one main tank. This has many windows on two floors and several viewing places. It can get crowded but no real problems. Has the usual sharks etc. Worth taking nearby cable car and going to science museum when visiting.

Nice for a day out with kids. Great place for a day out with kids
Many interesting things to see and learn.
Half a day trip.perfect with kids

Much bigger than you first expect.. Well worth a visit. I think the family ticket cost us 44 euros to not too expensive. We entered the main exhibition and you follow the path, I thought we would be round quite quickly but there was actually loads of content. I would recommend sitting down in the little cinema bit and watching the full video about the facility, it was really interesting.

Great way to spend a few hours!. Well designed exhibits that are easy to navigate. Penguins and otters were a big hit. The large tank in the center holds a vey good variety of ocean fish. Feeding times posted also say "time subject to change", so be aware that on the day we visited none of the feelings were on time, you should wait a bit as they are entertaining. Not the largest of oceanariums/aquariums, but a well planned facility that highlights individual regions and posts information at each exhibit in both Portuguese and English.

A great visit. The Lisbon Oceanarium is definitely worth a few hours to visit. Beautiful building away from the crowds, on the water. The permanent exhibits were very well done, on par with other large aquariums I've seen...however the temporary exhibit by Takashi Amano is alone worth the trip.

Awesome!. This was amazing! Spent 3 hours there. The Oceanarium is at the Expo area of Lisbon. Close to the metro, the river and a big shopping center. To avoid waiting in line at the entrance, it is recommended to buy the tickets online.

Interesting enough for a couple, lovely for kids. I went in with my (eager to see it) wife. Though I was skeptic at the beginning, the oceanarium had a wide variety of fishes in exhibition to amuse us. The huge reservoir in the center has sharks, Rays, sunfish and other species that can keep you attached to the glass. Interesting side rooms have penguins, sea otter and other animals that will be a lovely sight for kids. Overall worth to go if passing by.

Simply the best. Lisbon Oceanarium is without a doubt one of the best Oceanariums that I have visited, and I have seen quite a few around the world :) The current temporary exhibition, Forests Underwater - the world's biggest planted aquarium, created by a team of many aquascapers from all over the world under the leadership of, in the meantime deceased, Takashi Amano (this is his latest major project) - is magnificent! I recommend visitors to take their time and to observe from the several seats available this amazing aquarium. The main building of the Oceanarium has a recommended tour which allows to see the main central tank from different sides, which seems like completely different aquariums. A few hours of fun are guaranteed at the Lisbon Oceanarium.

Fun!. Really interesting way to spend a couple of hours. Watch the DVD showing what happens to keep the place open! Informative English boards, not too wordy but interesting. The sea otters are fantastic!

The best part of my travel. It was the best part of our tour in Portugal. The Oceanarium worth every penny,enjoyed every second. The exhibitions are great. I wold love to go back one day with my kids.

Sensational. What an experience.We decided to head to the Oceanarium on a whim, and we weren't disappointed. A very competitive price, especially compared to some tourist attractions in other capital cities across Europe.The Oceanarium was set out brilliantly, giving you the opportunity to experience fish from all corners of the globe, as well as a gigantic tank in the centre displaying exotic and tropical animals.We really enjoyed watching the otters and the penguins, and couldn't fault the immersive nature of the Oceanarium.Sadly, our trip was slightly hindered by a lack of viewing space, and some tanks were hard to get up close to.The English signs were detailed, grammatically accurate and really helpful too.Definitely recommended.
Great experience, so many different animals.. Great experience, so many different animals.Large sharks. Ugly fish. Beautiful fish. The sweet sea odders. Pingwins, always funny.

Awful. I was very excited about it as the day before we were in a ZOO which was amazing but at the end of our tour I was quite disapponted. A big tank full of fishes surrounded with some smaller tanks with some other sea species is all there is....bad value for money
Ocenarium. I was pretty excited by this great aquarium where there are a lot of fishes living in peace. There were also sharks and other exotic sea animals.

Absolutely delightful !!. Me and my brother visited this attraction on a weekday and it was easy to find , we travelled to here via metro . On arrival it was very beautiful and spacious , The Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano” was Very calming and magnificent. This place is suitable for everyone.

Sharks and Rays. Easy to find and within 5 minutes walking distance to Vasco da Gama shopping centre and Parque das Nacoes. Suitable for all the family, book tickets online and save allow about 3 hours for your visit.
Half day trip. Went there on a Saturday with another family. Impressive aquarium with various themes inside. Also visited the temporary exhibition which can really be recommended.
Landmark!. Excellent, a must if you visit Lisbon!The complex was originally built for Expo'98, and it's still a great visiting experience.

A huge sight. This is certainly a big and interesting place to visit. It is probably the biggest in Europe of its kind and you will find all kinds of marine life inside. The most rare and unusual fish and anything that lives in the water. It is located in the Parque das Nações, an area that was used for the Expo '98. The Portuguese have certainly made very good use of it. Visitors, whether individuals or families, old or young will find this place quite fascinating and there is so much information about everything going on inside. It is lots of fun and it is worth a visit.

Must do site in Lisbon!. Great place to visit for all age groups. Easily accessible by metro. You can find all kinds of animals not only fish. My favorite was the otter, very funny! Worth to book tickets ahead to avoid the lines.

Good but not Amazing !. I visited the Oceanarium with family, it has a big central pool with a variety of species.
On the aquarium corners you get some extra's with polar penguins, tropical fish, otaries...
It feels a little boring to get around the very same pool again and again during all the visit..
Not a most see in my opinion
Amazing creatures . My family and I loved visiting the Oceanarium, it's a great family experience. Informative and fun, something for all the family
Cool and lovely. Beautiful Oceanarium .... Clever design so all can view. Would suit any age so the whole family can enjoy.... Would love to visit again !
a must see. super nice Aquarium...one of the best in europe. full of things to see. kids and adults will live. :)

Best Oceanarium in the world. What a superb place to visit on your trip to Lisbon. Short walk from the Metro or you can even take a cable car if you want! Inside is an incredible 360 degree show of many fascinating species surrounded by many other smaller but informative aquariums of creatures from all oceans of the world. A place for all ages to enjoy a good 2 to 3 hours of fun. Tip - book online and save 10% on door price.
A must do in Lisbon. Excellent aquarium and I have visited quite a few. Very good value for money, but book on line and save 10% as well.
Fun day out. We had a fantastic day out at Lisbon Oceanarium, the exhibits were amazing. Loved the sun fish! You can easily spend a few hours or more here. Would definately visit again.
The Best Aquarium in Europe. Worth a visit. Tickets are 17 Euros for Adults (there's a discount for kids and seniors). The main tank is incredible, as is the sea otter exhibit.
Great place to visit on a hot day. Oceanarium was great, lots of different areas, really loved the sea otters. Everywhere you went there was things to see great !

Sea diving experience without getting wet! Amazing!. If you are in Lisbon this is an opportunity not to be missed. Our group, adults, teens and kids, had a great time. Most of the time you will have the sensation of being underwater, surrounded by all kind of fishes. It is really funny to see the penguins diving from an underwater perspective! The surrounds are great, lots of green, we took a nice walk by the river and ate at a very good restaurant close by. There where many restaurants around the area, a great way to finish the day.

Beautiful. So we were here during summer camp season, but the munchkins just added to the fun. Beautiful, easily accessed exhibits flow easily throughout. Does not feel huge...but nonetheless impressive. Our favorite was the sunfish in the big tank..a face only a mother could love!

Your rainy day spot. We came here, along with loads of other families, on a really rainy day. Even though loads of other folks had the same idea, it was still an incredible acquarium to visit. Worth it if you can't be outside.

Nice but criwded. In my opinion it was a good aquarium, the kids enjoyed it. No need for audio guide if you don't speak Portuguese, descriptions were also written in English. The area is great for children to run and explore. Very busy though but it is summer holidays.
Good and cool place for family visit. Well organized visit of the ocean world, very big aquarium and a lot to see. It is possible to hang around the whole afternoon.

Visit with a 4 yr old, 2 yr old and 1 yr old. A great place for any kids. The fish are plenty and diverse The viewing windows are easily accessible to all and the crowd is never overwhelming. Highly recommend for a break from the sun.

Nice experience with weird fish. Really interesting experience, they have many different fish that are categorized by region so you know what you are looking at.Everything from big fish to tropical ones is there, although you will not see everything. The tour is really good though, guided and with a logical series of steps. Ticket costs 17 euro for adults which is not cheap, but considering the amount of people working to keep the entire oceanariums going, it is logical.
One of the best Oceanariums. Every fish you could wish to see and in a beautifully designed tank.My grandson has visited 3 times and can now identify all the Sharks and Rays

The best aquarium I have seen :). The aquarium is very amazing and very well organized. It's great to see a family of penguins swimming and looking at you so friendly. I recommend the visit to everybody.

Expensive but good. A bit pricey, and you have to make an uninformed decision on arrival on whether to pay for the aquarium &/or temporary exhibits. These should all be covered on the one entry cost.The aquarium itself is pretty spectacular though.

Loads to see and a very cute otter. . Great day trip from Lisbon centre. Caught the metro up and walked, it's a fair stride so might be worth getting a bus a bit closer if you have little ones. Loads to see in the main aquarium and lots of viewing windows. Some of the more popular side tanks are quite crowed and difficult to get a good view. Especially the cuttlefish and jellyfish tanks. Sea otter was definitely the highlight, chilling out and giving himself a quick clean.

Fantastic place to visit. Great place to visit! There is a huge aquarium in the middle with many viewpoints in 2 floors and some other places around it. Just walk around and stop where you want to stop and look/observe/enjoy/learn. I liked the penguins too. I can only recommend to buy the tickets in advance as the place is crowded and you can then jump the queue. Great for children of all age.

Excellent introductory site, but tad overrated. .Background: As part of a three-week train-and-hotel tour of Portugal and Spain, I had sought out this attraction while in Lisbon. It had been built for the Expo '98 for the host country of Portugal.PROS: Proximity to the city centre is its best feature. About a 5-min drive from the airport, it is within walking distance from the Metro Oriente station as well as the Comboio Oriente train station. Designed to look like an aircraft carrier from the outside, the 3-storey building has a long walkway ramp that spirals around a massive central tank. This centerpiece tank holds a variety of pelagic fish, sharks, mantas, rays and a fine specimen of Mola Mola (ocean sunfish). Here and there are sitting areas to view the tank from any angle. Around the main tank are smaller exhibits that represent different biomes (not all) of the world. I applaud their focus on marine conservation. Open daily from 10:00 am, entry costs €15.30 per adult, and €9.90 for a child (4-12 yr old) but will require proof of age. If you hate lining up, there are a couple of ticket machines on the side that take credit cards. (There's also a 10% discount for online tickets, which assures fast entry with no queues.) Because it is an indoor oceanarium, it is perfect for a rainy outing.CONS: A few come to mind -- First, for its size, there isn't much variety. Seriously. I do understand that you can only hold as many animals in one place. Still, even my humble 180-gallon coral reef aquarium has more variety. (I counted.) Second, there isn't much displayed information around the individual exhibits themselves. Third, it may be unintentional, but there are some subtle misinformation surrounding some of the exhibits. For example, displaying small-polyped stony (SPS) corals -- albeit fake ones -- along the littoral zone of a mangrove swamp simply gives the wrong impression. Lastly, for what it's worth, the place is overpriced.Reality check: With all due respect, I would hazard a guess that most superlatives come from reviewers who are relatively new to marine life or public aquariums or both. How many have visited the aquariums at Georgia (US), Monterey Bay (US), Dubai, Okinawa, Valencia (Spain), Turkuazoo (Turkey), Singapore, Vancouver (Canada) or Osaka (Japan)? Having visited all but Dubai and Turkey, I do have the 20/20 insight for a side-by-side comparison. I fear this site is a beneficiary of the "bandwagon effect"? Don't get me wrong. If you've never been to a public aquarium, you're in for a special treat!Verdict: Caveat aside, suffice it to say that Lisboa Oceanarium is an excellent introductory place to see and experience marine life. But from the perspective of a marine biologist, I can understand how it can be a bit underwhelming to others who've visited other places. It is slightly overrated by TA compared to what is available elsewhere. I would not go so far as to say it's the #1 aquarium, but it's in my Top 3. Recommended. Grade A-minus..

Walk thru to witness aquatic life. Fairly clean and well aid out. A modest collection and reasonably priced admission. A bit far out from city center. Long walk to enter the facility is a burden from some.

Absolutely Amazing!. This is an absolutely amazing visit, truly special and very unique. The aquarium takes you to a wonderful under water trip, has wonderful species and the animals seem really happy and well taken care of! Otters, penguins, rays, tropical fish, sharks, a giant octopus, sea horses... You have to go and see for yourself!
Aquarium worth visiting . Really great aquarium! Large and full of exciting sea life. They had a variety of species and was well run and roomy. A lot of walking

Great place for kids. I went there for kids entertainment and show them different sea lives but I must admit it was enjoyable for adults and people of all ages. We went there on weekends and the place was overcrowded as expected, getting online tickets will at least save the hassle of huge ticket queue and we got 10% discount as well. There were ticket vending machines as well but being a tourism place understandably the queue for ticket purchase via counter was huge.The permanent exhibition on 2nd floor is a showpiece but offers great knowledge of different species, sounds they make, etc. The main attraction of the place is gigantic aquarium with lots of sea lives. Don't get stuck in one view, the whole surroundings has several views of aquarium and you may even find one you like the most and want to spend time watching the activities of fishes. The parks around the surroundings of oceanarium is lovely too, nice place to walk around during evening.
Fun Family Option. Very impressive place. The central aquarium is very, very well done. Great fun for the kids and adults alike.
A must for the kids!. The Lisbon Oceanarium is a very interesting place. They have a single large aquarium, divided more of less in "regions", in a very peculiar setting. Kids love it.

As happy as a penguin can be . Took the kids out to what is mentioned as the nicest aquarium of the world. It can definitely make a shot for it. It has one enormous tank centrally that holds sunfish and a manta ray as rarest species. In the 2 floors some outside habitats nicely match with bigger animals like penguins, otters,... The remarkable thing is that with the otters life fish co exist. And if you see the Penguins, they are enjoying their space, swimming pool and even fake but cold ice. A part from these there are several other thanks showcasing special fish like even cuttlefish and a decent size octopus. Also the area around is really nice. From the expo in the 80's including a still operating cable car. Getting there is easy by metro but also taxis are not expensive in Lisbon. Ticket line can be long, but machines around the corner will allow you to book and print and you don't need to queue. Last detail temperature is cool in the building which makes this a great trip at the hottest part of the day in summer to get your kids out of the sun during the hottest part of the day.
Oceanarium. I enjoyed their collection and the way it was laid out. However, their map was not very clear and we missed the sea otters!😕

Unique central tank. Visited in Feb 2016, very busy with school children. Loved the penguins and the huge central tank with loads of varieties of fish, sharks and rays. Was mesmerising watching them all interact. Would recommend a visit regardless of the weather as its in doors.
Great time!. Fantastic place!!! Wonderfull time!!! We enjoyed every minute spent there. Also very nice staff! Is certainly the most beautiful aquarium in Europe!

Remarkably astonishing!. It is a beautiful huge aquarium surrounded by small ones and open spaces recreating some habitats. The main aquarium is breathtaking. A must-go in Lisbon, and for me the best indoor aquarium in Europe!

Top morning out. We hopped off a bus tour and walked the short distance to the Oceanarium. Unsure what to expect, I was surprised at the quality and design of this very cool facility.
The experience is lovely and the main tank is mesmerising - the huge sunfish is especially cool.
Really good experience and watch out for the sea otters.

Wonderful experience . One to enjoy with kids! My 17 month old walked through enjoying all the sea creatures! There was such a variety of sea life, sharks, penguins and the otters were just adorable! It was easy to access with the pram.There are places to eat outside the oceanarium and a cafe inside.Book online as it's faster access with no queuing to do!

City trip . The aquarium is a fun place to visit. For the price of the tickets, there is plenty to see as it is organised across different ocean areas including the Antarctic and Pacific. There is more than just fish to explore, with penguins and puffins capturing your attention and the incredibly cute pair of otters- watch out for them holding hands! A great trip for anyone to enjoy.

Best way to understand the Ocean for Kids and adults. I just love Oceanarium, huge blend of different Sea "animals, it is perfect for a relaxed day with children in a rainy or sunny day, kids love it and at the same time you can teach them how fish live in the ocean and they are "made" of. It is great when you don´t have anything planned and just want to chill-out. Check prices first and see discounts, it is not the cheapest place in the world :).
Great Aquarium. Very nice aquarium. Perhaps a bit smaller than espected although very versatile. Good place to visit when in Lisbon with kids.

If you buy a pizza afterwards. Oceanium is a great place to visit with kids , takes a bit of walking around but very great view on sharks and other species over many different levels.Just be aware that after you get out you might need some food or ice cream for the kids which you only get a mile away.It is indeed a great place also for adults

Ocean on Earth. So, i don't know if they made renovations since the last time I went there but I still love this place.Really beautiful, Its a place to visit rather you are on vacations or not, very intersting, kids will love it. The noise its similar to the ocean, mini cinema, place to sit and apreciate the tank, otter, penguins, frogs and some marine species, tropical florest, etc. Its a little bit cold inside but It makes you want to get in and swim with the fish :-) Visit...

For the whole family. Oceanarium is an amazing place to visit with family specially with kids but will make everyone happy. :) Located in one of the most beautiful and recent areas in Lisbon, facing the Tagus river you can watch, learn, experience and be dazzled by many species of fauna and flora of the oceans. Do not miss it!

Wonders of the sea can be viewed here!. Being a solo traveler, I still visited the Oceanarium and its very worth the visit!! Did get some special time viewing the fish because I arrived till after 4pm and there was certainly less of a crowd.

Great fun for the kids. Amazing to visit on cloudy or cold days. The kids will love it, especially the big thank. We've found that they have tematics sessions for the kids in some days of the mont. Check the website for more info.

Great Aquarium . A good activity to pass a few hours in Lisbon. The main tank is incredible but our favourite exhibit was definitely the sea otters!! So much to see! It was a little too busy when we went, but this is only a testament yo how impressive this aquarium is!

Very nice. Lovely aquarium with lots of different types of animals: fishes, sharks, otters, octopuses, seahorses, penguins, jellyfish and more. Takes about 2 to 3 hours if you take your time.Temporary exhibit was kind of boring. Restaurant looked awful, and thus didn't actually try it.
Lots to see, great place to visit. A great way to spend the day, lots to see, many different types of sea life to look at, when you have finished you can walk along the river.

Fantastic.. worth a look. Superb facility if you want to know about fish and sea creatures. Great visual experience with close viewing of all types if shark, rays, sun fish, sprats and molluscs. Massive central fish tanks and many other attractions (tropical fish, v cute otters, frogs, penguins). Great for a few hours and you can see everything you wish. Go and see it if you have time.

First class attraction with unique design. This is one of Lisbon's great attractions. An amazing central tank that can be viewed from all sides, linked to 4 external displays covering different habitats of the world. Brilliant attraction for adults and kids.

Mr. It was amazing experience. If you are in Lisbon you can't miss this attraction. You will definitely regret the entrance fee. We had just one hour to see a permanent exhibition, but we could have spent at least three hours observing incredible ocean creatures like sharks or a huge sunfish. The oceanarium is in Park of Nations which was built in occasion of EXPO 98 so you can connect your visit with Oriente train building that is very interesting or with Vasco de Gama Bridge lookout spot.

How's it's #1 is mind boggling!!! . Very disappointed with the oceanarium. Been to a few around the world and this has to be the least impressive of them all. 1 big tank and several small tanks. Too small of a tank for the amount of the fish in it. Some of the fish looked depressed. €17 in and I was out in 40 mins. And that after taking my time going around it. There are better things to do in Lisbon than to go all the way out to the oceanarium.

Nice afternoon pastime. A nice and great place to get acquainted with the marine species. Could be crowded and some points but better get there in the afternoon. Good option is the self service ticket machines they brought this year. Now they have a very very nice temporary exhibition "Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano " - do not miss it.

Very diverse. Probably the best aquarium i have visited.The penguins and otters are so cute and seem to have a decent amount of room to move around in.Lots of different fish, lots of information, and activities to keep childeren occupied.
Outstanding . Great entertainment, surrounded by amazing architecture In the New modern Area of Lisbon; one of top attractions in the city

very high price, low information but quite impressive. It´s one of the most visited attractions in Portugal. Built in 1998 they usually have some temporary exhibits to visit. The interior of the oceanarium is spectacular. Made to impress visitors. It’s not the biggest in the world or the most spectacular one but it impresses. You can spend a lot of hours just looking at the impressive aquarium. But, nevertheless, some complementary information would be appreciated. The price is high for Portuguese standard’s. Want a tip? Search for the special activities.

Most Beautiful Aquarium I've Seen!. This is such a beautiful place, the habitats are all very natural and the animals definitely well looked after. It is also quite big and you can easily spend a few hours here. What I loved about the aquarium is all the unique animals that you can't find in many other places. Examples are the manta rays, sunfish and sea otters. Lots of great viewing oppertunities both above and below the water. Very nice gift shop too and nice cafe with amazing seafood paella.Really enjoyed my time here.

fascinating day out. we got to the Oceanarium by a hop on hop off tour bus which dropped us off right outside. Once inside we were amazed by the huge tank that holds an amazing number of sea creatures and fish. There was also an out side area where you could make friends with the penguins. There is a good restaurant area and good toilet facilities. They also cater for wheelchair users.

Wonderful fun. 3 generations of our family went and all enjoyed the oceanarium hugely. The layout, with a massive central tank and radial zones on 2 levels representing the different ocean regions made the visit properly educational as well as mind-blowingly beautiful. Reasonably priced for the quality of the displays.
Great !. If you like nature, fish, and deep water, this is for you !Many different species, and many informations about our planet.I would particulrarly recommand for children.
Great!!. We loved it!! So much to see and easy to view even when busy... Great fun for all ages and good value... I recommend this highly and the tour buses go there... Good times!!

Well worth a visit. Great aquarium! Lots of different animals to see in different areas. It's well laid out with nice cafe and gift shop. It can get busy but it isnt too bad. Would be ideal for families with children.
the collection and presentation are good. I liked it! And I was pleased to see that they offer programs for kids. The shop is excellent and the coffee shop in the garden good enough

One of must see in Lisbon. A great place to spend several hours, especially in a rainy day. A huge aquarium, several other exhibitions,multiple small aquariums should satisfy everyone. But the exhibition "Forests Underwater" by Takahashi Amano is a masterpiece - just sit, watch and listen...

THE MOST AWESOME AQUARIUM!. So I went here with my dad (me: 19; dad:54) and both of us had SO MUC FUN!Seriously tho if you have only one day in Lisbon, please, for de love of everything you hold dear for this life, do yourself a favour and pay a visit here.It's not only cool to see the permanent exhibition but also the temporary ones are always interesting and not expensive.I could spend the whole day wandering my eyes through the aquariums.The food is also good and it's a reasonable price to pay. I ate the bacalhau and was delicious!Very cool and if you wanna bring a date I highly recommend this one! Also for families! For everyone!!

Huge aquarium but quite hard to find. This was a nice aquarium and the tanks are huge. Its very informative but we found it quite hard to find. We bought the more expensive ticket so that we could see the extra exhibit but I didn't think it was really worth the extra.
Great Day. Very nice place to go a must visit . It takes you to see the sea life from all over the world. If you are in lisbon you have to go

Enjoyed it very much ! great for a date or families and kids, or just solo. This is a wonderful place ! We had fun strolling and checking out how cool fish are, they are so beautiful and calming to watch ! I am obviously a water and nature-ocean enthusiast, so I say it was wonderful ! Thanks Again !

Beautiful Aquarium in lovely surroundings. Go and see the Oceanarium, if you have more days on your hands and especially, if you travel with children/teenagers. They will love it! You get to see a variety of fish and animals from the ocean (sharks, otters - and all you can imagine of strange and funny fishes). We went there on the Yellow Sightseeing Bus and made a stop - spent about an hour there, which is enough time to see the aquariums.

Amazing Aquarium 🐟. My 11 year old son had found this online as a great Aquarium to visit ! So we caught the train from Loule (We have an apartment in Quarteira) which was a short drive away ! Very easy and train was 5 minute walk from the station.Kids and adults loved it ! Huge and animalsare so well looked after !!! The sea otters are absolutely gorgeous!!! Outside are cable cars and it's near the marina - we took a cab to central Lisbon which cost 8€ and then a tuk tuk tour to dodge the trams for a look round as only visited for a day ! ( that was 40€ but worth every penny) Definately worth a trip as the Aquarium has so much see - we will be backXxx
Nice aquarium . This was a good experience, a very nice aquarium but far too expensive for what this is. Go there early if possible because it can be very crowded.

Impressive but expensive. Money may be better spent for you kids (2-4yrs). Took the metro and after a 5 minute walk down hill (not signposted from the nearest metro) you get to the expo centre which is now a mixture of restaurants, exhibitions and conference centers. The aquarium is impressive but expensive for maximum 2hrs with kids. Could spend longer with older kids or just as adults. €34 for two adults. Young kids are free and to be honest if they did charge it wouldn't be justified.Lifts are available for buggies, but you will have to take kids out of them in order to see the displays as (understandably) people crowd around the windows to get a very close look at all the varieties of aquatic life.

Wonderful aquarium, great for kids. The oceanarium is really well made, you circle the central huge aquarium, lined with smaller exhibitions. Lots to see, and many possibilities for close up views. Our children loved it and we spent three hours here. Book online and skip the queue.

Fun day trip. The Oceanarium is really amazing, i loved that the walking path in the oceanarium is created around the bassinet and not the other way around and you get to come really close to the penguins.it is a bit complicated to get to, you have to take the metro to Oriente and the through the Vasco Da Gama shopping centre and then it will take around 15 min to walk. If you are a student remember your student card because there is at discount on the tickets.

Oceanarium is a dream for aquarium lovers. In a modern building, this aquarium is certainly one of the most beautiful in Europe. Central huge aquarium and a lot of other more specific ecosystems. And if you have the chance to visit the temporary exhibition of Master aquascaping Takashi Amano "Underwater Forests", please do so: a unique experience.
Great aquarium!. Ideal if you have time to kill then this a great way to spend a few hours! Large aquarium and lots of variety. Easy bus ride to get there. Highly recommended.

Outstanding. If you have children while in Lisbon, the Oceanarium is a must see stop. Its a quick taxi ride to a a beautiful area of the city where the 1998 World Expo took place. Oceanarium is a wonderful experience with many other attracting nearby.

Nice aquarium but not a must. Took the family early in the morning. Not too many people and there is a family ticket for 44 euros. The main aquarium is very big and impressive. Most of the tour is arround this tank. We did it in 75 minutes and we didn't rush it. If you saw world famous aquariums you may be disappointed. If you a big fan or you have kids you can consider it. Just remember the it's close to the airport.
Mesmerising experience!. first time in an Oceanarium and we were amazed! Really profecional space and so beautiful and educating. Highly recomented!!
dreamlike. very nicely designed, childfriendly atmosphere.you forget about thee outside world. the center pool is absolutely remarkable. nice ecological information.

Worth a visit if it's too hot outside. Was an ok oceanarium although we have been to better ones in other countries. The water was very murky so photos came out all blurred and dark. If you need somewhere cool, then go visit else will not be a huge shame if you miss this one.

For sure one of the most impressive Aquariums .... The Oceanarium is one of the Aquariums in Lisbon and the more stunning one, basically built around a central tank area (actually this one is split into different zones as well, but gives you the illusion of one big tank). You walk around this main tank areas and can see sharks, mantas, groups of fish, impressive sun fish and nice under water landscapes. In between the different view points you can visit other exhibits that include penguins, otters and smaller reptiles. Also the temporary exhibition of underwater forests is very worth seeing. Overall a great visit. We would recommend at least two hours. On weekends or during peak holiday times it can fill up, so take that into account. You can round up the visit with a stroll along the water front or some shopping in the Vasco da Gama Shopping Center.

Oceanarium Trip. Absolutely fabulous!Amazing experience for folks of all ages. You can easily spend a full day at Oceanarium, there is so much to see, with each viewing level giving you such a different perspective & experience of life under the ocean. Amazing seeing sharks swimming past you!!!! Plenty of outdoor activities also available for the more adventurous visitors!Highly recommend this worthwhile trip.

Lisbon Oceanarium. Best Oceanarium we had seen until now. A highlight in our Lisbon trip especially for the children aged 10 and 12. Easy access by subway from downtown Lisbon. Worth the admission fee. You can spend a whole day there.
Nice. If you like sea-life then you must certainly visit it. Thousands of different fish will excite your imagination.Very beautiful and relaxing.
Family visit. Excellent place to visit. The trip is well organised although beware the Arctic terms, one of our sons had an unwelcome gift from them. Aside from that a very successful visit.

Beautiful and well displayed. The big tank was mesmerizing, but the smaller tanks were difficult to get to because there were so many people. It was fun for both children and adults. The only exit was through a gift shop which I understand but maybe there could be another way out? The location is a bit tricky, we went there with the sightseeing bus but it would've been almost impossible to walk there. If you go to Lissabon and like ocenariums, you have to visit here, it's the biggest in Europe. And you the tickets cheaper if you buy them online.

Best Aquarium I have ever seen. Magnificent. One and a half hours are enough for the visit. You are guaranteed to see some aquarian life you have never seen before. And you are not sure if you are looking at the fish or they are looking at you, you are so close.The surroundings are top class too, with excellent restaurants and a shopping center nearby.
So beautiful!. Went with husband and our 2 year old son and we had the time of our life. Baby Gabriel couldn't have been any happier.

Great but go early!!. We went here by jumping off the hop on hop off tour bus, which takes a little while to get you there even taking the first bus. I would recommend that you go early as by the time we arrived it was packed with school parties, very loud, so busy and therefore difficult to enjoy the experience properly. That said it's worth the visit.

Not the best of his kind. I have read somewhere the Oceanarium would be the best in Europe. I think at least the one in Valencia is better, since you can walk through a tunnel and have all the sea world around you. However, it might be fun for family with kids.
Beautiful. Just go and be happy. Most beautiful aquarium. Children and adults will love it. Price is on target.

Fabulous day out of the sun. This was a must see in Lisbon and a great hour or two out of the sun.
Good value but I agree that the temporary exhibition is not worth the bother.
Can get quite busy so I would go early in the day.
Fantastic temporary exposition . Wonderful experience. Takes a good 3 hours to see everything. Love the sea otters! The temporary exposition is a totally zen experience.

We enjoyed it. We enjoyed our visit at Oceaneiro.
It took us +/- 2 hours to visit the permanent exhibition.
It's nice to see the fish in their natural environment.

Must see in Lisbon. Is a beautiful museum, just at the right place of Europe where it should be. It catches the soul of old sailor empire of Portugal which has see in all of its folk music, dance, food and Daily life. It gives you the feeling of being right there next to the Ocean. Indeed the museum is one of most interesting of sealife I ve seen. One is in Bodrum/Turkey which is much different with relics of ancient civilizations from under water. This one is so different, like the Monterey Aquarium by Pasific and sea museum in Hong Kong. You feel you are in a different universe totally with all those different species and flora living under the water. It has habitat from all oceans of the World and all are connected by canals to one ocean like it is actually on earth.
A place to visit. If you enjoy sea life, this is an amazing space to visit and for those with kids is education class. The variety of fish and sea life is great and the atmosphere is quiet and nice.

Something different to do.... Spectacular giganti aquarium with lots of different species including numerous sharks. Very well maintained and not overcrowded in busy Sumner season. Well worth spending a couple of hours there.

Nice half day with the fishes. Excellent exhibitions for both young and old. Quite busy when we were there (Wednesday end of July) and hard to see everything. Restaurant is about average for a museum restaurant. Surrounding area is really nice.
Amazing. A very good day out and all my friends loved it. The tanks are well thought out with loads of fish from all over the world.
Pretty good and interesting . A nice aquarium with loads to see and read with a lot of information available. Loads of cool things to see as well
A must visit. This oceanarium is simply breathtaking- a definite must do if you're in Lisbon even just for a few days!

Boring - but very nice fresh water aquariums. We have been at many of this larger salt water aquariums around the world, and must say that this was not above average. Many of the fish look unhealthy and the smell was not to nice either.
But it is worth a visit, but start with the temporary fresh water aquariums - you might stay there for long time...

A sea life experience with all the 5 oceans in one of the best aquariums in the world. If you want to see all the five oceans put together with the different fauna and flora, you need to come to Oceanário. The infrastructure is spectacular, the animal diversity is impressive and the organization of the exposition is well achieved in order to make this a lifetime experience.Coming to Lisbon, don't loose the opportunity to go to Oceanário.It's ideal for small kids since they may get a close look of some of the most impressive water fauna...
Oceanarium - a must see. Absolutely fantastic - only downside was their Temporary Exhibition - not worth the extra money - do spend time walking under the waterfall and little river walk. Brilliant
Amazing. This blew me away you must go visit. it is the best that I have been to and my kids had a great time.

Walking around the ocean.. The oceanarium features a gigantic main reservoir teaming with sharks, manta rays, sun fish, schooling fish, etc, etc, etc. The servoir is build using thick high glass plates offering stunning views from all sides. Set around are it are smaller reservoirs showing sealife in its different settings (tropical, artic, amazon, etc).Well recommended for an enjoyable morning or afternoon, although a bit expensive (60 euro for a family of four)

interesting for kids and adults. Impresssive main basin. A lot of different species and good information per species. Well structured setup and overall well maintained Oceanarium. Extra exhibition was is a waist of time, but was for free anyway.
Nice but bit boring. When you enter it has a wow factor because of the big aquarium however the whole "tour" you walk round that aquarium. They have nice features but I think it is a bit dated.

Children whill be amazed.... The big glass walls will certainly give children the time of their lives. So many fishes swimming around. This is not the best aquarium i have visited so far but it was fine for me. Enough diversity and lot's to see. The area around the aquarium is quite dull.
SURPRISINGLY GOOD!. Beautifully executed allowing an up close and personal experience between visitors and fish, birds and plant life. Nice flow to the whole exhibit.

Enjoyable Experience. Small compared to some other similar attractions but a great way to spend an enjoyable couple of hours.The full price is a little over 15 euros which is pretty good value but we got in cheap as we bought a hop on hop off bus tour ticket which incorporated entry to the Oceanarium. The only issue with this is that nobody told us that we would have to queue up to swap our vouchers for tickets so we did not save any time.The attraction centers around a large tank containing several species of large and small fish plus Sea Otters. There are several viewing points spread over three floors including a view above the surface where we could see the Sea Otters. There are several other displays of smaller species.A secure area where bags can be left whilst you explore could be useful to some. The only down side was that the only café was at the exit and as we arrived after mid-day, we were really hungry by the time we left.As a bonus (nothing really to do with the Oceanarium), as we sat in the café, we watched an air display that was going on.

Kids had fun. We went to the oceanarium in the morning and bought family ticket on the spot. Saw rare species of fish including the sand fish and sea dragons. Kids loved every minute. We also took a 10 minute cable car ride!

Something for everyone. The Lisbon Oceanarium is a great place to visit, with or without kids. The main attraction is obviously the big center aquarium with sharks and big schools of fish, but for us the special exhibition about underwater forests was the most touching. Half art, half aquarium we where really moved by it, which I hadn't expected to be.
Relaxation mood on. Very nice place not only to see a high diversity of species but also to relax and forget about the noise in the city
Very nice place. Close to the airport, it's à perfect place to end your stay in Lisbon. You can leave your luggage in a secure place while you visit

Many sea creatures to see. Went here because I have never been to an aquarium or Oceanário before. Was fascinated by all the sea life and being so close to them was amazing, price was reasonable at €17.50 per person. Staff were friendly and it was relaxing watching the fish and other sea life. Only downside is that it's quiet busy with it being so popular, besides from that a great experience that I would definitely recommend.

One of the best things in Lisabon. Great, great, great. Definitely go there if you visit Lisabon! We went there just before closing and we were there almost alone and we could spend time in front of the most interesting things.
Just beautiful. Worth a visit indeed. Money and time well spent. Best part were the sea otters (not seals as others said) and penguins ). Both were huge fun

FUN PLACE FOR KIDS. My child loves aquariums so it's impossible to visit a city without visiting it's aquarium and I was so pleasantly surprised to find these aquarium so spectacular!!! We've visited the amazing Monterey Bay Aquarium in Monterey California and so without really meaning to, I end up comparing my aquarium visits to that aquarium and I must say that this lives up to the standard. We had a fabulous experience and managed to see every tank enjoying every sea creature we saw.We particularly enjoyed the penguin exhibit but all of it is wonderful!!!Enjoy!!! And if you like it come back and give me a thumbs up!!!
Great place! . Plan at least 2 hours to visit this place. Nicely laid out and with species I had never seen before! Very nice and perfect for hot days or rainy days!

An excellent Aquarium with a lot of focus on environment and sustainability. Oceanario is highly recommended to anyone visiting Lisbon area. This is one of the best aquarium style attractions we've ever visited. You need a couple of hours to visit, but you could spend even much more time, depending on your pace, interests and attraction to sea life.

Unexpected treat. We hadn't planned to visit the Oceanarium but found ourselves there on a hop on/hop off bus stop - so glad we did, spent ages there are could have spent longer. So well set out, beautiful sea life and so much information - wish we could take the grandkids!

A bit expensive but definitely worth it. Although it might not be everyone's cup of tea, if you are like me and prefer nature to museums, this is the place you need to visit while in Lisbon. The price of the ticket might seem a bit steep (16EUR), but it is very worth it. There is a lot to see and enjoy and learn. I spent a cool 4 hours there, a lot of that time simply sitting on the floor by the massive central tank, just watching all the fish and sharks and rays swim by.The temporary exhibition (underwater forests) also took my breath away, and I feel I could have spent even more time sitting there enjoying its beauty had I not become terribly hungry.

Largest aquarium in Europe. Good trip for fish lovers everywhere. Reasonable entry fee, but first floor cafe was poor, very poorly stocked at lunchtime in particular. Aquarium certainly well stocked though with plenty of information in English and Portuguese.

one of the best I've ever seen. even better than the one in Chicago- i purely love it. I'm a diver and seen some of the fishes so close up (such as huge starfishes) made me excited really. the building is also very nice.

Really fun!. We went at the end of the day, last entry - which was great as it meant almost no people peering through the glass with us. Really fascinating species. Interesting for adults and kids alike. Special mention: the penguins and the otter are so cute.

Nice aquarium for all ages. I've been to many aquariums around the world and this is a good one. I think the price is reasonable and a nice place to check out for a few hours especially if you have children.
Worth it!. The permanent exhibit it fantastic but the temporary exhibit was amazing as well! Water forests. A beautiful exhibit with elements of water, music, and nature. Really amazing!
Perfect day. Oceanarium is unique, although included in Lisboa card , buying on-line blue tickets is cheaper, 15,30 EUR for adult, after exhibition the lunch inside id very good, menu for 9,90 EUR.

One of the best oceanariums. Very interesting place.A lot of fish species,great views.Everything is easy to see and to take beautiful pictures.Suitable not only for children,but for adults also.Must be visited if being in Lisbon

worth visiting. I arrived at the Orient Tain station, walked through the mall and outside, turned right and continued about 1,000 meters to the Oceanarium. You can see the roof set back from the pedestrian walkway. the entrance fee is a steep 17 Euros, but it is worth it.
