When you go in, everyone is crowded around the main tank taking pictures of the fish on their phones. Keep walking because you can see this same tank from many other angles, with fewer people around. There is one main tank and many side exhibitions. the highlight is the pair of otters, and the film tells you all about them. The film is very good, in Portuguese but subtitled in various languages. The translation is faultless. This is one of those places where you have to exist through the gift shop, but it's not too tempting because there is not much to bu - unless you really like nice mugs. I do not need another mug! I did not eat at the Oceanarium, where there seem to be chains of restaurants attached to the premises. Instead wander back to the mall and on the ground floor is a huge supermarket, with a great deli at the back. You can get hot food for as little as 4 Euros and eat it on the benches overlooking the water.

Wow! What was that?. An excellent display from all over the world, divided into geographical areas.Very well designed and very imformative. You need to spend a good 3-4 hours to see everything. Take a camera!

Fascinating wonders of the sea. This is something really amazing! With young children we have been already 3 times and each time we spend more and more time to identify, discover and just observe the thousand colors and creatures of the sea. I am a scuba diver and definitely I would prefer to see all these in their natural habitat but no doubt that the oceanarium is wonderful and allows to learn and explain a lot to my kids. The total time of a visit can vary between one hour and half and .. well it depends how long you want to stay looking back at the big central round aquarium with sharks (bull shark, silk shark, etc), manta rays, barracudas, tuna, moon fish and many many more: kids and adults are hypnotized in front of such a wonder. The part with the coral reef of course deserves a stop, so the sea horses that have been recently added in a column shaped aquarium. It's really a must go, especially with kids. Expect some lines in case of rain but online ticketing and self service machines for tickets are good options to save some time. If you have stroller elevators are available. There is also option for guided tours for kids, which I still didn't try but I have heard good things about them.
Very nice. lots to see for all, not just kids. Arctic area, nordic area and so on. Very large water tank in the mitten and you can se both above and believe the water surface

A beautiful place to enjoy the wonders of sea life!. You should not go in a rush but with enough time to take in all the information and the exhibits. The small aquariums are as extraordinary as the large one which encompasses the four oceans. There are also marvelous water mammals.
Loved it. This was truly a beautiful Oceanarium. The surrounding area is also very nice with a great view of the river and bridges and other modern architecture.

Great visit but slightly overcrowded . Went with my partner and two friends, all had a great time and really enjoyed both the permanent and temporary exhibitions. Was great to see some really exotic fish as well other sea animals such as otters and penguins! There's also some good educational stuff throughout. The only downside is that it did get a little crowded, some things we didn't see because there were just too many people.

Fasinated place. It's a perfect place to visit ,, very well organized and informative. We enjoyed our visit to the maximum.. The movie was very informative. It made us appreciate the hard work for keeping the exhibition very well maintained.. The only thing is missing is the photo booth،،،

Great aquarium, spectacular attractions. I saw a few aquariums (aquaria?) in recent months and this one is clearly the best. You walke around a huge round pool with smaller pools on the side.Most spectacular is the large moonfish, the sharks and maybe the smaller animals you can observe froom very close.Modern techniques have been used (obviously).
stunning. Beautiful place to spend the whole afternoon.Peaceful and relaxing.The only problem is that it is a little far away from Lisboa centre

ideal for kids. we have buy an on-line ticket to avoid the line of people. we have been there at 10 in the morning to avoid the children groups- after 12 it's become more congested. the main aquarium is very imposant and all the visit is centered around him. we loved the construction, the informations shown thru tunnel, it is a great choice for kids

Enjoyable overall, but-- . TLDR: It's mostly fun but some exhibits seem inappropriate and potentially harmful, and there is little information on display.While it's always fun to look at the different fish and other animals the aquarium has to offer, there isn't really much information around about the fish exhibited. There is a central tank with loads to look at, I found myself learning little to nothing new about the fish at all. Some of the smaller tanks only include the name of the species. Now, if you're concerned about the well-beings of the animals rather than only the enjoyment of the guests, there are points the aquarium should certainly look into. Even though the staff are caring and the biologists working for the aquarium so their best to keep the animals happy and healthy, some exhibits do seem kind of improper. For instance, the penguin exhibit where guests can literally stretch their hands and interact with them, was an unpleasant surprise. While toddlers and some adults may find it fun to be able to pet a penguin or bird (cause they had birds freely roaming the room), not only they but also the animals too could get hurt. A malicious person could get an animal poisoned or even killed relatively easily! The otter exhibit was also open, so people would easily be able to pollute the water or harm the animals. Not to mention, having the animals directly interact with humans and human food is highly unnatural. In the end, the aquarium experience was rather enjoyable, but the constant thought of the animals possibly getting hurt and the lacking information display, kept it far from being excellent.
good for kids. It's good place for kids to visit on a rainy day. We visited a lot of aquariums around the world and this place was not impressed us so much, but the kids were happy.
Fun For All. One of the best Oceanariums I have ever been to. Perfect for couples or families! Fun, and educational at the same time. Highly recommended as a highlight in the city.
Beuatiful. Siiiiiiii! Ronaldo is the beztLovely tank blueish beautiful dream of my world. Sharks and all. Nemo and Dory were there
Good for kids, but I don't have any. As someone in my 20's I found it very boring. Would much rather go snorkelling for the same price and see the marine life in action.

Lovely. For children it would be great for them to visit this place, if you have 2 hours to spend, be ready for signage, better if you study the place first where you heading because of its different areas of not just fish or ask for friendly staff to guide you.

My First Aquarium. This was my first aquarium ever (of course I'd go to the one in Lisbon) and it was really cool. I love the centerpiece because most of the fish were there. The aquarium is definitely big and a tourist must do because you get to see some fish you wouldn't see if you went to a smaller aquarium. Make sure you see the sea otters, they are cool.

Fabulous day for the family . We went to escape the heat and hilly streets in Lisbon one afternoon (two children in strollers, 8mth and 3yrs), and wish we had gone for the whole day! The kids were in complete awe, and hours flew by as it was so much fun. We didn't even make it round the whole place and saw none of the temporary exhibit, wish we had time to go back! The whole area around the oceanarium has lots to offer as well with fountains, museums, parks, and restaurants. Definitely recommend a visit. Worth the money, especially compared with how much you pay for the sealife centre in the uk which is a joke in comparison.
My children loved it!. My children are 3 and 5 years old and loved it. We arrived late and it was easy to buy tickets, but usually it is better to buy in advance.

Well done aquarium!. Not the biggest aquarium that we have seen, but certainly extremely well done. Has a strong conservation slant, and that in important. Whole place centers on one extremely large tank that all others attach to. Specifically, they have a nice, diverse collection of specimens. We only spent a couple of hours there, but were not disappointed. BTW, the temporary exhibit was extraordinary.
Well spent 2 hours. Great place to get out of the heat too. A good variety of sea life and plenty to do in the near buy area as far as eating and shopping go

Nice but overpriced. We visited on the recommendation from many locals that this was an amazing oceanarium - I have to say I found it a little underwhelming considering the price. It was €17 per person but only had one large tank for the fish (although there were many different viewing points) and from the photos I had expected a tunnel viewing walkway but there wasn't. Still a nice day out and good for kids.
Amazing!. Definitely worth the visit. Loved how huge this place was. Spent a good two hours here. Gift shop is lovely as well. Highly recommended!! :)

Great place to visit!. This place was just !ovely! Not just fish they have different areas to show the diversity of the different oceans such as penguin areas. It is a massive place & takes a good couple of hours to explore thoroughly. Good to visit even if you haven't got kids.
Excellent family trip. If you have young kids or if you are a sealife lover yourself.Visit the Oceanarium for sure. It is the best in it's kind i've ever seen.
Good . An interesting place to visit but their signage & information could do with improving. It turns out we missed a whole section!

Good day to spend a windy/rainy/too hot day in Lisbon!. It's definitely worth visiting! Just make sure, you will have enough time to enoy everything there is to see (you will need at least half of the day!
Wonderful and amazing! . This is an amazing aquarium and great experience! All the staff is friendly and it is worthed to visit!
Lisbon oceanarium. Kept my 9 year old son fully engrossed. Not just sea life also birds and frogs. Restaurant looks onto water park.
best place to cool down. you can make this a whole day experience. sit down and enjoy the intern view of the most incredible tank with so many fishes...
Fun!. Was there with my 16 year son. We spent two hours there. We both enjoyed it! The temporary exhibition was not worth the extra 3€.
Wov!. Really loved the Oceanarium! The giant aquarium was awesome. Also seeing lots different sea animals in a really well organized exhibition was an amazing experience

Good aquarium. Came with a friend on the 3rd day of our stay in Lisbon. This was a nice activity that was different from the sight seeing we had been doing. The oceanarium is designed well so that the order of the rooms follows a structure. Each area represents an ocean. It was quite busy with families and children when we were there around midday. Worth a visit if you are in town. The temporary exhibit was beautiful too.
Wonderful!. Even though I'm from San Diego where we have several oceanairums including Sea World, thus oceanairum topped them all. I will bring my neice and nephew here. Impressive!

An ocean of blue. Beside the Big tank of fish where you see sting rays, Sharks, sunfish and lots of others there are interesting smaller exhibitions on the outreret side og the aquarium. Kids love it we adults have fun for a couple of hours too, remember to buy your tricket online before you Arrive to jump the tricket boot queue and you save 10%

Very inspiring!. I can strongly recommend the Lisbon Oceanarium. The aquarium provides environmental education and shows the purpose of protecting natural resources like almost no other place I know. Also the animals are being treated really well. However, parents who consider visiting the Oceanarium should be able to control their overly enthusiastic children...
Excellent. Great place to visit- all services good. Big enought and colourful for small kids, adults and the whole family

Very Long Walk to Enter the Aquarium . The aquarium is located very far from the metro station Oriented. On a very hot day, it was a bit unbearable to walk the mile or so distance to get to the entrance. Once inside, you are transformed to a cool environment with a huge salt water tank with sunfish, sharks, stingrays, and many more. The aquarium is not that big so it didn't wow me. But if you had young children, it could be worth a trip.The entrance fee is 17 Euros per adult, and a 10% off if bought tickets online.

Good but not superb. We purposely planned a late day visit to avoid crowds. While there were still many people at 4:30pm but the place was not overwhelmed. The tank is awesome with really cool fishes and I like that there are niches throughout you can sit and watch the fishes. The place is well organized into ocean categories. Love the "forest under water" temporary exhibit. Having said that it is just another nice aquarium similar to Monterey in California, Dallas aquarium (and tropical forest/garden). Not sure why this is the number one attraction in Lisbon because this does not have any cultural significance other than the fact that Portugal is on the coast.

A must see in Lisbon. This is not just an aquarium, its more of an experience. Built around a huge central aquarium that you walk around while seeing other areas and habitats. Don't walk in and spend ages trying to view it from the first window (as everyone does), there are two levels, each with a dozen areas to look through at the myriad of fish, sharks and rays swimming around in this truly vast tank. The penguins are lovely in their own little habitat. If you are lucky enough to see the sea otters have your camera ready - they are too cute for words. I actually enjoyed the waterfront area its set in too. Nice walk from the train station (just over 10 mins), through the shopping area and turn right when you get to the waterfront, easy.

Beautiful aquarium to spend a lot of time. very interesting, beautiful, with a lot of variety of sea life in and out of sea. The big multi-storage aquarium with all sorts of fish is the centerpiece, but we enjoyed the pinguins, otter and alks as much. You can spend easy a couple of hours even with smaller children as there is so much to see and discover.

Penguin delight at Lisbon Oceanarium. I visited Lisbon Oceanarium in October 2015 and was very impressed by the place. lots of different Marine animals there to see, the highlights for me was the Otters who looked adorable and the Penguins there was over fifty of them. If you like Penguins then you will love this place. The only downside for me was the Cafe inside. There wasn't much in the way of choice, though the prices were reasonable. Overall a good experience and I would recommend to anyone visiting Lisbon.
Place that makes you happy!. Great place to spend an afternoon looking at the sea life of the Atlantic and other oceans. We absolutely loved it!

Just ok. We had great expectations with this oceanario. The building is very beautiful in an area that was completely renewed in the past years. But the exhibition was just ok for us. Only one restaurants inside de building, a shop that is nice but I thought they could have more of everything to show. Even so I think is worth the visit. They have a giant octopus..

Incredible place. Went here during our trip to Lisbon. Had heard it was a big aquarium, but the vastness of it still blew my mind. We spent a good 3 hours or so walking around looking at the different creatures. It was super busy even during a weekday, but the place is really spacious and I was able to still look at everything properly and take photos. The main tank is superb, and you get the opportunity to see into it throughout the visit. It really is enormous! Loved the fact that the tanks allowed the animals to live together in a similar way to how they would in the wild, with different species sharing the same huge spaces. Would definitely visit again if I go back to Lisbon.

The best Oceanarium/Aquarium in Southern Europe. Good ride at the end of June. Two adults + 2 children (because this type of attraction is especially appreciated by smaller). One of the best, if not the best aquarium I have ever visited. Two floors with lots of variety of aquatic fauna and flora, with themed areas with thermal change and moisture. The great attraction are the penguins and otters (those that existed at the opening - Amalia and Eusebius, have died) and feeding times of mammals and fish. The only caveat to make is that there is no news in terms of new attractions (animals, exhibits or new circuits) so that those who visit this Oceanarium several times, do not always find it the same charm.

4 days in Lisbon . The Aquarium is well worth a visit. Also for 3 euros more you can see the none permanent display, which we would recommend. On our visit, designed by a Japanese artist. You can also get here quite easily on the Lisbon metro.

A Giant Aquarium!. Very nicely done. The building's center is a multi-story gigantic aquarium. Visitors start at the top and walk around and down as they go through the building. each floor has side exhibits that are beautifully done representing the different oceans of the world. The main aquarium is always visible at the center. Really fascinating.
Absolutley massive!. The aquarium itself was absolutely incredible. The area around it was rather boring in both directions.

Superb . Great place to spend a few hours with the family. The Aquarium is lots of fun, 17 Euros for adults.
The surrounding areas are very pleasant with lots of restaurants.

An amazing place full of life, which gives us a glimpse of what's living under water. Lisbon Oceanarium is an amazing place full of life, which gives us a glimpse of what's living under water. With hundreds of different species of fish, known and less known, ranging from the Bull Shark to Otters and penguins, and lots of other small water animals that you don't get to see at your "average" aquarium. Really great experience for kids. My 5 year daughter loved it!I highly recommend it for everybody.
Enjoyable attraction. Great way to spend an afternoon, the otters were highly entertaining and overall enjoyable for families, couples and children. Well worth a visit.

Must see. This aquarium is honestly one of the best i have ever visited! Wide variety of marine life and serves as a good day out. Located close to a fun cable car line too and reasonably close to the metro station Oriente

Nothing much. I visited the oceanarium because friends recommended it. I was not impressed and it is not big. It not worth the money or the time. Of course, for kids it is a paradise and it could be very enjoyable but this does not apply to adults also.

I simply love it!. A must-do in Lisbon! Such a wonderful place, it will keep you entertained and fascinated for hours on end. It easily ranks among the best aquariums in the world, and i've visited a few! The central tank is an experience by itself, and you can never get tired of it, and then there are all of the other zones to explore as well. Fantastic.

World Class. We've visited aquariums around the world. The Lisbon Oceanarium ranks towards the top and exceeded our expectations. The "temporary" exhibition is well worth the additional fee. A beautiful facility with excellent signage in English.
Fishy day. A big oceanarium with many beautiful kind of fishes , sharks and ...The visit take more than 3 hours The morning is the best time for visit because is not too busy with students
A Nice spent Afternoon. They have improved the aquarium from the last few years,if you have kids its a great relaxing time to spend with them

Don't miss this one.. In the 1990s the Portuguese transformed this once very run down industrial area into the EXPO 98 park. And what a great job they did. Easy to get to from the Centre either by bus, train or metro its work a walk around and then a visit to this spectacular aquarium. As some have said it's not too easy to take photographs so just take in the serenity of the fish as they swim around this giant tank.

Great place to visit with kids or a special someone . This is an awesome place to spend an afternoon. The amount of fish from all parts of the world is huge.
It's so relaxing and very informative.
Great Aquarium. Been to a few around the world and this ranks right up in the top 3. Buy your tickets in advance and plan on spending several hours

A must in Lisbon - specially if you are here with children.. We went to the Oceanarium on the day we arrived in Portugal, after a long and tiring overnight flight. I was afraid we would all be very tired and not enjoy the tour, but it was just the opposite... We all LOVED IT!!!

A must to go with kids. . The oceanarium is amazing. A lot of sea life species. Very entertaining for young children. Once you are there take the opportunity do visit the near by science and technology museum. A lot of fun for kids.
Quick visit, fun to see. Stopped in for a day trip, buy tickets online and scan your phone, you will save 10%. Nice oceanarium. Kids will enjoy.

Sea Otters were amazing!. The oceanariums was quite good value and it took us a good few hours to get round - the main tank has so much to watch and it pretty much visible the whole time but the various climates were amazing to walk through as well. The penguins and sea otters were our favourites. It's very clean and clear - and the extra exhibit was beautiful. Make a day of it by going on the cable car and spending your time exploring by the river.

Interesting aquarium covering all 4 Oceans and more. My husband wanted to go here because he heard it is the best aquarium in Europe. I thought iy was a great aquarium since it had more than just the local aquatic life. It has a very large 2 floor main tank, and then areas for the 4 oceans: Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, and Antarctic. I was impressed with their penguin area. They also had some Australian and amphibian exhibits. We live by the Monterey Aquarium which has hands on exhibits and more activities. So I have high standards. It may not be the best aquarium, but it is among the best I've been to. Worth a visit if you have time.

Enjoyable experience. Aquarium is great with a huge centre tank and four other areas. Layout can be a little confusing over two floors, and it was very busy on our visit, but a good experience overall.

Cool, relaxing and interesting outing for a hot summer afternoon. Arrived at noon and it was a sweltering day outside. The Oceanarium provided a cool, entertaining and fun way to spend an hour or two. The displays were fun for the kids, and lots of sea life to behold, almost 8000 species of life to be viewed here from all the worlds oceans. The huge Sunfish was quite something to see. As for an aquarium it was ok, but nothing super spectacular. The kids loved it, we found the cool interior a relief. The restaurant had one good meal, the fish. Lol. The chicken and pasta wasn't to write home about. But the eating space was comfortable, with selection of cool beverages and desserts to choose from. The gift shop had some really cool stuff, pricy but cool. This doesn't make my top 10 in Lisbon, but it was an enjoyable and relaxing experience with the kids. Go check it out.
Aquarium at Lisbon. A very interesting, educational visit. Set in an area where there are lots of other things to see. Some really beautiful creatures such as colourful corals.
Oceanarium. A good place to visit when the temperatures are high, excellent for children. Buy the tickets online so you don't have to wait in line.

Nice little and big fishes. Although I prefer fishes on a plate, this session reminds you on their extinction and gives instructions how you as a consumer can contribute to mitigate it. Some interesting species I saw first time ever. Stories are ultra interesting.

Good way to spend an afternoon. Easy subway ride from downtown, a bit of a walk from the terminal to the aquarium. Large tank in the center with smaller areas at the four corners on two levels. A bit of everything, all signage and video in Portuguese and English.Nice cafe and gift shop on the ground floor, Large upscale shopping mall on the way back to the metro terminal.

Did not meet expectations. We felt this exibit was quite over rated. We have been to some much better underwater displays. The main attraction was the large center tank but picture taking was very difficult. We have been to a similar display but there were at least 2 underwater divers in the tank feeding & interating with the sea life unlike here. The print on the displays was very difficult to read due to the poor lighting & the font size.

Simply fantastic and phenomenal for people of all ages!. When I looked around for attractions to visit in Lisbon, this was honestly - in my backup list just in case I have some extra time, and definitely - I am glad I did and was astoundingly surprised on how good it was!From the moment you enter the aquarium area, to the exploration of the tanks etc, it is indeed a multi sensory experience that is unseen of in other aquariums. Yes, it could be smaller than some well-renowned aquariums but definitely trust me, this is the best, if not - one of the best.You'll be rewarded with a grand overview of the sea life ecosystem (have you watched Finding Dory yet?) - all the seawater aquariums are linked in some way to the main central aquarium to give a sense of how fishes and other sea creatures lead their lives in sea (to illustrate how the different grand seas on earth counterbalances each other).Definitely worth a visit, and should be in the top of the list of all travelers to Lisbon!
Fun. First we were not gonna go, but because of the weather we went. It was a fun place and we enjoyed ourselfs.
Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit, although after reading some articles about it I thought it would have been even bigger. A must visit if you travel with kids.

Fantastic exhibits!. We visited the Oceanario while on holiday with our 2 year old daughter. It's everything you would expect from a top class aquarium! The central tank is absolutely enormous and seeing the sun fish was amazing. My daughter loved the rays (and sharks of course) and took great delight having spotted some regal tangs (Dorys!) and clownfish (Nemos!) in the tropical reef section. One of my favorites was the enclosure with the puffins and muerres - watching them diving from an underwater perspective was fascinating. There was also a penguin enclosure and sea otters as well as the more usual amphibians, jellyfish etc. There is also a well designed section near the end on the importance of environmental protection and conservation with lots of interactive elements to engage kids. The only thing I think which might have added to the experience was a little more information on the species but all in all a fantastic morning / afternoon out for all ages!

Good aquarium, very busy . My boyfriend loves aquariums and since this was so highly rated on TripAdvisor we decided to go on our last day in Lisbon. It took us an hour to find the bus stop for the 728 from praça comercio (maybe look up the exact location beforehand). When we finally got there it was a decent aquarium with plenty of species, although I found it too busy to enjoy it fully.If you like aquariums this is a solid choice.
Fun with fish. Saw fish I had never seen before. Great lay out. Took my teenage daughter who also loved it. Right down by the river where lots was going on.

Better with 3+ yr old. We visited alone (not in a party), and I found the experience less amazing than what I expected. Our 2yr old wasn't enthusiastic about much, but i did see some other olders kids enjoying - so i'd say this is best for kids 3+ ...
Nonethess, for adults it's worth the visit.

A great attraction. Well worth a visit - it's #1 spot on Tripadvisor is well deserved. The central tank is of impressive scale with wonderful mature fish, and the surrounding exhibits as you walk through the building are very well presented, cohesive in style with interesting information.

Must see while in Lisbon. Honesty, I did not expect much from the Oceanario da Lisboa, well... people normally talk about Barcelona Aquarium, which btw is not half as interesting as the Lisbon one. I loved the idea of having a big aquarium in the middle and you may see so many species at one time. Actually, i loved everything about this place and got so much energy. Sea otters stole my heart!
Cool beans. Nice aquarium. Really unique. Gets a bit tedious after a while. Alot of kids blocking all the views. All in all 7,5/10
Interesting . Worth visiting, definitely enjoyed. Saw so many different cool fiches, including sun much that was huge. was surprised by various different fiches. Take a scarf, it can be fresh.
Great day out. We did the cable car ride then spent about three hours, going round here.......great exhibits, well laid out, the temporary exhibit was underwater forests, very restful.

Great family outing. We visited with our 1.5yo who absolutely loved walking around and looking at the tanks. We came mid-week in the morning and thankfully didn't encounter any crowds. Onsite dining facilities not impressive but there are nearby options. Great family outing.
Great attraction in a nice area. Great displays and variety of fish. Reasonable price and not overrun with kids. Take the cable car around the corner for great views

Nice day out! . Visited with my one year old, he loved the fish. Exhibition is great, very well displayed. Lots of fish to see. I only went to the permanent exhibition. Tips - buy ticket online. Also if you have a stroller they can't store it for you but there are bike lockers near the exit which would fit a stroller plus lockers inside which you can store bags in if you want to let the kids run around.

All things fishy. Great day out - kids ( well one who is 28 & one who is 25 ) love it - spent hours wandering round the main tank looking at the different types of fish etc.Lots of good clear information on the various fish and the surrounding pods which housed the other sea creatures i.e. crabs etc again very good with plenty to keep everyone happyGood value for money if you spend half a day or more - don't think of this venue as a quick hour and move on - you need a good 4 hours as a minimum to get the most out of this trip

Quadruple in the ocean . Oceanarium is located in expo part of the city right o. The bank of the river that goes into ocean. It is connected to the land with a bridge and offers good experience of ocean world if all five oceans. There is an entrance fee and a separate fee for audio guide.

the best aquarium in the world. in addition to the aquarium , which is unique , it has several recreated ecosystems and a lot of work in training and protection of the aquatic environment. additionally it is located in one of the best places for sightseeing in Lisbon, near the river and with an architecture that is not easy to be indifferent to.
Spectacular marine life displays near spectacular Oriente train station.. Spent an entertaining afternoon inside, getting respite from sun too! Recommend a visit for young and old.

Don't hesitate. I've been to; Camden aquarium in NJ, Baltimore's and Seaworld in Orlando. This is up there and will not disappoint. We almost did not go thinking we've seen it all. No matter, it was a great 4.5 hours spent and would like to have stayed longer. One can also devote some time to the area around the aquarium. Walkable to main train station ( I think, please check, about 15 minutes)

A really great day out . This place is very cheap to get in and offers everything you could expect in a place like this. It was really large and you saw all sorts of aquarium animals. Genuinely most times you were mesmerised..... It was easy to find your way around and wax an excellent touch that you were able to see the otters And penguins get fed. Very informative on marine life tooAmazing place, amazing value would come here again.

Great aquarium. Went with my girlfriend and it was great. The giant sunfish is definitely worth the admission price. We purchased our tickets online and were able to use the mobile scanner. The fish and giant tank in the middle was awesome. I highly recommend going. Also, I highly recommend seeing the temporary exhibit 'underwater forests.' It was beautiful.

Magnificent 🌟🌟🌟. If you think that if you've seen an aquarium then you have seen all of them ... think again. Sharks penguins on ice and a trio of sea otters that turns somersaults in the water, are just the tip of the Maritime iceberg on the huge Oceanario. This is Europe's second largest aquarium - where 8000 species are enjoying themselves in 7 million liters of sea ducks ... NB. prices are per. adult € 13 / children 9 €. Opening 10 April to 20 October. . November 10 to March 19... Very very recommend

excellent day out on a wet day.. A reasonably priced attraction for a family of four, €44. This a good way to spend 2-3 hours, either out of the sun or on a rainy day. The amount of fish is amazing, they have a huge tank in the centre with hundreds of tanks surrounding this main tank. Sharks, Groopa, rays and many many more. Smaller children will love this attraction as its mesmerising, so many fish swimming around of all sizes.

Very interesting . A interesting place for all age groups . Big arsenal of fishes with lovely colors and sizes. It is very relaxing just to seat and to watch the fishes in the big Aquarium. You should a lot of colorful fishes. It's also interesting for children.

Great family activity. We are no strangers to aquariums, but this one deserves the high praise it gets. A perfect family, and a great way to get out of the sun and spend the heat of the early afternoon.

A afternon with the family. We went there with our 3 years old child. The acess are really good and the staff were very helpfull. There is a lot information and oir child loved the multimedia.
The worst thing was the bathrooms.

A refreshing experience about life in waters. Location, architecture, and the aquarium itself are perfect!!!!
Sometimes it has cultural events as music representations and others.

Nice moment. In leaving the telecabine, we went to the aquarium.
We spent a nice moment. A lot of fishs, different fishs...
Very nice location to share with kids !
Very nice Oceanarium. This was a great afternoon visit. The Oceanarium is set up very nicely and is very easy to get around. They have a beautiful exhibit and lots of beautiful fish.
Fishes! . Lisbon oceanarium is the greatest thing I have seen so far in Portugal. Its quite expensive, but it's worth every penny. I am very happy to be there. Mark my words - you will be delighted!

Smiling sting ray. Decent aquarium. However, you should go for one reason - the smiling stingray! There is a glass tank that is about 4 feet high. If people looked over into the tank, a stingray swan up the glass and looked like he/she was kissing the person. The stingray also seemed to be smiling at us! Very cool.
Great place to go.. It is a really nice place to pay a visit. It is located in a modern part of the city and the facilities are really good.
"Fantastic". We had a very memorable and amazing visit on a rainy day in Lisboa! We highly recommend visiting this world class oceanarium.

Best Organized. The most kid friendly and best organized aquarium I've been in since Monterey. The directional arrows pull you easily through the two floors of exhibits. Phenomenal assortment of specimens. Emphasis is on oceans as a natural resource which we must preserve.
Brilliant time here. Interesting things to see round each corner , we got a taxi here which was only €7 from the port , there is a shopping complex 5 mins walk away as well.

Best I have been to. As we were on a cruise we only had a few hours in Lisbon and decided to visit here , we were not disappointed it is a lovely place full of interesting flsh and birds set out beautifully.
Fantastic . Highly recommend a visit so interesting, spent 3 hours there.all air conditioned. Saw the most amazing fish, sea horses jelly fish, penguins, otters.

Fantastic Sea life and buildings. This is an attraction not to be missed if in Lisbon! We went here on probably the hottest day of the week and enjoyed every minute of it. From the layout of the exhibit next to the restaurant (excellent food and good prices) to the Oceanarium itself. This is a place to see sea life that you normally would probably not see anywhere in one spot like this. Afterwards we strolled around the park area and went in for a drink and some shopping at the Vasco de Gama shopping center only 200 meters walking distance and you really have to walk through it to get back to the Metro station as well. But don't miss this attraction while in Lisbon. Family Pass costs 44 Euro (child up to age 12).
Great for rainy days. One of best aquariums have been to, spent several hours here and suited us all from age 8 to 69 (very nearly 70!). Ta ls are enormous.

World Class Aquarium. The Oceanarium is a wonderful experience for visitors of all ages. It claims to be the second largest in the world. The main tank is enormous and there are many viewing spots. The 24 smaller tanks are also interesting and informative. We also enjoyed lunch at the cafe.
Nice size and place for kids to visit. A fun place to visit with kids, decent size and collection of species. Worth the visit if you run out of place to go or have kids.

Fabulous. This is a fantastic place to go with kids, friends or even by your self. The huge tank on the center is absolutely stunning. The oceanarium it's divided into 4 zones and all of them has information both in Portuguese and in English. It is possible to see the animals being feed.Highly recommended!
Absolutely marvelous. Its like looking to the all ocean. Its absolutely marvelous. Unforgetable. Everyone should visit this. Mandatory.

Better that the one in Barcelona. For travelers that haven't had the best experience at the Aquarium in Barcelona and are discouraged to try this one, I can honestly say that it provides a better experience.It is big, has a variety of species (you can also see penguins), well organised, and shows more respect to the fauna (bigger tanks, personnel who advises you not to use flash and so on), which, for me at least is a big deal.

Worth the travel to the Oceanario!. My visit was brilliant! Got a 10% off by booking it online. If buying at the door you could also ask for the same discount if you are a student. Loved the big tank of fishes and the penguins and other marine animals, well explained and well maintained. It can also be reached by metro, just a few blocks from the red line. As near the surroundings are other attractions and a shopping mall, you could easily spend half a day in the same zone.

Very good attraction for kids. We spent about 2 hours in the Oceanarium, very nice and large, with many and varied species. Very well maintained. Really nice area, a handy McDonalds also since there were not so many restaurants nearby. Recommended to go earlier during the day and tickets can be bought on Internet. Very close is the Pavilhao do Conhacimento, our kids were even more thrilled with this one, highly recommended interactive science museum.

Wonderful sea life experience!. This is a must if you like sea life and you're visiting Lisbon.Considered the second best in the world, it offers you a wide range of species on a great environment providing a very pleasant and exciting experience.The several watch points into the main tank allow you to almost feel like you're in there, underwater, swimming with large fish, turtles, sting rays and sharks...If you're lucky enough to catch a quiet day, you can even sit beside the main tank wall and relax enjoying the calm...
Fantastic day out for all the family!. My husband and 9 month old son had a great time! There was plenty of space for my son to crawl and watch the sharks and fishes in awe! Highly recommended!
Must visit. Amazing place to visit solo, with friend or family. so much to see. great oceanarium. Can be packed with kids and tourists however. you can easily spend half a day or more there.

Excellent aquarium, except for signage. I love aquariums, and this was my first in Europe. The tanks and displays were very high quality, and everything was in both Portuguese and English. My only issue was that none of the exhibits listed all of the animals that were present in the tank. The tanks in the amphibian area had no labels at all, and in the general fish areas, there was, for example, a tank with labels for 3 different species of eels, but not mention of the lionfish that were also in the tank. Overall, the aquarium had a really strong and well-presented conservation message, but could have been even a better teaching tool if it named everything you were seeing.

Brilliant. One of the best oceanariums I have visited. Split into 4 zones around a central tank, the displays are well thought out and informative without being dull. The detail that is presented is without fault and makes for an enjoyable day out. Restaurant is pretty good and reasonably priced and there are quite a few alternatives in the surrounding area if it doesn't suit.
Great fun. We loved visiting the Oceanarium. The animals seemed very well kept and happy and it wasn't too busy which made the visit incredibly peacefull. Definately worth a visit

Awesome space.. For all ages. Wonderful array of fishes. The routes leading you along halls of aquariums filled with marvellous species. Different ocean piscifauna in different tanks. well organised. A day well spent.
World wide ocean life. Wonderful aquarium with lots of fishes.The central aquarium holds a lot of wonderful fishes. Even penguines and otters are there. The aquarium is in the same area as the Expo.

Best oceanarium I have visited and great for all ages - young and old. The oceanarium is located at Parque das Nacoes (Park of Nations). Parking is easy and it is only 5/10 minutes drive from the airport, so if you have a late flight and are not sure what to do to kill the time before your flight - then this is the place to go. You can either check in your luggage or leave it at Left Luggage and take a taxi to the oceanarium & book a return to the airport to coincide with your flight. The oceanarium is fascinating, beautiful and educational and appealing to all ages. It's also very relaxing. The enormous tanks seem to be connected but are in fact separate to accommodate the needs of the different fish species. The whole effect is spectacular.

MUST VISIT!. I happened to visit this place by mere accident but I'm really glad I did.Just trying to kill a couple of hours I entered this magnificent place to find a marvellous experience.Their main tank is breathtaking and one can spend hours just enjoying the magnificence of the hundreds of sea creature there. As if that is not enough, you find and discover species from all over the country in amazingly created environments. I got to see penguins, otters and a lot of animals I never thought to see in a place like this!The price is really fare when you compare to other places like this across Europe and the facilities and staff are top notch!!!
Amazing. Absolutely amazing attraction for both adults and children in a wonderful area of town. . I would certainly recommend a visit while in Lisbon.
Great fun to visit. Spent a couple of hours here with my two sons (9 and 12). It was good fun, and fairly priced. If I oculd I would rate it 3,5

Wow! Spectacular!. Previous reviews said this was probably the nicest aquarium in all of Europe. I can see why. The temporary exhibition was created by a Japanese artist and it was very beautiful. It contained a great variety of plants, rock and fish.However, the best was yet to come. The main aquarium was the largest I have ever seen. There are two floors to view it from and it is 360 degrees. The incredible variety of fish, sharks, stingrays, schools of fish made every viewpoint new and exciting. As you slowly circle the tank (and let me say that this is no SMALL tank and will take you on a wonderful journey) there are many side tanks and displays for fish from around the world. There is a large arctic display which is covered with a glass roof and has penguins. There is another room with large sea otters. You can sit on benches in viewing areas for the large aquarium or just sit on the floor in front of the glass and watch the sea life swim right past you. Some viewpoints show you "behind the rocks" areas where some fish enjoy the safety from the large open water.This bears repeating. The Lisbon Oceanario should be on your must see list. It is absolutely spectacular and well worth the low cost of admission.
I've seen better.. I heard great reviews about this place, but of all the others I've visited, this one was only average.
Very interesting. In our company of ten (from nine months to sixty years) no one was disapointed and all got their favourites. Prepare for long waiting time if you want someting to eat outside.

Beautiful Sight of Lisboa. It was a nice visit, although it was very croudy. The main tank with beautiful sharks and many other sea animals can be seen from different spots through the walkingtour, so you don't have to stop at the first spot. We just felt very sorry for the octopus! It seems as he has a way too small tank and you could see, that he was already hurt at the top of his head because he was hitting the glass everytime he tries to swim. We don't think that is an appropriate habitat for such an amazing animal!
Valeria. Excellent place, amazing aquariums, very nice day for lovers of nature, reasonable prices. Highly recommend!

Makes for a Great Day for Anyone!!. This was the first aquarium I had been to and it exceeded all expectations! Their huge tank that goes around the whole oceanarium was breathtaking and I learned so much this day. It is a wonderful thing to do for people of any age and I highly recommend it, especially on a rainy day. What an exciting time I had exploring this place, they have much more than just fish and you will not be disappointed.
Great experience for the kids. The oceanarium is a great place to visit, especially with children. The surroundings are very nice, everything inside looks great, almost magical.

Best aquarium ever!. We love checking out aquariums. This one is really unique. Very carefully and thoughtfully laid out. You basically start at the top and make serial circles around the giant aquarium in the middle while working your way down. Along the way many very well designed exhibits (like penguins, otters, coral, jellyfish, etc), with many good descriptors in multiple languages. As you go you continue to come back to huge views of the central aquarium. Overall - fantastic! Must go!
Just superb. The largest pool I ever saw. Moon fishes, mantas... just amazing. If you take your ticket in advance you avoid queues.

Amazing. This was my first visit to an aquarium and I was impressed. The design was excellent and there was huge variety. We were there at feeding time which was great especially seeing the otters catching their food.
Very nice!. Very informative museum and great fish! The highlight is definitely the huge basin and in it the sunfish!
Very good. A great way to pass the afternoon especially of the weather isn't great. Good value for money. Great exhibitions.

Great place for kids. We took our two children and there grandparents to see the aquarium and it was both interesting and appropriate for everyone. I highly recommend this to anyone traveling to Lisbon.
Great family trip. Fantastic place and a must for the kids. Best to book tickets online to save on cost. Cafe here also but we didn't eat so can't comment on food.

Diversity . The exhibits are divided by oceans and they are well explained on the side panels. You can choose for the audio guide, we didn't catch that. A regular adult ticket is 14 euros for the oceanarium itself or 17 if you also want to see the temporary exhibition. In our case it was about tropical plants- it included one room with few stuff and I can definitely saw it wasn't worth it. Overall it has rare and diverse species but the presentation could've been better - the tunnel from the Barcelona aquarium, the landscape arrangement from Munster Zoo. The Lisboa Oceanarium has too much unused space - especial walls that could've been decorated with themed paintings.

Educative and entertaining. Our family loved the LIsbon Oceanarium. We have visited other Oceanariums in places like Singapore. But this one was quite different. It was very educative because they had a blend of the sea world from different oceans. And they showed how each of the ocean life were different from each other. Finally they showed the melting point of the oceans. There was also a good treat about the forest life and green covers. Our kids loved it and of course, the selfies looked great too !!
Worth a visit . Good aquarium well laid out - don't bother with the temporary exhibition for an extra charge ! Fish on show were really interesting and overall it's a very pleasant experience

Great! . Visited with family and couldn't believe how good the aquarium was here- there were heaps of different enclosures here and many educational tools for the younger children. I would recommend visiting the oceanarium especially if travelling with younger kids

Must. It is a must visit attraction.if u fly from lisbon it is recommended to spend 3 4 hours there before the flight. The exbition is beautiful u can see many kinds of fish, sharks,pinguins and it is good to visit in hot days. Cheildren will love it. It is not big but very impressive. If u buy tickets online it is cheaper and u can enter free to the art exebition at the other hall. The other good thing is that next to it there is a big mall for shoping and eating cheap.Enjoy

Ocean from the great perspective. I was there on September, Sunday morning and astonishingly it definitely was not overcrowded. During that time I had an occassion to see temporary exhibition of freshwater aquarium designed by Takashi Amano (I think it was one of the last from His masterpieces) and I have no idea if it is still there. But it was definitely great aquarium (see photos). Going further, You can admire one of the biggest tanks with ocean animals in the world. You have two levels for observation. In fact it is possible to observe popular species as well as rare fishes like Sunfishes (Mola mola) or Mantas. I have heard that this tank has about 5 million liters of water - it is absolutely giantic. Nevertheless, You can also observe other tanks and installations with otters, penguins, jellyfishes, squids, shrimps, etc.I can recommend this attraction for everyone interested in marine fauna and flora. being a little bit bored observing those in typical zoological gardens. Comparing to other oceanaria I saw (like in Loro Park in Tenerife or Dalian Oceanarium in China) this one is much better.You need at least three hours to see it.

Absolute delight for kids and adults. I absolutely loved it! It was well worth the metro ride to oriente, the park is also a sight worth seeing per se. I was very impressed by the attention paid to the fish, as soon as they noticed untypical behaviour from a given fish, guards were already on the phone to alert their colleagues. I also liked the green message passed on to children about recycling and plastic waste in our oceans and seas.
Fabulous. Great aquarium over 2 floors with loads to see well worth the trip. We got the hop on hop off bus there and back

Excellent Aquarium. We spent several hours enjoying this large and diverse aquarium. The traveling exhibit, an underwater garden called "Forests Underwater", was excellent and worth the extra cost. The aquarium has an attractive layout with a large central tank and smaller exhibits laid our around it, including some engaging habitats with puffins, penguins, and otters.I would say this aquarium is better than the New England Aquarium in Boston and on par with the Baltimore Aquarium.

nice but not the best. I am a bit confused by its first place in Lisbon's atraction. It's a great place, especially for kids, but I had better time in e. g. Miseu do Oriente. You need at least an hour and half to visit it, there is small student doscount and locker room for suitcases. The building is behined other buildings, so don't miss it :) the entrance is by "the wall of water"

A wonderful afternoon - I saw Puffins for the first time!. My Mum and I had an afternoon allocated for the aquarium and we definitely needed that time.We arrived by the hop on hop off bus as its a little way out of the city but there's a metro station about 10-15 minutes away along the waterfront or you can take the cable car which would only be a 5 minute walk. We did this going back and there's a good mall there too.We first stopped at the restaurant to have a coffee and cake. There is seating both indoors and out. We took advantage of the lockers nearby and headed to the exhibit.The first floor has puffins, a first for me, adorable penguins and super cute sea otters. It was very hot outside but very cool inside ( you may want to take an extra layer!! )Downstairs you have the tanks and so many fish to see!! The main tank in the middle can be seen on both floors and is incredible.Take time to just sit and watch these amazing creatures - it's so relaxing.There is a good shop and another cafe adjacent. I would recommend this aquarium to all ages - it's beautifully done and the temporary exhibit has had a lot of thought put into it too.

Adequate. I don't know what I was expecting, but I was neither disappointed or pleased. I felt pretty neutral about it. The temporary exhibit of underwater forests looked like a fish tank you would find in a dentist office. The actual permanent part is fairly large & the exhibits are all translated to English. The penguins and otters were very cute. However, if you've been to the Atlanta Aquarium, you could spend your day doing something else in the center of Lisbon.

Awesome . A must experience for anyone visiting Lisbon. Great location also. You can visit the wonderful shopping center and take the cable car. Try to schedule more time to stay and enjoy the Oceanariums.
Amazing . I been in Lisbon oceanario.wit family and friends was wonderful visited and learn more about some animals I recommend for everyone.

Great value for your money. Be sure to reserve several hours to visit bv this beautiful sea aquarium. The main attraction is the huge basin with sharks, manta ray, devil fish and a lot more. With this in the center a walk through the building shows different panaramas with penguins, birds and otters while the ground floors shows aquaria with tropical fish, frogs and even more tropical fish. The temperarely exibition houses a 40 metres aquarium designed by the Japanese Takashi Amano, which is a delight for The eye, while the ear is anointed by the music of Rodrigo Leao.
Really Great Aquarium. This is a really nice Aquarium- if you like aquariums, you will like this one. Nice information posted, sharks and big fish to see in lots of different angles and spots. :)

Educational experience escaping the heat. It was great learning about all the species and oceans. The concept of the aquarium is really neat - bringing together all the oceans through a central aquarium. Didn't see the otters which was disappointing. Tip - check feeding times for the different species on the oceanarium website and plan to be there at certain times. I am definitely more "save the planet" after this experience. On the other hand, not sure the attraction should be as high rated as it is. It is not centrally located and I find the views and sites in downtown Lisbon more unique to the city than seeing fish from all over the world. I found Dory though (see pics):
Loved it.... Great visit and wonderful array of species. Loved the octopus but think he needs a bigger tank. Definately worth a visit.

Aquarium all around. First of all I would appreciate the design of the building. The main aquarium is in the middle and rounded. So you can pull to left any time and sit and see the aquarium on the wider scale.Moreover, there are tens of other small portions on each floor for fish, see creatures and plants from all around the world.Amazing place to visit specially if you are aquatic lover. Heaven for kids.There is a restaurant on the ground floor with gift shop. Also you can find nice food places around as you would love to sit after long walk inside the aquarium. Take water with you while you are inside as it gets humid.Enjoy fish and find nemo!!!

Much to See. This is rated as one of the top attractions in Lisbon and it truely is if you like oceanariums. There is the permanent exhiblt and a temporary exhibit with the combined ticket only slightly more than for the permanent alone. When I went the temporary exhibit was a large Japanese built aquarium like a big version of what you might have at home, beautiful and relaxing. The permanent exhibit is a three story high circular tank with an inclinded spiral around it. The main tank holds a wide variety of ocean fish and is fun to watch. The spiral has tanks with different habitats. A lot to see in one visit. They have a cafeteria that serves good fish.

Amazing view of ocean life. Not much to say as you need to see this to believe it. Walking around the tank you can see all the micro environments that exist and the different fish that exist in them. Also penguin and otter sections. Was truly an amazing view into ocean life.
Interesting but go early!!!. Beautiful big aquariums. There are dark hallways so the tanks look even more amazing. But I advice to go early , it gets very crowded after 11 a.m.

Do Not Miss. Its just amazing so don't miss this attraction. We took a taxi from Lisbon centre and spent a wonderful time watching penguins fed, otters play and many of the underwater creatures you imagine up close.

Interesting for just adults too. We visited the Oceanarium on a slightly colder and cloudier day. We were surprised by the lack of queues but figured we were traveling during the low season. I suspect that the lines can get really long during the highest of seasons.I was overall very impressed. There is plenty of space to see everything so if one window is blocked with tourists, go to the next one or the next one or the next one. The place is not a mace and you can't get lost and you don't have to wonder if you've already seen something. The otters and the penguins are placed so that you will first see them from the surface and then later from below as they dive. I thought that was really, really smart. All tanks seem spacious and you don't get the anxious feeling of 'are the animals happy'. We liked this place a lot and definitely recommend it for even those who are not traveling with children.

Just wow!. Do not buy your tickets at the self service. The machine does not accept Maestro cards.Once inside the Oceanarium it's just awesome to see all the animals.The place is build around a big fish tank and you can see the fish from different views.The entrance fee is 17 euros, temporary exhibition included.They show you different species from all ocean's around the globe.

A good visit. The central theme of the oncenarium is the main tank that is filled with a variety of species of aquatic life from predators to bottom feeders. The oncenarium complements the main display with smaller tanks with various other species of marine life. It is has a near by metro stop so you can reach it from most hotels with ease. Definitely worth a visit!

If you like the sea, this is for you.. Over the years we've been to a number of aquariums (e.g. Boston, Vancouver), and the Oceanarium is definitely in that premier league. It is great for families with children, but good for adults too. All the explanatory materials and captions are both in English and Portuguese. Another big bonus of the Oceanarium is that it is open on Monday, when most museums in Lisbon are closed.

Absolutely Beautiful!!!. Stunning aquarium with an impressive variety of climate zones and species. Viewing angles are extraordinary and I was privy to a special exhibit by Takahi Amano on underwater gardens! What a special treat!My only critique is that they have to do much better in managing volume to enter. I purchased my entry tickets on-line, then still had to line-up with everyone else to pick-up my physical ticket!!! The on-line purchase saved me nothing!Oceanario Management!!!! - When the voucher comes to my mobile from an on-line purchase, that should be good to proceed straight to the entry gate, not to have to line-up with everyone else purchasing on-site!!! It's 2016 - already!!!

Not bad, not great. . Seen a lot of aquariums, this is not bad but not great either. It's a bit dated, but clean and educational. Fish look healthy and the views into the main tank as you walk round are excellent. The large sunfish is the main attraction. Worth the money, and the main tank is really good.The area around the aquarium is good for a stroll and there are plenty bars/cafes. Buy tickets online in advance to skip q. The temp display they have on just now (June 2016) is fantastic!! Well worth taking time to sit and enjoy it.

Excellent for a rainy day in Lisbon . On the rare occasions that the weather calls for an indoor activity, the oceanarium is the perfect place to spend 3- 4 hours and keep children entertained. Would recommend buying tickets online to avoid the queues.
Aquarium. Beautiful and interesting facility. Good gift shop. Afterwards went on the adjoining cable car. Fun experience. A little out of town. Had to take cab.

Absolutely loved it. I'm a bit biased in that I love every single aquarium I go into.This one is fantastic. The whole thing circles around a giant tank on two floors. On the top floor, you see inside the aquarium near the top, and around it, are above-ground type exhibits, like the puffins, penguins and otters. We were lucky enough to catch the otters at feeding time and watched the two of them gobble up a giant pail of fish and mussels. I think they may mostly hide otherwise. On the bottom ring, you see much farther below the surface of the big tank as well as a whole bunch of other exhibits, like jellyfish, crustaceans and other creatures in smaller tanks. We went on an early Monday afternoon, between school groups so it was very quiet. Highly recommend doing this is if you can.

Huge, varied aquarium. The most amazing aquarium I have ever seen. The fact that there were aquariums of different seas made it most interesting. Only negative poiunt: the birds in the polar aqarium kept on hitting in the wall. They are not made to live in an enclosed space...

Well made . The Oceanarium is really amazing, a lot of species with nice atmosphere. They did a good job with lights and the whole walk has a good plan to see a lot. One advice: take care about the temperature difference, it can be cold inside after the summer weather outside.

Wonderful aquarium!. Huge aquarium with loads of different types of marine species. Whilst it's great to get up close to all the fish and other sea life (even otters!), the aquariums message is also applaudable - focused on sustainable development and respecting the world we live in. A fun day out and great value compared to aquariums in Britain.

Not worth visiting if you have ever been to the Georgia Aquarium. Lisbon Oceanarium is a fine aquarium. But if you have ever been to the Georgia Aquarium in Atlanta, then definitely skip this attraction in Lisbon. If you have a limited amount of time in Lisbon, I would skip this attraction as well because it is rather far from Lisbon’s historic center.

fantastic attraction. Despite not being mentioned by our cruise conpany we went along via a short taxi ride from the taxi rank opposite the port.It was great value for money and the exhibits were brilliant. If uou like sharks you will love this wont say more to spoil it . You must visit here !!

Ocean's Heaven!. For all of you animal lovers and marine biology enthusiasts out there, you'll absolutely love this place.Being Europe's largest aquarium/oceanarium, its main tank is quite impressive. First of all, it is huge to say the least. You can view it from all sides and on both the upper and lower levels. I'm not quite savvy on the nomenclature of marine life but the tank had many varieties of sharks, stingrays, manta rays and fish.At the same time, you get to visit different areas of the oceanarium, each representing different oceans and climates.Everybody was amused with the otters, gently swimming of their backs and rubbing their eyes and whiskers with their front "paws".Another area we enjoyed is the dimly-lit section where you can observe the jellyfish. They practically glow in their tanks.We also saw many other creatures we never knew existed.If you're visiting Portugal for the first time, you're probably not thinking if visiting an aquarium. But I highly recommend you include it in your travel plans, as you can also visit the neighboring Parque das Naçoes (Nations Park), site of the 1998 world expo. A most modern area of Lisbon, in terms of architecture. It's located close to the airport so you can easily go after arriving or before departing LIS.

"Don't miss out, a MUST VISIT whilst you are in Lisbon!!!". We went there on a cloudy day.Info mentioned that the aquarium is world's second biggest.The size of the aquarium is mind boggling. The only way of experiencing deep-sea life is this next to diving or documentaries. The building is created around the aquarium and gives you views from so many different angles that each time you look you discover new species and views. The exhibition itself is well setup aswell. Don't miss out, a MUST VISIT whilst you are in Lisbon!!!
Aquarium. A good day trip when your over castles and shopping. The aquarium is very well presented. Great for kids of all ages. Surrounding parklands nice with water views.
Huge fishes. I really enjoyed that, but thought it would be more aquarium. The center aquarium was fascinating! I was amazed the size of fishes!

Worthy Number One. A good walk and not well sign-posted from Oriente metro station, this is an impressive construction with what is probably the largest single aquarium in the world – with lots of fish, as well as penguins, and (my favourites) sea otters. The entry charge is 17.00 Euros. If we went again we would probably use the cable car rather than walk. Overall enjoyable and impressive. I think only the similar attractions in Barcelona and on Singapore’s Sentosa Island are better.
Great Aquarium. Very well laid out. fun time. allow about 2 hrs. great diversion from touring Lisbon.modern new part of Lisbon . Easy trip by Metro
A visit to the ocean. A must go for all ages. For those who never visit it I stongly recommend it. The ocean is waiting for you!

Nice Ocenarium - worth a visit . The Lisbon Ocenarium is definitely worth a visit. We went in the middle of the day on a weekday, and getting tickets took no more than 2 minutes - if you go on a weekend, but them online up front!The inside is well organised with different regions of the oceans represented in the 4 corners of the Ocenarium, with s huge pool in the middle which you can refer to throughout your visit. The facility is designed as a "one-way" system which ensures smooth logistics while inside. The building and exhibits are well maintained, and offer great views of the different species. Only small drawback is the cafeteria, which really is a cafeteria, but it does offer a "meal of the day" for less than €8 which will keep you going till the evening.

One of the best in the world!. I really like oceanariums / aquariums, and I visit them in each destination where I travel. This is for sure one of the best ones, providing a complete experience to the visitor!

Great Aquarium. . This is a great attraction in the Parque du Nacional area of lisbon. This area was developed for the 1998 worlds fair (I believe that was the year). There is a ton of shopping and restaurants, and the beautiful Vasco de Gama bridge and mall. The aquarium itself is a really cool concept with all of the tanks being connected by the one central tank. It can easily be viewed in about 3 hours and the price is reasonable at 14€. Don't bother paying the extra 3€ for the temporary exhibit it was not worth it. It is an easy subway ride from almost anywhere. Take the red line and get off at the Orient station. The aquarium is only a short walk from there.
Great place. Great day out but a little bit on the expensive side with temporary exhibition cost entry was €17 each. Loads of species to see and is well worth a visit .

Great experience for all ages. Both my kids and I enjoyed coming here. The vast amount of variety on display here truly is fascinating and interesting.The path throw the Oceanarium is split up into the different oceans and climates seen throw out the world and you can actually feel the temperature and humidity change as you pass throw the different areas which ads to the whole experience. I would recommend visiting this place for the whole family.
Great for kids. Perfect choice to take the kids, they can see sharks :) a lot of other species from the ocean, interesting place indeed.

One of Top 5 places to visit in Lisbon!. It's n amazing experience, with or without kids. Along with the magnificent views, it has summarized information about the species and it's environments, witch gives you a real tour around the world's most impressive marine species. I liked also the temporary exhibition concerning the underwater forests, by Takashi Amano a very well known Japanese acquascaper.
Ok, but not great. That might be fun for a family, but find this oceanarium a bit expensive for what you get.It is not a waste of time, but I don't get why this is a top attraction in Lisbon.

Nice but not impressive. In general everything is good. especially for children who never visited such places. but our expectations were higher than reality. in frames of design, entertainment, variety etc.
Spend time with kids and adults. Lisbon oceanarium is one of the most fantastic place to visit in Europe, if you like biology, if you want to learn and teach something about the Cycle of the Oceans.

Beautiful journey into ocean life. The Lisbon Oceanarium is my favourite place in Lisbon. It is a perfect option for people travelling alone and with families - if you are single traveller I can guarantee that you will spend there hours watching sharks passing by, with no notion of passing time. Children will fall in love with colourful fish and exhibitions, I think especially with litle pinguins. reember to buy some small thing in the ocenanarium shop when leaving, the money go for maintaining the aquarium :) Definitly book at least 2-3 hours.

Good day Temporary exhibit not worth extra. Great day for all the family, enjoyed by all. Plenty to see and we were there at feeding time. It is quite far outside city so a taxi or bus required which adds to cost.

Superb lighting. The team that idealized this Oceanarium was really inspired. Even IF they didn't have an amazing collection of fish / animals, it would be worth it.The main tank stands at the center of the Oceanarium so that you can keep coming back to it.The sounds that are playing while you walk around the place really help with creating a wonderful ambiance.And most of all, people who designed the light are geniuses! The atmosphere because of it is magical and even ugly fish get to look good!I was truly impressed and visited twice!;)

Amazing place for big and little children. Me and the children loved the place. Came not expecting much but was amazed at how peaceful and beutiful the place was. The price for the family was very reasonable.

Great to see all the animals, but a little bit expensive. It was a great two hour exerience walking through all the tanks and seeing all the fish, but I do think it is a little bit overprised for what you get. I paid 17 euros
Brilliant!. Loved this Oceanarium. So much to see and do there. It is at the site of the old world exhibition. Highly recommend!
Beautifully kept.. Really fascinating. Loved seeing the massive tank with all the big fish together. The sun fish are amazing and odd looking. We have never seen them before.
Ocenarium visit. The fishes and sharks were some of the biggest as I had ever seen. There were so many species that I almost lost my track inside the oceanarium marvelling at the view.

Хорошее место для посещения. Wished it visit it long ago, so planned our trip in advance and purchased the tickets online. Saved around 10% of full price. It is not gorgeous, but really a place worth visiting in Lisbon. Only 4 of 5 for quite small number of fish, but very good anyway.
Free the Sea Creatures. Enough with the small confined spaces. The otters and the penguins were so painful to watch. I don't understand the pleasure in seeing such beautiful creatures in a prison.
Nice! . The exhibition was nice and worth the price. There are a lot of special fish. The penguins and otters are also very nice. They did a good job in duplicating the biosferes of the animals.
Nice place!. A place to visit while in Lisbon. Great for all ages. I recommend to go there with cable car so you have view on the river.
Worth a visit. This site is predominantly one huge tank which you will around. There are other smaller tanks. Majority of the labels are also in English which was helpful.

One of my favorites in the world!. Whenever in Lisbon I visit the Oceanário. Besides being in an area very different from the historical center, very well structured, which gives the visitor another perspective of the city, it is very well organized, it was beautifully conceived. It is guaranteed enchantment for children and adults. There are several interesting educational initiatives + interactive activities for the little ones, which are fun for adults too.
Lovely visit. Nice place value for money good for kids and adults loved the permanent part. Very relaxing good atmosphere Highly recommend

An outstanding aquarium. I love to visit aquariums and this one is truly brilliant! The giant tanks are just amazing and give you a clear view of all the fish. The aquarium was slightly expenses at 19 euros, however it is worth a visit. There is a good café on site and it is a good place to sit and eat after the aquarium! Overall l would highly recommend visiting here while in Lisbon.
Worth Doing. If you like marine life this site is worth doing. Not as elaborate as some other sites but it was enjoyable, especially if you like penguins!
A very nice aquarium. A very nice aquarium. The central tank was the star and you can view it from many different angles on both level. It was interesting to see some feeding going on in the tank.

Magnificent experience of underwater willd life fans!. I think I spent at least 2-3 hours sitting on the floor by the glass wall of the biggest tank at this oceanarium. Absolutely fascinating. Recommend it to all underwater wild life lovers.Enjoy!

Deserved highlight. I always like aquariums, but this one is well-built and interesting, with a range of smaller exihibits and fishes in addition to the enormous central tank that is a major attraction.

Good fun in Lisbon. Great way to spend an afternoon. The structure of the exhibits allowed pleasant viewing of the sea life and the division of the exhibits into different ecosystems was enlightening.

Fun and fascinating. Fun and fascinating place. The giant tank is incredible, smaller ones are really fun, especially searching and discovering animals in them. The area with the penguins and water birds is also a lovely experience. Mind your heads! Educational, interesting. We enjoyed it a lot
Overrated and expensive. Aquariums are super well kept but its kinda expensive and not really worth the visit when in Lisbon for only a couple of days.

Interesting. We had a very interesting experience at the Oceanarium. It is also a good idea to take children. Besides the fish you can also see pinguins, the most amazing otters and a very large octopus. It's worth to check it out!

A fascinating experience. This aquarium is really worth visiting. Its giant tank will keep you mesmerised for hours, while the smaller themed areas around it will tell you more about the different seas and oceans and their inhabitants. We enjoyed it a lot.

Amazing Oceanarium. Don't miss it, its wonderful, well organized. A great place to spend at least 4 hours. Its so big its not crowded. Take your time, take lots of photos, enjoy the sharks, mantas, penguins and many rare species.

Fabulous oceanarium. This was recommended by a friend and we all enjoyed it, even the usually recalcitrant teenagers. Very peaceful atmosphere and seeing the large tank all the time was great. Information in English for anglophone monoglots helped as well. A great experience and educational too.

Fab-u-lous . I am a huge aquarium fan, if such a thing exists and this is one of the best. This and the Monterey one are the best yet. It is the first time I had seen otters and penguins up this close. The whole park it is set in is really worth a visit too.
Excellent. One of the very best places and must see for all ages. Restaurants food is also good. The oceanarium itself is very well preserved and looked after. Must must visit.

Okay. An all round okay experience, thought there would be more too it than what there is but maybe London Aquarium is hard to compete with. Would of been nice to see a few more different types of creatures.

Nice place to be.. Good place to visit.Big amount of sea live examples.Good for children and adults.It is interested how much money people spend to make big aquarium with animals witch one at least become they food.
Worth of. I am only sad that I did not visited it with my kids. It is very nice, and all focused of how big impact human has on nature and specially ocean life.
Great exhibit. We have been to aquariums around the world, although this one is not large, the exhibits here are well done with a nice variety. Great for families.

Finding nemo ;):). It is for sure one of the best places I've been in Lisbon. Breathtaking experience of watching the extraordinary daily life of fishes under the oceans ... Highly recommended!
Don't forget to bring your student card for discounts ;)

Not impressive enough. The main exhibit is not as big as I though it would be. The species of sea animals are very limited. But some of they were really pretty. They have a special children's place that is good for kids younger than 5. It would be worth it if you go with one of more kids under the age of five.

A must do!!!!!. Difficult to understand a visit to Lisbon without beeing at Oceanario de Lisboa. Opened in 1988 at World Expo occasion since then turned to be one of the top atractions in the now called Nations Park. Very well designed visit for adults and mainly for school children shows the natural Habitat within the different oceans.
