Children may even stay overnight through a programm named " Sleep with the Sharks". Very popular among locals, usualy ionserted on a Birthday party. On peak visit hours could experience some delays.

Brilliant! The sun fish, otters and dragon fish were a highlight. . We enjoyed the oceanarium greatly. The whole thing is easily done in an hour or so too, so you don't miss too much sunshine. It's definitely worth making time for.A trip on a cable car (which is right outside the oceanarium exit) along the sea front afterwards made for a happy afternoon!

Exciting, but.... The best aspect of this sea-zoo is a video investigating on the management of a huge number of sea species living together: feeding and caring, above all. Apart from that, fish live in captivity for an expensive live show, as everywhere in all continents. You might reach the same educational intent through a short scientific movie.

Second best Aquarium in Europe. It is the second best Aquarium in Europe and we know why ! Made on the site of the 1998 universal exhibition spot, big big big, not to busy in May and that is very good.
Awesome. REally good. Amazing colours. No need for audio guide. cool. . must do. Very well presented. A good 3-4 hours needed.

A big hit!. Go early and park in one of many below ground car parks nearby -Don't pick the ones near the shops go down towards the myriad hotel and drive along the street there. We bought tickets online and went straight in. If you like aquariums you can spend a lot of time here. Even a quick visit will take a couple of hours. We spent three hrs but decided to have lunch nearby and go shopping to the nearby mall afterwards.

Love this place, simply the best. Fish are friends not food!This oceanariums is simply impressive. There are currently expanding this and I hope they continue. Very well structured and thought out layout. Impressive collection of species and very entertaining. Could spend all day in here. Give yourself at least 2 hours to take a leisurely walk through if you can.It's worth seeing the exhibition that they have on, very impressive even if it's only half done.
Well concept and attractive display . Very interesting display and carefully structured . Special exhivision also interesting . Only issue is bit away and takes time to go
If you saw one you saw them all. again, like that in Atlanta, that in Boston and that in Dubai. Forgive be Lisbon but I could not find much difference!

Good aquarium . I found this great and really good displays one of the best I've seen however note they get lots of schools and tour groups. What this means is children and loins children. Might be best to try going a weekend day early rather than during the week early. However aside from this a great way to spend half a day.

Must see!!!. It cost €17.00 per adult to get in but its worth it. For someone like me who is cannot do scuba diving this is the closest i can get in experience the water world. Its fascinating and breathtaking. Children will definitely enjoy it. They offer "sleeping with the sharks" where i believe children have a sleepover in one of the area (supervised of course) and watch the sea creatures at night.

Great way to spend a few hours with the kids. The sea otters are the stars of the show, closely followed by the sun fish, which are like nothing you have ever seen, very impressive range of exhibits. Beautifully laid out and presented, would recommend.

Just Ok. This is advertised as one of the most impressive aquariums in Europe, but to be honest I found it average. It was clean and easy to walk around, but I was not impressed by the variety of sealife I saw.

Unforgettable Experience. Inside the oceanarium, you feel like you are in a different world with the fishes and the other water creatures that you would never have seen in your lifetime. It is indeed worth visiting this place while you are in Lisbon.

Unforgettable Experience. Inside the oceanarium, you feel like you are in a different world with the fishes and the other water creatures that you would never have seen in your lifetime. It is indeed worth visiting this place while you are in Lisbon.

Great aquarium themed around the four oceans. This is a fairly large aquarium with a range of sealife from around the world. It's open until 8pm and we went past 5 - which I think was a good decision as we missed all the school groups and coach tours.

Fun!. The layout of the aquarium is easy to follow. It was so fun to see Sunfish in the large tank. We enjoyed the puffin/otter habitat. There was a penguin perched on the ledge and was comfortable around people, we got really close to it. We enjoyed a good lunch along with a glass of wine.

I don´t really like acquariums.... ... but I have to say that this one really catched my interest. It´s small, but it worth the ticket. Sea otters, the Antartica section and the central tank took my heart. The temporary exibition with the masterpiece of Takeshi Amano is breath taking and unforgettable. Totally worth visiting.

MUST SEE. One of the highlites of our trip. Stunning! Amazing! No words to describe the beauty of the tanks and the sea creatures. From the fish to the penquins to the adorable otters....a must visit for all ages. You will not be disappointed. 😊😊😊🐳🐋🐟🐙🐡🐬🐠
Nice big fish in a nice tank. A nice big tank with cool fish! The moonfish is impressive, and so are the sharks. A nice setup and a lot of beautiful fish and penguins.

Beautiful place. Best and most informative aquarium I've been too, animals all well kept, the extra exhibition from a japanese artist for 3 euros was worth it too
Busy but what can you expect. Location is good too - on the coast, can take cable cars which is fun.
Worth a visit. Tried this place on my last day in Lisbon. It is quite far off from the central places but its a good couple of hours spent. Apparently it is the largest aquarium in Europe.
Fabulous. Brilliant. Well worth the visit. Absolutely fascinating. So well put together and thought out and the number of different species is incredible.

Don't miss it.... Children absolutely love to come here. Great variety of species, a lot of information. I live in Lisboa and I never ever get tired of visiting the Oceanarium...thats how great it is :)
Very good. Well worth a visit, not an all day experience but very good and when you've finished take a trip on the cable car outside!!

One of the flagships for the 1998 Universal Expo. The 1889 Universal Expo in Paris brought to Paris what was supposed to be a temporary construction, the Eiffel tower which of course not only remained but is probably on of the most visited monument in a Capital City worldwide. Well Lisbon did not fare too badly, the 1998 expo left behind a plethora of beautiful creations and this is a major one and not to be missed when visited this wonderful city. This Oceanarium is one of the largest in the world and one of the most impressive I have seen in Europe. It easily dwarves the London Aquarium and it is also far less expensive.

Amazing!. Perfect place to spend a few hours. Our 8 and 9 yr olds were spellbound as were we. Plenty to see, could've spent hours just in front of the massive tank containing sharks, sun fish, penguins, rays and much more.

Easy to spend hours here. I stopped off here to kill time between the airport and hotel check in and it was well worth the visit. The big attraction is the huge central tank (actually a few tanks invisibly divided) with its stock of shark, moonfish, sting rays and many other fish. But the smaller tanks around the outer perimeter also contain many interesting specimens, in particular the Sea Dragons

A look under the surface.. Mid week in May the area around the oceanarium is pretty deserted but judging from the infrastructure when the weather warms up, it gets busy. Kids would like the giant sea animals "drawn" on the plaza with the black and white stone paving typical of Lisbon..We like these giant aquariums and accept that the format is pretty standard. This one is at the better end of the spectrum. Inside there was plenty of English information available. The central tank had a varied selection of viewing points, some with seating, some very small . There was the opportunity to watch a film about conservation half way round. The sharks and rays are always interesting, but there was a good variety of other fish to enjoy too. The penguins had a large enclose to themselves. The otters had there own pool. We may have missed it but we didn't see an underwater viewing point for the otters. I always like the sea horses and sea dragons. Hard to believe they are real.All the kids there seemed to be having a good time.Took us about 2 hours to go round but no one hurried us and we could have spent longer. We bought tickets on line before going so we didn't have to queue. The weather was cool and cloudy that day so it was a good place to spend our time.

Some UGLY fish out there which is why they are under the sea......... Well this was a great day out, an amazing array of ocean life from all bends of the ocean. Definitely recommend a visit.It is easy to navigate and to get around. We were fortunate as we went on a Friday in May and it was relatively quiet - i would imagine it not being easy to get to the tanks for a good view if it was busy.We paid to see the temporary exhibition - i wasn't overly Impressed and would have been happy with just visiting the permanent displays. I did think the area for some birds wasn't very big but some amazing sights and colours to see and I am not a massive animal lover but the otters were cool! some very good facts and quite an eye opener on the species and oceans. Well worth a visit.
Wonderful experience. Huge aquarium. The variety of species is amazing. Very detailed information. Includes birds like penguins and mammals like otters. Children definitely love it!

Interesting and educational. This a great place to spend a couple of hours out of the sun and is bigger than it looks from the outside. There's a wide variety of marine life and good descriptions in English.
Nice. Nice place to vist with family of friends. A lot of fish and a lot of people in the summer... always full

Lisbon Oceanarium. Brilliant day out for all ages especially on a wet or too hot a day, so much to see and discover obout the undersea world. Tip get there early as possible so much to experience layout and viewing galleries are superb enjoy.
Nice place. Nice Place to visit. Likes Places like this and this is among the best i have visited. And its not just for rainy days. :-)

Great time. Lovely place worthy going. Recommend to take Grayline hop on and hop off bus tour - they probably have the best frequency to drop and pick up visitors for this route(since it's off city center).

Outstanding Experience. Very Special. The Oceanarium is world class. Allow yourself a minimum of 2 to 3 hours to visit. There are both large and small displays. A huge tank that can be viewed from many angles. Enjoy the flocking sea otters and the penguin exhibits. My favourite was the fresh water tank ( the largest in the world) designed by Takashi Amano with a multitude of different environmental settings. This Oceanarium is one of best experiences as a tourist that I ever encountered. A true delight for the senses. Pure enjoyment. Have fun.

Not only fantastic sights, but also sounds form the deeo.. We have been to several aquaria in the U.S but have never enjoyed and experienced the breadth and depth of what we saw and heard in Lisbon, The Oceanarium displayed multiple environments from tropical to Antarctic with a superb selection of sea creatures - everything from magnificent anemones and fluorescent medusae to rays and eels. Penguins strutted, amphibians preened, There was also a station where you could hear the sounds of whales and porposes. Everything was presented to all age levels, with an significant discussion re environmental concerns, current practices and future hopes.
Mind blowing. Lovely Amazing beautiful it was the most amazing thing I have ever seen beautiful scenery lovely conditions (by my 10 year old niece Eve)

Well worth a visit. The Oceanariums was pretty spectacular and well worth the visit. One main large pool you can get real close to to see a whole range of some 100 different species of different species, four specialist areas depicting the Antarctic, Pacific, Atlantic and Tropical India.Plus many small tanks of just about everythingLives up to its quote of "best acquiring in the world".Kids and adults alike will love itGood value as well as you'll probably spend a few hours in there

Fun day out. Visited during summer months. Great way to spend a few hours and very easy to get to, we used the metro. Highly enjoyed all the different sharks and the variety of fish and colour in the tanks. Lovely way to pass an evening and nearby to large shopping centre also

Fantastic and lovingly designed. Very beautiful Oceanarium which is lovingly designed for the sea animals ! The restaurant is very good for families who want to eat a "day menu"! Very friendly staff. (only one little thing: the octopus needs a bigger aquarium).
Super . Super for kids and adults! There are many species of fish from all over the world. Must see if you are il Lisbon with family.

Better than I thought. The main tank is absolutely amazing. It's bigger and better than I thought it would be and some of the displays are fascinating and breathtaking at the same time. Without wishing to contradict myself, it'll still only take you an hour and a half to go round.

Breath the seas. In one hand this is oceanarium like others but every one is still bit different. I like how it was divided to different oceans, also the fact there was quite lot of environmental information.

A must do experience. I have been to the oceanarium in Sydney and Chicago and this stands its ground with these two greats. It isn't huge but what it lacks in size it makes up for in atmosphere. I loved the embracing experience it offers and left feeling as if I had been totally emerged in the ocean and will definitely go back if I am ever in Lisbon again.
Good. Is a good way to spend a couple of hours but I think they don't have to much to show to come from other country and go to the acuarium, very nice for locals.

Really fun and impressive. We had a great time at the aquarium. It is really impressive and well done. We went without our children, but it would be an excellent location to take children. The two level tank was absolutely fascinating. This is definitely a must-see in Lisbon

Good, but not as big as expected. We went here on Saturday morning and there were a lot of people, making it hard to look at aquariums when you have 10 to 20 people standing in front of them. Try to avoid busy periods like the weekend.Overall, it was ok. As a comparison, I was at Kelly Tarlton's Aquarium in New Zealand and felt that this one in Lisbon was not as good as that one.The selection of animals was good and interesting.We went to the restaurant afterwards, but the food wasn't really that tasty, you are probably better of going to another restaurant nearby.Also, I went to purchase tickets on the machine, waited in line for 5-10 minutes, but it only offered the permanent+temporary exhibition, but we only wanted the permanent exhibition, which is 3EUR cheaper per person, but this option was not available on the machine and had to go and stand in line for the ticket from the ticket counter. I don't think that it's right to force people to have to buy the more expensive ticket if they go to the ticket machine.

Brilliant layout. The best thing about the aquarium is its layout. It's very easy to follow the route and understand the exhibits. The central large tank represents the 'one ocean' and various zones replicate the different climates and oceans, it really puts the planet in to perspective.The main tanks are very deep, I did feel that the otters although very playful and happy, could do with a bit more space.It was very busy however and often we just missed looking in some tanks because the crowds were enormous with at least 3/4 large school groups in a small space. Perhaps go early to beat the crowds

One of the greatest aquariums I've ever seen.. Great experience (I only visited the permanent exhibit) - Great tank with multiple views on rich collection. Lots of smaller exhibits with great views. Worth the visit.

Great way to spend an afternoon.. We were supposed to be walking around Lisbon but it was too hot, so we opted to go into Oceanarium, and are we ever glad we did. What an amazing display. From all the beautiful marine life to the penguins and sea otters. It was magnificent. You have to go!! Very well done!

World class. For those who enjoy aquariums (aquaria, for the Latin-trained), this is a good one, worth a visit. My wife & I have visited aquariums all over mainland US (including Monterrey, Atlanta, Boston, Minneapolis), Hawaii, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, and this one is among the best.
Nice and Cool. Nice and Cool! Just reserve a few minutes to sit in the main room in front of the aquarium and look the animals! It´s nice!
Very good! . The place is not that big but the video they show you is very informative and useful, it shows how the ticket price is used. We loved the sea otter!

Amazing Underwaterworld. Absolutely a must-visit when you are in Lisbon! The building itself is remarkable, but inside is just amazing. It is the second biggest aquarium in the world so it is really worth a visit.

Go for the Sea life, enjoy the architecture . Was pleasantly surprised by this place. It's supposedly the 2nd largest in the world but I have my doubts. Saw the largest Ocean Sunfish I've seen as well as the amazing temporary exhibit by Takashi Amano. Definitely worth a visit

Great viewing of interesting ocean life!. Great way to spend an afternoon. We saw fish that we had never seen before. The central aquarium gives an up close view from many different directions. Gave interesting facts about all viewable species.

Worth it for the sea otters!. The aquarium is similar in many ways to the one in London which we have been to a few times so we knew what to expect. However, in Lisbon there is a pair of sea otters who are so ridiculously cute I could have watched them all day. Also, the penguins here look a bit happier than the ones in London who always seem a bit sad to me. There is also a display area for little kids about our use of water which our boy loved (there are TV screens, need I say more?). There was a long queue for tickets on the Saturday we went but it moved quickly and wasn't a problem.

As good as the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Excellent aquarium - very beautiful and educational. Worth seeing if you are in Lisbon! It really enforces the need for us to eat sustainably caught seafood and for us to understand the plight of global warming. Great for all ages.

Interesting and well worth a visit. The huge central aquarium dominates and one has plenty of opportunity to view it from various vantages points as one travels through the aquarium plenty to see to keep all members of the family interested including penguins, sharks and spectacular sun fish!

Feels like going underwater.. Awesome experience, a lot of (sea and not only) creatures that I have never seen before, together with feeling and hearing the underwater. The main tank is like a small ocean, where diverse species live together in a perfect ecosystem, it is incredible.

gourgeous. A MUST GO place in Lisboa. Is far from downtown, but the cab costs like 10 to 12 euros. Very affordable. It's amazing. In a great ocean place where you can spend the day. Close to a mall of great restaurants. Specially if you have kids.

Fantastic aquarium. Enjoyed a few hours at the Lisbon Oceanarium great value for money . So much to see Sharks Rays and Giant Sun fish. My favourite were the Sea Otters luckily we arrived just as they were being fed. Lots to see for children as well as adults. We have visited the aquarium in Monteray many years ago it compares well. Worth a visit a short walk from the metro .

Very impressive. We visited the Oceanarium during an unseasonal wet spell in Lisbon. The main tank is huge, and it is interesting how the various species have occupied certain areas of it. The tank can be viewed on 2 different levels and has a number of viewing panels looking into mock caves and reefs.I personally thought that some of the separate tanks and exhibitions were a little small for their occupants, but the overall experience was a positive one.
i am a sea otter. it was raining so went with the wife and in-laws to the oceanarium......sea otters cute, puffins amazing, under water Japanese garden breath taking..... a must if you are in Lisbon

A bit far from the city--but hop on a cab and go anyway 😊. We visited the aquarium on Saturday afternoon and it was great! There's a way you can get tickets online with your phone and you just have to show them the barcode on their and they can scan it just fine.There are items to read in English and their cafeteria was good--and yes there is beer and wine.Clean bathrooms and children everywhere! I thought it very lovely: for families, for couples and for friendsGo visit! And get your ticket online! The URL to do so is there--just have your credit card ready or your PayPal information.

The best aquarium i have ever visited. Lisbon Ocenario ia surely the best aquarium i have ever visited. I've been in Ocenario in may 2016 when i was on a city break in Lisbon with my girlfriend. Admission to the Ocenario was 17€ but it was worth every cent. The central aquarium is two story high and has sharks, sunfish, baracudas and some other big fish. Sea ofters and pengiuns in the arctic sections are very interesting and fun to watch. Ocenario is also very good place to bring children as it's own superhero Vasco and the section for kids.
Excellent Aquarium. I enjoyed a quick visit to the aquarium on a Saturday morning. It's simply fantastic. Come early on order to avoid the crowds.

Somewhat expensive but enjoyable. 17e per adult includes also temporary exhibition. At May 2016 that was some Japanese guy small exhibition about earth. Took about 2min to go trough it so not worth of extra payment. The main thing itself took about 2h to go trough with very slow pace and many photos included.
Great for kids. Took my granddaughter here. Wide variety of sealife, €17 adult, 0-3 free. She loved it. Also miniature penguins, otters, birds

unusual Sunfish. The new Oceanarium is really a hit, the way it is build gives plenty of different viewpoints of the large central tanks which contains two sunfish, which are most fascinating. The outlying tanks are representing different climate zones, and some fish and also the birds can freely pass through. The Antarctica display comes complete with mini-glacier. There are multicoloured jellyfish, seadragons and plenty of more unusual fish from the oceans. Although there were plenty of visitors it didn't feel claustrophobic and everybody observed the No Flash policy which was also a first as there are always some people who think it doesn't matter.
Day Trip. This aquarium visit is on a par with the Monterey, CA, aquarium. It was crowded with school children visitation.

Fantastic. This place makes Rhyl Sea Life Centre look like your garden pond. Book online and get the ticket straight to your phone, it meant no queues at all for us. The attraction is well layed out and we both thoroughly enjoyed our visit - a must if you are visiting Lisbon. The range of creatures on show is truly fascinating. The surrounding area is also a nice place to visit.

Very well executed underwater feast. This is one of the best marine life exhibitions I have ever been to. The main tank is superbly accessible from multiple angles - no shuffling through a little tunnel to glimpse the sharks and rays here - and contains some fairly unique fish as well. We especially liked the sandfish and sunfish which looked so happy to be swimming freely!The side exhibits from the various oceans were also incredible, including a playful pair of sea otters that were the highlight of the trip.I wasn't amazed by the temporary exhibit as a non-art-lover but it did seem well done.It may seem odd to head indoors when Lisbon has a lot to offer in the centre, but in this case do make the exception!
Excellent. Really nice place to watch the ocean with millions of aquatic species! You can take the family and have a wonderful day there. It's educational for the kids!

Really astonishing!. We went there because the weather slightly changed during the day and it began to rain. We already knew about the price of 17€, and there were no discounts offered for students or else. But in the end I can say that the money was definitely worth it, there is 1 main aquarium with big fish like sharks, a moon fish (which I've never seen before, and it was really amazing to see one there) and so on. And then on the upper floor (there are 2) there are 4 seperate areas all dedicated to a different climatic zone. For example there is an arctic zone where u can see penguins or there is a tropical zone with a small forest. And on the lower level u can see the fish of all those areas and also a few other aquariums. All in all a really nice and memorable experience!

an amazing and UNIQUE place to spend time especially with kids. here you have several flavours (from educational to recreative)to invest in an amazing time, especially for the young children where they will see live sea animals that are impossible or at least very difficult to be seen elsewhere.

Great attraction for kids and adults!. We are a family of 4 with 2 little kids and have visited recently the Oceanarium. I would say that it was a great and itneresting experience for all of us (the kids got tired at the end though). A lot of species and short info - without being boring for non-specialists, nice ambience, huge aquarium with various fishes in the middle which could be seen all the time during the tour from different angles. It is not cheap but would recommend it!

Central tank is amazing...... The building and setting for this aquarium (touted as Europe's largest) is wonderful - a modern building on the banks of the Tejo. The central tank is wonderful, and you get some great views as you follow the prescribed path. There are also some smaller side exhibits with penguins, otters, amphibians, and some smaller types of sea critters. The crowds can be pretty overwhelming, but go later in the day and it's a bit better. Well worth the time if you like aquariums.

Aquarium visit. A good experience for all visted Lisbon and decided on a visit to the Aquarium spent over 3 hours in here alot to see with alot of eduction there too would recommend to adults as well as children great experience
Blub blub. A travel around the world in a few hours. Take your time so look around while it's not huge. Sit down and relax to see all the different species swim around.

The Oceanarium was OK. The concept of the place--that all the world's oceans are interconnected--is interesting and well planned. Just found it all to be somewhat underwhelming. Other than the ginormous tank that is seen from every floor and at every angle, there was nothing unique for me. Worth the hour visit IF you've seen all the other unique things Lisbon has to offer.
Been before, second trip, fantastic. Well thought out and informative. We loved the journey through the oceans. Everything looks clean and the enclosures are well laid out. Worth a trip
Nice. A nice place to go with the kids, but I was expecting something different (beeing the largest in Europe). We enjoyed the penguins, the sharks and the tropical forest.
Entertaining. Can be improved, more variety of exhibits , but the only thing worth doing at Plaza de las Naciones.The rest is a huge shopping mall, which on a sunday felt like Xmas eve!
Amazing place! . This place diserved five points. Absolutely amazing! Wonderfull!!! Modern, beautiful, awsome! Go there without thinking
Awesome. Unforgettable experience. Its an amazing feeling being so near with this huge fishes. The fishtank is huge. You can take awesome pictures. Bring the kids. Very relaxing.

Worth it for the main tank alone. The Lisbon Oceanarium is centered around a big tank in the middle that has a wide selection of different fish. There's a few sharks and rays and a lot of smaller fish, some which doesn't even look like fish at all!To the sides of the main tank there's various smaller expositions, but the main reason to go there is really the big tank. They also have temporary exhibitions - the one that was on display when we were there was really beautiful. If it had more to offer i would have rated it higher, but it is still worth a visit.
Amazing Oceanarium. Best Oceanarium in Europe!Great experience, an absolutely must for every ages, so interesting and enjoyable.

Fantastic, Great Day!. We were really impressed by this Oceanarium, set in the lovely part of New Lisbon. There's so much to see! It's better than any aquarium i've been to before. A group of 3 of us went, we all enjoyed it. Cost 17 euros each and well worth it.

Visit to Lisbon Aquarium. Brilliant experience- very well maintained- loved it!!Plenty of viewing places for the main aquarium- Sea otters were awesome- playing with ice-cubes and the penguins were adorable. Also had 'red bus' ticket so got 15% discount!!
Enjoyable but busy. The main tank is very impressive, but I think judging the right time to go is essential. very busy when I went.
Awesome!. This is one of the most beautiful aquariums I've ever visited. Perhaps of the whole of Europe! The whole area is worth while the trip.

Fabulous . The Oceanarium is a wonderful place to visit. The whole complex is designed so the sea life can move around freely. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly. It was €44 for two adults and two children under 12.
It is very clean and has a nice cafe where hot and cold food is served.
The toilets were spotless.

Beautiful!. We really enjoyed the circular lay out of the Oceanarium that allowed you to flow from one exhibit to the next, all while enjoying different views of the central tank. We appreciated the educational aspect of current environmental risks to our oceans and what that might mean for our future. It's also worth watching the film at the cinema-like area near the end. It gives great insight into the work that goes into the Oceanarium-well worth 17 euros!
Fishy experience. If you like fish in their natural environment then this is the place. The way it is set out to show the fish off is excellent I would recommend a trip.

Water world at it´s best. Visiting the oceans and experiencing this beautiful and fragile world of ours in the Oceanarium is an experience that you do nit want to miss. Definitely a "must", when visiting Lissabon.
Friends visiting Lisbon. Truly amazing aquarium. The sunfish is awesome! Great things to see, close up to the Penguins, lots of fishes, good food. A fun experience! And not that expensive!

Fun day with the family. Visited with my four year old and our baby. It was a bad weather day in Lisbon when we visited and seemed like we were there with the rest of Lisbon, long lines and big crowds. Despite this we had a fun day. All the exhibits/aquariums were interesting. We were glad we packed a lunch as the cafeteria food did not look very good (in fairness we did not try anything from the cafeteria). We took a taxi from Lisbon but having taken the subway there, would recommend taking the subway, it's very easy and the metro station (called Oriente) is very close to the Oceanarium. Overall, would highly recommend the second largest aquarium in Europe - especially if you have kids!

Not worth for what you Pay for entrance. Initially, we thought it will be amazing after visiting oceanarium in Valencia, but it has less collection and not worth for what you pay. But its worth to take a cable car ride from just opposite of oceanarium and ride for 5 min. It will cost about 5 euros round trip, but you will have amazing pictures of the longest bridge in Europe over the sea. The oceanarium is easy to access by public transport by taking Metro from Cais so sodre towards Teheiras ( Green line) and get down at Alameda and take the metro towards Aeroporto and get down at cabo ruievo. Then walk for 10 min.

Great on a wet day!. Visited on an extremely wet day in May and I can truthfully say we were very impressed. Go as early as you can as it does get very busy and on the day we went there were a lot of very excited school and nursery children. As well as the main tank there are lots of smaller ones and exhibits with penguins,puffins,seabirds and sea otters. We could have watched the otters for hours! The aquarium is really fascinating with a huge range of sea creatures and fish. Lots of viewing areas and up close and scary experiences with the sharks! Children will love it (and adults too).
Interesting! . If you are not a fan of captive animals then you will not share my view. Very informative with a huge central tank that can be viewed from all sides of the aquarium.

Best day out. This is a great excursion for any age group, young or old. The oceanarium is large and extremely clean. It's easily accessible by train for a nice day out. I would highly recommend it. Look for the largest sunfish you have ever seen.

In one word, GREAT. This place no needs a long sentences, praise stories. Even if you have a tiny interest against the ocean (sea), you should visit this place. Oceanarium deserves every coin which you spend for entrance. If you have a big time (approx. 2.5-3 hours); your pleasure get double, cause you can explore every amazing creature, thing more carefully.

a MUST for a sea lover although a bit small.. It is really like no other aquarium I've seen, they have an amazing huge tank where all the animals interact. It feels like a real, biologically diverse ocean. We were really able to appreciate the animals, never tanks where you can't find the animal. Really amazing.

Must see. This is a very interesting place to visit. The variety of fish in the aquarium is huge and there are many spots at different levels to provide you excellent views. In the open air you can see birds, pinguins etc. Also inside other small animals like frogs. During our visit there was a temporary exhibition which was spectaculair: a very large aquarium designed on a Japanese style

Beautiful sea life. If you're in Lisbon with kids, don't miss this beautiful place. My daughter, who was 8 at the time, was amazed at the opportunity of seeing a variety of marine animals she had only seen on TV or in her school books. Now, she keeps recommending this visit to her friends. Certainly unforgettable!

WOW!. No words can express my impression. Being a guy who lives deep in the continent, I have only seen such wonders in books or films before. Experiencing these fascinating creatures up close was a thrilling experience - in the most positive way. And by close, I mean a few inches, sometimes even less!You'll see all kinds of fish, clamps, crabs, sea horses, etc. of varying sizes. Some being unbelievably enormous!The building has a very clever structure. In the middle there is a huge fish-tank. You can peek inside through large windows from many sides. So don't worry if there is a crowd, just walk a few more steps and you will surely find another window.Inside you will see sharks, rays, mantas, even sun-fish which are the largest and heaviest fish in the world! (White sharks and whales count as mammals, y'know but you don't get to see them here ;) )You can find more spectecular sea-life on the corridors circling around the big fish-tank on two levels. There are species even from tropical rain forests. So you get much more then "just" the ocean.Spend a few minutes in the video room to learn about the every-day operation of the facility. It is amazing to see how much care and effort (and resources) are spent on maintaining the delicate balance of ocean life there. What they do is much more than prociding entertainment for the public. The people operating this facility deserve merit for their work in preserving oceanic life not just within the facility but also out in the ocean!On your way out you have to go through the shop - that's the only way out. :) There are some nice souvenirs there if you don't mind the hefty price.This place well deserves the first place it has earned among the the best locations to visit in Lisbon. (Though the other places are wonderful too! It is easy to fall in love with the whole city!)
Great Aquarium but.... Can't complain about the aquarium part itself...well designed, clear viewing and interesting life. But it needs more signs, some docents and more bathrooms.
Must see. I am not 100% sure, but I think this is the best in th world. Very good, very easy to walk and understand the ideas inspiring the place. The location is also very good, very inspiring.

Massive tank - all round great time.. Brilliant tank that houses many varieties of sea life that is encircled by many other tanks and even a couple of pool housing penguins and sea otters. Thoroughly good time.

Awesome Aquarium . Loved it loved it loved it. Could have watched the sea otters and penguins all day. Had a really nice layout and plenty of things to see. The price was good at 17euro for an adult but they offer a family package as well that is discounted. There are other museums in the area and a great stroll on the water. Highly recommend if you like zoos and aquariums.

A Wonderful Aquarium. This aquarium is one of the best I've been to. Entrance is about 18 euros. The central massive tank is spectacular, and I like that you can see it from many different viewpoints. The individual tanks are also fascinating. However, in a TripAdvisor survey last year, this Oceanarium was said to be better than Monterey Bay Aquarium. Sorry, but it's just not. It's great, but Monterey Bay is something else.

Great visit of 1998 world expo site!. Don't miss this exposition, it's well worth it!
It sits on the 1998 World Exposition fairgrounds along with Vasco da Gama super shopping centre linked to the awesome and futuristic train station...

Excellent - probably the best aquarium I've been to. I haven't got a huge interest in marine life but this aquarium was excellent. Huge range of exhibits, all very well presented. The 17 Euro entry fee was probably about right.

Great daytime experience!. I don't usually like zoos or animal related parks. The oceanarium took me by surprise, mostly because it gives you the feeling that animals are not caged but the other way around. It feels like people are confined behind the glass windows and being observed by the animals from the outside watery world. A good way to spend half a day, even if the weather outside isn't the best.

A Superb experience!. This was a long planned visit as we knew this Oceanarium was one of the most interesting in Europe! And wow! it did not disappoint! In places you feel you are in the water with the fish and other creatures and the way the whole place is laid out means that you constantly have something new to explore and see. A must if you have kids around the age of 3 upwards as the faces we have seen as the fish swim by are unforgettable! The price of the ticket at €14 (2015/11) was a bit steeper but the place needs to be maintained and the fish fed so it seems fair. The organisation is faultless and the long queuing to get in was not that bad. Bring your cameras and enjoy! We will definitely return with our grandchildren
Fantastic place to visit. Fantastic place to visit, much much larger on the inside to how it looks on the outside, many many sea sharks, fish and other things

One of the best aquariums I've been to. I went to the Oceanarium with my parents and husband and we all thought it was amazing. The huge central tank is spellbinding, it's easy to get stuck just watching the fish inside rather than making your way through the different exhibits.Apart from the central tank there are four smaller areas representing different climates, including the cold area with penguins.It's just so beautiful and a great way of spending time if the weather is bad outdoors. It's really easy to get to on the metro too.

Great Attraction. Really enjoyed my visit to Lisbon Oceanarium. It's a great attraction for young and old, both informative and fun. Loved the giant Sunfish, penguins and especially the sea otters at feeding time
One of the best oceanariums in Europe. Competes only with Valencia Oceanarium, yet very different. Worth a visit. The giant tank is a must. Very nice shop.

Almost like being underwater. A innovative architectural masterpiece at a beautiful location , to showcase marine life from the great oceans of our Earth.It's a long but pleasant walk to the Oceanarium from Oriente metro station -- and it was really worthwhile.I saw and learned about underwater flora and fauna -- many thing things that I would never have known, many species I would never have seen, had I not come here.Interesting shops and food choices as well.A great experience for the family.

Perfect for a rainy day.. or all days!. Definetly a must- see if you are Lucky enough to be Close by! Allthough there was quite a lot of People crowding infront of the tanks, I still found the view to be calming and relaxing. I would love to come back, but would try to avoid the busiest days.

Wonderful exibit. This is a wonderful place to visit. Children would enjoy the close up encounters viewing the different species of fish. Totally enjoyed the Penguins in their natural environment. We spent about 2 hours there walking through it all.

One of the best. This aquarium is almost certainly the best in Europe and one of the best in the world. They have a documentary explaining how they work that I suggest to do not miss. The cafeteria is reasonable.

Great family plan. Went to the Oceanarium with my 3 year old son and mu husband. Really great fun and great learning experience. The visit is around the central aquarium which is beautiful. There are loads of spots where you can just sit and stare at the fish moving around. Really breathtaking. There is a great variety of species from the large tak to the smaller ones. My kid loved it.

Beaty of underwater life - an amazing experience. The Oceanarium is an exceptional place which adults and kids must see when in Lisbon. You can discover ocean life from all areas of the world, from tiny seahorses to big squales and sea rays, sea otters and Magellan penguins, multi-colored fish and coral, and also enjoy the written explanations available. A few hours of pure delight!
definitely worth a visit!. Big aquarium + lot of smaller aquaria. Interesting and exciting for young and old. A visit takes around 1h-1h30. It is completely worth the money!

Excellent visit on a rainy day. First we didn't want to visit this Océanario, but because of bad weather we choose to do so. And afterwards we were very happy to have done so. By far the best i have ever visited.

A world-class aquarium. Huge two-storey tank with several species of sharks, huge stingrays and manta rays, plus lots much species of fish I couldn't name. But for me the highlight might be the sea otter pool - seeing them at feeding time, when the keepers give them shellfish frozen into blocks of ice to keep them stimulated, was fantastic.For me this is the European equivalent of Monterey aquarium in California.It goes without saying that it's a fantastic day trip with kids.

Worth your visit !. I have been to many oceanariums/aquariums with different sizes, but this one is amazing. Big, huge, real shark !! It just doesnt havve whale to complete the ocean here :P Not only like a exhibition of the ocean, the Lisbon Oceanarium provides knowledge, information and education to human beings on how to protect our Earth !

Underwater experience under your feet. If you're in Lisbon for more than 2 days, spend a day here and learn about the ocean life. I have been very much against aquariums and this opposition increased more with my upgoing experience as a professional diver. But this place is actually not bad. It doesn't simply give you the occasion to see and learn about some unusual fish types, besides that, it teaches you about the type of fish and the threatened marine species with significant information. The habitats of species seem quite spacious and very clean. Its atmosphere inside is very special, with a lack of light so that you only focus on the aquariums and the information written. It is one of the biggest aquariums in the world where quite much space is given to species. One thing that me and my boyfriend enjoyed the most, it was the feeding session of the sea otters where the sea otters were given an ice cube with a mussel shell inside the ice and you can observe how they use their paws and the rocks around their habitat in order to break the ice and open the mussel shell. The location of the aquarium might seem a bit outside of the center but you can easily get there and after your visit you should take the cableway and have a view of the longest bridge in Europe.

I never spent so much time in an aquarium before..... A wonderful experience in a wonderful town (although the weather was horrible at the time). In a very spacious setting somewhat south of the city centre is this modern, easily accessible, building which houses the aquarium. Centerpiece is a really huge circular basin which can be viewed 360 degrees on two floors. Of course fish are the main attraction, it also provides a 'home' for some shorebased species such a pinguins and several other birdspecies.In smaller tanks one finds the smaller fish which would probably be consumed by the sometimes huge and ferocious looking fish in the main tank.The many 'windows' allowing a view into the tank also help to distribute a large number of spectators throughout the facility. Ours was a very rainy day with many people seeking shelter in a aquatic environment (oh, irony) but we always had a very good view into the tank.Very interesting it was for us adults, fascinating it must be for kids. Shining sun or pouring rain, visit the Oceanarium, with our without your kids!

Just amazing place. We spend half a day in there. The main aquarium is HUGE! So much to see in here. Everything from aquatic garden, to penguins, sea otters and offcourse all those fishes. Sunfishes especially were just breathtaking, and sharks, and...and! There is so much to amaze you, no matter if you old, or a little child.I highly recommend, that you take your time.

Fun! Fun! Fun! For all ages. . I'm not sure who enjoyed it more, our 10 month old or us! It's outside of the tourist zone so it was calmer and bit more laid back. I fell in love with Vasco their mascot!
Lisbon . Oceanarium is smaller than I thought and i think it is too expensive (17Euro/per person) you can walk around in 30 minutes..

An interesting visit. We had a good time visiting the oceanarium, it was fascinating! Almost all the panels are translated in english, therefore, it was perfectly fine for non locals like us; plus the descriptions are neither too long or too short.It's better to keep the visit for a cloudy day as the visit is mostly indoor. We also appreciated how the visitor is sensitized to ocean life protection through the visit.
Wow!. Huge and beautiful ocenarium. If you ever wanted to see how things are going down there you must visit this place!
Excellent day out. Best aquarium we've visited, easy to get to and in a great area of LisbonOur 3 year old could have sat watching the sharks and sea otters for hours
Cool. I actually do not like such places. But how they treat animals, I was so surprised, both in the zoo and here animals live in perfect conditions. It is a pleasure to go there

Ocean life at your feet!. So amazing, I would recommended it to everyone. A lot of amazing animals, including sharks, pinguins,... Great view to the aquarium and sound effect from the ocean. Regular ticket, bought there, is 17 euros. Hard to describe it with words, you just have to see it. It has also an ecological point - every drop counts and we should all put a great effort in preserving the ocean.
good place to visit. biggest aquarium in the world some very unusual fish worth visiting needs proper sigh posting as we got lost getting there

Oceanarium Visit. Well organised with lots of different and beautiful species to see, giving you a much greater understanding and appreciation of the diversity of creatures that inhabit the worlds' oceans. Again get the Lisboa Travel card if you can as you will get discounted entry rates. The giant stingrays were simply magnificent.

Great!. Loved the temporary exhibition (May 2016), nice fish tank in the center of building, cute sea otters, penguins and so much more! I've visited this place for 3 times already and would definitely come back again!

Great place to see sealife. Great attraction in Lisbon. There you will find sealife from all over the world, specially from Mediterrean See and portuguese islands (Açores, Madeira & Cabo Verde). The central tank is really impressive.
Tip - don't go there early, you will be accompained by a very long school queu!

amazing, really well run, great for the family. kids and adults loved it, definitely worth the visit and the surrounding area is really coming on and full of nice places to sit out and eat or have a coffee.

Amazing sealife and great construction.. There's an amazing attraction in Lisbon, Portugal. The huge seawater tank shows an array of fish in all shapes and sizes. And the way they've built it all gives you many places and levels to watch it all. And in addition to those spectacular views there are a host of minor tanks showing all sorts of living creatures in the oceans. As long as you don't use flash you may take photos all you like. And the otters doing backstrokes smiling! Set aside at least a few hours if you can, you'll never regret it!
Great for kids !. Very interesting, and totally new experience.We spend one hour there, and it was nice.Eye to eye with ocean's world.

Too Much to See!. Our family of four with two young kids spent a few hours at the Oceanarium recently and I can see why so many people recommend it. The main tank - the main attraction - is huge. MANY different species of aquatic life - and many of each. The entire complex is on two floors, and the central tank can be seen from many different vantage points throughout the two floors, including at least 4 large viewing areas. There are so many displays of countless different types of fish and marine life - it's truly amazing. We spent about 3 hours at the Oceanarium - and could've easily spent more. Our kids are still young, so they actually had seen enough! But every time we turned a corner and saw another type of fish/sea creature, they were in awe again. Our youngest, who is three, just couldn't get enough of the luminescent fish. As many others have, I highly recommend a stop here - it's well worth a visit, and it truly is in a class of its own from a size perspective. Definitely worthwhile!

Wonderful place. This place is fabulous. If you love sharks etc you must go. There is a large central tank and as you go from floor to floor and area to area the tank is visible be it from a small window or large one. I would say it's probably a half day visit or a little longer depending on how busy it is and whether you like to study what's going on for a long time or not. If in Lisbon you must go. Facilities are good too and the staff are very helpful and knowledgeable.

Awesome. I've been to some wonderful aquariums (as we call them in the US), and this is certainly among the best. Not just fish, but penguins and sea otters--features not found in other great aquariums. A terrific treat for the whole family.

Save the oceans. Spectacular review of the greatest world oceans (North Atlantic, Antarctic, Pacific, Indian) from the surface till the sea ground. Building stays entirely on the Tagus River. If you have some time, I recommend watching the film of creation and maintenance of the whole complex which is surely not easy and is well scientific controlled. Oceanarium tells that they are supporting the protection of the oceans' flora and fauna, hope that it's true. It is simply super attraction and must-see in Lisbon, although one could expect more than 2 floors in the permanent exhibition. There could also be some more English books in the Oceanarium shop on the end of the visit (they are mainly in Portuguese). Recommended especially for families with kids and all nature and especially sea/ocean lovers.
Great day out. Wasn't sure what to expect from the Oceanarium but we really enjoyed it! Very informative and educational, a great day out for all ages!

The roof leaks. A very popular venue for all,however after 18 years the building is beginning to look very "tired".The roof leaks badly and when you look up you will see that the roof is covered in Algae !!!!!! also the main tank is cloudy water quality lots of "bits and pieces" in the water.The day we went Lisbon was experiencing torrential rain storms to say the least.The roof definitely needs cleaning urgently and the leaks repaired.

A New & Modern Aquarium. We spent a couple of fun hours wandering around the aquarium. Used our yellow bus tour tickets to get discount on the entrance charge. Really liked the corner tanks, especially the one with the sea otters which were very engaging.
Best aquarium ever . Amazed by the design of this aquarium and the sheer variety of species. Loved the otters and the sea dragons. A must see if you're visiting Lisbon!

Great place. I've been to lots of Aquarium's and Sea Life Centres but this one still had things I hadn't seen before. There's a huge Sun fish, giant Spider Crabs, Sharks etc. But it's not just fish, also Penguins, Puffins and Otters.

Mind blowing. This is an amzing experience.. THere are no words to describe it,,,I spent two hours there but I could have gone back again the next day..... you can look at videos of this oceanarium but they dont give you ani idea of the scale of it all . Its a must see when you go to Lisbon.
on raining day, is ok. just ok, nothing fancy about it, perfect for a raining day, on a sunny day, don't waste your time. we expected more, ok with kids I guess but not for us

Fun but small. Nicely thought out design, cool otters, smaller than expected for the admission fee. It's cool that most of the tanks are connected and a lot of the animals live together to some extent.

A must see in Lisbon. I have been to other places like Oceanarium, in other countries, and i still prefer our Oceanarium. It is not just big, it is all filled with the wonders of the sea and not just.Its cheap, its not chaotic, respects animal life, for what i could see (not an expert), its great place to take the kids, just dont upset the creatures with photos. Best moments are taken within us. And this will be a nice moment.

Rainy Day. Its was pouring during out visit to Lisbon and the ocenarium was very busy. Ive seen a lot of fishtanks - this one is one of the better ones. Queues to buy tickets long - but you can circumvent it either at the ticket machines or purchasing on line (on your cell phone instead of standing in line - also saves you about 10%). I liked the idea of a central tank where you basically watch the ocean from all levels - made for interesting viewing.
Lovely. Especially enjoyed the otters....Wonderful temporary exhibit on underwater forests.Places to sit down and watch the sea life.

Intersting Place to Visit. We took our two year old son here when on a trip to Lisbon. He loved it and we had a hard time pulling him away for the centre tank. The only thing I have to say that it was very busy. We visited on a Wednesday afternoon in May. Worth a visit for little and big kids.

At the ocean bottom. It's an impressive journey. I must confess I avoid zoos and oceanariums and there is always some internal conflict on supporting a place with confined animals. My daughter wanted to go there, so I went. The conflict is still here inside of me but I will write from another place. That place inside of me that was totally astonished with the beauty and wonder of nature.The central tank is magnificent! Sharks, moon fishs ... It's like being transported to the bottom of the ocean and still breath!The tropical area, the reptiles, the seahorses, the lovely otters and the penguins!... Pure beauty!

Fantastic experience . This was great. Fore the hole family. You walk around on two floors. There are lots of waterliving creatures to see. The akvarium is very big and you can see it from a lot of angels. To get here is easy by metro. In the area there are great restaurants. And don't forget to try the cable, by the river.
Nice attraction but not a must.. Very nice attraction for a rainy day. The huge aquarium in the centre in really impressive. The fishes are marvelous and you could stay hours looking at it.

Great place to visit with family and kids. It's not just an aquarium but a nice modern and big one with really a lot of things to see. Kids loved to go there and spent a lot of time entertained with the Penguins, all the different kinds of fishes, sharks, some sea birds, etc. Definitely worth to visit and especially a great plan if the weather is not so good.

is a impressive picture of ocean life. it was one of the places that took my breath away. you can see what happens under the see water. all kind of fish and marine life that you can no see other way. if you love the see you must visit this place.

Good, but not "the best in the world". I don't love how all aquariums and zoos take it upon themselves to say they're the best in the world. Especially not this one. It was SUPER crowded when I went. The otters and penguins were the highlight, but other than that - nothing original to the place. Definitely just a one time look-see and you'll never have to go back.

Best in class. I have seen various aquariums but lisbon is the biggest Every kind of ocean creatures were inside My three yeras old child is also likes the place We spend two hours inside with out any primoblem 17 euro per person

A lovely day out at a great aquarium. We booked tickets for the oceanarium as the weather forecast for the day was not favoring an outdoor visit to anywhere. You can easily reach it by Metro, although there is a bit of a walk to the actual location. In itself the oceanarium is quite small and compact, but there's several zones with different animals from different climates. The central tank is the highlight, as its one of the largest single tanks I've seen. There are great views of fish of all sizes, including the Rays and the Sharks. I would recommend this to families with toddlers, older children and teens would (in my opinion) be bored very quickly, but younger children seemed to be genuinely in awe of the huge tank and massive views.

Fun aquarium-- great for a spending a couple hours. I bought my ticket online so I saved a little bit of money, entered straight into the aquarium and visited both the permanent and temporary exhibition. It is a quite large, so it was worth the price and I enjoyed it a lot. I don't recommend eating lunch in their cafeteria though; it wasn't great and would have preferred to just trek somewhere else.

Very Good Variety, Large, & Informational. A little out of the way, but accessible by the metro. Wonderful large tank with sharks, rays, eels, sunfish, and all types of things to watch. Easy to just sand there for 20 minutes watching. Many other little rooms, tanks, and so on. Reasonable English sings to understand things. - Ideal for young, and certainly on a rainy day. (and everyone else will be there too since it is popular, so arrive early.... really!)
A bit overpriced for what it is. This was a pleasant way to spend a rainy afternoon, but I didn't think it was worth the price. May be more entertaining for children.

1st class Good Value. A great day out. Good value and extremely well presented. Make sure you see the Forest Underwater display which is the largest aquarium in the world. I recommend this venue for adults, couples and families

Great place to visit. This is a very good Oceanarium with lots of exhibits. It was a great rainy day activity. The main tank was amazing with plenty of different fish, sharks and stingrays. The signs were also in English which helped us a lot.

MAGNIFICENT. An excellent place and a must-see place if you get to Lisbon. It's a huge oceanarium with a lot and amazing creatures. It's also a place for children to have fun and learn about the creatures of the oceans.

Beautiful exhibits. This aquarium is very easy to get to via metro and is near a shopping centre. I found the exhibits quite immersive, large, and very well designed. The only parts I did not like was how extremely crowded it got.

Beautiful, just a bit out of the way. A wonderful aquarium with some amazing tanks, fishes and even birds - shame it's just a little way from the rest of the city centre. There's also not much else to see or do nearby either.You can take the metro or the hop on/hop off bus to get to the aquarium but the travel time leave a bit of a dent in your day.If you don't mind, or if the weather has left you with few other options, then this is a fascinating way to spend a couple of hours.

Allways impressive!. It must be the forth time i've come to the oceanarium since it hopened and it never ceases to impress me! The way you get to be surrounded with sealife, the diversity of the species and, above all, the quality of the exhibites they have. Really worth the visit! Try come at lunch time when the lines are smaller!
Amazing place!!!. Best aquarium ever visited, well taken care and very instructive. It is worth a trip there for the young and older people.

Nice range of sea life but not well maintained. I had heard a lot about the Lisbon Oceanarium so maybe I was expecting too much and the Oceanarium itself isn't that bad, its more the area around the Oceanarium that let's it down. Closed down restaurants, unmaintained parks and rest areas leaves this area really lacking in comparison to some of the more beautiful picturesque areas of Lisbon city. It was quite a rainy day which made the chairlift not very enjoyable - with not much of a view expect for degraded buildings and unfilled water features below. I hope the area is much livelier in another season. The oceanarium itself had a nice range of sea life but there was no real standout in terms of exhibitions or shows to watch. I would like to give the area another try in the Summer time to see the difference.

One of the biggest aquarium in europe. We spend up to two hours there. It´s a must go in Lisboa. They separates the different oceans into sections. Many beautiful affectionate styled tanks with lots of fishes and other creatures

A sea life delight. We were on a hop on hop off bus tour and decided to have a look at the oceanarium. It is in an area of beautiful modern architecture. The aquarium was amazing; seeing so many different kinds of creatures up close was a real treat. Our favourites were the marine otters who delighted us with their antics. I have some fantastic photos! We thought it would take about half an hour but it took more like two hours, and we had to drag ourselves away. There are lots of cafes and open places to picnic if you prefer, just outside.Definitely worth the time to visit if you like wildlife.
Kids loved it!. I've never seen an aquarium so big and well organized. The main tank is shown on every room of the building from top to bottom, really really interesting.
Interesting. Apart from the big basin, there are not so many species to see. I prefer from far the BREST Oceanarium in France

It's okay if it's raining outside . My expectations were higher, because everyone told me that this is one of the best aquariums in Europe. But actually you have the big aquarium in the middle and it's simply the same from all the sides. Despite the huge sunfish there's nothing really special in it compare to other aquariums. A highlight was definitely the small aquarium with the leafy sea dragon, but that's all. For that kind of aquarium it's pretty expensive. I'll not come back to this place.

Wonderful!. This attraction is a definite must-see while in Lisbon. Great wet weather day activity as well . Easy to get to, just catch the Metro to Oriente station and from there it is a short walk to the Oceanarium. Loved everything about this place.
Just amazing!. A fantastic place for kids AND adults! The huge aquarium in the middle of the building was just unbelievable great!!! For us a must-see :)

I was expecting more. After reading that this aquarium was second one in the world my expectations were higher. There is a nice main huge aquarium, with a big ocean sunfish in. Let's mention two otters and several penguins. That's all what was impressive for me. The proposed restaurant is just a place where not to go.
Excellent place. Weather wasn't great but Portugal is worth visiting. Stay out of the tourist areas in Lisbon. Rent a car and travel around in the area. Tomar is a great little town.
wales. please have a dream, let your soul remind the sound of the sea, enjoy the pleasure making a trip in nature

Great aquarium. Not only but also a for rainy days. The aquarium is absolutely worth the entry fee. Be sure to take your time: particularly in the immense central basin with its many windows on two levels there is much to discover. Also do not be disappointed if you do not see the otters at first. The little guys might be sleepy and since they are comfortable with just the head over the water line, they might not be easy to spot. If you find a knackered otter blinking at you it is a particularly adorable sight, though.

Fabulous oceanographic museum . This is an amazing oceanographic museum. The self service ticket machines were definitely faster than waiting in the regular ticket line. This is the most impressive oceanographic museum I have ever visited. The sea otters are adorable.
Nice for about 2 hrs. We had fun for 2 hrs max. We also visited the temporary exhebition which was the most beautifull aquarium i ever saw and would recommend to see it.
Excellent. Very interesting , time flies when you're there. Great for adults and children. Very reasonably priced.
Not much to see. They really only have one big tank that's cool but not much passed that. I would only recommend this place if your looking for something to do on a rainy day.

Very pretty oceanarium. Very nice Oceanarium, with a big tank in the center that has several sharks and manta rays, in addition to other fish, and also a couple of floors of other fish and even puffins. We had a great visit, all adults, teenagers and seniors enjoyed it. Worth a visit
Amazing. The modern building that we see out side hides the natural enviroment that the animals leave inside a perfect afternoon to relaxe with family and friends

Great day for the small kids and we enjoyed it too. This is an amazing way to spend half a day. This is a very good oceanarium and our kids really enjoyed it. The whole region around it is very cool and we also did the cable car next to it. Getting there is not very easy as you need to travel on the pink line Metro...

Small but fantastic. . The most striking feature about this aquarium is the layout. It's not the biggest. Be perfectly aware of this before deciding. But it is fantastic. And the most striking feature about it is that all of the fish and mammals in there are fed through one water tank. Every thing is linked together and that is the most fascinating feature about this Oceanarium. Make a trip to this place because you will kick yourself if you don't. The penguin and otters are so adorable you will fall in love with them. Most definitely. If you are going to Lisbon pencil this in as one of your stops.

Wow!. Better than expected - and I expected it to be good.Very, very impressive.Reasonable price at €17Just about every ocean animal possible in 4 ocean types - Pacific, Atlantic, Indian and Antarctic.Lahr, clean and modern with additional expected amenities - toilets, coffee shop, restaurant and shop.

Gorgeous Oceanarium. This is a little out of the way - we ended up needing to get a taxi to the site, but it was worth it. We purchased our ticket from a machine outside on the day with little fuss.The main exhibit winds around the outside of a large central tank. The first few views of this tank are very crowded - don't bother and just move on. You will have many opportunities to view this tank across two levels.Fabulous variety of plant and animal life available - one of the better aquariums I've been to in Europe. It was also my first time seeing a sunfish in the flesh!
Beautiful. Great aquarium, beautiful, very impressive! I would go back anytime. It is located at the Expo site, so it's nice to walk around as well.

Amazing oceanarium. We have been there with 2 kids 4 and 8 and the whole family loved it. The aquariums are huge and the different kind of fishes impressive. Staff is helpful, you can buy tickets online or in machines in the entrance. Even with a lot of people you dont feel it crowded.
Well Presented Aquarium. Some nice specimens and well presented. Engaging for all ages and the animals appeared well looked after. The stunning temporary exhibition is well worth a visit.

A few surprises . We had a great time at the oceanarium yesterday. For adults the price is expensive - €17 including the temporary exhibition - €14 without. To be honest I wouldn't bother with the temporary as there's so much to see in the main exhibition. The main tank is spectacular but we also were pleasantly surprised to see some otters, penguins, and puffins! We went on a Monday early afternoon and it wasn't too busy. Although we did have trouble finding it - it's the big building with the giant blue arrows outside!!
Beautiful oceanarium. we have visited ocenarium during our business trip to Lisbon and all our clients have enjoyed the place very much.

Even I liked it.... I'm not normally one for zoos and aquariums but have to say I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here. A few tips would be to visit later on in the day when the school kids visits have finished, make sure you watch the video about half way round and save some money by eating in the shopping centre across the road as on site cafe seemed expensive. It's in a nice area for a stroll after by the riverfront.

Nice afternoon . If you like nature we recommend giving a visit to this oceanarium, also it's located in Lisbon expo zone which is quite pretty for a walk and presents a different Lisbon compared to the city center.

The colourful world of fish. The aquarium is amazingly build, leading the visitor through all oceans of the world, making him understand the sea life beneath. Great place to visit with family, friends and young children. And don't miss the coffee place, too. An interesting piece of architecture.
Amazing display. I love aquariums. This one is perhaps the best in Europe. Covers species from all the seas and oceans. Awesome!

Visit at oceanario. We went to the Oceanario with a 2 years old child and two teenagers and we all had fun. I recommend to visit Park de Nacoes, where it is Oceanario as one day trip, there is also an interesting Museum of Science next to Oceanario. The surrounding in these park is very nice, near the bridge Vasco da Gama.
Nice visit. I had a lot of fun in there. It was great... my family had a lot of fun. I learned a lot about sea creatures from there. Best journey ever.

Well worth the admission fee. We visited during March. Staying in a city centre hotel we chose to get a taxi there as it's a little far to walk and the weather was changeable. Quite a long queue to get in but well worth it. Fascinating display of underwater life in general. Although quite busy it was still possible to lose the crowds and get a good view of all of the exhibits.Thoroughly recommended.

Major oceans, flora and fauna . Great place to spend the day. Very well set up vignettes representing the worlds oceans, the native birds, flora and fauna. Great place for learning and exploring. Very cool architecture. It is out from the old part of town and we had a hard time getting there by train. It might be worth it to cab it.

Interesting. A typical ocianarium. A lot of diifferent sea areas of all over the world. If not to busy you can walk around easily and see, study all aspects. Most impressing has been the movie about the building up and the maintenance of this oceanarium

Great both for families with children and lonely adults. Do not think you can spend less than 3 hours here - amazing exposition will not let you go away. I recommend just to sit and look. Underwater world will catch you ...

Much more than fish. Fantastic couple of hours! The temporary exhibition (tropical forests) was extremely beautiful - like the best home aquarium I've seen but then the size of an enormous room. The permanent exhibition is also great, and has so much more than fish! Puffins, penguins and, best of all, otters! There is so much to see! It was pretty busy with large school groups when we came in, but once these dispersed it wasn't too busy anywhere.Make sure to buy tickets online before you go for a discount and to skip the (not inconsiderable) queue.
A Fascinating Place. Loved this amazing place. Much more than just a sealife centre. So many wonderful exhibits, but my favourite has to be the lovely sea otters - they are so endearing.
Lovely. We went to the aquarium on a rainy. Day and that was a great choice. The place is big and if you are an animal lovers you will not be disappointed :)
Fun. A fun day....almost identical to the Monterrey aquarium. Still, it was under 20 euros per person and a big, and interactive aquarium
Fantastic. Really super place. Nicely organized, educational, keep you busy for a long time :-) big tank with fish was suprising, wow

Best Ocenarium. This is the best Oceanarium we've visited - compared with Melbourne, Sydney, Okinawa & Valencia. The temporary exhibit Floestas Submersas designed by Takashi Amano was simply the most beautiful aquarium we have ever seen as was worth the entry price alone. We actually went back for a second visit of this display after having lunch at the cafe.

Great experience! 5* aquarium!. The Lisbon Oceanarium is incredible and a must go place while in Lisbon! i live in Lisbon and I visit the Oceanarium at least once a year. The central aquarium is big and very cool with lots of different fishes and the otters are very funny (you can see them really close and both from above and under the water).It is a good place to visit alone or with kids because everybody loves it.

I ate a tooth. Really enjoyed the aquarium with the otters and penguins. However I expected larger sharks and a turtle or two would be nice. Absolutely shocking. The temporary exhibit was pointless. Never have i ever experienced such vile food in all my life from the cafeteria. There was a human tooth in my bolognese and the waiter said it came from the factory like that. What an insult! Me and my friends could no longer finish our meal. Not only did this ruin my day but I can never look at bolognese the same. Ever. (and that WAS my favourite pasta dish)
Cant wait to go back!. Lovely aquarium with lots to see. Easily accessible on the trains and a wonderful place to spend a few hours.

Wonderful aquarium in beautiful surroundings. My friend and I went to the Oceanarium on our last day in Lisboa. Lockers are available but if you have suitcases, it is better to store them at the airport; it is just 3 stops away. The aquarium is very busy on Sundays, full of children and families, so if you prefer more peace and quiet, I would recommend a visit during the week :) I absolutely love underwater worlds so I did not mind the crowds. There is plenty to see, both the temporary exhibit and the permanent ones were beautiful. The area around the Oceanarium is worth a visit as well, with a beautiful sea side view and small gondolas floating along the ocean bank.
excelent. Amazing Aquarium. a good place to bring the all family and enjoy a nice day. 5 stars.the children love it (and adults too :) )

The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the modern attractions of Lisbon. The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of of the modern attractions of Lisbon, built for the EXPO98, it is now located in the new affluent business and residential area of Lisbon. It has a large collection of marine species.A large main tank, has four large acrylic windows on its sides and smaller windows located around it. About 90 species are kept here including sharks, barracudas, sting rays and a large sunfish.Another four tanks around the central tank house different habitats with native flora and faunaHow get there, take the Metro, red line to Oriente, your will be impressed by the train station designed by Santiago Calatarva. Walk down to the water front passing by the Portugal Pavillion, with its enormous and impossibly thin concrete canopy designed by the Portuguese architect Siza Viera, and then to the right to visit the Oceanarium.Take the funicular along the banks of the river Tagus, and have a drink or a bite in one of the many bars and restaurants on the water front.After strolling round the Lisbon International Fair and the MEO Arena, indulge in some shopping at Vasco da Gama Shopping Mall.
Must see. Magnificent overview of the species found in each type of habitat. Beautiful, interesting and entertaining.

An impromtu Visit. It was pretty good to go out and see something different. I haven't quite seen many oceanariums except for one in Osaka Japan. Comparing the both, this one was slightly smaller than I expected. Still it wasn't a bad attraction. It would be great for kids.

Must see!. Nice place to learn e see all sort of fishes and some other animals. Without any doubt a place to visit. Please enjoy (& relax) a couple of minutes "lost" in a balcony with a view to the central aquarium...
Fun Day Out. Bit on the expensive side - but a fun day out, especially for kids. The jellyfish are particularly spectactular

Stunning . I can't recommend this place highly enough. The variety of sea creatures was amazing, enthralling and quite exquisite. The place itself is very well organised and perfect for all the family. My favourites were the sea otters and the majestic blue jellyfish which looked like they were adorned with tiny pearls.

Really good. The aquarium is very weel design and ir has a lot of diferent species to see. I went with my boyfriend so I think it a very good romantic trip, but it very good for small childreen and to visit with your family.

An Aquarium that Lives Up To Its Reputation. Plan to spend 2-3 hours here, with or without children. A fascinating and educational experience that delivers what it promises. There is something to wow you at every turn.
Take the subway to Oriente and walk over to the Oceanarium, passing the gigantic mall, the interesting Expo Park, and waterfront boardwalk.

Beautiful aquarium in lovely area..
