The Oceanaria was very easy to get to and in a lovely area of town.One of the few places with a queue and charges were higher than most other attractions in Lisbon.But,the sheer size,variety of creatures and imaginative displays made it well worth the money.I spent several captivating hours there and found it quite relaxing even though the place was crowded with many school groups etc.I reckon watching the fish and other creatures swimming around has a calming effect!
Excellente. One of the most beautifull aquarium in the wordl, A must see. Near the Tagus river in the new área of the EXPO 1998

Nothing better for families. One of my favourite spots to come with kids. It's such a super place, in one of Lisbon's most relaxing areas (past Expo site full of restaurants, gardens and bars). The walk underneath the white sharks is incredible and always impresses my kids. Beware that at times queues into the Oceanarium are huge and you might want to pre-order your tickets online.
Nice experince to family. Very nice Oceanarium. It is good idea to buy the ticket online. We were thre quite early even so there was a 30 minutes waiting. Tight corridor .
Beatiful, but nothing extraordinary. Good place for kids, for couples, and for those who like zoos. For everybody else there is nothing special to offer
Oceanarium in Lisbon. more than a huge tank filled with mantas and sharks. beet place to visit in the "new Lisbon place to visit"

not as Big as expected. Lisbon Oceanarium is interesting place, but maybe try it not on weekend, cause too crowdy:)and it is not as good as expected....too dark...to much space just like to go through. If you have nothing to do you can try it.

An absolute must see. Although the sign posting from the rail station seemed very well hidden & had to ask for directions to find it, it was well worth the effort & spent a couple of hours being constantly entranced by the amazing variety of sea life on display. Well laid out with lots of informative signing to give background on the species in the tanks.A particularly beautiful temporary exhibition when we were there last week was also quite magical.One of the best I've ever seen.

Fearless looking to sharks...!. This souvenir from the Lisbon world exhibition expo98, it's a wonderful way of imagine how the diferent animal species can live together inside the same tank.With several diferent enviroments, you can go from the south pole and it's penguins to the coral reef with the colourfull fishes and anemones, never forgetting the north see with the codfish alive...something very strange for a portuguese guy!
Just beautiful. Amazing place to visit, one of the best oceanariums of the world!So many species to discover..its a great way to spend your day in Lisbon.

A trip to the Lisbon Oceanarium. Considered to be one of the best of the world, this exquisite piece of Architecture simply doesn't let you down. The employees are friendly, the atmosphere is special, and your knowledge of the oceans is greatly increased. A must go place in Lisbon.

A must in Lisbon. Frankly, I am not a huge fan of animals, zoos and similar places but this aquarium was fantastic, anyone can spend there a few hours without boring it. Although the price of the ticket is a bit high and the location is a bit far away from the city center, but there is a metro station close that makes the visit of the Oceanarium convenient. As it is part of the former Expo neighbourhood visiting Oceanarium also provides the opportunity to see the other Expo premises; it also worth to spend some time to walk around.
Excellent attraction. There are 3 ways to purchase tickets at the site; wifi, distribution machine and at the regular counter. Not to expensive for the quality of the Oceanarium.

A really good Oceanarium. A lot of thought had gone to the design of this Oceanarium and the lay out was ideal for wheelchair access and children in prams. People of all ages seemed to enjoy their time there. The highlight was the sea otters. There was so much to see you could spend all day there.

Overcrowded but good. Definitely avoid on a Saturday! Full of pointless people taking pointless photos. But the aquarium is really well done and they have loads of interesting animals - not just fish.

A very good aquarium although the penguins and other birds did not look very happy. The aquarium is in the Parque das Nacoes and makes for a nice half day or day trip out from the centre of Lisbon (Metro to Oriente). The aquarium itself is a short stroll through the shopping mall and along the river front from the Oriente Metro stop. It's described as the second biggest aquarium in the world (after Monterey) but I am not sure if this refers just to the central main 'tank' spanning two floors and containing the usual array of sharks, rays etc or to the overall size of the aquarium as a whole. I assume the former as when we had walked around the whole aquarium we were quite surprised that we were at the end. There seemed to be relatively few amphibians which I have seen in other aquaria and no 'touch tank' although I am not keen on those as I think it must stress the fish. Having said that it is still a large and varied aquarium and well worth a visit. The incredibly cuddly looking sea otters are a must see. I assume they were bred in captivity as they seemed extremely relaxed and happy to lounge at relatively close proximity to visitors. I was less sure about the penguins and other birds who did not seem to be particularly happy and reminded me why I do not particularly like zoos and animals kept in captivity. Having been round the aquaria the cable car entrance is just outside and worth the short trip to see the view over the Parque, river and up to the Vasco de Gama bridge. The end stop near the Torre Vasco da Gama is about the same distance back to the Oriente metro as the walk from the aquarium.

Great for kids of all ages. We have just about had it with aquariums, as the last couple of ones (including the ones in Singapore and Copenhagen) left us tired of places that hardly offer more than a huge tank filled with mantas and sharks. Still, we wanted to give Lisboa a chance, and we are glad we went. The big tank here can be seen from all sides, even offering smaller niche-windows. Room enough for everyone to see. The special habitat tanks are visually connected to the big tank by glass, so at the same time you can see sharks and e.g. diving otters. Well done!

Great once we found the entrance!. This a a great interesting attraction. One could spend hours just watching the numerous species of fish swimming inches away from the several full length large windows of the main aquarium. Orbiting the central aquarium are countless smaller aquariums with species from all the seas and oceans around the world.The road signs we followed pointing to the oceanarium took us on a very roundabout route from where we got off the hop on hop off bus, but definitely worth a visit!

Great!!!. We saw a lot of aquariums around the world and we loved this one!We appreciated the idea of the central round pool on 2 levels with many viewing points, large and small, around the circumference with benches so one can rest and admire the beautiful scene of crowds of fish. Especially beautiful were penguins, sea otters, sharks and the huge fish-stone (called sunfish), “nemo” and the reef with various types of anemones.This place is definitely worth the entrance fee of €14!!!
Not to miss. For sea lovers of any age. The architecture is surprisingly !!! We can feel the animals are happy as they would be at "home".

Amasing experience - do not miss!. For everybody who love the ocean and admire the underwater world - the Lisbon Aquarium is a magical place! I spent two and a half hours and just couldn't leave :) Absolutely great built facility that gives you the optimum option to see and admire the marine life - with huge respect and care for the animals. Even if it's crowded you could find a place to be just by yourself and contemplate the fish. Special attention to educate and rise awareness about the importance of the ocean life. Excellent place for being with kids. The ticket price is great (less than the one in Barcelona's aquarium which has so much less to offer) and there is family entrance option. It's walking distance from a metro station + a stop of the hop on hop of buses.
Amazing. Great for the families. I always go to the Oceanarium when I'm in Lisbon. My kid loves it. The part she loves the most is the huge tank that look like a real ocean.

A splendid rainy day at the Oceanarium. This was our kids' first choice of activities to do in Lisbon and I'm glad we did. We had a great visit and all enjoyed our afternoon. The otters and jellyfish were their favorites. Nicely displayed and organized to flow people through the exhibits.
superb aquarium. Everything you could wish to see in an aquarium. Excellent entrance fee. Easy to get to if you use the hop on hop off tour bus.

Stunning Aquarium. The Oceanarium is a very well designed. the Central pool is with Sharks and Stone fisch and you can see it from 360° on 2 levels. side pools with various ecossytemare smaller but the overall is worth sisiting. Pay attention to the temporary expo it might be worth visiting it and not ony the premanent.

Amazing! . A must go to place when you've a bit more time in Lisboa. When you're more than 3 days in Lisboa, I would certainly recommend you to go to this, it's very amazing and you can gaze at it for ever!
A must visit!. Its a unique setup and close to nature Oceanarium. Beautifully designed and engaging experience. It take couple of hours once you get inside. Lovely place to be with kids. Enjoy :)

Impressive... Very impressive Oceanarium, firstly when you walk in, the main attraction is an enormous tank which is a centre piece for the whole attraction, wish many fish types and sharks. It can get very busy and get people pushing in to try and see exhibits but other than that, a very enjoyable day out which I can highly recommend for Aqua marine liking people.
Great time in family!. It is a very nice experience for you and children. You can see many different species and it's perfect for teach kids something about animals and their habitats. Really Nice!
Don`t miss it!!!. Lovely experience for people of all ages. Very well maitained Oceanarium with plenty of different species. It`s a bit like diving in the ocean...

Must seen in Lisbon. The Oceanarium is not directly in the centre of the city, but easy to find with the metro. We were there because of bad weather.There were not toomany people and the museum is made like walking through climate zones. There is a big main aquarium which you can see from different sides (like a circle and you walk around it). But there are also some smaller things to see.

Oceanarium. Just to the east of Lisboa, the Oceanarium is a 20 minute bus ride from the train station. Worth a visit, very informative about the fishes, mammals, amphibians and Oceans. Buy your tickets online was cheaper than from the front desk on the day.

Spectacular. I'd heard a lot about this and wasn't disappointed. A wonderful way to see huge numbers and varieties of fish. Allow at least an hour for your visit and then take the Telefonica which is located behind the Oceanarium for great scenic views
Cool for children. We spent there 2 hours and it was worth it. Children were happy so we were happy;) I just regret that there is no dolphins:(
Funny. Very nice experience and you can see different species even the weirdest fishes! Good time at the venue

It's a wonderful place. I love going back to the Oceanarium! It's so peaceful and beautiful. You can visit all the ocean, thousands of species in just a couple of ours (or more if you have to spare).
I live in Lisbon and have been there more than 5 times since it opened.

Very good aquarium. Visited here during a city break to lisbon. It is quite a bit from the city centre. We accessed it via the hop on hop off buss tour. It has a huge tank holding 5 million gallons of water. Sharks, the extremely ugly sunfish are just some of the things to see. You can get a 15% discount with the booklet from the bus tour.
Great place to learn about the Ocean and its inhabitants. Great place with a very impressive permanent exhibition and nice temporary exhibitions. Loved the experience.

Take the Plunge. Oceanario is in a very modern part of Lisbon. The metro station and surrounding buildings are striking. Oceanario itself is also a striking building but you may be forgiven for not being impressed from the outside. Do not worry. Once inside, the truth is revealed. There is a central display which the building surrounds. You get different views as you walk round the whole exhibit. This is very good if you arrive at the same time as a school party! Apart from the central display, there are many, smaller environments to explore. The range of sea life on display is huge and it all looks very well maintained. Well worth a couple of hours of your holiday.

The oceans right next to you. An experience that will make you feel small.Beautiful aquarium and a must see in Lisbon.Located in the modern part of the city.Quite expensive for Portuguese standards but normal price for such type of attraction.
Great oceanarium. The largest in Iberian peninsula and one of the largest in Europe. Well balanced exhibition that is organized in several earth ecosystems around a large impressive central tank
Nothing Great. We have visited oceanarium/Aquariums at other places but this wasn't that great. Doesn't have much variety, its too small.

Interesting but crowded. The oceanarium seems like a great place for kids. There are plenty running around the complex. It was a bit expensive and very crowded. Often needing to wait at most windows to see the species. On that note, there is a wide range of species and so much to see! If you are interested in ocean life then it is worth a visit!

Not bad but a few negatives. Having been to quite a few aquariums, this one is OK but doesn't really have enough to keep children (or adults!) interested for very long. It's got one massive tank that you can see from different angles, and a sweet but small penguin area; there are a few indoor ponds, an area with some small toads and frogs, a few tanks with jellyfish and other tropical fish but nothing that stands out. There was a poor giant octopus in a tank that was much too small for it, and it kept bouncing off one side and then the other - quite pitiful to watch. The cafe had a poor and overpriced selection (no children's menu!), and the exit is placed at the end of a long ramp, which forces you to go through the shop. Took about an hour to go round. I'd recommend the aquarium in Valencia any time!

A great place to spend a few hours!!. This was a great and fun experience for me and my family. Very clean and well managed, well organised and fun for everyone. You see a lot of different sea life, from small to large fish and mammals, penguins and we even saw a sea dragon which I didnt know existed. They have a nice gift shop as well and its in a nice area to walk around and have something to eat. For sure worth a visit, especially if your going with children.

Amazing . This was me and my girlfriend's last stop before we returned to London. It is just amazing. The diversity of sea life, the expositions and the whole set is just impressive. Makes you fell like you are in the middle of the ocean. A must in Lisbon.

Ok. If it's raining and you have a spare couple of hours then great go visit! I don't think it's the number 1 thing to do in Lisbon - there are better ways to spend your time. Having said that I understand the attraction for families.
Penguins, otters and puffins are hilarious - could watch them all day.

The best Aquarium I have visited in Europe. I have been to numerous Aquariums in Europe, this certainly is the best, the cost for a family of ticket for 4 was 44 Euros, compare this to Sea World in London which about £85.00 sterling, there is no comparison. The one in Lisbon, is larger, has a varied collection collection of marine life. A good tip to avoid the queues, is to use the ticket machines, rather than join the normal queue.
Amazing . Great couple of hours spent here. Without doubt the best aquarium I've been to. The way this place has been designed is incredible.

Amazing with marine biologist. We booked a marine biologist for our family with 3 kids to show us around the Oceanarium. We ended up learning a lot about the creatures that they have there, but also saw the backstage of the place including the machines that run it and the places where they feed the fish. Amazing, and well worth it!
Amazing central tank. Very nice oceanarium where the key thing to see is the central tank. On of the largest in the world. A very good visit for kids too, they'll love it...
Worth a visit. Go, go, go! Expensive entry fee €17 for adults, bur seniors get in for child price of € 11.An amazing aqaurium.

Awesome central tank. Went here during a very rainy day so we were not cooped up in the hotel.Seemingly the second largest aquarium in the world.The central tank where the building and all other exhibits are based around, is pretty amazing. The one fish they have that I have never seen before is the sun fish. A huge ugly thing but great to see.The central tank is full of a great variety of fish from all over the world.The other exhibits around the main tank are okay. The best were the otters floating around on their backs and the puffins.A good visit for all, especially the younger kids to see fish that are different.

Fun Acquarium - Love the Sea Dragons. We have been to a lot of acquariums around the world and this is one of the best. Need to travel to it - its not in "downtown" Lisbon. Can take Metro or taxi. It was a nice change of pace during a week of historic castles and churches.
Fish tank deluxe. This is one of the biggest and best aquariums I have visited in a while. There are some amazing views of the aquarium with a big variety of animals sharing the same water.

Worth it for the otters alone!. I wasn't sure whether to make the trip out here or not but we decided to go for it anyway - it was definitely worth it. The way it is laid out is really clever with a huge tank in the middle of the aquarium and other areas divided up by different oceans. There were so many different species of fish on display but the real highlight were the otters. They were absolutely huge (compared to anything I'd seen before) and as always so fun to watch. My only complaint is that the bottom floor is a bit too dark. I know it's necessary given the types of fish they have but people were bumping into each other all over the place! Still a well thought out attraction worth a visit if you've an interest in the sea!

Amazing Oceanarium. The Oceanarium is a fantastic facility which clearly intends to give a detailed insight into the ecosystem of the five oceans. They have sections dedicated to flora, fauna and life as it quietly flourishes in and around the Water world. The Oceanarium has 8000 resident species, it is also an introduction to the sensitivities of interdependence of the plants, corals, invertebrates. Spent the whole day inside and still wanted more!!! Amazing! Will be back for sure!! Totally worth it!
Good fun and educational. Make the effort to take an Uber to see this place. A really big aquarium with lots of cool fish swimming around. Really loved the otters and penguins.

If you have never visited an Oceanarium, this is a must see. The indoor displays were very nice but we did not see anything outdoors, i.e. dolphins,sea lions etc. If you expect to see only sea creatures behind glass this is perfect.

Worth a visit. If not just for the sea otters! They are super cute I could watch them all day! You can get some really awesome photographs with the jellyfish and the huge floor to ceiling tank in the middle !

A wonderful experience. We went here on a Sunday so it was very busy with children and their parents, as can be expected. Best to get there as early as possible. Although the exhibits were most interesting and the lay out of the place exceptional, it was sometimes difficult of get to see some of the fish etc because of the crowds. One of the annoying things was the people standing in front of the fish tanks taking selfies and photographs, so no one could get a look in !! There is a large shopping centre nearby which was open on a Sunday. The Oceanarium was well worth a visit, especially on a rainy day.

Great family attraction. We were not really inclined to visit but the incessant rain drove us indoors into the Oceanarium. And boy, we would have regretted had we not visited! A fantastic facility which clearly intends to give a detailed insight into the ecosystem of the five oceans, with sections dedicated to flora, fauna and life as it quietly flourishes in and around the Water world. Besides its 8000 resident species, it is also an introduction to the sensitivities of interdependence of the plants, corals, invertebrates and an ecology that must be protected for humans to flourish on terra-firma. A must visit for all families who visit Lisbon, besides anyone who has a couple of hours to invest into the vagaries of life in an alien environment, and be enlightened..

Good experience for a rainy day. There was torrential rain in Lisbon, we were soaking wet, so we figured taking a look at some fish could be fun. And it was.As usual when animals are being kept in indoor spaces there is always some restraint and the behavior that comes with it. But it was still enjoyable because they had some room to move.Very relaxing and meditative to watch fish in big tanks, so a successful afternoon.

Great place for kids. My children really enjoyed our visit here. In particular watching the sea otters being fed. A good wet day activity. The cafe was quite expensive though, and didn't have a very large selection.

Fantastic. A great opportunity to find out about different species and ecosystems. The main attraction is of course the central tank with a huge number of fish. Also, worth your attention is display of amphibians. Great fun for both adults and children.
A unique place. A must in any trip to Lisbon. Go with time and enjoy one of the best ocenarius is the world at a reseonable price.

Great visit even for sunny days. On this rainy day it was a great opportunity to visit this oceanarium.If you don't want to wait in the queue, you can buy tickets online (even on your mobile) it's cheaper, and you can enter directly.Inside, it's pretty like any aquarium, but take some time to look at the species. We spend 3:30 walking, learning and seing animals (birds, otters, frogs, fishes ...).It was really interesting, but if you want to enjoy it more, take some earplugs, groups of people and children speak louder and it's resonning; with your earplugs you'll be in your (sea)world.

Breath taking. Immaculate and well maintained. This is a great day out and such good value too! I have been twice and could happily sit for hours looking into the huge central tank. It's truly mesmerising. We did have to queue for over an hour to buy tickets but it was midday on a Sunday so perhaps just chose a bad time. It was busy inside but we still enjoyed ourselves.
Excellent aquarium. Haven't been to an aquarium for many years so decided to try this one! Very pleasurable experience and I highly recommend!

Amazing Time. I love the "one ocean/one world" concept that the aquarium uses. The views and exhibits were great; not only were they carefully planned and well thought out, they were educational. I enjoyed reading the signs to my 5 y/o daughter. The sea otter and penguin exhibits were by far our favorites. The aquarium is pretty massive, so be sure to sit down in front of the center aquariums when you can. Also, I would recommend going later in the afternoon to avoid school groups. :)We stopped in the cafeteria for lunch before leaving.

Good But Very Busy. We spent a couple of hours here - read some great reviews and we were excited to visit but slightly disappointed. The building is impressive and the aquarium is very good but I have been to others and been more impressed. A selection of tanks, lots of interesting creatures to spot - especially loved the sea otters - but it was so incredibly busy we had to queue behind the viewing areas and just grab a spot when we could get it. That definitely put us off, noise levels also were insane as there were lots and lots of school groups.We did enjoy exploring the wider Expo area though, very different to the rest of Lisbon and a ride in the cable car is great fun.

Main attraction is the central tank. The main tank in the middle of the aquarium is a mesmerising display of fish, rays and sharks. It features centrally throughout the tour with great viewing areas.The temporary exhibit of under-water forests was staggeringly beautiful. I'd happily look at these creations for hours on end.
Wonderful time. . Very much worth the visit. The oceanario is quite well set up. Incredible central tank with amazing and varied species of fish. Loved the temporary exhibit.

Oceanarium. Great aquarium. I really enjoyed learning about the different species. The various ecosystems were very well done and the displays were very informative. It was a bit of a walk from the Metro station (700 m) but otherwise easy to get to.

One of the best in Europe. I have already went to many aquarium in Europe, one of them in Barcelona and this is a aquarium that everybody talks, however I can easily say that: Lisbon aquarium is away better than Barcelona, for me "Oceanário de Lisboa" is the best I ever went

Great Family Afternoon. We visited the Oceanarium with our three small children and we all had a blast! Restrooms were easily accessible. The price for our whole family was definitely budget-friendly!

Amusing, but expensive. I loved the oceanarium - it's a modern, fascinating and engaging aquarium. The only drawback is that the entrance fee is quite steep and it is not located nowhere near the centre of Lisbon. On the other hand, it is a good opportunity to see the neighborhood constructed for Expo.

Truly Beautiful. Not the biggest, but uniquely conceaved, giving you a 360 degree view on the whole marine world. I visited many Aquariums all over the world. This is one of the best ones. Not for its size, it's not that big, but for how well they constructed it. You have a huge tank which you can see around at 360 degree and each corner has a different ocean's ecosystem and you'll the the whole marine world in one. Truly amazing. The cherry on the cake, is outside, seeing the otters playing with their gorgeous fur.
Not great.. Having been to great aquariums, such as the one in Monterey and the one in Atlanta, this one is definitely not worth the visit.

Lisbon Oceanarium. A fascinating and interesting collection of sea life. Well laid out and all areas easy to access, even in a wheelchair. A bit busy with school parties when we were there but an enjoyable day.

A nice aquarium, not the most impressive. It is maybe the biggest oceanarium in Europe, but for me the one in Valencia was more impressive. A huge tank with a huge, really, really huge sun fish, several sharks and a lot of other fishes. Standard side exhibitions connected to the main tank of species directly related to the ocean. Nice educational corner about recycling and water saving. But the exit path will lead you through the shop, full of plastic toys and memorabilia (ironic, or what? ). Excellent temporary exhibition about water forests. Could sit there for hours.Worth the visit in total if you haven't visited anything similar. Otherwise, leave it for a rainy day. Buy the tickets online, should be 10% off.

Not Quite Excellent . This attraction claims to be world class and leading the way. Well, it is indeed very good but not the best we've seen - the facility at La Rochelle in France for example allows you to walk "through" the fish tanks. There was an instructive video giving a very interesting "behind the scenes" insight into the care, treatment and feeding of the fish. There was, at the time of our visit, a visiting exhibition from a Japanese aquatic expert that held ones interest.

Amazing!. Amazing! When the weather is bad in Lisbon, this is the place to go... (not that the weather is bad that often!) A real must-see with a wonderful, Zen atmosphere. Could sit and watch the large tank all day!

Perfect family trip. Young kids loved it.Was a bit crowded though.And the waiting line for the ticket desk or even ticket machine (only 2 or 3) was VERY long (100m+).However, there was the option of paying Online (and WiFi was provided as well), but you were obliged to pay for the temporary exposition as well, which didn't interest us. After queuing for about 20min we got our tickets, which wasn't so bad.The restaurant is definitely worth a visit! Healthy food at a VERY reasonable price.The permanent collection was very nice.

Great aquarium. The aquarium is beautiful, clean, well mantained, it's not very big. Plan to spend 1-2h at the aquarium. There is a really big tank in the middle and a few small tanks around. No shows. Kids enjoyed the visit but after 1h30 they were bored.

Must do with kids - but beat the lines by booking online. We recently visited Lisbon at the end of a two week holiday through Portugal so we were starting to become tired of family activities! However, on a rainy day in a city with not a lot to do when it rains with kids we took the trip out...and it was absolutely worth it.When we arrived we discovered huge lines as clearly everyone else was thinking the same thing. However, rather than wait in lines we took a chance and checked online - and the tickets came instantly to my email and we could walk straight through and into the aquarium.Inside the aquarium its designed so you are essentially walking in one direction around a beautiful centre tank with countless smaller, specialty tanks on the outside. They have also used lots of big animals where possible, even the jellyfish and octopus were easy to see. The kids loved it because the tanks were accessible and the creatures easy to access.It was really lovely and a life saver in the rain - but would definitely revisit again when the kids are tired of walking around the city...

Amazing Aquarium, earns its worldwide status. Sun fish is a sight to be seen! this is a great Aquarium and much better than London`sand it is really good value. It was really busy during our visit but it was in the school holidays, so to be expected

A good thing to see. Various types of creatures from the sea world, worth of visit, for kids and adults...It is quite big, well planned so you can go around everything.There is always a special exhibition that you can choose to book or not.It was a fun day for sure :)
Visit with grandchildren. An excellent visit with 2 very enthusiastic young granddaughters. A brilliant 3 hour visit taking in the vast array of sealife.

Worth the travel time . Located by the water in the expo grounds. The walk from the subway station is a nice longish one along the boardwalk. The central tank is really amazing. Bit expensive (17 euros) when converted back into Canadian dollars but that's Canada's fault, and the huge manta ray and sunfish in the central tank make up for it. Educational and not too big so you lose interest quickly (can't say the same for the hoards of children running around).

Starting the year in a marvellous setting. We went to the Oceanarium with our son and fiancee when they visited us for a brief New Yearholiday. We had been there when he was a child. So many years after, we were curious about how the building and the exposition were (well) kept and our emotions would flow. It was a magnificent afternoon. Everything is very well and many new species were added to the group. Oceanarium is definitively one great attraction when you visit Lisbon.

Awesome - and also serenely beautiful. Best aquarium (bar possibly the New Jersey one) we've ever visited (and that's quite a lot) - worth it for the sunfish and sea otters alone. I could sit for hours in front of the main tank. The current 'Underwater Forests' temporary exhibit is well worth the extra couple of euros. Very good value for money and the café's not bad too.

'Must do' if you are with kids. A visit to the Lisbon aquarium is fully recommended if you are with children and its worthy to make a day of it. We arrived via the underground network which was simple to navigate, taking 40 minutes from the centre of Lisbon.From the station, walk though the shopping centre and then to the sea and turn right ...its a fab walk to get there if the sun is shining .The aquarium itself is excellent and our kids enjoyed the huge variety of fish and sea creatures on display. The centre piece tank is the highlight but plenty else to see.After the visit , you also have the science museum or the cable car but we chose to enjoy a late lunch, walking back towards the station ... don't turn left but go straight on and there is a row of restaurants include Mr Fish(!) which was excellent and had a display of fish almost as good as the aquarium !

Much better than expected. We paid a couple of extra Euros to go to the temporary exhibition and it was great. Just ordinary tropical fish and plants but on a massive scale. Beautifully landscaped by a professional aquatic landscaper. Can't believe such a job exists. The main exhibition is just as good. Sea otters, giant octopus, penguins, sea dragons and lots of other interesting displays. We were there for four hour with lunch. All very good but for the lunch.
Nice Day.... Great location...well laid out. Animals were lively and tanks were well maintained. Had a fun time with family.
Incredible. Could spend all day in there. Can be frustratingly busy at times but there is always a quiet spot to be found somewhere around the main tank. Exceeded all expectations! Not to be missed.
Great attraction . A really good place to spend a few hours with the kids. High class facility that is really well managed and maintained. Recommended

Vising the Oceanarium was an impulse that was VERY rewarding!. Having spent hundreds of hours at the Vancouver Aquarium, I did not expect to be so wowed by the Oceanarium, but it was totally worth the time. Visit all the oceans of the world under one roof, up close and personal.

Best Aquarium We've Been To. Slightly outside the city centre, via Oriente Station and alongside the Parque des Nacoes, this is a really impressive aquarium with a huge variety of species and a spectacular main tank. If you're in Lisbon and with little people, go there - they'll love it...!If sunny, the walk along the riverside to get there is also lovely and there are some nice restaurants and bars if you want to pause before heading back into the city.
Awesome Fish. This is a spectacular venue for those looking to see a wide variety of sea creatures. We got 10% off using our Lisboa cards and for 2 hours you can really relax looking at everything.

Beauty place to go with Family. Very Large and beautiful place to go with Family. It's bit out of city but if u have lisbon card which u can get from information centers or airport which u can use on trains, busses and trams then it will be easy to gp there
Amazing . I really enjoyed visiting the oceanário! I was amazed by all the beautiful fishes. It is also bigger then I expected. It was more then worth it!

don't waste your time. . being no1 on list of things to do in Lisbon I was very excited, but left deflated and disappointed. the main tank is way too small for the amount of sea life in there. sharks are my favourite creatures and it was sad seeing them in that tiny and very un-natural environment. it was very crowded and we didn't have much opportunity to see the smaller displays. the sea otters looked bored and lethargic in their tiny pool. same with the puffins and penguins. this aquarium needs to be much larger, it is years behind other aquariums such as London and Sydney. after 45 mins in the aquarium we decided it was time to leave.

Amazing experience. Took my 2 children here and they along with myself & my husband loved every moment. The layout is brilliant, great central tank which gives different views depending where you look into it. The area around outside is great, especially if the weather is good
Enjoyable couple of hours. Loved the oceanarium (as did teen & younger kids). Informative video. Good value family ticket.But, didn't think the temporary exhibit warranted the extra cost

Fun, clean but packed. We went on the Easter weekend so maybe that accounted for the crowds. There are extremely long queues so buy your tickets online. Once inside you're rushed along because it's so busy and you feel bad for staying in front of the tanks too long. Very nice and clean tanks. Lots of variety and photo opportunities.

Unique in the world. The Oceanário de Lisboa is unique in the world and all families should take their youngsters to visit. It is not only interesting for kids but also for the parents and grandparents.
Should be included in every visit to Lisbon, specially if you like natural life and water environments.
Excellent!!!!!. Excellent aquarium with variety of fish in their natural place of living. One of the best aquariums in the world.
Nice. Visit. great place to take the litle ones, for me was interesting the temporary expo from takashi Amano . My 3 year old was amazed whit the big tank And the sharks

Fantastic aquarium. You won't be deceived by that place. If you can, make your booking online and get 10% discount (it is cheap nonetheless) - 44 euros for a family of 4.Get there by walking the wood jetty by the river.The main attraction is a huge tank in the center of the building about 3 storeys high full of sharks, sun fish, barracudas, manta,...you will find yourself staring at this for a while...There are also temporary exhibits, ours was underrated forest by a Japanese artist.

Be Smart, use your Smart Phone to Book Online . We weren't the only people to go for an indoor attraction on a wet Monday afternoon. When we got to the Oceanarium there was a huge theme park size queue for tickets, which looked like a good hour wait. But we noticed the free Wi-Fi sign and logged into a very quick Wi-Fi connection, and within 5 minutes we had our tickets on our smartphone and were heading for the entrance, leaving the ticket queue behind us. The Oceanarium was well laid out with a very cleaver layout where you followed a clearly laid out route seeing large tanks and small exhibits. There was little new or different about the Oceanarium but they have a pair of the cutest Sea Otters. All in all a very interesting and enjoyable and clean attraction.

Excellent experience. This is a first rate Oceanariums, full of interesting exhibits and of course wonderful marine life. Little bit expensive at 17 euros but an excellent experience. Tip. Try not to visit when it is Children's holidays as it gets very busy.
Make sure you also go to the temporary exposition. Make sure you also go to the temporary exposition. The kids enjoyed this aquarium very much, worth the money.
Worth visiting!. I can't believe we spent hours in this Aquarium. So much to see, it really is worthwhile taking a visit.

Amazing. Even though is a bit pricey it worth going to see it. My 6 years old daughter loved it. It was a great day spent there. I recommend the temporary exhibition "underwater forests" as well. Great day out!!!
Great place to go alone or with Family. It is an experience to be lived, ...preferably with your children.... only visiting it you'll understand why it is one of the best aquariums you may go..

Brilliant Aquarium. If you are looking for an aquarium that tries to present a holistic view of sea ecologies in as impressive a format as possible - this one hits the mark. I could do with a bit more informational content, but at least there's none of those ridiculous pet the ray stands.

Nice day out good for children. A nice day out for the children. The Oceanarium itself is a reasonable size with one large tank being the main attraction. The other exhibits are informative but not particularly exceptional. There was a temporary exhibition on called "Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano" which was actually really good.

Do not waste your money or time!!!. Visited today after waiting in queue for about 30 minutes (don't mind waiting as due to rain spare of the moment trip there). There is only one tank in the middle with far too many fish and sharks in it. Not that we could actually see much as people were pushing and shoving to the front. SomeUnruly children were running around and pushing in to other children and generally barging past people with parents no where to be seen. There is no crowd control or tab on numbers of people so whole experience ruined by people using the flash on their cameras and scaring fish, children climbing all over the temporary expedition, rude people with no manners. Otters had the tiniest pool I've ever seen with no stimulation from finding kelp or diving. Their Only distraction was disobedient children banging and screaming near the Glass. Advertised as the best thing in Portugal and conservation work I think not! Totally false advertising the pool/tank is too small and there are no signs or instructions to tell people not to use the flash, bang on glass, climb on sides of exhibits etc. Weren't impressed at all. Went to customer services to find manager, no staff around apart from ticket people who totally ignored me. If manager wads this I am in Portugal till Wednesday if you want to arrange a time so I come and collect a refund. Spoilt my trip to Portugal.
Nice way to spend a few hours.. Good attraction, well designed, some interesting exhibits. Save time if iit is busy, you can buy an eticket on your phone.

Really Good!. The best aqarium I have ever been to! A great variety of fish. A great place to go if the weather isn't great. Itndoes get quite warm when on the lower layer and at times it was crowded but apart from that it was AMAZING!!!

Outstanding. The Oceanarium is worth a visit if you are in Lisbon on a rainy day as we were. The planted fresh water tank is amazing and a credit to the designer. The large ocean tank is real spectacle with the unusual and weird moon fish.The sea otters cannot be missed.Book online and save a few Euros
One of the most amazing place i ever been.. Wonderful, beautiful and exciting. It has a strong natural energy within. Its highly recommended. Don't miss it!
Nice collection. Took an uber to get out there (it's a ways out) but was a great way to spend a Sunday morning. A nice little collection. Everything is in Portuguese and English.

Great day out. We had a really excellent time at the Oceanarium and in the area around it. There is an excellent variety of sea life to view and really informative exhibits. Next to the Oceanarium is a cable car which is fun to ride and only around 3 euros. The cost of the Oceanarium was very reasonable (about £14 euros) and was definitely worth the money. There are 5 or 6 nice restaurants and cafes near by, I would recommend the burger one which was really tasty and great value. It's definitely worth exploring this new part of Lisbon!

Worth a visit if you're in that neck of the woods. This is a bit further out from central Lisbon and may not be worth a journey out especially but there are other things around there too. We went out for the cable car ride which was disappointing and actually ended up enjoying the visit to this Oceanarium much more. Impressive selection of fish and well designed structure meant you could get a great look at these creatures.

Interesting visit. The oceanarium experience is well worth the visit. Easily accessible from the metro and a short walk. The visit will take a couple of hours an is very impressive. Avoid school holidays to miss the crowds.

A wonderful attraction to visit. This world class aquarium is a must see site. It is located near the sight of the world's fair site, The Park of Nations. After spending the time in the aquarium, walk along the river to view the Vasco de Gama bridge.
Extra. Super place for the 'underwater break'. Price is high but it worth to pay because its amazing experience.

wouldnt let us in without I,D. We went up to the ticket booth to buy a family ticket with my two children aged 12 and 11 and the woman asked us for I.D for the children, we were on holiday from the U.K and don't make a habit of carrying the childrens passports around with us. The woman was extremely rude and just shrugged her shoulders and wouldn't let us in. such a shame as the children were really looking forward to it. DONT BOTHER GOING
One of the best aquariums I have seen. The viewing experience and the interconnectedness of the exhibits were outstanding. And there sea otters, puffins, and penguins.

Big fish. BIG tank in centre, very impressive. Information boards in English as well as Portuguese. Difficult to get close to some of the exhibits because of number of people and we weren't there in high season! Really cute sea otter and you won't believe the sun fish until you see it.

huge dissapointment. I was keen on visiting this place based on reviews but the visit was the biggest disapointment of my Portugal visit. I visited on Saturday and the place was way too crowded. They let in too many people (and kids) at the same time and it was something that could only be described as a living nightmare. The amount of things to see was also a let down, the place does not have much to see.I would rather have my teeth pulled out than visit again.
Good place. Beautiful aquarium, good place to go with kids and have fun.Natural plants, manu different fishes.Enjoyed.

The magnificence of the sea life. We have been there three or four times for the last two years.Not cheap but worth the price.Well organized, beautifully kept, with extraordinary animals. The kids love every visit and so do we.

Good afternoon in wet weather. Good place to spend a few hours with kids especially if the weather is bad. Not too expensive and lots to see. The cable car is very nearby too and very cheap to have a return ride!

Sister bonding . Lisbon Oceanarium itself is beautiful and a lot of knowledge to learn and a lot of water species you can see inside. I recommend that buy a ticket online to avoid long line just to buy ticket in the location and its not the good day when we choose to visit, a lot of people inside that you cannot see the fish in the aquarium because a lot of people inside. But still oceanarium is great.

Stunning . The whole aquarium is really enchanting, there are lots of different rooms, activities, and a big central fish tank that can be seen from many different parts throughout the whole route into the aquarium. The neighbourhood where it is located is completely new and modern. Highly recommended

Great aquarium, much more than I expected. Great aquarium, you can get really close up to the tanks. Only downside is the fact you have to walk so much between the ticket office and the aquarium. Also had Forests Underwater special exhibition which I also thought was really well put together and was more like a living art exhibit. Recommended for all the family.

Good Aquarium, but not one of the best. Definitely worth visiting. It isn't one of the best aquariums that I've been to, but had a good selection of sea life. If you're in the city with kids, definitely worth a look.
Throughly recommended. Thoroughly recommend a visit to the oceanarium. Lots to see and an ingenious set up to see the various sorts of marine life in each of the worlds oceans.
Oceanarium in Lisbon. It´s a nice program to visit with kids,a bit expencive(for Portugal).You will need minimum 1,5 hour to visit
Tour. When you visit Lisbon you must visit the oceanario. It is big, very well kept, magnificent variety of animals
Visit with teenagers. This aquarium is absolutely amazing for the entire family! The large tank in the middle of the aquarium in huge!! My 13 year old son and his two friends were intrigued as was i
Rated Higher than Experience Delivered. Would be great for kids or someone who hasn't visited an Aquarium.It was OK, just not the hype I expected with its apparent ratings locally.

One of the Best. There is only one other that I have visited that is perhaps better than this one and that is in Monterey, California. This Lisbon aquarium had a large selection of all forms of sea creatures. They also had sea otters and I loved the Penguins which you do not see everywhere. The tanks were formed into great alcoves for the different species.Unfortunately there were so many school classes the day we went and they made a lot of noise which made it a little less pleasant. But otherwise, we did enjoy the oceanarium very much. There is an elevator as well as flat surfaces and not an issue for the handicapped. This is a great family outing. The price of entry is reasonable for what you get.

Good thing on a rainy day for KIDS. Mediocre at best. Chattanooga TN has a better one. If this is the best that Europe has to offer go else where, like Tennesse. Too many kids and too many pushy people. Exhibits where small and hard to gain access too. The Sea Dragons where very cool. Went sought refuge on a rainy day otherwise not.

Spend two or three hours here. It's easy to get to this attraction on the metro or bus. They have a fascinating huge tank in the centre of the structure, and you can view it from all four sides on two levels. If you're tired from sightseeing, this can be a nice meditative break. There are sharks, rays, a sunfish, and a good variety of other fishes in the main tank. Other areas feature different eco-zones such as North Atlantic, Coral Reef, and Antarctic. There are enough interpretive panels (in Portuguese and English) to let you know what you're looking at, but not so many that you feel overwhelmed by so much reading.
Very impressive aquarium!. Many marine species, penguins and amphibians. Very impressive main tank with sharks, stingrays and the amazing moonfish. Worth visiting.
Neat and informative. A very nice oceanarium. Not as good as e.g. Melbourne, but very nice. Expect to share your visit with lot's of people (especially) kids.
Beautiful!. Great way to spend an afternoon learning about the beautiful life under the sea. It is a way to learn about the ecosystems around the world. Great outdoor penguin exhibit.

Education and fun combined. Very well designed, it is pleasant and informative for both children and parents. The informataion boards are clear and we loved the lay out and the huge water tanks that you get to observe from different floors. I recommend it highly.

Was really good but.... Great place to take the kids but nor as Amazing as advertised after you visit the big tank that's really the whole aquarium no special attractions just a bunch of sea creatures in one tank.

Amazing, but overcrowded. I have visited quite a few aquariums around the world, and Lisbon Oceanarium is definitely one of the best if not the very best I've seen (I've yet to see Barcelona's, though). The central tank is amazing and it provides a completely different experience from different observing angles.The only real problem was that it was overcrowded and the air inside was a bit stale - it was quite a relief to get out.Still, if you go to Lisbon, you must not miss the Oceanarium!

Great for a rainy day. Excellent for a rainy day and interesting building, although I personally wasn't as interested in the temporary exhibition. I would have given it five stars but the cafe was overpriced and serving disappointing food. Avoid eating inside!

Ocean's life at the corner - Amazing. If you do like oceans life, this is the right place to go. You can see beautiful species from all around the world in their habitat. Also you can see the different habitats at 2 levels: surface and deep sea, and the species that live at the different levels.It is about 1h30 to 2h of pure pleasure to people that love oceans life.

Good day out of the clouds! . What a day out. Loads of fish as expected. It was worth a visit. Such a shame a lot of the corals are fake. Only a few small tanks with real coral. The area itself is very strange not a lot going on. Needs a few more places to go for food and drink.

Impressive..... It's a perfect getaway for families, also the surroundings.For the fish lovers, it's a not-to-miss attraction, but be smart not to visit during a long weekend, it's simply too crowed to squeeze in.

Good for a half day in Lisbon. We went on a rainy morning and got there just before the queue got ridiculously long or I'm not sure I would have waited. Once inside the whole thing centres around a huge tank full of wonders including sharks, rays and a huge range of other wonders. Don't feel you have to wait to see in the tank when you first arrive as there are plenty of opportunities as you walk around and less of a crowd at most other viewing stations. The otters were my favourite floating around aimlessly and enjoying the attention. Worth a visit but kids would probably enjoy it more than we did as an adult couple.
Amazing . Perfect program on a rainy day. I was blown away at the size of this aquarium, Definitely recommend this to all ages!
A remnant from the Expo 98. A little boring for us, but maybe not for you?You can see different fishes, starfishes, pinguins,...
Crowded and average. Buy tickets online otherwise really long queues. Seems much the same as any other aquarium in any other city. Loads of kids and no restrictions on crowd numbers.

Very crowded, but worth it.. Do not even think about going here unless you buy tickets in advance - the queue to buy tickets on the day was easily a kilometer long. If you have tickets you walk straight past the line and you're in.However, it was extremely crowded on our visit and it was very difficult to see anything. The best approach is to walk through the top level quickly and go to the level below, where you can get to see into the main aquarium much more easily.The fish (especially the matas and sharks) in the main aquarium are fantastic and there are interesting smaller tanks with sealife from specific areas and habitats.There is a very cheap cafe which serves good coffee and reasonably OK food - but not a gourmet experience.It is a bit of a walk from the metro station.

Good value. Book in advance online, but _do not_ pay by credit card till they update the website to use https - use paypal.The main central tank is pretty good, and there are some good side-exhibits. A couople of these are unusual - not the best aquarium I've been to, but certainly not far off. The temporary exhibit (at least the 'underwater forrest') doesn't take long, but is best after the main exhibit - just in case you run out of time or get tired!

amazing!. You can reach by pink metro line. The ticket is 17€ for an adult. You can see thousands of fish, moss, and marine animals from all over the world. They are marvelous. You should live this amazing experience.

Great. Lots of children, but well presented.
Best to get in the morning. A bit pricy, but worth it.
Staff was friendly, but the children made it difficult to focus.

On the surface not so good but bear with it. When you walk in you are faced with a map showing the layout which is really just one massive tank in the middle of the site that you walk around on two floors but there are other display areas showing different species However every time you walk past the big tank you get a different view of a massive variety of sea life so it is an amazing experienceVery busy being Easter but the queue moved really fast Suggestion investigate if can get tickets on your mobile to avoid the queues
Worth checking out. It was very cool, and amazing to see so much sea life in one place. Very informative and interactive. Really enjoyed my visit!

Great. Allow 2 hours. We took ataxi back to the centre for about €8. Just regretted that we didn't go there in a taxi. We took the 759 bus I think and it went all around the place. 90 minutes after getting on the bus at Restauradores we arrived at the aquarium.Nice coffee shop. Children over 12 pay adult price. It was worth it though.
Great visit. Brought an irish school group here. We really enjoyed it.very easily accessed from Oriente station A must do in lisbon. Loved the sea otters.

Donrt Go on weekends or holidays!. It was so crowded with strollers and people that we could barely see any of the exhibits. It seems like there could be more to see but, the crowds make it very difficult in a small space to enjoy this exhibit.

Ticket information for Oceanarium. Rainy day in Lisbon so ideal to visit Oceanarium, made the mistake of joining a queue for tickets at machines near entrance - should have checked first as we got to front of queue only to discover the machines are for cards only, no cash. The queue under cover was just as long but at least we wouldn't have got wet and would have actually got in. A silly mistake on our part but just want to save others doing the same.

Very beautiful, definitely recommended. We went to the Oceanário on the day we arrived, since it was open until 7 pm. This was a very good decision. All in all, we spent around 4 hours in there, including a short coffee break at the cafetaria. The Oceanário is one of the largest I've ever seen, and is divided up by ocean. So there's a Pacific part, an Atlantic part, etc. There's also a large central aquarium where all kinds of rays, sharks, fish etc. swim around, including a large 'sunfish'; this was my first time seeing one of those, and it was quite impressive.Besides the permanent aquariums there was also a temporary exhibition, by a Japanese designer. This was a large mangrove-like aquarium, which was very beautiful. The exhibition had information on the kinds of species living in forests, and on forest protection.In general I liked the fact that the Oceanário also gives attention to wildlife preservation, sustainability and other similar topics.All in all this was a very good way to spend an afternoon.

an amazing experience!. went here with my girlfriend. i was really positively surprised. i expected something like fishes in tanks we walk by, the usual stuff. but this was something different. an enormous tank full of all kinds of fishes, and you could walk around it looking at it both from different angles and different levels. apart from that other animals such as penguins, turtles and much more made this into an experience you cannot miss

Unique attraction. Went to the occeanarium with our three year old daughter she loved it! There is a huge central tank filled with sharks and rays amongst others, then four separate sections covering regions of the world as well as lots of smaller tanks. We thought it was better than Sealife world in the UK.

Nice Oceanarium, but expensive!. In a book called 100% Lisbon we read about the Lisbon Oceanarium. It was a great experience, but it's also quite pricey (adult €17,-) in comparison to what you can do. There are two floors with permanent exhibitions and one floor with a temporary exhibition. The main aquarium is very impressive and nice to watch for some time, if its not too crowded.
Amazing!. I was blown away at the size of this aquarium, really felt like you was in the ocean with all the amazing sea life. Definitely recommend this to all ages!

Well presented collection and an imaginative experience. Layout was imaginative, with an impressive collection of fish and marine creatures. The mixture of indoor and outdoor zones was good. We arrived early, and there were many people queuing when we left at lunchtime. All age groups seemed to be really enjoying the experience. Ensure you keep your valuables secure, as the viewing areas are very dark. Really enjoyed the visit.
Really worth a visit. Recommend this - as scuba divers we thought we'd have seen better in the real sea than in an Oceanarium but this one was amazing - very well done and beautiful.

You see more than you expect. We stayed in Lisbon for 5 nights at the Fenix HF. To get back to the oceanarium its 2 stops on the yellow line and a change to the red line (as if back to the airport ) for approx 8 stops; a walk across the road from the Metro and then another walk, it's on the coast; it was pouring down and we were wet through when we arrived; only a small Q; it was easy to follow the route around the different features, we saw lots of large fish and some smaller species also small tanks with quite rare sea life, it was very interesting; all the area's are well kept and there are staff constantly cleaning inside the tanks; I felt a bit sorry for the penguins who only seemed to have a small place to live; they had an ice slide which was good; I suppose they don't know anything else; the mixed large tanks had a great variety from sharks, stingrays, one that was massive and looked like a large oven glove (only description I can think of) you could stand there all day watching them, we spent at least 3 hours; they have a coffee house and serve food; there is also a large shopping center nearby if you need anything; good coffee shops and lovely cakes. We went back on the Metro which is the fastest mode of transport but obviously not the most scenic; having said that; the stations are very clean and nicely tiled; trains are every few minutes and it's easy to negotiate. there are staff at the machines if you need any help.

Great trip with the family!. Beautiful location, the largest oceanarium we've seen, excellent gift shops too! There aren't many options for restaurants nearby, just a few little cafes with a good selection of food. So go after a meal.

Nothing special.. I expected little bit more from Lisbon Oceanarium. I thought it would be bigger than it was. Temporary exhibition was really really small and there was nothing special. Ticket was quite expensive.

The most interesting place I have ever seen!!. I have seen many similar places, but this one is really amazing, I didn't expect this place to be so interesting, definitely will come back, when my daughter will be a bit bigger.
Wonderfool. Perfect program on a rainy day. Interesting for children and adult as well. The places are quite small at view windows.

Cool & interesting. Lisbon Oceanarium was probably the best aquarium I've ever been to. A lot of rare and interesting species, such as weedy sea dragons, ocean sundisc fish, manta rays, sea nettles. And penquins! Try to go early or late - it is hard to see the things in the smaller aquariums when it is crowded.

Lisbon Oceanarium. The Oceanarium has a large collection of marine species. The tanks providing the illusion of the open ocean. Other interesting species are two sea otters named Eusébio and Amália, named after two Portuguese contemporary cultural persons.The aquarium is divided into four big parts, corresponding to the Oceans: Atlantic, Pacific, Indian and Artic, It's close to the river and surrounded by a pleasant open área. Easy to reach by Metro or other public transportation. This is a great place to spend as many hours as you wish.
Worth a visit!. We had exciting day visiting the oceanarium and it's amazing tanks. It is not wonder this has been voted one of the best in the world. Definately worth a visit!

Once must view. One of object in Lisbon on our holiday was oceanarium because my wife always like nature life. By description Lisboa oceanarium is second biggest. If it is second then how small are third or forth? Technically easy for exploring and viewing. But nothing extra. There are no monsters or somethings what can see on discovery Chanel . Good for kids for showing something of ocean life. All around exploring take one hour. We use hip on hip off bus for getting here. Stop is just by entrance. Price very good. Actually - yes. It's worth for be there. Once.

Spend hours everytime I visit. It is one of the biggest aquariums in the world and it is an absolute beauty to visit with your family. The staff is very informed and can give you the background story of every animal there and I just love it.

Incredibly noisy. Although this was undoubtedly a fabulous aquarium and extremely well done the visit was ruined by the hundreds of chattering, squealing, excited schoolchildren on trips with their very harassed teachers. Whilst it was great to see the kids enjoying themselves we were unable to hear or see many of the exhibits and had our toes stood on numerous times. All the school parties seemed to arrive at the same time and it was truly deafening. Perhaps if they had been staggered it may have been more manageable. Having said that though the aquarium is impressive and the sea otters were absolutely charming. The area around the Oceanarium is lovely for a stroll and we found it easy and very reasonable to get a taxi to and from the city.

Awesome . My partner, 2 year old and I spent a wonderful afternoon here. We ate at the self service restaurant which was nice. My little man had an absolute ball. It's very clean and well organised with plenty of things to see. I will definitely be back when he is older. Not an all day event, 3 hours is more than enough.

Great fun for all the family. The oceanarium is well worth a visit when you are in Lisbon. Situated in the Park of Nations it is very easy to reach by Metro. This is a place where everybody, young or old, can have some fun while watching the sea life of four different oceans. The aquariums are huge so you can spend hours there. Nice pictures too!

Interesting. The tank and wildlife were obviously the best attraction in the place but it could have some more interactive things for children to do as they have increasingly short attention spans. Staff were very helpful.

"Educational and Enjoyable". The Oceans and their environment together, in a pleasant área nearby the Tagus River. At the Eastern Lisbon (Metro- Parque das Nações), close to the river and surrounded by a pleasant open área, there is the "Lisbon Oceanário". It is divided into four big parts, corresponding to the Oceans: Atlantic, Pacific, Indian and Artic. There you can find , besides some of their fish, a little of their environment too (trees, birds and climate...). In the middle of many small aquariums with other different fish species, you still can find a very large central tank with the biggest ones (sharks, etc).

Nice to visit the Oceanarium. Charges are too high at 14 Euro per person incl the temporary exhibit ( which was not worth it!). But its nice to see the fish and sharks and sting rays glide through the water!! Some otters too!

Beautiful Place. Even though I liked my visit a lot, I must say that I didnt really see much of a difference to other aquariums that I have been to such as the one near Palma de Mallorca and many other locations. I can recommend not going right before they close as we were basically running away from this last guided tour as they wouldnt allow us to fall behind that group.
The best in Europe!. If you are in Lisbone definetly worth a visit to the Oceanarium! Don't forget the science museum next to it! Has been a very nice experience!

One of the best places with sea environment. In Lisbon Oceanario you can find a unique sea environment with fantastic sea animals of a great wide of species. It is probably the best in the world and it's amusing to visit with choildren.

Enjoyable, good value experience. After driving the kids crazy with historical sites, we thought we'd treat them to the acquarium. It's located north of the old town and we caught a cab for about €8. At the time of the visit there was both a temporary and permanent exhibition. The former was quite small but really impressive. The latter was big and even more impressive. Everything is really well laid out with exhibits in English and Portuguese. There are a pair of sea otters there which are ridiculously cute. They were not shy at all and had kids and adults grinning from ear to ear.
Perfect 2 hour tour - any day. Whether you're going alone, with kids, feel like walking around or just sitting by the main tank - this tour is perfect everyday.
Really great experience. Great place which made us loose hours. Would not mind revisiting soon. They deserve their nominee as a great ocenario.
The best. It's the most intersting oceanarium I've ever seen. It's big and with great collection. Highly recommended to visit!!

Brilliant experience!. We visited the Oceanario de Lisboa on the last day of our stay. This is a great place to spend as many hours as you wish. Apart from the huge aquarium ther is a gem in the middle of it---The Submerged Forest. What an incredible experience. It is so beautifully presented that it hits all the senses and emotions full on. Anyone not moved by it needs therapy!!

A unique experience...don't miss it. I really enjoyed the visit in the Oceanario.The duration was for about an hour.It is a unique experience because nowhere in Europe you can find so many different environmental conditions for fish ,corals, plants to live a survive in these 'natural' habitats. The cost was 17 euros for an adult + 2.5 euros if you wanted to take a handguide (not very helpful unfortunately) . Keep an id with you passport or driving licence,because for security reasons you leave it in the entrance and you claim it at the end of your stay.I was lucky as a had the driving licence,otherwise they could not issued the ticket!

Good but not that special. We were there on a rainy friday morning so the place was crowded with school groups which made it hard to enjoy the scene. Besides that it is of course nice and for a family with children its fun.for us it was an easy to forget program.
Visiting with friends. Highly educative and really nice spot especially for famillies and people interested in nature. Loved the huge pool!
Worthwhile. A lovely place. It's advisable not to plan to visit on a Saturday, a bit over crowded and noisy. Worth the trip to the suburbs.

Peaceful and Beautiful. Me and my husband spent a day here after arriving in the early morning to Lisbon. We were exhausted and waiting to check into to our hotel and this was the best way to spend the day in the peace + quiet of the cool aquarium.
Must see for families and couples.
Beautiful. Beautiful aquarium with a large variety of animals and information. Check out the otters, they're the cutest!

Beautiful , big and with extra exposition of Takashi Amano. It is very nice oceanario. I arrived i opennig hour (10am) so i could see feeding of pinguins, otters and sharks. It was exactly like i expect. Many different species selected into four main parts. Pacific, Atlantic, Indian and Antarctic. I like that way. But bonus was at the end. Extraordinary 40 meters of aquarium arranged by Takashi Amano. Something like japanesse gardens underwater ! Marvelous! Just sit in front and meditate. Love it.

Impressive outside look,not much inside. Well, I guess we went there with high hopes. It was a tuesday mornning 10:00 am, and the lines were crazy...about 4-5 school trips and lots and lots of kids!. luckily the line was shorter at the machines (you can buy tickets using credit card). From outside the building is spectacular, and really magnificent. On the inside, you are greeted by a large aquarium with many fish inside, however, this huge aquarium is basically it. all round you get the same view from this big tank that basically go around the whole place. The rest of fish and sea animals are out is dedicated small tanks. So yeah, overall, a good place to spend a couple of hours...2 at the most, because there would be not much to see after that. There was a temporary exhibition by some Japanese guy...really really tiny small colorful fish...and that was it.

Very different district of Lisbon. Very interesting place with its history, great animals, clean and tidy, great informative movie about work there, lots of kids, cafes, a shop. Very close to the airport and the moderately new commercial and residential area. If you go by hop and hop off bus, mind it's once an hour, at least during winter season. Strongly recommend!
Amazing and surprising!. One of the world's biggest aquarium with an amazing diversity and lot's of fun entretainmento for kids!

Amazing Place for Sea/Oceans animals lovers. It is amazing place for Sea/Oceans animals/fish lovers and not only. You will see many unseen fish. Also the Oceanario have a lot of penguins. The convenient thing is that you could buy ticket via Internet and you do need to stand in the line at the tickets.

Went here by hop-on-hop-off bus. Not a big one, compared to the one in Hong Kong or the one in Dubai Mall. 5 tanks represent 5 oceans. Collection is good. Some rare species are present. Good for children. Requires 2-3 hrs to complete comprehensively.
Good attraction on a rainy day. It's wonderful to see all the ocean animals with the feeling to swim with them together. The aquarium is so big!

Lots of fun! . So many fish and animals to see. A well worth place to visit in Lisbon. Very easy to order tickets on line and skip the queues!
You can spend hours there taking in all the exhibits. The main aquarium tank is huge and filled with so many different types of fish, rays and sharks!
a bit expensive yet fun. its a completely different world, where you can see fascinating creatures, maybe a bit to crowded but still worth seeing

Interesting. The acquarium is very nice and the varieties of species are quite a few. Everything is build around a gigantic central tank which, though, doesn't have very colored fishes. The seals are so very sweet. Overall speaking the place is not very big and they could add more spectacular fishes. Another flaw is that there are no restaurants but only a bar which is a pity. The temporary exhibition was nothing special.

Good for families . Interesting mix of creatures. Clean and well maintained - well cared for. Main entrance was not well marked and quite hard to find. The walk up was slippery and inside it was exceptionally dark. It was very busy and you often had to wait patiently for your turn to get close to the viewing window to see anything. The exhibits were nice.
Amazing. Beautiful place and well treated animals, calm, good access to everyone. You can visit at your hown rhythm.

Educational, entertaining, and exciting Oceanarium of Lisbon. If one has interest in marine life, mammals, and history and stories of the sea world, this place is worth your visit. The tank alone is larger than life and YOU.

Well set out in a beautiful setting. If you're planning to visit the oceanarium allow plenty of time. Not just for the actual visit which could keep you entertained for several hours, but so that you can wander through the riverside site - home to expo '98. The oceanarium itself is very well-designed and a source of wonder for old and young alike. It's calming yet exciting and spectacularly educational. Well worth a visit.

Weel worth a visit.. A fantastic aquarium that has an awesome giant tank that you can lose time just standing and watching. When I visited the Sea Otters were being especially playful and there were no a lot of people so it was perfect all round.
Very very beautiful!!!. Nice, clean, strange fish, shawrks, beautiful fish, seals and in a zone you can walk and visit almost all day long.

A nice place to children who are enthusiastic at the sea wild life!. From the smallest to the largest sea living being, you can see sea animals from the coldest to the hottest place, you can enjoy it as long as you wish, you can see the big fishes close to you (well, separeted by a thick glass), you can shot pictures (for that you need a very good camera because of the light reflections inside and the dark), all for a few bucks!

Very beautiful place to enjoy and relax. Is a very peaceful place. Better to go during the week I believe to avoid the amount of people during the weekends. Advise to go with calm and enjoy the big tank for a while.
Must go!. A nice family or alone experience, a "must see" in Lisbon. You can walk along the area and have an excelent day. Enjoy!

A must see. Wonderful facility in the middle of a dock and plenty to see inside with the huge tanks. Penguins and otters are really fun and I suggest to visit the otters during the feeding time. The schedules can be checked on the ticket sales at the entrance or searching on the internet

Great Learning Experience While HavingFun. Since the Oceans cover almost 3 quarter of the earth and 60% of the oxigen we breath come from there too it is crucial that we all learn how delicate and important the water environement is since all life on earth depends on it due also to the fact that is acts as global temperature regulation system. Learn the variety of species and the best way to protect them while joining the "Sleep with the Sharks" program where you can spend an unique night spleeping inside the aquarium completely surrounded by sea as if you were in the bottom of the ocean.

The big blue in one place!. This must be one of the most beautiful oceanariums around! Once inside, your met with the beauty and grace of sea life in a manner well worth experiencing. From tropical forest to the cold poles... you'll experience it all!

Nice experience- Oceanário de Lisboa. I´have liked both of the exhibitions. I have loved the permanent exhibition. It is a very well kept aquarium and I think that the temporary exhibition is very good as well- " Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano". I also believe it is a very nice experience for kids.You can buy your tkts online; don´t need any kind of paper.The downside is the price- 34Eur -2 ADLTS( kids up to 3- free) and the way is not well indicated on the road. Anyway if you are going by taxi I think that all drivers know exactly where it is. I can recommend this experience both for the locals and tourists. There are some activities that you can do there, like concert for babies and parties and everything is well explained on their website. I haven´t tried that yet...maybe next time.

A must.....in all visits to Lisbon. It is a fantastic aquarium and a place where peace and quiet inspire us all!Even if you've not an aquarium freak you should come and visit the aquarium and the new Lisbon (rebuilt after Expo98)
Best aquarium in Europe. Beautiful aquarium where you can spend 2 to 3 hours with family or friends admiring a great diversity of fish and other sea creatures.
Be Captain Nemo for some hours. Stunning nothing else to say ... Fishes in thousands, all the different environments , great ambiance. Nicely placed in the new part of Lisbon. Enjoy...
Good for the whole family. Openned in 1998 but still a must-do for families visiting Lisbon. Also the surroundings are beautiful and show a different Lisboa

Imperdível. Foi a minha 6 visita....e estou desejoso de lá voltar.
It was my sixth visit .... and I can not wait to go back.

Nice program for kids. It's a nice place to visit if you have kids (but also if you don't!)... The aquarium is very beautiful and the temporary expositions are always worth visiting. My advice is to go at opening hours to avoid the crowds.

Great visit in a great enviroment. Really nice building located in a fantastic and beautiful área of Lisbon. It is great for the kids, very clean and well organized. We spent a very enjoyable and especial day with all the family.

beautifull and peacefull. simply the peacefull place to be in Lisbon! Under water experience without being wet.
