beautifull place and a good architecture object and spaces.

Fantastic oceanario . It's really very beautiful we loved it so many fishes very beautiful if you like fish you must visit here when you in expo you will be happy.
Highly recommend.
Great Attraction. Loved it! Recommend it for locals and tourists alike. The exhibits were well constructed and maintained. Loved the central cylindrical exhibit, at the center of the aquarium.
A must visit for adults and children. A very pleasant 3-4 hours in an excellent and unique building - second largest tank in the world? Area it is located in will keep you busy ALL day.

Aquarium of Lisboa. It was a cool rainy day so this was the best day to visit the Aquarium. Many many exhibits. Not only for kids I was taken back by all the sea species. Great on a rainy day. Down day of fun.

It's okay . Be prepared to walk a lot. The place is huge. The aquarium itself is gigantic. Taking good pictures is hard due to very thick glass. I recommend watching underwater world with your own eyes instead. The place is worth seeing.
Great day out.. You could spend a half day here and not be bored. Lovely restaurant at very reasonable prices......to round off your trip. One of the best Aquariums I've been to.

Amazing!. A great experience showcasing the creatures of the ocean! Spent the morning there while waiting for a train, as it is ideally located by the Oriente metro/train station. Also only one metro stop away from the airport. Would definitely recommend!

Good aquarium not the best. Nice expierience but in my own opinion Aquarium of Barcelona is better. Many people is a little difficult. Remember - buy tickets via Internet. The queue for tickets is always very long.

Loce it - go there !. Very nice expierence, one of the best in Europe.
Forget the exhibitions, the main site is enough to see.
We loved it, we surely go back if in the neighbourhoud
Fantastic place. This was a great place to spend 2 hours in Lisbon. The price is reasonable and the displays are very impressive with a vast array of creatures.
Leuk uitje. Nice location, incredible building, surprising fish. Typical destination in case of bad weather or left over afternoon before flying home.

Nice indoor activity for kids when visiting Lisbon. Even though this is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe, we were able to see the entire aquarium in less than an hour. The kids enjoyed, but I think that we were expecting a little more. Doesn't compare to the aquarium in Valencia, Spain.
Beautiful!. Sea otters, penguins, and Nemo not to mention very well laid out exhibits I'd the worlds oceans. Well worth the trip to get there from the historic center of the city.

Great variety of sea life. Had all types of sea life - including sharks, otters and penguins. We were particularly impressed with the central tank that the whole place centres around. Was very easy to navigate round and worked on a hexagonal route across both floors. The sea life was in sections of areas/continents, which was very helpful and there was lots of info. The only thing that spoilt it a bit for us was that we were there the same time as a huge school trip so there were lots of screaming kids running around, which prevented us from seeing some of the display - not the centre's fault at all but nonetheless just prevented us from giving 5 stars. Well worth a visit of you like aquariums and there was also a cable car ride across the river, which had great views of the river and bridge.

Nice trip, for a rainy day. My boyfriend really wanted to go to the Oceanarium and since it was raining we figured we will see what it was like. Rather pricey €34 for both of us. A nice venue, especially for kids and adults alike! I loved seeing the wide variety of sea life they had at the attraction. I absolutely loved the otters! I did get slightly bored of the fish tank halfway round - as great as it is on first arrival, seeing the same fish all the way around was boring. The Japanese underwater forest was the main highlight for me. A couple euro's more but it is definitely a must see if you go anytime soon.
It was something magic. It cost us 34 euro for two adults with exhibition included. The fist time I saw a moon fish. Красиво и познавательно. В выходные очереди, лучше посетить в будни.

***. It's ok place visiting for you have a plenty of free time and you are interested in fishes and underwater world. I was expected something more spectacular, since it is a first must do thing in Lisbon. But, if you go for couple of days, you can skip Oceanarium and leave yourself to feel this vibrant town without this kind of things which you can do it almost everywhere. The ticket is little bit expansive.

Great experience. We found it surprisingly poorly signposted but when we eventually reached it we found it was worth the trek. Biggest fish tank in Europe is absolutely vast and really awesome. Plus all the other exhibits, tremendous!

As if you would be walking at the bottom of the ocean. Last year voted the best aquarium in the world. It has everything: huge aquarium, information about the world ocean and even separate exhibitions for each of them. Tip 1: After you go around whole exhibition, sit down and watch a short movie about in their little cinema. You will be able to get some rest after extensive walking and learn more about oceanarium.Tip 2: Take a picture or two with some crazy penguins or the biggest in the world bon fish ’Sun fish’ (it can be found in the main aquarium)Tip 3: pay attention to the windows on the bottom floor. Through them you can see the aquariums from the bottom. For example, we were able to see penguins diving towards us!

An aquarium to be proud of!. Superb modern building containing a vast tank with hundreds of species and surrounded by numerous smaller aquariums with specimens from all over the world. I thoroughly recommend a visit,you will not be disappointed.

A nice experience,. I was very excited about visiting this Ocenarium as it's known to be the biggest in Europe. Well... it is big, indeed. But arm yourself with looooots of patience, because:1. It's very crowded.2. Kids & parents don't respect much the rules, and the staff doesn't interfere in any way3. The staff it's pretty absent, overall (in case you want extra-infos, well... good luck)4. The extra-exhibitions don't justify the extra-price, it's better to take the regular ticketOur favorite moment was meeting the cute otter couple and watching the documentary in the cinema area. I would have really wanted to include more educational or experiential aspects (as the Zoo from Vienna had - including the Ocean segment), but overall it was ok. It's, for sure, one of the highlights of Lisbon.

Good but expansive. I went only once, because it's very expansive to go with children.I want to go again because I consider that it is very educational for all the family.The suggestion that I give to the owners is to lower the price at least for the families.

Excellent aquarium - dolphin free!. We visited the Oceanario with three kids (6-14). We have been to several other aquariums, but this one was perhaps the best. We bought tickets online and walked right in.The layout of the exhibit is well thought out, with plenty of viewing areas. The variety of fish and other species was impressive. We all enjoyed the two hours, our so, that we spent there.Definitely worth a visit if you're in Lisbon. This place does not have whales or dolphins.

A big aquarium with many different types of fish!. This is mostly a giant fish tank with the building built around it, and you get multiple views of a very large fish tank, although other smaller exhibits are their as well. It has many different types of fish in, a lot of which I'd never seen or heard of before, and I really enjoyed the visit. I'd recommend a visit, especially fun for children, and a good activity for a rainy day, unless you really are not in to fish. You get a discount with the "Lisbon Card"

Aquarium Visit. Great little visit. Came with my parents and husband, and we always enjoy the aquariums when we travel. The temporary exhibit was beautiful and it was a great way to end our first day in Lisbon

Almost all the water animals you can think of!. It has well organized areas where you can see different types of fishes and other water animals divided based on the geography. Pacific, indian tropical, coral reef etc. Great educative experience for kids & adults too.

Huge aquarium but nothing special. We have been into several aquariums and our expectations were that this would be the one that would amaze us. There is one huge box full of fishes and you just go around it on 2 floors. Then you can see some frogs in boxes, small dishes, and a colony of penguins. Don't get us wrong, it's a lovely place to take the kids but it just didn't trigerred the wow in us.Tip: go later in the day. There are a lot of schools and eldery centers groups in the morning.
The Best. I've been in some aquariums, and Oceanário is still the best by far . A lot of different species, located in a stunning scenario.
Nice experience for everybody from territory :). It was a first time for me to visit such "facility". I recommend to anybody who have not been to such. Nice relaxing and interesting hour and a half.

Wow factor ocean view. Exactly as described ........mega clear views of fascinating species......see the Sun Fish and wonder why why why did anyone who created the planet think that these swimming boulders fitted

Highly recommend a visit. And a walk through the Park of the Nations afterwards! The oceanarium is fascinating, at €14 per ticket, you get access to the temporary and permanent exhibitions. It will take about 2 hours to look through everything depending on how fast you read, how fast you walk and how many photos you take. Make sure you see the Sunfish in the main tank, amazing creatures! Enjoy!

Interesting species in a well organized oceanarium. I've seen quite a few aquariums but saw a Moon Fish for the first time in this one. The aquarium is well organized and can be visited by walking around the main aquarium, with many surrounding smaller ones.Kids always enjoy these visit and even though they don't read and get everything, there is always a little something that catches their attention and stays in mind.It took us about 1 hour 30 to walk around the aquarium with many touch-and-go at various window displays.We ate the restaurant but somehow regretted it after having experienced the much better and enjoyable food in the center on Lisbon's restaurants. It's convenient to have a small snack or drink + fruits or cake (large choice).

Without hesitation excellent. First buy you tickets online and visit at the morning. Be prepare for paid parking place. Dont miss cinema with movie about the backstage. Also Expo 98 area where is Oceanarium located is interesting.

Go there!. We have seen a few big Oceanariums in Europe in places such as Monaco or London . This place is well maintained and much cheaper the the others. We also attended the temporary exhibition -was brilliant.

Great views of some big fish. If you enjoy what the ocean can offer you will like this. In fact it was one of the best sights to see in Lisbon. The entry fee is very reasonable and the subjects are well presented with excellent photo opportunities.
Spectacular!. Go see the ocean sunfish! Worth the visit for that one view alone. It is very well done and there are lots of things to enjoy

Beautiful displays - well organized. Very large aquarium - a wide range of creatures - and well organised displays. Clearly a lot of thought went into the planning and the time taken to go round all the levels seemed to be just right. Superb colours of sea anemones, graceful movements of the Rays and jellyfish, the range of sizes of the fish, the camouflages particularly of the flat fish were just some of the memories of the day.....
Amazing experience. Quite the best aquarium I have seen. Recomend that you see the short film describing the care the staff take to look after the fish.
Pretty cool. It's a pretty cool aquarium. Lots of fish and other animals to see. The location isn't very good. There's nothing to do near by.
Okay . Good place to hang if it is raining. However, we had been to Sydney aquarium recently which was amazing so didn't find it that exciting

Family fun . Great family location . Definitely one of the best aquariums that I've seen . The staff was very friendly and are quick to point you towards the elevator if you have a small child in a stroller . Plenty of restaurants close by . The street parking was a bit scarce so I paid too park at the indoor parking . It cost about seven euros , just make sure you pay for the parking at the machine . It then gives you a ticket that and than you place into the machine in order for you to leave . If not you'll be sitting at the gate with angry people behind you calling you a dummy in another language .... So I've heard ...

A must for all lovers of the oceans. The main reason for my visit to Lisbon and it did not disappoint. The temporary exhibition was a beautiful example of japanese garden based aquarium decorations. The tanks were huge with a wide variety of tropical fish, the music and ambiance of the room make for a relaxing and excitable experience. The main attraction involved walking around a large central aquarium with natural exhibits of environments from around the world from arctic to indian ocean. The design was flawless, the information was interesting. An amazing experience all for 17 euros.

The largest aquarium in Europe!. The temporary exhibition Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano is a very unique experience and not to be missed. I hope since Takashi Amano died, the exhibition will be made permanent. It would be so interesting to see the evolution in the tank.The rest of the aquarium is a nice visit. It is interesting the way the tanks are organised around the central one.I am happy the aquarium does not imprison large mammals such as dolphins or orcas. The otters are very cute and probably the animals every visitor prefers!
Hopeless Organisation. Spent time getting there, then could not get in due to queues and the failure of ticket machines. All we can say is get there early, late or avoid!
Great attraction. Nothing to do with Portugal as such.. Especially with kids this place is worth a visit. Just don't expect a "Portugese experience". It's a good attraction - period.

Great aquarium - kids loved it - but skip the temporary exhibit. We had a great day at the Oceanario - the permanent exhibits were informative, clean, and well spaced. Our children had a great time - one of the highlights of our trip to Lisbon. The only negative was that we paid the extra 8 euros to go to the temporary exhibit, which was very small and disappointing - just not worth the money so avoid.

Interesting place to spend a couple of hours. Really liked the huge aquarium in the center of the building as you could see it from different angles as you walked around over the two floors. Also liked the outdoor areas that represented different environments.
Iphones. Sometimes hard to see the fish because people are trying to take photos of everything. It was really annoying. Unbelievable scenes.

Brilliant place, well worth a visit. Great spot to visit, very relaxing and the whole park around it is a perfect place for a walk, well worth few hour visit.. Bit hard to find, but once you do-you won't be disappointed!

Much better than expected. I was a bit surprised when an aquarium came in as the best thing to do in Lisbon on Tripadvisor. But, on our last day we had some free time so took the bus up there. We got a bit of a discount thanks to our Hop on Hop off bus too.Had lunch in the basic, yet quite nice cafe before viewing the exhibits. This is no ordinary aquarium though and was actually really good. As well as sharks, rays and all the fish you could ask for they also have a small selection of reptiles along with penguins, puffins and otters. Really great place well spread out with plenty of viewing areas. Definitely worth the journey.

Anniversary visit. Me and my boyfriend decided to visit the Oceanario de Lisboa for our two year anniversary because it came highly recommended. The Oceanario was excellent, the best part being the Sea Otters! The only thing that I was disappointed with was the fact that there weren't many sharks, I really expected something more.
Swimming with the fish. Fantastic place to visit, lots of beautiful and interesting fish. Favourite thing were the 2 otters who seemed to put on a show for everyone

Wonderful Aquarium!. Absolutely fantastic aquarium, the main tank is very impressive, filled with sharks, rays, sunfish and loads of other species. There are also other areas to see with penguins, otters, amphibians, etc. All the tanks and enclosures are clearly very well maintained. There's plenty to see and loads of information to take in, allow at least 3 hours for a proper visit.Reasonably priced at 17 euros each for the main aquarium plus the temporary exhibition. A little bit cheaper if you only want to see the main aquarium.

Interesting . We pre-booked tickets for oceanario, which gave us a small discount and enabled us to skip the queues. It was a good couple of hours of entertainment with very interesting fish and amphibians.

wow!. This was my second visit at Oceanario, many years after the first. This is absolutely (for me) the best in the world! Everything is perfect and there are so many explanations that you can really spend whole day here. I appreciate above all the nice otters but the main fish tank is beyond words! Super recommended for children and adults!

The must-see place in Lissbon. This is a great place where you can see a lot of sea inhabitants.
If you can see fishes in other places like Monte-Carlo oceanarium this one gives you an opportunity to see sea cats and penguins
The level of cuteness is over 100%
Children adore it

Good for a try. The building is amazing and the concept is kinda cool. Price is really not expensive and you could buy your ticket online and bring the PDF with your phone. The only thing is that you should remember is a central principle aquarium with tiny ones asides, two floors to explore the central aquarium, nice for a 2 or 3h trip

Amazing for children & adults. This is definitely worth a visit! It's truly amazing for both children & adults. It has every type of fish and sea creature known. Including 2 massive sun fish that look like giant dinosaurs! Even adults were commenting on them. I've never seen anything like them. There are plenty of windows and little ones can get right up there and sit and watch for as long as they like. The penguins and otters look delighted with themselves and seem to delight in all the visitors. My daughter enjoyed it so much and she's only 2. She said "this is so cool" the whole time. It's really fascinating and such a brilliant experience. I'd highly recommend it. Tickets are 10% cheaper when bought online and there are 3 card machines just outside. It does get busy - a lot more in the afternoon - so can be a little packed. Maybe choose your visiting time for mornings. The Oriente metro is about 10minutes if you're with little ones and not the most beautiful walk. However once you get towards the area it's super nice. They have cobblestone everywhere along the way. I'd highly recommend this to everyone - all the family will enjoy it!

beautiful, must see if you are in Lisbon. Unfortunately we had just 1 hour to visit the Oceanário. But it was more than worth it. You could spend there the whole day. The exhibition is nicely split to different geographic regions with big pool dominating in the centre. Newt time I come I definitely plan to spend there more time.

Best aquarium we have ever visited. We decided on our final day in Lisbon to go to the aquarium as it was raining outside, we got an uber from our hotel in Marques de Pombal to the aquarium for €10. When we arrived we bought two tickets that allowed us access to both the aquarium and the temporary expedition for €17 euros each. The aquarium was very busy with people of all ages. It was home to thousands of different species and allowed you to see a variety of different things. It was informative and interactive allowing customers to increase there knowledge of the wildlife within. It took us about two hours in total to see everything. If I was to return I would not pay additional for the temporary expedition as it was just a room with some fish tanks in, not particularly informative or specialist in comparison to what we had already seen in the main aquarium. The most spectacular part was the main tank which was the central attraction of the whole aquarium you could see it from any point and it was filled q large variety of fish, sharks, otters, rays etc etc! Would definitely recommend to everybody.
Brilliant. The Oceanario de Lisboa provides a fantastic experience for the children in a world class Oceanarium. It's definately a must do for any family trip to Lisbon.
Beautiful attractive . Awesome environment I felt so free n i was feeling as if I am living with those incredible n crazy under water creatures
Amazing. First time in here ! What a beautiful place .There are so many good things to see here Quite big with so many diferent tipes of fish

What a wonderful aquarium. I really loved my visit here, to an amazing but reasonably priced aquarium. The main tank is amazing, the penguins made my day and the little jungle walk is a nice touch. A must do!

Amazing experiences. We spend half day in. I have been to many aquariums in Europe and this one is the best. Truly enjoyable. They have a lockers (same size as the gym one) - big enough for my smal backpack - cost 1 euro. Benches inside the Oceanario give you the possibility to sit down and watch all the fishes. Outside is caffe Roma where you can refresh with nice ice crem. Highly recommend!

Worth the visit. We liked a lot! Is very interesting they separate each ocean (atlantic, pacific, etc) and their fauna. The temporary exhibition (florestas submersas) is very beautiful too. Is a tour you can do alone, with friends, kids or with you beloved one.
A treat for all ages. Ended up here by accident really...what a break, we really enjoyed their exhibits. It's very informative but fun also...especially the penguins and sea otters.

Worth a visit. We used our ticket from the sight seeing tour to get down here, which was ideal. The only downside was, due to it not been peak season, the buses were not regular so we were waiting for over an hour.But besides that, we loved it! We paid for both areas, we didn't really enjoy this temporary one. So not sure I would bother going! If I'm honest. Well worth the journey it takes to get here, you won't be disappointed young or old!
An aquarium with a good planning and design.. So close to a shopping mall and my conference venue. Great aquarium with sections dedicated to the 5 oceans.

where you learn and be dazzled. enjoyed both the permanent and temporary exhibitions. the forests underwater created by takasi amano are so mesmerizing and inspiring. amano is a true artist and has meaningful messages to convey to us all. appreciate how many thoughts go into the making of the garden. the lighting, the music, the seats, the curation. everythings just right. there are so many different species in the permanent exhibition that hours can be spent without u ever noticing it.
We enjoyed the visit here. Lots to see. You can save time buying tickets ahead. The penguin exhibit was our favourite. Even with a large school field trip there it was still fun

Don't miss the temporary exhibit. Went here on a rainy day. We were uncertain whether to visit the temporary exhibit (which doesn't look too temporary) ad it was fantastic. The main exhibit is well laid out and the central tank very impressive. Worth a visit with or without kids.

Amazing experience of the oceans. A city break in Lisbon would not be complete without a trip to the Oceanario. It is amazing and a must see for all, Our 8 and 11 year old were blown away.Give your self 1/2 a day and make sure you visit the current temporary exhibit of forests under the sea - beautiful

Brilliant. I have to say this is the best sea life centre I have ever been to! Can't praise it enough! We spent a good few hours wandering around, taking in everything that was there, simply an amazing day!
Never saw such a nice Oceanarium before. It was worth to go there even if we had the nicest weather outside. The Oceanario in Lisbon is the best I ever saw!
Nice Tank, Good collection. Has a huge tank in the middle with a few sections of tanks on the sides. Has a good collection of marine life. I have seen bigger aquariums though.
Oceanário de Lisboa. Awesome! Great architecture by the Tagus River. You can walk nearby. Urban nice scenario and visit this amazing place with or without kids.
Fantastic place!. The place shows an amazing scope of water animals. It is a wonderful place to visit, not only for children!
Very enjoyable. We enjoyed the experiece even we were all adults with kids. It was not croweded at this time of year and it was a great bonus

Amazing Aquarium. This aquarium is absolutely beautiful, Both the temporary exhibition and the permanent one are worth a visit. The aquarium shows the underwater life at different parts of the world, for four part they also have an above the water part where you can see otters, penguins and different other birds. The Oceanario is located at the former world exhibition part of Lisbon where there are more nice things to see and you can spend at least half a day at the oceanario and this area.

Lots of variety.. We were looking for something interesting to do and found out that the Oceanario was one of the best aquariums in the world. We had an amazing time here watching penguins and octopuses. Great place to visit, better if you have kids.
Worth to spend half a day !. This is a great place in Lisbon. I have returned after many years. Enjoyed the day ! Truly one of the best I have seen

The main tank is awesome. So, the main aquarium tank is by far the main attraction at this place. The other parts of it ie the smaller tanks etc were normal and nothing special, however the main tank more than makes up for it. I've never seen such a large tank with so many viewing windows where you can just sit and enjoy the array of sealife! To watch the sharks swimming right by your head, the stingrays and all of the other animals in one giant tank was just awesome to watch! Literally spent a lot of time sat there enjoying the view.
Brilliant Place. Very informative, great place, conservation top priority, tanks and surrounds in perfect condition. Good value cafe too!

Stunning. Fabulous, it's on the Yellow Bus tour, purple route. The temporary exhibition alone is worth the admission price, it was so beautiful and calm, we were captivated. The rest of the aquarium is great too, the otters were fun. The sunfish wins the prize of ugliest fish with the prettiest name! Fantastic glimpse in to another world.

Best aquarium ever? . Possibly. It's bloody amazing. Those sunfish had me fixated. As did the otters. Particularly when they ride on their backs and put their paws over their eyes. The little rascals.

Ok place. Ok place - a bit dissaponting because of the good rates in tripadviser. We have better Ocenarias in Denmark. Small bassins for many of the animals. The temporary exhibition was vaste of money and time.
Rainy afternoon. Brilliant ! It was cold and raining so we decided to visit the Oceanario and it was amazing. This is a must visit on a trip to Lisbon .

Picked the wrong time!. Well the oceanarium was probably very good but unfortunately the time I chose to visit turned out to be a half-term school holiday. The place therefore was full of school parties with children running about everywhere and so the experience was marred somewhat. I shall have to go at a less busy time and will then be able to give a proper review.
One of the bests Aquariums in the world. The Oceanario de Lisboa really worths a visit. The main aquarium has got 5 milion litres of seawater and lots of fish, including sharks.
Spectacular. We had a lovely visit to this attraction. It was a bit busy but we managed to see in all the tanks. They permit photography as long as you don't use flash.

Great visit. Visited the oceanario group of 7..Worth the price you pay for what you see.The dolphin show is a MUST SEE. aswell as the sea lions..amazing views. Animals well looked after. Great visit definatly recomend

Trip to oceanarium. Great place to visit with friends and family was an awesome experience. We saw sharks . We also saw many different types of exotic fishes. It was a very good day out. We enjoyed our time we spent there. I would go there again if i was to go portugal again.

Day out.. This is a must for all be it couples familys or just you on your own. We spent several hours here. Full of some of the most unusual marine life as well as the beautiful. Great value for money.
Great day out. All good. Really enjoyed the visit. Kids had a great time and very reasonably priced family ticket. Fish are awesome!
Excellent place!. Excellent place. A very nice way to spend your afternoon, lots of different "fish" types and not only.

Great place . Lovely Aquarium with lots of fish to see. The kids loved it. There was also a temporary exhibition which was cool.
Very reasonable price for families too!

Visited several oceanarios. This is the best, by far.... One of the best Oceanarios in the world! Huge number of marine species, fantastic location in one of the new Lisbon quarters, Situation witth view over the large river Tagus. In terms of arquitecture is very modern, and the design is unique.

A great aquarium, but .... We visited the Oceanarium when it was not too busy, so it didn't take too long to get tickets and get in. The free WiFi near the entrance was good to find. The huge tank that can be seen throughout the aquarium is stunning and it's possible just to sit/stand and look at it for ages. The fish from various oceans around the world are great to see too, as are the few sea birds like penguins and it was good to see some of these being fed.Sometimes, it was hard to work out what was on display (for example, the frogs didn't seem to be named). Towards the end, too, the dry heat and darkness made me feel like I had had enough. The restaurant at the end seemed a little expensive with a limited range, so it was good to find the small cafe through the gift shop. We didn't buy much in the gift shop because the prices seemed high.What might make it better? Free WiFi throughout the site would be nice, along with a cafe part-way round and some less expensive gifts.
Unbelievable. Absolutely amazing. Don't miss. They created many different coves to view the large aquarium in the center of the building.

Superb. This is a must visit in Lisbon! The temporary exhibit, Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano is utterly brilliant. It will bring you a sense of calm that is difficult to put into words! Highly recommended!

Great Aquarium. This was the nicest aquarium I have visited in Europe and one of the best in the world I have seen. It was a little pricey to get in, but well worth the money. It was not too crowded as we visited on a Saturday in the offseason.

One or even the best in Europe. This oceanarium is one of the best places to take your friends or family if you enjoy this type of thing. It has a lot to see and it is very well managed. As a bonus, the area of Lisbon were it is located is also a good place to be with a very beautiful view of the ocean. For sure it will not be a waste of time!
Don't miss. If you are in Lisbon, don't miss this wonderful Ocenario! You will be amazed by the variety of species and the amazing ambience.

Best aquarium I've been to. The ticket price seems a little steep at first in comparison to other places you can visit in Lisbon, but it really is an amazing aquarium and others I have visited in the past back in England pale in comparison- especially given that they have always been even more pricey to get into. The main tank is absolutely huge and contains highlights such as a very rare Ocean Sunfish and several very large sharks. I particularly loved the puffins and the sea otters. If you're in need of food there is also a decent cafe.
An absolute must!. Beautiful it's like being transported into another world. The tank makes you feel like you're actually in the water with the fish!

Geographical areas. Our kids love aquariums, we have been to the one in Bangkok and in Singapore which were both great. What I really liked about the Lisbon aquarium is the use of desperate geographical areas to show related plant and animal life. In doing that not only did the kids learn about the different types of fishes and plant but also about different climates in different parts of the world. The temporary exhibit is also worth going to. After the silence and darkness of the main feature, you get in a trace when you enter the temporary exhibition space.

Great on a rainy day. My 6 years old daughter loved it! A very popular attraction not only among kids as I could notice! The central piece is the main water tank where sharks, stingrays and some other less known fish swim undisturbed.

Really nice day out. Had a lovely day out here- was good to visit the permanent exhibition first- but buy online if you can to avoid the queues (and its cheaper). Great Acquarium- prob one the best that I have been to- VERY large, so make sure you have your walking shoes on! Just when you think you've gone full circle, you find another surprising corner :)

Awsome. This oeanarium was huge, it took us a few hours to get round it. It was really interesting and the range of aquatic animals and fish was splendid. Don't miss the short film show telling how the place is run and the creatures fed. It explained how the small fish were able to live in harmony with the sharks without being eaten.
Thoroughly Recommend. Best aquarium we've visited and one of the best things to do in Lisbon especially with children. Can easily spend 2 hours.
Brilliant place!. We really enjoyed the Oceanarium. There is plenty to see, make sure to watch out for the sea otters, which are really cute, and the Sun Fish, which is amazing!!

Spectacular aquarium!. Our family (2 teenagers) thorough enjoyed our visit to Oceanario. The exhibits are beautiful and well maintained. This is a must for sea creature lovers and aquatic enthusiasts. The environment throughout the exhibit is peaceful and serene yet constantly interesting.

Impressive!. Great experience. The tank on the middle of the building is the main attraction. Many beautiful species. All exhibits around it are great too. Kids loved it and we all fell in love with the different kind of pinguins. Two hours should be enough to see it thoroughly.
Very interesting. It is a excellente attraction. The main fish tank is huge and you can get this feeling like you are inside the fish tank. Recommended.

Nirvana :). You come to see the ocean and you see the ocean stares back at you with so many eyes. Very intense feeling with all those sea animals...when you look at the big blue screens in the darkness of the sourroundings it puts you into some special relaxing trans state. Funny but you could have seen few people just sitting next to the screen, in silence and barely moving while staring into those.

Great place for the kids. We saved this for a wet and windy day. Great place and loads to see. Parking was easy to find. Book ahead on line and save the 10% and beat the queues. We literally just walked straight in. The exhibits are all clean and worth having a look at. The temporary exhibit was awesome.

Superb!. Visit with kids was superb! Good sensation watching fish in their (simulated) natural environment. The kids, especially the young, had much fun and enjoy everything. The big aquariums allow us to see clearly all life there. There are no bad smells inside and everything is clean. Many variety of species, from sharks to reef inhabitants. Good location in Expo also makes it easier to access. Allways good! Superb!

Excellent Family Day Out. Great value - a pre-booked Family pass for 44euros. We spent 3-4 hours in the oceanarium, you could easily spend a lot longer.The central tank is simply stunning, with an array of sharks, colossal Sunfish, manta rays, barracuda, etc.Went with high expectations having read the reviews on TA and it didn't fail to impress, Simply the highlight of a weekend visit to Lisbon, enjoyed by the children and adults alike!!!

Well laid out, great for families. Paid 14 euros for the permanent exhibition. Lots to see with the huge main tank and the outer areas with penguins and otters. Information provided in English - gives the main facts without being too much to take in. Lots of viewing windows and with the two floors and floor to ceiling windows means even the smallest child can see and experience the sealife - plenty of space to sit by the windows too and just watch the fish swim past. Easy to spend at least 2 hours here. Cafe was good too. About 10-15 minutes easy, flat walk from the Oriente metro station and close to Parque das Nações for the restaurants and cable car if wanted. I had to queue for about 5 mins to get in even late on an off-season weekday (admittedly public holiday) - so possibly worth buying tickets in advance in high season.

Superbly fascinating. Came here on a very rainy weekend and so glad we did. We opted to see the temporary as well as the permanent exhibitions which cost an extra 3€. We did the temporary one first. It was interesting, but didn't take long. The permanent one was just amazing, though. They had fish in there I'd never heard of and the size and variety of species is very impressive. I would post a photo of my favourite one, but it wouldn't convey just how unusual the animal is (and might detract from the surprise if you go there too).There is a main central tank which has numerous viewing points around the building. They also have otters (cuteness factor on overdrive there), a few amphibian and lots of manic penguins.There is a café just after the entrance where you can get free WiFi. Wear comfortable shoes and if you're using your phone to take photos, make sure you turn the flash off.We were there for 4 hours in total. Money well spent. However, be aware that it's quite a trek from the Metro station (Oriente) so little (or older) legs might get tired. There is a Lot of walking involved. It is very much worth it, though.There is a gift shop there selling the usual kind of thing, including cuddly sharks and stingrays. Because of course.

Very nice aquarium.....worth a visit.. We have an aquarium near our home so was nice to go to one to compare. This one has a massive tank and its lovely to see the penguins as well.We paid 17 euros each for all the exhibits but it was cheaper just to do the main tank area and the permanent exhibitions, we spent about 2-3 hours here but you could easily spend more time here.

Feast for the Eye. If you like watching fish in their (almost) natural environment - it´s the place for you. Especially on a rainy day. I was there with my 15-year-old son and we both had fun (dont forget your camera and no flash please). It´s big enough not to feel squeezed by other visitors, comfortable enough to have a rest and just watch those beautiful creatures and is very well organized, so you can always find the way out or bathroom facilities. And there are no bad smells inside (what I do not like about other aquariums I happened to visit in my life).

Fascinating. One of the best things to do in Lisbon, for sure, is a visit to Oceanario. The variety of species, from sharks to Reef colourful inhabitants, the special pavillion dedicated to sea turtles, and the many other tanks/areas, make it an ideal place to spend more than a few hours. Its location in the former Expo area of Lisbon also makes it easier to access.

Best Aquarium I have visited.. If you don't go anywhere else in Lisbon, go here. You don't have to be a biologist to appreciate the way this is displayed. But go in the morning before the crowds to get the best of your visit, then lunch in the restaurant. Admission is very reasonable.

Aquarium is stunning but very crowded!. The oceanario itself is good; the aquarium is, of course, stunning; but it's very crowded! You can assists feeding times of for example the penguins but they hardly advertise it. Check the information boards of the animals for the feeding times! Most inside areas around the aquarium are very dark! They show a short behind-the-scenes film about the preparation of food and feeding of the animals at the oceanario that's worthwhile!

Awesome! Loved it!. This aquarium had a unique design. Numerous tanks with various sealife all surrounding a huge center tank, over two floors. Especially liked that the aquarium aimed to teach about conservation. Great experience and very enjoyable!

Wonderful aquarium. Beautiful aquarium with extensive range of sea life in wonderful environments; lovely temporary exhibition included aquariums as 'Japanese underwater gardens' with atmospheric soundtrack; even towards the end of our tour (couple of hours) there were still lots of 'oohs' and 'ahhs' as each area presented fascinating insights into the world of the oceans

Recommended if you aren't pressed for time. This is the first aquarium I have ever been to and it did not disappoint. Even though it is ranked as one of the best in the world, I wasn't sure what to expect. I only had about 2 hours to explore, but could have stayed longer because I didn't have the time to make it to the special exhibit. It is super easy to access by train and GREAT for a family with young kids. Make sure you wait around to see the sea otters. They aren't always visible in their habitat, but they will make an appearance. If I only had 2-3 days in Lisbon, I might skip it and make sure to fully explore the city (especially Alfama and Belem) and a day trip to Sintra, but if you have some extra time, it is worth a visit.

Creative Aquarium :). It is not too big and it is just fit to reach the animals underwater. It contains lots of spots for people to take photos. It has an open area for a bird with red mouth. They can fly outside the cage. Staffs are nice. Place are clean.Moreover, we kept our luggage in a security room. It is more convenient when we will leave Lisboa after visited.

Wow!. Definitely deserves all the glowing reviews on TA. Easy to get to through public transportation. An amazing display of different types of sea life from the 5 oceans. Can be crowded, but you will have no problem seeing all the sites with a bit of patience. Fun and educational for all ages.

Best thing to do in Lisbon . Make sure to pay the extra money and see both aquariums! The smaller exhibit is so tranquil and I could have spent hours sitting in front of the tank watching the little tropical fish. It is worth mentioning that you are allowed to take photos but be sure to turn your flash off. The whole aquarium is quite big and you could easily spend 2-3 hours here. There are lots of restaurants andCoffee shops close by and in the actual building itself. I can guarantee you will be blown away by some of the Sharks!! It is so strange to see them swimming so close by! We learned so much from our visit and I would definitely go back!

Excellent for small kids, must visit. Visited with two kids, 3 and 6 years old. They loved. Very well build and pleasant to visit, a must do in Lisbon.Also check the "Pavilhao do Conhecimento" (Science Museum) if your kids likes science. It was a half day visit worth the time.

Fascinating and amazing place. This is a must for visitors to Lisbon whether you are a couple or family. It is the largest aquarium we have seen. The range fish and mammals was amazing with various areas to suit the environment of the aninimals. Very encouraging to see the conservation carried out. Don't miss this!!!!!
A Day With The Fishes. I went there last summer and I can say that it was a fantastic day. The oceanarium has lots of fun thing to offer and it can certainly make your vacations better.
Great family activity. Good for all ages/ learnt lots and really enjoyed the film. Loved the otters and the jellyfish. Food nearby is not great.

My god, the sea sites the diferents they are beautifull. There is a large central tank, with two viewing levels, representative of all the oceans with their distinctive species and its periphery find small windows of very specific and wonderful species. It is a very educational tool for all of us.

Best sea aquarium for miles and miles.. Oceanário de Lisboa is located at the renewed settings of Expo'98 and is therefore a fairly recent attraction in Lisbon. It's a "must visit" for anyone with a specific interest in marine biology and quite worthwhile for the remaining curious about sea-life. The tour circuit is set around a central, very large tank, and other four smaller tanks, representing each of the oceans, and features anything from fishes to birds, mammals to invertebrates. The only thing missing is a view of the tank from underneath - all existing views are either sideways or from above.
Great Aquarium. A fabulous place to visit. So many different species in this enormous place. It is worth it buying tickets to both exhibitions - temporary and permanent one.
Top10 Lisbon. If you go to Lisbon this is a must. For adult and kids . Great for a rain day . Do not miss the temporary exibition
Impressive . Brilliant place to go to, really enjoyed it. Much better than london aquarium. The main tank is enormous and so many different unusual fish..loved it
Wow, it is really good.. This is really good place to visit. Lots of fish, lots of small places to see. It is interesting not only for kids.

Simply the best Aquarium that I ever new.. At least one should reserve 2 to 3 hours time, to have a good experience at the Oceanário. Try to cisit it during the morning as it is more adequate, silent and less crowded

Fantastic and well thought out. Kids and adults will love it.. A brilliant day out. We have visited a lot of aquariums and this one was fabulous. It has a fantastic collection of fish, rays, sharks and other animals (including sea otters). Well worth a visit and, if you have kids, don't miss the fantastic interactive Science Museum 'Ciencia Viva' a few minutes walk away.

My daughter loved it. I haven't been to many aquariums so I have a poor frame of reference with which to judge this one. The central tank is huge and there are some really interesting fish in it, not least the sunfish which is one of the weirdest looking things I have ever seen. The penguins are always cool. The sea otters seem to be the celebrity residents here and they are pretty awesome creatures. So yes it's an interesting day out. I learned a few things. It's fairly expensive (15 euros). My two year old loved it so recommended on that basis.
Interesting and educative!. A huge tank with vary many different species, as well as different rooms with even some birds and other animals (sea otter, penguins, frogs). Impressive!
Love the sea otters. Amazing, and good fun for adults and families. I loved the sea otters! Enjoyable day out. Must go!!!

Very nice place to visit. The place is huge and it has an option of two routes - shorter and longer one. We went with the 2.5-year-old boy therefore, we took the shorter one. We all enjoyed it very much. The main tank is amazing and it has so many creatures in it that you can watch for a very long time. Sharks were huge and sometimes even scary. The tanks are so clean in comparison with other places I visited. The overall atmosphere is very good and it makes you relax. The travel was slightly more complicated but it is in the Expo town so if you know something about architecture you will enjoy even the 1000meters journey from the bus stop (train station) to the place. The only regret is that we could not be longer.
Wonderful visit. I went there with my grand children an We all loved it. We saw the temporary exibition of the submersed forest. Very good. A Very pleasent morning and we learned a lot about oceans.

Amazing Place. This has to be one of the best aquariums in the world. It is mainly one enormous tank that is incredibly naturalistic with an amazing assortment of Fish and sealing. A wonderful day out that I'd highly recommend to anyone.

Its good to come back everytime. I live in Lisbon and time to time I go to the Oceanário de Lisboa. Everytime its diferente. New species its a great feeling see the animals in the water swimming just in front of you. Its relaxing time and I always take somente who never went there to show them a great place to take family.Forever oceanario de Lisboa
Espetacular. One of the most beautiful places to enjoy and watch sea world! If you come to Lisbon this is a must see to visit
Excellent attraction!. This aquarium is outstanding with a huge main tank and four smaller tanks representing the four oceans. Highly recommend.

Biggest fish tank I've ever seen. The Lisbon Aquarium is one huge tank. You walk around the edges of the tank spiraling up to the top. Sections of the tank are covered and others are open portals to view the aquarium from different angles. There have two mola mola sunfish which for me was amazing to see in person. They also have lots of cool corals and tropical fish. Upstairs the climate changes to polar and they have a 'chilly' penguins exhibit with an ice glacier that comes right over the hand rails. This aquarium has to be amount the best in the world A+

Enjoyable Visit. TThe weather was quite wet whilst I was in Lisbon so I decided to go and have a look at this aquarium to stay out of the rain. It was well worth visiting, all the tanks and displays were very well presented and it was so relaxing just to sit and watch the fish go by. There was plenty of information around displayed in both Portuguese and English and this helped to enhance the experience as you could learn about all the different fish and other ocean life as you walked around the aquarium. It was quite quiet when I visited and there was plenty of seating available so you could sit and watch the fish if you wanted. A great place to visit on your own or with the family. Children especially would love it and the entrance fee was very reasonable especially with the discount offered with the hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus. he weather was quite wet whilst I was in Lisbon so I decided to go and have a look at this aquarium to stay out of the rain. It was well worth visiting, all the tanks and displays were very well displayed and it was so relaxing just to sit and watch the fish go by. There was plenty of information around displayed in both Portuguese and English and this helped to enhance the experience as you could learn about all the different fish and other ocean life as you walked around the aquarium. It was quite quiet when I visited and there was plenty of seating available so you could sit and watch the fish if you wanted.

Great 2 hrs with family. 50 Euros for 2 adults and 3 kids
10 Euro cab ride from Alfama
Great exhibits - likely will take 2 hours to go through
Kids will love it
Buy tickets online - faster and saves 10%

Worth the detour . Located in a modern part of town, it is a very large aquarium with beautiful creatures. The sea otters are super cute! Glad to see they didn't do shows and seemed to treat the animals well.
worth Visiting. The Oceanario of Lisbon is really one of the best aquarium in the world. Tickets are also available for children with a good discount.
Beautifull. Amazing tanks with beautifull animals. Nice environment, dark and cozy. Great for an afternoon or rainy days.

A paradise. In Ocenario I seems to be in Paradise, is really very big and extremely relaxed to spend there 3 hours.
The sharks I saw there and Moon-fish of 2.000 Kg are something to remember.
Congratulation to Lisbon to have such a rich attraction!

Definitely worth it! . We enjoyed a couple of hours wandering around here and would highly recommend it. So we'll designed and informative. Got the yellow tour bus directly there and a 15% discount with the book from the bus too. Highly recommend.

Buy your ticket on the Internet in advance. The queues are very long for this place, having a ticket on your phone does the trick.
The building is interesting, beautifylly situated. You can spend quite a few hours here watching different sorts of marine life. The price is a bit steep but we are very interested in nature and wildlife so it was worth it.
Take your kids for a visit!. Splendid time for the children. A bit too crowdy and shady. Once inside it is difficult to go back! The coffee house is to a avoid.

Large, attractive, modern aquarium. A short walk from the Oriente station, the aquarium is located in the Parque dos Naçoes area of Lisbon which was the site of Expo 98, the year in which the aquarium opened. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the vicinity. When I visited there was an interesting temporary display of an underwater garden by a Japanese artist.

Awe-inspiring. The oceanario demonstrates in a very physical way how the oceans are all connected so that pollution in one area affects all the others. My favourites are the cute otters - in spring they swim about with babies on their tummies

A bit out of the way but magnificent.. It's a LOT better than the London Aquarium. I will never forget the sight of the huge Ocean Sunfishes swimming in the large tank. The glass is curved so your don't get the nauseating vertigo affect when you look into the tanks. The building itself is built on water which adds to the novelty of the place. Well worth a visit.

Great. Excellent experience. My 4-year old kid was so happy to see all those different species of fish. Unfortunally,restaurant inside oceanario was closed at this time. It should be open all year around.

Largest indoor Aquarium in Europe. A really nice Aquarium with lots of different species. It was my third time coming here and I always enjoy it. I particularly appreciated the huge central tank with sharks, sunfish, barracudas and many others. Also very nice the different habitat areas with fish from the different oceans and seas. I loved the puffins and penguins jumping and swimming around.Though a bit pricey i'm happy the money goes into keeping such lovely animals.

Great although out of the way. Really great aquarium. The sea otters are adorable and the exhibits are well-done. The only complaint is that it's a bit out of the way (we took the bus) so finding the return bus to downtown was a challenge! Use the Lisboa card for a slight discount.

Best In The World. I love aquariums, and this one is fabulous.The temporary exhibition (been there over a year now) is a massive planted tank with some small fish in it. Sound boring? It isn't!! This is the best planted tank I've ever seen. Something like 40m long and absolutely perfect. The fish range from cardinals to gouramis with rasboras and tetras - over 40 species. The light-play through the leaves and hiding places for the fish (and shrimps) was magical.The permanent exhibition is awe inspiring. I've been to others with a big central tank, but 5,000,000 litres?! Wow. And the way they've almost imperceptibly split off sections for fresh water or penguins is very well done. The Sea Otters were so cute, and I love Sun Fish so it was neat to see two of them. There's all sorts of fish, but as a fish keeper I was sad that there were no Discus.Rated on the internet as the best aquarium in the world, and it well deserves the title.Also, E17 entry fee is nothing for a place like this.

Good for everyone, young and old!. You'd expect this place to only be interesting to kids, but it's actually fun for everyone. Don't be afraid to turn back and ask staff to return to the top floor if some of the animals you wanted to see were "hiding" when you first walked around: we did this to see the otters, in our first passage they were no-where to be seen, I even asked staff if they had been removed, but it turns out they were just not in the mood. I came back about 45 minutes later and got to enjoy seeing them play.
A great trip. Fabulous side- trip- we took this as a side- trip before our long airplane ride- kids loved it and it was not crowded. Lots of outdoor space if the weather is nice.

Beautiful place to visit with young children... ..but don't forget your baby pushchair because it's so huge they can be tired soon! The visit can be made in one hour or a little bit more so I don't recommend to do near time to children get hungry. In the morning usually you find less people and can be less stressful. My baby loved! It's expensive but a interesting place to visit.
Impressive . It's an impressive aquarium with a huge number and variety of marine life. The puffins were cute. We missed the feeding which tends to happen in the morning. Book online to save 10%

Awe inspiring.. This aquarium is the best we have ever visited. The tanks were huge with an amazing variety of species. To walk round will take about an hour at least. It is like going scuba diving without the bother. If you go to Lisbon make this a must see!

Plunge into the underwater world without scuba gear! . You can relax and enjoy the beauty of underwater inhabitants. There is temporary exhibition "Forests Underwater by Takashi Amono" now, I like it so much
Too small. Nothing to see and too expensive. Go there if you are rich and have a lot of time. Plz dont go there just take the Cable car behind the aquarium.

Huge Aquarium, good if you're trying to find family friendly activities in Lisbon. We visited this aquarium with our 3.5 year old and 1.5 year old children. It was a pleasant surprise, and one of the nicer aquariums I've visited. The main tank in the center of the facility can be viewed from many angles, and my kids loved it. The special exhibit was some natural environment exhibit that was better for adults than kids (not much to see, but very peaceful) but the main exhibit hall did entertain my kids for a few hours. It's a bit of a trek from the main historic part of Lisbon, about a 15 -20 min cab ride, which cost about $15 dollars, but it was a good way to spend a morning with young kids. I wouldn't go there unless I had kids (or if you're really into aquariums) but I though it was well worth a visit with the little ones and would suggest it to families.

best aquarium yet. I love these places and found this one to be the best yet as it was so cleverly designed. There was a temporary exhibition on which consisted of a Japenese artist constructing an entire room od underwater scenes with tropical fish. hard top describe but absloutely beautiful and quite moving.The main exhibit is an enormous glass sided tank which is circular and takes up 4 floors. Wherever you are in the building, this will always be on your left and the smaller exhibits on your right. this allows such a close up, uninterrupted view of the fish-sharks, a vast stone fish, rays, a devil fish etc. It also meant that you didnt need to push and shove to seee stuff as it there all the time. there were several parties of small children during our visit and we never had problems viewing. The usual sections according to the Oceans were present with the fish and creatures you would expect, but again very well set out and informative with just the right amount of information. i wasn't too sure about the puffins and whether they should be captive but they were characterful. Of course, the pair of sea otters are a huge attraction and didn't disappoint, drifting around together holding hands, turning somersaults etc.All in all , well worth the money, especially on a rainy day.

If you have extra time spend it there If not don't waste your time. We got telecabine to reach the Oceanary, it was a little too expensive in comparison to what they offered. Previously I visited two aquariums in Barcelona and Dubai, but here was the summarized version of them. the good thing that I did like was the penguin part.not bad in total view but could have been better.

Beautiful and intresting. I went withmy husband for a day trip to the oceanario. There was a new exhibition there, forests under water, which was sublime!The oceanario in itself is beautiful, varied, fun for adults and young people as well as small children. It has great spaces to sit and watch and simply enjoy the moment!Great attraction! Highly reccomended!

Family fun. This "little"(in the most ironic manner possible) aquarium located on the outskirts of the city of Lisbon boast a large variety of sea creatures and is guarantied fun program for kids or adults alike. Its main tank supplies endless hours of wonder as you gaze upon its inhabitants swimming by. Along the way you cross several other exhibits that keep you engaged and interested. It's also an ideal place for a romantic date. Keep an eye out for the temporary exhibits because some good ones pop up from time to time. You can easily get here by train or subway(estação do oriente). Try to make room for a visit if you can I highly recommend it especially if you find aquariums relaxing.

Must do sight in Lisbon. Best aquarium that I've ever been to! Great layout because it looks like one big ocean that you can walk around, and also find information as you go. Definitely a must do while in Lisbon! It was my favourite attraction in Lisbon and I highly recommend a visit!

Beautiful Oceanarium with large collection of marine species. The Lisbon Oceanarium has a large collection of marine species. Four tanks around the large central tank house four different habitats with their native flora and fauna. The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the few aquariums in the world to house a sunfish due to their unique and demanding requirements for care. Other interesting species include two large spider crabs and two sea otters named Eusébio and Amália, named after two Portuguese contemporary cultural references.

Nice seafood dinner great staff : located on the waterfront. Nice seafood dinner with great staff. you can walk inside the restaurant and see all the fresh food and make your selection from the iced table filled with all types of fish. I saw some of the largest shrimp in fact they were big enough that you could ride them (not Really) They also have some excellent meat dishes for people that prefer that over fish. be sure to order the shrimp in garlic and dip your Portuguese rolls in until it's all goneThe fish is D-boned at the table and fish like Cod and Seabass, which is what we had were lovelyI had the Porkchop. The dinner menu is reasonably priced.
Beautiful Oceanarium. The most beautiful oceanarium i have ever been. All is very well organized and with a huge variety of species and attractions
Beautiful aquarium. Beautiful aquarium for the entire family. Don't miss the ocean sunfish and the otters. Try to go when there are less people, avoid weekends.
the richness of the seas. ideal for family trips with young children to admire the richness of the sea - take time to visit it all in a slow pace
Magnificent. It's just beautiful, well maintained and organized. Entertaining for children and adults. Must see when you're in Lisbon.
Outstanding!!!!. The Lisbon Oceanarium is really marvelous. It is a must visit venue. There are so many types of fish, corals and sea creatures, it is really beautiful.

Great to see the underwater world. As scuba divers on a non-diving vacation, this was a nice respite from touring churches & museums. Everything is well displayed with plenty of access to see the huge aquarium with its variety of sea life in the center of the Oceanario. Great for all ages - plan to spend a few hours there.
Absolutely Fabulous. This aquraium is probably the best I've been to. Huge central aquarium with an immense range of fish. Great restaurant at very reasonable prices. I would go again.
Amazing expereince.. This is one of the best aquariums I have been to. Worth the visit, and you can have a good walk in the area, as the area is interesting.
Best Aquarium ever . The aquarium is very modern. And it gives you the chance to discover all what you need to know about the aquatic life.

Perfect place to go when it rains. I've enjoyed visiting the place a lot. It has all you would expect from an oceanarium and even more. It has a huge aquarium in the middle with sharks, rays and plenty other sea creatures. You can also see penguins there. Not too overcrowded and it has many places to just sit and dive into the ocean life.

Simply the best I've ever been. No words to describe the feeling.. The aquarium, firstly, is situated in the well-known area of 'Parque das Nações' which is relatively quite new and modern on the side of the river, while still being very close to the centre of the city. The aquarium features many types of fish, mammals and invertebrates with many rooms with large glasses to be able to see clearly and in details these extraordinary creatures. This aquarium is perfect for children as it includes videos and tours especially to optimise the experience for children. While being great for children, the aquarium is also perfectly fine for adults to go as a solo, friends and family or as couples as it is not only centre based around entertaining children.

5 years later and it was even better!. They have this settence "Sempre diferente" (always different) as a mission and indeed they made a lot of changes and I spent the same time or more wandering amazed by all the vigorous and sinergic sea life in there. A must see for all ages, kids will enjoy a lot. Temporary was more special to grow-ups.
recomended!!. very nice experience should definitely check it out!various types of fish, a giant aquarium that is in the middle of various types

Nice aquarium . Fairly good aquarium in a nice location away from the city . You could spend the day in the area as many other things to see and do including a fairly large shopping centre. Easy to get to with the metro
Amazing!!!. We have an aquarium in Boston, most assume, Portugal is better than ours, very good to see the fish and very safe. It is worth paying the value of the ticket.I suggest to go visit !!!

this is the most stunning aquarium ever. I have been to quite a lot city aquaria and this one is by far the coolest. It has a big tank in the middle that "follows" you everywhere you go, from every angle you can always see the big tank filled by every kind of fish you can imagine. Since the price is kind of much, I wouldnt go for a second time but for one time it surely is recommendable.
Great visit. Never thought I'd like this venue so much. Albeit on edge of town and not a visit I'd generally choose the BEST attraction of this type I've been in. Brilliant attraction for all ages

Must see when in Lisobon!. Just amazing, must see when in Lisbon! But your tickets online with 10% off, and don't waste time queuing in the ticket office. We paid 15€ for both, main and the temporary exhibitions, totally worth it!

Great time had by all. Really lovely place and easy to get to, lots of herds of excited school children though so you have to work out your own strategy to avoid being swept along and bustled back onto the school bus.

My View. The whole aquarium surrounds a massive tank with all sorts of sea life. This tank is viewable from all levels. On the outer areas are the other life forms. The tiles leading to the aquarium are beautiful showing artistic sea life. Price was good. Food was real good.

Lovely experience. Had a lovely time at this aquarium, the glass was lovely and clean so you could see everything clearly. Great experience and a lovely way to spend an afternoon. Lots of different species of fish and good size tanks for them too!

DONT MISS!!!. Beautiful place, huge aquarium, sharks, fishes, penguins, otters, beautiful exhibition on under water forests.
Great and beautiful experience!!!!
Great for couples, families, kids, everyone!!!
Totally worth the visit!!!
Nice experience. This is a great way to spend an afternoon in a relaxed manner, while apreciating many examples of sealife.

Lovely oceanarium experience!. Set out to East of central Lisbon, in a lovely area to visit, is the Oceanarium. Once the busy bit at the start is done, there are lots of places to wait, or sit, and have great views of a wide variety of ocean dwelling creatures. Well worth a visit!

Awesome oceanarium. This was one of the highlights of a visit to Lisbon. At a little over £12 p/p entry fee, both my wife and I came away amazed and mesmerised by the scale, quality and quantity of marine life, from various oceans around the world, on show. There was no pressure to hurry through the exhibition with plenty of time to just stop and stare. Worth every penny/euro! Thoroughly recommend.

The Ocean close to the Ocean. Located in the Expo '98 Area (Parque das Naçoes), the Océanario is the ideal activity on a rainy day and, by far, the best place to have fun with your kids while in Lisbon! We really had a great time enjoying the view of the different species of fish swimming in the huge tank! I only found the ticket a little overpriced even with the online discount.

Very nice experience, very well kept. Beautiful location and perfect activity to do on a rainy day. The kids loved it, and watching the big tank with all those fish was the most relaxing thing to do ever. Totally worth it the expensive entry fee.
Fun time. Fun time spent with a few hours to burn. Easily accessible by taxi.. Tickets available online. Lots of fish & creatures.

Must see!. If you have any interest in freshwater plant aquariums, the temporary exhibit by Takashi Amano is extraordinary. The permanent exhibit is no less impressive, with an enormous central tank view-able on multiple levels, and corner tanks representing the major oceans. Smaller tanks on the bottom floor provide more focused groupings. Very well-organized and low cost.

The most awesome aquarium I've ever been to. Came in 2008 and was blown away by this place, returned recently and it was as good as I remembered if not better. As a scuba diver I am yet to have the feeling of being so close to so many incredible awe inspiring giant underwater creatures such as manta rays, oceanic sunfish, sharks, groupers, tuna etc. I turn into a giant kid when I go to this place so if you actually have kids it will blow their mind!
A must visit. Went there with my wife and daughter, and we had a great time. Such a variety of species. Very friendly staff and a cosy olace to visit.

Very Nice. Individuals who haven’t been to the aquarium in Osaka will definitely enjoy this one. This aquarium was well laid out with marine beings from 4 oceans surrounding a central tank, which contained many types of fish. Many benches were strategically placed to rest and view the central tank. Very peaceful and tranquil. Information everywhere in Portuguese and English were very helpful. Children clearly enjoyed themselves. The pathways were dark, and many people were jostling past each other, so it might be important to keep wallets and belongings safe.

Best Europe Aquarium. .My friends this is one of the most inportant atrations of Lisbon.Is maybe the biggest aquarium in the europe , with very important expositions.Come to Lisbon and see this beautiful city.Good food, good wine, good people.

One of best aquariums we've ever seen. On our cruise to Spain, Gibraltar and Portugal in Oct '15 on the Celebrity Equinox, we found this ship to be excellent in every way. This review concentrates on the fabulous Oceanario in Lisbon Portugal, a port we visited for 2 days. On the second day there, we went to this largest aquarium in Europe. Magnificent!!! We've been to the one in Baltimore and Monterey and Tampa. Oceanario is better than any of these.It has an enormous central tank with all kinds of fish and side exhibits with many of the world's various environments. We enjoyed the Arctic and Antarctic exhibit the best with its penguins, puffins and Inca terns. The visitors get to walk within the same room as the animals. One tern, for apparently no reason, dive bombed my wife and attempted to hit her with a fish! Missed! After you seen some of the usual highlights of Lisbon, you should visit this aquarium, especially since it is a welcome break from so many churches and castles.portugal

Awesome place to take the children. We went there mostly for our daughter, but we left more happy than she did...great atraction both for children and parents, we walked around 2 hours because we were in a hurry, but you can spend easily 3-4 hours admiring all the species and learning a lot about them.The only minus is the toy store where you have to enter in order to get out of the oceanario and where the toys are very expensive...
Fun Place! Magic Ocean. The Oceanario of Lisbon is a magic place for a weekend visit. The space is very well organized and has a lot of animal to discover. I specially liked the jelly fish
A really impressive oceanarium. When being in Lisboa, visting the place is worth the effort. Buy tickets online to avoid long queueing.
Great immersion on oceans of the world. Different oceans, different set and fish. Spot and gardens around are really great too.You can also make nocturnal visits

Great museum in the wonderful EXPO area. We loved the visit, in particular the central water body is MASSIVE, and full of beautiful species. The most amazing to me was the Moon fish, which I had never seen in the past and I found incredibly fascinating (they have 2 very large specimens)...

Great Place for family. Great place for family. My 5 y.o. daughter enjoy staying over there. We learn a lot, see a lot and spend time really nice. All places are prepared really professional and with care for tourist outside the Portugal. Minus for price-28 euro for ! adult a child its a lot I think, and prices for souvenirs are huge as well 17 euros for small shark toy :/ Anyway it is very good to see it!

Rainy Day is Lisboa. Fun experience, great way to spend a rainy day in Lisboa. Interesting area where the Expo 98 was held.
The entry price is worth it for the HUGE sun fish, the sea otters and Penguins.
Informative information without overkill.
Glad I went and will recommended to other travellers to Lisboa.

Amazing experience for children - and adults.. My nephew was so excited during the whole visit. My family and I were also not expecting to be so impressed. It feels like you're under the ocean. Staff was very polite and helpful. Cost is alright. We stayed in line to get tickets for too long, it was a rainy day. They do offer free wifi access if you want to buy them online right there though (we didn't do it because in Brazil we have to pay taxes when you use a different currency on your credit card)!Great place to visit overall!

Something to do in Lisbon. It was a good getaway with the children and we got to see the new Japanese addition. Having visited a lot of aquarium I still got to discover another type of fish. It was a nice visit

Better than expected. The aquarium is large and has differing levels.A great surprise was to see the penguins and puffins and it all added to the overall excellent visit.There is currently also a temporary exhibit and not great but worth the small added cost.This place is not a must see but very worth a visit if in the area.

Great Visit for People of All Ages. Located about 15 minutes drive from Lisbon City Centre and well worth the drive.Without going into too much detail, this is one of the most interesting places I have visited. Great for adults and children.The oceanarium is quite new and very well constructed and planned and is open every day of the year.Recommended visit if you are in Lisbon and have 3-4 hours to spend there.

The best in Europe. It is said to be the best in Europe in 2015. It sure is a great experience. You will find it both amusing and interesting. You must also visit the temporary exhibition. They are always fabulous!

If you do nothing else in Lisbon, then visit this !. A little way out of the city, but accessible on the metro, this is a must. It may not be the most attractive of buildings, but what it houses inside is truly magical. A central tank is home to sharks, rays, large fish, small fish, creatures too many to name (even if I could) and as you go around the two floors, on the outside walls are more tanks, plus some outside areas with penguins, sea otters, puffins and things to delight young and old. There are plenty of places to sit and wonder at what is in front of you. There are plenty of explanations as to what you are looking at, in Portuguese and English. This place will relax you, inspire you and just make you smile. Do not miss it !

Great Oceanarium. Fantastic place to visit with children and adults. Lots to see. Would highly recommend at any age. We especially loved seeing the amazing tank with so many different types of sea animals

A must. I thought it would be small and boring, but it was huge and fun, the layout was just perfect, they care about the details, covers a big part of the marine life, it looks very big, to the extent that I doubt that dubai got the biggest, such a serine thing to do in Lisbon.
An very interesting place for families with kids. We could easily reach this place by Telecabines from the starting point close to Vasco de Gama Tower. A nice designing concept for a sea lives.

Interesting glimpse into the underwater weird and wonderful. We enjoyed our trip to Oceanario. It was a bit of a nightmare to get to, with our Uber stuck in traffic for nearly an hour (poor Uber driver!), but luckily we weren't met with such queues when we arrived.We have visited a few aquariums and this is probably the most interesting. There is one big central tank that the rest of the exhibition is centred around. There are several viewing areas over two levels for you to get a different vantage point.We had put aside half a day for this visit because we had read other reviews on here that suggested you will need four hours to make the most of it. We were there for just over an hour and a half and felt that was enough.Unsurprisingly, there were a lot of families with children visiting, and they all seemed to really be enjoying it.
Oceanário de Lisboa. Besides a pleasant outdoor space, the oceanarium is a nice place for those who enjoy life at sea and for those who want to have a good family time.
If you like the underwater world... Defo go here!. Really nice and beautiful place. It was worth every euro! Had a great time here. Especially a good place when it's a rainy day!

beautiful and organized aquarium. The aquarium is located in a very nice area next to the sea. We decided to visit this aquarium as it was open on the 26th dec and we read good reviews about it on Tripadvisor. I think the ticket is abit too expensive for what they offer to see. Good for families and friends.

Worth visiting if you are a fish lover. The facility is new and well maintained. The fish tanks are quite big so plenty of room for the fish to move around and not cramped in a small area.There are also many seats so you can watch and relax.The ticket price might be a little expensive but if you really love fish, it is worth the visit.
