Great place. This place is magical, the most interesting modern thing to do in Lisbon the species in this oceanarium are includible. This is a perfect place if you want for children or if you want get fascinated by the beautiful life of the oceans.

Great fun on a rainy day.. Even on a normal day it would be great, but it's a perfect plan for a rainy day with the "pavilhão do conhecimento" right next door. Maybe not quite as big as I had hoped, but still lots of fun and the restaurant is moderately priced and not terrible quality for being the "museum restaurant".
Expensive for what you get . Very dark inside, not a lot of information on all the species. Ok if you have kids I guess but it would be expensive!
not to be missed. We had a very pleasant afternoon in the oceanario. Friends had recommended we visit it and we were not disappointed- if in Lisbon its a must-

Amazing aquarium . Book your tickets online before you go as the queue outside can be pretty long. If you don't, they offer free wifi so you can do so while you wait. Once you have these you can just walk straight in. Once inside, the visit is great. My 18 month old daughter loved it, running from one tank to another.

A must see. Our visit here was a real highlight of the trip to Lisbon. We came here because of the rave reviews we had seen and were not disappointed. Easy to get to on the Bus and there are also some other fun attractions in the area, such as the cable car ride.

A little overpriced, but worth the visit. We had a nice afternoon in the oceanario. Although it is nothing out of ordinary, the neighborhood in itself is worth the trip! It was completely refurbished for the World Expo. The train station (oriente) is worth a look - it's design is inspiring.
I thought it was ok. This place was recommended to me so I decided to go. I was excited at first but then it felt sad inside to me. Not sure why. The most exciting thing to me was the sharks.

Worth a visit!. The main aquarium is huge so don't stop at the entrance because there are many other places where you can see it. Really interesting species and the places where are kept is big and special.
Just visit it. One of the best aquariums we have seen, Kids will love it. Very informative and the sheer size is spectacular. And good plaza nearby for a walk and for food and shopping.
Nice aquarium . Good to visit, wouldn't say best in the world though (according to trip advisor), could have done with more explanation of the different fish as it only listed some.

Better than expected. I've been to a handful of aquariums, and this one was a really enjoyable experience. The centerpiece is a large tank of water filled with many varieties of aquatic life, including a couple large sunfish which we (and other people) seemed to enjoy tracking. Around the edges are smaller exhibits featuring specific species of fish or other creatures.I especially enjoyed watching the penguins (you can get closer to them than at most other zoos or aquariums I've been to) and the sea otters, both of whom were very playful and entertaining when I visited.Finally, I would suggest people see the Forests Underwater temporary exhibit while there -- I got it on a whim and was pleasantly surprised. It's the a finely landscaped garden worthy of a grand palace, except in an aquarium. The more time I spent looking at it, the more details I discovered.

Absolutely fabulous. I'm glad I've visited the Oceanario, as it is the first of it's kind for me to see. I loved the tropical forest, I could actually feel and smell the air, it was fantastic. I saw lots of fish but as much as I wanted we couldn't see the octopus as it was hiding behind something. I loved the birds and the noise you could here inside like you were really there in the ocean or forest!! I definitely recommend the visit to the Oceanario in Lisabona. You should have at least 2 hours reserved for the visit to enjoy as much as you can.
Excellent family day out. Most aquariums are small and over rather quickly, this ine is quite large and spirals you through different sections. Definately worth a visit.
Good fun. It is very nice, huge and it easily takes a whole day to see it all. A must go if you never been to an aquarium and children love it.

Great place for family and friends!. We were in Lisbon for New Years Eve, but it was very rainy on New Years Day. So we found great reviews on the aquarium. There was a VERY long line outside to buy tickets. However, there were large signs everywhere that explained how to purchase them online. They even offered free wifi to purchase them online on your own phone or tablet. I have no clue why hundreds of people didn't read the signs and stood outside in the cold rain?! It took about three minutes to purchase our tickets on my iPhone. They emailed me the tickets and then we showed the attendant at the door and we were all set. Beautiful aquarium, worth the adult admission cost.
Excellent. It is the right place to see marine animals. They have also a temporary show very interesting of ocean forest.

Excellent temporary exhibition. The temporary exhibition "Florestas Submersas by Takashi Amano" is really surprising. However, you should choose a proper visiting our to avoid crowds. Otherwise, you'd miss the real sense of the exhibition. On the other side, the permanent exhibition, being an excellent one from the pedagogic point of view, offers the same as any other.

Quality time in a magical place. You must visit Ocenario de Lisboa, is great. You can see there a lot of fish species and a variety of animals.You cannot do pictures there, but if you really want, you can succeed.

Best place to see a lot of ocean and sea world. In oceanarium you can see a lot of fish, crabs, octopus etc. Ticket is a little expansive, but i not regret for that, because is worth if you love sea world.

You must see it. I love it.....It is very intersting. The price of the ticket is very big ( almost 18 euros) but from my point of view it is a must. You can see many sea animals and everything it is so "natural". You can dream that you are on the ocean between fishes.

Interesting fish !!!!. Went for the first time in the Oceanario and i was really impressed about the "new style" building , very clean , contemporary , organised...very good attraction for all the people which love nature.For sure if I'm gonna chance i ll pop back !

Amazing attraction!. A beautiful educational aquarium for the whole family. It has three levels and covers four oceans with so many unique species we've never seen before. Go early because there are long lines and some of the viewing areas aren't that big. We also enjoyed the temporary exhibit, Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano. Definitely worth seeing!
Beautiful experience. Kids love it and the adults too!. Great experience for sea animal lovers, A chance to learn a lot in a fun way! I love the giant octopus and the moonfish..
Family Visit. It´s a wonderful place to go with kids (and without!). It's also a great place to rest and read some book, because it inspires calm and it's very anti-stress!
A Must Go. A fantastic place. It is so beautifull with amazing specimens and a uge tank. One can stay hours in this amazing place.
One of the main attractions of Lisbon. One of the main attractions of Lisbon. There is also cable car that you can ride. A family place and half day with of visiting.

Oceans indoor. The place is unique. See for yourself. You can see living examples of the several Oceans. The Central Tank is fantastic. Camera is mandatory. To have a global view 1h is enough. To see in detail depending on the exhibitions that frequently are available, 2 to 3 h is not much.
Great place. Oceanario is one of top places to visit in Lissabon . The kids just love it this unique huge aquarium in the park expo of Lisboa.

The Largest Freshwater Aquascaping. Must visit this aquaria , it is really an amazing freshwater aquascaping setup in the world. Has not seen anywhere else that can compete. High end eye pleasure time.

well-designed Oceanarium. I love visiting Oceanariums and usually make this one of my stops whenever I am in a city with one. In comparison to those in the US, Oceanario is neither the largest, has the widest variety, or is the prettiest. It does not have shows like some in the US for example. It is however very well-designed, offering 3 levels that allow people to circumnavigate the Oceanarium, and offering more than just fishes, with playful otters, puffins and birds that seem to interact with you in their natural environment. Well-run and a good place to visit if you can spare the time.
Nice interesting and beutiful. It was nice visit Queue was too long better to order on-line A bit expensive for a fa ily of four The range of sea creatures was really I netted ting
Expensive. Absolutely not the first thing to do in Lisbon! It is funny and there are many fishes but it is too espensive (14 euro per adult). Anyway the main acquarium is fascinating!
Miss. Definately worth a visit. .....even if you've not got any children in tow! Buy your tickets in advance.
So beautiful. You have to go. This is so beautiful.Take the subuway, easier & cheaper way to go there.A little bit expensive but so nice.
Oceanarium. Good for kids, but nothing too exciting otherwise here. It's a nice space, but once you've seen any aquarium, you've seen them all.
Whole family loved it. We brought our 18 month old daughter here recently and she loved it!! It is so well layed out and the staff are really helpful

Paradise. Worth every cent. This place is magical and would entice couples, families, kids, marine biologists or eco-tourists. A plethora of species abound in gorgeously designed tanks and wonderfully created environments. Absolutely must go to this if in Lisbon, even if in Lisbon for a day! 5/5 stars and would go again happily. Also, open on January 1st and on Christmas Day, so go then for quieter days! Also, the area around is awesome for exploration.

Absolutely Wonderful in every way!. Although this was on my list of things I wanted to do, with so many historical sites to visit, it wasn't top of my list. However, a particularly rainy day in Lisbon presented the perfect opportunity, and I took it. What a FANTASTIC aquarium. Just wonderful!! Sectioned to cover four different oceans, and with over 8 thousand sea creatures to view, this is a whole day of captivating experiences and then some. The absolutely stunning permanent and temporary exhibits (the Forest Underwater is truly awe inspiring), have, without a doubt, helped earn this aquarium its somewhat boastful title as "Best Aquarium in the World." My only regret is that my 11 year old wasn't there to see it with me. A MUST see....

Great fun. Great fun loads to see some lovely unexpected surprises like the penguins and the otters so cute and will put on a display.. Lovely afternoon put i strolling around all the different continents at our leisure

Brilliant Oceanarium in Lisbon. This is a must-visit place in Lisbon! We were in Lisbon during New Year's Day, and it was open on 1st of Jan as well which was great. The permanent and temporary exhibitions were both great, especially the gigantic tank in the center of the place which holds large sharks, rays and many other sea creatures.

Aquarium visit - good rainy day activity. Typical aquarium - nothing special. great rainy day activity. Children will enjoy. Thought it was a little expensive, especially after the visit. Long line to buy tickets and large crowds inside made it difficult to see some of the exhibits.

Calm and Relaxing. I usually go every year to the Aquarium and I am never disappointed. I've been there with my girlfriend, family and even all by myself.I put my headphones on and just contemplate all the different kinds of fishes swimming around.You can decide what kind of visit you want, just a stress reliever, a romantic date or something more didactic.Just a heads up... depending on the time of the year and day of the week you might get some schoolkids from kindergarten visiting the aquarium. They usually organize these schooltrips around summer. They can be a little bit noisier but nevertheless funny.I personnaly enjoy the facilities and environment creates all around.

Very entertaining.. Very interesting installation with an enormous aquarium in the center and a circuit around showing different ecosystem of the oceans of the world. Placed in a modern area of Lisbon is really worth visiting.
It was great!. I was happily surprised by the great aquarium and also by the penguins. In addition to all the amazing fish, there were a frog-exhibition as well.
Wonderful place to be.. Take your family there ,they will enjoy for sure.Place where you want to stay and not leave.walk around a Oceanarium where you can see all,...10 points.
Great for an afternoon to fill up. Not too big, which makes you not so tired in the end. Big collection of the ocean world, nicely displayed. Maybe a tiny bit expensive.
Nice. Great place to go with family or friends, a lot of variety of fishes to see (penguins and sharks included).

An exceptional aquarium experience. They have two Sunfish in the main Ocean habitat. There are four other main habitats surrounding the central ocean habitat representing the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian and Antarctic oceans. The upper level is open 'at sea level'. The lower level is at the lower level of the habitats, under the sea. It is dark and quiet and really gives you the illusion that you are underwater. There are lots of smaller spaces to hang out and is quite intimate in that regard. It really is a very cool design that changes your mood. Incredibly serene just like SCUBA diving.

Mola mola!. This place keeps ocean sun fish in their big tank. With several windows, tourist could enjoy different parts of the tank. Feeding time is about 4pm. Other highlights are sea otter and penguin, they are really like camera. Actually, this is the first time that i can take photo of penguin at this very close range. Currently, they have temporary exhibition of freshwater plant by Mr. Amano too. Additional fee is applied.

Its extraordinary !. if you come to Lisbon you have to make it a top priority, i wen t here and boy i was amazed with the place and the different types of fishes and gardens they have, you have to be patience and look closely in order to see all the beauties hidden in the ocenario.

Large variation, long lines. We spent about two hours in oceanarium. Don't recommend eating there if you want something more than school lunch. The ticket line was long, but there is a wifi in the queue so you can buy your ticket online there.

Superb. Great place to visit and a wonderfull experience best tips are to get there early and don't view the tanks as soon as you walk in big crowds and there is many viewing spots of the same tank all the way around the exhibit

Great experience. A great venue. Don't miss the fresh water exhibit. This was one of the best parts. Skip the long queue and buy tickets ahead of time. We didn't but were able to buy on my mobile phone, took 2 minutes. Not sure why others weren't doing this as well. We spent about 2 hours there and didn't rush but saw it all.

Very interesting activity for a morning in Lisboa. You can spend 2-3 hours in Lisbon's aquarium. It is divided in 5 sectors, one per ocean. We paid 29€ for 2 persons using Lisboa card, for seeing both temporary and permanent exhibition ( really worth it). You could combine the visit with a walk in parc nacoes and Vasco da gama mall which is 5 min walk away
Enjoyable. Enjoyable experience. Tickets are a little pricey but it is still an an enjoyable day trip out so worth the cost.

Awesome aquarium. This place exceeded our expectations. Very modern and well laid out with some really unusual fish. Especially loved the penguins and otters. Free to wander at your own pace and lots of photo opportunitys.

Number One, justifiably. Don't just think of this on rainy days. This is a world-class aquarium, one of the biggest. But it's not just size. Be sure to sit for their 15-minute documentary about halfway through the visit. Puts the collection into context, answers lots of your questions (like, "why don't they eat each other?"). Fish of all shapes and sizes, but also aquatic birds (penguins in an icy habitat) and mammals (sea otters lolling on their backs). Really a pleasure, and easy to reach by metro or train (Oriente station on the river).

quite disapointing. First of all the quique to get tickets - huge and moving very slowly. Secondly - toilets - there are too few of them and there are also quique to each of them. The interior is a bit outdated and shabby. The price of the tickets - very high. Good things - very nice shop with big variety of presents and free wifi in the ticket quique.
Don't go on holidays. Went there on New years day, Just like the rest of the country. The line was very long. After an hour of waiting we went back to the city center.

Amazing sea life!. We loved the Oceanario in Lisbon. It was the most beautiful aquarium we have ever seen. It is an ideal place for both adults and kids (small and older ones). When in Lisbon, don't forget to visit Oceanario!!!

Get there early buy ticket on line. Went here new years day as most places are closed on new years day. I had already brought tickets online which means you can beat the lengthy ticket queues. For europe probabsbly the best aquarium i have seen. All centered around a major exhibit tank. Good experience and also enjoyed tempory exhibit. Definately a good choice for a visit.
Super place. a great place for all the family the whole place is set up to allow you to see everything in one trip
Short and sweet. The tickets cost 14 euros without the the temporary exhibition.. Im not a crazy biologist, so I felt it had the right amount of marine life to keep you fascinated and bored.

Nice way to spend half a day especially if weather is not great. . Easy to get to with the metro. Great aquarium with lots to see and lots to learn. My son of 12 had a great time and loved looking at all the fish and other species of the ocean. Need to count on at least a couple of hours to see all. The cafeteria at the exit in the gift area I thought was not great with little to choose from for a simple lunch. If going by metro you walk through a fairly big shopping centre so if that is your thing there is some shopping to be done before or after....

Interesting and ideal if it's raining. We were visiting the Expo Area. Since it was raining we decided - like million othrd - to visit the Ocenario. Interesting and nicely prepared it is worth visiting. But it can be very crowded.

I thought i was actually in the ocean!!. We went to the oceanario de lisboa and it's pretty cool, big. It looks like you're inside the water! You must go there you'll love it so much !! Hope you like it!!🤗🤗
Ok. The highlight was the special exhibit and the 2 gigantic fish in the main tank. Good for no more than 2 hours.

An oceanarium or a cathedral?. Created in 1998 for the Word Expo (theme-the oceans), receives annually 1 million people.Why?The North American Architect Peter Chermayeff created a structure like cathedral.When you reach the inner Oceanarium you are invaded by serenity when you move your head towards the top scanning the huge water tower (5.000.000 liters). You see sharks, barracudas , rays , tuna, small tropical fish... graciously and silently swimming receiving the daylight while you are immersed in a discrete shade.You are bound to be invaded by religious feelings and your mind can rest and meditate.There is much more to see and do...but this is the essential.
Good but not that much!. Enjoyable and fun but not as amazing as I expected. I was told it wwasthe best in Europe but I disagree. Anyway, always good enough to enjoy and have fun with kids
Big. Big aquarium, lots of fishes and even penguins and otters! You can't use flash in a dark area with fishes, but that is reasonable. If you have kids, they would love it too!

Big aquarium . This place is a big aquarium where half a day can be spent here. Giant tank with different angles you can see the sea life from even through a glass tunnel. There are even a school of penguins and a pair of otters. Also very educational in signs describing sea life. I highly recommend going here if you like sea life.
Fish! . So many. So different ones. In the gigantic fish tanks they are even more impressive. Seriously, go there!
Good Christmas Day activity.. The venue was a perfect place to visit on Christmas Day. The layout is clever. Signage is good and it was possible to view the fish from different angles.

The temporary exhibition is stunning. The temporary exhibition honours the memory of Takashi Amano, a nature photographer and an expert on aquariums. An aquarium is wrapped around three sides of a room and inside is designed like a Japanese garden. Plants and flowers stir in the water currents. Beauty and simplicity that could move you to tears. The rest of the aquarium is superb but I recommend that you leave behind the crowds, noise and bustle of the permanent exhibits and savour the peace and stillness of this simple masterpiece.

Coly. Very diferent nice acuarium.
It is a large indoor aquarium, one big tank for two floors, you're doing two circles around the same tank.
Nice, but not for this price.

Family stuff!. Children love it! Must go with childrem!
There is a restaurant inside, Tejo, no good. People working there are really bad humored and don't like what they are doing. If you have the time, there are a lot of options outside, at Parque das Nações.

Not as big as they say. We always like to see places like that on our trips . But this one was not great as we thought. Most of reviews say that you should book 4 hours to see it all. I don't think so. We been there with a child and we had time to take a seat , loads of photos and that took us like 2 hrs. So it is really depends from child. We hoped to see a large Sharks but they where not that big as you can read on their website. After all very good experience. I can recommended .

Marvelous Experience. This is trully a one of a kind atraction. I went there once with friends and it was amazing. Recently went my kid and seeing it through a child's eyes it's even more amazing. I trully recoment it.

Great tribute to nature and sea life. Love the experience and the exhibits are great!!!!!!If you love the sea and love nature this is the place to visit We loved the giant Boney fish, sun fish, sea rays and other tropical and salt water fishThe aquarium is massive and has over 400 species of fishThe otters are interesting and the Penguins really round out he experience Take the cable car over to eat at the local places This is a great afternoon experience for Lisbon

Oceanario was worth the visit.... We had a nice time at Oceanario. The aquarium is huge - I think it's multiple floors. The entire complex features otters, penguins, sharks, and a numerous other marine life. We decided to go because it was raining. We're not big aquarium people - but it's worth a trip if you're staying in Lisbon for several days and the forecast isn't particularly good.

Practical Tips. I am always looking for practical tips when traveling, so here is my contribution:1. Easy to get to via metro - red line, Oriente station. Head SE to the water. 2. Buy tickets online prior to going! The lines can be rough and they are a bit cheaper online. 3. Do not use the 1st bathroom upon entering. There are plenty of options later without lines, including one right after you enter the exhibit. 4. The main tank is amazing!! You will want to stare and take pictures the second you see it - as will everyone else. There are literally dozens of places for viewing. Resist the urge and wait for a less busy section so you can truly enjoy the experience. 5. Save time to walk around the immediate area. There is a really nice Boardwalk just outside with a great view!6. And for those of you who need gluten-free . . . There aren't any options (but you already knew this). You may get lucky with a banana, but pack your own.
Fantastic. This was the most amazing aquarium I have ever seen. You will love the diving penguins! The breakout of the exhibits by world oceans is a nice touch.

21 century experience. Excellent time for education and amusement! Everyone should go and learn about the ocean! Very interesting way of showing the underwater life using methods of modern technology. Easy approach by metro.

Fantastic. We visited on Christmas Day and it was surprisingly popular! It opened at 1pm and people were queuing. If we went again I would book tickets online to avoid the queue. Definitely worth the brief wait-such an amazing array of marine life on show. The sea otters really stole the show, they were gorgeous and very entertaining. There were lockers to store bags away which came in handy and made the visit more comfortable. The cafe seemed very reasonable-we only had drinks and snacks but the food on offer looked and smelt very good. A really good set up, huge tanks, lots of information. A must see-especially for children! We paid to also see the temporary exhibition which was worth it. If we return to Lisbon we would visit again. Easy to access from Lisbon on the metro (just one change) Also a lovely area to wander round afterwards, we walked along the river and went on the cable car. Fantastic!

Most impressive aquarium I have visited. We where there with our 2 year old son. He loved it. He is fascinated by fish. I have seen a few aquariums around the world. This one is the most innovative and impressive so far. But it gets crowded. In the middle of the day there was a 300-400m entry line.

Amazing place. Indeed one of the most beautiful aquariums/ oceanariums in Europe. Penguins, otters, sharks, fish from all over the world - the place is definitely worth a visit. Quite busy, so buying online tickets is better.

Close encounters with sharks. Close encounters with sharks are always fun - as long as there is some glass separating you. Visiting the Oceanarium (?) gives you a possibility to see the fascinating diversity of the oceans up close. The animals are fascinating, the colours are incredible - and the enthusiasm of the (huge number of) children is contagious. Well worth the ticket price.
great aquarium. nice big aquarium, lots of small side tanks, nice second experience with still water, get your tickets online!!

Must visit in Lisbon. First time to see the Penguins, sea birds and Sea Otter in an aquarium! Have 4 habitats around the aquarium, from North Sea to Indian sea...
It worths paying 14 €

Love for the animals. Great location with a great aquarium. The moon fish is great. And other duzens of species that are nowhere to be found.
Must see..

Great experience. Great experience for kids. Well worth a visit. Has a full spectrum of the worlds sea life. Easy access. The food experience in the ticketing area was not up to normal Portuguese standards and other food outlets within the Parque should be considered.

The most stunning aquarium I have ever been. This place deserves a five-star. The most stunning aquarium I have ever been. I love the especially the way they present the ocean species. Absolutely worth your time and money.

fantastic. the main pool is just a dream you can stand and watch it for hours.
and detailed small ones. in a very relaxing and dark atmosphere
Best aquarium ever. Easily the best aquarium I've ever been to. Well worth the entry fee and travel to get there. Temporary exhibition was amazing; get there while you can.

Nice. If you love sea and fish and corals there is really good to see this.
Was very fantastic and i wanna see again if will be in Lisboa

Absolutely First Class Aquarium Experience!. Enjoy this superb aquarium! Easy to get to from the metro. Spend some time wandering the waterfront before or after going inside. Laeve about 2-3 hours for the aquarium itself.

Fun half-day trip. The aquarium has a great selection of fish and aquatic mammals. We went to the temporary exhibit also which was great. I felt like I could sit in there and listen to the wonderful music while watching the fish forever.

Highly recommended!. The aquarium was really nice, much better and bigger than expected! There were so many different animals and species of fish from so many different parts of the world! Definitely worth visiting.

Great Aquariumwith small price !. Definitely one of the must visit places if you are travelling with little kids. Ticket price were very competitive if you compare it with London Aquarium. Staff are also very helpful. Do also visit temporary display on 2nd floor. My daughter loved it, so did I.

Amazing!!!. Fantastic
We did not realise it is so big and so interesting did not have time to see everything
The main fish tank is incredible can see it from different angles could easily spend all day there the view is mesmerising!!!
Absolute must

Average . The entry price is quite expensive. The permanent exhibition is unexpectedly small n nth special (as the website said its one of the largest aquarium in the world lol). The temp exhibition is not worth going at all.

Interesting. It took us a view times asking were it was but it was worth it.
Amazing fish in a huge fish tank!
We spent about three hours at the aquarium and learned a lot.
Toda a vida marinha num só espaço. Wonderfull place where you can see a big diversity of fishes and other sea animals. it really deserves a visit!!!
Just Ok.. Not sure why this is the top attraction in Lisbon. It is an ok oceanarium. Good for local kids on educational tour. As an adult, I found it boring after the first few minutes.

Pricey for what is there. . I went with my fiancé at 1pm on a Wednesday. VERY crowded with VERY loud middle school children. The children had to be "shushed" by workers multiple times for screaming at the Sharks. Quiet annoying. The "temporary exhibit" is not worth the extra money. It was pretty but we were in and out of it in about 5 mins. The aquarium is beautiful but there isn't a huge variety. It was expensive for what was included. Not sure if I would go back.
absolute MUST visit. Outstanding, well populated or should I say FISHated, oceanarium with great views. Situated in a New aerea of Lisbon with modern architecture

Like diving with the fish . It's a no doubt worthwhile visit. The permanent exhibition is great and huge. Two floors full of fishes and small aquariums surrounding a big central one which has a real piece of the ocean on it. On the first floor each of the four corners has one type of climate. Great time with the kids!
Great for nature lovers. Wonderful place to spend some time with family/friends. Besides the huge tank, there are some exhibitions that mimic natural environments really well.
Awesome!. So much to see and gape at, definitely worth a visit. The huge aquarium is amazing, with all manner of incredible creatures in it.
Fun Trip. I loved spending some time at the Ocenario, it doesn't take a full day, 4 hours would do itIt was fun and we had some nice photosThe area around the Ocenario is nice as well

Good fun and an impressive tank, but should probably been even bigger for the inhabitants. We had a very nice visit here despite it being sunday and very crowded. They have a big and pretty impressive main tank full of lots of fish/sharks/etc of differing sizes. It was fun to see the sun fish and the other bigger animals but I do fear they really should be in an unrealistically big aquarium to be comfortable. As it were many of them just swim around and around in the tank which is not a good sign for their longterm mental health.The sea otters also seemed to be kept in a very small pool area, they definitely require more space than that.Big plus for all the smaller aquarias in the lower sections, lots of fun critters to be seen in those.
Amazing. Great place to visit so much to see, you feel as though your swimming with the fish, very well put together fantastic for children of all ages.

Well worth a visit. Oceanario de Lisboa is about a 20 minute taxi drive from the main cruise terminal which should cost about 7 euros each way. The Oceanario is a very modern attraction with many varieties of fish on display including shark and barracuda, I can highly recommend it and would be very suitable for a family, Entrance fee is about 17 euros or 11 euros for a senior citizen,

Huge aquarium. Nicely arranged. Yes, it it just one huge tunk with animals you walk around but makes an impression. I could spend hours in this place. Plus there are few additional "attractions" aside like pinguin habitat and temporary exhibition.

King of the Sea. Very nice aquarium, with many separate ecosystems. The penguins were a favorite for my wife, while viewing shrimp, seahorses and octopus were mine. The main tank has a some fantastic rays, the usual assortment of sharks and a couple of enormous Ocean Sunfish.

Highly recommended! . Beautiful aquarium, easily spent 4 hours wandering around admiring the exhibits. Absolutely stunning fish, appear well cared for...with the occasional surprise of penguin and otters.
Price was €37 for 2 of us, but well worth the money! Go visit!

Great place to spend your time if the weather is not nice. We visited the place during our stay in Lisbon this December. The reason was mainly, the weather outside was not great and we wanted to see something nice. Which we did - It is a good deal for money, even more if you visit with children, they will love it. For us, as a couple, even though we did not hurry we saw the whole place in about an hour, or a bit more.

amazing place. Although the fee is a bit high (17 euro/adult), it was worthed every cent. The place is huge. It took me nearly 2 hours to visit it. You can see all sort of fishes, aminals and birds from all the areas. The place is divided in multiple areas, each one for a different type of ocean. It has also a restaurant and a gift shop. I loved every corner of this place. I will revisit it every time I return to Lisbon.

Good diversity, educational for children. It was a pleasant visit for few hours. They have good diversity of seas creatures. However, comparing to similar attraction other countries I have visited, I rate it only good (especially when factoring the price tag - 14EUR for adult). Having said that, if you are visiting Lisbon with children, this is one of should visit location. Very educational.

Oceanário de Lisboa. The Lisbon Oceanário is the best I have ever seen and I've seen a few.The one which comes close to it is the London one but it is not as spectacular and interesting. It is worth visiting it when you come to Lisbon, It has the WOW factor.
Delightful diversity. A park very well organized and equipped with specific rooms with more ecosystems and climates, with a wide biodiversity, a unique place not to be missed

Great to spend a couple of hours. Wonderful place to go. Wonderful property. The kids will love it. It's huge and lots of interactive things to explore about our oceans, global warming and its impact on our planet. A good and relaxing place to visit if you are in Lisbon, that place make you feel so good.Don't miss it.

This is a must to visit with children. Splendid presentations by seas, climate and regions. Round pool in the middle is astonishing, rare fishes that could be observed from every side! A must for every marine fan and for families with children!

Traveling in the deep of the Seven Seas. There were a kind of people, they were called "LUSÍADAS"! (Epic poem by Camões)These adventurers sailed all over the world, fighting the elements, giving and taking new understanding of cultures that no one had dreamed about.Some years ago, those "Lusíadas", remembered the past! They did not sail any more, so they thought about bringing the seven to their land.THEY DID IT!!!And you can even see the seven seas from the deep...Welcome to Portugal!Carlos
Uau.. it's just a wonderful place to "get lost" for several hours. The main exhibit, it's just hypnotizing, you don't want to leave.

Amazing and fabulous. One of the best aquariums in Europe ! The temporary exhibition, Underwater Florests, is astonishing beautiful. Listem to the music by Rodrigo Leão and enjoy.
This was the last work of the japanese landscape architec Amano, that died after the exhibition started.

There's two sides to this place.... If you're staying in a bigger city for a couple of days, you tend to end up in an oceanarium at some point and in comparison to others this one seems to keep their animals more or less appropriate to their needs (as far as it's possible to match an animals needs in captivity), so I didnt't feel too guilty while roaming through the different levels of the building. The price is quite high (15 € for an adult I believe) but reasonable if you keep in mind, what I mentioned about the conditions the animals live in.Now, the big downside to this place is, that it was very crowded. To be fair, it was a rainy afternoon and we expected that quite a lot of people would have the same idea and visit the aquarium, but the reality was overwhelming. Tipp for crowded weekends/rainy days: The oceanarium provides WLAN on the entrance, so you can buy your ticket online via smartphone without waiting half an hour or more in the queue.Once we got inside the building, we couldn't really enjoy any of the attractions because people didn't wait "in line" until they could catch a glimpse of an aquarium but rather pushed themselves in front of you and used every inch of space there was. We got annoyed pretty quickly and left half way through.Please, learn to relax. You have every time in the world to stroll through an aquarium. Respect the other visitors who also payed to see this place. There's no first come, first serve or survival of the fittest in a venue like this.In the end, it's a nice place but selfish visitors ruined the experience (at least ours).A big compliment for the beautiful, temporary exhibition!
One of the best oceanariums in the world!. An attraction you simply cannot miss in lisbon. The world's second biggest, with 20.000 square meters. Fabulous!
worth a visit. definitely worth a visit especially if you go on the Hop On Hop Off bus as it is slightly out of town
Waterland. A very big and calming place wher you can sit and just looking at water-animals....Nice notes, nice shopping possibilities.

Best attraction at Parque das Nações. If you have like 3 days at Lisbon, one of them you should visit Parque das Nações, the design-modern area of Lisbon. Well, once you are there, go to the Oceanarium. It's huge, well organized and they have a rich diversity of animals, many of them visually incredible.

Time well spend. On vacations why spending time visiting aquariums? Well in this case it's worth every second specially if you have kids.A place well designed, scientifically studied and maintained with excellent information and every possible inhabitant of the sea.

Always amazing. Our two young girls loved this at the weekend. It's a great thing to do when the weather isn't very good and this time of year it wasn't busy at all!Seeing the otters being fed at 10,30 was so lovely. Everyone was very helpful with us with the pram too

"Florestas Submersas by Takashi Amano"; THE HIDDEN TREASURE. I love this place for its unique mission of educating and preserving the marvels of the natural world in a visible manner to all concerned citizens.

Fabulous. Well worth a visit. Stood for ages watching the amazing fish. The staff are very helpful and knowledgable if you have any questions and the entrance fee is very reasonable. I would highly recommend Oceanario.

Not as good as expected. We visited this famous acquarium with my daughter, during our family trip to Lisbon. It was nice and it would be unfair to say that we did not like it however we had expected more. Oceanario de Lisboa was smaller than we thought and apart from a few really interesting species like the Sun Fish, in general, it was an acquarium like you can see in many other cities ( i have seen many others that's why i say so). If you are in Lisbon and if you have time you can pay a visit but keep this fact in mind. If you have a limited time and you are with your children, I would rather recommend you to visit the zoo in Lisbon, it is much better in my point of view.

Impressive Stuff!. The main aquarium is astonishing, spread over three very well designed floors. Much enjoyed the Otters and amazed to see a Sunfish, incredible. Very family friendly and worth buying your ticket online to avoid delays st the entrance. Located in a great spot with miles of walks available.

Waterworldy amazing!. The huge water-tank spanning the entire building on all floors is good enough reason to visit. It was simply amazing. Good atmosphere, fantastic fish attractions including several big sharks, and hypnotizing views taking you deep into the ocean. This can be enjoyed by everybody and anybody.
Nice temporary exhibit. the aquarium has a massive tank with many species. It is not the best I've been to but it's very nice. The temporary exhibit of underwater japanese gardens is amazing

Surprisingly fun. We sort of got here by accident - our tour guide was driving along to show us various sites & on the spur of the moment decided to go in.Well laid out, good English descriptions, and of course incredible fish and sea birds. Highlight for us was seeing a puffin swim underwater - just amazing.

2 Visits in Ten years and both Visits Were Great!. Great for families, friends, dates, school trips! All ages will enjoy. Lots of variety of sea life. First timei went ten years ago was in middle of summer and lines were quite long. this year (September 2015) lines were non existent because it was outside of regular tourist season and also a week day.
The most wonderful oceanarium in the World.. Great atmosphere, you can see the Sharks and all the species that live in our oceans. Beautifully built its a place you have to visit.

The best Oceanorium you can dream off. I live in Portugal since 1998 and I went there at least 10 times and each type is a discovery. The place is amazing, the permanent exposition also. It is a great place to see sharks, penguins....

Different atmosphere . Big, variable and lovely. There is a big aquarium at the centre with a varied collection of sea life. And one gets to turn around in on two floors. And as you turn around you get into some escapades where you find yourself at times in an environment of the north pole or at other times an environment like at the indian subcontinent. Very well maintained areas and varied species. Like they say it is the biggest indoor aquarium. You get to buy few souvenirs at the end of the journey.
beautiful. I really like the visit to the oceanário. I went with my kids and they enjoyed it to. They provide lots of information about the fish and sea creatures we can see.
Cool experience!. We were two couples in our 40's and we did have fun! We've had a mid-afternoon flight and because the Oceanario was not far from the airport we've profited from the short distance.

Great improvement over the oldie Aquarium.... This has been a visit that took me too long to do. Since its opening back in the late 1990's that I wanted to take a look in since. And it's worth it. A lot of fishes and different habitats in only one place.
Oceanário. A fantastic and funny day for the kids. The setting is very beautiful and staff is very friendly. Be prepared for lots of kids

Great rainy day in Lisbon activity. An easy ride from the Alfama, this is a great rainy day activity in Lisbon - good any day, really. The commentary could be a little more detailed, but the exhibits are amazing and the people working there are clearly proud (justifiably so) of this world class aquarium.

One of few aquaria to house sunfish!. Loved this aquarium - largest in Europe. Fascinating to watch sharks, barracuda, penguins and otters, and to see everything from octopuses and seahorses to schools of fish. One of the highlights of my visit to Lisbon

Awesome, but not the First option in a hurry schedule. The Oceanario is awesome!! Very well organized, friendly staff, good 'collection'. The price worth the visit. But in point of view, is not the main option in Lisbon. Especially if you are kids free.
Great. Really surprising experience. More than we expected. Worth the visit as it is a bit far from city center.
Great experience . This aquarium is the second biggest in the world. The tour is around the building and has two floors easy to be seen and enjoy. It's a good choice to spend the morning.
Just wow. Beautiful display of ocean wildlife. Very entertaining. We loved the main attraction (the big aquarium) as well as the temporary exhibition.
Good trip with Kids . If you want See wonderfull place visit the oceanario IT whort IT to See. 3 -4 hours to See everything.

a great day trip with nature. For adults and children, a great educational and fun place to visit.Changing exhibits and very easy to walk around and read as well as see the sea life up close and personal! Friendly staff and afterward visit the area , walk along the river, have lunch. A place v to visit again and again. Loved it!! The setting is also unique and interesting to view.

big aquarium - good experience. entry was approx. 17 euros - well worth the experience, large variety of fish and very friendly staff. we spent about 4 hours. large windows to get close to the SeaWorld. toilets were clean and the restaurant was nice and cheap. only negative thing is that the Oceanarium is not really near any of the tourist sites so you have to go out of the way to get there. but once inside its well worth it
Awesome shark tank. This place has the best shark tank I've seen and some nice areas where animals are free. Everything else is pretty much what you can find in other cities.

Love it. I was at the site when the oceanario was getting built, i was working on EXPO98. It was great then and its great now, so many years passed by and i still like to go there ! With kids or no kids, always nice.
A great aquarium. Worth a stop. Lots of beautiful attractions. Easy to navigate and great views from many angles of the main aquarium.

Breath taking even for divers. No matter what age you will be impressed by the shear size and fish life of the central fish tank which is filled with large array of shark and fish life. Highly recommend. I'm a master diver and it's the closest to diving you can experience with out a tank.

Amazing glimps of an underwater world. I was amazed to see this 3 story aquarium. with amazing animals like Sunfish what is that? I have never seen it. but there is was over 4 feet high and 6 feet long incredible. There is also a nice Cuban restaurant serving real Cuban coffee on the bay not to hard to find as the Cuban flag is painted right on the wall. You can get there via the subway train, walk in to the mall and across at the exit you will find a train that takes you to the Aquarium. Admission is very reasonable. But the site is pure entertainment.
Best place in lisbon. As a nature lover fell in love with this place. Must see. Great idea for half day for families,couples and lone travelers. Top end oceanario
Amazing . Worth the visit.. Amazing place you a lot of places to visit, the central aquarium it's very amazing and have beautiful fishes..

Best aquarium ever. We were uncertain we wanted to make the trip out to Oceanario from central Lisbon but it was absolutely worth it. The current temporary exhibit features fresh water environments and is incredibly inspiring with fish and plants collected from around the world. The main tank which has hundreds of different species all seen up close and personal is beyond description. Go and enjoy.

Excellent visit. Well organised and well presented you could be here for half a day.super main tank but so many smaller ones as well.suits all ages.no queues today but signage from the metro is poor easier to ask a local I think they are well used to it!

Sharks and eels and tiny tots of fishes above and just behind you!. When I saw how they set up the huge cylindrical aquarium at the center of the oceanarium, I find it bland at first...but when we started to go around it while viewing sharks, eels, giant stingrays and little tiny bits of fishes in different colors and shapes, it became a fascinating experience. By the end of the walking tour, our eyes had a feast! Lovely place to go! You'll have fun, every tourist must-see!
A fantastic view under the ocean. You will be fascionated to look at a wonderful world yo will never forget. 3-4 hours at least you will never regret. For people in all ages.

amazing and not only for children:). we spent there 3 more than hours and were amazed by the fishes and my favorites, the penguins. it is a unique experience to just sit and watch the big aquarium. Maybe we didn't arrive from a logical direction, but for us it was difficult to find the entrance, the direction boards were not clear.

Very wonderful aquarium. Had a great visit!. I had so much fun at the aquarium! The whole thing is centered around an ENORMOUS tank filled with giant fish and sharks, and around it are separate enclosures for fish of different regions of the world. I was disappointed with the size until I realized there was a whole downstairs that was very very neat. I also was very happy with the living conditions for their animals. I'm certainly no expert but I did work in a zoo for a little while and I found their exhibits to be enriching and healthy.I bought a ticket that included the temporary exhibit and was very disappointed in the temporary exhibit. It was small and unexciting and not worth the extra euros. Unfortunately there are not many plaques describing the animals, but watching them is usually enough for people anyway.

Marvellous 3 - 4 hour Ocean experience.. We visited with our 5 year old grandson. The facility is easy to locate and good parking is very close-by.,The exhibits are cleverly designed around the central aquarium and this has a distinct " wow " factors. The kids simply seemed engrossed by the various ocean areas.The central aquarium is never far from view.We even managed to get a 5 year old to simply sit still for 5 minutes and wonder at the marine world and it's ocean home.No hesitation in recomending the Oceanario but recommend some periods of silence for moments of true wonder and sheer enjoyment when sitting on a seat next to the central aquariumOK - for a teenager this exhibit might not have the graphics and high definition of a computer game but it is a " live " experience. Above average coffee shop.Well done Lisbon on showing how a tourist attraction in a coastal environment can work. Wonderful views of the sweeping bridge and coastline.As an added bonus, there is a major shopping centre within 200 m. This turned the experience into a 1 day event . great choice of restaurants and kid;s shop.Great for lady shoppers as well!.

Little bit expensive but cool. Cool oceonario, but little bit expensive. Payment parking 2 minutes walk.The most interesting for me was the working people in aquarium. They swim with sharks, lunafish and it was cool to see

An amazing Experience. I had the chance of visit big parks all over the world in places like Orlando. This one is probably the most impressive one. Not only is a beautiful building but has lot's of different species that you can observe. Located in a lovely place gives you lot's of options of things to do before and after.
Don't miss this. Amazing for children and adults. Extremely well done - a must see in Lisbon, the closest you will get without diving.
Very Nice. We took our 2 year old son here the first day we were in Lisbon. He loved it and didn't stop talking about it the rest of the trip.
good day out. Had a great out out here it is a very well set out oceanario with plenty to see definatley worth the trip

A definite must when in Lisbon. Spent a couple of hours in here and was amazed at the amount of different fish and animals in the aquarium. We even got to see the otter's being fed. There was a big gift shop at the end with a wide range of stuffed toys/animals and other novelty items to purchase. I would be back again when in Lisbon.

Bit disappointing. Had expected a big place, with powerful visuals, but somehow it was disappointing for me. I had hoped to see the penguins walking around. We did seem them swimming through. Seemed like we were looking at 1 main group of fish from different angles. I remember being more impressed with the display of fish in Arnhem Zoo. Very little in English.

Worth a Visit. This aquarium was really well laid out, so you don't miss anything. Each section leads you back to the main tank which provides yet another amazing view. The staff were active - and interactive with all of the creatures in their environments. It is a bit of a distance from the main tourist part of town, but worth a trip out just the same.

A "MUST" in Lisboa. A bit difficult to find, but from METROstation "Oriente" (Linha "Vermelha") youpass the shoppingcenter "Vasco da Gama", turn to the right and walk along the Tejo.After about 20 minutes you see the impressing building of the Oceanario. We visited aspecial exposition first, afterwords the "Exposicão Permanente" and paid 11 E as seniors (+65 years). Enjoy the wonderful world for 1-3 hours...

Small but nice. We did this on our last day in Lisbon. Purchased tickets online (you get a 10 or 15% discount I forget which) and spent about 2.5 hours here. Amazing to see the different types of sea life and read about them. Wasn't very crowded which made it nice and easy to see things (we went on a Saturday mid afternoon in Nov). Well worth the visit and a great way to spend a couple hours.

Amazing. . It is an amazing place for both children and adults alike. If you haven't had it on your to do list in Lisboa defenetly add it. Wee recomend you take the cable car from next to Torre Vasco da Gama for a great view of the Vasco da Gama Bridge and Tejo Estuary.

great experience. I have been to Oceanario 6 or 7 times alltogether and still it never gets boring. The amount and variety of animals to be seen and the bilingual (english, portuguese) information given makes you stay several hours and sometimes even lose track of time. If you are on holiday in LIsbon, Oceanario is a great idea for a rainy day, as it is completely indoors. Try to visit it in Winter, as in Summer it gets VERY crouded which makes it lose a bit of its atmosphere (this not being an actual criticism as it just proves its popularity).

One of the best Aquariums ive visited. This was my second visit to this attraction,and it did not dissapoint.I usually try to get in early as it can become very busy in the afternoon.All in all a must see place to go to when in Lisbon.

What a surprise.. We went on a cold rainy Sunday and the placed was packed but this was a great way to spend 2 hours. We did not know what to expect but the place was well laid out and they had english signs at every stop along the way. The main tank was very large and full of lots oaf sharks Rays and the usual fish. My advise would be skip the first viewing stop at the entrance. It bottle necks there and you can not get anywhere near the glass viewing window. Do not worry there will be many other viewing windows that are not crowded. The meditation/Rain Forest exhibit was serene and thought provoking as well as sobering. Do not miss it.... We stopped for a soda at the Cafe and found it crowded and messy.. do not bother. Also the "gift shop " is full of tacky stuff and not worth a glance. But the aquarium is worth the cost

Best in europe. Wonderful place to go. Lots of variety, up close and personal. Wonderful property. The kids will love it. It's huge and lots of interactive things to explore about our oceans, global warming and its impact on our planet. A real eye opener.
Relaxing time. See otter is one of the sweetest animals I've ever seen. Nice place to be, funny fishes, sea nettles.

Great aquarium . This was a great surprise in our trip to Lisbon.Is located in the middle of a huge complex of entertainment near the coast, they have a huge thank were you can see more than a hundred fish species including sharks and rays.
oceanarium. Tooted as the largest in Europe, it houses penguins, puffins, sun fish, sharks and a limited variety of sea animals. The temporary exhibition of underwater forests shines.

Relaxing time. A good and relaxing place to visit if you are in Lisbon, that place make you feel so good . Is like you don't wanna leave the area! Near to the shop so you can visit that too, or have a coffee outside where is a wonderful view.
Must visit while you are in Lisbon. The aquarium is amazing, so beautiful. I could sit here for hours watching the 'sealife'. It's so relaxing.

Cannot fail not to be amazed. Book the ticket online before you go. Saves you both money AND line ups at the Oceanario. Take the Metro to Oriente and walk along the esplanade to the Oceanario where you start with the "Temporary Exhibit". Read about the work that went into building this "Tropical Garden" by Amano and you would be impressed. Wait till you get to the permanent exhibition in another building where all 5 ocean habitats are displayed in a united environment. Plus all the individual display tanks that accompany the different genus; from dragon fish to tiny eels that poke their heads from the sand. Can't think of anything similar, done so well, anywhere else in the world. You won't find captive creatures here on display for the entertainment of the masses. It is an educational set up that showcases the diversity of the oceans in our world.Well worth a trip.
Nice aquarium.. Nice big tank with lots of cool fish to see. Informative exhibition, with a strong focus on environmental issues and sustainability. Worth the admission cost.

"So amazing!" - someone who frequents the Monterey Bay Aquarium. I live near the Monterey Bay Aquarium so I was not that interested in going to the Ocenario while I was on vacation. However, this place was fantastic! The facilities are very modern and have a futuristic vibe. The exhibits are intimate and filled with beautiful creatures and animals. Take 3 hours of your vacation and check this place out!

Don't need kids with you to enjoy this. Allow plenty of time. Lots to see. Sea otters adorable and you can get right up close to the Sharks and Sunfish. One of the best if not the best aquarium we've been to and all occupants appeared happy and healthy.

Fabulous!. We spent 3 hours at the aquarium and thoroughly enjoyed it. Beautifully laid out and so interesting. It was a nice cool way to spend some quiet time and see some incredible displays from all continents. Loved it!
It is beautiful...but small.. It is a small aquarium compared to others. It is good to take children for environmental education. The location is beautiful and the store with nice gifts.

It was OK. Came here to hope to experience the ocean life, but there was not much exotic species available to see. The best fish was the massive sunfish, other than that there wasn't anything special.
Lovely day. If its raining, come here! We spend half of the day and loved it. Exposition is large, venue is clean, food available in kios if needed
“Great experience Well designed aquarium”. Great aquarium , Great array of species and highly informative , Kids loved it so did we , must visit place in lisbon .
Must see!. On our last day in Lisboa we took our 4-year old son to the Oceanario and he loved it (we all did) ! It was a great way to spend our last day in the city.

Well designed aquarium. On our last day in Lisbon, being at a bit of a loose end we visited the Oceanario de Lisboa. The place is arranged around a large central tank and visitors are gently directed over two floors to visit a number of different scenes. There was even an Antarctic section complete with penguins. there were a few large whitepieces of scenery that looked rather like polystyrene but when you touched then they turned out to be ice!This is a superbly designed attraction and well worth visiing.
Fantastic attraction. Excellent way to spend a few hours with the family. Had the chance to check out the temporary exhibition by Takashi Amano. Spent a good hour here on my own in awe. A must see.
Great experience . A beautiful escape from the main city. Only $10 euro cab from the main city. Great array of species and highly informative
Fab location . Great aquarium, probably only one better that I have visited is monterey..... great exhibits, animals fit and healthy...excellent value for money

Stunning on the inside magnificent on the outside. Thought it was only going to be good for kids very enjoyable day. Take your time this is a big place. I work near a puffin colony and it was great to see you up close.
Well laid out display. This was an unexpected bonus for our trip to Lisbon. The tanks are very well displayed with maximum visibility and several different angles to see the fish from.

Fantastic Aquarium. I really enjoyed our visit to the aquarium. We spent nearly three hours there. I have been to a fair few aquariums in the world and so far I found this the best one. It's very well looked after, well presented, and I think the only way I can truthfully discribe it as, spectacular.
Big aquarium in Lisbon. This is a good choice if you want to spend some hours with the fishes. Take the subway and walk about 15 min, when you reach the building. The children loves it too.
Amazing not only for kids. Big, interesting, entertaining for all ages. Located in the modern area of the city, this attraction has become a must-see.
A fantastic Aquarium. It was a very interesting to visit Oceanario de Lisboa, The Aquarium of Lisbon. It has really a good variety of See life. I can recommend it to every visitors of Lisbon.

Good half day visit. Very good half day visit. Situated in the Oriente area of Lisbon when combined with a visit to this ultra modern area its a good day ( and evening ) out. The aquarium itself is built in a circular design around a huge tank. That you can view on several levels with various exhibits off to the side, including all kinds of sealife,reptiles and birds. All clearly laid out and explained in several languages. There is also an audio tour option.

Wonderful time and tons of fun. i wasn't so keen but this was on my husband's to go list. but it was a pleasant surprise. we spent a good 2.5 hours there. a good variety of fish and i was really excited to the sun fish (fondly called by me the ufo fish). and after the trip, we went to eat lunch at a nearby mall. it is easy to get there by public transport.
Special . Very special place! Wonderful experience. Recommended for groups and families. Certainly you will spend there a wonderful day. Enjoy you too!!

Nice aquarium, well maintained. The Oceanorio is located nearby Vasco de Gama shopping mall (reachable by metro).
The entrance fee is not really cheap (17€ including the 2nd smaller aquarium).
Well maintained and clean. You will see lots of fishes.
Worth to see.

Sea otters. We haven't planned to visit but it was well worth the visit. It was good value, very well done with a new exhibition on fresh water tropical fish with a video of the construction of the tanks, which was interesting. There are penguins, sea otters & terns, all easy to see both above ground & beneath the water. Some nice stuff in the gift shop too but a bit dear for us.
Superb. A must see or visit place in Lisbon, great atraction both for children and adults. The prices are decent and you will be amazed by the fish!

Spellbinding . It's made me think about the sole goldfish in a bowl . This is amazing both the permanent exhibition and the temporary exhibition . I have made a good friend with a ray he and I had a long conversation through the glass. See photo In regard to the temporary exhibition can you please kept it as permanent I have never been so moved. It was beautiful this is beauty at its best I sat there for some time just drinking it all in. Takashi Aramo was a genius and deserves a permanent place there.

Cannot find fault..... Visited the Oceanarium while in port on a cruise. The 728 bus route stops close by. What a great place! The central exhibit is of course the main tank with its varied inhabitants. As we walked around we had many opportunities to view the inhabitants of the tank from different angles. At some points the glass is curved, at others flat. Visibility is amazing. There are smaller tanks with specialised environments for their inhabitants. In the open air one can view penguins and see from the surface fish from different locations/oceans. Then it is possible to see the same creatures from under the water eg penguins swimming underwater, fish indigenous to the Indian Ocean area observed above ground in their pool, then see them swimming deeper in an area of the large tank. It's hard to imagine the set-up until experienced. There is also a temporary exhibit - forests underwater. Interesting but not exciting! Facilities - souvenir shop at exit, kiosk on entrance approach, cafe, educational facilities and plenty of WCs at breakout points throughout the exhibition - very important when visiting with children! All in all - very worthwhile visit and value for money.
Awesome!. Best aquarium I've been too. Would recommend it. It's located in park of nations and they have some great exhibitions. Slightly pricey but we'll worth it.
One of the best aquarium visited . Very well done. Built on the river front. One can admire the huge pool from different position. Really worth visiting for kids and adults

Incredible Underwater-World!!. The Oceanario de Lisboa is a magical place where I would recommend everyone to go! This place is fabulous for people of all ages! And you can get lost (not literally) wondering around this magical underwater world, created to make you feel like you are walking with the fish! The enormous central core of the aquarium is simply mesmerising! There are so many different types of fish in there its impossible to count! Amongst the majestic manta rays, tantalising tuna and the stunning sharks you will come across the most unexpected (and enormous) fish you have ever seen!! The Sun fish!! Beauty is in the eye of the beholder!! The rest of the aquarium is also very wonderfully laid out, you simply follow the path in a spiral and you get all the way round, from corner to corner exploring the differing environments and animals, as if you had traveled to far reaching corners of the world! The ice caps and penguins, the rainforests, the fresh waters and otters, each time feeling like you have walked into another world and always returning though to the stunning central core of the sea world... a real fabulous experience, which I would highly recommend!!

Amazing!. I just love the Oceanario! Quite big ans covering all corners of the world! I just love sitting in front of the big central tank and stay there for 10/15 minutes!A bit expensive but it is worth it! you can see sea otters, the feeding of the otters, sharks, reefs, sunfish, devil manta ray, sea horses, amphibians, and a lot more!Note: they don't have a lot of information on the animals, since the goal it's to just observe and connect with them
Awesomely big aquarium. Really cool place with lots of different species. Penguines, sharkes, rays, otters and of course a lot of fish. Absolutely worth a visit if you visit Lisbon.

It's a tsunami. Went to this aquarium as a suggestion from tripadvisor. It is just amazing animals they have there, with so diversity of climates. The coolest thing is the big central pool with different animals. We love this place!

Great attraction. So you have been to many other sea life type attractions before but this one really is different as it is more than just fish tanks with many other things to experience. Set in a quite clean modern environment I would recommend a visit for all the family.

Great large aquarium with ocean sunfish. Large queue to buy tickets, but you could get electronic tickets yourself online (with smartphone) while waiting - really convenient and cheaper! Large aquarium that is well kept, and two wonderful ocean sunfish as well as many rays and sharks and schools of fish in the large tank.Probably one of the best aquariums in Europe. But: beware of the restaurant, the lunch was hideous.

Wonderful Aquarium. This is one of the best Aquarium's that I have ever seen. What a beautiful setting. Great for all ages. The displays are well done.Be sure and bring your camera, for lasting memories, and comfortable shoes.If you are elderly, there are many places to sit an observe the fish.
Bonito aunque algo caro. If you are a student you get 10% of discount, not much but at least is something. It's a great place to see marine animals from all over the world :)
If you like captivity. Reluctantly went with an eight year old who really enjoyed it and actually wanted to go back the next day. Glass cages don't hold any appeal to me.

Good Aquarium. Visited the aquarium with a ten and eight your old. They were both impressed with the aquarium which had some interactive activities. The central tank with the large fish and sharks is entertaining and as it can be seen from multiple locations around the site reveals different species every time. The worlds regions are represented in the aquarium, I and the children found the penguins quite a treat in the artic section. The sea otters in the North American were equally interesting and playful.It doesn't take long to visit the aquarium, of course, depending on the level of interest in learning about the many species kept, for us it was a good way of getting out of the rain for a few hours. Nevertheless a worthwhile visit.

Big smile. Who said aquariums are for children? That is either not true, or we are big children. Smile didn't get from our faces from moment we entering it to moment we exit it, and long after. There is big round tank wit many species and walking path is around that tank. And there are many smaller tanks around walking path. No, you can't see wales, great white shark, but, never mind. Among many creatures, for example guitarfish, devil giant ray, there is one slow, ugly, but fascinating monster, sun fish. We could watch it for hours. And, don't look only at big and beautiful. There are many small creatures which are either colourful, strange looking or interesting by behavior that you can spent lots of time examine. It is a little expensive, but for us was well worth spent money. And there is whole experience. What I mean: You come to Oriente station, It is by itself interesting architecture. Across the street there is Vasco de Gama mall. Then you continue to Parque de Nacoes, park made for Woorld Expo 1998. You can walk park, enjoy funicular parallel to river Tejo, and as cherry on cake go to Ocaenario. So, if Oceanario itself is not convincing, wrap it with mentioned places making half day trip to that part of Lisbon, and you will be happy for doing that.

Oceanario Experience. This is an excellent aquarium on the "modern" side of Lisbon - Parque Das Nacoes which is well worth a visit in general. We took the cable car down to the site of the aquarium which was fun. The displays and range of animals & fish is great with a very clever layout representing different regions and oceans from around the world. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful place. Was a great time together with family.Recommend it even for small children, they will love the otters, penguins and colorful fishes.

The best experience. Indeed this is one of the very best places to visit in Lisbon. Starting in the design of the building (built in the area and for the Expo 98), in the quality of the visit... It's truly amazing! I've visited it a couple of times (one of them was with tour guide) and there's always something new. There's temporary exhibition as well as the permanent one, optional if you buy the ticket in the place, or included if bought online. Online also offers 10% discount and it's better to avoid the queue, expectable during weekends and or special visits/events in the place.Either if you're visiting Lisbon or live here, this is a place you don't want to miss if you enjoy culture and sea life!

It's so big, you need at least a half day to see everything.. My friend wanted to see the aquarium, so by the time we got there, we found out they had a permanent collection and the temporary collection. Because we were on a tight schedule with our hop on hop us bus, we just decided to watch the permanent collection. You at least need an hour to go trough it and to absorb everything they have. It's so huge inside, with a lot of very beautiful fishes and tropical fishes. They even have penguins and sea-otters that actually stole my heart away ! =) I would definitely would recommend this, especially when you have children, it's a nice way to show they how life under water is all about. Definitely a thumbs up !

Forget the sharks look at the ocean sunfish.. I'm not normally an aquarium visitor, but heavy rain drove us to look for somewhere to go. We bought our tickets on line to skip the queues. I was glad I went. It's apparently the second largest one in the world, and the impressive sharks grab the headlines, but for me the huge and weird ocean sunfish did it for me and for the kids the sea otters were very entertaining.

Impressive Aquarium. My 2yr old really enjoyed it! Was different to aquariums we'd been to in Sydney. More so for the size of the tank. To be able to see schools of fish swimming around with plenty of space is quite a site! We didn't have time to see the temporary exhibit as we were only in town for the day and struggled to find the place initially as didn't use a guided tour.

Sight seeing. Nice enough place. Impressive main tank with lots of opportunity to sit and just watch the many fish swim by really close.also there are some good food places a cable car ride and a shopping centre in the area. We stayed in Lisbon for 3 days so had the time to venture out to the oceanarium but if you are limited for time i would recommend the more in city sights first if you have the time the fit in the oceanarium. I found nemo !!

Big enough. Big but for me it was dull. It was good for children as they were exited on any fish they could see. Especially with sunfish. Remember that families with a pram and smaller children have priority!
Very impressive.. Beautiful aquarium. Thoroughly enjoyed walking through this impressive aquarium. Beautifully laid out.
For a rainy day. Not as big as expected with less different fish then anticipated. The temporary expo was beautiful but expensive for just one small floor.

Amazing!. The set up was really neat with the large aquarium in the middle surrounded by habitats from different areas of the world. Being able to get so close to otter and penguins exhibits was a major bonus!

Beautiful!!!. Oceanario was the cultural partureita of my holiday in Lisbon. It was amazing as well relaxing experiense. Definately worth to visit! Among the tour in Oceanario they tell a serious story about saving the seas.

Great place to go on a rainy day. We opted for the Oceanario because of a rainy day. The place is not a water park rather it's a huge aquarium. The species they have in there are spectacular, including different types of sharks, sting rays, manta, this hugest ugly fish weighing upto 3 tons. Nice are all the theme small side aquariums for arctic and indian oceans. Definitely recommend even on a nice day.

Worth a visit. I recommened buying your tickets online so you can skip the long lines and go straight to the exhibitions. I just did that on my phone when I saw the big line and just presented my ticket on my phone. We liked the main one but not the temporary exhibit

Well worth a visit!. Beautifully located, beautifully designed and beautifully maintained! A real pleasure to while away a few hours, suitable for children of all ages :) Added attractions are the workers floating around the tanks and the excellent movies.
Never seen so far. The concept of aquarium and other settings along with a very large amount of different species is unique. I was in many aquarium centers in Europe, none so rich as this

Wonderful Basin with incredible diversity of fishes. Worth the visit depsite a high price but you will enjoy the main basin which is really impressive. The whole place is organized around the main aquarium, very clean and well lighted up. Kids will love it and parents too.

My favourite aquarium yet. I love aquariums and will always try to fit in a visit to one when on holiday and there is one in the vicinity. This one is my favourite so far, the reason being that there is so much variety from the fish to amphibians to otters to penguins.Everything is laid out into geographical zones over two levels and there are info panels on the walls (although I don't usually read them).There was a bit of a queue to get in but that is to be expected with an attraction of this quality.Highly recommended for visitors of all ages.

Please make the Takashi Amano exhibition permanent!. This is an absolutely stunning aquarium and unrivalled in Europe. There is currently a temporary exhibition designed by Takashi Amano who died earlier this year and who was the world's the greatest aquascaper. It is truly striking and I urge anyone who is wavering over visiting the aquarium to do so while this exhibition is on.
Great day out. Well worth the visit, great watching the divers with the fish, if you've got kids take them they'll love it I'm a big kid and loved it.
Best aquarium I've ever visited. The beauty and simplicity of the exhibits was really incredible. It's no question at all that this is my favorite aquarium ever. My two year old was blown away!

Trip to all 4 oceans in 1 hour. The oceanarium was built for showing the variety and richness of ocean life and also symbolises the interlinkage of 4 oceans. There are lots of different fish and animals there and even though I've travelled to several Asian and European countries where I have seen those creatures in real nature it was interesting to see them much closer in aquariums. Great for both kids and adults. Must visit during beeing in world exhibition area of Lisbon!

Fantastic in every single way. amazing experience, lots of different marine species. They all look very healthy and happy. You can easily spend 3 hours here and still wanting more.Tips: purchase tickets online in advance to avoid the queue. We forgot to buy ours and ended up spending 45 mins in the queue. Also avoid weekends if you can as the place will be packed with both tourists and local and it does get very noisy which will affect the whole experience as you wont be able to spend enough time watching the fish swimming peacefully.

Great exhibition, highly recommended. What a great day out! the exhibitions, both the temporary one and the permanent one were very informative and quite magical. The aquarium is a must to see as the variety of the fish were fantastic. Although we did not have any children with us, it was ideal for any age, and all the children we saw were in awe of the aquarium.

Truly amazing. I was knocked over as soon as i walked in and saw the monstrous aquarium with so much really big and interesting fish, And there is a lot more besides the big tank. A really interesting place to visit

It is mesmerising .
