Really amazing experience even for the adults.It is going to be really fun for kids as they have a huge selection of all kind of fishes.Also they made it really fascinating by adding the trees and birds to depending on the aquarium .There also entertainment for kids such as digital games .there are also a souvenir shop and a cafe

A must when visiting Lisbon. Loved it, the temporary exhibition was absolutely amazing. The oceanario itself is impressive with its huge main bassin. A large variety of species. It takes about 50 minutes from the historic centre to get there by metro, but it is definately worth the travel.
Fantastic aquarium. Probably the best aquarium I have ever seen. Absolutely amazing. Great for all ages. Incredible variety of fish. Plan to spend at least a couple of hours there!

Magnificent . This place is unbelievable. Don't forget to visit the temporary exhibit which currently is a Japanese seascape. It's wonderful to just sit and ponder it. The main attraction is huge. Three hours slipped by without us even noticing. There is so much to see. Take take to watch the video showing the back room stuff.

Outstanding. As a diver, I have always been drawn to aquaria, even though I have my doubts about the morality. I have to say this is the finest I have ever seen. Exceptionally well presented and the exhibits appeared well cared for and in a clean environment. Good value and needs a minimum of two hours.

Too soon after my visit to Monterey. This is a nice aquarium, but it is not Monterey. Some nice displays, and the sun fish is impressive. This is an educational activity and the children will enjoy it.I probably took off one star because the cafeteria food was horrible and it would have been expensive at any price. They pile on your plate tasteless stuff. Avoid!

Lovely aquarium. Especially great place to visit on a Sunday when it's wet, along with all the other tourists. If you can buy your tickets in advance, queues can be very long at this popular attraction. Amazing central tank with all the species together it seems.
Wonderful experience. This place was absolutely magical.A truly memorable experience! Just wonderfull aquarium - must see,

Excellent Aquarium and worthy of reputation. Said to be best of its type in the world, and lives up to that reputation. Definately the best aquarium we have been to in the world. The main tank is a spectacular 2 story high display that forms the centre of the Aquarium and can be viewed from all sides on two levels. The climatic zone displays are the best I have ever seen, and the lack of glass screens made you really feel part of the displays. The Penguins were close enough to touch, birds flying over your head, otters relaxing only a metre or two away. Huge variety of fish in all the displays including the huge sunfish. The temporary display in the entrance building is also spectacular and proves that gardens can be landscaped in the water as well as on land. The building itself is an example of great modern architecture and the tiled exterior walls are really well done.Can be reached by the metro and the surrounding area is quite a modern contrast compared to the old part of Lisbon so allow time to have a walk around.

A must visit if in area. This is a fantastic place for adults and children alike. Having visited many aquaria over the years this one surpasses them all. The underwater garden installation is also impressive.

Don't believe the hype. This is actually a nice aquarium. They have shark and other species in the fish tank you don't see every day. It's great for children. But it's outrageously expensive and definitely not a must see. Don't believe the hype. If you didn't bring children, have a walk along the Tejo instead and study the monstrous architecture left behind by an EXPO long forgotten.

Amazing and well worth a visit. I dont normally like zoos and enclosures as I hate to see animals and reptiles cooped up. This was something off the scale. The actual tank itself is roomy and tranquil and the variety of sharks, rays and fish was awesome. The otters in the arctic section are really cute and obviously very happy. The tank was being cleaned and the otters were having great fun with the divers tube and equipment. There is the allusion that the otters and penquins dive into the same tank as the sharks but its not as the water temp is very different. a great and enjoyable day. the food in the restaurant didnt look very appertising and and was expensive so eat before or after. The food court in the shopping complex by the train station has lots to offer

Some awesome fish! . Great place, easy to access either by tube or by the 728 bus from town. Some amazing fish in the big tank - 2 sun fish look prehistoric! In the smaller tanks, some rare fish too, including frog fish.The "outside " areas were great, including sea otters, penguins etc etc. Was a good way to spend a few hours.Queues were massive at the entrance, bug you can book online on your smartphone in 2 minutes and jump the queue :)
Oceanario de Lisboa. Much better than we expected. We only visited this attraction because our hotel was located nearby. We were pleasantly surprised and spent 4 hours there!

Monuments. Great place to visit I. Family and in a new area of Lisbon with good restaurants near in the shopping Center vasco da gama, they have wonderful fishes and the oceanario is very well build and the surrounding are great.
Great day out. Went here on a Sunday morning due to rain, was much better than I thought. The main tank is the biggest draw. The sunfish is the coolest thing I've ever seen!

A must see in Lisbon. Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the many attractions of Lisbon you can not miss . It is certainly in the top 10. The purchase of tickets online helps a lot to jump the queues , or buy through the smartphone is also very easy and has assistants who can help you. Reserve at least half a day , otherwise you will regret it. If you have children it is a magical visit. Has a bit of everything about the marine life and at the end we feel we visited a very very special place. It is a bit out of downtown , but it has underground very close.
best of best. BEST experience. After lunch in a very good place near oceanário ( boalisboa), the employee suggested, take the telecabine and see the Oceanarium . Really one of the best in the world.

A very very good experience. Having visited a Singapore oceanarium just earlier this year, i must say that i liked the Lisbon one even better. Very very nicely and smartly done. The highlights are of course the penguins and the otters. Both are just marvelous !!!

Truly and excellent experience. Long queue, but it was a wet Sunday. But well worth the wait. Disability assistance is also on hand which really helps for anyone with limited mobility. Well worth a visit.

Excellent permanent and temporary displays, don't miss!. We had a great time here and got a 15% reduction with our Lisboa Card. Went on a Friday to avoid the weekend queues. Great central tank, loved the Sunfish, huge, bizarre looking and mesmerizing, we even saw one being fed by a diver. The sharks and ray were gorgeous to look at too. Loved all the surrounding displays including the penguins, puffins, terns and most of all the cute sea otters which were floating in the water, heads touching preening themselves with almost human mannerisms. Lots of other displays of incredible sea creatures and topped off with an wonderful temporary exhibition, "submerged forests" by Takashi Amano. Huge tanks with the most beautiful tiny fresh water fish and incredibly realised natural landscaping with subtle planting and placement of twigs etc. The effect was enhanced by relaxing music and the whole effect was magical and memorable. Loved it all.

Top attraction in Lisbon. We didn't come to Lisbon with a view to visiting this but the weather steered us towards an indoor activity one afternoon and we were very glad it did. Suitable for adults and children alike this aquarium will have you staring at the giant tank in fascination as you watch the huge sun fish, rays and sharks and schools of smaller fish go about their everyday activities. The sea bird enclosure is yet another delight. Plenty of room for everyone, it's just a couple miles out of the centre (we took a taxi which was very reasonably priced).

Great afternoon out!. Spent a couple of hours on a wet day in the Oceanario with our 3 kids. It's a 15 minute walk from the metro stop and through the shoping centre.Booked online and glad we did, there was probably over 100 in the ticket office queue - we were guided straight through to the main entrance after showing my PDF ticket emailed to me on my phone. They also say it's 10% cheaper online as well. The main tank is just superb, and the highlights for us were the sharks, the sunfish ( rare to see in an aquarium ) and the stingrays and mantas. As you walk around in a path around the main tank, you go through different habitats of sea life. There are penguins plus a tropical area. There are many more tanks of fish and sealife to see as you explore, with the main tank viewing areas coming back to delight. We went to the temporary exhibition which was also worthwhile. The main cafe is ok, there's a 4 course set menu with a choice of mains and a drink for about €10. Shop is very expensive as they often are in these types of places. Good value for €50 (£36) - costs £67 in Blue Planet for a family of 5.

Very good and well laid out. Long queue but relatively fast moving on a rainy Sunday morning in Nov.There were adverts saying to buy tickets online to avoid the queue, but it didn't show where to go if you did this whilst in the queue, so people would benefit.Very good oceanarium, not so much info on all the displays though.Easy to navigate however unlike London which totally disorientates you.Good to visit once, but would not revisit for a long time.
Excellent. Very well laid out and lots to see. Innovative way to cover all the world's main oceans. Good clear displays. Tasteful goods in shop.

Great afternoon out. Visited last Weds (28th Oct) after lunch catching the bus from Plage ComercioCost of the bus included in the Viva Viagem card so that was easy, a few minutes queuing to pay when we arrived but after that no real crowd issues once insideGood quality attraction with plenty to see and read, would highly recommend it. Our party consisted of Mum & Dad and 19 and 21 year old sons

Impressive giant fish tank. We spent a few hours at Oceanario which is a huge and well designed aquarium highlighting the different marine habitats on the planet. On the day we went (a bright day in mid October) it was busyish but you could still take your time and wander with plenty of room to get good views and pictures of the creatures. The imperious Sunfish and the sea otter were amongst the most interesting. The layout probably afforded the best 360 degree view of penguins compared with other wildlife collections I have visited with excellent views of them beneath the water as well as on the surface and on land. The modern building design is itself quite interesting. There is an interactive area where kids can explore the interelationship between human and marine environments. The tanks and displays are augmented by some written information but there could have been mire of this, We did not visit the temporary exhibition so can't comment on this,

Great Experience. It was a great experience. A huge central tank with plenty to view from the large windows. It is really very impressive. They have thousands of fish from all over the world. It is a 30-40 minute ride from downtown in the metro rail. Entrance fee is around 15.00 euros.
Great fun for kids. the best oceanarium experience I had so far, we went on week day and it was not crowded at all, our son enjoyed running around and watching fish

very interesting. We went to the ocenarium on a very wet day. The place is not as big as the acquarium in Genova (Italy) but very well organised. It was very busy and it is a good idea to book the tickets online and show them as a pdf file from your mobile phone if you can. It avoids the massive queue at the entrance. The exhibitions were well laid out. Teh winner with the children were the penguins and the otters. The temporary exhibition of an underwater forest was also fantastic

Ocean sunfish amazing! . Visited for a morning. Really well laid out and it certainly is large. We visited for a morning whilst on a cruise. Well worth a visit. Reasonably priced and lots of interesting things to see.

Great oceanarium in Lisbon. The Oceanario presents a very interesting display of sea life in 4 quadrants of the globe. The audio accompaniment is a bit basic, at least the English version. But the overall visit was lovely.
Facinating experience. Just wonderfull aquarium - saw lots, learnt lots. Children (including one teenager) were engaged the whole way through. Sun fish were amazing

Beautiful place. It is by far the most beautiful place I've seen in my life. There aren't many places where you can just sit there for a long time and still have an awesome and never tiring experience

Although small, a fine piece of architecture. If you want to avoid the LONG lines outside, better to buy tickets onlineIts is fairly small, but any structure built in the middle of the water, is to me something worth a thumbs-upThe visit might be quick, but it is worth itAccessible from Estacao do Oriente (Metro or Bus)

Decent aquarium.. If you compare the Oceanario de Lisboa to most European aquariums, it is indeed bigger. That's it. There is 1 impressive fish known as the ocean sunfish and a couple sharks. About 90% of the information provided on the boards is about being eco-friendly and not buying just any fish at the supermarket. There is much less information about the species in general. I much prefer the aquarium in Valencia which has more than just one big tank and gives relevant information. The fresh water aquarium at the exhibit was really cool.
2 floor big oceanario. 2 floor big oceanario, very beautiful, variety, different pavilions, you can sit n front of it on any floor you choose and any part of it and get lost in contemplation

Crowded day but great aquarium. This is certainly a great aquarium. Unfortunately it was very crowded on the day we visited which was a rainy day, so it was harder to see some of the smaller aquariums. Nevertheless it was magic to get to see some of those animals.
Fun and wow. We had a lovely relaxing time. The exhibition are done so well. You get to see the fish so close up and the otters a real treat.

Great for kids. We took our 7 year old.She was amazed by the huge tank with sharks , rays and various fish that came right up to the glass. Is ideal as lots of information. Also places to stop and just watch the fish.There are also penguins, otters and seals . Just beware of the queue for tickets , we got there at 10 and waited 15 minutes. We also didn't find it very well signposted .

What a tank. We very much enjoyed the was the exhibits were set out. The large tank in the centre with views from lots of different points was brilliant. I would not bother with the temporary exhibit next tine though.
One of the best place in Lisbon. A great adventure. Just beeing in front of major tank deserve what you pay. Don't miss.And the places around deserve a visit to!
Best aquarium in Europe. I rank the Lisbon Oceanario very high in my top-3 of aquariums world-wide, in the same league as Cape Town and San Diego. World class!

Great aquarium . We went on a Saturday afternoon. Being the number 1 thing to do in Lisbon the queues were extremely large. If you log onto the free wifi outside you can buy tickets online and walk straight inside. It was really busy once inside and you had to queue at every glass window to look at the fish. The main tank is impressive. It took us about 2hrs to walk around.

Really good aquarium. The aquarium is a little far from the city centre (€9 euro in a taxi from Alfama or €1.50 on the metro but on a Sunday takes 40 minutes). It is quite large and we spent approx 2 hours there. We booked tickets online so skipped the queues and it was €15 each. They accepted the tickets off our phone screens.

An amazing place. If going on weekends - pre-order your ticket :)I went on a Saturday and had to queue for a while to get the ticket (but not a big problem). Then when finally getting in it was a lot of fun. A really good coverage of different parts of the ocean world.

Worth the visit.. I loved the oceanario- could have spent the whole day there. Lots of good variety of sea life- different and strange varieties of fish! The sea otters were fascinating and the penguins responded to their names!

Perfect pn a rainy day. Thoroughly enjoyed the aquarium in Lisbon. It was a slightly rainy day in October and was the perfect inside escape. You truly feel like you are in the tank with the amazing variety of fish and the temporary exhibit of the nature aquarium was very interesting. The sun fish definitely stole the show for us.

Oceanário de Lisboa. It's an amazing aquarium. It is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe and was recently distinguished as the best aquarium in the world. It is located in "Parque das Nações", an area in Lisbon highly in bad condition that underwent a huge refurbishment when it was chosen for the grounds of Expo '98, the last World Exposition of the 19th century.

Best aquarium visit!. I live in Baltimore, home of the U.S. National Aquarium which is great....but I thought that my visit in Lisbon was fabulous. The outside looks pretty ordinary but once you are inside its quite magical. Another nice feature is that there is a generous discount for seniors. Hours of aquatic fun.

Up close and personal with the denizens of the deep.. A truly memorable experience! Having a shark swim past your face,or a manta ray swim straight at you is something you will never forget. Amazing amounts of sea creatures including the astonishingly huge and very weird sunfishes. We spent four hours or so here and were consistently engaged by the myriad creatures we encountered.

Must see!. If you are passionate about sea life, a geek, a kid, an old man or anything else - this is a must in Lisbon. Very good arrangement, it's mesmerising to sit and watch the fishes graciously swimming around.Tip: If you want to visit the Science centre as well, don't choose Monday as your visit day!

Not just for kids!. WE had planned to take in Oceanario de Lisboa as part of our 'city tour' and as a wet day was predicted, we decided to go for it (on the 728 bus). There was a good sized queue but we got in after fifteen minutes or so. I must stress that it is very popular with families and young children, but on a wet weekend in October, I guess that is inevitable. There is lots to see and loads of information and the main 'tank' has to be seen to be believed. The sun fish are amazing!
Deep blue. Many different kind of fish from everywhere are living in this Amazing Island-building in Parco do Nacoes- North Lisbon

Not that impressive. Is not that impressive. Probably good for one day with kids but not more than this At the end it is a single huge aquarium built arond a central element where the most Interesting fishes can be seen You walk around and it is always the same

A fabulous experience. If you have any interest in nature and the world around you a visit to the Oceanario is an absolute must. The current temporary exhibition is jaw-dropping and the permanent exhibits are extraordinary too. Time seemed to fly by and our party spent in the region of 4 hours absorbed in these fabulous creatures. The prehistoric looking Sunfish are particularly striking and the sea otters which we observed being lovingly hand fed are beautiful creatures.

Great for families. Very enjoyable 2-3 hour visit. Well worth the bus ride from downtown Lisbon. Having been to Aquariums around the world, this was in our top 10% given the great layout and diversity of exhibits.
Big and nice aquarium. You must visit this aquarium if you like fish and marine life. Here got big sun fish (Mola Mola) and many beautiful fish.

A true experience. A little bit different to your usual aquarium . It has a special tunnel area where the fish all swim above you and you feel like your under the water with them . Scary and amazing at the same time.
Never on Sunday. The entry ticket line was so long that we decided to avoid the crowd and just walk along the rainy waterfront instead of herding through this busy Sunday morning.

Really GOOD. Excelent experience, great if you have kids. The temporary exhibitions is ok, but the main tank and the surrounding fauna are awesome.You can book in advance online, and you can use the ticket 120 days from the date of purchase, it's 10% of the pricey 14 euro +3 euro temporary exhibition.You get a 15% discount if you buy the Lisbon Card.If you have at least 4-5 hours time until you catch your next flight(reserve at least 2 hours for visiting) is very close to the airport- 3 stations to be exact at Oriente Station.You ca also have a decent meal for 8 euro with everything included from soup to main course, dessert, and beverage!

It did get boring after an hour. Maybe this place wasn't for me to visit, however, I struggled to keep myself entertained. It is focussed all around a large tank in the middle of the centre with everything else getting only a little view.I don't think the ticket price is justified.

The Oceanario an interesting half day visit in Lisbon. One day during our stay in Lisbon, Rain changed our plans. We took the Metro to the oceanarium. I would suggest that you buy tickets in advance on line. The ticket line was quite long. It happened to be a Sunday, so it was somewhat crowded with families.We had a wonderful time. the exhibits are interesting and the presentation was excellent.It was nice to see Lisbon families out for a day of fun. It seems like we spent too much time rubbing shoulders with other tourists. So it was nice to talk to locals. There was a special exhibit called "forests underwater" that was very beautiful.

Hypnotic and breathtaking . This place was absolutely magical. We also had the luck to visit the temporary exhibition of Takashi Amano (underwater forests) which was one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen.I have never been a big fan of oceanariums in general, but this one was just fantastic. The setting, organisation, variety... Time just passed by and I didn't even notice.Definitely save part of your time in Lisbon to walk around this area and visit the Oceanarium.

beautifully displayed. I really enjoyed the experience of 'connected oceans'. The fact that the areas of the Oceanarium are divided by Oceans, each one with its own characteristics, makes it to be great. The temporary exhibition on October/15 was a very poor one, and definitely not worth of the extra cost.

Heaven on earth!. An overwhelmingly beautiful experience. The permanent exhibit is incredibly interesting however for me the temporary exhibit by Takashi Anamo was just heart lifting and slightly overwhelming - it was so beautiful.
See the ocean from the inside. On your way to the airport waste a few hours for this incredible place with oceanic flora and fauna, otters were my favorites.
Amazing. It's just incredible. The Oceanarium is a must-see for everyone visiting Lisbon: the number of tanks and the fauna diversity offered are unique.

A great place to visit whatever the weather. We went to the Oceanarium with friends and enjoyed an afternoon there. The place is amazing. Aquariums aren't for everyone, but I can't imagine anyone not being impressed with this one. People of all ages will enjoy a visit as there's lots to see. There's plenty of places to rest for the foot weary visitors. I would recommend wearing sensible footwear when visiting the Oceanarium. There isn't actually any cafe's within this building, but plenty nearby.

Great day out . Brilliant collection of marine life and very well maintained. Well worth it. We had 12% reduction in price as we had the voucher from Grey line City sightseeing, which was good considering the admission prices. Don't miss the science museum - Pavilhao do conhecimento right next to the Ocenario. My 11 year old daughter had a great time at both places.
Big Aquarium. A beautiful one in Europa. Sharks, Stingray, fish and so all together in the same basin. Really fun.
Amazing!. Best aquarium I've ever visited. Great design and lay out. The sea otters are total babes - you spend all ay watching them. Good eco message too with lots to do for kids.

Like you were in a submarine. The Oceanario it is the perfect place to go with the family, specially kids. They will love it. The colosal amount of species in the large tank is amazing and mesmerizing. I will never regret a visit there.

Best aquarium ever. Without a doubt the best aquarium I've ever been to. The central tank with sharks, sun fish, manta rays and many other species is fascinating, while the tropical room, the penguin area and the sea otters were amazing to explore up close.Our baby daughter loved it too!

If you like Aquariums, you'll like this one. I've been to some pretty cool aquariums around the world and this one is certainly a quality one. It has a large number of species and is easy to walk through. Probably best for a sub par weather day, or if you decide to do a trip/tour out to the newer part of Lisbon.
Great visit. Oceanario is nice place if you like sea life.You can see many species of fish (specialy shark and ray)
Day trip. Paid a visit on a rainy day . Only spent a few hours and managed to see all the displays . Ideal for kids , as long as you keep it short .

Must see in Lisbon. We were lucky to get a private tour - but this place shines no matter how you visit it. The new underwater landscape exhibition is fabulous (like your home, freshwater aquarium multiplied by 1000 and then modelled and maintained to perfection). But the main tank with the Atlantic fish and the four large habitats are also fantastic to visit. And so much more... This is the one attraction in Lisbon that you can't miss!

Mesmerizing aquarium . This is the best aquarium I have ever visited. The central tank is enormous and houses dozens of different varieties of fish. You can sit in a comfy chair and watch the interplay. I like the stress on conservation and environmental threats. The setting, in a futuristic park, is also pretty amazing.

To do for bad weather. I went to the oceanario with two friends on a rainy day. It was really cool and I enjoyed watching the fishes. Especially the main tank is amazing. Friends told us that we would need one to two hours in the aquarium, but we stayed in total for 3 hours. The actual temporary exhibition is very long aquarium and it is a piece of art. If you have time you should sit there for a while and relax. We are three students and we really enjoyed both parts. With kids I would recommend only visiting the main part, because the temporary part could be too boring and relaxing for them.
Amazing and beautiful. I have been to the Ocenario several times and it is always an amazing experience. Definitely worth a try
Perhaps I have seen too many. My wife always wants us to go to the aquariums... For me they are all the same - dark rooms with fish, some nice sharks and so on...

Fabulous Few Hours. I really enjoyed a couple of hours to talk around this Oceanarium, the displays were enormous and very well looked after. The glass was very clean (on both sides) and I managed to get up close to some Puffins for the first time !

One of the best aquariums in the world. Can't add much that the previous 13,000 reviewers couldn't. Go and visit this place! Definitely not the cheapest, but it's worth it.Take note of the feeding times in the leaflets (usually around 10am and 3pm) and try to be there. The sea otters put on the best show, but the penguins are fun to watch too. Bring a jacket or cardigan for the colder sections, I got a nasty flu there. The temporary exhibition is worth visiting, the Japanese 'aquascape' was beautiful.
Amazing. This is an experience of total immersion in a sea of wonders.My kids loved it and its peacefull environment.

Nice visit. Spent the morning here on our way to the airport. Very well designed central aquarium with a wide variety of fish. The four sections based on the different seas were also very well maintained, designed and had a good mix of aquatic life. I think kids would love it ! Just a tip, book tickets in advance as queues can get very long.
Disappointing. Don't race to this aquarium! It is just alright. It is big but that is all.It is also difficult to return to the city centre from this place. Taxis are not available.
Spectacular. We got there early to avoid any queues. This place is spectacular and is a must for both adults and children alike. You could sit for hours watching these stunning fish entertain you.

lovely day. skip the special exhibit. at least when we went, it was kind of dull. not worth the extra price. the regular exhibit however was very interesting. do not go to the cafe of the oceanario though. there are plenty of restaurants and cafes around and the cafe was NOT good.

A huge, beautiful Aquarium. This is a modern and very nice aquarium with many interesting species of fish, birds, and mammals. It also features a temporary display, which in our case was the beautiful Underwater Forests by Takashi Amano.

Lots to see. Queueing up for the tickets took a long long time. Better buy ticket online. No inhuman trapping of large whales and dolphins for show. But lots of different varieties of sea living creatures to see.

Large aquarium. Very good place to spend a day with the family and look at all species living in all the seas of the world. It has also a small jungle walk where u can experience the jungle like temperaturas and flora. Very interesting and next to the Parque das Naçoes and within easy reach by metro station Oriente.

A symphony of colour. They have thousands of fish from all over the world and incredible aquarium. The building is very interesting, build when Portugal hosted the World Fair. If you have children a must, a day trip, there is so much to.
Small and big fishes. Big enough to have something to see and small enough that you have time for other things that day, too.

A nice aquarium, some interesting species but very overrated. Firstly, the queue for the aquarium was very long so it's definitely worth booking tickets in advance!! It was a nice aquarium with a few interesting species such as sunfish, manta ray and penguins which was lovely to see, however I can't help but feel it's a bit overrated, it is all laid out around one main tank - which is an incredible huge tank holding sharks, manta ray and sunfish amongst other fish species - this tank I would rate 5*, it is excellent, however it gets tiresome seeing the same tank over and over again with only a few small tanks containing other species around the edge (with the exception of a penguin enclosure and a otter enclosure although we only saw 1 otter). My favourite part of aquarium is a shark tunnel, however there was no shark tunnel here, the only sharks were in the main central tank and there wasn't much of a species variety. Overall it was good, but not amazing. Also don't bother paying extra for the temporary exhibition, it was very disappointing. A nice day out all in all but I probably wouldn't return unless they added more to it.
Great alternative to castles and churches. we had a day off on our trip to Portugal and wanted to see something unusual in Lisbon. We took a cab and had a delightful morning excursion.

All I can say is WOW. I have had the pleasure of visiting this Oceanario 3 times and each time I am very impressed with how it looks and all there is to do there. Well worth the trip when visiting Lisbon Portugal. Very large facility and a great deal of wildlife to see. When you leave you will say WOW that was nice!
Wonderful Aquarium. A huge main tank with plenty to view from the enormous windows. Many other birds and fish to see in a well-laid-out Aquarium complex. What a fantastic experience.

Amazing. As a "mature" couple we were a bit unsure about whether to visit going on other reviews. We both found it really a worthwhile visit. Exceeded my expectaions totally and felt it was worth the €14 entrance fee. A unique experience
Great experience. It was a great experience. They have the exhibitions organized by the different oceans, which adds to the teaching value, I think.

A memorable ocean visit. Excellent possibility to see marine life in its natural habitat, plenty of areas to stand and watch the sea creatures move through the water, and for the mammals even on land. Pre-buying a ticket on line saves time standing in the long queue to get in. Even the additional exhibition was well worth seeing. The photos we took really help to relive this memorable occasion.

Amazing sealife.. One of the bigest attractions of Lisbon. Worth every penny. The variety of sealife in this place is amazing. The only negative: is too crowdy. People keep pushing you non stop in the dark.

Off the beaten track but well worth a visit. Our expectations had been tempered by a review that said, despite the good reviews, if you've been to Monterey Aquarium then this one will be disappointing. I think the aquarium at Monterey is fabulous so I was prepared to be a bit let down by this one. I was wrong, it is a splendid place and, dare I say it, some bits are even better than at Monterey. In particular the sea otters had more space and a more interesting habitat. The big central tank was really impressive with lots of spectaular exhibits - sun fish, manta rays, several types of shark - amongst many others.We did have to queue to buy our tickets but the queue moved quickly and, because my partner is on crutches at the moment, we were spotted and taken to lifts to reach the different levels without having to ask. My only complaint would be that it has a very strict one way system so you can't go back for a second look at any favourites; I guess that is how they manage the vast volume of visitors they get.

Great day out. The oceanarium is one of the best we had seen and our 3 year old absolutely loved it, especially the otters,penguins and fish tank. There is a gondola ride thats great and plenty of restaurants across the road. We spent all afternoon and the evening nearby. The orange fountain at front of the oceanarium was great fun to watch waiting for the water to come out and splash every 5mins! My son didn't move

Expensive but worth it, selfie sticks were annoying!. The aquarium is definitely worth a visit. It's easily reached by public transport but not well sign posted so head for the sea when you leave the metro and you will find it , roughly a ten minute walk. The price when we visited was 17€ per adult which we felt was expensive however there is a lot to see and you can appreciate the charges once you get into the venue. It gets very very crowded, we visited mid week first thing in the morning and it was packed. The aquarium is built around a central tank and there are lots of viewing windows so move on when one gets crowded and you should get a good view. Annoying selfie sticks were being used a lot which did spoil the views for other visitors so this is something the aquarium may need to look at in the future.

Ocenarium. TIP:Buy tickets online. It has discount and you dont need to wait in long line.There are lots of things to see, you can stay 1-3 hours depends are you with kids or not. We didnt have delphin show and we were very dissapointed, but weather was rainy and windy.Complete mark will be 3-4, as there are areas that needs improvements, starting with employees who doesnt speak fluent English.

Money Well Spent. We used the "city sightseeing Blue route" hop on/off bus(19e for 48hrs) to visit this place that is a bit off the usual tourist area, cost of entry was 14 euros each for the permanent show, but it was worth it, fantastic large centre focal point with interesting side tanks, far too many to mention here the photos show a fraction of the beauty, covering The Atlantic/Pacific/Indian Ocean a good 2/3 hours are needed to take a gentle walk around a superb exhibition, a nice cable car ride after and then we carried on to the Zoo using the hop on/off bus(every Hour) that you pick up near the hotel at the end of cable car ride. Kids will love it

Fun for all. You don't have to be a kid a heart to enjoy this aquarium!! Hubby and I spent about two hours checking out all the exhibits and the oh so fascinating big tank. The current temporary exhibit: Forests Underwater by Takashi Amano is not to be missed. Make sure you watch the video at the end of the exhibit on how it was built. The aquarium's huge center tank is the big attraction and you make your way down a gentle spiral stopping along the way to watch the sea life at different levels. They also have a great tropical rain forest/ sea tank that almost melts into the large tank so you also can enjoy colorful fish at many levels as well. This aquarium is located in the Parque das Nacoes which was a bit quiet when we were there (weekday in October), but I can see that during the summer it would be full of families.

Amazing Oceanario Lisbon. A great ocean of fish, not to forget the penguins and puffins! An incredible showcase of the biodiversity in the great bodies of water of the world. Go in the morning when it opens and spend three hours, then ride the cable cars up and down the seaside. Plenty of places to eat and stroll after the splishing and splashing.

No wonder it's the best oceanarium in the world. Wow. It was so amazing I'd definitely go again if I'm ever back in Lisbon! The layout is genius - you get to see the four major tanks from different angles as you wind your way down, then around.

World Class Aquarium. Well worth a half day visit. Take the clean and efficient Metro to the Oriente stop. Walk along the river walk a short distance. Wonderful variety of fish and aquatic life. Don't miss the 2 charming sea otters, the happy and sociable penguins, and the 30 min film explaining some of the technical details of maintaining a healthy environment for about 500 living things. In the big tank, are all kinds of sharks, rays, barracudas, groupers--some you have likely not seen at other aquariums, and certainly not all in one place. Two enormous sunfish (2 ton) are in the main tank too. All information is is Portuguese and English. Very fair admission price. Nearby is gondola ride along the river.

Great family time!. The kids really enjoyed this. There were many animals to see. The cute, playful otters were my favorite. There is an interactive area for the kids as well. The cafe was reasonably priced and had a few good choices.
a Must!. What a great day spent in a beautiful and colorful place... its a must see for sure.... if you have little ones they will have a blast!

Great attraction but you need to travel a bit from the city center. Great attraction for families. Nice area with museums and harbour. A nearby shopping mall with grocery store is pretty good to visit on the same trip. Instead of the metro you can take a cab to/from here, it is about 15 Euro.

Memorable! You can't miss it!. Oceanário is a temple of nature and a tribute to the Oceans and all the life there is in them. If you are in Lisbon you must make sure you won't miss it, particularly now that it has an additional treasure inside: the work of Takashi Amano. There are no words to describe the wonder, the sensitivity, the artistic gift. You must see it, at least once in your life!
A must do especially with children. The children loved it - as did we. A great way to spend a morning or afternoon. Easy to get around and plenty to see.
nice to see. the office I was in was next door.. so I took a bit of time and checked out the aquarium.. nicely done.. a great visit to relax after work.

Well worth the trip. We hopped off the yellow bur tour to visit the Oceanarium and it was well worth it. Yellow bus tours gets you a 15% discount off entry price too. Very informative and a well organised establishment. The outside is covered in ceramic fish scales ane the waterfall outside is amazing. Lovely place for children who tend to be too fascinated to misbehave, plenty of interactive stuff too. Outside there is a lake surrounding the Oceanarium which has fish and jellyfish clearly visible. Nearby is the cablecar to ride on. We could easily have spent longer there but can recommend the whole expo 98 area as interesting, clean and worth a visit.
AMAZING. best place ive ever been endless amount of different types of fish from around the world recommend going here
Beautiful. A little bit expensive ( use lisboa card to get a discount), but totally worthy to pay a visit. Located in the newest and more modern part of lisbon

Interesting place !. A good place to go when in Lisboa. Has some interesting things to see. Having seen a few others didn't rate this very highly..good but not great especially for the price. Doesn't have to be on your list on a short trip. Probably much better for children as they'll be fascinated
Magnific. The main aquarium is gigantic with many windows providing different perspectives. Penguins and otters are very enjoyable to watch.

Amazing spot. This is my favorite spot in Lisbon. Located in Expo, you will have a lot to do, but it is vital to take a pause and visit Oceanário. The working force are really friendly and the collection is amazing. Really good if you.go with your family or to just go alone,

Extremely Impressed. I am a huge fan of aquariums but I never imagined I would go while traveling abroad. However, we heard great things about the Oceanario so we decided to swing by on our way to the airport for a couple of hours and I am glad that we did. It was less than 20 euros for admission and the exhibits were phenomenal. The large tank in the middle has an amazing collection of fish. If you aren't in to sea life, I wouldn't bother but if you have any interest in aquatics, this is a must see. You can also ride in the gondola after you are done along the Tagus river.

Am excelent place to visit. A must GO for kids And adults!. The Oceanario is located in Parque das Nações Area, a modern part of Lisbon well worth a visit, for the arquitecture, the river Tagus views And the overall ambiance . It is a modern aquarium with rich diversity of sea life. The central tank is just fabulous! Sharks swim along big And small fish. Diferent áreas reproduce the continents in a naturalistic environement both efficient And realístic. It is a great programme for kids And adults too and you should reserve about 4 hours to enjoy all of this. There is a good shopping centre nearby called Vasco da Gama with a good selection of shops And restaurants.

great attraction. a very interesting attraction in the modern part of the city Parque das Naçoes.i have visited the 2 buildings the big one is the main aquarium but they have another one for temporary exhibitions which i found also a good option.
Very Nice place!!!. I went with my husband and my 2 Kids, with 2 and 3 years. We liked a lot, but we saw it very quickly because they wanted to go and go.

Great Place for Kids. If you have kids, or have time on your hands, you should definitely visit this place. The high point of the Oceanario are the two huge sun fishes in the central tank. The fare is a little steep compared to Portuguese standards but you do get bang for your buck. Be aware that there were no signs in the huge Paco des Nacoes pointing out this place in April 2015. Nothing's even written on the building itself. So take good directions, have a maps app or printout and don't be worried to ask for directions.

Awesome sunfish. Saturday morning visit but it was far from crowded and really pleasant to wander round. It was clean and well presented. Have been to a few similar places but had never seen a sun fish. The one here was quite amazing; looks like a large fish head swimming round. As we were sitting and just admiring all the activity in the enormous tank a large ray swam past and photobombed a group of tourists taking a selfie. Quite made my day and I still laugh about it - I wish I had got my camera handy to take the whole scene.
Destination Attraction. One of the most beautiful and impressive aquariums on the planet. It justifies, by itself a trip to Lisbon.

Great Aquarium. We had a free day while in Lisbon & decided to take the metro to Oceanario. We had seen it while taking one of the Hop On Hop Off buses. The whole area was built for the World Expo 1998, with a very nice shopping center, several good, reasonable restaurants & beautiful walking area. The aquarium was really interesting the way it was presented & an incredible collection of sea life.
very interesting!. an oceanarium is well worth a visit while not a cheap attraction, very well organized and nicely equipped. kids enjoyed it greatly.

Well worth the entrance fee for the Takashi Amano display alone. Looked forward to this all week while in Lisbon and it didn't disappoint. I went specifically to see the Takashi Amano tank which absolutely floored me, and was worth the entrance fee alone - must see while in Lisbon wether your into aquascaping or not as its like a living work of art. The marine displays where also top notch, though I think the Barcelona aquarium beats it by a notch, highlights where the Amano tank, Sea Otters ( hard to find - but worth waiting and looking for ) and the giant Sun fish. Book online to save you from the monster line for tickets at the aquarium, we walk straight in with absolutely no wait.

Beautiful!. This aquarium is just beautiful! Have been to others in U.S. but the Oceanario is unique in having a huge tank which is viewed from numerous points showing a variety of fish and other denizens of the ocean intermingling.We spent so long in the permanent exhibit we almost didn't have time for the temporary one which was nice too.Easy Metro ride from the city, then about a 10 minute walk.

Best Oceanarium I've been to. I was really impressed by my visit, the building is in the old Expo site, the parque das naceos on an artificial island in an old dock. Access is across a short bridge, although there is also a really nice temporary exhibit on the entrance side of the bridge that's well worth a look. The Oceanarium itself is a cool design, with a massive in the middle which you walk around, both at below tank level and surface level. A couple of cool features really stand out and push it above the level of previous ones I've been to, firstly there are concave walls to the tank, you can stand at the apex of the wall and feel like you're totally immersed in the tank, which is great. The second bit is that the various animals appear to be contained in the same tank even when they're segregated. They do this by having rock and glass walls between the various tank elements, so it looks like the otters are swimming with the sharks, but thankfully they're separated. It's definitely worth a visit, either with kids or without!

A must for people who love aquariums, great location, too.. A brilliant aquarium. I enjoyed it as much as the Monterey Aquarium, SeaLife Sydney, SeaLife Melbourne, and Vancouver Aquarium. The Pacific Sea Otters and sea birds were among my favorites, but there were many tother beautiful and wondrous creatures here. The displays were also accompanied by wonderfully informative texts.The location is stunning, right on the bank of the Tejo River, with views of Alentejo and the striking Vasco de Gama Bridge. This is such a relaxing area to hang out in on a sunny day.

Fabulous aquarium in Lisbon - Go, it will not disappoint. What a fantastic experience at the Oceanario. I arrived late in the afternoon in Lisbon and decided to just venture down to the river and seeing all the wonderful fishes. I thoroughly enjoyed myself.

A must-see. One year ago I visited Monterey's Aquarium and I thought that it was enough, but no, visting an aquarium is always interesting. No matter how many you have already visited. Oceanário is a really beautiful and interesting aquarium and worths a visit when you go to Lisbon.

Amazing...... Especially recommended as something to do on a Monday when a lot of Lisbon is closed. Sunfishes to sea otters to penguins to frogs... there's really tons to see. A great way to while away an afternoon!!!

Fantastic aquarium...a must visit. This is one of the best aquariums in the word, and it probably is!
The central tank is awesome and huge, with hundreds of species. Seeing the penguins and otters being fed was also a real treat.

Wow!. We are keen divers so often visit aquariums on our travels. This one is special and spectacular both for the species on show and their display. We loved the Sun Fish and the Sea Otters. The team has somehow managed to get species to integrate and the design allows for territories to be established. The information is deep enough and interesting. Go and visit , you will not be disappointed. Also as an additional benefit the Oceanario is located in a former industrial area which has been regenerated. The area makes a very interesting contrast to other parts of Lisbon and shows the Cit's modern credentials.

Oceanographic Heaven. Go for a wonderfull experience,to fully appreciate the size of the aquariums you will need a full half day to take it in and do justice to it,every ocean and its aquatic life is on show

enjoyed it. We enjoyed the Oceanario. We have seen other similar exhibits before, it wasn't new. Everything is centered around one main tank over three floors. It took around one hour for us to complete the tour.

A bit too fishy for us!. Aquarium was a bit too dark of a place to fully enjoy the beauty of the fish...we were so excited to see the light at the end of the tunnel! being from Florida,i guess we are spoiled with all the great places here. definitely not a must-see unless its your first time seeing this..the temporary exhibition..underwater forest was worth seeing while there.

A definite don't miss when in Lisbon. A fantastic overall display of life in our oceans with great visual access to the hundreds of specimens in the tanks. A perfect place to educate all ages about the seas and their wildlife.

Mesmerizing - World's best Oceanario. The central tank is threes stories deep with levels at each floor showing you Luna fish, sharks and much more. My favourite is perhaps the jelly fish tank with these mesmerising creatures floating about in terrific lighting. Great for the kids of all ages and a few adults too.Well organised inside but sometimes hard to get a taxi from outside - call Lisbon taxis as you get out and they will get there fast

Great aquarium, but I was expecting more about oceanography.. but I was expecting more about oceanography.Sunfishes were stunning! I would recommend it though, as it is one of the biggest aquariums in Europe.
Amazing Aquarium. This aquarium is absolutely amazing. I enjoyed walking around and seeing all the fish, sea otters, and penguins. If you find yourself in Lisbon make sure to check it out!

Fantastic aquarium . I had read this was one of the best aquariums in the word, and it probably is!
The central tank is awesome and huge, with hundreds of species. Seeing the penguins and otters being fed was also a real treat.
Booking online saves a lot of time to avoid queuing and the whole visit takes about 2 hours.

Just nice. I guess our expectations were a little bit high because we find the Oceanario disapointing... There is only one big aquarium that is really nice but most of the tour is just to see it from different angles. We didn't had the "wow" effect so for us the experience was only nice, not more.

poor. Advertised as one of best in Europe in my opinion it isn't, one big pool with fishes but you walk only around it not under it as best this kind places, 1 hour waiting for tickets and veru crwdy and hot inside
Nice aqurium . The line for the tickets was quite long but we were inside quickly. Aqurium is very nice and quite big. Even though it was line for tickets there was not crowded inside.

Lovely aquarium. Lovely way to spend an afternoon. There was plenty to see and do and the cafe was surprisingly good. Excellent value for money. We had a discount from the hop on bus which made it even better value.

Wonderful. Amazing space to spend the day!
I went with a friend, but it's a space that everyone can go and will love it for sure!

Expensive to get into but better than expected. There wasn't a great deal of activity in this area of Lisbon in October so we headed to the aquarium. We felt it was expensive at 14 euros per person but were pleasantly surprised by the amount to see once inside.

Worth a visit!. We visited on a cold and wet October day in Lisbon. The queue to get in was huge but once inside it was well worth the wait!
There is so much to see. You will not be disappointed.

Good on a rainy day. If you want to support animals in captivity and their wellbeing this is a beautiful journey through the oceans and also how mankind influences the earth. Very well made with a path through the whole oceanarium were you move around the big fish tank in the middle.It's very crowded and be prepared of screaming and yelling children, being pushed around by baby carriages and a very special aroma. Woth a visit on a rainy day, definitely beautiful.

Fantastic and a must-see. Fantastic huge oceanarium. Definitey worth the visit and if you take your bus ticket with you, you'll get a discount on entry. We spent a few hours here, there is so much to see and enjoy. It wasn't overbusy and you really get great views of the fantastic creatures. The open air birds were also lovely to see and interact with.

great aquarium but very busy. It was a great aquarium with lots if exotic sea creatures but was too busy for our liking.Took a long time to get in abd then each room was very crowded. Was very impressed with the selection if sea creatures though.

Absolutely THE BEST sight to see in Lisbon!!!. This claims to be the second best in the world so when coming here expectations were high! The Oceanario de Lisboa delivered and even more!! Great architecture and amazing variety of sea life all in a fantastic environment where you will easily spend 2 or more hours. This is an absolute no-miss and a wonderful break from the monument and museum visits!
Like Dr Who's Tardis !. This is really worth a visit, from the outside it doesn't look very big but once inside it was amazing. The temporary exhibition was lovely. The underwater rainforest.

Even better with kids..... One of Europe’s biggest and most beautiful aquariums. We were there for over 2 hours, with 2 kids , ( 5 & 8 yrs) they loved it and we could easily have stayed longer…I am not sure if I'm a big fan of keeping animals captured. But I most admit it was a very special experience seeing such magical creatures up close , and they seemed to be taken care of as best as you can under the circumstances..

fun day out. We loved the Ocenarium. Its main tank is huge with lots of sharks and strange looking sun fish. also the surroundings of the ocenarium is nice. There is a cable car near bu and river with the view of the famous bridge.
Great for children . Our two year old loved it but could have been better for the parents,Dont know if its worth 17 euros

A must do in Lisbon. One of the best aquariums we have been to. It is set out in different zones which are themed to oceans of the world. Each zone is linked to each other through a big aquarium which include numerous massive fish including sun fish - which we have never seen before. They have the cutest sea otters and penguins as well. I really enjoyed my visit.I really would recommend you travelling out to east Lisbon to see this brilliant aquarium.

Fantastic! . It was a great adventure for the whole family. Can recommend to buy tickets online so you don't ha to stand in queue, which can be pretty long when it's cloudy weather. As a said, great for the family and something for everyone!

Excellent presentation . This modern aquarium is built around a huge tank displaying a wide range of fish in a realistic ocean setting. Around this central tank are smaller displays of differing coastal settings like artic and mangroves with the creatures found there. Very informative and entertaining. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful Oceanarium!. Its worth the time and money, highly recommendable not only for children but for all ages. Educational and very relaxing to watch the fishes and the cute and funny sea otters and penguins!

Superb. Probably the best attraction Lisbon has to offer. Get out of the overpriced, overcrowded and charmless old town and escape to this oasis of calm. Beautifully created exhibitions and a stunning and inspiring aquatic centre. It's something this city can boast is of truly international standard.

"Funtastic" and great for kids. Be ready to walk for a while but it's worth the Money. The feeding times are the best t. Very good. Great fun to ser the feeding and all the variety of species from allover the world. Educative and fun. Best spent money ever.
Best Oceanarium in Europe. By far the best oceanarium in Europe the tanks is huge the manta rays, sun fish and zebra sharks are beautiful. Staff really know there stuff to.

Informative and educational. The main exhibition features a central tank, surrounded by side exhibits and sections dedicated to the Atlantic, Pacific, Antarctic and Indian oceans. The creatures on exhibit range from Pacific sea otters to Mola Mola, the Sunfish, and from grass eels to spider crab. On the second floor of the entrance building, there is a temporary exhibition by a Japanese aquarist, which presents small freshwater species like cyclids and tetras in their own environment, complete with the plant species they thrive among. The Oceanarium is an informative reminder of how much we depend on the seas that cover 70% of our planet and how little we still understand about them. Beautifully presented and well curated.

YOui will have never seen anything like this oceanarium. Don't leave Portugal without visiting it. This oceanarium is not only spectacular but very scientific too. I visited a similar one in Manila in thePHilippines and there is no comparision... Lisbon's one beats Manila's by miles.

Wow. We went in the middle of August. But we had prebooked our ticket online. A brilliant idea! The queue was massive but we walked straight passed it and in. The attraction itself was busy, really busy! However with a little patience we got to see all the fish, and birds. The information is set out in English as well as Portuguese so was really useful. It is set out well and the children and adults really enjoyed it.
We loved it!!. Easy to locate, and lots of fun. What a great place to be with kids! It even has penguins. My kids were on the top of the world!

Nice. Nice to see, explore and enjoy if you are lover of aquariums...Also, this is a good opportunity to see that part of Lisbon which is also interesting, very modern and definitely worth spending couple of hours.P.S. One advice - Do not pay for the extra exhibition in the aquarium, except it is not something you are reaaaaly interested in. All you can see, in most cases, are pictures of some exhibitioner who explores a sea life :)

Ummmmmmmm ??. #2 best attraction in Lisbon ?? I was undecided after our visit, yes it's a big tank with lots of fish but it's only 1 tank in the middle with little exhibits on the outside, there were about 15 - 20 places to view the main tank but it's the same fish all the time, we went when the flower forest exhibition was on in a separate building and that was superb, 17 euros each ?? Bit pricey too.
wow. very easy to get to on public transport the metro only 6 Euros for 12hrs pass you get of the metro short walk to Oceanario

Do not take photos, watch as much as you can. This place really impressed me.
It is full of different sea animals, from the very tiny to the big ones that live together.
Take your time to watch what happens in the underwater world rather than to take pictures (it's dark there and you cannot use flash so these will be poor quality anyway).
Must see, especially for families with kids. Wonderful place to spend half a day, getting to know many different life forms. Do not miss the black OLM. Also enjoy the coast view outside.
Spectacular . The best aquarium I have ever visited! A good mix between visuals and information and fair price. Perfect for a afternoon in Lisbon
Absolutely amazing place. Amazing place. Fantastic ambience, oceanarium has 2 levels. Spectacular views, especially moon fish. Almost 1,5 meters in diameter. Small stands with jellyfishes.
Great. Great acquarium, the large central tank is mind-boggling beautiful. Seeing a sun-fish is really a must.
A great getaway. A step away from the bustle of Lisbon...this well designed Oceanarium was a welcome interlude....and a great walk along the river park.....with many dining options.

Underwater World. It says its one of the largest aquariums in the world, and it is, You can see the penguins up close with no glass wall in the way and also see how big a sea otter is. There are 2 levels above the water and below the water. Great for the family to spend a few hours looking at the most wonderful underwater life this planet as.

Large and very interesting aquarium. We had a great few hours looking around this aquarium with a wide range of aquatic and bird life to see. The central tank, containing a huge variety of fish including huge Sun Fish, is stunning and it was fun to see two frogmen inside for a time. Information on nearly all the species was readily found in Portuguese and English; however we would have liked some further information to be available to take away, which it didn't seem to be even in the shop at the end unless it was in a hardback book which we didn't want. In particular we wanted to know precisely how they prevent the sharks and barracudas in the big central tank from eating the smaller fish, and which fish are still sustainably fished and therefore recommended to eat (in a country where every restaurant seems to serve at least as wide a range of fish as they do meat)! From reading the labels we got the impression that virtually everything is endangered in the wild and shouldn't be eaten, including cod which we saw on every restaurant menu in Lisbon and the Algarve. I was also concerned about lots of visitors using flash to take photos, in contravention of the signs, but the staff took no action on this; I wondered whether the fish are happy and if not, how the staff would know. We enjoyed it very much but not quite as much as the aquarium in the French port of La Rochelle which was stupendous.
Excelent to view.. Astonishing. It was amazing to visit, my daughter just loved it, the Luna fish, the sharks... all, it's a must. All is ok, all very well taken care of. You cannot miss it.

Best Aquarium in Europe ...one-ups Boston too. A must-see in Lisbon! The most amazing aquarium our family had been to- and reasonably priced once you see all that your Euro buys you. It is similar to Boston's aquarium, but a step above in every way. Not the easiest to get to on public transport, but doable.
Fun fish. Very educational and great fun.There were so many fish I hadn't sen before and the way you can view them in the enormous tanks is amazing!
Superb. Amazing range of exhibits. Beautiful presentation. Definitely worth a visit and I'd recommend buying tickets online (cheaper and you beat the queue)
Fun Place to visit. Easy access and very interesting place to visit if you're in Lisbon and want to spend a morning with friends and kids.
Amazing. Easy to reach by metro or bus, amazing place. Shows a little bit of diversity that lives in Oceans of each part of the world. A must-see in Lisbon.
Must watch. lovely collection of sea life. too good to miss, a must watch especially with your kids they will love it.

Amazing and a must do when in Lisbon. This is a fantastic aquarium and the surrounding area is great too. Lots to do and see, but the Oceanario is something not to miss. Fantastic place and I will certainly be going there again some day. Brilliant for families and couples alike. Fabulous!!!!

A magical place. One of the most amazing sites in Lisbon, and one of my most memorable experiences overall. It is very easy to reach, located in the beautiful Parque das Nações. Very well conceived, and very educational. I would recommend buying a ticket on-line. There's a discount, and you can avoid very long queues.
Fish, fish and more fish. Good rainy day experience, lots to see and interactive for children. A lot of thought gone into the design of the ocenario, easy access.
Oceanario. Excellent venue, lots to see very interactive, love all the "snugs" where you feel as being the only one in the aauarium

The penguins were really sweet. Great 2 hours with my daughter and 6 year old grandson who loved the experience amazing collection of sharks fish rays and more.penguins living on an ice feature well designed exposition.well worth a few euros.we paid 32 for the three of us
good. Very interesting and informative. a bit on the dark side but nevertheless, showed lots of different varieties of sea life, inlcuding Otters
Oceanario de Lisboa - Highlight of my Lisbon Visit. Love that place. I like it better than the aquarium in Chicago. Less kids running round. More modern. Good place to spend an afternoon.

worth a visit if you have an extra hour to spend. Did some reading before going, and expected something bigger and better structured. Yet, it's quite nice, with one large circular aquarium and lots of small ones. Takes around an hour to leisurely walk around and enjoy yourself.
Amazing. Amazing animals and really good installations. There´s a discount for students. it took around 1hr and 30min to visit everything but it was a great experience.

Excellent for adults and kids. Just great, when i realize that is the end I just want to go back and seat on the carpet watching the fish. My son now with seven can read all the fish names and learn about the oceans and species.
Oceanario in Lisbon. The Oceanario shows wide range of animals living in the Oceans from each part of the world, and offers a lot of possibilties to look into the life of the oceans.

One of the best I've seen!. Oceanario da Lisboa is easy to reach by metro and it is a great way to spent a rainy/windy day in Lisbon. This visit was the highlight of our stay in Lisbon. The Oceanarium is very well organised and is a perfect way to discover the undewater world&life regardless of your age. A must see!

Wonderful aquarium - one of the best. I have visited many aquaria around the world and this is one of the best. There are displays from oceans around the world with excellent up to date labels and an underlying conservation message. The sunfish is fantastic. Other animals on display include otters, penguins, sharks, jellyfish, corals and other invertebrates.
nice. I am not in general a huge fan of aquariums and I have been to a few but this place was very nice and was and afternoon well spent.

Located in the amazing world fair site .. If you have never gone scuba diving and been thrilled by your encounters with the creatures of the sea you will get a great feel here. Wonderful setting and well thought out. Enjoy

Good for a rainy day. I was not that impressed with the oceanarium. I think this is because I have been to a lot of similar exhibits and this one wasn't that different. I think that it would be a good stop if you had nothing to do on a rainy day or if you have never been to an aquarium before. Don't worry that you can't get thru the crowd at the first big aquarium, you will see the same on multiple times later on in the visit and there are way less people so you can take pictures easily.

Relaxing . Nice but not impressed, it said one of the biggest in europe but basically is just one big fish tank with few others. Beautiful and interesting fish. Guest exposition was a disappointment, unless you plan to chill there and meditate.
Life under water.. One of the best in Europe. Very big, very beautiful place to go and visit. If you have kids it will definitely make them happy. Lot of programs to follow, amazing day.

Very enjoyable. One of the better oceanaria, centered around a spectacular and huge 3 story aquarium. One can watch sharks and other fishes from above, below, and eye-to-eye. Solid penguin exhibits also. Very good photo opportunities. Highly recommended for all those who like to view wildlife, even those otherwise indifferent to fishes. Warning: the place is extremely popular -- to avoid the lines for tickets, buy them on-line.
Fantastic. A Great place to visit with children with many kind of species. The place is unique. The Tropical florest and the the tank with the sharts and mantra is very beautiful to see.

Wonderful day at the Aquarium. We very much enjoyed this aquarium. There may be better but this one is the best I have been able to see. There were some very large ocean sunfish that I have never seen before. The otters and penquins were interesting seen both above and below the water surface. Very modern displays. At least three main sections with different environments (temps). Large main tank that could be seen from multiple directions and at different levels. A nice film that offered a chance to rest the legs. We went on a week day afternoon and it was not crowded. We would go back. It is a little hidden but there were signs. Took the bus from the town center to get there and took the metro out of Oriente when we departed.

First time in an aquarium. The aquarium can be easily found at the coast of Lisbon. We were impressed on how big building was it. The price for the ticket was 14€ for a regular ticket and 17€ for some extra exhibits, which weren't worth the extra 3€. The main aquarium at the start of the tour has a one huuuuge tank in the middle of the place with all sorts of fishes like devil's fish, sun fish, sharks,... Your trip continues with walking around the tank on 2 floors, where in every corner of the floor you can see all sorts of animals from around the world. The walk around the aquarium is well marked. The visit took us 2 hours, but We could have easily been there even more.Would very much recommend the visit!

A good solution for a bad weather day. Ive read many reviews before going here with my husband. All in all it was OK. Some sharks, some fish, a nice big aquarium in the middle. My husband enjoyed it more than I did. We went on a Saturday morning, there was no line and a normal amount of visitors,not too crowded. Probably a must for fish lovers, otherwise just a place to kill some free hours.

wow....worth every penny. I have been in many aquariums around tge world- this one is one of the best in my eyes.The big "cup" is facinating. One wolks around and from every window things looks different. There are unique fishes, sharks... . We loved the otters and the huge Sun fish .We spent 3 hours and felt that we could stay more

A good way to spend a couple of hours on a cloudy/rainy day. The upper exhibits were probably most interesting mixing birds, marine mammals in with the fish and other sea life. The large tanks followed you through the descent giving different perspectives as you descend so well done on that one. Smaller exhibits as you progressed downwards became more problematic though as small children, and some pushy adults, hindered many from getting a good view. That last niggle aside, well worth a visit.

One of our Lisbon highlights!. Otters, puffins and other amazing aquatic friends are to made! How can you miss out on meeting the world's biggest bony fish (Mola mola, a.ka. the Ocean Sunfish)? Well worth a visit - we enjoyed every minute :)

Dissapointed..... Okay, So this place was highly rated so my life and i were very excited to go since we love Monterrey Bay Aquarium and we kind of like long beach aquarium.This place basically had one main tank, which is cool, and a bunch of small exhibits around it. It is a creative set up and had i never been to Monterrey, this place would get another star. They have a good assortment of fish on the main tank like a few different sharks, molas, rays, and fishes. One thing i want to point out is they have a sea otter that has no kelp, no diving space and hides in the corner of their medium size exhibit. This has got to be cruel especially since there are sharks in the same exhibit. Where can this otter clean it's fur and feel safe? I'm boarderline on making this a one star but i can't rate off one exhibit.If you have gone to an aquarium like Monterrey, this place sucks.

Nice for Lisboa, but world wise quite pale try. Not a modern aquarium, small in size, not following contemporary trends for letting you in the natural habitat and living through the oceanic life. On the top quite expensive for the value - regular entry is 17 EUR
Beautiful. Like snorkeling without getting wet. We loved this place. Many different ocean environment ts are recreates. Stunning.
Must have. Specially fun for kids. As additional - beautiful overview outside the oceanario, big shopping center near by and close are the bus stops.

Full of memories. This place is amazing. You are stunned when you are over there. It takes around 3-4 hours so you don't need to be in a hurry. You will see from some big Rocky fishes to small ones, pinguins. The place too be, with families, young kids, group of friends. Not to miss at all.
For Aquarium newbies . A nice Aquarium, unless you have been at the best ones worldwide, eg Monterey, California. In that case don't expect that it adds much.

If sealife interests you - don't miss it. Oceanario is a great place if you are interested in watching some sea life. There is one big aquarium and during your visit you are going around it, so you can see it from all angles. You can always find a spot to stand, which is not crowded and you can enjoy it without being disturbed. While being downstairs and near the glass, you can feel like you're inside with all the fish! Apart from the main aquarium there are other interesting places and animals (penguins and otters are super cute!). It is not cheap though, and it was very cold inside, I was shaking in my shorts and t-shirt all the time!But if sealife is something that may interest you, definitely go there :)

Great fun, saw some amazing sights. We are a couple in our 50s, not the target audience, but it was such good fun. We loved the penguins and the sea otters but we also really enjoyed the very odd-looking fish! We were there about an hour and a bit and really enjoyed it. Every exhibit had something about it being endangered which i think is actually a little out of date now, but it wasn't too preachy and we had a great time.

Very good aquarium. We made a day of seeing attractions/museums and this was one. It is a distance from city centre. We took a cab. Cabs are quite reasonable in Lisbon. Downside most drivers think its a race for the cab. We have seen aquariums around the world including Singapore. This one is well laid out and worth a visit but not at the level of some others. If a rainy day even better for a visit. If time is limited then I would see other museums / attractions first.
Go there!. Go there and become a child again.We really enjoyed this sweat visit!Take a time, and give your attention to small fishis, not just to big ones. :-)

Good for families with kids and also for a little relax. We spent few hours there because of the rain. I think is especially good for families with kids. All kids were really thrilled to see all those fish. For me it was really relaxing espacially sitting on a soft couch watching aquarium big as a cinema screen.

The best aquarium in the world! . Travelling often and absolutely loving water and the peacefulness it transmits, I have been to aquariums all over the world.Lisbon Oceanarium comfortably gets the "best of the world" title in my opinion.The wonderful environment, the careful and strict maintenance, the always up to date information, the mix of temporary and permanent exhibitions, the variety and diversity of species, and so many other aspects, make this a relaxing, calm, soothing and at the same time invigorating place to visit. I have visited this Oceanarium 15 times since it first opened in 1998... you have to try it for yourself :)

Wonderful experience for marine life fans. Very large aquarium with impressive representatives of marine life from the different oceans of the planet. I also suggest taking a ride with the Telecabines nearby.

Worth It For The Sea Otters Alone. A fantastically laid out aquarium that gives just the right amount of information about each species. We spent over 2 and a half hours here and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The sea otters were a particular highlight.

Great afternoon. We visited the oceanarium on the yellow bus tour. The bus ticket gave us a discount entry fee which for 2 adults was €18, good value I think for the amount of time spent here 2-3 hours

Superb display of marine fish and invertebrates. Some fantastic stuff here to see, especially the otters (they KNOW they're cute and they milk the attention!) but look out for the tropical marine aquarium which is just about the only one I've ever seen where you can also view the fish from above as well as through the glass. Some fantastic marine fish and invertebrate species here, despite some of them being very challenging to keep (trust me, I've kept them and I know how hard it is to keep Copperband Butterflies!). They all seem to be really thriving!

Sea otters soooo cute!!. The best aquarium I have ever seen - good informative signage and lots to see - split into 4 areas, and features Penguins, Puffins and the most adorable Sea Otters ever. Can easily spend 3 to 4 hours here and well worth the entry fee. Spend some time just sitting and looking at the massive tank in the middle and you keep seeing something new.
Nice but not so good as Atlanta-USA Aquarium. The Lisboa Aquarium is OK if you never went to an aquarium before. There are sharks, fishes, mantas, penguins, but you don't see whales, for example.

One of the best in the world. The Oceanário de Lisboa is one of the largest and best aquariums in the world. You will experience a wide range of sea life with large windows that putt you almost as being part of the ocean.

Loved it, but expensive. modern, well designed aquarium with a spectacular central tank. The permanent exibitions are very enjoyable. Some of the most kid oriented exibitions lacked explanation text in other languages than portuguise, which is a pity since they were so well done, the kinds wanted to learn more. The temporary exibition was very good as well, but limited given the pricetag. It is quite expensive overall, so make sure you really like this kind of attactions. For us it was all worth, the kids didn't want to leave. Higly recommended, we will come back

Nice aquarium. Not the best. . The aquarium is located in the grounds of the 1998 World Expo, which sadly looks like it's just been forgotten about. The building to the aquarium is impressive. Getting tickets was quick with a small queue. €17 each per adult. Inside, it's built around a large tank.
