It's pretty, but having been to a few aquariums at home and around the world, it was nothing spectacular to me. The Penguins were cute. We did not see any otters. We looked for them but they must have been with a vet or out of action. Theming is good. I don't think I'd return if I found myself back in Lisbon though.
Great. There are many interesting species, which we haven't seen before. We loved it. It's a must see place in Lisboa.

Great, but maybe expected a bit more. Oceanario is certainly a great experience, and was a fun activity to do with our 16 month old twins. Just not sure it's one of #1 or #2 things to do in Lisbon (as it is currently ranked at time of writing).I suppose maybe I had built up expectations, given the high TripAdvisor rating and the rave commentary, quoted as "mind blowing" on various ads, including a massive floor mural upon arrival at Lisbon airport.As aquariums go, I would say the Kaiyukan in Osaka (whale-sharks!), or the Monterey Bay aquarium in California (hammerheads!) both have more impressive central tanks. But this one is still up there, and they do have a good variety of sea life, including Manta, sea dragons and Mambo fish.The highlight to me were the Magellanic Penguins, as the design of the exhibit allows to get up pretty close without any high barrier in between. The otters are adorable as well.In general our family always enjoys aquariums, and the layout and design here was access friendly and interesting. Basically a single corridor path circles around the central tank and guides you through the permanent visit, so you don't feel like maybe there are other wings or areas you may have missed or need to go back and forth to see everything. (It also makes it easy to keep track of the little ones running around).We paid the extra fee to see the temporary exhibit as well (submerged forests by Amano Takashi), which was very cool, but given that it's just one single room, felt a little bit overpriced.Overall we enjoyed it, but I wouldn't say it was mind-blowing. My mind was not blown.It was a bit out of the way to get to by metro from where we were staying in Baixa, but not too bad. We rounded it out with a ride on the Teleferico nearby, which gives a good view of the Vasco Da Gama bridge and world expo park.
Meeting the Global Ocean. Meeting the Global Ocean and the living lfies, was a wonderful experience, specially when you don't have the change to be actually in one of each Ocean .

Transfixed by the Giant tank . There is one giant tank in the centre with hundreds of different species of sharks and fish which you never get bored of seeing as you walk around. The sea otter is adorable and there are loads of smaller interesting tanks. Took us about 3-4 hours to walk around because we just enjoyed relaxing watching all the different animals.

Good day out. Really good day out for all ages .Big ultra modern building with plenty to see and lots of good info. Cost about 17 euro per adult . Out side are cable cars that take you down the shore for a bit so worth doing also return journey

Fantastic central tank.. The central tank in this aquarium is incredible. Some really fantastic species on offer and not to be missed. The additional displays are all situated around the edge and your tour essentially circles the central tank. You see different view points of the central tank as you move along. The temporary exhibition was rather poor and not worth the additional 3e. Don't waste your time. The restaurant was also rather other priced and of low quality. Must visit just for the central tank. It really is incredible.

Very good, but not #1. This is listed as the #1 Aquarium/Oceanarium on Tripadvisor, so I felt going to Lisbon it would be a must see. It was very good and had a great range of fish and sea creatures, but also mammals and birds. However, I don't think it is the best aquarium I've been to, and would definitely but Osaka above it. It had one large tank in the middle that you walk around, and you end up seeing this tank about 10 times. It is very impressive, but it does get a little boring after a while, and I found myself losing interest in the center tank, which is arguably the main attraction and just looking at the smaller exhibits around the outside. Overall it is a great aquarium, but I would lower your expectations a little, and don't expect it to be the best aquarium on the planet.

Great. Tip: by the tickets on the net and you will get them with around 2€ cheaper than at the entrance Tip2: don't think about few more €, ge to see the temporary exhibision also. It realy worth.The central tank is amazing. In fact that is the most of the oceanario.Spend a while with the otaries, they do quit a good show.
Expected much more. Expect for one very impressive display the rest was pretty mediocre and overall there is not much to see.
rainy day in Lisboa. the day promised some scotch mist, so the oceanario was the prefect place to be, lots to see, interesting and easy to get to

a real tropical rain forest. I had a feeling of wandering through a real tropical rain forest when I walked the bridge from the forest of Oceanario de Lisboa. Great experince. Loved the penguins. Loved the sharks.

They have Sun Fish!. I highly recommend that you buy your tickets online. My husband and I arrived and the queue was unbelievable. Luckily, we managed to get enough of an internet signal to buy our tickets online. And then it was, skip the queue and straight in. So satisfying. heh.Since I'm from New Zealand, the only fish I was really interested in seeing was the sun fish. It was huge and incredibly ugly. My husband described it as cancer with a tumor. I'm not sure it's that ugly, but anyway. Apparently, if you put a sun fish in an aquarium with corners, it can get stuck and then die. When you see it, you'll understand.There are 3 viewing levels of the "fish bowl". A lot of people were queueing up at the first 2 windows, when they could've just moved around to the next window. Probably the bottom level has the most space for viewing. A lot of people were sitting on the ground in front of the windows.As you move around the tank, it leads you into other smaller habitats which have otters, jellyfish, starfish, anemones, etc...NB. It is relatively dark, quite warm and airless inside. I don't suffer from claustrophobia but I was starting to feel very closed in and had to go and spend some time in the outdoors bit.I didn't feel like the short term exhibit added anything to the experience. However, my friends felt like they had a near religious experience there. So, eh.On the ground floor they had a very nice cafe. I thought the food and drink selection was good and the prices not too bad.

Don't dare missing this extravaganza.. Me and my wife did not plan to visit this place at all. While passing thru with a bus we made a sudden decision and went in. What a big surprise ! This was one of our best experiences in our whole life!! This place is catering to all ages. To kids, families, adults and senior citizens like us. We have spent there about 3 hours and we were sorry for not having the time to stay more.

The Largest Indoor Aquarium in Europe. The Lisbon Oceanarium (Portuguese: "Oceanário de Lisboa") is an oceanarium in Lisbon, Portugal. It is located in the Parque das Nações and is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe. It's really a very cool design, said to resemble an Aircraft carrier. It's built into the pier on an internal sea. Well worth a trip!

nice.. The short term exhibition is nice bit not worth a tour just by it self – it could be the beginning for the long term exhibition…The long term exhibition is very nice – a giant aquarium with sharks, 1 manta, 2 sunfish (mola mola) and many more.The kids enjoyed it very much. There are lots of windows around and extra small aquariums with more creatures and a little bit of information.Nice place to pass a couple of hours.The building is in a nice location and surrounded by water, with many jellyfish in them…

Definitely worth a visit. Excellent aquarium. A wide variety of fish, birds and even penguins. The whole area Oriente where the Ocenarium is located ire pretty interesting. I would advised to spend half a day exploring it while admiring quite a different architecture compared to the old town Lisbon.

Definitely worth it. We really enjoyed visiting here. The queue to get in wasn't long at all (but it was a Tuesday) and we spent a fun couple of hours wandering round. The central tank as people say is amazing but we quite liked some of the peripheral exhibits too, like the penguins and otters. The latter really are as cute as the pictures you see on the postcards. There was a very extensive collection of fish, from four oceans, that converged at the central tank. Overall, well worth a visit and you get a 15% discount if you happen to go on the Greyline bus.
I liked the atmosphere here. I liked this alot. Not to big, but had a nice atmosphere. Had a good variety of species and we had a good time beeing here.

world's marine ecosystems. the oceanarium is built around a huge central tank where all kinds of underwater life exist. As you go around the oceanarium you are always seeing it from diferente angles and from two diferente heights as the building has two storeys. the variety of fishes and other underwater creatures swimming in it is amazing and makes for great views. In each corner of the building you find a complete marine ecosystem from the four corners of the world. Plus you will see scores of smaller aquariums with all kinds of fishes and seawater life in them, some truly incredible. The whole place is dark, only the aquariums are lit, and so you feel like you're exploring the sea depths. very enticing.

Fun day out! . Visited the aquarium with my boyfriend and we had such a fun day. The aquarium is great value for money, lots to see and I especially loved the penguins!! We spent just under 2 hours at the aquarium and felt we seen everything and we weren't rushing about. One of the advantages of the aquarium is the location! Once we left the aquarium we went for lovely lunch at a nearby cafe, a trip on the cable cars and it's a lovely area to go a walk by the water. Overall we had a fantastic day and would highly recommend the aquarium, suits all ages!

Must see. Wow, just wow. This place is awesome. It's fun, educational, happy and perfect for families.We were there with our nieces and the look on their faces would have been the perfect review for this attraction, but unfortunately you're going to have to settle for this instead.The huge tank in the centre of the building has several viewing areas from all sides and the collection of fish is phenomenal. Look out for the sun fish. There are so many different types of fish, some smaller fish and some really large monsters.There are several other smaller tanks that house the smaller fish which let you see them much better as they would be far too small for the central tank.This place is not just about fish, as there are also penguins, puffins, frogs and otters that you have to see.If you are interested there are some learning zones for the kids to learn about the fish and you also can learn about the efforts that are put into running this facility.

The number 1 oceanarium in Europe. We spent a whole day there with my kid of 3 years old and he was not bored. Breathtaking, great variety of animals living there, great photos. The oceanarium is very modern and clean. People are taking a good care of it. Animals and fish look happy, like having great time! :)
Lovely well worth visit . Really enjoyed trip to Oceanario ! Very well priced tickets wonderful collection of sea life great for all ages !! Took grayline sightseeing bus to Oceanario .

Amazing. As someone who loves science and nature I found the Oceanario to be astonishing. I didn't have to wait in line at all to buy my ticket. Maybe it was a calm day because it wasn't too crowdy at all. I think the price is okay because it probably expensive to maintain the aquariums and the Oceanario is wel maintananced. You should visit this if you have some interest in animals/nature/science.

World class at a great value. This aquarium is truly impressive. The center aquarium is huge and numerous windows provide ample viewing opportunities. The penguin and otter habitats can't be missed. We've visited a lot of aquariums and this is by far the best one we've been to yet. And the value can't be beat. Tip: if possible go during the week. We visited on a Monday and the crowds were minimal and we never had to wait in a line.

Overhyped but still worth it. There is one large central pool which you effectively walk around and view from many angles over two stories. No need to join the crowd at the fist window when entering there will be at least a dozen more windows on the same view. Other aquaria around the sides a little more hit and miss. Everybody loves the cute otters. The tropical reef aquarium beautifully put together.Worth sitting down in the auditorium and seeing the film of behind the scenes. Shows how the various inmates are fed and cared for.
Awesome day in Lisbon!. Yesterday we visited oceanario, and had so much fun..it was absolutely great! It's a bit out of the city center, but worth a trip..i would recommend it to anyone :)

Best oceanarium in Europe . This is by far the best and biggest oceanarium i been to. There's species from all over the world and very good explanations and information about those species. Apart from the main aquarium there's also another separate expedition solely focus on one specie, quite interesting too. The aquarium can also be used by other persons to practise meditation and yoga as it's such a pacific place to be in. Be aware of the time you have to visit this place as its extension is so big and involving that hours may be feel like minutes. It has taken us about 5 hours to go all around it when we thought it only has taken us just over 2 hours to do it. Take plenty of batteries as spares for all your fotos :-)

Overhyped . I expected way more, a tunnel or something... But It's basically making a circle around one impressive aquarium and some small ones here and there. Beautiful but not worth the entrance fee.
A world-class aquarium. Would say that it is not only the largest aquarium in Europe but also the richest in species. It is perfect to visit on a rainy day.

A fresh break for everyone in the family. Probably not on your first visit to Portugal, as the "Expo Area" will not be my #1 reco to truly enjoy Lisbon atmosphere... but definitely a must at one point, especially when the heat has been taking its toll for a few days of walks in the city and you want some fresh air in one of the best aquarium in Europe... kids will also love it!
Perfect . First and one of the most important point during travel around Portugal. Price for student 12,5 € and it's worth to spent this money. Must see!

Worth a visit. The oceanariums is very impressive. It is arranged by the types of fish that can be seen in the different oceans. The talk in the auditorium is worth going to. Unbelievable range of fish to be seen.

Nice aquarium. The central aquarium is very big and contains an interesting variety of fish including some rarer species such as the sunfish. Besides the big tank there are a lot of smaller aquariums also definitely worth a visit. The aquarium is very easy to reach by bus from the city center and although a bit pricey, it's worth the money.

Very Natural Friendly. We visited one Wednesday in August. There were quite many visitors from the morning - 10 o'clock when it is opened, but we enjoyed our visit in any case. There are plenty of animals to see and the tanks and exhibitions are made in very natural friendly style. We really liked it there and learn plenty of new.

Highly Recommended. We have spent some excellent time at Oceanario (almost 3 hours). Wonderful aquariums with a lot of fish, shellfish and reptiles. Great rooms with blue and clean water, trees and animals, such as penguins and sea otters (that are very very cute and funny).

Great place to go to escape the sun for a few hours!. Spent our last day in Lisbon going to the Oceanario with my 19 year old as we love visiting aquariums when we travel. We were so pleasantly surprised at how great of an aquarium this is! There were even some species that we have never seen before. We really loved the Penguin exhibit. Definitely worth a visit if you have the time.

Great aquarium and surrounded areas. Not the biggest of aquariums, but a very nice one. Get ready for a mesmerizing show of colors and shapes moving in front of your eyes. The huge vertical tank in the middle of the building is the more important one but you have little ones around each corner.
sights to see.. Fantastic, needs to be seen, then go up in the cablecar which is just around the corner!! The metro was easy to use and not expensive.
great aquarium. you can easily spend half a day watching all the fish in the great Setting. The whole Expo area could be worth a visit and there are several places to have lunch

Good way to spend a couple of hours. The main tank, perhaps unsurprisingly, is the main attraction of the center. There are other small exhibits which are diverting but they could be better presented.The animals seem happy enough and well cared for and the variety of fish is good. I was keen to see the sunfish and wasn't disappointed.Its well worth buying tickets in advance if you can as even a shortish line can take quite a while to get through.The signage, particularly coming from the nearest metro station, isn't adequate and you'll likely find yourself waking to the seafront until you see the building. There seems to be other things to see in the area but they too aren't signed.

Outstanding. Located In the expo area of Lisbon next to the river the oceanarium is one of the best In the world. An outstanding permanent display of sea creatures and their environments, full of detail and carefully labeled, complemented by temporary exhibitions of world class quality. A must.

Was good but not amazing. . Heard good things about it. However the price we paid for two adults was a lot. We took our time in the oceanarium and it lasted about 45mins. Could have been a lot worse but again it could have been better. It has pro's and cons.

Amazing experience. The Oceanário (aquarium) in Lisbon is really a unique experience. The giant 2 storey tank is mesmerizing. I could have sat there all day long watching the various species of fish glide along. It's really beautiful. I've been quite a few times, and it never ceases to amaze me.

Great day....love the fish!. A brilliant day out, lovely huge tanks with amazing fish. The Penguins can the most wonderful setting and looked so happy! Even the cafe was well priced and there was so much room everywhere it didn't appear busy despite the flow of people. Is defiantly worth the extra few euros to visit the largest fish tank in the world, the kids spent 30 minutes just lying on the floors listening to music and watching fish....bliss!

For animal lovers!. I really liked the place, because it was not like the zoo where the animals are kept in really small cages. The main tank might be a bit small, but the animals seemed satisfied. I am a bit afraid of ocean life, so that was a really nice experience to deal with it.

Excellent place to visit anytime. Signs from Oriente station got us a bit lost, but visit was really worth the effort. Loads to see and a great opportunity to get close to fantastic range of fish. Good for all the family
The best!. Amazing opportunity to see sealife in a very natural way. Well organized. Perfect spot for a family visit!
Very good!. Very good experience! Highly recommend! Me and my girlfriend had a lovely time! It was her first time and she loved! Is one the places that you can't miss once you visit Lisbon!

Medicore. When reading about the aquarium online and finding out it is the biggest aquarium in Europe I was very excited for it. When we got there I was disappointed to find out that it was mainly one aquarium in the middle that you walk around and see the same animals just on a different side. Plus we paid an extra 3 Euros each for the temporary exhibit which was mainly one wall and nothing special. I would save the aquarium trip for other cities!

Beautiful place to visit!. I had high expectation with this place, and I was not disappointed. Do not forget the temporal exhibition!.I strongly suggest to buy the tickets in advance in internet to avoid the long waiting lines at the entrance!
Great place for the family. This was my second visit here,and i can safely say i still enjoyed as much as the first time.The central display tank is an impressive feature with numerous photo points.

It's an ok aquarium...not worth the hype. I went to check out the aquarium since it is apparently one of the largest in the world. It was ok but nothing to write home about. It's located in modern Lisbon though so the neighborhood is worth seeing and you can ride in a cable cabin.
Awesome sea experience. One of the best places i've went so far. Beautiful colors, beautiful sea life and very well organized space

The Other Lisbon!. So glad we decided to go the the aquarium! It got us to an area of Lisbon we had not seen and what a contrast to the old, historic tourist spots. The aquarium is this delightfully modern building (which alone is worth the visit!) in a great setting on the river. If you take the Metro to Oriente you also get to check out this amazing, modern train station. Lots of great work done by the city of Lisbon for the Expo a few years back. The Aquarium itself was crowded on the first Sunday of Sept but ticket sales went fast and the design handles the crowds fairly well. Looks of great sea life to see and lots of good ecology minded info to remind you that the Earth is precious!

The best oceanarium in Europe. This is by far the best oceanarium in Europe. I recommend at least a 2 hour stay. So nicely organized, clean and informative its a fun for all ages. The ticket might be a bit pricey but its worth it. The area where its located offers a lot of things to visit.

Interesting visit. Had a nice visit to the Oceanário. The huge tank in the middle of the whole thing is a sight to see. So many sharks and interesting fish you have never seen before. The sea otters where fun to observe. The whole place is built very well, you follow the signs and it is sure that you won't miss a thing. Totally worth the 17€ ticket. :)

Buy tickets online to avoid the queues!. To be fair, the ticket sales were handled very well and efficiently, so the large queue took less than ten minutes to be processed. However the impressive inside gets very crowded around the first viewing point of the main tank. Keep going right and you will find compatible views less crowded. Overall we liked it but it is so annoying to see other visitors ignoring the no flash photography regulations, which no one enforces. The wonderfully cute sea otters are easy to miss. Be sure to look out for their small area on one of the tree lined corner plots.
Fantastic!. Very nice place to visit. Amazing for all ages! In August it is VERY busy, which makes the viewing of the aquarium a bit difficult. Nevertheless it is great!
Watching the sea otters was the best!. The sea otters were adorable and my favorite! Beautiful facility with a huge tank representing the Atlantic. Awesome location at the Expo 98 site.

Wonderful Visit.. We were on sightseeing hop on hop off bus tour,and noticed the impressive building,on the grounds of Expo 98 ,so we got the bus.So glad we did.Was 30 min wait for tickects,but free wifi available to buy tickets online.THIS OCEANARIUM IS THE BEST WE HAVE EVER VISITED.Fantastic for families.Panoramic views of the scaryist sharks,stingrays,pretty fish,ugly fish ,and under-sea world.PENGUIN EXHIBIT SO REALISTIC.
Nicest Aquarium in Europe. This place is full of wonderful sea life and creatures of all walks, was an amazing day out with the friends.
well-enough. It's well-enough experience in Lisbon but there are better aquariums. If you have a limited time, do not waste your time to visit.

Good day but crowded.. Beautiful aquarium. Really enjoyed the day. Very crowded, probably better during school term. We went an hour after it opened and it had a huge queue just to get in but was worth the queueing and the crowd.

Great day out! . My boyfriend and I absolutely loved the aquarium, and we had no children in tow, so this doesn't have to be a family attraction. There were plenty of opportunities to get great views and pictures of the sharks, rays and their fishy friends! Also loved seeing the penguins and watching the otters being fed.A great way to spend a few hours, would recommend to anyone
Scenario, Lisbon. Good attraction but the audio guides (which are extra) are not worth it. Good exhibits and plenty viewing areas.

Great visit. Buy your tickets online, a bit cheaper and no wait. No need to print them out either. A very entertaining visit. The main fish tank is huge and contains al kinds of neat fish. This main tank is furthermore surrounded by countless smaller exhibits with different species. Definitely worth a visit. Only drawback is that is very crowded, try and be there early (10:00 am)!

Great!. You should not miss this one. Apart from the great view you have around, the Oceanario offers a tremendous visual experience. The otters were adorablet!!! We had a lot of fun watching them. You also learn a lot of things, as the aquariums have nice explanations written below the exhibits.The ticket was 14 Eur for the Permanent Exhibition and 17 Eur for the Temporary Exhibition.

Amazing!. Read a lot about the oceanarium prior to our visit and was not disappointed. Amazing array of sea life! A huge place once you get inside, with the fish, sharks, crabs and otters leaving you in awe at times! A definite must see while in Lisbon for kids and adults alike.
If you stay in Lisbon a bit longer.... Huge place where to discover all the oceans of the world in one time! Interesting and unusual, very good choice to go there if you are travelling with kids!

Small aquarium, with not much too see.. Too small, not a lot of things to see, and too busy!! Waste of your time, and only nice for kids as they would of course love this. Don't go there when you expect something big because it isn't that big. We walked around for 30 minutes and that was only because it was busy.We absolutely love Aquariums and we visit everyone in the city we went to, for example Valencia, Barcelona, Cape Town, Antwerp, but this was just not worth the money.

Wow. Well we love Aquariums and have screen many of the best... But this is a great aquarium. exhibits are well thought out and a wide range of ecosystems are featured. You will see giant sunfish, sharks, penguins and some cute otters.
Fish. Expensive but worth it to see sea otters. It was easy to get to using the metro and travelling from the city centre towards the airport.

Best acquarium ever. My husband and I are almost 70 years old and loved this acquarium. The large fish tank is two stories and filled with ocean creatures -- sharks, baracuda, giant sunfish, etc., and watching them is mesmerizing. The building is layed out around the tank and as you go around there are nooks and crannies where you can sit and eye the creatures. There's a cold mountainous and water area for penguins, and darling sea otters who lie on their back and fluff their furry cheeks. Written material is placed in lights above the exhibits so there is no problem in reading about what you are looking at. I could go on. But we loved it and rate it highly. And seniors get a hefty discount on tickets.

Go because it's there . The Oceanarium is one of those tourist attractions in Lisbon that you go to because it's there. It's the second largest aquarium in Europe so why not? If I have one piece of advice it's too tag the signs outside to buy your tickets on your phone. The line was massive when we got there but they offer free WiFi to buy tickets and skip the queue instantly. Connecting to it automatically brings you to the ticket page. The Japanese temporary exhibit was really cool but the rest bar the area otters I could have taken or left. There wasn't much effort put in to make this a more memorable experience for me I felt.

Have to agree, this is superb. We got off the City Sightsering blud line stop to visit here and it was an excellent visit. Despite the large numbrts visiting the queue for tickets only took about 15 minutes and only 17 euros per adult, including the temporary exhibit. The place is well laid out and has an excellent and not expensive canteen. Ideal for kids and adults. Everyone will learn something here.

Beautiful Aquarium!!. Fun for all ages!! This aquarium is the nicest aquarium I have ever seen in my life. It's huge!!! Lots of different fish and fun for all ages. It is also very affordable for families. We spent a few hours there with my family enjoying all the ocean life.Highly recommend!! Buy your tickets in advance to avoid the long queues..
Must go!. This place was amazing! There was so much to see and to do and definitely a great place to take the kids.
Amazing fun!. Great temporary exhibition! I especially loved the main tank with sunfish. The price is definitely fair for what you're getting.

Stunning variety of sealife...Wonderful for the family. From a distance the Oceanario Looks like an oil platform and as you approach it you realize the huge dimension it has. The designer Peter Chermayeff is famous for building large Aquariums. I would strongly recommend for anyone visiting to come early because there are masses of people waiting to get in. If you have a baby with a strolller you have priority and can skip the line. We were fetched by a worker from the Aquarium as we were waiting and instead of waiting for about 90 minutes, were inside in 10! There is an extense variety of wildlife in the Ozeanario, including fish, birds and mammals that will interest public of all ages. There are elevators available for strollers and wheelchairs. I would also suggest that you bring the smallest stroller you have to Lisbon because it is easier to manoever wherever you go. A day trip in the area would be best, you can take the cable car (not included as part of the Oceanario) and have lunch in one of the many Restaurants in the area. There are also many other attractions for the children, such as a knowledge Center and many fountains. The visit is definitively worthwhile.

Nice, especially for kids. Really nice way to see world under different oceans and seas.. Amazing, huge range of different creatures under the water. Aprox 2-3 hours for visit. It is good to see a film about Oceanarium, to see how it really functions. Beautiful environment around the Oceanarium, river, parks, fountains.. We recommend to all to buy tickets online, because it is always so long queue in front (we were waiting aprox 45min.). This is something you have to visit if you are in this park of the town. So many tings to see around it also!

I am a sucker for aquariums!. As a scuba diver, I always love a view from below. I have to admit, living in Monterey near the world's best museum, it is always tough to compare....If you have not had a chance to see a decent aquarium, this is definitely worth a visit and some time staring at the sealife!
Beautiful. It was beautiful! We were surprised at the varitity of fishes and pinguïns. The movie half way the visit was very interesting!

Well worth the visit. Took an organised trip from our cruise ship as out of town & wasnt sure how easy would be by publivc transport.Was quite expensive to do it this way but we were not disappointed.Very interesting area-Total contrast to LIsbon itself.Aquarium amazing.Kept my 8 & 14 yr old interested for 2-3 hours.Wonderful main tank & though the place was quite busy there were lots of viewing areas.Cute otters & penguins.Very educational as everything in English as well as Portugese. Took 3 Euro cable car return trip (For all 4 of us)-20mins-after the aquarium.Amazing views,.No queues at all.Would have liked to spend more time in the area.

Fantastic visit to the magic underwater world. Perfect visit for a rainy day.With friends and family we had a great time at Oceanario de Lisboa.The facilities are very good and clean and the staff were fantastic to guide us to the best paths suing the stroller.Our toddler was thrilled by the huge central aquarium with many beautiful big fish.There is plenty to see and enjoy. Even better knowing that you can come out and have lunch at a restaurant and reenter in the afternoon to revisit the best spots.I will recommend this to all my friends.

Simply the best place to go in Lisbon. The Oceanario de Lisboa features two exhibitions, the permanent exhibition and a temporary one.The permanent exhibition is a true feast for your senses, you start on the top floor where you can "travel" trough 4 different habitats and spend literally hours looking to the main tank and it's hundreds of sea creatures. On the lower floor there are dozens of smaller tanks, each one with different creatures, mimicking their habitats in nature. The Oceanario is a true beautiful place, from its architecture to the effort made to make you feel that you are somewhere below the water, in the antarctic or in a rain forest. This exhibition per si is more than a reason to visit this amazing place.The second exhibition, the temporary one, is now devoted to the "Florestas Submersas" (underwater forests) an amazing 40 meter tank, made by Takashi Amano and the Oceanario crew. It is a breathtaking scenario, with literally thousand of small fishes, and a luxuriant flora. This is the world largest tank of it's kind and deserves a visit.Oceanario de Lisboa is definitely the best place to visit in Lisbon.
Fantastic for families. Definitely one of the best aguariums we have been to. Located in an interesting are of Lisbon you usually do not visit. Well kept, fun and a lot to see. Perfect for families.
Biiiiig aquarium. Very nice and big aquarium. A bit crowded, but with patience you can have a look of everything. Do not miss the temporary exhibition!

Very good but busy. Excellent aquarium with lots to see. Wasnt overly impressed with the temporqry exhibition but overall it was worth it. Takes a few houra to walk around and see everything. When i went (peak of tourist season) the place was rammed- keep this in mind, they should maybe think of a better way of managing the crowds.

Amazing, do go. I've done my duty as regards to kids attractions, especially aquariums. Yet this stands out and deserves it's good reviews. First the area is good, interesting and different, kids will like its location. Second the price is good €36 for family. Third, it's beautifully designed, it's clean, it's full of interesting fish! And the signage and description brilliant. Enjoy it, it's stunning. We followed the visit up with cable car ride, trip to vasco de gama shopping centre and nice walk of the area. Worth the detour from central Lisbon.
Wonderful. One of the biggest oceanariums in the world! Beautiful, fantastic, breathtaking! Such a vast amount of different species from all over the world. Don't miss!

A must!. Fabulous place which should be visited by every school child. Beautiful pictures but more important very educational and lots of ideas on how to protect our planet and who to think about the impact we have on it!

One of the best aquariums. My family has been to a number of aquariums around the world and this is one of the best.There were some very unique aquatic creatures that we enjoyed seeing, The sea otters were a lot of fun. One of them was scooping ice cubes from a container, swimming around with them and then eating them. It was quite a bit of fun to watch.The underwater plant sculpture temporary exhibit was a real treat. It was such a nice relaxing and tranquil way to start the tour and none of us had seen an exhibit like that.Buy tickets online in advance to beat the queues.
Not the easiest access, but well worth it. The access is not easy by public transportation, and taxis were hard to find on my way back to Chiado, but the place is excellent.

Good for all ages. Really nice aquarium. Good place for kids to combine with cultural sightseeing. You can spend 2/3 hours there and than walk around to see the rest of the buildings and public spaces that were built for the Expo 98.
Terrific!. Very nice aquarium! very diverse and fun! I would definitely recommend for anyone to go, even if you don't have kids!

An average experience. We went here as a family and were full of high expectations; alas, we were treated to a very average experience. The penguins were cute and the main tank was huge but other than this, the experience was that of an average aquarium. Added to this was a very long queue and very little room to move around due to the crowds. This is one sight which can be missed and there would be no great loss!

One of Expo's best legacy!. I love this place. I've been there so many times. It's not cheap, but it just makes me feel good and calm. I can stay for 20 minutes in front of the same aquarium, observing the fish... It's beautiful. I totally recommend a visit, especially for children and for nature lovers.

Wow. A really lovely experience. We arrived at the aquarium about midday and it was very busy, but there's so much to see that if somewhere is too busy you can just move on and come back to it later. The sea otters were my personal highlight - don't miss feeding time!
Coool. Spend zwo nice releäaxed hours there! Dont go to the main times, too much people! After 3 pm it was very ok... price was ok - 12.5 euro...

Awesome. Really worth a visit, awesome and a really big main aquarium.
Book online to skip the queue (we waited 15min on a friday which was ok) and get a discount.

Honeymoon trip. Came into Lisbon and didn't have time to make it out to Sintra or the beaches the first day in and this was a perfect experience. Prices are fair and offers you a great look into marine life on all the oceans, seems very family friendly. No pressure or rush as you see everything at your own pace. Slightly out of the way but worth the detour.

An Ocean experience from start to finish. The experience starts as you walk upto the building with the piped sea sounds and the ecological/geographical information. A great layout with each continent having its own zone. The penguins were particularly fascinating to watch. The highlight of the attraction is the double storey tank in the middle of the building.

Overpriced. We decided to go to the aquarium based on the great reviews from TripAdvisor. The main attraction is a huge water tank with a variety of different fish and sharks. It's not that impressive and personally I have seen better aquariums. But, if this is the first time you go to an aquarium, there is enough for you to see. Overall, it'a nice experience, not a must see, and it's average value for money.

Overrated and a tourist trap. This place is a complete tourist trap with hundreds of kids running and screaming all over the place. save yourself time by buying tickets online and avoid the huge rush to get in. They say its the second biggest oceanario in the world but its not the second best aquarium in the world.

What a wonderful world. Whenever you are visiting Lisboa, this is a must-see. If you visit, please take enough time because this wonderful sealife will keep on amazing you. You will feel impressed and this visit will most certainly paint a big smile on your face, no matter what age you are. A visit to remember for a very long time and to return to...
Great. Best aquarium I've ever been, my teenage girl loves it, located at the former expo area, worth to visit and stay there

To not be missed. No matter if you have children, if you are on a honeymoon or even on a business trip. You HAVE to find the time to go to the Oceanario it's a stunning experience. No words can describe it.

Amazing Ocean Life. This is worth a visit. There is a vast amount of sea life to view, plenty to keep all ages happy and interested.
Book on-line to save time on queuing, although the queue moves fast.

A good few hours out with the family . Excellent aquarium couldn't fault. Very good selection of fish etc. also very relaxing.
Only downside is that it can get very crowded in certain areas but that is to be expected.

Beautiful!. The place is beautiful, on the river bank on a beautiful part of the city.
You can see the oceanario is well kept and the animals are well treated.
It is really worth a few hours to visit!
Environmental responsibility. Impressive oceanarium ideal for kids to explain importance of preserving nature and responsible use of water

Well worth a visit. Fantastic oceanarium with an astonishing variety of creatures. Beautifully presented with just the right level and amount of information. Watching the sea otters being fed was just one of the highlights!
Fantastic aquarium. Giant aquarium with fantastic view of the sea world. Children just love to see it and feel as if inside the ocean. A place worth visiting.

Great fun for kids and adults alike. Excellent display of fishes from all corners from the world. Ensure you have enough time to stroll at your own pace. Educational corner for kids and film show interesting for all ares.
Brilliant aquarium!. Visited here with my wife and two young kids. This is simply the bet aquarium I have ever been to. Very educational and has lots of exotic species. Well worth a visit!

Dissapointing. It seemed to be a large place and expectations were high and after paying €17 for not only the permanent exhibition but also the temporary exhibition.It seemed very promising but turned out later on it just wasn't.You just don't get what you paid for.It's a small place inside with a variety of tropical fish and coral.I would prefer the Lisbon zoo.
Wow. Amazing, loved it. So many different fish to see. They also had penguin which were very funny. The middle tank was amazing. A must if in lisbon

Ok but crowded. We were there on a Tuesday. The price was 17€ for the permanent and temporary exhibition for each person. Which is too much in my opinion since the place is really crowded by tourists and you will have a hard time seeing everything. It takes about 2 hours to see most of the Oceanario.

Worth seeing. Wonderfull place for everyone looking for a peace and real life fantasy. Gigant aquarium with variety of fish, sharks iand other animals takes your breath away. You are better of to come earlier to avert standing in the line.
Worth seeing. Wonderfull place for everyone. Gigant aquarium with variety of fish and sharks is breathtaking. It's better to come earlier to avert standing in the line.
Stunning Aquarium. Beatiful aquarium to visit. Highly recommend it for families. Kds and adults will love it. Discovered fish we had never seen before.
LIKE LIVING UNDER WATER. They have one of the best views because of the large bowed glass, you feel like you are walking under water. The sides have cute little exhibits and great for kids!

Huge tanks and tons of fish. My favourite sight in Lisbon! The aquarium is realy big and has a lot to offer. You can see there from fishes, to pinguins, turtles, sharkes...really wow! The tanks are really big, you can just sit there for hours and just watch fish swimming by. Its a great experience for children.

Interesting and educative. Nice experience in a perfect environment. Ideal for kids and adults too. Animals are astonishing and you can gather a lot of info spread along the path. Warmly suggested the temporary exhibitions. Ours was about wabi sabi applied to water garden.
Lovely. My two children absolutely loved it here! The middle tank was amazing and although it was busy we could stop and spend time looking.

Really enjoyable. This was a stop on the yellow bus tour and one we had planned to visit. We weren't disappointed. Yes there are queues but the line went down quickly. a huge place and one where although busy you could easily view all the exhibits. Specifically enjoyed the Underwater Landscape displays by a Japenese artist . Good value for money as there is so much to see. Excellent shop adjoining with a wide variety of quality items. Great area outside also to eat, drink and wander around .

Great experience. We visited the Oceanario with our daughter. She enjoyed it a lot, especially the big fish tank and the educational part of the exhibit. The price of 44 euros per family is competitive compared to other such attractions in Europe. The surrounding area is great to chill and enjoy the river view. We recommend taking the Yellow bus tour purple line and make a 3-4 hour stop here. Also do not miss the telecabin at the river front.

Nice place. Too crowded. A very nice place. Especially the big aquarium in the middle. The queues however were very long so it pays off to get a ticket online and skip those. The downside is that for every window we had to wait 5 minutes before there was space to see anything. Too many people!

Well laid out. We visited in August to find huge queues waiting to buy tickets but the huge sign on the wall said book online for immediate entry. I whipped out my smartphone and within minutes had received the email confirmation and we were in! We must have saved a 30 minute wait at least. Inside it is laid out in 'oceans' and is very well done however it would be good to see more, and bigger, information panels. Worth a visit but not worth a long wait in my opinion.

Brilliant!!. The aquarium is nicely done and well run. It's exhibitions were quite stunning and the gift shop had low prices on information and gifts. My personal favourite exhibition was the sea bird one because they had loads of active birds and you got to see them being fed.

Loved it . We had a great time, had to wait in line for about half an hour, but it was worth it. There is so much inside, so many creatures you wouldn't see if you're from my part of the world. I did enjoy the zoo more, but it depends what you're looking for!

Relaxing and interesting. We spent a couple of unplanned hours enjoying the Oceanario as it was on the yellow bus tour route. It is very cleverly designed around the ocean regions of the world with excellent information and viewing points. We had not pre booked so the queue was about 15minutes but it was in the shade. It is not something I would normally visit without children but it was very very enjoyable and relaxing. Definitely worth a visit if you have the time. Nearby there is a cable car which travels along the whole park with fabulous views of the Vasco de Gama bridge

Great time. Awesome experience! Stunning displays and exhibits. This was certainly one of the highlights during our stay in Lisbon. It's very nicely distributed and very informative and it displays 'something' from all oceans. It is very well preserved.

Buy tickets online! Great place. If you are visiting Lisbon in summer season prepare yourself to spend hours in line to get inside, unless you buy tickets online. That will save you a lot of time. There is one huge aquarium in the middle of the Oceanario, you can observe the life inside from different perspectives. It goas across 2 floors and there is great number of viewpoints where you can just sit and watch for hours these amazing creatures including sharks. It is almost hypnotizing. Apart from that there is big number of small aquariums, but these are not that good. Make sure you see the otters, these are really cute.

Expensive and small. When comparing to King Shaka in Durban ,South Africa and Two Oceans aquarium in Cape Town,South Africa this exhibition is truly disappointing .Maybe the owners should visit South Africa for ideas as to upgrade and enlarge your facility .Not value for money at all.

great aquarium. visited Oceanario recently,has great collection of sea life,however it is overpriced as compared to comparable in world.You can use some discount vouchers from books given by tour buses.Sea life collection is worth seeing.Has scenic surrounding , cable car ride.You can enjoy few hours around Oceanario, more so if you have children . Drop off and pick up point on bus tour route.
Very nice afternoon. We spent 2 hours in Oceanario, really great, just buy tickets online, otherwise you will wait about 20 minutes, but inside it is perfect :) just go :)
Truly the Best!. Awesome experience! Marine life in all it's splendor. Oceanario is like walking through an aqua fantasyland.

Oceanariums Lisbon. This is on the Metro red line, get off at Oriente and is well worth a few hours.prebook tix on their website, their is a priority system. Preferably start your day at 10:00 to avoid the waiting to enter. The large aquarium is unbelievable, the closest to scuba diving on dry land. The small displays containing eels, jellyfish, sea horses, octopuses are excellent.If you have a few hours to spare this is worth a visit, g eat for kids.

Great family day out. Stunning displays and exhibits. We visited during summer holidays, so it was very busy, but we were still able to view all exhibits at a leisurely pace. Buying tickets on line will avoid the queues. The restaurant looked good for a main meal, but it's snacks were mediocre. Be sure not to miss the temporary exhibition of the Japanese underwater garden designer. We can highly recommend a trip on the cable cars by the river to finish off a great day.

Very well preserved and worth a visit!. This was certainly one of the highlights during our stay in Lisbon. It's very nicely distributed and very informative and it displays 'something' from all oceans. It is very well preserved. This attraction is not just for kids and it's certainly not just another aquarium. Allow at least an hour.
Worth to see. 17 euros (price of entrance in August 2015) might seem too much but the costs to keep the facilities, staff and species there justify the price.

A very enjoyable couple of hours. Having taken the Big Red bus tour round Lisbon we passed the Oceanario and decided to go in. Its advertised as the biggest in Europe. It's a fascinating visit. Very well laid out with plenty to see and well designed so that you walk between the different ocean areas and see the fish that live in those waters. Very educational if you want it to be so or just enjoyable if, like us, we wandered through without stopping to read everything. We didn't stop to eat there but the restaurant looks nice - very clean and organised. As with all tourist attractions you need to walk through the shop to get out but I am happy to say that it it was well stocked with quality buys and very little tack! For your information, we stood in a lengthy queue as we chose to visit on a Saturday. It's VERY busy BUT you can download tickets onto your phone and avoid standing waiting to pay at the ticket counter.

One of the greatest Sea Aquariums in the world. We visited the Oceanario with our 3 children. The amount of sea creatures, the number of information, aquariums and sea species is simply outstanding. A great way to spend a good part of a day.

Awesome experience. Loved loved loved this Oceanarium, it's truly awesome in the real sense of the word. The rainbow fish in the central tank is jaw dropping, and the sea otters are so cute, and you can get really close to them.Definitely worth doing. Go for a walk along the sea front afterwards.
Great day out. We found the Oceanario Loads of variety of fish. The separation into oceans is very clever. The biggest aquarium in Europe. Well worth a visit.

Amazing. Amazing, great for family and couples so easy to get too and from.It's got plenty to see and a good day out, has a place to eat and drink.I would recommended pre booking tickets online which luckily we did, due to the question being massive at least 45 min wait. If you pre book you can go straight in and no waiting.

A fantastic collection of sea life. 7 of us visited - 3 kids, parents and grandparents and all loved this place! We bought our tickets using the App which was good and saved time in the queue. The space inside the aquarium is good and most of the viewing spots aren't too crowded. We all loved the temporary exhibition by Takashi Amano - beautiful. We spent a good few hours in here. A good visit!!

Visita. The place to see altogether all sorts of beautiful, and some ugly also, fish and other see creatures. Wonderful to take your children. Mine went there for the first time even before they were born.

Great for the children ( and not only). We have found the Oceanario very well organised. Our daughter enjoyed species she has seen there. She was very excited during the visit. Even if it was crowded it was not packed.

Awsome place. The aquarium is amazing. It has loads of types of fish and is separated into oceans. Pay attention to the animal feeding times specially the otters as it's really cute to see them eat. The times are posted on the info boards in each section. Highly recommend the visit... plus buy the ticket online it will save you time and money and you don't even have to print it.

Awesome aquarium. The tickets are a little pricey but if you have gone on a yellow bus tour you can get a discount on your tickets! We visited the temporary exhibition and that was awesome! We watched the documentary on how it was made and it was very interesting! The rest of the aquarium was brilliant too! My favourite was the shark but the biggest surprise fish to see was the sun fish! There are also birds in this place! I have taken so many pictures way too many, definitely worth the visit

Fishes. I'm not really a big fan of nature and wilflife :-) So this wasn't really my cup of tea.But anyhow, the place is well kept and not tooooo crowded, so you can easely walk from window to window to observe the fishes.

Worth the money and time. I visited it on a Saturday in mid August 2015. It was a unique experience for me. Though there was long queue, but it was moving fast and were were in after ~20min wait. The permanent exhibit is 14 Euros and if you also like to see the permanent + temporary exhibit then it is 17 Euros total. The temporary exhibit was some model of warm fresh water fishes by a Japanese creator. This temporary exhibit was okish-stuff, I would not recommend visiting it (just 1 floor of aquarium with tiny fishes and underwater plants). The permanent exhibit is excellent, as many others have reviewed. Varieties of ocean life can be seen here. Other than that there are exhibits of deep sea creatures, penguins, otter, frogs, corals, etc. It is a must visit and keep at least 2 hours at hand. Only complain is I couldn't take good photographs due to the crowd and the prohibition on using flash (even if you use flash, the thick glass barriers reflects back a lot of life).

Refreshing visit !. What a wonderful morning we had at the Oceanario ! Such a refreshing experience in all respects. Lots of things to learn, admire the life of the ocean and raise awareness about potential dangers. Lots of colors, diversity of species and one unique wonderful habitat

Beautiful museum. I had quite high expectations for the #1 "thing to do" in Lisbon, and I was not disappointed. There were so many fish and of so many sizes from different oceans around the world. The fish were beautiful and fascinating and it was possible to get really close to all of them.

Great place to visit. If you came to Lisbon and have time, it's a very nyce place to go. It's unique and you can join education and pleasure. If you have kids, they will enjoy the colors and all the things in there.

Good place to visit! 🐟. A lot of interesting fish and animals! It is good for a day trip. You should by the ticket online when you arrive(then you don't have to wait in a queue), they have wifi. We also did the tram while we were in the area, so you can combine those two activities ✌It is nice to tke pictures there to

excellent for kids an adults. take at least half a day to visit the oceanário.you can see lots of fishes you don"t imagine to exist.my favourite ones are the giant rays.it"s easy to get there take the Metro and enjoy the way near the river.Nearby there is also a shopping center.

Nothing special.. I have to say I love that the oceanarium focuses on educating about conservation and showing how we destroy this planet. The day we went it was really hot outside so it was nice to run away from the heat. The queues were massive since the morning but we have bought our tickets online which I recommend to anyone that's planning to visit. It saves a lot of time. My partner loved the visit.Personally , since I've been told it's the biggest one in Europe I expected a lot more. There's a huge tank you see from every side which is beautiful to sit down and watch after the walk. I loved the sea otters even though I only saw one for half a second as they hid under the rock. I liked the place but the idiotic ignorant people using flash even though it's forbidden and clearly upsetting the poor animals. No staff to stop them!!!!!A cable car ride is a must.

FIshy Fishy. It's a unique place to visit with your family, you can learn and see so much. The aquarium is very well kept. The colours are amazing and they look so happy. It was not my first time, but it keeps me surprising with all the there is to see.
Under the Seas! Magic!!. Not to miss when in Lisbon. One of the main attractions of the city and the opportunity to "live" on the oceans!! Great for all ages!!

A great place to take the kids!. The Expo area of Lisbon is a great place to see, with lots of things to see and do (including great shopping), you are certain to find many things to enjoy. One of them is the Oceanario de Lisboa, one of the biggest aquariums in Europe boasting lots of exotic fishes to sharks!A great day out with the family!

Highly dissapointed. I rather go to the fish market.. When we arrived there, the queues were really long. The whole trip was not worth it at all. We spend about £50 for some small walk around a building. I rather go to the fish market then spend time there. They have a really big tank that you see from mostly every step of the way which was quite amazing at first, but then realized that it was one of the only attraction in the entire aquarium. If you want to go to an actual aquarium, i would 100% prefer the one in England. The sea life aquarium have a walk in tunnel which makes you feel like you are under the water. It's amazing. From all the good reviews on trip advisor about this aquarium, I expected much more. The only thing that i actually took interest in on the trip was the view on the way there. The view was immaculate. On the way back there is a place for cable cars which I highly recommend. It makes the boring trip ten times better. If you enjoyed the trip to this aquarium, I advise you that you head to a more well known aquarium to see what you are missing out on. I would recommend you going if you were below the age of 5

Nice place to visit in Lisbon. A nice place to visit when in Lisbon. A bit outside the city centre but easy to get to using the simple and well signed Metro system in English and Portuguese. A great selection of sea creatures, well displayed, modern and clean. The only two sea otters in Europe as well as some deep sea critter that are rarely seen in aqauriums. Set nicely in a large park built for the 98 expo its certainly worth the trip.

A good way to spend an afternoon. The Oceanarium is located a short walk from the Vasco da Gama Shopping Center. Take the subway (red line) to the Oriente Station to get to both The exhibits are well explained, and there is more to see than just fish. The way through the Oceanarium is easy to follow and at the time I was there the Special Exhibit was worth the time to see.

amazing place. You can sit for hours staring at the giant stingrays, sharks, jellyfish ... A great alternative to spend time with the whole family. It is impressive not only for children but also for adults.

Anti-climatic. Was informed best aquarium in Europe(not).If entry was more expensive would not of been impressed.Basically large tank in centre which can be viewed on many different locations.Penguins looked depressed and always faced away from crowd.Live in London and our aquarium ten years ago knocked spots of this place.Best thing of the day was the cable car ride outside ,only 6€ return.Had lunch in the Irish bar nearby,lovely steak and live footy.

Just amazing, a must see in lisboa. I can easily say that this is one of the best oceanario I have seen so far. If you only can see one thing in lisboa it should be this( and you help preserving the ocean's)
Great experience. It is very interesting, especially for the children. Some tanks (otter tank for example) did not seem very clean though.

Good visit but no answer to my email for a request on an activity . Good visit but no answer to my email for a request on an activity organized. I tried to sleep I need night with sharks but they didn't take into consideration my email

Fun!. Specimens of fish from all the oceans - complete with the full environment of the 5 great oceans on earth. You will enjoy as a child or adult!Tip - instead of waiting inline - buy your ticket online and print / show it on your phone

Excellent . Loved the Oceanario de Lisbon. Incredible main tank with so much to see and smaller habitats within the main one - I loved it and I'm a BIG aquarium visitor!Loved the temporary Underwater Forest exhibit too. Just beautiful

Wow!. What a fantastic aquarium! We immensely enjoyed the trip here. The highlight most definitely was seeing the otters. Couldn't recommend this place more...providing you love seeing animals and nature.

oceanario. great day out we spent the day here in this area as you have the twin towers here as well plenty to do walk the promenade plenty of places to stop for a coffee or an ice cream parlor or something to eat spoilt for choice great for families

It was ok. We had a day in Lisbon and based on the reviews decided to squeeze this in. To be honest I would probably have given it a miss if I'd known what it was like. When we arrived the queue for tickets was very long probably about an hour wait. Luckily we had bought our tickets on line in advance so did not have to stand in line. However, the whole place is really crowded, it's very hard to move around and see things. Also there is one big central tank which you see many, many times. The topical area was very nicely done. The queue for the toilets was about 20 minutes. The kids got fed up with the crowds and became disinterested. The large tank is impressive but I have been to better aquariums that are less crowded and more interactive. Difficult to find taxis when leaving and they won't pick up families of more than 4 people, it's a long way out from the city so you need transport to get back as it's not really walkable. We got round in about an hour. Would rather have spent more time in the city centre.

I felt like a mermaid :P. Oceanario de Lisboa was such a nice place to visit :), is a place one must visit if in Lisbon. I believe that 3hours are good enough for a decent visit.
There's a variety of animals..> and most times you feel like you are in the middle of the ocean...its mesmerizing :D

Amazing. A really big ocenarium, which shows the sea life of the North Atlantic.Although it was a weekday, there were lots of people both inside and outside standing in a queue. We made use of a coupon (we got a booklet of coupons on a hop on and off bus tour) which gave us some reduction from the entrance fee. Don't miss a ride in the cable car over the river!

Perfect for a family visit. The huge Atlantic tank, viewable from two levels and multiple windows, where truly amazing. If one window is crowded, just walk to the next. The smaller tanks with all kinds of fish and saline from around the world was also very interesting. We spent a few hours and both kids and parents had a wonderful time. The line for the ticket window was long but you can order tickets online and skip the line. The even have wi fi service outside so you can order tickets on your smartphone outside the venue. The Oceanario is outside the centre of town but the Metro will take you there in 10-15 minutes.
Not to be missed once in Lisbon! Nicest aquarium ever!. The best in Europe, if not in the World! Not to be missed with various species to see and appreciate what the nature has!

Fabulous Place.. We had a number of hours free before catching a flight home so dropped off the rental car, and took a short taxi ride to the Oceanario. So glad we did. What an amazing place! Brilliantly laid out around the massive central tank and so much to see besides the hypnotic fish including sea otters and penguins too. We all loved it including our teenager and 8-year old.

Lovely afternoon spent with the fish. A large variety of fish and different sea creatures.Good information provided about the fish/sea creatures.Large tanks/good environments.Long queues to enter and to gain access to some tanks/areas.Temporary exhibition was not worth visiting.
Best oeanarium I ever saw!. This oceanarium has to look for some one similar in Europe. I was in favor for this attraction of Lisboa and was glad that I visited this wonderful place!!!
Deep ocean. Amazing and big. That's why it was considered one of the best of the world. Allways a good place to relax.

Well done but crowded. I went on a weekend (probably why so crowded) and it was a bit more expensive than most exhibits in Lisbon- I think around 18 euros without the special exhibit. The line moved quickly and the interior was really well done. There is a central tank with sharks, rays and tons of different varieties of sea life. You can see this tank in many different viewings throughout the aquarium so don't waste time in the beginning where the crowds gather. I loved the otters- they were feeding them and they were very funny. They were definitely the crowd pleasers. Overall a nice way to get out of the heat but it is out of the way. It would definitely be worth it for those groups traveling with children. The surrounding area is also really cool to walk around.
Fantatsic Experience. Na amazing experience specially when with kids, very well organized, and will see every tank as it is a "go around" exhebition.
Good enough. Maybe with less people you can enjoy a lit bit more, loved the big Tank, not something to do often, in 30 or 45 minutes you can see it. Good for children.

Deceptively large, well organised out and good value. This is worth a visit. It is organised in different segments and there is a good flow around the facility - the exhibits were very well done. The entrance fee was very reasonable €15 per adult, and the food and drink available there was very reasonably priced and of good quality

Seaworld magic experience for your kids. Best European Seaworld acquarium in 2014. That about says it all. Located in Parque das Nações, aka 'Expo', which is Lisbon's newest and most modern area.
Once you go there try also a ride in the cable car just above the Tagus River.

Baby concerts are a must not miss!. Our Oceanário de Lisboa is one of the best in the world, no doubt about that. I visited it several times since its opening back in 1998, for the Expo 98. Any time, any month, for locals and tourists, a must not miss place in Lisbon. However today my review goes to their baby concerts. Lovely! Children adore them. The environment provided by the big aquarium is unique. My grandchildren love to go! The only shortcoming is that you need to book plenty in advance.

Amazing underwater life experience . The Lisbon Oceanarium is a wonderfull place to spend a few hours.Including the small theatre we attended, we spent 3 hours in it.My advice is to go for the entire program that includes the play and the circuit guided visit with all the explanations about the different species and habitats.The central aquarium is quite big, with an impressive number of species, some of them of large size. The penguen area is also very realistic and the otters are quite funny to watch. Animals are well treated and the aquarium very well maintained. Finally stop by the merchandising store for some nice gifts for the Kids.

Don't miss the otters!. A great way to spend an afternoon with kids in Lisbon. The aquarium has a wonderful central tank that provides great views from different angles across the aquarium. The highlight is the couple of otters who will delight kids and adults alike! The aquarium is also located in a very nice park alongside the Tage river. The place gets crowded in the summer so plan to go early or later in the day.

Tour of Lisbon including the Magnificent Oceanarium. Amazing and no words to describe how impressive it was! The way life in the five oceans is shown to us here! Also, we can see that the animals and fishes here are very well taken cared of. We looked on facebook for a tour and found a great company called Travel Care Portugal. Great professionals and top of the line cars!

One of the best attractions while visiting Lisbon.. A favorite site in Lisbon. Quite liked spending the day here. Educational and well planned. When you first walk into the main building you'll find the first window to view the main aquarium. Often crowded, but you can by pass this as there are several similar view points with less people as you navigate around.

Probably one of the best oceanarium in the world. Spectacular viewing of different types of fish and mantas, penguins, otters, birds, etc. the place is almost a zoo. Been here more than once I can say that the temporary exhibition usually follows the same quality of the permanent, thus well worth paying the extra € to get in.

An aquarium like you never seen one!!. There's a word o discribes it "amazing" is massive with a lot of different species calm well mantined as soon as you step in you feel really under the see and it's so amazing you don't want to live it gives you a calming sensation is very peaceful! !activitie for all ages and to all ocasions strongly recommend! !

Lots to see. A little costly to enter but it was worth it. There is a large tank in the middle of the aquarium with sharks, stingrays... etc which you eventually walk around twice (upstairs and downstairs). Around the main tank, there are enclosures which house different breeds of birds and other marine animals.I would personally recommend this attraction to families with young children.

Plenty o' fish. I really enjoyed this place. It was informative without being overwhelming. Plenty of information available but you can also just go and look at the pretty fish!!! A relaxing way to spend a couple of hours. Kids seemed to adored this place too.

A wonderful afternoon. A delightful variety of species- I was particularly excited by the gigantic sun fish- and the many different places to view the central aquarium was brilliant. I must agree the price was a bit steep for the amount of time spent in the attraction but I am very glad we went. If you have had a good few days already in Lisbon, I would recommend it, especially as part of an outing to the whole Parque das Nações on a nice day. When walking on the promenade, be sure to scan the sea and pools for fish, jellyfish and wading birds as well.
Alright to visit. Really beautiful place with a lot many sea creatures. Very pleasant visit that I would recommend to anyone visiting Lisbon.

Pretty fun. Honestly, I feel that 14 euros for the permanent exhibition was a bit overpriced. Although they had an impressive selection of different species, it is not the best aquarium I've been to. You also have to count in the taxi ride, which for us was about 8 euros each way from the city center, as it is slightly too far to walk. However it was a quite fun experience!

Superb. The oceanario is well worth a visit. Wonderfully diverse exhibits presented with an opportunity to feel quite Virtually immersed in the various tanks, pool etc. The location is superbly convenient adjacent to the metro station. When I visited I was able to go right in with no waiting line - despite the place quite buzzy with people. There is something for people of all ages. I quite enjoyed the ocean otter who also seemed to enjoy the audience's attention. Highly recommended.

Beautiful Aquarium. The aquarium is so much beautiful!! Very well treated!! The diversity of species makes a visitation be so much richer! But, the title of the best aquarium of europe deserved be with the Valencia Aquarium in Spain.
AMAZING. Definitely worth a visit. We stayed there about 2:30!! It is also worth buying the tickets online as you save money and lots of time. I've never seen such an impressive layout of aquariums!

I expected more. The Oceanario is a very interesting place to see, and there are, of course, many interesting and beautiful species. I've never seen a shark before so close to me - what a great experience! Overall experience was very good, but I felt like the price (14 euros for adults for the permanent exhibition) was too high for a relatively short visit (less then an hour and a half). I've seen much bigger zoo parks (and interesting aquariums inside of them) in Europe for the same price. It was just a bit disappointing, but I would recommend it to everyone who is staying or more then four-five days in Lisbon since the whole aria is also interesting to see.

A nice centerpiece for an ocean based holiday.. I had never seen a dragon fish, spectacular! Describing each ocean apart was interesting.The ticket line was thankfully not too bad, 20 minutes covered.

My wife had to drag me away from this place. This place is great. The main tank is unbelievable. It is so nicely structured so that everywhere you go you can have another perspective on the main tank. The other parts are spectacular also.

It's not a must go.... It's a very interesting attraction, of course.
But, in my opinion, only if you have spent more than 4 days walking the streets of Lisbon, you have to try the Oceanario.
I mean, you will like it and it's the best excuse to visit the modern part of the city, but it's not Lisbon.

Good afternoon programme but overrated. Worth a visit if you have children. I was expecting more to be honest. However you have everything explained in English as well. Buy a ticket in advance so you skip the long waiting time. Especially recommended in august.

Recomended if you have halfday before evening flight back home. Very nice attraction, especially for families. Recomend to buy tickets online, saves you lot of time in high season to enter.Good parking abilities around and short way to the airport and city center, so taxi is not expensive.We visited as two families with kids age 2-11 and everyone enjoyed the stay. We spent about 4 hour incl. lunchbreak. We felt we had done it all in that time.

worth a visit. we stopped of here as part of the hop on hop off bus tours.It was very busy when we arrived, you can book your tickets using the free onsite wi fi. worth a thought. we stayed in the que but took advantage of the 15% discount on offer from Grayline tours.you can go take your time to go around the vast aquariums and there is lots of interesting things to see for everyone.there is also a large selection of eating places around.we used the cable car which is situated out side,to take us along to the Vasco da Gama tower and walked back.(it closed in 2004 if you expected to climb it).

An absolute must see. In a recent part of the city has been designed one of the largest muséums fully dedicated to the seas. You will see evolve many different species (including birds and mammifères) in their homeland. Perfect to do with children.
Nice place to visit. The Oceanario is well organized, you'll go through 4 climatic zones. Wait for the sea otters to come out, they are amazing. The large aquarium is very interesting.

Fantastic Acqarium. This is by far the best acqarium that we have ver visited. It is full of interesting exhibits and the major tank can be viewed from several different angles and levels it is quite breathtaking.
The best. Built for the 1998 exibition is one of the best in the world. House of thousands of diferent animals it is a place that you should visit.
Amacing and grand. Very impressing huge main aquarium. Lots of smaller, too. Nice, but not overwhelming. Smart to go early - crowded later.

A great journey through the oceans . It was a splendid journey through the oceans. The oceanarium is divided in different areas, each for one of the oceans. It's built around a central tank with thousand of fish inside and you get to see at them in several different prospective while visiting. There is a room with penguin and another one with birds that are flying just above your head.I would highly recommend it to anyone who has a spare day in Lisbon, because has the city offers plenty of historical monument, I would be better visit them of course.It is a good place for kids too.Enjoy your visit!
Relaxing calm, nice retreat . Decently priced with very nice exhibitions. Bring your children or make it an adult trip. Definitely enjoyable by all ages

Not worth it.. Read the reviews, and we were all looking forward to the visit. 40 min wait in line to get tickets. The aquarium was not at all impressive. Our kids were dissapointed, and so were we. Felt like we were still queuing inside. The kids couldn't see properly. Wall of people everywere.

Family friendly aquarium for all ages. An aquarium that has something to offer for all ages. Good to learn about ocean preservation. Nice location, very beautifully built. The cafeteria was also surprisingly inexpensive for a museum
Great underwater view. Intresting and spectacular see world. Enormus aquarium with sharks and fish from all over the world. Best for family vacation children will be thrilled.

Major spot to visit in Lisbon. Apart for all the old and historic side of Lisbon, the new side with Parque Expo and especially the Oceanário de Lisboa are a must go for every traveller. It's more than a simple aquarium... it's a oceanarium, since you can observe a lot of species, including otters and penguins. Children love it and along 2 or 3 hours you'll have an excellent visit. Avoid weekends for a better and quieter experience.

Book in advance . Fantastic aquarium, would highly recommend as a must visit in Lisbon. Make sure you book your tickets in advance so you can bypass the very long queues and get there early because it gets very busy!!BYPASS the cafe, poor service, poor food selection. The food was stale, dry and tasteless. Definitely put a downer on the visit.

Average. It was very average. I'm not a fan of animals in captive, but went with my partner who wanted to go. The birds and otter's need more room. It's too cramped. Or let them go. They all went round in circles. After we were finished, my partner thought it was very poor conditions for the animals.

Fun experience. I came to this aquarium with high expectations since it is tripadvisors number one aquarium. However I wasn't blown away and wasn't impressed. It was very good and a nice way to spend a few hours. I expected to see more octopus, and didn't see any cuttlefish or squid. I do think it was a good deal since its half the price of other aquariums ask it was good value for what you got.

Swimming with the fishes in the hot summer afternoon. One of the best things you can do on a hot summer afternoon.
