Although somewhat expensive (HINT ask for the student prices) the experience is well worth it.I would recommend going there during the work week to avoid weekend tourist flood and make sure you eat first as it could take you from 1 to 2 hours to see everything.The feeding time is between 15:00 and 15:30 for the most animals and is the time when they are most active.

A fun marine experience. The Oceanário de Lisboa, situated in the Praça das nações Business district of Lisbon. The oceanarium boasts the second best of its kind in the world after Japan. Equipped fully and well maintained by qualified staff, the oceanarium is a fun learning experience for adults and children alike and keeps up to its reputation. Surrounding the oceanarium are malls, restaurants and open parks for cylcing and walking that overlook the marina.

VERY REFRESHING. We went there today in the morning It was ahot day in pperspective so we choose a place we thought it would be great. And we were right. We spend the rest of the morning until we were starving and we totally forget the time passing by.We recommend it strongly

Really great. The main tank is filled with great fish andthe walkingpatch takes you around the main tank (so you get to see it from all angles) through exhibits representing different regions on earth. It was extremely busy though, so buy your tickets online and be sure to go in when the doors open otherwise the crowd will frustrate you.
Fun for the whole family. Great afternoon out for the whole family with amazing sea life, interesting exhibits and a bit of education too!

Book before you go. Me and my boyfriend enjoyed our visit to the aquarium but are so glad we booked in advance as we were able to skip the queue, which was massive by the time we arrived. Would recommend, especially if on the Yellow Bus Tour as there is a stop just outside of the aquarium.
Very Good Spot. Brilliant, dont MISS this, travel as much as you have to , from whereever you are in LiSBON, but visit this place for SURE... you will enjoy each moment of the visit
Great Oceanario. One of the most interesting Oceanarios i ever visited, although quite warm inside. Great shops for souvenirs.

Good day. Oceanario is a great day out especially with kids. It took us around 2 hours to do the whole tour but it depends on your pace. Wouldn't bother with the non permanent exhibitions as the permanent exhibition took a while and it's enough. Quite a big place but I was expecting a bit more to be honest. My expectations were too high.
Must do in lisbon. More special than other aquariums. You can spend more than an our here and have a great time looking at all the beautiful animals

Good choice for families. Good aquarium, not as excellent as Monterey, but recommended for kids & family; close to the airport, thus easy to combine with a flight back and some time left; 5 minutes away from the airport.

Awesome Oceanário! . Smaller than we expected but awesome nonetheless. You can see they did everything right to have the animals live the best way they possible can in a viewers area. The temporary exposition was also worth the ticket price although it might not always be the case so it's a good thing you can pay both individually or combined.

Great for all ages!. As a family traveling with a mixed age range (parents, children and grandparents) finding something for everyone is sometimes a challenge - but the oceanario did it!We all loved it here - there was initially a rather large crowd but we went slowly and they seemed to all disappear so we had lots of time and space to stand in front of the enormous viewing panes and just watch the world swim by! We actually ended up there for ages as we went by slowly just loving what we saw.Out of the five weeks of Europe this was one of my daughters top 5 - which is saying something! Defo recommend if you have kids!Also when we were there, there was a special exhibit of "trees under the sea" or something - it was utterly enchanting and almost meditative with its pretty views and calming music! My only suggestion for the areas is that there is remarkably little to eat nearby or in the oceanario but if you walk over to the far side of the lagoon (where the cable car goes) there were lots of eating options.

Amazing. Hands down my favorite part of our trip. Pay for the temporary exhibit; it is amazing. Full of beautiful tranquil music Fish and an endless Fish habitat. Like no other aquarium... Ever. Very clean and family friendly.

Large Central Tank Display was awesome. Overall this aquarium was not as good as the Monterey Bay Aquarium in California but the way the central tank was viewable from many cubby holes and levels was superior to the Monterey Aquarium. The viewer was able to escape the crowds and quietly become a part of the environment. We visited our first day in Lisbon following a grueling day of travel. Although the six of us from age 7 to 75 were jet lagged, we were very glad we stayed awake long enough to see this great attraction.

Very Unique Experience. I wasn't expecting much, but we were happily surprised. Took photos and videos of my spouse with sharks, humungous ocean sunfish and gigantic rays swimming behind him and overhead in the three to four-story aquarium. We have one in Montréal, but it pales by comparison.

Love this place. This "aquarium" is nothing like the others... they recreated the environnement of every continent and placed some of the most beautiful and/or stunning water animals. In the center there is the big aquarium which is impressive. They also have temporary "exhibitions" (I went to a sea turtle one and it was magnificent)

Great experience for a sea lover!. Spectacular place to spend a day! The central tank is hypnotic with all the big fishes and sharks. It's also very interesting to see other animals from all the oceans. Penguins and sea otters really made my day!

The best Aquarium I have ever been to. . This place is great. New, modern and very easy to navigate. Great place for children. It does get very crowded, but the place handles crowds well. Giving more than one viewing angle. Lots of different species and well organized. Tickets are available online, even outside the ticket office. Also has free WiFi.

Excellent place to visit. The Ocenarium was fantastic. Central aquarium was awesome with all sorts of sealife. It was very interesting to watch most interesting fishes so close. Other tanks are around the building and it is very easy is to move from one spot to other spot.
Okay but not that awesome. I was slightly disappointed - one big tank around which there are two stories of smaller aquariums. Not sure I'd recommend it.

Buy tickets online!. This is a very popular attraction so it is wise to book tickets online, where they are cheaper, paperless and allow you to walk straight into the oceanarium without any queuing! I went to the Oceanario de Lisboa on my own and it made for a good hour's entertainment. The premise of the oceanarium's layout is that all of the oceans are connected and the displays are set out as such that all of the 'zones' radiate from the same central point, which is a thought provoking idea. The large tanks are interesting, with plenty of places to stop and look at the fish and the opportunity to sit down. It is very popular with children and families and so can get pretty busy, but that's to be expected. I wouldn't say that it's somewhere I would feel the need to visit more than once but it was an enjoyable experience.
Nice place for families. Nice place , little bit outside of the centre. Rent a bike to get there. Good place on hot days, especially if you have kids. Outside (but shaded) bistro.

Get out of the heat and check out Oceanario!. Wonderful aquarium with all sorts of sealife. Best in Europe, I would say. Expensive, but really worth it. Take some good walking shoes though because it's massive!

amazing under water world. as part of a citytrip on Lisbon, we visited the Oceanario. It was really a surprise on what was out there. We has seen already a lot of swimming animals, but this was even a big surprise. Very worthwhile to visit!
Well maintained and instructive. Up to something else than historic monuments and buildings? Go here and plunge into an impressive display of nature's wonders.It may be crowded.

very nice. Very exciting experience for a person coming from a country without sea.Tried headphones with audio explanations (for an extra charge) but it was not necessary at all. You need at least 4 hours to see it all.

Very Beautiful Aquarium. Very nice aquarium with giant tanks you can see throughout the facility. It's a little tough to figure out how to get to and we ended up just taking a cab. The mola mola fish is SO COOL. The kids really liked it, but we got through it in about an hour and a half - I kind of wish there were more interactive exhibits. But the park outside is really nice and we took the funicular as well. The area around the Oceanario has a ghost town feel, and while there are a few restaurants, there's not a lot going on. The aquarium itself though, was very nice and we really enjoyed it. If you are with kids, I would highly recommend it.

Great ride into the oceans. Great modern buildingabsolutely fabulous presentation of marine life. The gigantic tank in the centre provides opportunity to reconstruct a fair quality eco system which can be observed from the top to the very bottom. Flying Mantas - absolutely fabulous.We also visited the temporary exhibition which was about an underwater landscapes. Magical underwater garden again presented in a captive way. Overall - magical and educative experience for all

Great facility and lots to sea. We took our kids here and they absolutely loved it. They take great care of their aquarium. It's very large and has lots to see. They have a temporary and permanent exhibit. The temporary one had a Japanese artists work on display and it was very peaceful and beautiful. The permanent one has a large tank that seems to be shared with all the other small tanks off to the side so all the animals can freely swim between habitat zones. I could be wrong, but I think that's how it was laid out, from what I could tell. The central tank has all the big fish(sharks, mantas and some other massive breeds of fish) the side tanks are divided in to habitats ranging from tropical to cold. Our daughters loved watching the sea otters. They give them ice cubes to nibble on and these little guys are hilarious to watch. There is also a science museum right next door so be sure to check that out too. Our little one had a blast there, I think even more fun there than at this aquarium, but just because there were so many hands on things for her to do.

Amazing Nature Experience. Out of seemingly white elephant from the Expo 98..this aquarium is a gem. Unlike the over produced aquariums from the big cities around the world, the oceanarium exhibits are closest reflection of the natural setting. Strongly recommended
not to miss. The architecture of this building is very nice and it was a relaxing experience. Variety of animals and impressively large tanks:)
Best Aquarium. Very interesting place. Huge tank with amazing fish/sharks etc. Good for any age. Get there early - it opened at 1000, but by 1100 there was a huge queue.

Crowded, but good. We went in the afternoon on a Thursday and the place was rather packed. Because most of the permanent exhibit is dark, we had a lot of kids run into us and push us as they tried to get a glance at the animals. Overall, a good experience, but a bit tiring since there were so many people and there were long waits to see some of the animals.
Great place to spend a few hours. I spend an afternoon here with my son (11) and we had a great time. If you are fascinated with the deep ocean and the creatures there you will not be disappointed.

Great day out. Had a fantastic time at Oceanario de Lisboa, such a great range of animals from various fishes to penguins and sea otters. Many animals and fish that I had not seen before which made the visit even better. The whole thing was clear and well labelled for information and routes. Priced very well for attendance and free WiFi was great. We weren't overly impressed by the temporary exhibition while we were there as it was quite small and busy but it did not effect the overall feeling of the place. Highly recommended.

A world class aquarium but choose your time with care. Impressive displays. We especially liked the sea otters and the penguins. But our family went on a particularly busy day, and sometimes we struggled to get close to the fish tanks. So you might want to time your visit to coincide with smaller crowds. Perhaps your hotel concierge can give you advice on this.

Great afternoon out. Had a fantastic time wondering around the aquarium, all centered around the big tank which is full of scary looking fish and sharks. Lots of smaller tanks off the main one with beautiful fish inside, split into the different seas you will find them in. Along with the temporary exhibit. Well worth the money you pay to get in. Buy tickets online to save the long queues and save money.
Great stay at the Oceanario de Lisboa. It was a great pleasure to visit the Oceanario de Lisboa with a lot of fishes. It can be recommended for families even with small children

Refreshing visit. It was nice to spend some time at Oceanario,it worth it , no matter how old are you or if you bring kids or nephews with you or not.Pices of amaizing worlds, linked with the water will be presented to you, fishes and animals and birds, a labirintic zone around central huge aquariumCan't remember the cost as we had Lisboa card and a discount of 15%Not only the Oceanario itself was good to see but also the sorroundings - a space with palmtrees from the bus station up to the entrance, a nice water falling wall, where everybody wanted to pass near, nice coffee shops and snacks(where you can not pay by cards, only cash) and of course all the children positive noise, visiting and beeing amused by every new thing they discovered.A very nice japanese exibition was presented during our visit- visual and acustic stimulation in order to protect the waterAn if you would like to continue this adventure you could go on the shore, get the gondola and survey the space from the air, just up to the Da Gama Monument.
Wow!. There were fish I've never seen before. It was nicely set up. Really an exciting day out. Well worth the time!

An excellent way to spend a morning!. Excellent way to spend a couple of hours! Stunning tank in the middle where all of the oceans meet. Lots of interesting fish and sea creatures. Loved being able to see the Penguins up close too. Information in English as well as Portugese. Reasonable entry price with concessions for seniors. Good facilities. Easy access. Pleasant cafe and shop. Lots to see and do for children and adults.

Enjoyed our visit - Fantastic fresh water aquarium exhibit. I went with my nephews, ages 11 and 14. I'm from Boston where we have an excellent aquarium. This Oceanario seemed a little smaller, but the exhibits were perhaps more beautiful and rated very highly with me with respect to being educational and artistic. The huge fresh water aquarium was super, but I am not sure if it is a permanent exhibit or not, so check.

An experience that is guaranteed to give you a new perspective on ocean life.. Great place to spend a couple of hours. With a very impressive, huge aquarium in the center, this site offers both temporary exhibits and a very fine permanent ditto. Fun for the whole family and a great learning experience.

Nice getaway with kids . The Oceanario is a great place to give your children a boost and refuel them for further sightseeing :). It is not huge and it is very well organized, very eye catching for kids and for parents as well ... Unless this is the 100th similar place you 've visited. If not, no news under the sun : Barcelona, etc. all very similar :)It worth (no, it's a must) buying tickets online: it saves you an hour at least if visiting in prime time .

Oceanarium overpriced.... Oceanarium was in an interesting building, interesting old expo 98 area but 17€/adult was overpriced. Too crowded and most interesting part to us was not the permanent exhibition but the artsy aquarium exhibition. Big shopping center on the way to Oriente metro station and a wine festival in another building.

Outstanding attraction - don't miss the aquarium. Huge aquarium; it's supposed to be the second biggest in the world; huge variety of fish and sea creatures; mesmerizing; you'll want to do nothing but photograph the fish; great price (half or one-third cost of aquariums in U.S.)

Very Good. Really it's worth visiting, besides being one of the biggest I've visited before, I loved the variety and diversity of under water life and how amazing the ocean it's. We enjoyed it very much
Off beaten track. Slightly off the beaten track, but worth heading out of town for - nice area - captivated by the large tank of fish - children will love it
Great half day activity. Very well designed Aqaurium and many interesting things to see. Easy to get from the city centre and more attractions close by.
Amazing. The Oceanario de Lisboa is one of the best oceanariums in europe. Its an amazing place to bring the family.

The Oceans Brought Together In One Place. Arriving in Lisbon on a Sunday, we had few places to visit the following day. Luckily for us, the Oceanarium opens on Mondays and we could spend the day there. Located near the "Parque das Nações" and the "Oriente" subway station, it is easily accessible. There were two exhibitions offered, the permanent and the temporary ones, and we purchased tickets for both of them. Upon entering, we got to see the magnificent central aquarium, which we can certainly say has not found its match. It contains many species of fishes and invertebrates, as if the oceans were brought together in one place. Everything is nicely organised and well marked, with many fun and educational spots for the kids. Apart from the vast variety of fish, we got to see penguins, otters, corals, and frogs - all set in skillfully assembled habitats. The temporary exhibition was called "Forests Underwater", the largest nature aquarium in the world, designed by Japanese aquarist Takashi Amano. The restaurant is also worthwhile, offering reasonably priced meals, drinks, and desserts. At the end of the tour, make sure you have enough money for the gift shop, because it is almost impossible to leave without buying a souvenir.

Beautiful. Always something to do, stop before the big aquarium on different floor a real spectacle, sun fish (called fish Moon in french) are downright blase, did not forget the temporary exhibition currently "Florestas Submersas do japonês Takashi Amano" forest under Navy, of the Japanese Takashi Amano.

Fun time spent looking at the aquarium . Loved it. Even though the aquarium looks really small compared to the other aquariums I've been, it's really big with different areas to explore. Really liked the giant (main) tank in the middle with variety of fishes including sharks, rays and other fishes I've never seen before.We paid €14 each which I thought was reasonable too.

You can easily spend your day there. First, let me say that I have been to a huge aquarium before and was therefore somewhat sceptical if this one would impress me in any way. Secondly, I am not fanatically interested in marine life. Regardless of that I managed to spend half of my day at the Oceanario and thouroughly enjoyed it. It's great that you can see the marine life of different parts of the world (the aquarium is divided into distinct sections; you might need a jacket in the Antarctic section). In the middle you can look at all the different fish in a huge aquarium and just sit on a bench and watch them swimming by. Besides that there are lots of smaller marine animals to see and study. If you take a lunch or snack at the cafe, you'll suddenly discover that you've spent much more time there than originally planned.

Giant fish. There is a central tank with lots of fishes and there are sunfishes as well, they are very big and flat, interesting. It was nice to walk around the water tank and stop for a moment in the niches.

Not so much to see. First i have to advice to buy tickets online. We did that and could walk through The crowd. The oceanarium is big, but not that much to see. Of course The otter and penguins were cool to see but The rest was a little boring. Wish there was seals there.

Wish I lived in Lisbon just to go here every month. I really enjoy coming here.Lisbon is such an old city full of history and I really appreciate this new modern building near the water. It doesn't stick out like a sore thumb and the inside is very well organized. I really enjoy how they have the fish divided and how things are explained.

Nice. It was full of colours. I really liked it. Don't miss a chance to go there. The only thing is that you need to stand in a big line to buy the tickets so if you can better buy the tickets online.
Fun place for a family. It was a lovely aquarium. It isn't too big. It was a little overpriced and don't bother to get the temporary exhibit.

Worth a visit. I stopped in here today and had a really good time. There's lots of rare fish and other animals, which you won't see at many other places. You can get up close with the penguins as well.My only complaint would be that I felt the individual admission price of €17 was a little high. The family admission provides a better value at €44.

Fun for all the family.. Price is a little high for an aquarium but the tank is huge and has a wide variety of marine life. The penguins and otters were my favourite. There is an extra exhibition that is €4 extra but it was not really worth it to be honest, note this exhibition changes so it may get better/worse.

Still as good second time around. First visited 9 years ago and loved it then - the central part never fails to impress and fact you see it constantly almost throughout the 2 floors is a bonus. You find yourself just getting lost in a moment staring at the Sharks or rays or Sun Fish - a great place for kids, and big kids

Must see in Lisbon/Portugal. I've been to Lisbon for the second time, but I discovered this place rather accidantely, it's little out of the center, but it's 100% worth visiting!
The primary attraction is huge acquarium with sharks, stingrays and other animals. Plus two sections with pinguins and particulary otters are real fun!

Great place. Great place to spend a few hours when in Lisbon. Expect a lot of people in the weekends, to avoid the queue you can buy tickets online in advance. The place has a stunning collection of marine animals and you will not be disappointed if that's what your're looking for. Would recommend to visit the place at noon, to escape the heat as well as spending your time well
perfect to enjoy marine life. very nice, amazingly huge, perfectly maintained and mesmerizing experience. enjoy with kids and spend time. be careful for train timetable to commute.

A must see!. Went their by Metro (Oriente station). Very cool place, both children & grown ups will enjoy this one. A great way spending 1-1.5 hours. After the visit you can jump over to the near Vasco de Gama shopping mall.

A great experience. Best to book online first and save time with the Qs and save 10 per cent on the price. An excellent exhibition and well organized route through the oceanarium really helped with the school holiday crowd. Very friendly and knowledgeable attendants. A great way to spend half a day

Fantastic visit. Lots of different types of fish and sea life, with interactive areas for kids and adults, to reflect on the environmental damage we are doing to the planet and ways to be more eco conscience.

Wonderful place. It's a really wonderful place to go with children ore friends - so much new and interesting information and amazing pieces of art , installations and of course the oceanario creatures and all underwater flora and fauna . I was amused by the way it's done and been introduced to the way for example Penguins are living and other animals and fishes

Great aquarium. Very nice aquarium! The temporary underwater forest exhibit was amazing. It only takes about 2 hours to make it through and our girls really enjoyed themselves. A nice break from site seeing. We had lunch there and the food was really good. Tickets were a good price. Definitely worth taking some time and going to visit.
day visit. Compared to other aquariums this was an excellent experience and really good value for money. It coincided with some nice shopping and an easy place to get something to eat

Great place to go with friends or family. It's just an unbelievable place to be in. If you never visited something of this sort, you'll be amazed with it.
Highly recommended if you're nearby.
Very expensive but impresive. I love the sea, i love the aquariums. This is one of the largest in Europe. Pretty awesome, i recommend the temporary exhibition, its fascinating. And the octopus!

Great place to watch fish from all over the world. We purchased out tickets at the venue and found the queue quickly disappeared and the buying process was efficient. This is huge Aquarium with fish from all over the world, from all the oceans in actual fact. Is it very well designed and allows us to see the beauty that surrounds the fish. I was very surprised to also see penguins, yes penguins, puffins and otters in the other pools. It is also an excellent place to spend an afternoon away from the heat when the temperature outside reads over 30 degrees.

Awesome. An awesome experience not to be missed! The aquarium is huge and is 2 storeys high. It is jam packed with an amazing diversity of species including sharks, manta ray and sun fish. There are different zones at each corner representing the worlds oceans each housing something special including penguins, puffins and our favourite the sea otters. We spent about 3 hours here and could easily have stayed longer. Also it's nice and cool inside especially welcome on searingly hot days.

Best thing in Lisbon except for eating. If you are even remotely interested in marine life, you must go here. It is hard to not spend hours just staring into one of the many windows into the main fish tank. Take you family, take your friends, heck, take everyone you know. They'll thank you.
Insight into the world's oceans. Fascinating views of the world's oceans in wonderful surroundingsThe queue to get in about lunchtime was quite long but I was surprised how quickly it moved.

Amazing!. I had heard a lot about Oceanario, so when I found the opportunity I took it. Firstly the building was nice with a modern touch in a modern new neighborhood, overlooking Tejo River. Then the permanent exhibition of a vast variety of animals, divided into the natural environment they inhabited, is surrounded by a huge tank with impressive species like sharks. Definitely a place to go and have a moment of relaxation, being surrounded by all this "natural" beauty. A little on the expensive side, but totally worth it. A great must see of Lisbon!

Biggest bullsh*** ever. During our trip through Portugal we stayed in Lisbona for 5 days and dedicated one day to visit this "so-called worlds best" aquarium. We decided to do so, based on the tripadvisor list of 2015 "best aquariums in the world". Oceanario was #1 and therefore we were expecting really something special. Aside from main tank aquarium in general was a big disappointment as there were no live shows, no live feeding, no dolphines, no sharks, no outdoor activities, very bad level of cleanliness and slightly smelly ect..We don't recommend visiting and especially it's not worth 15€/person!

Feel in another word. The Oceanario in Lisboa is really worth visiting. Very interesting presentation. You feel, like being in the ocean. Nice smaller aquarium with very colorful fishes and others. Time passes very quickly, as you are very fascinated.

A must for children. it's a few hours well spent. A must do especially with children. The staff are nice. The layout is easy and very informative. The fish and other sea inhabitants are beautiful to watch. Note that upon entering the exhibit areas you will smell very stale fishy air.

Amazing experience. It was an amazing experience to see the wildlife of the ocean. The four little and one huge pools are full of fishes, sharks. I would recommend the oceanario for everyone, not only for children.

Mesmerised by the underwaterworld. While going around in circles, you see the natural habitat of wonderful sealife, such as sunfish, shark, baracuda's and stingrays. I had a great time admiring all the salie, reliving the many dives I've made in my life worldwide. When I returned home I discovered that Oceanario Lisboa is ratel nr. 1, best aquarium 2015. It made me realise even more how special my visit here was.

Amusing. Nice place with a variety of animals. Special attraction is pool with sharks where there are divers very often. They are divided in the separate box, out of sharks, but it is not possible to see it. So, it looks like they are next to sharks.

Entertaining. I was fascinated by diversity of species which I observed there. The time ran so fast while walking through its premises. Had a discount of about 15% on ticket as owner of Lisboa card which I bought in the airport.
very nice!. very nice palce to visit. for adults too. wide display of sea life.the cable cart outside the ocenario is great also,

All oceans at once. We enjoyed our visit at the Lisboa Oceanario - which is in fact an aquarium as far as I'm concerned. It's main difference is the way it presents fishes from all oceans around a huge central tank well organised. It's not the best aquarium we've seen (take a look at the New England aquarium) but it's still nice to visit. If you can, use public transport because parking is a mess!

Excellent sea life zoo. I love aquatic live and I have visited many places like San Diego sea life or Valencia Oceanographic. This is much better. I think that the staff are real biologists. The shark tank is vertical, not a tunnel like in most aquariums. I think that animals are treated with much more respect than in other places. I highly recommend the visit.

Oceanario Lisboa. Nice place to visit in family and pass a quiet an nice afternoon , see animals in they're environment and habitat . Divided in four continents . amazing central aquarium here you can see several species interacting .

Great for a rainy or very sunny day!. The oceanario was superb, it's a real great day out for families. There is an option to buy tickets online and you can even buy them on the free wifi beside the oceanario, my advice is to do this rather than stand in the queue. There was the usual tripping over school tours and packed areas but once you got over that it was a great experience.

Superb !!!. One of the world's largest aquariums, it rises from the river and is reached by a footbridge. It is like a deep-sea diving experience without any of the risks, with about 25,000 fish, seabirds, and mammals in an enormous central tank that is the size of four Olympic-sized swimming pools. Visitors can look into it from different levels for close-ups of the various creatures, including different species of sharks. But it's the design rather than the size that makes it outstanding. It is the first aquarium ever to incorporate world ocean habitats within a single environment, with impressive recreations of various ocean ecosystems -- the Antarctic tank containing penguins, and the Pacific tank with otters playing in rock pools. Must see !!!

Magical. Lisbon is a place to be, very affordable with the Oceania very wonderful,a lot if not all water body species. A wonderful night life in the center with street live band, it's almost like the whole town is dancing in the evening. Traditional dishes are a must taste and very old wine

Very impressive aquarium. We have been to many aquariums, this one is very impressive. When we went there, took elevator to the top and walk down to save energy. One floor with huge fresh water tank sounding the whole room, designed by the Japanese nature photographer, bring the nature with Japanese garden philosophy into the tank, it is a shucking scale and beauty. The vast central tank with variety of fish co-exist peacefully. We took subway from Bairro Alto and Estrela toward airport direction, get off at beautiful Oriente Station, walk through the shopping center located across the station, toward 1998 Expo. site behind the center, present walking distance to get to the aquarium. After visit the place, you may want to go back to the shopping center to have a meal and rest, there are all different kinds of food there.

Excellent experience. It's an amazing place for all ages. Well organised, and the staff are helpful. Also has a good wi-fi connection which helps propagating the place. Really loved the experience. Totally prepared for all types of public. Children love it.

Normal visit. Not a peculiar place to visit ! It's OK of you're passionate with fish and aquarium but it's not so good if you think this oceanarium is the best you have ever seen! I suggest you to spend your day somewhere else
Excellent Oceanario. Well worth a visit, many different fish from around the world's oceans along with a few other animals. Kids seemed to really enjoy as well. We recommend.

Superb!. We drove up from the Algarve to Lisbon and this was one of a couple of things we chose to do. Give yourself at least half a day here as there is loads to see. The central aquarium tank that everything is built round being the highlight, this is the best fish tank we have ever seen, my son absolutely loved it. Sharks, stingrays, tuna, penguins, puffins.......

Worth the $14 euro entrance. It is an aquarium , not sure how it has been voted the best in the world. Sea World in Queensland and the aquarium in Melbourne have arguably more diverse choice of sea creatures and more actual " touch " opportunities. Don't get me wrong it is pleasant but in my humble opinion not much different to other aquariums around the world.

Best dive ever. Amazing place to visit! Very peaceful and so beautiful... You will feel like you are diving in the ocean with all these wonderful creatures.Best way to spend the afternoon with the familiy!
Superb. Be sure that your mobile battery is fully charged and you have enough memory to record/photo what you see! It will be a pitty otherwise. The same applies to your camera.
Well worth the effort.. Our kids loved it. A nice place to spend a day out in Lisbon. Not to crowded. A lot of things to look at. also good for learning. Sharks and Otters were the highlights.
Good fun. It is a great experience visiting the aqarium, we spent a good two hours inside. We got tickets online wich gives you 10% discount. The otters are adorable!

A bit overrated but nice experience. We visited the Oceanario based on the reviews here on tripadvisor. I won't say that I'm disappointed, but definitely expected more. The impressive part is the huge pool which is the center of the building with loads of fish. But the side aquariums could be better, more interesting. And if the place is crowded (which it was) you can barely see anything unless you "fight" your way to the glasses.I would say if you are with kids, have plenty of time or never been in an Oceanarium, then go and visit the place. Otherwise there are more exciting things to see in Lisbon.

Marvellous unexpected site. Most unexpected pleasure. well worth a visit. They had a special exhibit by a Japanese aquarium designer and he produced the most marvellous formal aquarium I have ever seen.

Perfect for kids. Lisbon is a great city and lots of fun and perfect food, but this time I was traveling with my little sister and cousins (aged 5,6,9,10) and Lisbon was one of the European cities where it was the hardest to find something fun and convenient for both us and the kids, so obviously when someone mention the Oceanario we were on board, and I got to say is the coolest place, the kids had fun and I had the time of my life with the otters, if you like wild life or even just architecture y recommend it, is a very beautiful place with tons of sea life and you can see it all in about half a day so maybe afterward you can go see the sunset at Belem tower, Belem is not too far away but if you're taking the city sight buses plan a little bit ahead cause the Oceanario is on the less traveled route so it takes a while for the buses to pick you up, in our case we where waiting for a whole hour and then decided to take a cab.

Very interesting place. In the middle of the building there is a large aquarium which you can watch from 2 levels. Very nice. Don't stay on the first place near the window you find. There are many more and not so crowded. You can find a place for you alone. So many different fishes. Very nice. Maybe - outside - they shoul put a nice photo on the walls of the building...

Fishes from all the Oceans. We spent here a half of the day, watching the high diversity of fishes from all the oceans. Especially bright fishes are from the Indian ocean + there were some small pinguins, otters etc. I would recommend to go here for relax or if you have a kids - they will like all these fishes!

One of the Best!. We spent several hours in he Oceanario de Lisboa, the aquarium of Lisbon. It was an incredible experience! We have seen a few aquariums in our time, but this was probably the best. Our favourite part was the giant aquarium that could be viewed from two floors and several angles. The giant Sunfish were a species I had never seen before. We stood there for hours, just watching the fish. They also have a very interesting film that provides some behind the scenes information about the operations of the aquarium. A good way to spend a day!

The Real Deal. The central tank with that big moon fish, sharks, turtles, rays, tunas, WOW! I love to seat on the floor and just watch the fishes hanging around. Several other temporary expositions/aquariums it's superb! I truly recommend
The best aquarium!. Super!!! Best aquarium I've ever visited! Large main tank, clean both on the inside and on the outside, lots of species to watch from lots of different angles.

Really nice way to spend a cloudy afternoon . The weather was not great on the day we decided to go to the oceanario so it was a perfect place. The cost for 2 of us was €28 which isn't bad compared with other Aquariums in the world. We spend a good 1.5 hours walking around and saw some amazing fish and other creatures. Highlight by far was the otters (so cute!) and that in itself was worth the €28! Would be quite expensive to take a whole family here but if you are looking for something to do indoors for a while - this is perfect!

The best Aquarium in the world. Trully a must see when visiting Lisbon. Both the zone where it is located and the aquarium itself present visitors with a fantastic experience while exploring the world's different oceans.

must see. this was a very fun and educational visit. My 11 year old son loved it. Coming from Hawaii we are very interested in sea life and its preservation. I enjoyed the educational aspect and the sea otters...so adorable!
Our 10 month old loved it. Loved the visit but not the tourists who crowd everything even in front of the baby. Great place to visit marine life from all of the Earths oceans! A must!

So tranquil!. Such an amazing place to visit, the aquarium is spotless! you are constantly wowing throughout the tour! A bit pricey at 15 euro a student (make sure to ask if for student prices if you are a student as they do not specify on the price list) however well worth it! The most unusual fish that you wouldn't see in any old aquarium. well worth a visit!!
Best aquarium in town!. This is by far the coolest "aquarium" in Lisbon. There is so much to see! It is a bit pricey, but totally worth it IMO.

Awesome experience!. My wife and I have tried to visit different aquariums everywhere we go and this has been the best one. This aquarium has little habitats with the different animal life for each of the world's oceans. The cost to get in is 14€ without the temporary exhibit and 17€ with the temp. exhibit.

great place to go!. The most amazing place!It so great to see these big fish in the water.I feel, I am swimming on the ocean with sharks, stingrays and other big fishes!It is a must go, when you are in Lisbon!

Great fun for small children . Went there with 3 and 6 year old. Was great fun,especially the construction site which allowed parents to relax in sofa while the kids relentlessly played. Combine it with a visit to the Acquarium and lunch at the Hippotatamus restaurant, and you have a full day.
Wonderful place. I felt like a kid again. It was very nice to be able to see, so close, so many species. Fun and interesting for kids but in the same time for adults.
Great day out . Was a nice change from the usual tourist attractions outdoors, could get lost in the views for hours. Would recommend for all ages

Oceanario visit. Well worth a visit to see, particularly with kids under 10 years old. Make sure to examine all the extras, i.e. video shows, interactive exhibits etc. A number of nice restaurants close by as well.

Breathtakingly amazing. The world's best aquarium.. After missing this the last time I was in Lisbon, there was no making the same mistake twice.The Oceanario is just amazing. 8 million liters of sea water, 360 views, and surrounding the central tank are all the world's ocean habitats, from Arctic to tropical, with area specific flora and fauna. Sharks, rays, otters and more. Prepare to spend at least 3-4 hours, more if you're going to learn about everything. As a bonus, the Oceanario is located right at the waterfront at the former Expo site, so there's plenty of restaurants well worth your while.ä - and a very large shopping mall nearby, at the oriente railway station.Ps. Take a ride on the cable car first, then visit the Oceanario. And prepare to spend €€ at the gift shop.
Must se aquarium for aficionados. Maybe not the biggest but one of the best I've seen. The building it self is fantastic and the tanks are a wonderfull display with a very high quality of collection.

Great location for kids. Need half a day to visit the Ocenario but it is lovely, educational and the kids will enjoy it. The casino, vasco da gama mall is close to the Ocenario. There are several restaurants around the area for food. The Oriente Metro is also very close by.

The best Oceanarium in the world!. This indeed is the best Oceanarium in the world.My God, just every possible underwater creature is there. What a great learning experience to see the sharks, rays and 1000's of other creatures. My 2 years old daughter loved it and so did her grown up parents :).Highly recommend to anyone in Lisbon for few days.
Amazing place to visit!. The Ocenario aquarium is placed near the shore on the water with a beautiful scenario. A lot to see and experience about sea life. Worth to see if you travel to Lisbon.
Wanted to stay all day!. Amazing aquarium that mesmerized our family! Highly recommended..spent 3 hours there..enjoy! Great for all ages

MUST SEE, Puffins, penguins, otters, FISH!. This Oceanario in a newer developed area of Lisbon is a very close #2 to Singapore's Sentosa aquarium. There is a very well done penguin exhibit and another area with puffins & otters. Of course the huge fish tank is impressive also with viewing areas from all sides.
Great place. One of my favourite places, beautiful place great value for your money, was there with my family, my sim 14 loves the place

Fun and interesting. Oceanarium was very enjoyable. Penguin exhi its were really nice, you can really get close to the penguins, and take nice pictures. The main fish tank is also nice, with all sorts of stingrays, small sharks, and other sorts. We saw a lot of species I havent encountered before, which was interesting. The temporary exhibit of "underwater forest" was completely lame, boring and an absolute waste of the 3 euros it cost.

Nice even just for a walk around the grounds. The grounds of the aquarium are among the best parts! It's a little out of the city centre, but easy enough to get to on the metro. It has a really neat sustainable oceans theme. Coming from Vancouver (with the Vancouver Aquarium) we were somewhat underwhelmed, nevertheless its definitely worth the trip.
Nice experience. This was a very nice experience in Lisbon. The Oceanario is very big and there is a lot to see. I recommend.

wonderful. Well set out. We spent two hours there. We will go back. Very peaceful and soothing. Some visitors have complained that it is too small but having nothing to compare it with apart from aquariums, which are different, we thought it beautiful.

worth the visit. amazing aquarium. Price a little steep for a 2 hour visit, but knowing how much fish cost to keep, well worth it. Lots of kids, and sometimes hard to see, but if you have time you can wait around and see some huge and exotic fish.

Great place to take the children. This is a great place. You could spend hours just sitting on a seat next to the big central tank watching all the fish in it go past you. And then there are the otters that I could just spend hours watching. It has a cafeteria with basics, so if you want to get some lunch, as wee did, you can. Nothing spectacular, but edible, and good value.The temporary exibition (Forests Underwater) was also excelent.Recommend this place, especially if you have little people in your family.They have free wifi, in the cafeteria and lobby area, but not inside the temporary exhibition or the main building.
Such an amazing place!!!. Don't miss the best sight in Lisbon (Espacially for families with kids!), 2 Minutes walking from the Excellent Vasco da Gama Mall!!

A wonderful amusement not only for kids. In the new district of Oriente, where the 1998 Expo took place, the aquarium is amazing. Second largest in Europe, one can discover all different kind of fauna according to their original living place, from Antartica to coral reefs. Staff is very helpful and kids but also adults enjoyed their visit when I was there.After the visit, there is a nice Brazilian restaurant offering picanha meat in the style "eat as much as you want" for a very affordable price.
Nice. The place is very big and nice collections... we loved most the Otter ... a lovely sea animal very smart and enjoyment to watch

Impressive. This is one of the most impressive aquariums i’ve been to. It’s in a building built over the water. At the heart of it is a vast tank. There’s a lot to see; we split our visit over lunch. The cafe is a nice space, though the food isn’t all that special. As you go into the aquarium and show your ticket, make sure you get your hand stamped so you can go out and come back in. The shop is also very good. My only criticism is that, once inside the aquarium, it’s not easy to get out or find toilets; this is something of a pain if your child needs changing or feeding.

Peaceful. A very nice and peaceful break in the city !
Especially during the week.
Beautiful fishes and great set up.
For the whole family.

Great for families with children age 5-10. Nice aquarium with many interesting species to see. A bit far from city center. A great attraction after you have seen most of the historical sites or if you have children. Not a must go attraction otherwise.
Excellent, well organized, not too crowded. Wonderful . Architecture amazing; especially the big central pool is astounding.The giant sun fish was our favorite of all species seen :)

Good, but crowded. Visited with a four year old and it was easily worth the visit even with a 45 Euro price tag for a family.Especially the huge center tank and their "One Ocean" idea was great. Try to sit down and spend some minutes just watching. There is so much going on that just passing by will not give the best experience.It was a little crowded on a Saturday morning, but not more than that it was possible to get a good impression. Maybe an idea to go during the week if possible?
Oceanario. I've spent there almost 2h and it was very nice xp. Also i have a lot memorable pics. It is a little bit further from the centrum but it is worth it.

This is the best Aquarium I have ever seen!. I have been an aquarium enthusiast for many years and even have had a salt water reef tank in my home but the Oceanario blows away everything I have seen before away. We started with the temporary exhibition which was designed and implemented by a photographic artist. It was magic! The entire large room was surrounded on 3 sides by large aquaria filled with water plants and designed to look like several gardens full of greenery of different shapes and shades of colour with the water movement moving the branches as if they were in a breeze and the colourful fish seemed to replace butterflies and other insects. We were entranced! The music in the room for perfectly. The permanent exhibition is massive and is made up of multiple aquaria (all extremely large-huge) surrounding a central, utterly massive main tank. Each of the separate areas represent one of the earths seas with aquatic life appropriate to that sea in it. The main tank is unbelievably large( I need to look up what volume but haven't yet) and contains thousands of fish, sharks, corals, sponges and other marine life. It includes 2 big (and I mean big) sunfish, many varieties of shark, at least 1 manta ray, lots of other rays of different species groupers, cod and etcetera. If I lived in Lisbon I would be visiting frequently. This is a visit worthwhile for any age including toddlers as much of the display is floor to ceiling glass.

Loved it. The exhibitions here are arranged fantastically, the range of different animals is incredible, all animals seem happy and healthy, displays are informative and thought-provoking, great value for money, free wifi, easy to get to from the oriente metro station, in a lovely area which is worth having a look around, really nice place for a day out

Oceanário, the sea so close to us. It's a beautiful exhibition with a lot of different species. What I enjoyed the most was watching the penguins and the otters. They are so funny. I really enjoyed it!

Fantastic - returned 13years later. Spent a good few hours here today. Booked online before we left for the day which, while saved us around €8 for 4 of us, the biggest benefit was jumping the long queue for tickets ( used smartphone to show tickets ) One of the best aquariums we've been too. Great set up amazing display with weird and wonderful sea creatures. Would recommend and can see why the number 1 attraction.Great place to visit even without children -i was the youngest in our group at 34! Shop wasn't over priced either.

Great panorama with kids or teens. The aquarium is really well done in a nice neighborhood where the international exposition of Lisbon was held. There was a temporary exhibition that is really amazing and is a must. It is a underwater universe made by a Japanese artist. The set up, music and display are absolutely marvelous. Don't miss.

an entertaining afternoon. We went here on a Sunday, expecting a crowd of people and long queues and were pleasantly surprised: it was almost empty when we got there. the layout and aquariums were beautiful, my only objection would be that the area for the penguins was way too small.
beautiful exhibition. Very well organized, beautiful exhibition and very well preserved.The scenery makes you feel like you are underwater
Fun. The Oceanário has a lovely variety. I went with a friend and we learned a lot that day, without it ever getting boring. I think this is very nive for kids as well.

Impressive experience. We spent 2 hours with teenagers in Oceanario. So far the best "aquarium" visited. Can be quite crowded at some times. Most people stop in front of the first "window", but move on, you'll see the same view in several places, because the central aquarium is round... remember to take camera.

Beautiful Beyond Words. If you are in Lisbon, Portugal you must go to this aquarium. They have so many exhibits to see and currently their underwater forests exhibit is amazing. The variety of fish and plant life is beautiful. My friends and I spent three hours there. They have a great gift shop and some restaurants. We also went on a lift ride that's at the lower level of the aquarium and got to see the Mediterranean from the sky. It was so amazing. Loved it!
So many oceans!. I love the layout and concept of the Ocenario. I felt emerged in different climates and I was able to see so many animals I have never heard of. I'm glad I went. Definitely worth it.
Brilliant Oceanaria. Went on the on/off bus tour.Great location and value for money.Spent three hours there for 11 euros.

Fresh piece of experience. I strongly recommend this visit in Lisbon. Apart from being the most beautiful institution, with great architecture, view, highest level of nature representation, great species, there is also a new even going on now: "Forests Underwater” - the world’s largest “nature aquarium” the new giant exposition by the Japanese genius Takashi Amano.

Huge aquarium with really good temporary exhibitions. The main tank is huge and you can see into each from each side on two floors. Lots of other tanks and pools to view as well.If the temporary 'underwater forests' exhibition is on go and see that as it's really impressive

It is like a real dive!. Nice, interesting and it is very good organized! It is made a Very smart combination of big aquarium and small "pieces of nature", where Island birds live or otter.Amazing.I am sure it would be great for the children also!

Fabulous!. We left this for our last day with an evening flight back home to London. Stopped off at Oriente, just a couple of Metro stations short of the airport, and spent a very enjoyable couple of hours at the Oceanarium. Absolutely fabulous experience. Excellent free facilities for looking after luggage. The Sun Fish is amazing - never seen one before and can't imagine how such a creature evolved
FISHES EVERYWHERE. The otters were so cute, the main aquarium is awesome, not very expensive. Many different fishes, also pinguins and birds. A must do in Lisbon.

Amazing!! Great place for families, singles and groups. Loved this aquarium, lots of photo opportunities. Great value for admission fee. Outside you can take gondola ride 10 minutes each way, go round trip or one way (cost 3 to 5+ euro). Beautiful walkways on grounds. Aquarium had many sections and lots of educational signs. Temporary exhibit of rainforest well worth it. Spent 2 hours. Towards the end of the exhibit in the dark bottom floor on a busy Sunday we had enough...it got alittle close, however we loved the overall experience.

Go diving without even getting wet!. an excellent attraction. Well kept and well organised. If you are a diver the large tanks with the Sharks enable you to get up close and personal without the danger. Suitable for all ages.
Well worth a visit. Great aquarium, well designed and plenty of space for all the creatures. Displays are beautiful and you could spend hours just looking at the large tank. Kids loved it.
simply the best. It's an excelent place to bring kids, learn about wild life, see ocean specimens you wont see other way

bus tour. We went on the blue line hop on hop off Bus tour and planned our stop at the Oceanario,well worth the stop(discount with your bus ticket)it take approx 1.30 hours to walk around giving out great information as you walk round.

Visit highlight. If you like nature, if you like to know more about 70% of our planet, you cannot miss it. Beautifull, well build. Does not matter if you are young, old or a child, as long as you enjoy the sea, this is the pleace to visit when you came to Lisboa.

Worth The Money . Amazing aquarium with a lot on show covering the earths major oceans. There is a wide selection of fish on show, aswell as birds and sea otters. There is also some very interesting conservation and sustainable living information present. The temporary exhibit at the time of visiting was a very peaceful and enjoyable representation of underwater forests, but I would not pay for this individually due to it's length.

SUNFISH in the main tank ! . It was perfect decision to take a bus 728 and go to see this attraction. We have relaxed at many points especially around the main tank, so finally it took almost 3 hours for us to go through all this exhibition. I have never seen the Sunfish before - it is really something to look at this creature from 1m distance. I guess only in Lisbon and several few aquariums in the world you can see this fish. Definitely recommended trip.

You could spend hours and hours just watching. The whole oceanarium is divided into four parts, by four different habitats for oceans: Antarctic, Atlantic, Pacific and tropical Indian Ocean.It is really popular to spend even many hours just enjoying the view and relaxing. And I'm not surprised, because most of the tanks is amazing. Luckily, it is possible to find a sitting place with a view at the tank.The only disadvantage is a loads of school groups visiting the oceanarium because they usually make a lot of noise.
Good place to take the kids. Slight let down after being told how amazing it was.. But, it is a great place to take kids with a superb range of sea life.

Nice aquarium. This is a very nice aquarium - I wouldn't say the best in the world but good. They have a huge tank with some very large sunfish floating around among lots of other fish and sharks. I always wonder how they keep them all from eating each other... Anyway, they have exhibits of species from all the oceans. They also have some puffin birds and penguins. The river around the building - kind of like a moat effect, unfortunately has garbage floating in it. I don't know why they don't keep that clean. That being said, I did see every huge jelly fish in the river when I was walking up the walkway to the entrance. I think it is worth the time to visit.
A well-designed aquarium. Well thought out, good exhibits. Visit later in the day after school groups have left. Take the cable car before or after you visit.
a oceano in Lisboa. Its a nice place in Lisboa, if you like animals and sea live you can have a very nice time in this place.

A lovely place to take the kids. I spent a very nice afternoon at the Oceanário.Their collection is very impressive, but it should have more information about the different species.A good attraction to visit in Lisbon!

A must see in Lisbon. Absolutely gorgeous location in the area of the expo 98, the oceanarium provides a wonderful day out for all the family, easy access from the oriente metro station. So many diferent maritime species to see, loved it.

Lisbon - sun fish extravaganza at aquarium. Superb range of sealife. The sun fish was the weirdest sight to see so huge. If you get time when In Lisbon this to me is a must do. Very interesting. Incredible venue
Great spot. Great spot - six different aquariums, a huge central tank and a great temporary exhibition. Very enjoyable, with or without kids in tow.

Pretty, but pathetically uninformative. If you want to see pretty animals, then GO! If you want to learn something, don't bother. It's a pretty impressive collection in a very logical layout (making walking through the exhibit easy), but there are very few signs, and the few signs that are there have very little information (and no QR codes for more info). Right from the start you're given a beautiful view of the main tank, but without a single sign telling you anything about what you're seeing. Later in the tour you'll pass by 8 main views of this same tank, and a few of them do have signs identifying a few of the fish in the tank, but this is pretty representative of the whole place: alarmingly uninformative. Unless you happen to know the name of the animal and can google it on your phone, you're not going to learn anything here. It almost seems as if their main goal is to teach people that animals in cages are pretty. I prefer zoos and aquaria that focus more on conservation and education.

Cool fish tank(s). We (10, 12, 39 years and baby) were excited to go there, but were kind of surprised it wasn't bigger (guess we might be spoiled).
Our favourite were the sea dragons!
Go see!. So well done - the central tank is amazing and the surrounding habitats are extremely well done. The restaurant is excellent value as well.

For all ages. A very nice layout for an aquarium. Delightful for all ages, lots to see. Highly recommend taking the gondola ride from the Ocenario to the Expo Center, a nice ride with the opportunity to see the beautiful shoreline.

2nd largest in the world. A must see if you have extra time after seeing the most interesting and historical places in Lisbon. Located in an area nearby the area where there was an expo in 1998. It has been a while but the area still looks modern. There is a nice and modern shopping mall nearby and great restaurants facing the beachfront besides a nice botanical garden and suspended transportation with nice views. The Oceanario is similar to others around the world where the visitors walk under and around a huge water tank full of sharks and other exotic sea creatures. Great for kids. The place closes early though so better visit it in the morning

It was great!!!. For someone whose own country doesn't have a sea, it is such a unique exprerience to walk between sharks and other ocean inhabitants! We loved every minute of our stay there! It is a very well made oceanario, really enjoyable, I recommend everyone to visit it while in Lisbon.

Excellent educational facility.. Normally not interested in these types of places but this was an option to get out of the intense heat! Gladly it was very good. The Oceanario is situated out of Lisbon on the Expo site. A tip; don't catch the bus that goes via anywhere except straight to the Expo site. We were on a hot bus with no air con for over an hour. Inside, the route is centred around a main aquarium with some pretty huge fish inside. You follow the route around areas replicating various temperate regions from around the world.The information given in Portuguese and English is just enough to keep you informed.A short film show at the end is very interesting. It tells you how much work goes on behind the scenes of this excellent facility.Well worth a trip

walking between sharks and sun fishes. We spent many hours with our daughter and nice discovering the ocean life we enjoyed the oceanario as much as our daughter and nice it is an atraction worthy visiting

Quite disappointing. I was really looking forward to visiting the Oceanario in Lisbon as I love aquariums. I especially loved the Oceanografic in Valencia earlier this year where I spent the whole day, and when hearing this was one of the other larger aquariums in Europe, I had high expectations.There is no entry ticket for students, instead I had to pay the full 17€, which I thought wouldn't be so bad, including the temporary exhibition. However, I feel that the price is overpriced, I managed to walk around everywhere in 35 minutes and left feeling deflated. As there is only one pathway through the aquarium, you can't choose where to go first and it was a shame as certain areas were overcrowded and it made the experience less enjoyable and made me want to move on, but with little chance of going back.I'm surprised TripAdvisor has this rated as the top activity in Lisbon, as there are so many other amazing things to see and do in this city.

Great place to spend a couple of hours. We decided to visit here as we like aquariums and the weather forecast was to be desired! We had a good time meandering around, looking at the fish and reading the explanation boards. There were many families with young children, but is enough to keep adults amused for a while. I'd recommend it - especially if you want to see something different/escape the weather.
Great experience. Perfect for all ages and educational around the entire aquarium. Also a good place to go if its really hot/rainy as its al inside.
Amazing. One of the biggest aquariums in Europe. Excellent place to go with the kids and be amazed with the variety of sea life.
Wonderfull experience. Oceanario de Lisboa is a wonderfull place to visit!!! In same bug aquarium so much diverse fishes and seas life!!! If you are in Lisboa you just must visit it
Lovely . The most amazing aquarium in the world, definitely worth a visit you won't regret it. Will definitely be back very soon.
impressive diversity of fish. Great if you like eveything about the ocean. Really a LOT of different species of fish you can see up close. Young kids go crazy overthere.

Do not miss watching the penguins fly underwater. This is a very impressive aquarium, absolutely worth visiting even if you've seen two dozen aquariums before. Do not miss watching the penguins dive, from the lower level below their above-water enclosure.

I can see why it's rated so highly.... This aquarium was great. Huge itself but not overcrowded, and gorgeous well maintained tanks. We also saw birds and otters on exhibit. The main tank was mezmerizing, but the smaller tanks held their own. Its a must see.

Huge and well organised Oceanario. On the last day of our trip we reached sharp at 9 in the morning and purchased ticket in the first lot. It's huge having very good collection and arranged quite nicely all it's collections. You feel as if doing sea walk at times. We spent about two hours but this place need at least 4 hours to cover fully.

nothing special. expensive not worth while, unless you have kids
i really didn't like it,
ps if you go, dont bother bringing camera

Transported to the Oceans. What a delightful place. Arriving by cable car you can hardly believe the building will contain as much as it does. Your path through the complex is guided by arrows. You travel from above the water to various ocean levels and through various oceans. Plenty of places to sit and watch the ocean 'tv'. A must visit.

Marine Magic!. An amazing oceanarium with the objectives of conservation, education and entertainment of the mysteries and wonders of marine life. The centre piece giant aquarium houses a huge variety of marine animals and our favourite are the weird and wonderful sunfish, graceful manta rays hovering around like alien spacecrafts, fearsome sharks, the comical penguins, the cute otters and the colourful anemones with 'nemos" or clown fish darting in and out of them just like in the wild ocean. It is in the new town of Lisbon but well served by the metro.

Amazing place. If you like marine life this is a top attraction for you! Temporary exposition of Takashi Amano is breathtaking! I've never seen something like this before! Its worth seeing and penguins and otters are lovely too.

For families. I went there together with my sons (8 and 10 yrs.). There are always fascinated by these kind of places. Ticket was quite expensive: 39e one adult and two kids. We spent interesting 3 hours there. But if you are thinking should you go to Jardim zoo or Oceanario I would say that choose zoo.

Oceanario to dream of. Explicit effort to show life in open ocean! One of the best I have ever seen.Definitely visit with your children, they' ll love it.Easy access by hope on hope off busses.You have to have some time thow because it takes over 2 hours for the whole visit, apart from any extra expiditions!! Do not forget to use the teleferic for a nice view of the the river and the city

Paradise and unike moments. Very well organized with more than 25,000 fish species from all over the world is a wonderful and perfect unique experience you will feel a very nice connection with all the animals, a vist to do with time and you will have a perfect biology class. Good place for every ages and for sure a place to don't miss.
Awsome. Really awsome place to relax and enjoy the "sea" ! Its very well done and organized, and i would love to go there again...

Worth a visit. The aquarium was stunning, well worth seeing! We spent several hours walking around and looking at the various tanks. The fish, and sea animals were amazing. The architecture was different, and the atmosphere was nice!The only downside is the unfriendly staff. When it is near to closing the staff following you through the building and usher you out. We didn't love this, we felt rushed and they staff were quite rude. My travel partner has Crohn's disease and he had trouble assessing washrooms close to closing. It seemed we were an inconvenience.
Great experience. I went with my 2 year old daughter. She was hysterical. The aquarium is huge and it is feels like you are under water. Best fish is the moon fish. I loved the otters.

Breathtaking!!!. I liked everything! So so beautiful and touching, the animals look like they have a nice life. I really love that they focused on conservation and education and not entertainment...At first I was a bit nervous about coming to this place, I'm always skeptical about attractions with animals and such, but my BF had read all about it and said there were not going to be any huge animals with little space and that everything they do they do it for conservation and education purposes only.It was an amazing experience.
Takashi Amono exposition. One of the highlights of my life! ( Being a tropical fishbreeder hobbyist )The oceanario itself is rather ordinairy if you know your marine life.

Top class aquarium. Brilliant for a rainy day or to escape the sun. The windows are huge and the fish varied. On three levels if gives a great idea of the chosen oceanic zones. Excellent for photography if your camera has a short shutter delay.
Great place!!. excellent place to go, specially with kids!! The main aquarium is huge with all kinds of fish in there.

impressive. we loved it! wow!
definitely worth a visit for everyone - family friendly too. In fact I've been twice over the years :-)

A very good experience. Visiting the Oceanario was a very good experience. It showcases a variety of sea-life in a very interesting way and the descriptions (in English) are both helpful and educational. The aquarium itself is truly impressive and captivating. The only minus point was the restaurant which offered very little choice and the quality left a lot to be desired.

Relaxing to wonder around. Firstly, the Aquarium is not well sign posted and difficult to find. I enjoyed my experience wondering round. It is well laid out with very good descriptions of the animals on view. As a lone traveller, I had complete ted the tour in about an hour, but there is no limited of the length of time one can stay. Children will enjoyed the tour.

A good distraction. I decided to visit this place with my fiancee partly because I like seas and fish etc, and partly beause it was very hot that day in Lisbon and I hoped to be cool down there. It turned out to be the right decision.Oceanario de Lisboa is supposedly one of the largest and most beautiful in all Europe. I haven't seen the others but this one was quite impressive indeed. The main (central) tank alone was huge containing all sorts of sea life. You could admire it from all possible angles and from 2 levels and it really had some impressive specimens to show. Plus the smaller corners with all sorts of curiosities. And of course the supposedly only 2 living sea otters in Europe who had obviously a perfectly good time - quite cute to look at, actually.Children would obviously love this place but I would certainly recommend it to adults as well. The more so that the Park of Nations is just close by and has also lots to offer.A good place to spend some time.
Fun day out!. Well worth the long queue! Beautiful fish, great variety of things to see. Definitely merits its high rating on tripadvisor! Otters were a highlight.

I now love Otters!. Really a great visit. We bought our ticket online which saved us a little bit of money and jumped the queue. Really fun experience as neither I nor my girlfriend had been to an aquarium in years. There is a great main tank and the two Otters were definitely a highlight!

Get wet. Let's dive without even getting wet. Now, start counting the number of times you'll say Wow.The main tank is truly hypnotic, and the small ones on the sides will let you see the tiny details and all the small facts about so many species.I keep visiting this place over and over, as it never cease to amaze me.

Better and better. Better every day, fantastic way to improve what was already very good. Very well-kept and with new species and always very interesting for kids and not so kids!!I advise at least 3 hours, not for hurry visitors.

The best Oceanario we've visited!. Our trip to Lisbon was just what we needed before we started our season in our own rental business in Crete. We did a number of activities, absorbing the culture and layout of Lisboa and the bus ride out to the Oceanario was easy and efficient. We were lucky to be there when the special turtle exhibition was on and we spent a number of hours wandering round the amazingly-kept place. We had a delicious lunch in the restaurant and carried on with our tour, finishing with buying various gifts from the well-stocked gift shop. Thank you for a great experience!

Worth an afternoon trip after a LOT of waking. We were hesitant about getting to the oceanarium as we felt we could do this anywhere but we loved the experience, especially the temporary exhibit which was a stunning freshwater nature aquarium with over 160,000 liters of water. It's a 10 minute cab drive from downtown, ~10 euros, and worth an afternoon or morning expedition

Fabulous experience. Impressive aquarium. First time ever to see the Ocean Sunfish, which can weigh up to 5,000 pounds. So good, I visited twice! Great for families. Lots of easy to understand and well-presented information.
amazing fish. really neat displays...very well thought out with unique creatures. the moa moa will blow your mind!

Great!. Perfekt transport connection from centre of town.
Lots of amazing fishes and sea animals.
Big shop with souvenirs.

A bit disappointed!. Having seen this was the top rated thing to do in Lisbon I had high expectations. There was a large tank in the middle with many different windows looking in at the fish and around the outside was a few exhibitions, but not much else. The penguins and otters were nice to see but apart from that we were not blown away for the expensive price we paid and distance we travelled!

take your kids!. The giant two storey tank is stunning. I could have spent hours just sitting there and watching the rays and sharks and sun fish and barracuda swim past. The rest of the displays were pretty cool too, but nothing really quite as spectacular as the main tank
Best dry ocean experiences. I'm a diver my self and I can assure this is the only fascinating dive you will do in your city wear... And with sharks, Manta ray, Barracuda... You name it...

A must-see in Lisbon!. We went there on August 2014. We had been there before, so it was a "repeat". Really cool aquariums, the animals are well feed, and it has a really nice environment. We spent 5 hours there, just sit on the floor and enjoying the view. It's a little bit expensive, 16€ person, but it is worth the price. Going back there this summer!

Good fun for a couple of hours.. I had a couple of hours of free time while taking part in a congress held in the Lisbon international fair and exhibition center which is very close to the aquarium, so i decided to visit the aquarium for a couple of hours.It was nice and i had a good time but wouldn't really put more than a couple if hours for it.but i guess kids would love it more and would be hard to get them to leave!
Worthwhile visiting - however: expensive. This aquarium is one of the best we have ever visited - so many wonderful fish - beautifully presented. However: the entry is quite expensive.
Big pool with fish. Nice aquarium with one big pool with many windows, a lots of tourists and shcoolchildren, good restaurant with terrace

Oceanario. I had a wonderful visit to the Oceanario. There were tons of things to see. The middle of the aquarium was a giant round tank with lots of different fish and sea creatures. The penguins and sea otters were also great to see.
One of the best aquariums I've ever seen. Very good to spend a couple of hours. It is very well presented and the central fish tank is massive. Worth the ticket price.

Fascinating place for both adults and children.. This is a beautifully designed aquarium. The large central tank shows the interconnectedness of all the oceans, and the tanks or exhibitions on the periphery show species and environments unique to different areas of the world. I would rate this as one of the best aquariums in the world. It is both fun and educational for everyone.
Very pleasent. Very nice aqarium that has a lot of diversity. Great big tanks filled with different species from sharks to giant crabs to sea otters to deep sea fish. Very clean as well.
Unmissable. This is a fabulous place. You could easily spend the whole day and still not want to leave. So many wonderful exhibits. We can't wait to go again.

The best aquarium in Lisbon. It was build for Lisbon International organism in 1998. It's a great place to visit with children because it reproduces some of the habits of the World like north atlantic, antarctic, pacific and indian tropical.
It's the biggest aquarium in Lisbon with more than 8000 fishes and other organisms.

Unforgettable visit . Being an open water scuba diver, I had to visit this place! I must say this is beyond any expectations. I was impressed by some huge sun fishes. The diversity of species presented is marvelous. A must do in Lisbon.

What to do on a wet day. We spent about 4 hours in the Oceanarium. The central tank is spectacular with many viewing windows on both lower and upper floors. We stopped at every one to watch the large variety of fish. We have been to several other oceanaria and this beats the lot.

OK, but nothing fancy.. Its an OK aquarium, but nothing fancy. There's a fair bit of walking required, up and down huge ramps, and the food facilities were not very extensive, at least that we could find. Good for an hour or two, and you can combine it with a trip on the cable car, which goes...nowhere. We had to walk almost all the way back to find a bus stop.
Belleza. Oceanário is one of the most interesting places in Lisbon when speaking about nature. If you want to see many interesting creatures and admire the nature do not forget to go there !

Not to miss in Lisbon. It is a fantastic exhibit of the marine life, in a beautifull location close to the river Tagus. The all building is amazing and the way the aquariums are organized really makes you feel you're underwater with all those fishes. Unmissable.
Great for everyone. Best aqvarium i ever been to. Good organized, clean and good price. Relaxing to walk around and look at fishes and the other animals, seems very well taken care off.
A must!!. A must in Lisbon! should not be missed! online tickets can be cheaper. great experience for all ages.

Love it love it love it. Maybe I'm to emotional as I have never been to such place before, but in my opinion it is a super interesting place to visit in Lisbon.
