A lot of sea creatures are gathered in on gigantic aquarium (sharks for example) in there are dozens of other aquariums presenting sea animals form different parts of the world. They are also arranged thematically. Text information and screens are not dominating and are just perfectly matching. You can meet also penguins and otters. Amazing.

Nice aquarium. nice aquarium. I like the fact that you could sit down in front of the huge tank and just observe all the vertebrates swimming around. But i wish there were more species-facts-posters around, so you could learn more about where they live and what they eat ect.

Just couple of hours. The place is nice to see not a must see placeIf you have kids they will enjoy it too muchThe tips of this trip1. Never book temporary tickets They are very tiny fishes and small place2. Take photos .. it may be the only time you can have selfi with a shark

A Great World-class Aquarium. If you love aquariums, as I do, you'll find the Oceanario amazing... the collection is phenomenal spanning the warm waters of the Caribbean to the cold arctic... a must see, especially for kids!

Amazing place. It suprised me. You can spend a lot of time time just sitting and watching... Our son enjoyed it. Be prepared to buy some souvenir in fanshop. And let's not forget that the cabine line is right next to the Oceanario so you can have good plan for few hours...

Wow!. Fabulous aquarium with something for everyone. Definitely worth a visit. Spent most of the day there and was able to see everything without feeling hurried. Great experience for kids of all ages.

Definitely the best aquarium I've been to.. Admittedly, I haven't been to a ton of aquariums, but I've been to some major ones (like the Baltimore Aquarium) and the Lisbon Oceanario out shines them all. Beautiful exhibits, very diverse, arranged to represent the ocean environments as "One Ocean" with the idea that all the oceans of the world work together to make a whole.I especially love the rainforest area, but the main, central aquarium is awe-inspiring.
Great place to visit. Would recommend a visit here. It is absolutely amazing. It was quiet when I went I could really appreciate all it had to offer.

Good place to spend a couple of hours.. We were lucky in that they had a temporary exhibition of underwater gardens by a Japanese "Designer". After that we went to the main Aquarium. This is both interesting and educational if you have children in tow. There is a huge central tank around which the aquarium is designed and it is full of a wide range of fish from huge to tiny - Sharks, Sunfish, Morays etc. They also have tanks relating to the various Oceans in the World and even Penguins with real ice to keep them happy. This can get busy at peak times to suggest an early visit.

Underwater. Since the 1998 Expo I hadn't visited the Oceanário, and back then I didn't see it properly because of the crowds.Nowadays, with the fish and other animals fully accustomed to their environment, the gorgeous venue and easy viewing conditions and great ocean environmental replicas, make it a really worth a visit.Plus the beautiful art installation, 'Submerged Forests', by Takashi Amano, with soundtrack by the Portuguese Rodrigo Leão, made my day.On a hot summery day like today, it's the perfect place to 'cool off'.

Nice but nothing spectacular. Considered as the best aquarium in Europe and the second best aquarium in the world , thats why maybe I personally expect more. Anyway it is very nice to see it if you can pay 17 Euros .

A great day with friends - totally worth the price. One of my favourite places in Lisbon. An incredible diversity of animals and some really interestinc and interactive stuff for the kids (and grown ups) .The penguins are super cute and the central tank has a great place downstairs to sit down and feel like you're deep under the ocean

Huge variety of Fish and other sea-life. Specially on rainy days, probably the best thing to do in Lisboa. The center-aquarium has most likely one of the biggest variety of sea-life. Different shark-species, Mola Mola; Rays, swarm fishes and many very rare species can be found. Around the big aquarium you find lot of small "specialty-aquariums" and sea-life-habitats. Wonderful experience!

Fantastic exhibitions, good for a rainy day. We made use of the rare rainy days in Lisbon and visited here. Not far from the Metro red line. The main tank was impressive and several other smaller tanks were great compliments too. Seeing the otters fool around was a personal highlight.The temporary exhibition 'Forests Underwater' was spectacular and well worth the extra fee. A mix of tanks mixed with underwater garden art, very peaceful and extremely well thought out.

Worth visiting when in Lisbon. This is one of the world's largest aquariums. It is located in the Parque das Nações. Metro stop Oriente. It has a huge, spectator aquarium in the center from which all other exhibits span off from. It has a vast selection of marine life. When finished visiting find Vasco da Gama shopping Center which is only 15 mins walk away.

adventure. Visiting there is a real adventure, huge aquarium with many kind of fish is breathless. You can spent hours looking on this astonishing view. Being eye in eye with shark, huge devil fish or other exotic species makes you fill like in different world. For me was great to see other exhibitions, penguins and playing otters.It is worth to go there, book around 2-3 hours, but you can stay there longer if only you have time.

Hours of fun. We had an absolute blast at the aquarium, €17 admission seemed a bit steep (a student rate would have been nice) but we spent 4 hours here in the end so it was well worth it! The aquarium was fab, the otters were definitely our favorites! We went in the late afternoon around 4pm and felt this was the best time as there was lots of time to do everything but the exhibits weren't too crowded so it was comfortable and you could get a good view of everything.

Great big aquarium. This is one large aquarium in which you wind around. There are some side enclosures with otters, penguins, forest and others. It's a unique aquarium full of wildlife that can be viewed from multiple angles. I SCUBA dive, so aquariums tend to be a little let down for me. It is a little bit of a haul from the central sites.

Feeding time. Reasonable prices, beautiful animals and fish. We got there at feeding time which was great, the otters and penguins were my favourites. Overall a really fun day my only negative was it was quite cold inside and I wished I had brought an extra layer.

Nice place to spend the morning!!. It is a well maintained place in a very nice and new neighborhood. The Oceanario offers visitors a interesting experience with a great variety of ocean life. Especially children would really enjoy it, although adults can have a pleasant experience as well. At the exit there is a gift shop, so one can take a souvenir back home. It is nice to enjoy the whole neighborhood including a ride in the cable car.

where the fish is taken care of. On the way from or to the the airport save a few hours to visit this incredible place with a plenty amount of marvelous fish, amusing otters, meditative penguins etc. Also this oceanarium is very educating for both children and adults, it teaches how to avoid any pollution and preserve flora and fauna of the oceans.

Perfect for rainy day. That was a visit at Great aquarium on one rainy day. Everything is well-organized, my 5 year old doughtier was happy! I highly recommend it for you and yours kids! Nice area for a walking , lots shops and big shopping mall also you can find there suspended cable cars.
Worth visiting. An experience not to be missed in this great oceanarium which has a massive fish tank with all sort of fish which are delightful to watch so closely.

Presented beautifully but not alot to see. The aquarium is presented beautifully. The main tank is impressive and the penguins and sea otters are really close. However, there isn't much else to see and I think 17 euros for an adult is abit steep based on the fact the zoo is only 2 euros more and by far a much more enjoyable day out. Doesn't take long to get around.

Perfect destination. I have been several places like this before. But this place is awesome. Everything is well-organized, the staff so helpful. The whole exhibition is great. I bought the tickets online and that was pretty good because I can avoid long minutes of waiting.
Very nice!. Great aquarium, beautifully done! I highly recommend it! Specially if you have kids!Nice area for a walk, shops, suspended cable cars!
lisbon oceanarium. the best of the best,you can easily spend 4 hours in there,stunning,you can go to the main part only or extra exibits if you want to pay extra,

Very cool!. There is a huge cylindrical tank filled with all sorts of ocean life. One can walk through the exhibits of the various oceans of the world surrounding the tank. It is a worthwhile visit. Plus, the surrounding area is beautiful and very walkable.

Nice place to visit with kids.. Took the metro (red line) to go to the oceanarium and we weren't disappointed. The entry fee was a bit high -17 euros per person (reduced to 14 if you have a Lisbon card) - that was my only complaint for the trip. The oceanarium is wonderfully designed and will keep you engaged thoroughly. It's a great place to take kids. If you are an adult without kids, this could be something to do on a day you are too tired to do sight seeing - kinda relaxing. Overall it's a good experience.
Exceeded expectations. Huge pool for separate seas. Fish that never seen before. It was a great experience overall! I guess we do not need to visit other ever.

The best aquarium. This is the best aquarium i have been to. Set in a modern spacious part of East Lisbon, from the outside it looks deceivingly small and normal. Inside is another story, from the lovely sea otters to the huge shark and whale tank, this is truly wonderful. Always visit when i return to Lisbon

Do not miss in Lisbon. Was lovely to visit this area and take a ride in the cable cars. We weren't sure what to expect as from the outside the building looks very industrial and gives nothing away.It seemed a bit pricey at first, but I think it was worth it.Inside was fantastic, there's a huge tank when you first enter, which gets very crowded, but it can actually be seen from several areas as you make your way round the exhibits, so don't get stuck in the crowd.The information and interactive screens were good and the signs were very informative.
Oceanario. Really nice. Inevitable 10000kids around. Rather expensive. No Delphins which I have found strange. But nice day out expecially in summer when outside temperature is unbearable

Bigger and greater than you may think at first sight. It's an amazing experience. Not only the Oceanário itself but the surrondings too. You certainly should take time to see everything, 3 or 4 hours at least. It's easy to get there by public transport. Anyway, that part of the city is incredibly different from the Lisbon that you could see otherwise.
Maybe the best aquarium I ever visited. Great place! Especially the huge aquarium you can see from each different angle, really worth seeing it!
Unique place. Must to see in Lisboa apart from the city itself. You will fall in love with what live in the sea and the ocean
Very entertaining. Very entertaining, as it is well visited, go for the opening times. Animals are well kept, are healthy and seem to enjoy themselves.
Oceanario Lisboa June 2015. Wonderful visit. Oceanario is not larger then Genoa Acquario but the fishes, the pinguins and the birds are very close to you.

Great for kids, not too big, extremely busy, buy tickets online. Take your family there, it is worth it but you will have to handle hundreds of small kids around.
It is not very big and you can spend 30 mins or 3 hours there depending on how much you want to experience it.

Worth a visit . When its really hot and you've burned yourself under Lisbon's sun, the oceanario is a good place to spend a few hours. The tickets are quite expensive but the place is quite big and everything is clean and well maintained. There are plenty of different fishes etc, but for me the two main things were the penguins and the sea otters.

Very impressive. First when you come inside, you see a lot of people in front of a huge window but you see nothing, because nobody moves! But ... there are so many windows to see the main aquarium, you'll see all the fishes, mantas, sharks, etc. etc. So just go away from the first view point and discover a great attraction.

Very educational!. The Oceanarium in Lisbon is one of the best we've visited. Living on the Gulf Coast in the Tampa Bay area, we're a bit spoiled when it comes to learning about the ocean. The Oceanarium did not disappoint. Highly recommend it!

Great underwater experience. One of the better things to do in Lisbon. Depending on if you go with kids or not it can take 2-3 h in there if you do like what's in it. We loved it, they lay out is great you can take a peak into different tanks from different angles. The temporary exhibition though is probably not worth the extra cost.

Brilliant and a fun day out. We visited the Aquarium on June 1st. The place is very easy to walk around and informative. The Penguins and sea otters were particular highlights. It was very busy and popular whilst we were there so we'd recommend going at a weekend or earlier in the morning maybe. Easy to find and right next door to the cable car which was great fun.

A bite-size fun outing. The aquarium is nicely organised and a must see for families visiting Lisbon. It can be visited a a short trip or it can be a full day if you want to stretch it out. We would definitely appreciate a bit more interaction. Overall very pleasant.

very nice choice for an afternoon. I enjoyed it a lot, is big but not giant and if lucky, not crowded, so the visit is confortable and funny. nearby restaurants are good and the area is modern and different from the rest of Lisbon.

Interesting, not wild. I expected more of the second biggest aquarium in the world for some reason. It was very informative and the fish were mostly interesting. Saw some crazy species, and was nice to finally see a live codfish (:The penguins and birds however seemed kind of sad - maybe it was just my imagination but I think keeping it only a fish thing is probably more eco friendly.

Fun for the family . Might be a bit expensive but family found it super fun. The lots of viewing points and tons of fish to and other animals to view. Location is around tons of restaurants, perfect for lunch after the oceanarium!

Very cool. Great place to learn more about our oceans, a must do in Lisbon! Located in a beautiful new area of Lisbon, brings physically the feel of being in each ocean and surrounded by its nature and animals...great experience!

The Oceonario de Lisboa is a "must see" when in Lisbon!. The Oceanario is a great place to visit when in Lisbon. It's attractive for children and adults alike. It is interesting to see the sharks and all the big and small fish and other creatures like the penguins, otters etc. I will go there again next time I visit Lisboa
Fantastic!. Was really great place to go and just chill, so many amazing species of fish. Only bad point was the severe amount of kids, but thats kinda expected
Brilliant. What a great way to spend two hours. Fantastic central fish tank which you can view at different levels. So easy to follow the themes. Don't miss this. Great value for money.
Beautiful and well worth the time. The animals are all well maintained and the area is beautiful! The penguins are healthy and adorable. Definitely a must for individuals who lover animals.

Excellent Experience. We spent a morning here during our recent visit and were really impressed. It took us about an hour to go through all of the exhibitions but it wasnt overly busy while we were there. Saw some fish that I had never seen anywhere before which added to the enjoyment. We got a discounted entrance fee as we had a Lisboa Card.
Nice experience for everyone. A very pleasant experience for the whole familyGet informed about ongoing activities.There are many kinds of fish and sea animals.

a Must. worth to be visited Also with young children.the underwater life of our oceans are displayed in various aquaria around a huge central tank with the big fish.on the top level birds like pinguïns are wating for you;a MUST to be visited

Big disappointment . Disappointing -- compared to aquariums I have visited, not just in large cities, but also small ones (Cornwall). Entire visit focuses mainly on one large tank with small exhibits to the side. Price is expensive at €17 per adult. And no turtles! Skip this tourist trap which was overrun by kids on their school trip.

Always a nice visit! :) . Either to chill 'under water' while watching the fishes passing by or to explore all the many sea creatures (and others), this is a great place to visit!
The only downside are the long dark areas that get a bit boring after a while, but it's well worth it!.

Stunning. This Oceanarium is very large but so easy to access, you flow from one ocean type to another seamlessly and joyfully. The huge main tank can be seen from many areas. It is just beautiful and easy to get to by public transportation.
Great experience . Been amazed what I saw there. Interesting place with fishes sharks and different sea animals.lots of informations
BIG OCEANARIUM !!. Many kinds of fish. Sharks, Etc. Very Big. One of the best of the world. At the Parque das Nações area, not far from the Gare do Oriente.

Massive and beautiful central tank. Much more than a regular aquarium, altough the central tank is clearly the jewel of the crown. Species from the five corners of the world at display and nicelly kept.
Always a pleasure to go there!

One of the best oceanariums in the world. This Oceanarium was built for World Expo 1998 in Lisbon and used state of the art materials. It has a huge main tank with thousands of fish (big and small) and many small tanks. On the top it has 4 tanks(one for each type of climate)
Just wonderful. Made for expo'98 ,,one of the biggest in Europe ,oceanario is a awesome place to visit . Placed in the new part of town it's really a must see in Lisbon

It's fresh and it's cool. :). It's fresh and it's cool. :) It is a very nice aquarium and very pleasant to visit. Kids, and no kids, like to see all the marine life. It deserves a visit that usually takes two or more hours.It's good, too, to runaway of the hot sun of Lisbon.It stays in the new neighbourhood of Lisbon, the Expo, that was built around 1998 for a world fair. It's possible to walk a lot, near the river, the gardens and go till near the bridge Vasco da Gama. It is possible to rent a bicycle and ride where there are no cars, near the river. It's safe for kids too.It is possible to go there by metro, going to “Gare do Oriente”, red line, and then walk near the river. You need to walk a lot, take comfortable shoes, and/or a bike!It's possible to spend a na afternoon or more in the location, walking, seeing the views, riding a bike, eating in one of the many restaurants in the shpping Vasco da Gama or around. Lisbon is nont only the old neighborhood, it has new zones too. Try the Expo if you are tired of old streets and old buildings, and so on.If you want to do some physical exercise or just let the kids run at will, then the Expo is a good place to do so.

Nice Aquarium. Nice aquarium with lots to see. However, since I have taken up scuba diving, aquariums don't see to hold the same "wow" factor. I probably should have passed. Also thought it was very pricey....

Must see. One of best aquariuns in the world, in an unique location.
A lifetime experience for kids and adults
Very good route and at this time in an amazing temporary exibithion "Submerse Forrests"

one of the best we've been to. having a small child we are some what of connoisseurs of aquariums from Genoa, Italy to St. Petersbrurg, Florida. This one is top notch. Not the largest or most diverse but the layout is very engaging. There is one gigantic tank in the middle. you circle around it, starting on the second floor and descending to the bottom. along the way are other enclosures and aquariums with specific species but the center tank is truly the master piece. schools of mackerel and tuna, a pair of the largest sun fish ive ever seen, countless rays, a half dozen species of sharks, they all mingle and pass right in front of the gigantic viewing area. even when the viewing areas are crowded with people, the windows are so large its very easy to see something beautiful.
What a day. Really interesting, part of a big park, full ofo attractions for all ages, something different, easy to reach, well treated animals, not to miss
Mesmerising. Excellent aquarium very impressive. The route to walk through is well planned. Highlights were definately the otters, loved them doing their back strokes in the water. We

The Best Aquarium EVER!. Such a nice, peaceful retreat from the main tourist attractions. The aquarium is better than any I have seen, and I'm so glad we set aside 3 hours for the visit. I was just as amused by all the fish, stingrays and sharks as my kids were.
GREAT WAY TO START LISBON. You are going to have a great time there. Learn a lot and see fish and mammals you probably didnt know existed!!

Another great attraction!. The aquarium was really lovely to see, the design is really clever and has two levels, on one level you see the penguins walking around and then as you go down you can see them swim. Provides a continuous feel. Biggest must to see are the sea otters, such adorable creatures :-) nothing could top the zoo but this was an attraction worth seeing!

High quality aquarium, expected it to be larger. Went for a quick visit an the quality of the displays are good. Informative plaques all through and two very charming sea otters.Looks like they also have some activities for kids and focus on informative and educational presentations. Was expecting it to be a bit bigger though with some larger outside exhibitions as well. But well worth the trip if you're into life in the seas.
Very good, you hear some oohs and ahhhs.. €17 euros for an adult but worth it. It's very well done and the location is on the waterfront with others to see as well. It was worth the time and money.

Don't think twice... Just take your Kids!. Like I just said.. don't think twice, just grab your kids and take them to the oceanario. An amazing experience, they will learn a lot. What to say about the central aquarium?... Impressive at least. The price is fair.

fantastic day out!. We spent several hours here and could have stayed even longer if we'd had the time. There are wonderful displays of all kinds of sea creatures, sea spider, shark, huge tank in the middle of the aquarium...

Oceanaria Lisbon. Extremely interesting exhibit in excellent position by river. Wonderful range of species although I think there could have been better information displayed. Mission statements should have been clearer too. Excellent children's area. Excellent value for money.
A great day out.
It"s a must to see. The second biggest aquarium in Europe. There are hundreds of special animals form all around the globe. Great program for families.

Impressive!!!!. Nice and huge place to admire many marine species, it is great its design and building, was a memorable experience. The main part is to watch the main tank with the biggest species, it was breath-taking for me. I really recommend this!!!!!

Good but expected more.. Impressions are all relative, but compared to Barcelona's I expected a more impressive sight. The tank is cleverly planned and some separate exhibits are great, but I had a feeling there is a lot of unused space in this place. But do have a walk around it as the sea promenade and vistas are impressive and V de Gama mall offers a lot of shopping and dining experiences!
Great Place to visit with your kids. Excellent aquarium in the modern side of Lisbon where your kids and family will adore visiting it! Fishes, penguins, seals you name it!
A spectacular aquarium. We spent several hours here and could have stayed even longer if we'd had the time. There are wonderful displays of all kinds of sea creatures.

Great for a few hours.. We enjoyed our visit and were impressed with the quality of the exhibits. There's a large central tank with viewing windows around the perimeter on 2 levels. A clever arrangement with a different aspect from each window. It's well lit and maintained and home to many species of fish including Sun Fish, sharks and rays. Elsewhere are smaller tanks with other fish and animals, all well presented. At the time of our visit there was a temporary exhibit of underwater gardens by Takashi Amano, a Japanese artist. A different aspect to seaweed!The admission charges are quite expensive but overall it's good value.

as a big fan of aquariums... I can only say that this one is definatly worth a visit. After visiting serveral ones in the world such as Shanghai, Stockholm, Australia..i have to admit that this one is my absolute favorite. You get educated, see enormous "Mondfisch" and those seaotters are just way too cute. And the price is absolutly fair if you look at all the attractions.
Where is Nemo?. Big pools with fish. Doesn't look as well attended as before. Sea otters were shy and not playful. The smell of the sea was extreme.
Nice and expensive. Very nice place to visit. The Praça das Naçoes, where its located, is very nice too. But its very expensive.

Bad timing. I love an aquarium as much as the next person. This one really is fantastic, in particular the outdoor attractions with the animals in replicas of their natural habitats was great.Unfortunately for us, we hopped off the hop on-hop off bus and went to the Aquarium on the Sunday of a long weekend in both Portugal and Spain. Needless to say, there were lots of tourists in town, and the place was jam packed. To the point where it was not a pleasant experience.If you ae in this Expo 98 section of Lisbon, the Aquarium is definitely worth a look, maybe just pick your time a little more carefully than we did!

All about the sea!. I visited the Oceanario last year with mom and nephews and sis. It was the third visit. It is really a great place for all ages. Yiu can walk the whole ocean and I felt the same excitement I had felt 17 years ago when visited the first time. It deserves a visit, it alerts you without paternizing you or lecturing: teaches how to live in peace with water and life.

Disabled & Carer point of view. We visited the Oceanario de Lisboa as an excursion from our Cruise and can recommend it.There was adequate disabled access, there was a long ramped access to the higher view points, but there are lifts that were not readily found.The Oceanario de Lisboa provided a fantastic close encounter with sea life etc. that would otherwise have not been experienced.There was also a café on the site for refreshments.We only had a total of 1:10 and this was inadequate to enjoy all the displays.Discounts when entry tickets bought on-line.
Aquarium. Dark and crowded with school kids. We were forced to walk in one direction through narrow, dark hallways.

All the oceans in one visit. If you want to experience all types of oceans in the world in one visit than the Ocenario is a must. A beautiful out of this world experience . The teleferique is facing the Ocenario so enjoy both.....
Serene. I learnt a lot about the different kind of aquatic animals all over the world and their Habitats. Very organized and well designed. A serene and educational experience

breathtaking - made me feel hopeful for the future of the planet.. stunning design and remarkable concept. probably the world's most innovative aquarium ..the place was alive with the sounds of children and older adults…made me feel hopeful about the future of the planet…because the educational aspect of the design was so welcoming to the next generation of minds..

MUST VISIT!!!. It was unique experience! You see all kinds of under water and you have the taste of scuba diving without need to dive!!! You can seat and enjoy all kinds of fish with no fear!!! a place to relax, explore and refless...

Brilliant if you love aquatic life. Lots to see you could spend the whole day inside.I loved the Otters they are super cute I could have watched them for days!The large tank in the center of the Ocenarium was massive and had such a large selection of marine life Sharks, Stingrays, Sun Fish it was incredible. Definately worth a visit espicially if it is too hot or raining outside.

Very interesting. O aquário é grande e tem diversos tanques com peixes e animais do mundo todo, o tanque central é realmente muito bonito. / The aquarium is big and has tanks with fish and animals from all over the world, the central tank is really very beautiful.

Totally stunning. Really excellent sea aquarium, massive, very well laid out as you walk through geographical zones, but can always get back to the main tank. Absolutely stunning sun fish, giant rays and sharks. I do love fish and was there for hours, but i would think anyone would enjoy this. Photos allowed without flash. Temporary exhibition really beautiful too. If there were to be negatives, i think some of the massive tank rocks look a bit manufactured rather than natural. Also timing might be an issue, there are plenty of screaming children and school trips. Though its a large place, you can generally find somewhere to sit and feel its beauty and peace.

Very well done oceanarium, well worth a visit. The oceanarium is very well done. The two baby Mola-Molas (ocean sunfish) were quite a site as were all the manta rays, sting rays, sharks and others. It would have been nice with a couple of hammerhead sharks and large sea turtles. We easily spent a good half day visiting the oceanarium. Highly recommend a visit.
Must visit. Awesome place to visit, when we walked there was a huge tank with hundreds of different fish, sharks, rays etc Could have been watching that for hours.
A selfie with a shark maybe once in a lifetime :). Exceeded expectations. You can see sharks, manta, reys, pinguins and other sea fishes. A selfie with a shark maybe once in a lifetime :)

Lovely aquarium. We had a lovely afternoon in the aquarium. It was very informative with lots of information about the fish. It is well laid out in the different ocean zones while you walk around the big central tank. We loved the penguins and the sea otters too.

Great visit. This beautiful aquarium was well laid out and clean. The tanks are clean and the fish look healthy. One of the high points of the visit was a temporary exhibit by Takashi Amano creating a nature aquarium which is both beautiful and imperfect. Both really worth seeing!

Really enjoyed- surprising!. Travelled with my family to Lisbon recently, and one member really wanted to go. I wasn't thrilled, but we took the underground to get there (wonderful by the way) and walked through a great mall to get there. we all really enjoyed it, stayed for around 90 minutes. Then we hit the casino (that was a bit cheesy) on the way back to the train.But the oceanarium itself was surprisingly interesting.

Make a day of it! Great area and place. . One of our private guides recommended the aquarium. We had just flown back in from Seville and needed to kill some time before going back to the States. This place is great. It's a bit far from the downtown so we took a cheap taxi. We were so surprised how big the aquarium was and all the stuff to do nearby. The aquarium has a huge tank that you circle throughout your walk. The whole experience is at least one hour. It's clean, has great fish, and the signs are in multiple languages. The otters are adorable. They very clearly take care of everything here. Afterwards, we took the cable cars for a ride (right behind the aquarium) and ate a huge sushi buffet (next door). The science museum is right there too--loved all of it!! Great experience for the day. Would be good for families or couples like us!

Go sea. This is a marvellous and imaginative sea-life centre with everything from sea-dragons to sea otters, huge sunfish to tiny clown fish.It explores the life of every ocean habitat, from the Arctic to Australia - the information is excellent, with an emphasis on sustainability, & there's even a film showing the work of an aqua-vet ( if that's the right phrase !)We also enjoyed the almost poetic temporary exhibition by a Japanese artist - beautiful underwater garden with tiny colourful fish.A great place to visit if you're in Lisbon
Must visit it !!. Incredible place!! All the sharks, the unkwow fishes for us, the small and coloured ones, everything completed a great experience
stunning. This is our third visit to the aquarium since 1998 and is still stunning. You can spend hours there. Well worth the trip to Nacoes and the entrance fee.

amazing must see attraction. an awesome place to visit, visited here from a cruise cost us 14.90 euros each which worked out at about £18.80 in total, when we walked in we were greeted by an enormous tank which hundreds of different fish, sharks, rays etc all swimming past, some fantastic photo opportunities , could easily have stayed watching that for hours. the sun fish is a fascinating fish not quite seen anything as ugly. the penguins, puffins are all great and the sea otters are brilliant. Great for a couple of hours to walk around and enjoywe got the yellow city tour bus from the city centre on the purple line

Huge aquarium with a great variety of fish. It is basically a huge aquarium with lots of different fish in it. Two storeys high and takes about an hour to go around and see everything. It is nicely done and overall a good experience. For families with kids, l highly recommend.

Fair but not must-visit. It is a good place, if you have a kid. However, don't imagine bigger aquarium than ones at Atlanta, Osaka, etc. In addition, it is too far from town. If you are a short time visitor to Lisbon, it might be a lower priority place.

A beautiful and tranquil place to relax for a while.. The aquarium is huge with a surrounding walkway on two levels, so there are plenty of viewing points, some very busy, and some empty. Pick yopur spot. The outside of the walkways are filled with additional exhibits and seating. Watch out for the otters being fed!There is also a temporary exhibit 'underwater forests' which is very intetresting.Great fun for adults and children alike.The cost per adult is €17.

Excellent aquarium. We had several Portuguese recommend the Oceanario and neighborhood to us and it was well worth the visit. We spent about 2 hours in the Oceanario and another two hours walking along the water and in the nearby Vasco da Gama shopping center.

Well kept and a great place to spend some hours.. It's a great place to go if you're visiting Lisbon. You'll be surprised by the big central tank where you can see loads of different species. You can also see penguins and seals! Great!

Enjoyed a lovely day out in the midst of lovely aquatic life. I went with a friend, because I had a day ti spend in Lisbon. We were thrilled at the nicely planned layout and scheme of putting animals in their natural habitats with appropriate flora and atmosphere. Under one roof, we enjoyed Tropical Forest to Arctic Conditions. And we saw so many different type of fish, in all shapes and sizes.
nice place. It was a nice experience. Kids liked it and so did we. The location is also good, with some other attractions around.
Lua..... Amazing Place for underwater life lovers , best side for me was the HUGE chill Fish LUA ....moves very gently bringing Peace to the most trouble Mind !

Wow!. Was not really keen to visit but my friend wanted to go. I was blown away by this excellent aquarium and could not drag my nose from the glass. You must see the sea otters cavorting! There are also penguins and arctic birds and the corals and anemones are breath taking. Take the cable car which is in this well regenerated area of Lisbon.

My new favorite aquarium. I've been to a view aquariums over the years, but this one is the best. The centerpiece is a huge circular Atlantic tank, viewable from two levels. The exhibit path leads around the tank to smaller (but often quite large) tanks and biospheres, always offering new views of the central tank.The only negative aspect to mention: the signage between the metro station and the Ocenario is very sparing, we had to ask people to find the way.
Best attraction in Lisbon!. Great place to visit! Had lots of fun and learnt a lot! Loved Mother Earth and loved ocean! Also loved the sea otters hahaha
Nice. I actually felt a bit sorry for the fish and birds and penguins....but the kids enjoyed it ! I thought it would be bigger and that the animals would have a bit more space...
A day with fishes. Great place to go, specially with kids. Surrounding area is also beautiful. Take a stroll by the river and have a lunch nearby.

Natural Sea Landscape in Lisbon. If you want to see one of the bigest enviroment of sea out of the open ocean, this place will take your breth way, with several regions of sea world concentrated in the same place.

Well worth a visit. I've visited a few aquariums in the world, Copenhagen's 'Den blå Planet' and Boston's 'New England Aquarium' being among them but this one really is quite the bit bigger (and more crowded). The main building itself suitably situated in the water, the Oceanario de Lisboa is well worth a visit. Spent about three hours there, yet those who are -really- into aquariums and animals could likely spend a whole day without getting bored.Some pretty cool and high quality stuffed animals (I doubt you'd find a stingray or a blowfish at Toy's R Us) can be found in the gift shop. :)

Size matters . This aquarium is huge, beautiful and a must see, if you visit Lisbon. I went there with my children and they didn't want to leave. The environment inside is great and the sorounding area is amazing, with lots more to see. The cable and the River right there... So calming and enchanting. Food is great too

Great visit. I have visited this Oceanarium twice now, and I would go again. If you book online you save 10%, making the price well worth it. It has lots to see and is located in a beautiful part of Lisbon near to the river. I didn't enjoy the current temporary exhibit this time (Underwater forests) compared to two years ago (turtles).
The Best. Just about the best aquarium I have ever visited, impossible to list all, just to mention the sun fish, dragon fishes and overall layout. A must for any visitor

Great place, great time. It is really a place to see in Lisbon. We were amazesd not only with the fish but especially with living corals. Never seen so many marine species in one place. Very informative and worth every penny. A short film about the facility is a must as well
Great for family and fun. Once in a life is worth to see, the aquarium is really beautifull, and its amazing how sharks and other fishes give along together

Again and again! :). I've been there a few times already! Everytime friends/family come to visit, there we go! PS: Just don't really go there after you have a meal or have a full stomach! Fish smell is defo gonna rock your world! :P

Beautiful amazing place!. A very beautiful place, a wonderful way to learn more about the species in our world. The tropical area is amazing, in my humble opinion. And so is the central tank. Unforgivable. A must see!

One of the best in the world!. Not only for this building, it worthy to visit the all area around, as a good exemple of an urbanistic regeneration, full of life.
Be prepared to find it quite crowded, specially on weekends.

Awesome!. My wife and I are huge fans of aquariums and being Europe's largest we had to visit and we're not disappointed. I have to say that it is probably the best Aquarium/Oceanarium that we have ever been to. Well designed and thought out and very reasonably priced? Must see!
Worth your while. A fantastic place. Compares to Monterrey's aquarium in California. Different qualities in each, but none above the other.
Dive into this!. This is one of my favourite places in Lisbon! Its like dive into de ocean of colors and in perfect harmony! Must go definitely!
SUPERB. Simply the best in Europe. Four aquariums in one. Diversity, from the tropical forest to the poles. Amazing.
Simply the best!. No doubt one of the best in the world and the whole aquarium so appropriately standing in the water!

A stupendous Marine (and not only) Wildlife Display. Located at the renewed area of eastern Lisbon and by the Tagus River, this Aquario stands above the waters with an internal and gigantic acquarium in the center , allowing visitors to keep up with the viewing of a remarkable variety of fish and maritime predators.In the areas that expand from this central glass gigantic pool, one may admire and enjoy the most diferent natural habitats from Antartica to the Equatorial rain forests.

Fantastic aquarium. Very beautiful place. The big and very clean main tank is absolutely amazing. I recommend to visit the aquarium during the week because there are lots of visitors on the weekend. The price is a bit higher than other attractions here, but it is not to expensive for what you get.

A must visit. The visit of Oceanario de Lisboa is a must for any visit to Lisbon with children. Adults will enjoy the very nice surroundings with view on the "mar de palha" ("Sea of straw") as well as the the view of one of the nicest aquariums in Europe.

Mandatory stop in Lisbon. As a resident in Lisbon, I always advise my friends to visit the Oceanário. It is one of the greatest in the world, an amazingly beautiful place to relax, discover sea life, have fun with kids or date you other half. Its tranquility and beauty is really special. Plus, you get to visit the whole Prque das Nações, an amazing place full of restaurants, shops and activities, with the best view in town.

Nice aquarium. The aquarium is very nice and has alot of diffrent species. It is well laid out and easy to visit. The reason I give it an average rating is simple: the price is way to high (14 euro or 17 euro if you want to see the temporary exhibit as well). Secondly it is far from the city centre. Finally, the temporary exhibit is not worth the extra 3 Euro....it takes 5 minutes to view and as no interesting species.

Amazing aquarium. Having been in several aquariums all over the world, I can say that this one is one of the most spectacular and organized of them.The central tank is a spectacle of its own, several species coexist in it, the sharks and the rays are an attraction per se.The other exhibits presenting different bioenvironments are, also, very interesting,

Very Fishy - in a good way. The Oceanario is really something you should visit if staying in Lisbon for a week or so. It's divided into 4 Ecosystems (Antarctic, Atlantic, Pacific and Indian ocean iirc) and taks you roughly about 2h to visits. It's great for kids too, as there are also pengiuns, otters and all other kinds of animals apart from fish. The most impressive is the huge tank in the middle. The Oceanarium is at the former Expo site, which has lot of other things to do, there's a park, a shopping center, a cableway, lots of restaurants and along the Tagus River!

Fantastic aquarium. I really enjoyed the Ocenario, is definitely the best aquarium I've ever seen. The building is absolutely beautiful. Your tour through the aquarium takes you on a journey around the several oceans, visiting the Northern Hemisphere, moderate, tropical and the very southern seas. These are in the periphery of the building. In the center is a huge basin in which all types of mainly big fish (sharks, rays etc.). Really good to spend a wet or too hot afternoon in Lisbon!

Nice aquarium. My daughter loves aquariums, so we spent Friday morning here during a 4 day weekend visit. We all enjoyed it! The main tank contained many different species. We all enjoyed the sunfish as we've never seen them before. They also had a wide variety of rays including a manta ray. I liked the layout. Other exhibits are placed around the main tank as you walk through 2 levels allowing you to see the main tank from different viewpoints. Loved the 2 otters!! The gift shop was large and contained quality souvenirs. We bought the additional ticket for the temporary exhibit, which I didn't think was worth the money.

Beautiful. This one of the best Aquariums that I've ever visited. The way it is set up makes it easy for you to take in the view of the species. Two of the things that amazed me were the Drangon fish and the Sun
Fish. I've neve seen these rare species before.

Great aquarium. This aquarium is very big and there is lots to keep everyone interested. It was great how you could see in the main tank from many different angles, there are large sharks and sunfishes. Didn't believe initially the sunfish were really! Were lucky to see one of the otters. The aquarium is very clean and even when busy was pleasant to walk around.

A cool aquarium, but expensive for its size. This place is very well designed and the sea life here really good, but it's not cheap!That said, on a hot day when you want a slower pace, well worth the visit

Great aquarium . It is worth going just to see the sunfish and sea otters. Most of us will never see a sunfish live, they are incredible - and ugly. The sea otters are a delight to watch. The rest of the aquarium is one of the best I have been to and is well worth the trip. In the area there are plenty of other things to do, cafés, restaurants, casino sporting complexes. the cable car to vasco da gama tower is excellent.

Perhaps not the first thing that comes to mind in Lisbon but DO NOT miss it!. I confess that this was not on my radar (didn't even know there was such) and that I am spoiled by the Atlanta and Monterey Bay Aquariums so what a wonderful surprise! A perfect way to spend several hours; very well laid out, great viewing on all levels and many fish that were new to me. Penguins too! I thought the printed explanations excellent and learned a great deal. For example, the emphasis on sustainability from the Portuguese POV. You don't have to be a young person to really enjoy this.
Interesting. Really interesting. A good place for a relaxed program and also good for families.Save your self some money and avoid the temporary exhibition.
TOP!!! :). Excellent oceanarium, a wonderfull half-day or even full day trip if you expend it to the whole World Fair park.

Nice place. I imagined something more legendary when I was going there, but I didn't regret. The aquarium that goes through all oceanarium is really impressive! And I recommend you not to stay near it when you see it just after to enter to main part. You will have much better view point and not that crowded. The best place to observe life inside aquarium is lower lever, where you can sit just in front of it and feel like a little fish in an ocean

Impressive!. We totally loved the experience the Océanario offers. It is as if you are immersed in a densely populated sea. The sharks and rays are impressive, the moon fish totally bizar. Do check out the sea otters and pinguins!We also really loved the temporary exhibition: forests under water - totally zen.
Many fishes. One of the best things you can visit in lisbon.+Many fishes-Many fishes"Too much water - 7.8" IGN.com

Great break from backpacking with the kids.. Though we would take a break from watching homeless people sell free parking spots in the Alfama and check this out. We have been to the Vancouver and Phoenix aquariums and this was amazing. The whole exist seems to spiral around a central aquarium teeming with sharks, rays, fish and of course, sun fish. It's an easy walk and our 3 year old was enthralled. The building itself is also beautiful. I wanted to write a review while still in the cafeteria here. The prices are very reasonable. The meal of the day is the option of lasagna, rabbit, or fish (oddly enough). It was truly a terrible meal. Probably one of the very worst meals I have ever had travelling. If I find something else soon I would have no problem making myself vomit so I could forget this meal all together. If you have to come, come early as all the food isn't kept at even close to a proper temperature and by early afternoon the bacteria which doubles every 20 min at this temp will have taken over. The vegetable soup tastes like expired medicine ground up with industrial road chalk. We all 4 of us ate a bit till we lost our appetites. Great place to watch the swim five stars for sure. Just don't eat the food....it may just ruin Europe for you.

A little too hyped. But worth a visit.. We have been to the sea-life aquarium at Munich. If a land-locked place like Munich could do so much, I had expected Lisbon to do a lot more with this aquarium.The Oceanarium is a one huge aquarium with lots of sea-life put in. The first floor, where the tour starts, is partitioned into four corners around the main aquarium, each displaying a different oceanic zone (Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Polar). A part of the aquarium extends into these corners that also houses birds and plants in the openings. The tour then takes one to the ground floor where individual exhibits of specific sea life specimens can be seen. The Oceanarium makes the artificiality apparent. The sounds of the ocean that are always played through the tour though, were quite interesting.As said, this place could serve a good attraction to those visiting such a thing for the first time. But for those who have already seen such sea-life exhibits, it is no special thing.
Fantastic!. Great aquarium! One of the best we have been to. They had Penguins!!!! Kids had a great time as did mom and dad :)

Great place to visit. If we like marine life or wanted to spend good time with children this is the right spot in Lisbon. Created for the international exhibition of 1998, Oceanario receives every year thousands of visitors.Its not cheap for a 4 members family, but it worth the money.I lived in Lisbon but visited many times.
Lovely place to visit. well laid out and saw species of fish that I had never seen before. some areas a little on the warm side. well worth a visit
More than fish. Wonderful example architect building with almost every species that you can find in sea. Could give some experiences in sea life for visitors

Nice place to spend an afternoon with the kids. Situated in the modern part of Lisbon, the oceanario is a great place to spend quality time with family and friends. You can find here species from all the oceans around the globe and a huge aquarium where you can see how ocean life looks like. It is well organized. Kids are loving it; and adults too.

Fun family time. It's a fun place to visit for a few hours. There are also many beautiful things around: a small water garden behind the waterfall just close by, the interactive science museum, the cableway. This part of the city it's worth at least a full day.

worth to visit, specialy for families with children. have been there with my mum and a friend, a nice experience, you can watch closely there a plenty types of fish, underwater plants and animals, a nice surounding area of Oriente Expro Park, worth to visit in Lisbon, a metro access to get there,

Cool place to visit.. This is by far the best aquarium I ever visited. It is well worth the money as you'll see impressive displays of virtually all marine life.It simply is amazing. Search for Oceanário de Lisboa and purchase the tickets online. They are cheaper and you avoid the lineups. Do not miss this place. It truly is amazing.

Very good, but smaller than original thought. I was expecting a much bigger one. After I got out I can't believe it and thought I have missed something. It was a great experience and worth seeing and the money. There's a centre tank that you will be able to view after first floor and ground floor from many different wibrows. Each window provides a different angle and sometimes different types of fishes. The Smaller tanks are great too.

Well worth seeing while on a trip to Lisbon. The Oceanario was a delight to walk through. Each corner is a particular Ocean each connected to a central tank to emphasize how all the oceans are in fact one. The highlight for me was the temporary exhibition 'forests underwater' by Takashi Amano demonstrating freshwater river beds and the life that inhabits them. Accompanied by a 13 minute suite composed by Rodrigo Leão it is described as 'a perfect fusion between art and nature' and I couldn't agree more. Finally at €17 including the temporary exhibition (€14 without) I found the price to be very reasonable.

Funny fishes. My and my sister are in love with the big moony-fish. It is so ugly that we just adored it. Did not want to leave, because the big aquarium in the middle is truly enchanting; you keep on watching it! Great with kids, but also fun for adults that never want to grow up.

Amazing aquarium. The Oceanario is a very interesting aquarium. It is organized in an appealing manner, and easy to get around. It's in a nice area to explore in Lisbon so there are other sites in the same areal.

Average Visit. I do love a good aquarium but I expected more from this Oceanarium.Here are the pros as I walked away with mixed feelings on this place.- It's easy enough to get to, catch the red line Metro and get off at Oriente and its a 10 min walk from the station. You can walk across the strange bridge made of wooden pallets which is disorientating but fun!-It had plenty of written information about conservation of the ocean which is always a great thing in my book-Some great eco systems have been replicated and information supplied on these all.-It's compact and easy to navigate-Some nice species of fish, including the rarely seen Sunfish - you'll get some nice pictures of the rays and sharks by way of the enormous tank they all live in. The puffins / penguins / sea otters were also a treat for the eyesAnd now, sadly, the cons:-Expensive to get in - 14 euros per adult for the permanent exhibitions only. -Queues were crazy, I felt there should have been more staff on at peak times to cope with the volume of people visiting-It feels smaller than you think it is, don't worry if you can't initially see into the main tank because of the children and people in the way as you circle it the whole way round several times anyway. I put this as a con as the tank doesn't look big enough.-Other people - you're warned not to use flash photography but I saw countless people that blatantly ignored this, which irritated me - there was a lack of staff on duty to police this or be available for supplying information.- I saw there were videos to watch but never got to see them, too crowded and no system in place to ensure that everyone could enjoy the full information on offer.It felt hot in there constantly and very crowded, not so much the fault of the Oceanarium but I expected to see more in the way of diverse species, more information on the sea birds, seals and deep sea creatures and mammals. As it was smaller than expected, we were only in and walking around for just over an hour. A mixed bag for this big kid I'm afraid..

Lovely aftternoon out. Nice afternoon out spent wandering around the oceanarium. The range of fish on view is amazing and the central tank is wonderful, not sure if you can even call it a tank as it's so huge. Also, saw seadragons which I didn't know existed before the visit, amazing things. We saw the otter feeding time, which was literally the sea otters being fed, so not massively exciting. The video at the end was worth waiting for - it's from the 90s so a bit dated in place but it shows how they feed the various animals in the huge central tank, really fascinating. Book online for a 10% discount - the ticket you book can be used up to 120 days from date of booking so nice to fall back on if the weather fails plus you avoid the huge queue for the ticket desk. There's lockers at the entrance where you can leave you bags for a refundable e1 cost.

Great aquarium and worth the visit. If you go in the morning it will be much less busy.The aquarium was part of the world expo and they have a section for many different kinds of fish from various countries. A lot of interesting and unique fish.

Why not?. We've been recently in Lisbon for a week and we have an amazing weather, except one rainy and windy day, on which we've decided to visit the oceanarium, rated as number one things to do other there. Well we were not disappointed, but neither very impressed. Lisbon is more worth it for its heights and amazing views from the top, at least for our taste. One hint for the oceanarium, don't stop at the first 2-3 windows, it's too crowded with tourists making pictures and you have the same big aquarium all around the entire visit

Why visiting the Lisboa Oceanarium is a must. I have a travel blog (redfairyproject.com), have visited many countries and was blown away by the beauty of Lisbon. Our trip to the Oceanarium was so memorable. First, it's the biggest one in Europe which is quite impressive and second, the magic you experience there is so unique. There are so many species to discover and admire and it's a great place for kids and adults alike. The photos and videos I took show you the beauty of what awaits at this wonderful venue: http://bit.ly/1E5FIfd
One of the best aquariums. Worth spending 2 hours even if a bit out of the way. Excellent lay out and descriptions. Temporary exhibit not great value.

Calm beauty. The calm beauty of the sea life It might give a meditative experience. It also very romantic environment for couples. One of most beautiful oceanarium in the word.
Very spacious facilities with many relaxing corners.
There are also attractions for children.
However, the educational aspect is nicely in balance and not obtrusive.

great couple of hours out!. a lot to see in a small amount of space, very nice with lots of variety, however what initially seemed really big, ended up feeling rather small, finished main exhibit in less than 2 hours and that was taking a relaxed walk through with sitting down here and there and taking a fair few pictures, was amazing sights and animals, just a tad too small to make it a great day out and the temporary exhibit was tiny and not to my liking, felt like a waste, but all in all the rest of it was worth it, but if your looking for a full day out id recommend going to the zoo.
Nice with family. this is a perfect weekend program with kids. they loved it. everything is very nice and take care. I strongly recommend!

Familiarise with the sea life. Not everyone of us will have the opportunity to see, safely, from close enough a shark, a manda, or a huge sun fish. Nor see anemones or small colourful fishes...This is a chance to familiarise with unknown sea creatures that live with us on this planet.
Awesome place. One of the highlights of our trip to lisbon. The big tank in the centre is absolutely awesome. Definitely the best aquarium I've visited, some really crazy species to see

Below average. Ive visited aquariums all over the world, (see Madrid, Monaco reviews)This is not an impressive one, Not really much to see to be honestI expected more for the ticket price.Staff were non existent to ask any questions should you have anyOne very large tank which in my opinion, could have been cleaner too.

Interesting, crowds block viewig, costly. Even on a average tourist day, the views of the glassed displays are quite restrictve. Main tank is impressive, but really thats about the main attraction, and the secondary live displays are small and disappointing. The cost to tour this aquarium is really very high. 45€ for 3 people. Not worth the trip.

Good value for the money. The entrance can be a little expensive but it worth it. We "swim" inside the oceans of our world and it's easy to lose hours there just watching the fishes in their environment. There are big "ocean windows" and it's really relaxing to stay there
Not very impresive . It is one huge tanc full of water and different kind of fish. I expected more from second large oceanarium in the World.

A MUST SEE. When visiting Lisbon this is an absolutely MUST SEE attraction. There were many visitors when we visited but we were still able to see all we wished to. Have visited other aquariums which do not even come close to matching this spectacle.

Very enjoyable. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here both children & adults. Visited on a Tuesday afternoon & there was a very small queue & not too overcrowded. Reasonable price (you can pay for both exhibitions or just the main one) and good facilities. Main exhibition is laid out well & very impressive with a huge central 'tank' containing a large array of fish, sharks,rays etc. as well as areas with birds & otters. Overall a very enjoyable & interesting day out - worth a visit.
Almost as diving. Large sealife pool allows you to take impressive photographs of sharks, rays, sunfish etc. Do not miss the qute feeding otters.

Only the real sea is more beautiful. This is great! Really beautiful, many very beautiful fishes. Well balanced, schools of fishes, Although there were many people present, this never was a problem; everything was good to see. The Large aquarium was situated in the centre and could be seen very well.

It's not an Aquarium...it's an Oceanarium!. Huge variety of animal sea species, with great conditions to all the animal and plants. The internal conditions are great and present you with an amazing experience to the childrens. Don't miss it!
Far better than expected. We really only went to see the puffins - which we did - but were impressed at the size of the place - great fro adults as well as kids.

Not to be missed. Being a professional in Travel industry and a hobbyist in aquarium/ aquascaping I admire this place. The visit simply takes you in the undewater world. So much better than many other places (visited a lot of aquariums around the globe). You can spend one hour there but it does require at least 90-120 minutes if you want to enjoy and relax.
It's ok, but I've seen better. For a rainy day this is a nice trip. It's on the hop on hop off route. The Aquarium it self is average though. I truly have seen better. Bathrooms could be cleaner
Fun visit for us adults too!. The four of us thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. The only aquarium we've enjoyed more is the one in Genova. But this one was totally worth the visit.
FISHIES!!!!. Loved it!! It does get busy but that doesnt matter because you can go around the tanks at your own pace. Its a nice and peaceful way to get out of the hot sun and rewind for an afternoon

Good presentation. The partly very large aquariums are very well presented from different angles and perspectives. Building with interesting modern architecture, surounded by an artificial pond. We missed outside-basins for dolphins etc.

Fun and education for all. I'm a sucker for aquariums and wasn't disappointed in Lisbon's offering. A fascinating visit all around, both educational and fun, so much so, that I really felt like a kid again. Very professional and friendly staff, facilities were great and the place really seemed to get the balance between geared towards children and adults. Don't go to Lisbon without visiting this place!

Great aquarium- even without the kids. This is a great aquarium. Be sure to ride the telecabines on your way over to get a great view of the Parque das Nacoes and the River. The bus can take you straight from the Praca do Comercio to the Aquarium. It is well-worth the trip.

Worth visiting. For those who know them, this is a mix of the national marine aquarium in Plymouth and the Eden Project. Both the permanent aquarium and the temporarily exhibition. Something for al ages to enjoy

Great fun, but buy the tickets ahead for no queues and a 10% discount!!!!. My hubby and I had a great day at the Oceanario De Lisboa yesterday. We got our tickets way up ahead nice and cheap while we were in London from their website. We did not have to select a date. We just had to use them within a month. We got 10% discount off and it was very straightforward. We printed the tickets at home and brought them with us. We jumped past a huge queue that were waiting to buy the full price tickets and got ushered straight through. Sweet!!! The place was absolutely charming. I recommend trying to be at the front when the Otters are being fed. They are so fun to watch. We loved the way the place is laid out and the variety of really well kept animals you can see. It takes a while to get around though. It took us about 3 hours. It was Worth the money.

Worth the Wait. My husband and I arrived on a rainy afternoon and the line outside was long, but the line moved quickly and we waited no more than 10-15 minutes. It was well worth the wait! The permanent exhibit area is very well organized, with arrows pointing in the direction of each next section. The Aquarium did not disappoint, and has multiple opportunities to view the fish inside, so there is no need to spend too long at the very first viewpoint. There were several types of ocean life inside the main aquarium tank that I have never seen before, including sunfish and guitar fish. The signs explaining the various types of fish are in both Portuguese and English and are well spaced out throughout the building. The side exhibits are arranged by habitat/area of the world, tropical, sections of the Pacific, Atlantic, Indian oceans, etc, and a section on amphibians. The otters and penguins were especially cute! There is also an emphasis on conservation throughout the exhibits, which I greatly appreciated. It was worth the wait in line and the price of admission, which is 14 Euro for an adult for the permanent exhibit, plus an extra 3 for the Temporary exhibit. There were many many young children there, and they seemed to really enjoy themselves and were absorbed by what they were learning. It took my husband and I about 2 and a half hours to see everything.

A Quality Aquarium. A good choice to visit on a rainy day as we did. Definitely a place to visit if you have kids with you. Get there early to avoid the crowds. As a photographer I found the exhibits difficult to photograph due to wide-ranging lightening conditions, scratches on the Plexiglas, water bubbles, and people camping out in front of the exhibits. Nonetheless, I came away with what appear to be some great shots.Before leaving, we relaxed in the cafeteria with a nice bowl of soup. Tip for women: use the WC in the cafeteria and avoid the very long line at the main WC.

A great day out.. Located out of town in the area built for the expo, this is by far the best Oceanarium/Aquarium we have ever visited. Spent a very enjoyable 3 hrs or so going round this well organised and well presented place.

one of the best things to do in Lisbon. really a must-see! the biggest aquarium in Europe - you can see sharks, ocean sunfish, coral reefs... a bit of everything! Worth taking about 3 hours and have a lunch break in the restaurant to rest, then go back for another hour or so for a final tour

Big aquarium, nice location, good quality. It does what it says on the tin - a big aquarium in a statement building in a nice location by the river. Easy to get to on the metro, its near a big shopping centre and there are other things in the area - a cable car, science museum and dining options. The 'wow' factor comes from the huge central ocean tank with some cool fish which you keep seeing as you go round.

Excellent experience. It is amazing! There is beauty everywhere. You are going to learning about some species and you can see them right there. I think it is a good deal for children. You can take pictures inside, but you shouldn't use flash. You can buy the tickets in advanced, obtaining some discount. The view around is amazing too.

Amazing place to visit and learn. Huge quantity of animals. Very good venue.
Staff very professional.
I had a great time with a friend there.
Bring confortable shoes and patience. More than 1h30 to visit it all.
Worth the entry price.

i was expecting it to be bigger. The Oceanarium is located at Oriente station, so from downtown you would need to take the subway to get there. then, from the subway station, there's a walk of about 15 mins to actually get to it.From the outside it seems big and impressive, however inside it's not that big. there is one main huge tank with fish from all 4 oceans, and the tour is basically around it. There are a few habitats for penguins and sea otters at 2nd level, while at level 1 there are small aquariums with fish, octopus etc. What i found very nice and soothing is that as you go round the huge tank, there are sitting areas (a lot of them). When i visited i wasn't feeling well, so siting there in the dark and watching the tank was a very soothing experience for me. Price of 14 euros seems a bit much. However, if you catch the feeding times for the penguins or sea otters, it's a nice show.

One of my top Lisboa experiences. This place is great way to spend time observing ocean creatures. The oceanario is 5 min from the bus stop. A bit away from the other main attractions but still worth visiting. The ticket is 14eur and you can get 10% student discount. It takes 3-4 hours easily, so when you go, be mindful of the closing time. Watching the penguins and sea otters was so relaxing. I would recommend it to children and adults alike.
Oceanario. Interesting. You learn a lot! not the biggest I have seen. But a rainy day it is a good place to visit

Great place. I just loved the Oceanarium, great place to be and enjoy a day out. Very clean and easy to reach. A place to relax and get to know species from all over the world. Great for children education.
sea. One of the biggest . Enter the underwater world and enjoy the wonders of the sea. Forget where you are and what you just relax. Trust is an amazing experience

Stunning. better than any aquarium/oceanariums that I have ever visited previously. Easy access by train and metro. Queue formed early but did not get unduly long during our visit. Take your time. Absorb and be absorbed.

A nice place, but not really number one.. The aquarium is clean and there are many different areas from around the globe. The place was so crowded it was hard to see many of the displays. There also didn't seem to be much action in a few of the tanks. So, a nice place, kind of pricey, but not the number one attraction in Lisbon. So many other sites are better and cost less.

birthday and family trip. very educational, ecological and environmentally planned. I really enjoyed it.There was also an interactive area for young children which we didn't go into but saw a lot of people with young kids.
Amazing!. The Oceanario promised to be one of the best in Europe and it didn't disappoint! We loved every aspect from the variety of animals to the price. A great day out for everyone.

Best Oceanarium ever. Fab Oceanarium...the Otters are a must see. They even have puffins flying around indoors. The big central tank is brilliant. They dont give much information about the fish so some stuff you need to google. We stayed in lisbon and got a taxi out. There's also a cable car outside to view the marina.

Superb. The whole family really enjoyed the place
The view is splendid
A must do in family
The cafeteria inside the place is very nice and convenient we you have finished the visit and you're tired it is on the way out!
Nice with a push chair

Oceanario 👍. The first thing to note is the oceanario is slightly out of the centre of Lisbon but easy to get to especially if you have purchased a travel pass .We found it a great way to spend a couple of hours on a day mixed with rain and sunshine .I wouldn't say the tickets are cheap but if your kids are interested in nature they will love it - each of the sections is well displayed with every detail covered and the mixture of ocean life is amazing.It's one of the biggest and most detailed we have visited - top of the list of things to do ???? Perhaps in the top 5⭐️

The best aquarium we have been to. Very big, very well designed and an absolutely fantastic place to visit if you have young children. Our daughter was absolutely captivated and we really enjoyed it too. A must for a visit to Lisbon. It's also worth walking around the area as there are some great restaurants and an enormous shopping centre.

Not cheap, but must do.. The biggest aquarium in Europe, and that's no lie. 2 floors, with a lot of side activities. The main aquarium and the fish in it are really overwhelming. A must when you visit with kids, but also very recommendable for adults!

A lovely day trip. I appreciate that there are not dolphins or killer whales here as they are very unhappy in captivity. We took our 2 year-old son here about a year ago and he really enjoyed it. The exhibits were clean and well laid-out. Unfortunately there were some tourists that thought it was ok to use flash photography despite all of the warnings not to do so. The sunfish was really neat to see. It was a great day trip from where we were staying out near Sintra. Lot of room for strollers and plenty of places to sit along the way and enjoy the views of fish and other aquatic wildlife.

..that´s it?. I do not think that the Oceanario belonged the first place in the "to do list" in Lisbon. Oceanario seems to me nice but quite small and even if you find species that you have not seen before( and that ´s great! :) ... walk through it and you will feel like ... that's it?

Amazing scenery!. If you like nature, you will be very impressed by Oceanario! Seeing so many species, swimming at a few meters near you is breathtaking! I had to wait around 30 minutes to get in, but believe me, it was totally worth it!

Best Aquarium I have seen!. The way they have this aquarium is amazing. They have a huge main aquarium you are able to experience many times as you visit the other exhibits and learn about all the oceans. Throughly enjoyed the visit.
Wonderful !. Wonderful experience giving an insight into sealife round the world. Amazing for all ages to get upclose to fish that most people will never encounter!

Nice way to spend an hour or two. Oceanario de Lisboa is situated in Oriente, quite far from old part of the town (Baixa and Alfama), but it's still worth visiting. Inside you'll find big "Ocean" with plenty of different species. Around it there are smaller aquariums divided on 4 oceans with different climate conditions. All of them are finished in every detail and with good descriptions. Although tickets are expensive, this is a good way to spend few hours (especially when it's raining).
Impressive very large aquarium . It's build around an impressive and very large aquarium where lots of sharks and other fishes are swimming but that's it... Don't really worth it's status...

Great for the kids. If you are looking for a family trip in Lisboa the aquarium is a good place to visit. My kids loved it and we spend a couple of hours there. Once you enter the aquarium there is no food or drink to buy. Just remeber that. It's in the middle of an area where they had the world expo in 98. It's a little bit sad to see that there is not enough money to keep the area in shape.The aquarium is easy reachable with the subway. There is also a shopping center between the subway station and the aquarium which has also a food court.
Only with kids. Fine but not that spectacular. Guess it would only be worth the visit with young kids - a bit remote from city center

Small and there is not a big varierty of fishes and sea animals. There are very nice discoveries : such as the impressive sunshine fish or the guitarfish or the dragon seahorse. But it's quite small and there aren't the big oceanic fishes and other sea species we would have expected (dolphins, killer whale, turtles, more species of penguins...)
Fantastic. Oceanario is an amazing place to visit in Lisbon, specially if you are travelling with children. They will love it for sure.

Fish!. Apparently the second largest aquarium in the world. We stayed about 2 hrs. Enjoyed watching the sun fish. Not many big fish cf (say) Atlanta. The first few viewing areas were packed, move past them to quieter areas, including seating. Also enjoyed walking around the area, had a great sushi buffet for €15 in one of the restaurants close by (stopped serving at 1500). Got the metro out there ~15 mins?
Visit the ocean. Wonderfull, amazing, profound, introspective.. an opportunity to visit the deep sea and it's secrets.

Worth a visit!. Great size, great presentation. You have benches along the trail so you can sit and gaze at the underwater world. Plan 1,5-2 hrs. Our kids of 4-13 y.o. enjoyed a lot. It was my second time there and I am glad I brought my family over this time.

Pleasant . It's a very enjoyable place with plenty of restaurants and a mall right outside. Great day trip. If possible, try to avoid going there if you see high-school students on a field trip. They'll be too noisy and ruin your experience.

Amazing day trip. I went to the aquarium as part of a trip for my 30th birthday!! It was fantastic. The design of the aquarium is great, with a massive central tank and parts coming off of it. The wealth of marine life was truly fantastic.
I thought it was a great trip and would definitely recommend going!

Good for rainy days. The Oceanario is nice, but not amazing. Compared to the other big Aquarium in Europe in Burgers Zoo/Netherlands it is really not very good. You can definetly go if its raining and you have nothing to do, it is still quite amazing due to the size but it is not a "must see" in Lisbon

Aquarium not to be missed . Stayed for hours and was captivated the whole time. School visits going on at the same time so patience needed if you're an old fogey like me. Plenty for all ages to see and the cafe outside was very handy when we were trapped by a thunderstorm.All the explanations were in English and Portuguese. Not quite as good as Barcelona but definitely worth the entrance fee.
Spectacular. When you visit Lisbon you must see Oceanario. A beautiful afternoon surrounded by animals from all over the world. Worth 14 Euro !!!

Amazing but expensive . Very good job, detailed and very interesting , you will be able to learn not only for the Atlantic Ocean but for pacific, Antarctic, Arctic as well. The big central aquarium is just amazing and if you try to stay close to the glass you feel you are in the ocean hearing the sounds and seeing many different kinds of fishes. Interesting as well the video they show for all this daily job. The only disadvantage is the price of the ticket which is expensive. Recommended specially for families.
Oceanarium. Excellent huge tank at centre of visit. Sea otters very cute. Display notes in english. A bit busy downstairs
Great attraction. family of four really enjoyed the aquarium. It is very well laid out and the various exhibits are of high quality. The central aquarium is spectacular.
