Very well designed. This a great way to get up close to a wide variety of sea life of all shapes and sizes. There are great viewing points as you descend around the massive tank. There are also many other smaller tanks with special species. Well worth a visit with discount for seniors.

15 years old and still young!!. One of the most successful aquariums! Combines pure beauty of the marine world and learning about the oceans. An excellent museum that allows to visit four oceans around a huge central basin.

Lots of dead fish. I expected more from reading reviews about the oceanario but I was a bit disappointed. There weren't that many different species or exhibits and several of the animals including cuttlefish and jellyfish were dead. Not that great.

More to see than expected. The oceanario in lisbon seems t be a very popular place to visit and it was quite crowded. It is not a huge place but had a greater variety of creatures than i was expecting, including penguins and sea otters - very cute.

The Oceanarium was awesome!. I could have stayed all day and watched the otters. They are so smart. The sea turtles in the glass thing you walk on and can sit at and look down was very cool. The huge walls of tanks to see in was unbelievable. Very peaceful place to go and spend time.
Fishy. Good value and plenty to see. Is pretty child friendly as well. Good chances to photograph all the specimens.
Great. You learn a lot about the oceans of our planet, see fantastic, colourful fish and can face sharks. Interesting and exciting.

Great Family Attraction. We’ve been to several large aquariums and this is one of our favorites. Huge central tank is very impressive! The sea otters were a huge hit for our youngster! He is still talking about it 3 weeks later. Good location close to the metro and train station.

Fantastic. Fantastic tanks and fish, all displays are excellent. Very reasonable too. Worth a visit to Lisbon, just to go here.I think it's worth the cost, since it's a beautiful place and well preserved! If you have time go to see the temporary exhibition available!
Amazing and Beautiful. This was one of the highlights of our trip. I could have stayed for hours and hours, it was simply so magnificent

Loved it!. It is almost impossible to visit Lisbon without going to the Oceanário!The children loved it and being able to see all the sea life in such great environment! If tired there always some sofas or benches where we can sit down and appreciate the views! Excellent location and after the visit it is possible to go for a walk and enjoy the sun!
Done very well. They show several different ocean environments. It is larger than it first appeared. We enjoyed this exhibit.

Magical experience . I thought that this attraction was overrated and mainly for kids but I was really impressed by its beauty. You could easily stay 30 minutes watching the fish in the giant aquarium.

Excellent attraction and good value for money. Great place situated beside the sea on the Expo 98 complex. This a must if you visit Lisbon. It will keep you and the children busy and interested for a couple of hours. The ticket price is reasonable, the layout is very good indeed and the main central tank is the size of four Olympic swimming pools. We had a great day out.

Half the price of the zoo and absolutely incredible experience (see photos!). The Oceanarium is conveniently located near the Oriente metro station (on the red line to the airport.) Coming off the metro, follow the signs for the "Vasco da Gama" shopping mall (large mall with dozens and dozens of stores, cafes and a movie theatre!) Walk through the shopping mall, cross the street and head straight towards the ocean, and then turn right. Admission is 14 euros, but a family discount is available for 36 euros (two adults and two children.) The main aquarium tank is absolutely huge and contains a variety of species of devil-fish, sunfish, stingrays, sharks, etc. There were so many different fish, and angles to view the tank that you could literally spend hours just there. Our kids particularly enjoyed the penguin exhibit, which was very popular. The Oceanairum also contains a gift shop (10% discount with your receipt) and a popular cafe. For those needing it, there is a lift/elevator inside. TIP: After your visit, consider taking a ride on the cable car, which is just literally 50 meters outside the front door. A round-trip ticket gives a beautiful view of the coastline and sea, and you will usually have a "car" all to yourself. Enjoy!
Very beautiful. Although rather expensive entryrates, this aquarium is very beautiful and a must-see if the weather is not OK.

Definitely worth the visit for anyone that likes science!. Fairly easy to get to and worth the visit. I was surprised at how educational the entire place was. They don't just have things for you to look at, they talk about what things are and how we all need to change to protect our oceans. Worth a trip, very cool

Average really.... Spent less than an hour here and we had exhausted all there was to see. Nothing spectacular and many displays repeated. Quite small in size and no touching pool like I've seen at other aquariums before. €14 for adults. Gift shop at end very expensive. Only go if you've got time to spare. There's better things to see and do in Lisbon!
Great!. A huge aquarium! Really a good place to visit with kids or without. Quite a few fish roam the scene, small, big , huge, and size or form,,they are here.

Fascinating insights into the life of the oceans. You could spend hours here, but even in the 1.5 hours we had available we saw and learned a lot. The central tank can be seen from many different angles and two levels, there is plenty of information to help you identify the creatures and learn more about their habitats. Some of the creatures are truly amazing, including the sunfish and some of the corals and jellyfish. The sea otters are especially cute. At 14euros per adult, it is worth spending as much time here as you can. It's some way out of town, but the hop-on-off buses drop you close by, and the metro is not far away. If you have time, you can also explore the huge shopping mall and the cable car nearby.

Excellent. I was a bit skeptical at first when my hubby wanted to visit this oceanarium. But I'm glad we did. The place didn't look that big but there was so much to see. It was very organized and well maintained. One of the highlights were the sea otters. Spent a good afternoon here.

Wonderful. We thoroughly ejoyed the visit .. Connectedness is a great concept. Check at your hotel, many provide the tickets in advance at a 10% discount - 2 advantages discount, plus skip the line walk right in. At the entrance are lockers. You will need a 1 Euro piece. Small gift shop upstairs - buy something here and you get a 15% discount in the large gift shop. Enjoy!!!
Nice place to visit. Great place to spend time - really worth to visit. The main aquarium is huge and one can see it from many places around on two levels. Very well thought.

Worth a visit, not fabulous and buy advance tickets.. The Oceanario is well done with a single large tank with viewing from 2 levels. There are 4 side tanks which allow them diversity in their exhibits. It was very clean and we noticed divers cleaning inside the tanks the day we visited. While they have a lot of fish I thought their variety was limited and it was not outstanding.Purchase your tickets in advance to save money and skip the lines. You can purchase the tickets without committing to a specific day, which gives you flexibility. The dayvwevwent, the Oceanario was very crowded and you had to stand two and three deep in the viewing areas.Take the metro to Orient, walk through the mall, go to the waterfront and turn right. Just keep walking. You have to walk past the modern style building to find the entrance and it is not well marked.
Amazing aquarium. One of the largest one and well-managed one I've ever seen.Look out for the cheeky otters pausing for photos whilst swimming on their back!
Amazing. I've been to the oceanario 4 times already and it never gets boring! There are sharks, mantas tuna etc in one big basin! feels like being under sea :)
Great Aquarium. Definitely worth a visit if in Lisbon. Not the best aquarium I have been to (I love aquariums) but it is very good.

It was just okay..... My boyfriend and I went during a rainy day in April. It was a good activity to do indoors. As far as aquariums go, it's pretty average. If you've been to an aquarium in the US, then you probably won't really be impressed. There are no marine mammals, just fish. I did like that it was divided up by the different oceans, and it was pretty informative. There's a strong conservation message, which would be good for kids and educating them.
The best experience. I have never seen such a well maintained and amazing natural place to learn about the beauty of our oceans. Totally recommended, not just for kids but for adults as well.

One of the most beautiful aquariums of the world!. When you enter at Oceanário, you will go deep inside the sea world and it seems that you are at the bottom of the sea surrounded by the wonderful sea creatures

Go see the sea otters!. This is an amazing aquarium! It is possible to stand in front of the main tank which is absolutely huge for a very long time and still keep seeing different things. You can walk round the tank and it is three floors high so you get to see lots of different angles.Then there are the puffins, the penguins and the tropical fish. And the sea otters which are possibly the cutest animals I have ever seen. I was a bit sceptical about whether we would see them at all but there they were, two of them, being excessively cute!Then there were things in other tanks that I had never seen before and didn't know existed. Check out the weird sea dragons and the sea nettles.It is good value as well!

Perfectly done, well kept ... but .... I strongly oppose holding any kind of animals in captivity!Undoubtedly this structure is really breathtaking in any aspect. Instructive, organized to perfection. A film about Oceanario was also very helpful ... but ...I never visit ZOOs, no matter how well kept they may be. I feel such sorrow seeing poor animals living far away from their natural habitat. The same applies to sea parks with dolphins and Oceanario (in my opinion) is in the same category of organizations. Wouldn't it be better if all inhabitants of Oceanario could live where they belong?At least for them.

Typical aquarium with grumpy teenage staff!. I absolutely love aquariums and this place was fantastic (though there weren't any turtles, always a disappointment!). We also had lunch here which was reasonably priced and seemed fresh, but the staff in the cafeteria were super grumpy! If you can laugh a bad attitude off the meal was nice, but it was like walking into a morgue. The oceanarium however was super, and relatively cheap to others I've visited in Spain and Germany (about 14 euro for an adult).

Good aquarium but very busy. We visited on Easter Monday and had our daughter in her pushchair. The weather on the day wasn't particularly good which probably pushed everyone to the indoor activities. That being said, every part of the aquarium was busy and we had to push through to allow our daughter to see anything. There was nowhere to leave an item as large as a pushchair and whenever we asked a member of staff they weren't helpful. On the other hand, our daughter had a good time and loved pointing at all of the fish and saying "look, another one ... look, another one ... look, another one" A LOT!

Great for adults & kids. Visited in March with my grown up daughter and we both loved it. Very well planned aquarium with a superb large central tank, also some very nice bird exhibitions. As has been mentioned it is a bit expensive but is well worth it. One area they do fall down on is the gift shop, little more than a kiosk really, such a good exhibition. Deserves a better shop, but other than that , first class.
Excellent Experience. We have been to this Oceanario a number of times now. It is a good experience for all family members. A great atmosphere with lots to see.

Good place to go with the kids. We visited it in march. They have a lot of different species, from all over the word. A great water tank in the middle hosts large fishes and all around it you'll find areas with smaller tanks and smaller artificial environment created for them. I was fascinated by the jelly fishes they have. A lot of kids inside and all of them were delighted!
2teens. Brilliant ...with a visit...get metro out to orient...entry a bit expensive.but top class....teenagers loved it...also big shopping centre beside it

A place that teaches to respect nature. The only however I noticed at Oceanarium, was the lack of access options for seniors and people with mobility problems because there is a big distance from the box office up to the main entrance to the Oceanarium .The interior of the museum is literally a visit to the bottom of the sea in providing proximity sensations with the sea and its inhabitants. The location is very clean and well signposted . An enriching experience for all ages .

Great oceanarium & beautiful architecture. Lisbon has many nice things to see and to do, but if I could only visit one tourist attraction, this would be it. The entry fee (15€) is reasonable and it wasn't too crowded. Located on the ground of the 1998 world fair with some beautiful modern architecture and easy too reach by metro

Wonderful variety of aquatic life and very visitor-friendly. There is a wonderful assortment of fish in a central huge tank which is surrounded by displays for all sorts of aquatic life with explanations that are very easy to understand. I usually don't like to spend a lot of time at exhibits, but this place was so well-designed and interesting that we spent 3 hours without getting tired of it. We also saw a lot of families enjoying it, which added to the pleasure.

Great experience. Big tank full of different sea creatures was extremely interesting, taking fotos was easy because of many possiblities to take fotos (lower/higher levels). Suitable also for smaller children, great views.
don't miss it!. One of the greatest city attraction, great for families with kids.Expo is also a great place to enjoy.

Compact but well done. Relatively small museum, but well worth a visit. One main tank with 4 outliers representing different oceans. Nothing really unique but definitely worth a visit--takes about an hour & half to tour. Area outside of Lisbon is all modern with great architecture. Take the metro to Oriente.

Really cool, but takes more time than expected. Went here on a Tuesday afternoon, and had a great time. The oceanario was recommended to me by a couple of friends as being a top highlight in Lisbon, and I was not disappointed.By going in the afternoon, we were able to see the otters being fed, and enjoyed the bright sunlight coming through the upper windows into some of the exhibits. I definitely suggest bringing water and/or snacks, especially if you have kids. Unlike most places in Portugal, there was no opportunity for a coffee break. We probably rushed through the last 3 rooms and were surprised that the exhibit went on for so long.That said, the exhibits were very, very impressive. Very organized, very well-presented, with good information. I would definitely go back to this again. Note: this place might not be great for someone who doesn't like dark spaces or who has vertigo. The entire exhibit is built around the aquarium, which is several stories high. On the bottom floor, where there is little natural light, the glass can be a bit disorienting. Still, if that's not a concer for you, I highly recommend adding this to you itinerary.

Recommended!. Lovely clean, spacious area to spend the afternoon. Big tank in the middle which is the centre piece of the Aquarium, with some fascinating fish/mamals . The staff are hot to stop people taking photos with flashed which shows the animals are well cared for. The sea otters were just adorable, I could have just sat there and watched them for hours. All the animals have lots of room to explore. It wasn't busy so we could really enjoy it, i expect during the holiday season it would be a night mare!!

nicely organised and spectacular fishes. if around in Lisbonne you should spend couple of hours in this place situated 20mn from the city center. Huge building by the sea ina new area closed to the vasco gama tower. many fish in a big tank frommanta fish to sharks.... and many other varieties. good organistion like Disney Land. one way trafic.
A Great Place To Visit. We enjoyed our visit to Oceanario de Lisboa. The huge tank was amazing with a great variety of fish to be seen. We especially loved the two Sunfish.

Great when not busy. We enjoyed our afternoon here, but did wonder if the Oceanarium would be a better experience if the route visitors followed was changed - eg. to start from the bottom and work upwards to end after the otters and puffins at the top. It was fairly quiet when we visited (at 11pm on a Monday), but could see it would have been too crowded had we not beaten the large school trip that arrived as we left...

Lots of animals. This is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon. There is a big tank in the middle of the Oceanário that gathers lots of fishes (even sharks!). I could spend hours watching them. You can also find rare animals like ocean fishes, different types of jellyfishes, colourful anemones...

Okay but not a must - see.... I love aquariums so I made a special effort to get to this one but I was a little disappointed. There are a lot of fish and I enjoyed seeing them but I didn't feel that they were any different to any other aquarium I have been too. That said, there was an octopus which was pretty cool. There was quite a bit of reading material in English which is nice but even after reading all of them, I was only there for an hour and a half so it entirely depends on what sort of day you have planned. It is nice but the entry price is 14 euros and therefore I don't think it is incredible value for money.
Amazing!!!. If you are in Lisboa, you will have to visit this place. It's totally crazy and amazing - you can spend there more than half day watching the sealife and feel like a real diver!!!

This place is fantastic for both adults and children alike. One massive central tank with all kinds of fish, sharks and rays in, with other smaller tanks round the other edges showing other ocean environments and its sealife within. There are plenty of areas to sit and watch life in the tank real close and personal. Sea otters are way too cute and definately not camera shy. Pengins are just as cheeky. All very informative, with pictures so you are able to identify which fish/sharks/rays are what. Smaller tanks hold seahorses, jellyfish and various other sea creatures.You don't have to worry about not seeing anything due to so many seating/viewing areas which give you a 360 view of all the tank. This is a real must visit attraction and if you book online via their website http://www.oceanario.pt you get a discount.

A world apart!. If there's a spot you can't miss when you visit Lisbon is this one!The diversity of fauna amazing,the way the staff keeps all this immense complex is something they should be proud of!All the habitats are well labeled and animals are in great condition.In my humble opinion this is something your kids (and you) going to remember forever.

Magical. We felt like kids walking around this huge aquarium and feeling amazed at all the beautiful creatures especially when standing in front of the huge tank at the center of the building, what a 5 star show!

A fantastic day out - just hard work with a pushchair. the lifts are hidden away and you need a member of staff to let you through which seems a little unnecessary. A fab day out for little ones - but miss the cafe - it was worse than school dinners!
Great place to visit with kids!. The fish in the big tank are amazing! Very worth it the different species along the walk keep you very interested.

Walking through the Oceans!. Its a very nice experience for kids and adults. All the information is well distributed and the connection with some animals is excellent, specially the otters.
A must go for tourists and a must go for locals, at least once in five-ten years.
Under the Sea. This is a beautiful space for sea lovers. You can relax and enjoy the under water scenaries for as long as you want. All type of fish seem to live in perfect harrmony. Refreshing!
Great experience. Well, I've never been to an oceanarium, so when I knew there was one there, I went. It was brilliant, many explanations, species divided by oceans, nice to see that!

Captivating experience at Oceanario de Lisboa. The Oceanarium at Parque Das Nacoes is a must see attraction when visiting Lisbon. We enjoyed an afternoon after having had lunch in the canteen there, which itself was good value. The oceanarium comprises one very large tank, seem from multiple places/ viewpoints, with fish of many types, shapes and colours, plus smaller tanks for other types of flora and fauna - eg, small blue jungle frog and dragon fish. The place is popular with people of all ages, tourists and Portuguese alike. There are no dolphins but rays and sharks, groupers, sun fish, yellow fin tuna, and many other species. Parques das Nacoes has plenty of other attractions to fill a day's visit. It is a completely different scene to Lisbon city and is reached by the underground and several buses - recommend the underground!
Nice. Modern building in a very modern area. The Aquarium shows many different fishes, and the jelly fish tanks are beautiful, the kids loved the day at the aquarium.
Nice place!. A nice place to spend a couple of hours. I was expecting a lot more after reading reviews but their huge tank was amazing so it was worth it.
Lovely experience. For kids and for grown ups, a must. Do not miss the wonderful moon - or sun - fish, and the mesmerising sea dragoons. Not to mention the delightful otters.

One of the Best Aquariums To-date. I thought this aquarium was on-par with some of the best I've ever seen. Definitely up there with Osaka's world-class aquarium. If you're in the area, it's definitely worth the 14 euro to see it.

Great place to spend an afternoon. I spent a rainy afternoon in the oceanario and it was great. There was a huge variety of fish and animals on display. The exhibits gave facts on all the fish which was really interesting. The exhibits also mentioned the threats faced by each of the species. I thought this was a really good feature because I learned a lot about the risks faced by these animals and it will make me a lot more conscious of the threats humans pose to the fish.

Good aquarium. We really enjoy aquariums and this has to be up there as one of the better ones. Good selection of fish, nice giant tank and the other sea animals such as the super cute sea otters make a pleasant difference from your standard aquariums.Located in a up and coming area so a good few things to do in the surrounding area

Unbelievable!. I'm so happy that we went there. It was not cheapiest thing to do (about 14 euros per person) but absolutely worth it. Biggest aquarium is so cool and there are so many different fishes (shark and sunfish was coolest).Best thing at this place that everything was perfect. It was clean, modern etc. You should see this!

Bit of a hike but our youngster loved it. The aquarium is about 20 minutes from the main square in a regenerated zone built for a world fair. The aquarium was pretty fun with a massive central pool with plenty of interesting fish. Our 4 year old thought the penguins and sharks were great.There is also a very smart shopping centre and plenty of space by the waterfront to do cycilng or take the cable car. However it is a collection of large modern buildings by a lagoon so not a picturesque area.

Save it for a rainy day :). If you've been to Sea World or any similar place in the United States this won't blow your mind. However, it is still worth visiting if you have the time, especially on a rainy day. Highly recommend it on any given day if you're going with children because they will be amazed. The penguins and the otter were quite entertaining. Also, the huge glass wall where the sharks and other fishes show off is amusing too.
Fantastic. Well worth a visit if not only to see the sea-otters!! Situated in a lovely new part of Lisbon, plenty of restaurants to choose from after a day at the Oceanario!
First class attraction. We visited this attraction in February and were blown away. A first class attraction, we would strongly recommend it.

Wonderful way to spend day. This is an amazing complex. You can wander around and look, watch , sit and relax, learn . So many things to see , but it is possible to see it all in one visit . Lots of space outside to relax and enjoy the day and the water inside and out . So many fish - so little time .
Great for the family. Huge shark in main water tank was a great hit. loved the different continent habitats, quite educational.
Nice tour. It was nice to see but nothing that blew me away. Could absolut recomend it if its grey wheather a day and I think its great for families with kids :)

Fantastic Aquarium. This was one of the most fun things to do with the kids in Lisbon.
If you like nature and learn something more about it, you have to come here.

relaxing. The Oceanario is situated in a nice modern area were you can spend half day: on the ocean proximity with a cable cabin along the water, the interesting Oriente train an metro station, water fountains with urban design, pic-nick facility, walking and cycling zones, restaurants and cafes.The aquarium itself holds many species and it it quite relaxing a walk among them, although there were some who didn't look very happy in the created environment.It deserves a visit in the whole urban space to spend a few relaxing hours.

Unmissable. From Oriente you enter a Lisbon of unexpected scale. The bay is huge beyond expectation and the Tagus second bridge extends to the horizon. Then there's the cable car and finally the Oceanarium on its artificial island. Yes, getting there is part of the fun. The oceanarium is everything others have said. It is astonishing in its size and variety. To be even more amazed, watch the video to see how it all works, from the controlled environments to operating on fish out of water! Watch and marvel.

The wow factor Aquarium. What an amazing experience and definitely worth a visit. The range of ocean life available for view and the quality of the setting is only surpassed by diving/snorkeling the seven seas for real...
Very impressive. Well worth a visit. The huge fishtank (one of the biggest in Europe) shows you a massive variety of marine life, passing by at 5 feet of your face.
Nice attraction, especially for kids!. Very nice aquarium. Many sorts of species. Kids will really love it. I thought it was larger though. It should take no more than two hours to see it all.
Perfect for rainy days. The Oceanario in Lisbon is quite amazing, even though it is always a bit sad to see animals in captivity. Many kids - they loved it.

Beautiful aquarium. Great way to spend hour. This tank is huge, biggest I ever seen, you can see different angle from different floors. Truly magnificent and fishes, birds and penguins looks very happy. You can tell they are well look after, in huge space and feel a bit freedom. Definitely worth the price we paid. I love this.
Beautiful well laid out very interesting.. Huge assortment of fish etc saw different fish and sea creatures that I'd never heard of . Got awesome photos.

Just Fantastic!. It is a crime to not visit the Oceanarium if you're visiting Lisbon for the first time. We absolutely enjoyed our visit. We were amazed by the diversity of the aquatic life! Totally recommended, specially if you have Kid.

Astonishing. I like my fish on a plate, thank you, so hadn't expected to enjoy this place. But it was simply amazing. My wife and I spent two hours here, and could happily have stayed much longer. On the outside, the building looks nothing special - inside, though, it's astonishing. The design is quite brilliant. For the most part the visitor walks round a single large central tank, but it's been so thoughtfully planned that it's more like seeing several dozen different habitats. I still can't work out why the sharks didn't eat the sea-otters...My one grumble is a minor one, but should be so obvious to the management: the shop has almost no guidebooks in English (or French, or Spanish), yet on the day we were there probably 95% of the visitors were from outside Portugal. This should be a no-brainer.
Fish-and-shark buffs will love this. The central aquarium with its multiple viewing windows offers an otherworldly view. You are totally swept into the immensity and peace of the place. Amazing!

:). Such a lovely place, plenty of fish & animals to learn about. The penguins and otters were our favourites. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Lisbon. Very easy to get to via the metro.

Interesting Theme. What I liked most about the Oceanarium was that it's structured around a theme. So there's sections that represent the aquatic life of the four oceans - Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Antartic - and a very big central section that encompasses all these oceans. The visit is very well organised so you don't miss anything and get a taste of the varied aqua life in these four oceans. The signage and text is clear and readable and well-written without being long and tedious. They also have some cool programs like 'Sleep with the Sharks' for kids which are worth checking our for travellers with young ones. Expect about 1.5-2 hours for the visit.The only downside was that its expensive at 14 euros a person, and makes me question if it was worth it.

Really well designed. This is a really nice aquarium, set out well, with a clear route to take through. Easy to navigate with a buggy.Lovely big tank which you can see from all sides. Lots of interesting inhabitants expecially the octopus.

A must see for anyone who likes Aquariums!. We were well impressed with this attraction and thought it had all been very well done. As a previous reviewer said, the big tank was spectacular and was worth seeing just for it's own sake let alone all the other installations to look at. Worth every penny in our view! The only negative was the miserable woman serving in the restaurant, think she's in the wrong job!
Amazing. Amaizing visit and nice promenad nearby. We took a funicular to get down to the bridge and than strolled back to the metro.

Very impressive lay out.. This was my first aquarium type zoo I have been too. I wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. I kept being concerned that it would be too small to occupy much time but alas each turn exposed yet another area to explore. There are two floors encircling a very large tank with several views into it as well as many other tanks butting up to the main tank giving the illusion they are all one big tank. If you buy the tickets on line as of Feb 2015 you can get tickets for 11.90e while iti s 14e at the door. Use the restroom before you go into the main area as there isn't another one handy inside and there is no reentry.

Inspiration for science and nature study. Very inventive way to build an oceanarium. Four oceans are present on each corner of a building: Arctic, Antarctic, Pacific, Indian. Biggest aquarium is in the center and really blows your mind. Going with children should be great, but going alone is also good to watch fish and clear mind. If you are visiting Lisbon going here is a must.
Amazing!. One of the best acquariums we've been to. The big circular tank is absolutely spectacular! Highly recommended!

Great experience. I have visited couple aquariums in Europe and I can say this is worth time and money. The aquarium is really big and you can see lots of different species in the same time. Otters are lovely! This is perfect place to spent time and get away from the city center for a day. There is nice park near the aquarium and you can just sit near the river for some time.
captivating. Kids love it! So do adults, nicely managed flow control. clever use of underwater tanks that make you think the oceans of the world really are in front of you.

One of the nicest aquariums I been too.... ... My husband and I been to a couple of aquariums around the world including one in Kuala Lumpur and this is def on top of my list of aquariums. It's locely, large and plenty to see. They have many seating areas around from different angles of the big tank which are super. It's nice sometime to just sit down and watch the fish swim around. The price was very reasonable €14 each which is great to be fair.

Well worth the trek from the city centre. Fantastic aquarium, worth the trip even if only on a short stay in Lisbon! Loved the sea otters and penguins, as you could get so close to them. The massive central aquarium was brilliant. We went on a Sunday morning, before the main crowds arrived, so could easily get to all the displays. We took the bus from the city centre (about 20 mins, 1.80€ each way). Bus not ever so regular, but it was a Sunday...
Plan for a rainny day. It's considered one of the best in Europe. I really enjoyed, but recomend to do it only if you are with lot of time, and not in a short visit.

A great day out for kids. We took our 18 months old and spent nearly the whole afternoon there. There were so much to see and learn together with your child, yet a very tranquil place to watch the fish freely swimming behind the big screen. Loved the sea otters as well! We enjoyed every moment.

Recommended for wildlife lovers. We made a trip to Lisbon's oceanarium on the final day of our visit to the city, as it's located on the way to the airport from the city centre. We made sure to book our tickets online the night before, which provided a 15% saving.What an incredible experience this turned out to be! I have always been a fan of aquariums and oceanariums, and the diversity of life on display here is very impressive in comparison to others I have seen. They have specimens of two of my favourite animals - the cuttlefish and the critically endangered axolotl - neither of which I had ever seen before 'in person!'While there are many small tanks and displays with rare amphibians, jellyfish, corals, anemones, sponges, crustaceans and so on, the obvious highlight of the experience is the central tank, with a seemingly endless collection of weird and wonderful fish, rays and sharks all in one place! The oceanarium is laid out such that you are always moving around with some kind of visible access to this central tank, and some of the windows in their scale are truly awe-inspiring.There was no temporary exhibition on while we went, but I would recommend you give at least 2 hours to stroll through the main exhibition at your leisure.

Fishy. I'm not usually one for this type of family fun attractions but we spent a really long afternoon here. Fantastic huge central aquarium that you keep seeing as you make your way through the building. Numerous smaller aquariums, interesting information. The wonders of the oceans, indeed!

you can see everything. brilliant place and very well organized with all the species; i can never imagine such place and beauty. All type of fishes from the sea...I was alone but its ideal for families.

one of the best in europe. If you end up in Lisbon on a rare rainy day, this is actually a great place to go. The oceanarium is amazing, greatly designed allowing us to see the gigantic main tank from all angles. the building inside is all black so you can fully enjoy and focus on the main point, the fishes. At the time I went there they also had a nice little exposition with frogs, was great.

Amazing place. I spent hours and hours inside of the Oceanário. Was really peaceful and quiet despite of the several groups of kids there. Grown ups and kids were amazed by the all the fishes and sea creatures. The only place available for buying food is ot the the Oceanário.

Great Sunday. Came here on Sunday with friends as part of a weekend break. The Aquarium is really good, with a big tank full of Sharks and Rays in the middle, worth a visit, sadly the temporary exhibit wasn't open so we didn't get to see this.
Have to go there. Absolutely worth to visit the Oceanario when you be in Lisbon. One of the best ones I have been. It takes around 3h to go through, afterwards its nice to visit the former Expo area.
Good for an afternoon. Clean and well maintained aquarium, good break from visiting historical sites. Perfect for afternoon trip with the kids.

Okay Aquarium. We were on the Hop-On Hop-Off bus and noticed that there was an aquarium. It was 'okay'. The central tank is pretty nice but it seems to be the cornerstone of the entire aquarium. After a bit, we were tired of seeing it.
Worth a visit.. This was a great place to visit.We are senior citizens and found it fascinating. The main aquarium is huge with a huge variety of sealife. Really worth the ticket price.

Okay, but not the best I have seen. Given that this is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe and 6th in the world one would have expected much more. I have visited many aquariums in the world most of which have been much better in terms of species of fish, animation, hands on experience and organization.The main feature is the large tank in the centre which is great for viewing the fish. Certainly nothing to compare with those in the USA and London.Be prepared for crowds and a lot of pushing.

Otters Rock!. Fascinating, informative, beautiful place. We have spent so much time looking, reading, taking pictures. really enjoyed it. Main aquarium is huge, and full of sealife, plus otters, pinguins, and so many interesting animals on show. definitely worth a visit, Children corner is brilliant, we are still talking about Vasco! My only criticism is that there was nowhere we could stop and have a drink or a quick snack with the children, so the last bit of our visit was rushed by hungry children.

Great for the kid and their parents. This is great!
Awesome time for both kids and parents. It has a good tank with sharks and all those wierd creatures that traditionally you only see on TV.
It has good planning, good viewing sequence, fair enough space to accomodate all visitors, a snack bar and meal self-service.

Beautiful Oceanarium. If you love the sealife you have to definetely pay a visit to the Oceanarium... Worth the ticket price.. The central pool have a lot of species and it's the focal site around the whole things evolves...

Reserve a few hours to visit this spot, kids will love it and grown ups too. Lisbon's Oceanarium is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe and 6th in the world, with 5000 meter cubic of water. With over 450 species of fish, marine mammals and birds, it is certainly worth several hours of visitors' time. For exemple, one unique resident in the Oceanarium is a sunfish, a species rarely kept in aquariums because it is so difficult to care for. The main tank features a plethora of aquarium standards: sharks, eels, rays and schooling fish. It is perhaps fitting that, given Portugal's long history as a seafaring nation, the exhibits cover every major ocean on the globe, with an Arctic exhibit, an Atlantic Ocean tank, a tropical Indian Ocean habitat, and tanks housing species from the Pacific's temperate waters.

3rd largest oceanarium in Europe. Don't miss this at Parque de Nacoes, Oriente. There is a large central aquarium showing different species living at different depths in the ocean. The most photogenic are the Sea Otters. Good information on the exhibits in English.

A wounderful time. We visited the ocenarium before leaving lisbon and it was worth our while. They divided the whole place in 4 areas resembling the 4 great oceans. In the middle they have a huge tank with hundreds of different species of fish. There are two floors: surface level and below surface level. There are also smaller basins with emphasis on specifc details of the sea life. The had penguins, real ice, birds that flew right over our heads, a fish one meter long and half a meter of height that just was afloat next to some visitors. We also saw some penguins (unsuccessful) hunt other fishes. They really care about their fish and treat them to their ever-growing best knowledge.
Fantastic Experiences. For adults and children or teens... an amazing "fish experience" with an unique worldwide collection of species of fishes!

Great fun for the kids and the grown ups. Huge central tank with hundreds of species to watch. Not so claustrophobic as other similar venues. Ideal if weather is not great, do book online for discounts and skipping the ticket box queue. Definitely worth a visit if you have half a day to spare, ideal if you want to make it the last thing to do before flying home as it is very close to the airport.

Fantastic place. loved this place. It's quite spectacular with a huge central tank with full length windows over a few floors. There were species that I've not seen anywhere else! Loads of variety and well laid out. My favourite was the sea otters - so cute. Reasonably priced and close to the shopping centre, river, cable car and restaurants so enough to keep you entertained for hours.

Amazing. Amazing place.The building is modern and feels like a magic place from the moment you get in. It was for sure one of the best experiences i ever had.If you have the chance to visit don't miss it. Even if it looks a bit expensive it worths every euro.Children will love it! Truly amazing!
a place of beauty and peace. must see even lisboners go there for the peace of mind and beauty two floors and can even pre book a visit to the interior.

WOW, Fantastic Aquarium. This is just great. For me, the absolute best aquarium i have ever seen. Simple, yet elegant.
All sorts of sea life to see, from sharks to schools of herring. Just GREAT!

Great visit. Took my son (11) and husband just to make our city break more fun for son, turns out we all really enjoyed it. We were there about 2 hours and found it easily from our bus tour. Not cheap but worth the money I guess. Didn't see the sea turtles though, not sure if there was any? A nice break from usual sight seeing
Must see. If you enjoy marine life this is the place for you! This is the right place to spend half day of your stay in Lisbon, especially if you have children.

The most aquarium i have seen in my life. Simply inside the oceanario you transported from your daily life above the land ... to the life of Atlantic ocean ... a life you will give your eyes the chance to watch how this life is wonderful and fantastic .... this is the first time of me to see the penguin in its nature atmosphere .. the sea horse .. the colored frogs .. and The big basin with a plenty of fish kinds .. wild kinds and Ornamental fish ... you are in Lisbon so you have to visit this place

Good aquarium. It does what it says it does - it's a good aquarium. The main tank is very impressive, the four surrounding habitats less so. Lost of information and more sea life in the lower level. Very good "behind the scenes" film.We spent over two hours here and enjoyed it. However it is no better than other major aquariums that I have been to.

wonderful 2,5 hours. I just loved sitting in front of the main tank of 5,000 cubic meter of water with its four main windows. All the sharks and sting-rays plus also the enormous sunfish were just spectacular.The penguins and sea otter were cute as well
Great Experience. A great way to spend an afternoon or morning - fantastic collection of wildlife environments and one huge central tank filled with an amazing variety of fish!
Brilliant. Go see it. It's brilliant. Huge central acquarium and lots of small ones. Sharks' rays, penguins, otters.
Lisbon Aqarium. Loved the otters and penguins, impressive large fish tank. Was asked by the cashier if I wanted adult or senior tickets, which didn't do my self esteem any good :-(

nice. this fantastic oceanario ever i see .there is many kind of fish overall very nice experience .i was here off time but people are always curios to see there n also its was located near expo where we can shopping also
Amazing. This is probably the best aquarium I have ever visited. Such an environmentally friendly place and such good value for money. I learnt so much about the oceans. A beautiful place to visit.

Great visit. Fantastic place to visit with or without kids. It was fascinating to watch the different variety of fish peacefully co-exist in the main tank. The ocean sun fish was a bizarre sight for those like myself and my partner who had not seen them before. Decent food in the cafe too!

Good if you've never been to an aquarium. Based on the high rating we decided to go to entertain our 8 year old. We were not very impressed, especially after visiting aquariums elsewhere (London, Atlanta). The big tank in the middle with the sun fish is a highlight, the rest is very mediocre. Some sections are very small and you have to make your way through crowds of people. Only recommended if you haven't been to similar place before.
Excelent. Worth the visit. Perhaps the best inheritance of Lisbon Expo 1998. Try to avoid weekends, as it is usually too crowded.

one of best attractions in Lisbon. What an amazing place. As we are adults and really enjoyed our visit it must be superb for children. The main tank is enormous and houses so many and varied sea life it is wonderous that so many different species can apparently live together. An education film in a small cinema shows the efforts that are made on site to ensure this and to have perfect environment for the inhabitants. Def worth a visit.

dive without wetsuit. The most beautiful experience, the building's architecture provides great views of wonderful tank, the marine fauna is diverse and coming from all the world's seas. Not miss this wonderful site.Bring your children they will love it

One of the Best in the world. Superbly located, very modern with state of the art technology. Very friendly atmosphere and staff. Avoid school time visits, normally in the morning, if you value some tranquility in your visit. The surroundings also worth a visit, due to the fact that the Oceanario is integrated in the previous expo 98 fair grounds. Overall it's worth a little detour from the Lisbon centre and all the hop on and hop off buses have it on their route
Great experience but expensive. Really nice, the idea to turn around the main aquarium while walking into each continente is greatKids loved it, parents also
Excellent. Very nice.Price of 14€ might seem a bit expensive but it's worth it.Great for children as well as for adults.
Dreamy and restful. This place can also teach you something about the world oceans. Slightly expensive but it is worth your money.
Magnificent experience. One of the most beautiful aquariums of the world. I recomend a visit. If you have childrens they would love it.

Amazing time, to share with kids ...or not!. great space, good environments, a placa not to be missed! I went there five or six times, and i always find something new to surpresa me! Apropriate for kids, all ages, all levels of knowledge. We also learn something new every visit.

Oceanário de Ĺisboa. Although in reality such a large variety of sea animals is not to be found together in the same habitat, the purpose of this "cohexistence" is to show the visitors as many sea creatures as possible. I don't mind if this cohexistence is plausible or not, since I'd have to visit several aquaria to see so many species as the ones we find there.
Fantastic day out. Very exciting day out in family. Interesting for adults and in particular for kids.Diversity of animals in an amazing aquarium
Amazing afternoon. An educational, interesting sightseing tour to an fascinating destination in lisbon. All quinds of incredible creatures and a warmth in iur hearts...
A must see.... You can go and learn about the oceans, their species and so on, but what I love doing is seat in front of all that clear blue water and relax...

Excellent for a rainy afternoon and the little ones. We visited with my daughter this attraction. It can be a bit on the expensive side for a family. If with small children the extra attractions are not worthy to be paid, as by the time you make the circuit, the children will be tired. Apparently my little daughter appreciated more the pinguins and the "tropical forest" than the fishes. The fishes and the ambiance are quite nice for a rainy afternoon. Children up to 3 do not pay, and to 12 pay 9 euros. An adult pays 14. In my opinion the only drawback of this attraction is not having a cafeteria middle course to rest a bit the little ones. As far the attraction itself, far better than the London one.

Lisbon - Oceanario de Lisboa. Interesting and modern aquarium ,built in 1998 for the Lisbon world expo, fabulous modern location right on the Tagus river, modern tube transport to gare do Oriente,full of atractions within a 10 minute walk, lovely walkways by the river, Hotels 5star and 4 star, concert hall arena (Meo Arena), Shopping mall (Vasco da Gama Shopping) with cinemas, restaurant court, Train station (Gare do Oriente) connecting Lisbon to Porto 2H 30min trip, and Lisbon Airport 15 minutes away.Check out visit Lisbon's website on what to visit at this link. http://www.visitar-lisbon.com/lisbon/places/oceanarium.html

A rare experience about animals, flora and minerals across all the oceans. Each of the great oceans is there in its individuality, and by clever architecture and scientific design, they all mingle in a center tank...How well they live together, predators and small species... (All are well fed by the Oceanarium staff!)The beauty is incredible, and each time we return there, the show is surprisingly new.Do NOT miss this, if you ever visit Lisbon.
Awesome. The best aquarium in Portugal. Thousands os species, in what is the closest to their natural habitat, with very good information about each one.
Just amazing. This is an amazing experience, specially for the young ones. If your visiting Lisbon this is a place not to miss.
enjoyable. it was quite a pleasant time, these enormous fish tanks are fabulous... do not miss this Lisbon's must !
Beautiful. Amazing place.What a sensation. Lots of diversity and big fishes (sharks, Garoupas...). Enjoy a lot this couple of hours. It deserves every cent payed.
best thing in lisbon - learned so much. loads of pools representing all the oceans, you can just wander round at your own pace. the film is interesting as well,

Oceanario de Lisboa. I make sure I visit at least twice a year ( I live near Lisbon so easy to do )
Always a pleasure and fascinating
Which reminds me we should go back to to see how the baby hammerhead shark is doing
Beautiful experience for everyone. A big aquarium to visit and it seems like you inside. Really cooll and a good atraction for everyone

A excellent aquarium. Just like diving to see lots of marine species. A very quiet environment.
Interesting for children, young and older people. Just love to go there and enjoy watching.

A fun and fascinating visit. A beautifully designed and maintained aquarium great for spending 2 to 3 hours with your kids...
Throughout the visit you're informed about all the species and also about the environmental questions surrounding the oceans. A must see for all.
truly beautiful. The entrance fee is a bit expensive, and souvenirs too. However it is well worth a visit for everyone.

Not Sea-World, and thank God for that!. Hey, it's not about animals with trained abilities or some show with birds. It's about trying to allow the visitors to view the animals in a environment that resembles their own in nature. The Oceanario also has a long record of receiving and nurturing injured animals until they can return to nature.I like some shows too but Oceanario is not about that. It's not about a human made fantasy.It's about the Ocean, period!

Very goood!!. It's a spectacular building in a spectacular city. The visit does not take long and it's not boring. You always find news around the corner. Penguins and otters are very cute. A must when in Lisbon.

Avoid weekends too many people. We loved it the most of all the things we did. One very large tank which is harmoniously controlled amazing. There are lots of view points just avoid the over crowded ones. I want to go for a sleepover!
Good way to pass a few hours . Interesting spot to pass a couple of hours in Lisbon. Although a little pricey it was worth it. I would recommend it foe families
Interest choice. It is a very nice place to enjoy If you have short time to do something. There are many interesting species to see. Please do not miss it!

Its an amazing aquarium!. Bought thru internet tickets in advance and saved some money, cant buy them online for the same day i read. The place is so biggg, an incredible giant aquarium on the middle with creatures i havent seen before, very well maintaned, and I think was worthed every penny spent.
Have been there two times now, just love it!

The ocean at a glance. Going to Oceanário is a beatiful experience. The layout is very pratical and you can see a lot of species that normally aren't at your reach to see.
The central aquarium is a handful of big and small fishes, living together in harmony.
The experience is really cool and it's a great idea for an activity to do with children.

Dont expect sea world. A spare afternoon and I love fish ,and I found the whole visit a bit strange ,I reminded me to start with a visit to a pet shop ,but it did get better good variety of fish but you are not going to be here for more than forty minutes ,its ok

Not the best I've seen. The layout was great - everything is themed around the central aquarium. However, there was very little to see. We had a choice between this and the zoo, which was a few euros more, and I think we should have gone for the zoo which had a lot more animals and a wider range. The aquarium is also in the middle of nowhere, so bear that in mind if you're taking the family for a whole day. We did the whole thing in less than 90 minutes.

Great activity. ThIs is a brilliant place to spend a all afternoon, a great place for children, the huge tanks are amazing.This was the best ocenarium I have ever seen. It was not overwhelming with information, simply sign-posted and the marine life is absolutely top. It was very peaceful and well laid out. I will absolutely come back.A great activity for couples, families or a solo visit
Wonderful. Almost perfect 😄😃😀😇🐳🐬🐟🐠🐋🐧. So many kinds of fish sharks loters pingoins and more

One of the best aquarium experiences in a city. Beautiful architecture in a wonderful landmark setting of the old Expo area in Lisbon (called Parque das Nações).... the aquarium is a perfect size to visit with little children and has some amazing sights!

Among the best in the world and specially pleasant. This is a beautiful aquarium with species from different seas of the world, well designed areas reproducing specific habitats and all animals you wish to see when you visit such a place. The absolute center (physical and of interest) of this is a huge tank with several kinds of fishes, including sharks, rays and interesting species like the moon fish. Other big and smaller tanks are built around it and several are very nice and beautiful. The visit is very pleasant and takes easily 2 to 3 hours.
family trip. Mind blowing experience. Sharks so near you, that´s almost unbelievable. All sorts of fish, besides a couple of otters so cute...

Breathtaking.. This establishment is located in a modern and rather drab building in the Parque das Nações and can, to my knowledge, only be reached on foot via a river promenade, or by the cable car. The signage is abysmal, but the locals are helpful. The amenities include two souvenir shops (shopping at one gives you a 15% discount at the other), an Italian bistro with outdoor seating, and a tranquil garden.At €15 per adult it's not the Lisbon's cheapest attraction, but it's well worth the price.The central exhibit is a three storey tank, opening at the top into various land habitats, and housing flora and fauna from all the world's oceans. Included are attractive fish like the great white shark and the Europe's only captive sunfish, but also animals like penguins and otters. The setup allows for some fascinating views. You can watch otters from above, floating on the surface, and if they dive, you can descend and see them swimming in the tank with ths fish.The corridors are lined with supplementary tanks housing fish, coral, jellyfish, starfish, anemonae... There is some multimedia, including a theatre showing a film on how the oceanarium is run (and how to perform surgery on fish!), a kids' playground with an ecological message, touch screens,sounds and tactile samples (including shark skin.) There is a small rainforest garden and, at the time of our visit, there was an exhibition of amphibians.The visitors' preferred activity, however, seems to be lounging on a carpeted floor, watching devil mantas, tiger sharks, and other exotic fish swim by.The sheer number of exhibits and the fascinating behaviour of animals make the oceanarium a full-day activity.

take time to marvel. I've enjoyed the thrills of scuba diving and can say this Oceanarium can deliver similar close encounters with the fishes without getting wet. I spent a lovely three hours taking in the multilevel breathtaking artificial environment and contemplating the state of the world's oceans (a bit melancholic actually). The experience was enhanced by the large script plaques describing the creatures and the philosophical reflections found on the walls. The location along the shoreline is a great combination of clever architecture and aquatic vista and worth a wander.

Excellently presented. I've been to a few good aquariums, but this may be the best. Very enjoyable and educational. Good for both adults and kids. Be sure and watch the "behind the scenes" film in the small screening room.

One of the best oceanariums in the world !. This one is among the best, the other being in Valencia. The Oceanarium is easy to get by using the metro or bus, and very near the Parc de Nacoes and Vasco de Gama shopping center. A nice area for a walk. Search the web and you will find discounts that you can use for admission.
Excellent option for any age, better if you have kids. Really nice aquarium, not too big, not too small, with great windows and interesting variety. Well worth the money and time.
Value for entrance money !. Big aquarium, clean and nice. Much to see in several departments. Fun for children and adults. nice.

Great place. One of the best oceanariums in the world and it is worth watching. Audio guides are available in many languages, and they are worth having - you learn many additional facts here. The Oceanarium is easy to get to using the metro, and very near the Parc de Nacoes and Vasco de Gama shopping centre. A nice area for a walk.

Great visit!. Second time here and it still make me great impression!
Educative and well maintained you can check big and small fishes and other sea species in a nice architecture project.
Nice public spaces and still have a good mall close to the metro and bus station.

A good way to see how human actions affect nature. This is one of the best oceanariums in the world. It gives one a chance to see the living world there, and shows how our actions (fishing, polluting, using water) has an effect on the many living creatures in the four major oceans (including many types of fish, birds, corral, etc). Set around a main tank, there are mini biodomes of four types of ocean environments (Indian sub tropical, antarctic, etc). There is also a theatre that shows the behind-the-scenes workings of the Oceanarium. It is worth watching. Audio guides are available in many languages, and they are worth having - you learn many additional facts here.The Oceanarium is easy to get to using the metro, and very near the Parc de Nacoes and Vasco de Gama shopping centre. A nice area for a walk.

Nice aquarium but a bit out of town. As aquariums go, this one is among the best. It's one of 2 aquariums I have seen the sun fish (the other being in Valencia, spain) and showcases quite a wide array of marine life.Outstanding displays were that of the penguins and sea otters (2 very delightful ones frolicking playfully). Contrary to this being an aquarium, the one thing that was different was the display of small colourful frogs which one would more likely find in a zoo.If you have a car then getting here is easy. Located near (with stupendous views of) the Ponte Vasco de Gama bridge. As this place is rather quiet, eating options are found in or next to the aquarium. Search the web and you will find discounts that you can use for admission. Alternatively go to the counter and tell them you were unable to access the website and they will also extend the discount.

Good selection and penguins!. For me, the penguins and the sun fish were the highlight of the visit to the Oceanarium. There's lots of good selection of fish. Try to be there when the fish/penguins are getting fed, it's so much fun to watch. Oceanarium is a little out of town, but it's worth the visit if you like aquariums and are staying in Lisbon for a while.
Amazing!. Great place, beautiful architecture and a huge variety of species. We took a taxi (it's cheap in Lisbon) and all the surround area is nice and has beautiful views. Worth going!

Brilliant!!. This aquarium is is brilliant. I saw fish that I haven't seen before and it is really well laid out with the big main aquarium in the middle so you get different views as you want around looking at the smaller ones. Definitely worth the visit and it is good value for money.
A must see in Lisbon. Great aquarium and a place you surly should not miss in Lisbon! Easy access with metro. Great for a rainy day.

Beware of the birds!. Very good in general, but beware of the birds that fly around in one of the area which may, and actually did on me, drop faeces. Not a particularly pleasant experience for me, but the aquarium is excellent in terms of the variety of species (with poison dart frogs which I didn't expect to see)

Amazing. This dwarfs any other aquarium and is well worth the visit even if the children are teen-agers. The surrounding modern architecture also calls for a stroll and an afternoon meal taking in the views.
A must when visiting Lisbon. Brilliant and very impressive collection of different sea mamals and species.Huge oceanarium represents all oceans in one.
Mandatory to go. Fantastic place to visit where we can spend a pleasant time. Kids love it and adults too, very big variety of fish's and environment's.

Best aquarium i have visited!. I have been to plenty aquariums in Europe but this is easily the best I have seen. The entry prices were very reasonable at about circa 11 Euros. The layout with a massive central tank visible at various points during the tour through the regions was brilliant. Wouldn't hesitate to return!

Great Place. Went here with friends visiting from the UK who live in cheshire and so know a place similar, by far Oceanario de Lisboa was super a real treat at an amazingly good price the only down side i felt was the prices in the gift shop.
Fantastic Aquarium. Fantastic, best aquarium I have ever visited,give yourself plenty time ,there's a lot to see.There are different themes from the arctic to the tropics,ten out of ten.

Huge maritime sanctuary . Based on the numerous reviews from tripadvisor my wife and I stopped by this fantastic aquarium and where not disappointed in the slightest. We used our Lisboa cards(get one people seriously) and got a good discount on admission. We arrived here by metro which was free thanks to the Lisboa card(really people all public transportation is free with the card). Upon arriving we could see why this place is the largest indoor aquarium in Europe. Their collection is amazing including my favorite the sunfish which is huge as it is scary looking. Overall a great day spent with marine life and if you have the time it is not to be missed in Lisbon. Outside the aquarium the whole area is really nice to walk around once you're done so that's a plus!
Family visit. Great aquarium, goes in a circuit, so family can all travel at different speeds. Easy to find and lots to see.

An enjoyable day out.. It was a rainy day in Lisbon, so we took the metro red line towards the airport to get to Orient station and the oceanariums was about a ten minute walk from the metro. Do bring your walking shoes, as it is a good walk round as well. At 14 euros per adult give yourself plenty of time here. The exhibits are well laid out and in species order. Photography is allowed, but no flash. If you have ISO function on your camera you will need a high ISO to get any decent shots, as most areas are very dark. I took movies in the end as stills were difficult as the fish move much faster than you think! It's beautiful and restful to watch and each exhibit has a little bench to rest on, so you can take your time. I think it is quite expensive to get in to the oceanariums, so it will need to be budgeted for in your holiday expenses. There were few exhibits outside just a few penguins and otters . All in all worth a visit.

Nice and mind opening experience. Although it seems to be relatively small compared to some similar places this has it own advantages. It's great how you can observe all the animals from different angles and together. Great experience!

Don't miss this!. One of the best in the world. Great environment for the children and adults alike! Plan for almost a full day here if sea life fascinates you, and if it doesn't yet, it will after this visit!
ok. easy to get to on tourist bus and easy to findbig tank plenty of fish sharks stingrays but didnt do it for me we were a couple no kids6 euros each

MAGNIFICENT!. Worth every dime! Have been there several times and will go back over and over again. The cental aqurium is magnificent! Bring a tripod and you will take fantastic photos! The mood and the atmosphere are great. The variety of species is fantastic. Cant recomend this enough!

Lots of sea creatures as well as people. This aquarium has lots of interesting tanks with the large central one being the main attraction. It is worth a visit if you have a day or a couple of hours to spare. Bear in mind that the place can be very crowded and that there will be kids running around in all directions.

A place to visit with kids. If you are on vacation in Lisbon and you have a cloudy day, this is a great option for an inside tour.The variety of sea species is amazing with special highlights to the giant turtles and the main tank, where you can spend a good half an hour just watching sharks and all kind of fishes go by. You can also see penguins, otters, sea birds and a gigantic variety of sea animals.When visiting the Oceanário, take a walk in the surrounding Parque das Nações, is a great place to walk by the Tejo River, to jog or to use a Segway or bike.
Some great fish. The only attarction that worked on a New Year Day! Beautiful location, nice facility, plenty of specimen. Captivating jelly fish.
Well worth a visit. We are a couple in our 50's and thoroughly enjoyed this fascinating experience. It was informative, educational and extremely interesting.

Intimate display of the sea. The trip to the " new city" was fantastic. We took the metro and got off at Orient . Every where respect and love for the sea is visible. After our stroll we went to the the sea acquirium . It is winter so not many visitors which made it easy for us to get around. Definitely a recommendation when you visit Lisbon
It's superb. superb and relaxing! it's awesome! go during the week after lunch. attencion it may have a line for the ticktes by it in advance

Excellent for small kids . My 2 year old was blown away and so was the rest of the family. This is one of the best aquariums we have ever visited. They have several ecosystems with different kinds of fish with a full setting for the environment in display. Superb !!

Excellent activity with the kids !. Our kids have asked to go back to the aquarium during our second stay in Lisbon. The aquarium has a very nice size. The main tank is the core of the building and you will have several times the opportunity the view it while walking in oceanarium !

great place for families. We had such a lovely time here. My daughters 8 and 5, my husband and I in our early 30s, and my inlaws in their 60s and 70s had such a fantastic time. It is hard to find something the whole family enjoys but most certainly this place is it. We spent about 2 hours here and then headed down to the cafe and we had a wonderful lunch. For the family pass it is not too expensive and neither was the cafe. We have been to aquariums all over the world and this one tops the list. My girls love the one here in London but havent been able to stop talking about all of the wonderful things they saw here.

well designed & impressive. This is a huge aquarium/sea life centre a few metro stops from Lisbon city centre, I spent hours wandering around being amazed by the huge tanks and the variety of aquatic creatures, wheelchair friendly & child friendly with cafe on site (sells beer & outside seating) best to buy tickets in advance, we got an on-line discount and saved 20 minutes of queueing. it's not particularly well signposted though, so when you come out of the metro, go through the shopping centre towards the sea and turn right.

first class aquarium. A great place for traveller's and for those with kids.Impressive collection withnew exhibits.Educational, interesting and fun.Its Europe's largest saltwater aquarium and worth a visit.
Jacques Cousteau would be jealous. This place is amazing, part of the Expo 98 this is still one of the most beautiful places to visit in Lisbon.
big big aquarium. very easy to get with metro, many amazing things to watch (including a temporary exhibition), also loved the fountains what near to this bulding

Big aquarium. Get off at Oriente metro or there are several buses that run from the city centre. The Oceanario is part of a large collection of exhibition space on the coast. There are several sections as you pass through the museum - polar (penguins and inca terns), tropical etc. which all surround a very large tank with large fish species - mantas, sharks, sunfish etc. which you pass by in between the themed sections. There could have been some more educational text with the exhibits, and of a more adult nature. Spent at least three hours here, and then took the cable car to the other end of the site.
You must go!. There aren't many places like this around the world so if you are in Lisbon don't miss it! The only pity is that you can't dive in...

Not to miss. A delightful visit to one of the best acquariums in the world. Nicely kept, wonderful fishes and a delight to all ages. Walk around the new Lisboa district afterwards. Modern and nice spots
Worth the visit. Beautiful and well kept place! Very instructive but the signs are poorly located. I loved the introduction movie!Beautiful setting and well located by the bay!

Unsurprisingly voted best in Europe. Brilliantly conceived and executed and designed, this aquarium shows highlights from most of the world's seas in a dramatic presentatation. At first the 'shore' exhibits may look a little dreary, but when you descend the gentle spirals taking you 'underwater' the sight of penguins 'flying' past is amazing.Equally the sight of giant rays swimming straight towards you almost makes you sway out of their way!Excellent education, enchantment and value

pretty!. A place to visit in Lisbon!The Oceanario has a very pretty building and is located in a cool quarter of the city. As it is located close to the airport (on the way from the airport to downtown) you may visit it as soon as you arrive in Portugal or shortly before leaving.

You will get lost. And love it!. I've been to the Oceanário about 10/15 times already. It is a lovely place to discover different species but most of all great if you love to sit still for a few minutes, relax and just look into the humongous central tank to see life going past you.I went with and without the young family and it catered for all. There are penguins, sea otters, birds roaming about, a sunfish, plenty of sharks and the 4 different oceans worth of fish.If you're visiting, go there!

Excellent. If you take the bus tour your ticket gives a discount. The Oceanario is well presented and entrance costs are very reasonable. We went end of December and was still busy so can only imagine chaos in summer. At the Oriente end of town too far to walk but part of the bus tour route the area is very good and also you have to do the cable car just outside about 3.5 euros one way, good way to see the area at height

Nice. Very nice. Not all the expositions were available when i went, so i felt like i should have seen more for the price apart from that, very nice and interesting. Also, i found looking at the animals veeery relaxing
Nice peaceful place . Loved it. Amazing place to spend the afternoon. The main fish tank is great. U feel like being under the water with the sharks. :)Nice affordable cafe near the entrance.

Spend at least half a day. The enjoyment is doubled when you see the children enjoying the permanent exhibit of penguins, sea otter, sharks, etc. Watching the large aquariums is at once mesmerizing and relaxing. The museum is well maintained.

Oceanario de Lisboa. The Oceanarium was a great experience ! There were all kinds of fish from all the oceans of the Earth, other organisms of the seas like jellyfish, coralreefs! etc, detailed explanation of every fish species. During the whole tour there was also a soundtrack which consisted of sounds various fish produce. The ticket was 14 euros but I believe totally worth it.

Nice place to bring your children to. Very diverse and educative stations; all oceans are represented by fish and some birds, also by plants. The central aquarium can be seen on two floors and from different angles. You can admire mantas, stingrays, barracudas, sharks and so on.

under the sea. This is a must! It is not only amazing in size, but also in the diversity and quality that it offers. Educational and captivating! Prepare to take some time to visit (+-3-4 hours). Wonderful experience for kids and adults.

Nothing special.... I heard that the Lisbon Oceanarium is the best in Europe, but for people who were already in the other aquarium - I don't recommended ... Central aquarium is really large - is impressive, but other - nothing special ... (It can be great idea for family with children.)

Not as expected - great for kids. It wasn't what I expected, I've been to other and much better Aquariums. If you have time and looking for something to do then yes I would recommend you go here but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there. The sea life is limited, you think your seeing new and different sea life but it's the same just all in one big tank. Wouldn't go out of my way to see it, although it's a blast for kids.

Could be better. We visited this place expecting to see an array of wild life that would bedazzle us in the least, although the most exotic beings proved to be the 5 turtles we found in a new exhibition focussing entirely on turtles, we saw little fish, jelly fish, turtles, penguins, otters, and a big tank with 2 or three sharks and a few fish, somehow I think the oceanario still has to develop a bit more in order to proportionate the wow factor.

Even if you don't nornally enjoy the fish, GO!. We are normally not into sea, fish, zoos or aquariums. Since this place got such great reviews everywhere we decided to give it a go and it was definitely worth it. If you're in Lisbon for more than two days, you shouls definitely go!

One of the world's best . The Oceanarium in Lisbon is one of the the world's best. It has a large central tank with plenty of easily accessible viewing areas and angles from top to bottom. It also has evenly placed habitats for other marine, bird, and amphibious life. The educational text is concise and precise. The marine life is diverse and apparently healthy. The physical plant is well maintained. It is easy to get to by public transportation and it affords a lovely view of this wonderful city's shore. It is well worth the price of entry and should not be missed.
Worth of money!. You should go there! Beautiful place! You will be like inside a big aquarium. There is a cheap cafeteria also.
Absolutely fascinating. Best aquarium I've ever visited, and I've seen many. The sunfish are not to be missed. My (adult) children were fascinated for several hours.

Something Fishy. The centerpiece in the Park of Nations, the Oceanarium is one of the largest in the world and is well-designed. The recreations of different ocean ecosystems offer a unique glimpse at marine life in various parts of the world. It is the huge main tank that offers up-close-and-personal views, from different angles, of the nearly 25,000 fish. Many display the beauty of nature. Others, e.g., the Mola Mola (Ocean Sunfish), are popular with visitors for their more unusual appearance (a face only a mother could love). One of my favorite exhibits was the family of sea otters that reside in the facility. I was with a group of mature adults from a cruise ship, and we loved the Oceanarium, but part of the joy was in watching the many children who were visiting. This is a family-oriented attraction, great for all ages. It is easily accessible by public transportation. There is a nice gift shop. Other shops and eateries are within easy walking distance. Recommended.

Great Oceanarium. If you are a fan of martime life, you should definitely visit this place. They have a lot of different animals from various climatic zones and a huge aquarium in the centre of the building.

One for the adults and the kids.. Oceanario de Lisboa is well worth a visit. There is a lot here to see and experience for both adults and kids. It is located in the area of Lisbon which was developed for Expo 98. This area is serviced by the Red Metro line.The admission fee for adults is €14, though you can get tickets at a reduced rate if you buy online. At the entrance pay the extra €2.50 for the audio tour. As we did not see any signs advertising this option we missed out. It would be well worth the extra few euro, as information signs inside the exhibit, while bilingual, are fairly basic.Staff we encountered were very helpful, and could speak English. We visited in late December and encountered no queues. The whole place was spotlessly clean. The toilets at the exit area were surprisingly small for what must be a very popular attraction, and would not have been much the better for some air freshener.We were two adults, and took about an hour and forty five minutes to see everything. Expect to spend considerably longer if you have children with you. The Oceanarium is really well designed and laid out. It is very easy to move through and the whole experience was very pleasant.
