The sunfish are a real treat. My own personal favourites were the delicate dragon fish. The lower levels were a real surprise, with the diversity of sea creatures on display. It was a particular delight to watch the Penguins and Sea Otters swimming under water.There is the usual gift shop and restaurant on the way out. There are also plenty of restaurants in the immediate area, with the large Vasco Da Gama Shopping Centre, complete with food court, close by. If you intend to visit Lisbon, take the time to travel out to Oceanario de Lisboa. Probably best to set aside half a day. There are 450 different species of one sort or another to be seen. So whether you are on the lookout for sharks, sea horses or starfish, there will be plenty for you to enjoy. And don't forget your camera.

Make sure to have it on your to do list.. My husband and I spend a couple of hours in this Oceanario and loved it...Of course, if you have kids they would have lots of fun with it.A lot to see and explore.The area is accessible by metro which makes it much easier to get there...Just hop on the red line and you are there...Enjoy

Nice place for your kids. Once in Lisbon, with kids, I would recommend a visit there. It wasn't too crowded, clean, and I was able to purchase tickets right there (no long lines). I also paid an extra ticket for a special exhibition but it was quite small and not that special. You can check the exhibition program in their website to check if the extra cost is worth. When you leave the Oceanário, you will find a souvenir store, toilets, and an ice cream shop. Surprisingly, all shops were kind of crowded (much more than the Oceanário itself), but nothing that would ruin the overall experience.

Not as big as it seems from the outside, but worth a visit. The main feature is the central ocean tank, with sharks, mantas, sunfish and lots of other creatures. A little expensive but definitely worth a visit, especially with kids.
We found Nemo!. Excellent visit when weather less favourable. Fabulous set up and we spent longer than we would have imagined just watching fish!
Fantastic. You must visit! The tour is well organized and the audioguide will explain everything during the visit. Absolutely don't miss it!

Nice place to spend the afternoon with a family. Big, modern, situated in the new district – think, that the Aquarium really deserve to be visited! Impressive big aquarium in the middle which you can see from the different sides… Has a good collection of sharks and other big fishes… My favorite part is an aquarium with otters – they are absolutely lovely, funny and actually they made my day! :)
Nice see aquarium. Oceanario has very nice aquariums with a big tank in the middle. They try to give you a broad ook into to the ocean life and in my opinion they succeeded.

#1 Attraction in Lisbon. For me this was the nicest attraction in Lisbon. It is in the newer Oriental area which was built for Expo 98. It is really the highlight of the area. The architecture is amazing and the way the exhibits are laid out is both efficient and beautiful. The penguins and the sting rays were the highlight. The price is 14 euros but is was really worth it. It is very dark inside, but you can still take good photos.
second time i go. its my second time there and it was great...there is alot to see and learn, and after i visit i just wish to have an aquarium like that at home...lol it was great fun too
nice display of sea world. well preserved sea species in almost natural environment. the large aquarium containing shark & many other fishes would easily amaze. Specially our children liked it a lot.

Best place to hangout with kids. My 9 year old son made us to take him there and we loved every bit of it, we had great time learning about various species. Make sure you plan to be in the Aquarium for over 3-4 hrs. The walk from the metro is about 10-15 min
Amaizing. i now live in uk. Been to deep in Hull but this is something else. Even when you don't have kids. I go back every year.

Simply wonderful. When I visited here it was the most relaxing afternoon I had in the two months I spent in Portugal. I'm not a massive aquarium fan but the sheer size of the place was fantastic and the natural habitat that has been created is faultless. The main tank is stunning over so many floors and it was spectacular just sitting on the floor at the bottom watching the creatures in the water. The place is well laid out and good for the price. Kicks the behind out of The London Aquarium in every which way.

Nice aquarium. Oceanario de Lisboa is worth a visit, with a lot of different animals in a nice environment, the only thing we missed was more information in English, especially all the quotes from Sophia de Mello Breyner Andresen, we were curious about what they meant.

Great for adults and kids. We spent a morning here and loved it. The big tank is full of many fascinating fish: there are massive sharks, rays, colourful fish, starfish, sunfish, the list goes on. Then all the way round the rest of the place there are other smaller tanks with different creatures in them. Lots of informative facts and descriptions also in English and the layout is very good as it enables you to get round everything smoothly without repeating or missing things out. Great day out!

did not impress me much. Maybe I have expected too much, but it did not really leave me any extraordinary impression. An aquarium that does not differ from many others. Although the surroundings are awesome: loved the art and architecture!!!
Beautiful!. Worth spending a whole morning or afternoon! On of the best seaquariums I've visited so far. It is close to a shopping mall where you can have lunch.

great aquarium. This aquarium is worth a visit as its main tank is one of the largest in Europe and in the world. They have 4 areas setup in it, one for each ocean. One could see few sharks, various other species of fish, penguins. Of special interest I would say is the "Indian Ocean" section with its coral reefs ... it is fascinatingly colourful. Part of the main tank and of the smaller, thematic aquariums are actually under water level ... so it's very interesting to see how this structure was designed, starting with its underground level. I found the entrance fee a bit high, but perhaps that's due to the high costs related to constantly maintaining the proper habitats for all the creatures hosted here. Also, there is a short movie presented in the small cinema room, which goes into details about this work and the other research done here.

Fascinating for adults and older kids. Good value for money, not just for a rainy day, unusual and impressive huge central tank with myriad fish including sharks, that can be seen from different heights and angles as you follow the posted route in semi darkness past displays, vivariua and fish tanks of each of the great oceans. An easy bus ride with the hop on hop off red line, the Olympic site to walk through with a large waterside restaurant with a large, varied menu about 15 minutes away that is great for families.
Great aquarium!!!. If you want to see sharks and spend a good time in the Oceanarium, you have to visit this place. The conditions are amazing, and we go there with Lisbon By kombi.

Amazing! Take the children or go by yourself. They have a huge central tank that will amaze you the moment you get in. As a bonus you get some really good portuguese poetry on the walls. For the children, they get the chance do see how the animals are fed, from time to time. They have a schedule, so you won't miss it.

Wonderful- go there!. If you're in Lisbon and you don't visit this wonderful spot then you have missed out.It's out of town but easy to get to by subway on the red line (unless you have a motobility issue - not all of the tube stations cater well).

Great place. Very good lay out and full of information. The central aquarium is magnificent. All the oceans are represented in a fun way, to include birds and mammals. Definitely worth a visit...especially as the entrance fee is only 14€.

Fantastic Aquarium!. The Oceanario was developed for the 1998 World's Fair in Lisbon. It is a magnificent exhibit covering all of the world's oceans. All of the various regions are interconnected like they are in the real world. A fantastic exhibit for both young and old. Lots of places to eat and see in that area.
Beautiful place. Beautiful place to see the underwater world! Beautiful places to seat and enjoy. And that center tank two stores high... make you feel that you are inside of it!

nice place to visit. this is an amazing time spent in Lisbon, for families, children and those who admires nature and its representatives in the sea world. great amount of species varieties, showing the diversity of different oceans. worth every single penny!
Visit to Oceanairo. We have stayed in Lisbon two years ago. We visited Oceanairo and I really liked the place. Will be back again

It lives up to it's world renowned reputation. World-class aquarium that was fun for the whole family. We spent hours there and enjoyed every minute of it. Check out the schedule ahead of your visit to see habitat feeding events and special attractions.

Magnificent space. A wonderful place to go there with our sons and grandson (4years) the aquarium is pretty big with a lots of wonderful fishes? The penguins and the sea otters. Then we came to the shop where you can buy lots of attractions and souvenirs.

The best aquarium I have ever visited!. I have been in a lot of aquariums: Barcelona, Chicago, London... and the one in my hometown is, without a doubt, the best one! Although it has almost 17 years it still looks brand new and the all the habitats are very well kept!
Fun place!. A nice place to go with your kids and have some fun! Great aquariums and cute sea animals! Very interesting for people interested and life under the sea!

Expensive entry. In my oppinion its more an atraction for children. The aquarium is awesome, but the other areas could be in better preservation. I think its very expensive for what it is and what it offers when compared with same atractions in other places.
A Lisbon must see. A Lisbon must see. There are more impressive aquariums infelizmente the world but this is a great one to visit.

It is fun to go with your kids!. It is located in a very nice place in Lisbon where you can enjoy the river and take a walk.
Here you can enjoy and learn a lot about life in the sea. You have a very large diversity of animals and it is a very beautiful tour.
A must-go place in Lisbon. One of the best aquqrium on the world. Take your time to sit and admire the fish and sea creatures ballet.

Inside the ocean!!!!. The oceanario de Lisboa is a great place to visit. Alone, as a duo or with the family. It's absolutely spectacullar beeing able to see so many different species of fish and other sea animals. The central Tank is a wonder for all eyes. It's a bit expensive but it is worth everytime!

An underestimated attraction of Lisbon. The visit is a guaranteed success!The place is very relaxing and inspiring, with the deep blue of the ocean and the sounds of the sea always present ;)I would have to say that the only slight hitch that can indeed put many off is the hefty entrance price, but if you can afford it you will soon understand that maintenance costs must be sky high... Plus, after a few minutes you won't regret it!!!
Awesome. Really a grate place to take all your family and friends. Unic In the World were you can spend a lovely afternoon
Nice Place. Really nice place, situated in Expo, have a lots of bars and restaurants.Good place to go alone, with family, kids or friends.Recommend

Fun Experience. I visited the oceanarium mainly for my 9month old daughter but ended up enjoying the experience too. She was completely delighted with the penguins and sea otters. Definitely a must do if you're in the area which also has a huge shopping mall and is easy to reach via the metro.

Magnificent space!. It is a wonderful place to go there with your family. The main aquarium is pretty big and contains lots of wonderful fishes.Then you have the penguins and the sea otters. Fantastic place and visit !The place is very clean.Then you have a shop where you can buy lots of attractions and souvenirs you have seen.Also you have a great place to walk all around. The aquarium all around is fantastic to go for a walk with your family, near the river...You have lots of parking slots all around the aquarium.Must visit for sure !
Beautiful Afternoon. This is a "must go" place in the beautiful Lisbon. Not only for kids.Go in the morning and then take a lunch in the "Parque das Nações" area.

Oceanario, must see. You will find an huge tank in the center of many interesting ones. Indoor and outdoor views of marine live. But on the center tank you will stay long time and be astonished about the live in front of you.
My three year old LOVED it.. Totally with the trip out there (a hajj, practically) but ideal for little kids. With the Lisbon card discount, it's a great deal. A huge selection of marine life.

Excellent aquarium!. I love aquariums and always try to visit them as I travel, and this did not dissapoint! You can easily take the subway to the aquarium which is situated in a large complex that's built a little ways out in the water (easier to explain once seen). The way the exhibits are set up make it really easy to see everything, and their large main tank, one of the biggest I've ever seen, houses all sorts of fish, shark and two sunfish, which I've NEVER seen before and was one of the highlights for sure. Definitely put this place on your list if you like aquariums, can easily spend 2-3 hours in this place.

Very nice and modern. Definitely a family attraction, but for anyone. The cafe serves a daily lunch of main, dessert, drink, and bread for 9€. It is fresh, cafe is sleek and modern, and food good. The aquarium is pretty big and the highlights got to be the penguin s and otters. Though all the fish are presented in ways that benefit them for their livelihoods and is for our fun factor.
Not Impressed. Having visited Thailand sea world, I had huge expectations from the oceanario but a little disappointed. I would recommend this for kids and If only you have time to kill visit it.

Nice Way to Spend a Few Hours. We visited the Oceanario with our grandson and his parents and we were all delighted with the large collection of fish in the central tank. The Oceanario also had live exhibits of all the seas of the world. We all were lucky enough to see the sea otters playing in one of the pools. The facility was well signed with lots of information about what we were seeing. It is set in the former expo site in Oriente so it is an lovely stroll to get to it.

Best aquarium we have been to. This is a very impressive aquarium and so it should be, being the second largest in Europe. We only visited because it was a very wet day, but are so pleased that we did. The central tank and the marine life in it are stunning and the smaller tanks great. Highly recommended.
Brilliant afternoon. ThIs is a brilliant place to spend a wet afternoon, a great place for children, the huge tanks are amazing, don't eat in the café though

Absolutely fascinating. This was the best ocenarium I have ever seen. It was not overwhelming with information, simply sign-posted and the marine life is absolutely top. It was very peaceful and well laid out. I will absolutely come back. You can see the main aquarium from every angle and it is amazing. You are so close up to the marine exhibits. It is a great feeling. Worth every penny.

Stunning aquarium and a great way to spend a rainy day in Lisbon. We spent the afternoon at this aquarium on a rainy day in Lisbon. We chose it based on the Trip Advisor recommendations and were not disappointed. It is a mesmerizing exhibit, entertaining and informative. You cannot help but be drawn in to the main aquarium as you view it from both floors and from every angle. The additional exhibits are well done and you will see things you didn't know existed. A great activity for couples, families or a solo visit.

Perfect Place. If you wanna see all marine life in one place... experience Heat, Cold in one place... this is THE PLACE to go to.
Perfect form individually or with family visit a monster aquarium that gives you peace.
Even seeing sharks ins peaceful in a place like this...
Just go...
must in Lisboa. great experience, fun to visit. we liked very much and you can see all the different ecosystems from all parts of the world.
Really nice aquarium. It was nice, lot of different fishes and other animals, birds etc. Maybe I was expecting bigger aquarium but it was fine

A must. Visited a few of these but this was the best so far. Excellent vieuws on the sharks and so on. But also the concept to see the other animals is great and takes you very close to them. Children will love it, so excellent option if its a rainy day

Fantastic day out. this place is brilliant.
Fantastic tanks and fish, all displays are excellent. Very reasonable too.
Worth a visit to Lisbon, just to go here

Enjoyable experience. The price for the entrance fee is a bit high and the location is far out from the city - it took two metro lines to get there, but overall, I really enjoyed myself. There was so much sealife to view in the large, main tank and the individual aquariums were very interesting and full of life. The place was tidy and calm and it's near lots of restaurants and cable cars.

It's not just an aquarium...it is an 'oceanarium'.. I am a lover of aquariums. It shows me a world that I am completely unfamiliar with and mostly terrified of, but safely contained within a giant glass tank. Which is essentially what I found this 'oceanarium' to be, a giant tank with possible the biggest sun-fish(??) I have ever seen!!! Honestly, if it was swimming towards you, it looked like the MOON. For 14 euros it was pricier than what I would have liked to spend on it, but definitely worth a visit if you love fish! The structure is very much centered around the giant tank in the middle so as you are walking you get a 360 view of the tank which is so big that you can't see the other side of it. Other smaller exhibits are on the side and one of my favourite was the Indian sea one with the exceptionally coloured fishes. One downer...I didn't get to see the otters :( Definitely worth a go-see if you are looking to get inside from the rain as my group was looking to do!

Very beautiful. Spent half a day here in november, the location of the building was beautiful and the oceanarium was home to so many interesting species. It looked fresh and clean and the animals seemed to be happy and comfortable. The sea otters were especially adorable.

We love the ocean sunfishs, the cute sea otters and the nice location. We enjoyed our time at the really interesting "Oceanário de Lisboa". Located within walking distance from the metro station "Oriente", near to the shopping center "Vasco da Gama" at the old area of the Expo with the "Parque das Nações". We paid € 14 per person. You can use lockboxes for free for your stuff. The whole area is really interesting, but the big fish tank is the best. You can walk along at the different windows and from each of it you get another view at the ocean sunfishs, the different kind of sharks, the rays, especially the manta ray and all the other bigger and smaller, sometimes colourful fishs. They had also two very cute sea otters, eating fish while passing by, little penguins, puffins, jellyfishs and many more. Outside there is a big souvenir shop and you got some possibilities for eating and drinking.The aquarium is one of the "must be done" in Lisboa! Nice located at the river "Tejo", surrounded by water. We would recommend it!

Ocenarium. This is one of the biggest I have ever seen , interesting story about oceans and different habitats This is an awesome visit for kids as well they will be thrilled Reached by Touristic bus and public transport bus 400 I believe There is a cable very close , a separate facility that I did not have time to try but it looked very good Enjoy

1st class aquarium. Just a bit crowded. We decided to check out the aquarium on a rainy day. Maybe that was why it seemed crowed. $15 Euro each to get in seemed a bit pricey after only spending an hour or so trying to get close enough to the glass for a good look. Tanks seemed very well maintained and roomy and the central tank area is impressive. Penguins, Pacific otters and the large sharks and rays are the stars here. I would recommend to a friend but to find an off day or a quiet part of a day to avoid the crowds.

Best aquarium in the world!!. If you like myself have been to aquariums, you will be totally blown away when you visit this one!!The size is the first thing that strikes you, then as you descend through the various 'oceans' of the world, viewing the great fish that swim in these oceans, it is absolutely magnificent. Don't leave Lisbon before viewing this place. A fantastic experience for all the family!!

Nice place. It is a nice place to visit with kids especiallyWe have arrived there with 1,5 hours before closing and we have visited it on fast forward. But we were disappointed to find out that it was not opened all!

small but still a great experience. it is a small aquarium but I loved the layout. It's almost like you are swimming with the fish and shark. they had some exotic fish that were very interesting. but I really loved the one huge tank in the center of the room.
Wonderful!. It's really nice, the big round tank with a ton of fish is wonderful and the places with penguins and otters are... just... wonderful!
Beautiful. Beautiful aquariums and all sorts of nice fish to see, especially the funky tropical fish with beautiful colours

Unique dive in marine life. The concept of this aquarium's architecture is unique in the world. All is dark and painted black, with accompanying sound and sea fragrances so that you fully dive in a multi-sensitive experience throughout the oceans.It is beautifully accomplished and by far the best aquarium I've ever seen in the world. An absolute must for sea lovers and to take your kids too. As yourselves...

FIRST CLASS. A great experience to see the work carried out around the world in our oceans and seas - this attraction suits all ages and anybody who has an interest in conservation.This is one of the biggest of its kind in the world and really glad I went to visit
Wonderful!. Don't miss this. It is incredible. The best aquarium I've ever been to. Really interesting and well set up.

A Maritime Marvel for the Senses. We had this consigned to our "things to do on a rainy day in Lisbon" list but we decided it would be a nice way to end a long day exploring the city. It was fantastic!A short train ride and then another short walk through a pleasant, modern part of the city led us here. One minor flaw is the modern, bland building suggests nothing of the aquarium within.As soon as you enter you encounter the main central tank that they build the exhibit around. It is the "one world, one ocean" idea and is a large tank consisting of many species including sharks, sunfish, shoals of mackerel, rays and many other interesting specimen. We stayed staring into this tank for almost an hour, getting lost in the blue glow and hypnotic movement of the animals. The areas are divided into regions, each one with different animals, temperatures, plants and atmospheres. Keeps it all interesting!I really appreciated how much the information focused on conservation and the environment and hope they improve that further.One thing I loved is how multi sensual (if that term exists) it was. Combined with amazing sights you got to enjoy the sounds and even smells of the maritime world, made it all feel real. It was a beautiful break from the urban reality outside and something I'd recommend for those of all ages!One small thing was that some of the signage was missing or incorrect. A small detail though.If you love animals and/or the ocean you will love this!

Typical aquarium . If you want to see sea life from below and above the tank this is where you need to be. Typical tourist attraction so it was quite busy but plenty of windows to see all the sea life from
I loved it!. Amazing place to visit for the different environments and animals. Additionally it is located in a beautiful building.

Incredible place!!!! . The place was great, very organized with a great variety of species. We loved the big center pool with a lot of different fish of every size and type and the way the corridor leads you around it to observe them from all the angles possible. Another great place not to miss are the penguins and the sea otters.

Good half day out. Excellent aquarium one of the best ever visited. 13 euros for adults and 9 euros for 65 plus.
On the edge metro line and near Oriente metro station.
Many varities of ocean fish, sharks etc. personal favourite were the Sea Otters.

Don't miss it. I was here 5 years ago and last week me and my family were again in Lisbon and we had to see the fish again. It is amazing. To my opinion everyone who goes to Lisbon has to visit the Oceanario. We spent 3 hours there and the kids were very happy. After that there is an Italian Restaurant called IL RUCOLA very close to Oceanario. They have lunch menus and it is a real Italian Restaurant.

Crowded, but a lot to see.. The huge tank is quite extraordinary, but it was difficult to get a clear view quite often. A lot of people in the afternoon. I guess it would be smart to turn up early to get the most out of the visit. A bit to expensive.

One of the best. This is a modern Aquarium and one of the largest in Europe. It is layed out in an unusaul way with a huge centre tank full of large and small fish, and which takes a central spot stretching up two stories. On the outside are small tanks highlighting specialised environments and animals, and with one area ore open with sea birds and otters. One wends one's way down from the top round and round as one moves down through the Oceanarium giving one different views of the fish in the central tank. Well worth a visit and expect to spend several hours to enjoy all it has to offer.

I never saw something like this. It's a great place to spend an afternoon, here you can see the different sea animals from the different regions of our earth. If you go to Lisbon don't forget to visit this place.

A very big bucket of water. The most impressive aspect of this for me was the dedication and the effort that was put into conservation. The themed areas around the central tank were enjoyable with a mixture of fish and birdlife, as well as a couple of otters.
Amazing. Stopped here when we were riding the hop on hop off bus. Thought it would be a short visit but spent over two hours there. We loved it and it was so inexpensive!

Very worthwhile for everyone. Great place to spend the day, well worth the admission, the center tank is fantastic and the side tanks very interesting. check out the displays under the boardwalk and out by the bay. Have a snack from the vendors in the square and get adventurous!

Good but not superb. The building itself is quite large and impressive, because of that we assumed that there will be a lot to see.Unfortunately,there wasn't and we would have expected a lot more frogs and different sea animals ,but something there still was,like basic fishes and a couple of animals.Just there is no wow efect.Hopefully they will enlarge the exhibition in the future.
A great place to visit!. I think it's worth the cost, since it's a beautiful place and well preserved! If you have time go to see the temporary exhibition available! They are always really good!
Should be seen!!!. Unforgettable experience! One of the most beautiful Oceanario in Europe!!! No age to go there and have a good time and learn!

A great place to visit. This is an amazing place and no wonder it is currently the 2nd best in the world! (according to Tripadvisor).
Some great fish to see, nice penguins and some animals i have never seen before.
Make sure you visit if you are in Lisbon

Very well laid out, super educationa and impressive.. You will want to spend the day in this special aquarium, the largest in Europe, I believe. The center tank is filled with hundreds of varieties of fish large and small and galleries representing 4 different climate zones surround it. We saw otters playing right up close, an Arctic habitat and a rain forest environment.Everything is explained in multiple languages. Definately a Lisbon highlight and easy to get to by bus train or trolley.

Good for family visits. This oceanarium is no longer new, which can be seen in many of the exhibits. A good thing is that the way through the different exhibits is well marked, so you are not in doubt where to go. Some of the cooridors are a bit dark. The layout with a central tank which can be seen from different angles all around at two levels with many smaller side aquaria around it is very good and you get the impression that you see many tanks. The same layout has also be successfully copied by others and is functioning well. The variety of fishes and all other sorts of marine animals is very good, spanning from arctic to tropical areas. It was a pity to see too many of the fishes having infections on fins and parts of the body. They should be replaced. An overall impression was that the oceanarium is well organised, but maintenance could be better.
Well presented. Lots of different fish from tiny to big Sun fish, also penguins, very informative. Good value for money too.

one of the world's best. this oceanarium is awesome; those who cannot stand caged animals should not go. It is comprehensive and very beautiful for solo visitors, couples, families. good public transportation and great setting.

Wonderful place to go.. This is a must see! I've never seen so many different kinds of sea life and in several instances you can get up close to them. It is one of the best places I've ever visited and so much fun for both kids and adults. I would definitely go back if I'm ever back in Lisbon.

One of the best Aquarius of the world!!!. One of the best Aquarius of the world. There you can find and fill 4 different continents with their diversities. One of the best attraction in Lisboa, believe that you will like it. It is very well constructed and very well structured. And the environment area is great with a big river almost ocean and very nice and modern area to spend sometime just going around.

Very nice!. This makes a good visit to combine with soms other sites in Lisbon. We've been here twice, so far. We spend about 2 hours in the oceanarium. That's long enough, especially with small children.
Sea Life. A great WOOOW for people who like to look at fish without getting wet, worth a visit even if you don't like fish they even have penguins and birds
great place for take a rest. Very nice place. When you have a free time in Lisbon this place is amazing for relax. Silent underwater life. Funny are otters.

Not impressed. In the middle there is a huge tank with number of fish species. All they do is swim in circles. Penguins looked kind of sad and were not interested in eating fishes floating on the surface of the pool. Other smaller tanks were interesting, for example you can see sea horses and smallest frogs on earth in variety of colors (red, blue,...). Section with turtles was not working since some renovation is going on (there was no info when it will be finished). But there is no discount for this reason. You have to pay full price and no one informs you that you will not be able to see the turtles before buying the ticket.

Pros and cons. Don't get me wrong, this is a very nice way to spend an afternoon. But for the same price you could do a lot more in Lisbon.Pros.:The whole vecinity of the Oceanario is very nice and it is a very calm place to take strols before or after the visit. It is a great place to take kids, as it is entertaining and it has a very high value on the educational part.The sheer amount of animals inside is mesmerizing. You will see animals you never thought to see in such enviroment.You can kind of travel the world a see the most famous species of aquatic animals, and some birds too.There are pleanty of places to take spetacular photos and/or selfies with or without animals in the frame.Cons:The price, I think it is a bit expensive, if you are going with more than 2 people it can drill a hole in your pocket. If you are going with kids and they don't like it or if they are afraid of dark spaces you are in for hellish ride, as the tour is normaly long and sometimes there are spaces with low light so they don't disturb the animals but at the same time make kids unconfortable.So to resume, it is a very nice place to go and I urge you all to go, just be aware of the costs and be careful if your kids tend not to like this kind of places.

Good Place to dive. Hello Travellers, this is a good place to visit specially if you like sea and have kids, they will love it.Even if you dont have kids, you will enjoy it its a trip to oceans species and a good place to chill out and watch in the big Windows of the aquarium.You can and shall bring some food like sandwich, water, juices whatever you like as you like.There are some spots in there that you can sit on the floor eat and drink and enjoy the sea.i think is a must see place.You Will leave and remind it!

Brilliant day out!. We planned our visit and arrived not long after opening as we had seen long queues on a previous day. Very organised place and we thought good value for money. Although it is effectively one very large tank in the middle with lots of little bits around the outside we were amazed with everything we saw. In places it did become crowded but we just looked at something else and went back when the crowds had passed. The sheer scale of the main tank is breathtaking. Our girls (nearly 6 and 8 1/2) were mesmerised the whole way round. Really great and unique place.
A great place in a superb setting. Loved the approach from the Estacao Oriente and the slightly unsettling 'sea-nettles' and 'sea-dragons'.
birds look very unhappy. I had no idea they had birds in there. And some of them are migratory birds. Most of them were sitting next to the windows gazing out. They did not look happy, rather sick.
Fun. It was a very nice and average aquarium. It was to dark and I would like a lot more content. The big aquarium in the middle was the main attraction.

More like a big tank. I was expecting to be taken aback by a huge aquarium. But all they got there - and for 14 euros! - is a big tank with hundreds of fish and some sharks. Maybe even too many animals for such a tank. All they can do is swim around in circles, which I found kind of sad after observing them for a while. The place was packed with families and I visited at the end of October during a week day. Inside, there are quick exhibits for the kids on ocean preservation, which is nice, and some external areas where you can see penguins, otters and some other sea animals. If you have kids, this is surely a must, as they go crazy.

Seeing the underwater world with a different perspective. Located on the site of the 1998 world exposition (near Oriente subway station) the Oceanario will introduce you the underwater world like hardly any other aquarium in the world (except for Sydney, Australia). 4 large two story bassins will let you explore the various species of fish and marine animals (sharks, stingray, penguins etc) from above, sea level and from tha abysses. It is worth the approx 2 hours plus visit.

Amazing range of sealife on view. This was a really well designed aquarium, lots of access to see the range of creatures, some very unusual and spectacular ones. Clean. Restaurant served tasty, good value simple meas.
Great. Great place to visit with or without kids. Plenty of information available & space to walk around to see the fish from all angles. Enjoyed it.

Unique Presentation Well thought out. Not usually a big fan of oceanariums, prefer the real thing, but this was world class, highly informative and left when with a feeling of hope for the future of the oceans

Definitely worth a visit. This aquarium is world class. Well laid out, rich in exhibits. Up there with the Monterey Aquarium which we visited two years ago. We were there on a busy weekday, I imagine it is packed on the weekend.

Superb setting and well displayed, for all ages. the location in the modern area about 5km N of the main town makes it a long way to go but metro goes within 500m, and if you have kids do not miss this one. The main tank is HUGE and sited in the sea itself, and has some of the nicest and ugliest fish in town in it. Good educational attempts also .... Allow 2 hrs inside, more if you have kids.

Good but not as good as we expected. We had heard that this is the biggest aquarium in Europe, so expected it to be amazing, but it was just good or ok, not better than that. We went around in less than an hour. Try the science museum next door....much better!
Ocean for the little ones. Great to visit with kids and return back your little child inside! Fabulous conditions! Will bring back my niece again
great fun. All good. 2adults2kids is €36. Worth a visit. Metro stop oriente. The other side of Vasco de Gama shopping centre walk to the right and you see it.

A day in the area of the Oceanario. If you have a day in Lisbon with kids and do not want to visit historical sites I would recommend you do the following:1. Take metro to the Vasco de Gamma Shopping Centre and walk around the shops.2. Stop off on the top floor for a mid-morning custard tart and juice at the food court. Great views of the river.3. Go to the cinema on the top floor and play air hockey or if you wish watch a movie the majority of them are in English and sub-titled in Portuguese although be careful with the under 12 movies they are in Portuguese!4. If hungry have lunch in the food court lots of variety food to suit everyone.5. Go to 1st floor entrance facing river and walk towards river turn left at river walk 5 minutes then get on cable car going opposite way it stops outside Oceanario. Great ride kids will love it.6. Visit Oceanario it is fantastic the best one I have been in in Europe better than Barcelona.

ONE big tank seen from different perspectives... a bit pricey!. The Oceanario is a huge tank seen from different perspectivesthey offer that day at extra cost an exhibition about turtles, very poor, we saw more on the walls written essay ( not really for small kids) then on the huge aquarium they haveit´s all about going around the one big piece aquarium and seeing the same fishes either left/right /center or first/second floorthey allow a lot of people at the same time and you need to wait to see what´s i front of you and cannot move easy and it becomes a stress day to see what you there to see... people keep bumping into you, then there are baby strollers all over the place... it kind a becomes a night mare being there and the idea of visiting the seas and the animals it´s not enjoyable at its potentiala bit disappointing for the money they ask for the visit... not really worth it and to be honest kids have more fun on a beach day out ( free of charge)

Interesting visit. This a great place to walk through. You can see the main tank from a number of spots within the building. They have a number of good exhibits. The surrounding area to the aquarium is also interesting.

Well worth a visit. A great place for everyone who is interested in the ocean. there's a huge tank in the middle where you can see sharks, rays, barracudas and even sunfish. there are also lots of small tanks arranged by habitat (indian ocean, arctic, pacific, north atlantic), where you find penguins, seaotters, puffins and of course lots of different and interesting fish. they have a focus on the dangers due to pollution which is also very interesting and thought provoking. When visiting Lisboa, thr Oceanário is a must-see.

Best Aquarium ever seen a real top attraction. We went back there having seen the area from the grey bus tour. With the bus ticket you get a small discount too. This is a truly impressive aquarium very modern and truly beautiful which puts to shame any other aquarium ever seen before. The main tank is enormous and just beautiful with some of the best fish collection ever seen with lots of sharks, stingrays etc but also sun fish, a truly impressive giant. The other recreations of the oceans are also amazing. They even recreated Antarctic sea with mini glaciers for the Penguins, there is a small tropical forest and many secondary tanks that are just beautiful. If you like the sea don't miss it. Great to do also the cable car just outside (ticket is extra) which seems to work only at weekends.
Good family activity. Very good - not mind-blowing but a very nice hour or two with young children. Nice plaza also for a snack and running around!

Fabulous - fabulous - fabulous!. So worth the time and the ticket price. A beautiful place to visit - would definitely recommend.Not too busy when we visited but perhaps during peak times it could get a little crowded. Fantastic experience.
Wonderful. Miraculous diversity of marine life wonderfully presented .Our whole family (adults and teenagers) enjoyed the experience.

Great Rainy Day Activity. I am a diver, and this visit made me want to plan another dive trip. You will find beautiful displays full of all sorts of fantastic fish! We even found a frogfish in one of the small side tanks. The more time you spend looking, the more fantastic fish you will see! I recommend that you do not stop when you walk in the main door - yes the tank is spectacular, but I assure you there are many many viewing windows. Everyone crowds around the first few areas, but about halfway around the circle you will find windows with no one. We sat down and enjoyed watching all the antics of the fish without a crowd. If you have a fish identification book at home, it is worth packing along. There is so much to see that the book would be helpful.

beautiful ,very nice view. very nice view, the weather was spectacular.
took many pictures, and the people very nice. they want to help you out
Fascinating fish. Fabulous species of fish and other mammals, but despaired of the people in front of us at every window, making interminable videos.
Worth visiting. Interesting, educative. Great opportunity to learn about water and its life. Big but compact premises.

Excellent outing with kids; come mid-week if you can. Just visited the aquarium and it's one of the best we've ever been to. Lots to see and we came on a Monday when it was not crowded and we could explore at our leisure. We loved the massive central tank and how it looked different from all angles, above and below, etc. the smaller tanks were also well presented. The temporary exhibit was closed unfortunately. We ate in the cafe and found it to be convenient and a good value. We also found some bargains in the shop. I would recommend it for anyone who likes sea life.Only pet peeve is we found it difficult to find the entrance coming from the Oriente metro stop. The signage could have been better; we sort of walked way out of our way to arrive.

Another world!. What a lovely place. The aquarium is set in 4 areas that have their own exibits of life; antarctic, tropical, pacific and indian. From that, they are all linked via one massive tank that has a variety of marine life. There was so much to explore, it pretty much is a day trip. The temporary exhibit had turtles in it. Was not as impressed with this, but the actual aquarium was enough to impress, the variety of marine life I saw was countless. Would absolutely recommend it. This place coupled with the nearby shopping trip, I say it would make a great day out.

great for a wet day. Built for expo 98, 2nd largest aquarium in the world. . On a pier surrounded by water , on two floors divided into four main areas. Great entertainment for a morning or afternoon.

Fishy:). Worth a visit, although far from center. We first tryed to take the train from Santa Apolinia but the wait for the next train was so long that we took the metro around. That took a hour! The place itself was interesting and worth the travel. Huge centertank with hugely variation to the fish in it. Dont know how they keep the big fish from eating the small ones:) Injoy!

Awe-inspiring!. Wow was my first impression of Oceanario De Lisboa - informative, respectful of wildlife and educational. Loved it! Staff are helpful and go out of their way to answer questions and offer information. The sea otters were a personal highlight! I would avoid school holidays as I can imagine it gets very busy.
One of Lisbon's icons. One of the best in Europe. Worth a visit all year long, fantastic location in Expos 98 surrounding area

Largest Aquarium in Europe. Great attraction for any age. The size of the tank and variety of fish was pretty awesome. Very hypnotic watching them all swim round and different heights (the tank must be 20 metres deep).

Good Aquarium. We enjoyed a couple of hours here but it isn't on the top of our list of things to do in Lisbon. The main tank is great and the views into it from lots of different angles was wonderful as was the variety of fish. The giant Sunfish are truly strange. After that, there wasn't much else. The cafe is excellent with a nice patio and views. Cost is a little high. Senior discount.

What everybody does on a rainy Sunday in Lisbon. Very crowded because of the weather, something for people to do with their kids. Decent, but definitely no Shedd Aquarium. It was interesting to see the big ocean sun fish, very strange animals!
Cute otters =). Quite a nice place, well organised. Fantastic large aquarium! Surely a very romantic place to visit, and the must-see for kids!

Good for the kids. A good attraction, is someways out of the city though so need transport.Def worth it if you have kids and have already seen the historic sights of this fantastic city.Penguin enclosures are not very big, but the marine life is good. Allow 3-4 hours round trip

Lisbon Oceanarium. A nice place to visit, a bit expensive though. Mainly marine life, but some amphibians and mammals are displayed. Consists of a huge central aquarium (impressive especimens, including sharks, barracudas, moon fishes, grouper) surrounded by smaller specialised environments (jelly fish, penguins and other birds, smaller colourful fish, eels, etc.).

Great way to spend time with kids. We took our 3 years old girl to the place . We had great time watching all the sea Creatures וn the huge aquarium, The Penguins , Sharks ext. Our child enjoyed a lot watching them and it was educational as well..a Great way to spend 2-3 hours in LIsbon.

Excellent attraction. Went here on a rainy day and so did the rest of the Lisbon. The aquarium is wonderful and lots of narrative in English and Portuguese. Excellent film in cinema (about 20mins) with English sub titles which was all about the aquarium and how they care for the fish, penguins etc.Not enough loos inside the aquarium queued for 20mins for a unisex cubicle only 1 on each floor unless you want to leave aquarium. Its out on a limb to the North of Lisbon and a taxi took 4 of us right to the door. Queues for tickets were very long but you can book tickets on line while in the queue and then just show the bar coded vouchers that you are e mailed.There is a restaurant and a small coffee bar ( about 5 tables) where you can get sandwiches.Really worth doing.

oceanario de lisboa. Four tanks around the large central tank house four different habitats with their native flora and fauna: the North Atlantic rocky coast, the Antarctic coastal line, the Temperate Pacific kelp forests, and the Tropical Indian coral reefs. These tanks are separated from the central tank only by large sheets of acrylic to provide the illusion of a single large tank. Throughout the first floor there are an additional 25 thematic aquariums with each of the habitats' own characteristics.[8]The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the few aquariums in the world to house a sunfish due to their unique and demanding requirements for care. Other interesting species include two large spider crabs and two sea otters named Eusébio and Amália, named after two Portuguese contemporary cultural references.

love it. we visited with son and my wife , we had a very good experience, because we always visit around the world zoo's, aquariums, and this ok was very nice, I recommend to visit the Oceanario in Lisbon!!
Great for kids, best oceanario ever seen. Great situation. Amazing central tank. Sharks awesome and Luna fish. Kids enjoy. It s calm and clean, well done.

Probably the best I've visited!. This is a great aquarium and at 14 euros I think a real bargain. Real thought to the setout with the 4 corners upstairs and down dedicated to a different ocean all surrounding a gigantic central tank.With Sharks, Stingrays, Penguins, Sea Otters, Amphibian exibit and more its got everything you want to see. They are all about the conservation message not the tacky tricks & gimmicks.Got the metro to Oriente then just a 5 minute walk with a shopping centre and restaurantes along the way. The aquarium is also next door to the cable car which runs to Vasco de Gama bridge so a good day out!

Amazingly huge tank is star attraction. The layout of this place is simple but effective. You walk around the top floor, with the huge tank in the centre and each external corner is themed on a different zone, with different sea creatures in it. There's an antarctic zone that has penguins and flying birds (terns I think), a pacific zone, a rainforest zone and atlantic zone. The star attraction are the two sea otters that are unbelivably cute - guaranteed to be a winner with the kids I think.The aforementioned internal tank has all sorts of creatures in it - sharks, shoals of fish, devil rays, small fish, big fish. Each perspective on it gives you something new to see. Downstairs the layout is similar, with lots of smaller tanks too highlighting different species. The coral and anenome displays are amazing. There is also a temporary exhibit as well as the permanent one, but this was closed when we visited. There's a perfectly good cafe and gift shop too. I'd allow a couple of hours for a really in depth visit.
Otters, all sorts of fish, penguins, sharks and turtles, very nice. One of the biggest aquariums in Europe, and its well worth a visit. The otters were soo cute! Great for the kids...
needs a facelift. not that great, very worn.- area seemed a little down on its heels as well. I wouldn't waste the time.

Better than expected. We visited after doing the red bus tour. The area surrounding the Oceanario is a great place just for a walk, a picnic or just to read a book.The building is huge and the aquarium was massive, many different species. Half way around we watched the video about the Oceanario, this was very interesting and we got some great picture and videos to bring home.Worth a visit and not expensive. The do great work for children and the facilities were very good.

Amazing Fish Tank. It has the biggest tank with the widest collection of fish and sea creatures that I have seen. Looking at the information they clearly do a great deal for marine research and conservation. If you feel strongly about the sea and its contents this is something you should not miss when you are in Lisbon. The big tank is a truly amazing sight.

One of the Best!. I've been to many great oceanariums including Monterrey California, Cape Town South Africa, New Orleans, Louisiana, and Boston. This is one of the best. The exhibits and physical plant are tops. Everything is fully signed in English as well as Portuguese.
Children's enjoyment. We took my 2 grandchildren last year and they loved it. Coming from NY you never know how children will assess other countries' sights. Loved it and will be back!

Great ocenario. One of the best attractions in the Expo district. Definitely must see. I was in standard exposition and I really enjoyed time spent there. Especially the small aquarios located around the big one are worth to see.

The best in the world. A great Acquarium with a huge center tank with a breathtaking variety of fishes and other marine fauna. Imprressive sharks, great crowds of fishes, rays, moon-fish... in the side tanks very intersting species from the water world. It is easy to spend half a day without a boring second. 14€ adult, 9€ child 36€ a family (2+2), worth every cent
To learn and to enjoy. Wonderful place to see and learn a lot about ocean animals. Really beautiful and relaxing place. Much better than the one in Barcelona.

Don't miss it. If you already know other aquaries maybe it will not have the same impact on you. But for me it was worth the price - even having already visited London's SeaLife. First, because this Oceanary is very well mantained and organized, and second because it has some special characteristics. For example, the penguins and the otters are in open spaces and not behing glasses, some birds are flying freely inside the penguin's space, etc. Recommended!

Dreamily relaxed. Really lovely experience, very calm, very well curated and we adored the otters. It's supposedly the largest in Europe. In a gorgeous part of town, which is very relaxed and has been redeveloped recently. There is a really lovely ice cream shop close to the fountains, enjoy!

Good but others are better. This is a good stop to make if you want to visit a different part of Lisbon plus situated right near the cable car that is worth a ride. Reasonably priced compared to other aquariums around the world but it is quite small so not sure the claim that it is one of the best in the world quite stacks up

Breathtaking views. Convenient to all via Oriented Station, as well as the mall, which has a very nice food court. The river walk with its spectacular views of the Vasco da Gama bridge is wonderful outside venue.

Only worth visiting on a rainy day. Visited the aquarium mid week on a Wednesday, and was not busy at all, arriving at around 11am there were absolutely no queues to buy tickets, and we had to do a double check to make sure we had gotten the right place. The area in which the aquarium is located (within a few hundred yards from the Vasco de Gama shopping mall), is quite an empty big space, with just the aquarium, a large theatre/stadium, and the shopping mall. So if you're planning on walking around, not much else to see/do.The aquarium isn't the best I've seen. There are smaller tanks that you walk around in rooms that showcase parts of the central tank containing the most of the aquatic species- sharks, rays, boney fish, schooling fish, etc. There wasn't much else in the way of a good showcase of the aquatic life there. Although the aquarium itself felt relatively new and well kept in comparison to other aquariums I've been to- e.g. UK Birmingham Sea life centre. In comparison to Sydney Sea life centre, there wasn't much comparison, as Australia wins hands down.As for the price, €14 was a bit too much for an aquarium which we walked around within 1 hour 15 minutes.

Don't miss it!. This has been rated as one of the best attractions in Europe. Indeed, it is! Specially for kids. A great diversity of species in a wonderful space. Everything is always so clean and well kept.
Amazing!. Big central tank is amazing! I was also surprised to see penguins and otters. It has lot to offer but ticket price is a bit high.

Well worth visiting. Visited Monday 6th October 2014. Took about 2 hours to leisurely go round. It is well laid out with some amazing fish, some of which we have never heard of. Information regarding the exhibits is also in English, and there is an audio guide available at an extra cost (we did not bother with this, so I cannot comment on it). It is located in a lovely park area, with access to the cable car and views of the incredible Vasco da Gama bridge. It is open until 8pm.

Amazing.. We spent about 2 and a half hours here. My eighteen month old boy was spell bound. He had an amazing time running around totally free. The sea otters, penguins and puffins are brilliant as is the main tank.

An amazing aquarium. This is the best aquarium we have visited. The arrangement of species by ocean was an excellent way to present the huge array of aquatic life in the aquarium. There was good information provided about each aquatic creature, including many that we had never seen before and some that we had never even heard of. Each area was large and clean and the inhabitants were well cared for. The movie showing how the animals are fed and kept healthy was most interesting.
A good option for kids or for a raining day. If you have kids or its raining in Lisboa, this is one of the entertainments for you... :) .. in almost 2 hours you will go thru this nice place!
It's a must!. One of the most terrific and interesting places to visit in Lisboa. And you can see sunfish here! :)
Brilliant architecture. spectacular central tank, brilliant architectureneed only about 1 hour but well worth the tripalso has a family rate

The marvelous aquarium I ever seen. I loike very much the way it is organize, the multitude of species. The big central aquarium is marvelous, with a lot of big fish or very curious one. Excellent experience.
Great place for adults and children as well. Easy to reach by metro, easy to go through and see all. Be prepared to spend time enough to see this wonderful sea world.
A great attraction for kids.. Our kids (ages 4 and 8) loved this aquarium. It was modern and clean, and the signs were also in English which was a bonus for us.
A real gem. Worth the trip out. Eat at one of the fish restaurants along the front whilst you're there but watch out for paying by weight!
Great fun for all kids!. Now this is what an aquarium should be like! Loved it, especially the sea otters! A good starting base to explore this part of lisbon
A bet for you money. Great aquarium... Lots of species on display and a great center tank with sharks and lots of other sea species... Great for bringing your family along.... The kids love it...

Excellent Aquarium. The Aquarium is by far one of the best I've seen. The main tank which contains a variety of fish and some beautiful sharks is very well laid out with several viewing locations around it. You have locations you can sit and just view the majestic animals. Perfect to sit with your kids and just see what the underwater world looks like. The penguins and the otters are adorable and again educational for your kids. Highly recommended as this will not disappoint. The price is reasonable especially for what you see.
Great!. I never visited an aquarium and it was great to see all the different fishes and environments recreated.

All the Oceans.... Interesting displays - loved the penguins! Lots of fish and sea creatures. Relatively quiet when we visited so we were able to spend time at each 'window' - not sure how it would be if crowded.

Beautiful aquarium. Beautiful aquarium, and a nice place to visit, with or without kids. There are a lot of exhibitions to choose from, and everything looks really good with a great variety of the life in the sea. The big aquarium, wich is the main attraction has a lot of places around it where you can watch the fishes etc, so it doesnt get very crowded.A good tip is to visit on weekdays, long ques in the weekend, because many of the locals are going there too in the weekends.
very nice. A must see place especially if you're travelling with your kids.A must see place especially if you're travelling with your kids.

Great price, incredible exhibit. Spend half a day here - lots to see, the kids loved it! In the centre is a giant tank with sharks, rays, a couple of sunfish and many man other fish. The aquarium is built around it so as you see the smaller exhibits you get a different view of the main tank. There was a special sea turtle exhibition on when were here and was worth the extra euros. Wasn't anything really we disliked, we had a great time.
Worth a detailed visit. Extremely well layed out and magnificently kept. Great to take both kids and adults who are interested in sea life.

Unique Building With a Huge Internal Tank. The "oceanario" has a nice collection of fish from Indian, Pacific, Atlantic, and Arctic domains. They put these on the four corners around the main tank. Each of these areas includes an upper and lower area so you can see the domain from land to water and from under water. In and of itself, these made the visit worth it. The main tank in the center though was incredible. We saw a large range of fish, many of which were more exotic to an American like me. Many of the fish, rays, etc would swim right next to the glass boundary. That was also pretty cool.The oceanario is in the Parque Das Nacoes area which is the newest part of Lisbon with great transportation, shopping, etc. Worth a visit.

Impressive and inspiring. The main tank is mesmerising, with its healthy and diverse collections of fish. The side tanks are also good. I particularly enjoyed their amazing eel displays. Well worth a visit.

Unforgettable Experience. This is must a do activity if you are in Lisbon for a few days. Easy to get on the metro from central Lisbon. A very reasonable price for the length of time you can spend strolling inside. We spent hours staring at the central tank with sharks, sting rays, schools of fish circling around. The four outer zones offer a nice mix including otters, penguins and tropical fish.Fantastic experience - strongly recommend.

Very busy. Worth the money. Very big aquarium with fish, manta, stingray and sharks. Lots of fun. Very busy inside had to slowdown to avoid crowds a few times. They even had a penguin exhibit. It was good. We missed turtle exhibit by one day.

Lots of fun for the little ones. Our 1.5 yr old loved it and so did we. The main attraction is really awesome with a huge tank that you walk around while exploring the different oceans of the world. Worth the visit.
visit to Oceanario. I think this is the number one attraction in the world, the first wonder. Its amazing mesmerised by fish swimming every direction
Great aquarium experience. The best aquarium I have ever seen ... professional and huge windows to see the fish, sharks, plants and otters. Put it high on your list of things to see in Lisbon.

Very good.... We visited the Oceanario based on the extremely positive reviews and their claim that it is the best Aquarium of Europe. It is a very impressive aquarium no doubt, the exhibition is centered on their gargantuan aquarium in the middle of the building. This in itself is worth seeing. The rest of the exhibition is very good, but I recall seeing more interesting things in Genova's aquarium. Nevertheless, great visit, try to buy your tickets in advance so you don't have to wait in line.

Value for money. This was a great place to visit. No queues she we were there but I can imagine it gets very busy.There are tearoom/cafes and bars along the same parade. Inside is massive there are too many species to name them all but sharks, penguins, Turtles and fish of all description. The place seems to go on forever. When you leave if you go to the rear of the building you can see the river and there is a cable car well worth travelling on.

Cool Otters!. The idea of centering the exebition around one "big unifying Ocean" is a good one. So the divition into the top floor, and the bottom floor, which gives you two different perspectives of that big Ocean. The problem is that the "Big Ocean" due to obvious reasons actually is quite small,- and it soon gets really repetetive. The division of the climatic zones, with fauna and birds etc in that setteing, could be really cool,- but the exebition hardly contains anything. Ex.. The "tTopical Rainforest walk" was just a walk on a slippery wooden path, with a few plants. Nothing else. The walk through the Oceanario was very dark, narrow and at times a bit claustrofobic. Lots of shrieking kids...On a whole,- very repetetive, a bit boring, thin exebitions, but the Otters were really well displayed!
Not the biggest, but definely one of the worlds best. Had a great visit with a group of friends.Well thought out concept and architectureThe expo's are usually worth it
absolute must. we ve been very impressed. huge pool with all possible fish. worth of visit without thinking. Huge and so nice! advising to everyone.

A great relaxing experience. Aquariums aren't my favourite places in general, but this one is great if you want to take a leisurely stroll while the kids disappear for hours exploring it by themselves.
Turtles!. Fantastic place to visit, visiting exhibition of sea turtles which we had never seen before. Didn't see the otters them must have been hiding!
Very informative. I really like this oceanario. It was very informative. The turtle presentation was amazing. It was a great time.

Amazing. As recommended by the Lonely Planet guide we visited the Sealife :)
Both me and my partner agreed that it was worth the visit.
The design of the building and its usage is fantastic and it is very informative about the need for conservation, and preservation of the earth, and nature.

really cool. in General I liked the area of the Park of Nations (which Seaquarium)
modern green recreation area, shopping centre, cafes.
very convenient to arrive at Nations Park in the morning. With the beginning of the Aquarium, and then ride on the cable car and take a stroll through the Park.

Well worth the trip. A friend strongly recommended we visit the aquarium. We looked at the location and were initially put off by the distance from Lisbon town centre. We'll forget that, because it's a doddle getting there on the brilliant Metro. Less than 30 minutes from the blue line, one change to the Oriente stop on the red line followed by a 5 minute walk. Easy. The aquarium itself is superb, not just in what is on show: ocean fish including rays, small shark, sun fish etc. but also marine and arctic, including penguins and puffins, also amphibians, they even have sea otters and many more...but also the way it is designed. There are so many good viewing areas, there is room for all.
Amazing!. I loved this place. I lost track of time in here. The amount of sea life present is particularly impressive.
Great. Great,great,great.Excellent work done there.It demonstrates exactly all the oceans.Dedicate a visit to it and the surrounding area.You won't miss!

A good place to visit in a rainy day. Not really a great fan of oceanariums but this one is quite special. The main aquarium contained a wide variety of fish whilst the 4"worlds" housed fish and sea creatures your rarely get so see a first hand.
Best I've visited . Superb attraction in LisbonGreat valueGreat for both adults and children Easily spent a few hours Fascinating marine life I've never heard of let alone seen !!!Jelly fish awesome
Great!. Everything is great! The staff, the animals, the space.Worth a visit!! We will be back! That's for sure!!
big and modern. Like a huge aquarium,with many people,you need To go early 'cause you spend long time to go in...very big collection of jelly fish...if you like the sea or have kids, you need to go.

Waste of money and time. When you pay upfront, they'll ask you if you want the turtle tour. We said yes. All we saw was one turtle. Aside from that, there are probably 3 sharks by my count -2 of them small- a few other types of fish but nothing wow'ing and that's about it. All and all it was a waste of time and money.
Very interesting. I went here on my last day and I am deffinetly not sorry. If you are in Lisbon this is where you have t go.

A delightful place anytime!. Incredible sights! Family friendly. The staff is warm and friendly. The temporary sea turtle exhibit was an added bonus. The full wall aquariums are truly magical...great place for every age!
What a day !. We had a great time at Oceanario. This is one of the best aquariums we have visited in our travels. Don't miss it if you like the oceans.
Otters. Nice place to spend some down time. Bring a lunch and eat outside. The sky way next to it is worth the ride for the views of the area
Great place to visit. Excellent and interesting aquarium, with so much to see. We especially loved the turtles and the sea otters. Really good attraction for families. the cafe there is good, too.

Expensive for what it is. One large tank containing a multitude of different species. Some other smaller tanks. A Sea Turtle exhibition that I had to ask a member of staff where the Turtles were. That's about it folks....and at €16/head it isn't cheap.
Excellent aquarium. I would highly recommend this aquarium particularly to parents with children. The displays are excellent and will maintain the interest of people of all ages.

Fantastic experience. The oceanarium is very special because it shows many kinds of fishes together in their almost natural environment in an enourmous basin. You can walk around and see new and new views of the underwater life. Besides there are also smaller outdoor garden-like places where you can see fishes, animals and plants of a certain biotop together, like the Indian Ocean or the Antarctic. There are also small aquariums with special fishes and water animals. Everything is wonderfully arranged and explained and you also can watch movies about the functioning of the oceanarium. Young and old, everybody can enjoy it. After the visit you can take a cable car to a nice lookout tower, which was unfortunately closed at the time of our visit. The only problem is that the metro stop is quite far from the oceanarium.

Amazing adventure through the diversity of world' oceans. Diverse, fascinating for both children and adults. For some extra money you can also see the turtles on the upper floor. One of the most interesting places of Lisbon!

Stunning trip under the sea. I love aquariums. However this place is like none other. It quite simply has one huge enormous center piece of a tank. The majority of the time is spent spiraling around the hypnotic tank of circling fish and sea life.

Wide awake with the fishes!. Nearly didn't go.Closest I've been to an aquarium is my goldfish at age 8.
The moment you enter you will be enthralled.
Spent hours here.
Even Tony Soprano wouldn't be "sleeping with the fishes" here.
This is one BIG goldfish bowl.
"Pinky" would have loved it!
Amazing collection of sea creatures. This is a wonderful facility with a huge and amazing collection of scores of sea creatures. Well worth a visit.
Interesting place. Very well organized place, where you may see a huge variety of ocean creatures. Children and adults will enjoy this experience

Beautiful. It was the first time i went to an acquarium and it was so good, so big, so fascinating, so many diferent varieties of fishes..I traveled in another world...very high recommended with a small spliff before! :)

huge fun. So, we spent two hours at this huge aquarium. There was a waiting line for the tickets but it moved quickly (yes, you can buy them online). We bought adult tickets for permanent exhibition which cost 13 euors per person (if you want to see the turtles then you pay 3 euros for temporary exhibition as well). The oceanario is situated in the area of Lisbon known as Park of the Nations where the EXPO was held in 1998. It's far from the center but easily reachable by metro. If you love fish and all sorts of sea life you'll love this place. First of all, it has this huge circular aquarium and everything else is placed around it. All the oceans are represented. The penguins were cute as well as otters. There is a gift shop at the exit, plenty of restrooms etc. Outside the ticket box you have this big waterfall, so cool. I definitely recommend a visit!

Large modern aquarium. Modern and well designed. Good variety of marine life including the only sea otters in Europe. Definitely worth a visit if you have any interest in marine life. Personally preferred valencias oceanarium but still worth a trip.When visiting the cable cars are a short walk away and worth a ride
Amazing. One of the best Oceanarios. The concept is based on the ecosistems of each species. Location is in the totally renovated area of the Lisbon Expo. Very good.

for those, who not diving in exotic oceans. make impression, big and with various species of fish and other sea life. But if you at any time dive or even snorkel in Red Sea or Indian Ocean or caribbean you can feel insufficiency. I felt.
A must visit. One of the best Oceanariums in the world. Well worth a visit for Adults and children alike. Could have spent all day there just sitting and watching the marine life.
Great experience. Great experience - Highly recommended! If you don ´t need any discount you can go through the shorter queque ;-).
Nice, specially for kids. Very nice ambient, but a bit small for the expectation. Nice huge main pool for various species of fish.
smołę all over. ITS really big and nas few nice sharks. No tunel but Stilo, worth visiting. It masę my day a very good day.

Not to be missed. The Oceanario is a fantastic experience in Lisbon. I've visited twice and will go again. The sealife is very impressing and the side basins are nice and well illuminated and explained.
The area around is nice and quiet, providing a relaxing break in a citytrip.

For those the love Aquariums. Being there several times. It is a must to visit. Within the EXPO 98 area it is one the biggest Aquariums in the world. Well maintained and very pleasant place you will visit many attractions and if you want you can seat and relax a little bit too.

Great for kids. This was a highlight for us. Our son loved looking into the main tank - I think he probably could have stated there all day.
It's a really well thought through exhibition. I would try and book your tickets in advance over the web. Will save you a lot of time.

Good place for spending a rainy or a hot day. In comparison with the Oceanario from Barcelona I think the one from Lisbon is offering more intersting stuff to visitors and is bigger than Oceanario from Barcelona.

For a rainy day. If you have a day to spare this is certainly an option, especially if you have kids. Also the nearby Nations Park is worth a visit and for the ladies a great shopping mall Vasco da Gama.
So great!. Great experience, huge Aquarium, beautiful environment and very interesting exibition. A MUST in Lisbon.

Modern aquarium on the waterfront. A well presented collection of aquatic life, well explained in Portuguese and English, and plenty to look at. It's a shame these places are taken over by people who seem to be more interested in taking pictures on their 'phones than actually looking, but there you are.
Amazing!. Beautiful place to visit, especially for kids. A site not to miss when travelling to Lisbon. Amazing!
Arrive early. Arrive at the opening hours to enjoy it better. Located at the Parque das Nações, it is very beautiful and interesting, mainly for kids.

Must see. Whenever we can we take our child to go there and visit, it really impressive. If you book ahead some times of the year the small ones can sleep in near the main tank. Also some special activities occur for the babies before the opening for the general public.
stunning. It is a lovely relaxing place to visit, lots of things to see and it is worth a visit and I would recommend this trip to everyone.The price was reasonable roo

Amazing experience! . The Oceanário has huge water tanks with plenty of different fishes and other animals living at or near the sea. I really liked the temporary exhibition to sea turtles! Good place to go for rainy days!

Fantastic day out. Cruise ship docked in Lisbon after 2 weeks in the Med, we had visited lots of cities & wanted something different. It didn't disappoint. Could have spent the whole day there and would love to go back. Well worth a visit when in Lisbon

Stunning aquarium. This is an excellent aquarium; lots of thought has gone into the design and if you're inclined to it will easily take a couple of hours to walk round it. As far as Lisbon attractions go it is on the pricier side but that's the miser in me as anywhere else in Europe you would probably pay a lot more for an aquarium and it wouldn't be as good. I don't usually but for this visit I got the audio guide and it really enhanced the visit. Combine this with a trip in the nearby cable car and a browse round the Vasco De Gama mall and you've easily filled a very pleasant day.

a well passed time. Perfect maintenance conditions, great views to the different water tanks, loads and loads of relevant and properly organized information on the species you are looking at, it is a well spent time each visit to Oceanario
I loved this place.. All the oceans are represented. Genial. Every family should see this attraction. So educational..Again we liked every minute of it.

Great place. It's a great place for kids and grow ups to see and learn more about sea life. Huge variety of sea creatures and loved the turtles. My kids loved the penguins and the jelly fish. Definitely a place to visit.

interesting. we enjoyed the oceanari, it is supposed to be the second biggest in Europe and the main tank is really really big; lots of interesting notes in English but we were disappointed that we couldn't find out where the feeding was located. we went through the shark exhibit (extra cost) and thought that we had seen better elsewhere.

The best place to exprience the seas on dry land. Before anything else, a quick recommendation, in order to appreciate the Oceanario to the fullest, try to visit early morning during the week, when there are fewer visitors (and student trips), being able to walk around in silence and without the crowds makes the visit much more special.The central tank is awe inspiring, the penguins majestic, and the otters very cute.All in all, this is a must-see for whoever visits Lisbon and is curious to experience what's under the seas.

Otters and penguins the highlight!. Had a lovely time with grandparents & kids at the aquarium. A really good setup, easy to follow and great selection of fish. Better than the London aquarium due to the easy layout. We only viewed the permanent exhibition which was fine for a couple of hours. Will definitely do the temp exhibition next time.
Huge Aquarium. Wonderful place to visit, its quite big so you need a lot of time to get round the entire place, a must see
Must visit with children. Located at a modern district of Lisboa, it's a very good place to have a break when travelling with young children. It won't disapoint.
Best aquarium ever. So well designed, with concave windows that make you feel like you are in the tank. Spectacular collection of aquatic life - a "must see" even if you're not an aquarium person.

Good fun, but.... The Oceanaria is good fun but not worth the money. We paid €26 for two people and it only took us 15 minutes to walk around it. We expected it to have a few massive tanks but there was only one central tank with small nooks and tanks surrounding it. Plenty of variety of sea life though! If you've got the money to spare, do it. If not, just wander around the riverside area and enjoy the views.
Must go.. Already been there at least 3 times, and it is always a really nice place to spend some time, especially if you have children.
