Would be great for children.. Very crowded, but a nice experience. Easy to reach by metro. Great area With a huge shopping mall near by..........

Big & Interesting. As oceanaruim's go, this is right up there with the best we've visited. It's huge, based around a massive central tank with all manner of sealife. The route is well organised sprialling down through three storeys of the central tank, inside and outside (for puffins, penguins and beavers). It's also very reasonable for a family ticket and there are plenty of other activities to do right outsie from the cable car ride to the water gardens.

Great visit. This is a great aquarium. The exhibits are well cared for and routinely updated. The only disappointment was the turtle exhibit was much smaller than we expected. Take your time and enjoy the very wide range of animals they have. The café leaves a little to be desired, not a huge selection and only so so quality.

It's not just visiting it's like you're there, in the ocean. I liked the fact that because how everything is designed the focus is not on where you are but where the water is. You feel like you're there. Also loved the fact that it has stories everywhere and that it's about the whole marine life, with us humans in it (the good and the bad).Gets you to become conscious about how connected is everything.Great experience

Overall it was good but not exceptional. It was very dark inside and crowded. Small children camped in front of the main viewing screens and parents were happy to basically use this area for babysitting. Not great for other paying customers.

Something good for the whole family. When doing a city visit with the kids it is always good to find something interesting for them. This place definitely ticks that box. The way they have laid out the oceanarium is superb. When we visited there was a special exhibition on showing some turtles that were eventually going to be released back into the wild. Then there is the main aquarium. I know a lot of aquarium boast about how big their tanks are but this is exceptional. Apparently this is the second largest aquarium in Europe and I can believe that quite easily. Then there are special habitats such as a chilled area where there are penguins and puffins. There is even ice produced to try and make it more authentic. This is a great place to visit. Not just fun for the kids but for everyone. I cannot recommend this place enough.
The indoor marine aquarium in the world. Very clean and organized place. An excellent program to all ages.See the moon fish and her cute baby.

Great aquarium - one of the best. This is a great aquarium. Built around a very large central tank with plentiful viewing places for adults and children/pushchairs etc.Disappointed with the temporary turtle exhibition though.

One of the best and biggest Aquariums in the world. It is realy worth a visit. Located in expo a very beautiful are surrounded by gardens and river front. Ideal to go with the kids and the relax on the surroundings. Also shopping and restaurants very near by.
Awsome experience. Excellent family programme!My daughters and my Grand-Children adored it!The children dreamt about it and wanted to go back the next day :)
Entretainment. Very nice oceans experience in a very modern buiding on the river side. We can see the four ocean habitats in one place - Atlantic Ocean, Antartic, Pacific, Indian and their species.
Worth every penny!. Favorite place in Lisbon. Worth every penny. Well localized, very beautiful place. For ocean and nature lovers, it's well served.

Great experience, nice but expensive and restrictive. Inside u can see different ecosystems very well kept, the main tank is amazing with a great number of species coexisting.There is also plenty of information available and for kids is botb entertaining and educational.On the ther hand, its expensive and if you go out for any reason, you wont be allowed to re enter, and I am not talking about going home and come back, I mean still inside the Oceanarium. When we visited the site, firstwe enter the temporary exhibition, then the main building. At the end of our visit, our 5 years old daughter wanted to go back to the turtles but we were prohibited to reenter that area, even when the employee could still remember us. My kid was disappointed and honestly, after paying such expensive tickets, do were we.
almost inside the sea. enjoy the Lisbon´s oceanarium, and do you know your kids could spend the night there, close to the fishes ?

Don't miss !. It is the best aquarium in Europe, with species from all of the world! The central tank is amasing and the discover of the several mini tanks is a surprise. Each time I go there I find something new to wow me and the kids.
Unique!. You can see all the oceans in the same place.There is also a fine temporary expo about turtles. Very interesting.
Neverending fun. The best in Europe, year after year. I live in Lisboa and never get tired of visiting the Oceanário. Just take your kids to the place. You won't regret it.

A place to learn about the sea. Lisbon's Oceanarium is certainly one of the best in the world. It's an amazing place to learn about the sea environment. Here you can see hundreds of species placed in nicely simulated sea habitats.
amazing place. This is the right place to be... calm, quite and just amazing. Alone or with someone you won't regret it. Ok, the price might scare but it worth every cent.

Oceanario Visit. I visited the Oceanario on my birthday this year with my family. We had a great time seeing all the animals and fish even the sharks. There was a special sea turtle exhibit which was very informative.It is a must visit when you visit Lisbon.
Worth visiting!!. An excelent aquarium! Huge variety of sea life in an amazing setting!! Loved it!!! Will visit it again for sure.
Oceanário de Lisboa. Very nice!Very well managed. The central tank is aussum. And the other activities besides the exibition are very nice.

The Best Oceanario in Europe. It's the best in Europe. Really interesting exhibitions with several new programs around the whole year. It's for the whole family each member will find it extremely interesting. You will lose yourself in the Oceanario.

Wonderfull day at the Oceanarium. It's a must see in Lisbon.
Amazing giant central tank. Several areas showing animals from all the oceans. Even penguins, turtles, etc
Kids love it, grown ups love it.
A day well spend for sure.
Wonderful Place to Visit. Very good and enjoyable place to visit. Nice to spend time with your family and kids. You can spend a relax time during the visit.

Wonderful place. My first visit to an oceanorium, but not the last!
It was so amazing, aquariums are big and species look greta and well treated.
Really great visit for child and grown up!

The Best in Europe!. As my wife has master degree in Biology, it is a must to visit oceanarium or simillar while we are on one of the city breaks.Oceanarium Lisboa is perfect with one HUGE tank in the middle that is cornered by thematical ones (each representing one ocean). There is big variety of sea animals (and floora) inclouding manta. Pricewise it's on higher end (eur 16 with temporary expo).I would skip current temporary expo (turtles) as there were too few of them to make it worthwhile, but at least info about them is detailed enough. Tip: While there jump on to Telecabine Lisboa the view from it is perfect

Too pricey for What they offer. We went the weekend where the special expo were the turtles. I believe we paid 16 euro instead of 12(or 13) to see the expo as well. It was a small aquarium with lot of fish and one giant turtle. The staff said that there at lots more but that they were hiding? It was a small aquarium not much room to hide. So not worth the extra money.The main aquarium has some nice sharks, and unique fish. The main area circles around one big aquarium and that is pretty much it. It is nice to see but not worth getting there from downtown and spending that much money unless you are a marine lover. You can use the time and money elsewhere. Didn't find it that spectacular.

Amazing place. The temp show was about turtles and they were really cute.The big fish tank was also awesome,the penguins and other birds and otters were cute too.To get in i had to queue up a lot and the entrance was 16euros.

Spent two hours in delighted admiration of fish. A place to go .... very well organized .... always space to see all the fish and other animals ....... the explanation on various fish present in the ocenario always interesting and short ....

too pricey. we visited as a family of four and paid 58 euros for a family of four owing to age of kids 15 and 10. You are only allowed one visit (specified on tickets) so cannot go for lunch and come back like we can do at our sea life centres. There is no interaction and is basically a glorified fish tank. Yes I understand the need to highlight the impact humans have on the world with what we do to the ocean, and as a family who have visited a lot of the sea life centres in the uk we have done this. However, our kids although enjoyed seeing the creatures found it pretty boring compared to previous experience of aquariums. What disappointed us even more was the temporary display of sea turtles. My kids have seen them before elsewhere and when they did someone did a talk etc. about them whilst visiting. Didn't think the extra for this was worth it. So if you enjoy staring at various marine life through a glass then its okay but we wouldn't recommend it.
kids travelling. Good experience for kids. Go to science museum on the front. Puffins, tortoice, shark, otter. Good presence of lift for stroller.

must go with kids. This is a great place to go with kids. It is huge and you can sit in front of aquarium watching fish floating by. Sun fish (the biggest in the world) is amazing. You can see penguins, seabirds, starfish, jelly fish, etc. A lot to see. Get your tickets on line or use machine near the booking office (no discount tickets though) to avoid long queues.

Fish lover in Paradise. This is a great way to spend time with on a sunny afternoon.Of course you canbe outside and enjoying good wather..but inside this closed ocean you can see all different kinds of fishes receiving the sunlights or even play with them in ouside area.For night experience try to sleep with them.I looove fishes so this was a great escape during the afternoon with the kids,

Beautiful aquarium. The size of the Oceanario is impressive and it is very relaxing to sit in front of the big aquarium glass for a while and watch the fishes floating by.It is located right at the coast, next to a park and some other places of interest. Definitely worth a visit, especially with kids.

Skip the queue. Hour long queues can easily be skipped by going to the automated machines (separate queue). You can only get non-discounted tickets here, but it's worth the extra few Euros to avoid standing around for ages.

A good place to visit if you like aquariums. My husband and I didn't see any feedings of the fish but liked all the nature which was surrounding us: fish and starfish in aquariums, weird ramps (they were very weird, you can see the pictures!!!), different birds, turtles, passing by under the feet (we had to buy a ticket with a visit to the turtles).That was not the best aquarium i've ever seen, but it was nice.
Do not miss this!. Fantastic Aquarium. Great experience for everyone. The main fish tank is HUGE! With lots of big fish, sharks, stingrays and so on. Also otters, penguins and seabirds is to be seen.

100% worth the trip and the money. I'm not an aquarium connoisseur by any definition, but as a very amateur enthusiast, this was an incredible experience. The main aquarium in the center is absolutely huge and the variety of marine life that live together in it is mind-blowing. Huge sting rays swimming along sharks and schools of smaller fish swimming together in a three story tank that gives a surrounding impression when you stand up close. There are also a lot of smaller tank exhibits in addition to some penguins and otters that live outside. While I was there I saw a special exhibition on giant turtles that was also a real treat. All of the turtles were rescues and we were told there are plans to release them back into the wild, so I don't know how long it will be there. I did not get the audio guide and felt nothing lacking from my experience that was mostly just being visually stunned. It was easy to find taking the subway and strikes me as an excellent activity for kids.

Good place for family visits. I have been visited many aquariums in the world (Bergen, Sydney, Dubai) and this was one of the good ones, however the overall experience is just average. It is great that they explained and tought how to protect the sees, but I could not find any extraordinary or very special attraction in this one.

Next time I would take the audio guide. I was a little underwhelmed by my visit to this aquarium - there is a lot of hype about visiting it which it didn't really live up to. My husband and I spent a good couple of hours here and did not manage to find sea otters or turtles. We chose not to take the audio guides and this may have been a mistake. Inside I thought the labelling of exhibits not very informative. On the plus side there is so much to see, everyone will love something - my favourites were the corals and tropical fish. Beat the long queues to get in by looking for the one queue for the automatic ticket machines. This got us in almost straight away. Extensive gift shop with wide selection and good quality souvenirs.
Great experience. Super. Excellent work by the staff. Would love to visit it again. Very clean and greatly organized. Gift shop a bit expensive though.

Bast place for kids as well as parents.... When I went to lisbon last Month than I went there with my two kids .. And my hubby too. We did enjoy too much as well as that place is awesome for kids .. We saw different kinds of fish and did shopping from vascodegama shopping mall .. And enjoy to eat launch at royal India restaurant .. That place is full of attraction ... Next time when I will come lisbon with friend and family Than I will come again ......
Spectacular!. The best aquarium I have ever seen. Has a good variety of aquatic species.A must see if you are visiting Lisbon.
Amazing experience for children. If you have a baby I recomend the music experience. You need to book in advance but it's an amazing experience that the family will love.

Interesting. Our grandchild loved to see the sharks and fish shown.We will see the equivalent in San Diego to make a comparison.We had appreciated more text in English. It is not that easy to be there with the earphones to be rented when you have small children with you.

Oceanario great place for everyone to visit!. I visited the Oceanario de Lisboa with my adult daughter and we loved it! Although it would certainly be a wonderful place to bring kids - it's also very interesting for adults. The whole place has a consistent conservation theme which educates without being heavy-handed in any way. The building is structured very well so that you "visit" different oceans and learn about the habitats in each. Right now they have a temporary exhibit with sea turtles which costs a bit extra. I love sea turtles so I bought the extra ticket, but was a bit disappointed with the number of turtles and trying to find them. Only worth it if this is a big interest for you. Everything else was top notch - even the cafeteria! Great food at reasonable prices.

Great Aquarium!. This aquarium was recently rated the best in Europe, and the second best in the world (after Monterey), and for good reason. It's huge, and has an incredible assortment of sea life. It's designed so as you walk around the large main tank, you also have views into some of the other tanks as well (otters, etc.). Stick to the permanent exhibit, though -- we didn't feel the temporary exhibit was worth the extra cost.

Top attraction for adults and children. The visit was no doubt one of the highlights of our trip to Lisbon. If you have time and patience, you can spend hours there, especially in front of the huge aquarium in the middle. There are several other areas, not only aquariums. You can only take photos without a flash.Don't be scared by the crowds at ticket box and inside. Everyone can find something interesting, no matter if adult or kid. The place teaches about the importance of protecting the oceans. Don't miss it, even if you have one day in Lisbon. From the "Oriente" train and metro station, it takes about 15-20 minutes to walk.

Crowded but great for the kids. Whom ever you ask, this is one place you will be advised to visit when you are in Lisbon. When we arrived, there were huge queues at the ticket office. There will be two queues that are not distinguishable at the entrance. Chose the one that goes directly to the ticket machines since that is shorter. This is not the case if you are looking for Group discount or any other kind of discount. I would actually suggest buying tickets online the day before.Although the aquarium is HUGE and spectacular, I must admit I founds the crowds a bit off-putting. It was hard to get decent views of the main dome and most of the exhibits. The Penguin compounds was good to see but the special attraction of the Turtles was a waste of the extra we paid for the ticket.I would recommend only going for the permanent exhibit and not both permanent and temporary.Your kids will have loads of fund though - with the central dome and sharks and divers and some really ancient looking fish called the "Bone fish"!

Busy, but very good. We were lucky and there was no queue when we arrived, but I think you might have to expect queues. Patience is a virtue whilst you're in there as there are loads of people, but it is totally worth it - lots of interesting things to see.
Ocenario. Many species and different kind of sea birds aswell. Mabye a bit squeezed and small tanks at times. Mabye a bit pricy.
Beautiful ocean experience. Watching all kinds of fish (even sharks) as we are in the middle of the ocean - priceless experience! Highly reccomended

Beat the crowds. Note - in the summer the Oceanaria is open daily 10am-8pm, last entry 7pm. The long entry line progressed quickly, we were inside withing 20 minutes. The Lisboa card gave us a 20 percent discount on the entry price of 18 euros per adult. Despite the throngs of people inside, it was possible to enjoy the wonderful marine life on display. In particular the fish in the big tank such as the Mantra ray and the Sun Fish were great, as well as the sea otters. Many other interesting species in quite a few smaller tanks as well, plus a number of pond/basin style displays.The big turtle special exhibition near the entrance was very good (and very busy) as well.Would recommend to visit early in the morning and/or during week days to avoid the biggest crowds. You can spend the better part of the day here.
Nice place for the kids. Nice for the kids . they did have a great time . good value for the money.. The sharks and sea turtels was a favorite .
Very good. One of the most important and well furnished aquarium around the world. Locate on the area of the old Expo area, a place to visit
Spectacular. I keep a very strong impression about it! I saw a lot a species and the central aquarium is indeed huge. The children were astonished.

Under the Sea :-). Amazing display of marine life from salt water fish to otters. They also had a temporary museum on the voyages of turtles but not sure when that ends. Pay a little more to see the temporary exhibition with the permanent one - it's worth it.
Wonderful. Wonderful place,excellent place to spend entire day,beautiful aquariums,numerous fish and animals produce easy going relaxing atmosphere,make sure that you visit this place.

Place for everyone. I was in Lisbon with my 16 year old daughter. We enjoyed our visit at the Oceanario de Lisboa. Because it is supposed to be one of the biggest Oceanarium in the world my daughter didn't want to miss it. So we went and had a great time watching and examining the under water world. it's not pricey and with the Lisboa card you get a discount!

Zero waiting time with pre-purchased tickets. We purchased tickets for the Oceanario online about an hour before we left to visit it. The building was a short walk away from Oriente station, thanks to our e-tickets we were able to completely bypass the queues and go directly to the permanent exhibit. The exhibit covers a wide array through all of the world's oceans and climate zones, also featuring otters, penguins and puffins. The temporary exhibit had the topic of tortoises and their journeys, which also was very informative. All in all we spent about three hours in the Oceanario, afterwards we explored the surrounding areas. All in all we spent an entire afternoon including dinner for the trip, which I definitely recommend to anyone in the greater Lisbon area.

Excellent Day Out. It's a brilliant day out, cost in August 2014 was €16,00 for an adult but worth every penny. The huge tank in the middle has some amazing fish in it, big and small, had a few big sharks!!! I especially loved the penguins section.
Excellent. Very very good aquarium i have ever seen. It has so many different types of fishes. Especially Seaotters were amazing. Must see

The best aquarium I've visited!. The Oceanarium is huge and really well designed with exhibits around an enormous central tank, featuring sharks, rays and many unusual species. There are penguins, puffins and sea otters amongst others in addition to the fish, with well designed, interesting enclosures. You are guided around easily and everything is clean, with good visibility into the tanks. There is also a temporary turtle exhibit, as the Oceanarium is involved in rehabilitating these creatures. There is also an excellent cafe on site. We visited on the spur of the moment , when it was cloudy and we are really glad we did, as it was really interesting.

Great option. That's a great option whether you have children or not! It has an enormous tank representing all the oceans with many different kinds of fish and other animals. There are explanations and pictures, and on your way in and out you can get in the mood by hearing sounds that remind you of the ocean and the beach...

Absolutely a must-see if you travel to Lisbon.... Lisbon is so beautiful..like a jewel! This oceanario/aquarium adds a little more to your visit!You will be delighted to spend not two or three but more hours wandering around exhibits and enjoying to the fullest the calmness and beauty of deep waters, fish and other sea creatures...From sharks and rays to turtles and penguins, it is all there...Amazing exhibits, a good price in my opinion and more importantly an activity for families, solo travelers or group of friends. Take the subway to the south(if i recall correctly) part of the city and within 20-25 minutes you will be "diving" to an unforgettable experience..Don't miss the jellyfish, the amazon zone, the sea orchids/corals on several displays and don't try to count the creatures you will encounter as you will definitely miss most of them out...Highly recommended!!!

A fantastic place!. The place is absolutely stunning. Highly recommended if you are traveling with children, they will be amazed of all the animals they will be able to see. A place that makes conscious people about why is important to preserve the ocean and the variety of species, not a circus at all. The ticket is a bit pricy but if you have a student card they will provide you an special price.

So not just for kids. I'd probably spend the entire day there if I could. The largest oceanarium I've visited in Europe and so worth the visit. Not just the tank and fishes but other sea wildife as well. Not to mention the shark hanging around just half a meter away from your nose:)A bit expensive but well worth it. Temporary exhibition was great.
Great for kids. A nice experience for the young ones. They'll really enjoy to see the sealife so close. Specially that shark swimming around ;)

Magnificent. Nothing really to describe, one of the best "animal locations" in Europe. What surprised me was that in addition to the huge main tank, the place had numerous smaller tanks filled with interesting creatures. Also having a big turtle swimming underneath your feet is quite a fun experience. Couple of tips: Buy ticket online, the line can be pretty long. Save some time, at times you will want just to sit down and enjoy the serenity of the main tank. There are some spots that are crowded with viewers but there are also quieter spots to enjoy the experience alone. Also - when approaching the main tank the first time, there can be quite a lot of people there, so I would recommend to move on as the rush of people gets quieter basically at the next viewing spot.

You just can't miss it!. "Excellent" is the best word to describe it; although a bit expensive it's definitely worth a visit, with or without kids...Usually they also have a temporary exhibition, which costs a few € more, but also worth the price.
Nice but not great. Nice change of pace for the kiddo as we closed out our vacation. Not the best aquarium I've been to by far but a welcome change of pace.

A quaint underwater treat.. The scorching heat and crowds will drive a man to his limits on any day, luckily this world class oceanarium provides the perfect get away. Special Exhibitions are always a lovely addition.
Great aquarium. Lots of fish and great facilities. It is a way out of the centre but we got there fine and enjoyed the visit we had there.

I'd have stayed there the whole day. If you're into that sort of thing. It's a beautiful place to take your children or nephews/nieces to, and just watch them take it all in. There are some secret spots inside by the main tank where you can just sit down on the floor quietly (or as quiet as possible depending on how many people are inside). Very relaxing

Better things to do!. It was essentially just one big tank, and you circled it, occasionally seeing some penguins, sleeping eels and starfish. Regret paying 13 euro. Probably a good day spent if you have kids! Otherwise, nothing that exciting.

Good price-quality ratio!. Even though Oceanario seems pretty expensive it's worth its price (for the normal exhibition + temporary one with turtles you have to pay 16e, unless you find a good discount on groupon.pt). It will be fun for children, but also older people will enjoy the variety of exhibition (divided into areas devoted to particular oceans) and one huge aquarium around which whole oceanario is situated. We all agreed that even if all the fish and plants are cool (we even found Nemo!) otters are the best thing you can see there. If they are not in their area wait patiently or just come back in few minutes - you'll not regret it!

Nice place to visit with kinds. The oceanario is a nice place to visit with kids. The oceanario is actualy build arround their huge aquarium with different sealife. Walk after your visit in the area which used to be the expo in 1998.

the sea otters are the best!. I spent a good half hour watching them!The huge central tank is great - with plenty of big fish (although the main attraction for kids where the divers cleaning the tank or medicating fishes). GReat attraction, a little bit expensive (but the price is understandable due to high maintenance costs of such a place)Cut waiting time by purchasing your ticket on the automatic vending machine (cash only) [there is a dedicated line].
Excellent. Great Aquarium, very well prepared and has a great variety of animals. Amazing! Best Aquarium I've to.

Nice to escape the heat. We went to the aquarium, because it was so hot outside that we thought an indoor activity would be nice. We went during the week at 3pm, so we had to wait only 10-15min to get a ticket. We bought only a ticket for the normal exhibition. If you go as a family you will be surprised how much money you have to pay!The aquarium is built around a huge round tank, which you will explore from every possible angle. My highlight was the ocean sunfish. That was really cool to see how big they are! Otherwise if you are without kids you will not need more than 1 1/2 hours to see pretty much everything and not being in a haste. The gift shop is great, with nice things. So all in all it is a nice place to escape the heat and the location is very nice and completely different from the rest of lisbon. So you should definitley go there some time during your trip.

Fun time. Great place to visit with kids. Quite a unique experience, you feel as if you are under the sea.
Take your time going as your exit will be into the gift shop!

To Everyone!. Very good experience to the whole family!
Located in a very good region in Lisbon!
A place that you can find multiple types of fishes, sharks and others.
Must See. I've been in other but this is definitely the biggest.Very well maintained with exposure of turtles.Has presented all the oceans.

Worth a visit. Went on a sunday afternoon. Queue to pay was quite large and it was a bit too crowded trying to view each area in the permanent exhibition.It is worth a visit but go during a quieter time if possible, The Sea turtles temporary exhibition was a waste of money. Take’s only about 5- 10 mins to go around and only saw one turtle. Give it a skip and save your money.

The best aquarium we have seen anywhere.. The admission for an adult was 16 euro to get into the main Aquarium and the special exhibit, giant turtles while we were there, we didn't think that was too bad. The main tank is vast with lots of places to peek in from different angles, it has all types of fish from sharks and rays to schools of smaller fish swirling round. The tank can be viewed from different levels giving a different perspective each time. The otters and penguins in their climatic environments is a nice tough and a good opportunity to get up close. The smaller tanks all offer interesting fish, frogs, crabs and anemones.  There are informative facts and information in English on every display along with interactive display areas for the children. Clean toilets are available along with a shop offering the usual overpriced stuffed animals, pencils, rubbers and other useless tat! The main issue is the number of people there and getting close enough to see everything you want, being patient definitely does pay off though. The local shopping centre is huge with fast food outlets along with indian, salad and sushi available on the upper floor and a supermarket on the lower floor.

Very interesting visit. If you want to do something different during your visit in Lisbon, this is a very nice stop! An impressive variety of fish from all 5 continents. You surely will have a nice time.
Wow!. I have no words do describe this place. It's breathtaking! New, very well equipped, nice staff. And most of all, all the life you find inside. A must see!

Loved This Place!. We visited the oceanarium due to reading about it in a guide book. We paid the 16 euros for both parts of the experience. It was 13 euros for the general oceanarium and and extra 3 euros each if we wanted to see the turtles. The turtles were not worth seeing, two out of 3 were asleep and there was not much else to see. Not worth paying the extra.One the whole I was really taken by the size of the tank and the fish! I stood and watched the fish/sharks for hours. I enjoyed going round and seeing the variety of life in the different sections. Really amazing that some of the fish are the size they are, still find it hard to believe!Well worth a visit, just dont pay the extra, its not worth it. Also be ready for a long queue and to spend a lot of time trying to see past other visitors! Very busy!
Must see. I'm from Lisbon and I never get tired of visiting Oceanario with my kids. Being standing up in front of the big aquarium is a lifetime experience.

Must See. Wonderful place to visit in Lisbon. So many marine animals that you will never see unless you visit the oceanarium. The tank where many of the fish are situated is humungous and full of big and small fish alike. As you walk throughout the facility you are treated to different creatures from all over the world and displayed nicely in their own environment.Inexpensive in relation to other aquariums worldwide. Worth the visit, most definitely.
No turtles. Same as any other large aquarium but they ask you to pay extra to see turtles but there was only 1 !!! Restaurant in the aquarium was not great. Not being picky just being honest.

Lisbon is hot, trendy, and welcoming all year long. I actually first discovered Lisbon as a child and as a tourist. Then, my parents came to Portugal and I was a college student when Lisbon was growing up a bit chaotically. After many years of coming back to visit my nephews and in-laws for Xmas and the summer holidays, I became a permanent resident in Lisbon. What a difference from when I was a student! A city full of activities, rhythm, places to discover, events, well-cared museums (even if not cheap according to the Portuguese standards of living) suited for every taste, age, want, and budget. The Oceanário is well-known, especially if you want a kiss from a seal, but there are other places to visit and rest, in Lisbon and all year round around its natural seashore you will find small cities and spots (some of them inevitable such as Cascais, Sintra, Mafra, Ericeira, Estoril, Guincho, Troía...), all listed and described in the travel literature online or in books. Plus, for what I reckon as a non-tourist now, tourists are above all under the spell of foods and the vistas... charmed by a white city, thriving with life, water, fire, wind, and earth . Codfish, sardines, ice creams, more or less traditional like the famous Pasteis de Nata...Come to visit Lisbon, min. 3-day trip or, for the whole package, at least 5 to 7 days: forget stress as a tourist (the other working Lisbonenses will carry your burden) and stop counting calories or checking on your levels of good cholesterol!

Mandatory when visiting Lisbon. The Oceanario de Lisboa and its surroundings (called Parque das Nacoes) is a great place to spend an afternoon & evening. I agree with the others when they say the ticket is a bit overpriced (around 15 EUR in 2014) but it is something worthy to see with all the fish and other animals (birds, insects, mammals). The base tank (aquarium) in the middle accompanies us through the whole journey and it makes us feel so ... insignificant yet calm and quiet. You can either be romantic and take your girl/boyfriend with you, or make it a family/friends trip. Everyone fits in, and everyone enjoys it. And to finish the day in style, pick any restaurant nearby or in the Centro Comercial Vasco da Gama (10 minute walking distance) in the Parque das Nacoes area.
The best!. Great spot to stay for a few hours. The silence in the rooms is perfect! Go on a week day! Very full on holidays and weekends. Perfect to bring the kids!
liked it a lot. it is very big, a lot of information and sea life, loved different regions presented. Liked that there are also some birds presented.
wonderfull. Oceanario is the wonderfull place where children can enjoy very well. This is the good thingfor general knowledge also about see life for them..Superb

Sharks, turtles, fish, etc who wouldnt want to watch?. You can sea different fish there, multiple sharks, penguins, turtles and many more.The ticket is a bit overpriced, they have a permanent and temporary sections which i recommend seeing them both.Spare a couple of hours there to enjoy the visit, and dont forget your camera!

Worth a visit. This was easy to get to using the metro and although the queue was quite long, it moved quickly and staff were efficient. The aquarium itself is not very 'hands on' but the huge tanks full of all sorts of sea life (based on oceans of the world) more than makes up for it. Great for children and families although we found it really dark and it took a while for our eyes to adjust!

Great for families ... or anyone!. Full of families and school groups with little children, but great for anyone with a vague interest in marine life. Generally, you start with an exhibit (Sea Turtles when we were there - we could not access bits of the exhibit due to the design + large families crowding certain areas), then proceed to a gigantic aquarium with 50 or so species of fish. In the corners of the top floor, where you enter, are stations with penguins, sea otters, etc. On the lower floor, there are special tanks on the periphery with regionally-specific fish (e.g., fish of the Indian Ocean, Pacific, Atlantic, amphibians...). All along the way, you have different views of the huge central aquarium. Note that on the lower floor some types of fish (and seaweed/star fish/sea cucumbers) hang out in specific corners of the tank. We are +/- 30 yrs old and don't have kids and thought it was a great way to spend our day.

The best ever. On the riverside near the cable-car. What a brilliant layout. A huge central tank with dozens of viewing widows on three levels. And then around it other rooms with shoreline scenes, one with puffins and another with penguins on real ice (it's 30C outside.) The backdrop to the scenes are paintings that merge in with the rocks and driftwood props. Even reading this I know I'm not doing it justice.The outside plaza is also really well done with a huge water cascade and a stream with stepping stones . The only disappointment is that there isn't much else nearby.
Impressive and informative. The best we have seen and we could have stayed all day. The center tank is awesome and do also spend time to see the film of their daily routines
worth to see!. Fantastic aquarium with a lot of fish and water plants. There is also small restaurant where you can have a lunch.
Nice. Nice, big aquarium with much to enjoy. From sharks to crabs and "Nemo". Lovely to combine with the cable car and lunch in the expo- area.

Love this place!. I've been to a number of good oceanariums, the one in Cape Town, South Africa being my favorite. This one those is certainly up in the top 5. They have two ticket prices, one €14 for their permanent exhibit and one that includes the temporary exhibit at €16. The temporary exhibit right now is quite cool. It's a sea turtle exhibition that also has a lot of fish. It's definitely worth the extra €2/person to see. As for the rest of the exhibit, it was really something else. Having all the four oceans in one was very cool! Their main aquarium was huge and had a massive sunfish in it! I've never seen a sunfish in real life so this was something else! They also had a very big manta ray, some large sand sharks, guitar fish and a variety of other fish and unique sharks too. They had a very large giant grouper which was cool, and there were multiple angles from two different floors in which you could see the tank. There were four other 'ocean' exhibits being pacific, atlantic, indian and arctic. In the atlantic they had sea otters which was also a unique exhibit. This was really cool for the kids. They all loved the sea otters. They had two different varieties of penguins, and again, many species of fish. The Lisbon Oceanarium is definitely a must see when in Lisbon and is a great retreat for a hot day! It's a great place for families with children of all ages too. Our daughter spent a good time in a double stroller and we had no problems getting around. There are ample elevators and the staff are very accommodating to make sure that you can get in and around with ease.

A must see attraction; beautiful Aquarium; Just don't go there for food. Definitely a "must do" if visiting Lisbon and you have any interest in marine life . Visited with family as hadn't been back since here when first opened in 1998. The array of tanks, location and information generally gives you a first class experience of all the oceans and the central tank is very spectacular. The variety of species on display is top class and it is a very worthwhile place to go despite the slightly awkward location (not much else in this part of Lisbon). Just don't go near the restaurant as the fare is barely edible, service poor so an utterly forgettable.

Interesting collection of sealife. We spent half a day here at the Oceanarium and throughly enjoyed it. As others have said it is quite large and very informative. When we were there they had a temporary exhibit involving sea turtles.The different angles and views you get to see from are all quite spectacular.It was a nice deviation from the outside during quite a warm day and overall a great experience. As others have stated, you can take the metro right from the mall next door.

Great aquarium, excellent location!. Had a great afternoon in the aquarium today after lunch in the cafe there (which was very reasonable and tasty). Great display of a wide range of fish and mammals and a few birds too... Kids loved it as did the adults. Highly recommended as is the cable car nearby!

Great aquarium, avoid the restaurant. Quite new, well kept with lots of interesting fish. Huge tank i n the middle and lots of small ones around. Pretty standard setup. Good information about the oceans and nicely designed touch-screen-experiences. The area of the World Exibition 1998 is a great area for a walk, there are good restaurants in the area ( just avoid the simple one in the aquarium ). And the Vasco da Gama shopping center is by the nearest metro station.

A great place to see marine life. This is one of the best aquariums in Europe.The central tank is awsome. It is huge. You will see very very large number of spieses of sea life.It is very clean and well maintained.A tour around it with many smaller tanks is incredible.Viewing the tank from many angles, you will allways find someting new to see.This is a must for the ones who enjoy marine life.Crew is very nice too.Cafeteria is not very good. Like it is in many mass attractions like this.Children and adults loved it.

Expected more!. It was the second time I visit this attraction, now with my wife. We can watch expositions: temporary and permanent. I missed ötters, sealions and dolphins (what happened?). Off course, I cannot consider whales and orcas, too big to fit there. We loved the visit, although we didn't like much the dark hallways. We expect too have more in our next visit
Very informative & entertaining. This is a wonderful place to visit with family, friends and children. We spent 3 hours there and we loved seeing the animals and the feeding time inside the aquarium.

Well worth visiting. Walking through the lower level with the tanks wrapping over you and seeing the sharks and rays and other fish so close up was a remarkable experience. Beautifully done and a huge variety of fish and other aquatic creatures. Don't forget to go to the sea turtle exhibit as well. Seeing these amazing sea turtles swimming under your feet, over your head and beside you is worth the extra few dollars. Kids would love this!
Just great. Well taken care. Just loved it. A great day spend with the kids. Felt like in a seaworld school. Thanks.

Great!. This is where you should take your kids, get them excited and make them learn that the ocean is the most imortant ecosystem on planet earth. From central Lisbon you need to take a metro out here, and walk a bit to ge down to the seaside, but when you get here its beautiful here, big open spaces. fairs, parks, resturants, gondolas, shopping centers etc. The oceanario has a massiv water tank with a lot of species of fish. They also have departments for seabirds and penguins. Great place.

Beautiful aquarium; great for kids!. We spent an afternoon at the Oceanario de Lisboa with our 10- and 8-year old. It's about a 10-minute walk from the metro. The aquarium is built around a central tank with various levels and it took us a few hours to walk the entire thing. I did not think it stacked up to the Baltimore or Monterey Aquariums in the USA, but it was a very impressive place. My favorite memory were these tiny, delicate sea dragons, which I had never seen before - lovely! They promote their sea otters but the day we went they were nowhere to be found. They also have a temporary exhibit on sea turtles which I recommend is worth the extra few euros. All of the turtles have been rescued and the exhibit includes some interactive displays for the kids.The aquarium's exit forces you out via the gift shop so it's hard not to buy something on the way out.

Awesome place!. This oceanarium is so unique in its set up. It was quite unusual and different--I love that they have a safe place for turtles that have been re-habbed! We have been to many aquariums but were glad we came to this one. The scenery outside of the aquarium's building was amazing as well. If you are ok with heights, try the gondola rides too. :)
Amazing. There is little negative to be said on this experience. It was overall satisfying, despite the crowd. :-)

A unique living museum!. Discount with Lisboa Card, fantastic number of species, the sea-otters alone are worth seeing (and have a lovely story; their parents were named after Eusebio (football legend) and a Portugeuse singer.

I loved it!. great place, many things to do and see, the best aquarium I have ever visited! Must see: the penguins!!! I also liked the temporary exhibition about the sea turtles, it was great. Highly recommended for kids and adults!

A little disappointing. We had high hopes and although we enjoyed our visit we couldn't help but to compare to Valencia which blew us away. A good way to spend a few hours during your trip but don't expect anything amazing. The best part was seeing the Sea Otters.

Lots to see. Aquarium was very nice with many things to see. It does take a bit to get used to the change bright light to dark once you initially walk in. It is also very relaxing with quite a few places to sit and watch the fish swim around.
I had my bike stollen right in front of the security offices. If you go there leave your bike at home or you'll be left without it. There are cameras but they didn't do me much good.

Great Permanent Exhibits. We were disappointed with the turtle exhibit as it was focused on reading information rather than viewing the turtles, of which we counted one. The permanent exhibits were great value for money. We spent almost 2 hours in this area alone. I would recommend visiting just this part of the aquarium.
Fun!. This attraction was so fun, it's very touristic but so worth it! Especially the temporary exhibition about the sea turtles, was so great! It's really worth its price.
Outstanding Aquarium. My child is an aquarium fanatic and we've seen many around the world. This one was awesome. Beautiful fish, really well done windows, huge tanks, lovely layout.

Great place to relax. It's just so relaxing to sit next to the aquarium and watch the fish swimming, so slow and with no worries... The only thing that bothered me was the constant flashes from the visitors cameras. We spoke with one of the employees and he told us one of the moon fish got blind that way. If you go there please respect the animals and turn the flash off!
Worth a visit. Very nice and entertainingVery good exibition, children and adults will love it.Liked it very much
For children and adults. Really nice visits! It is located in a futurist part of Lisboa, very modern, clean, and beautiful. The oceanorium is well organised and seduces both young and old people.

Verry good aquarium. Take a camera with you and enjoy. It is a great aquarium if you have never visited one before but don't expect too much. If you are a student, ask for a discount even it is not advertised on the website.

Expected better. We were expecting much better and bigger as we had been told that it was the best aquarium in Europe, but we were slightly disappointed by the number of things to see. The big tank was impressive and filled with sharks, rays and many species of fish but you spend most of your time just walking around the tank and there is not much more to see. It took about one hour to go around it, perhaps one hour 30 if you walk slowly and read all the descriptions. Not really worth the money but interesting thing to do if you have kids.
Best Aquarium Yet. This aquarium is the best I've ever been to. The huge center tank is amazing and the layout is great. There is plenty to see and all of the exhibits are really well done.
worth to see all. was my 2nd time there- 100% worth to see! take kids with you if you can- will love it! full adult ticket costs 16E with exhibition about turtles included.

Not to be missed. The oceanarium is located roughly 1 km away from Oriente metro & train station. Although visited in high season, it wasn't crowded and we could walk around easily. The main aquarium is impressive with a reach collection of sea life specimens. It took us a little bit over 2 hours to get around.

one of the top attractions in Lisbon!. I went to Oceanario a couple of times and I definitely want to go back! This is definitely one of the best attractions in Lisbon and really worth visiting. I highly recommend it!

Perfect and colorful. It is a really colorful and beautiful aquarium! I now understand why it is said to be the best in the world. It has a lot of different species of fish and there are also other things. There are some places that if you are tired you can seat with your family and watch the fishes in the tank. When I went there I saw some species of fishes I had never seen in my life! There are also attractions depending on when you go there. When I went there the attraction was of the story of a turtle. There is also a part where a tank passes under your feet and you see lots of fishes and it's really cool!It is a great place to go in Lisbon!
Beautiful Oceanarium. We went here because we wanted to experience something new.. And the oceanarium did not disappoint. It was one of the best experience that we had in Lisbon.

great way to spend a rainy day in lisbon. I really enjoyed the aquarium, the main exhibits is a 5 story tank harboring all types of fish and sea life. As you walk down a spiraling ramp you get to experience the tank from all angles. I defiantly recommend for children and its a perfect way to spend a rainy day as it is all indoors. Also the is a cable car/tram behind the aquarium that offers a great view of the ocean and the aquarium complex. this was my favorite part!
Lovely time in the Oceanario. The best aquarium that we had the chance to visit is the Oceanario de Lisboa. The esplanade is also a nice place to look at!

Aqua heaven. The best aquarium ever I sat for hours and watched the sharks it was amazing a group of us went and everyone was so impressed the otter was worth the trip alone! Love it great fun for adults and children

very good but a bit Boring. I love aquariums so was very excited to visit the Lisbon Oceanarium. Be prepared for a lot of pushy kids and likewise tourists, but that is to be expected! We paid the extra couple of Euro to see the additional exhibition which at the time was a turtle exhibit. I was not that overly impressed with this one, I felt it was not very informative, a bit small and lacking any clear theme. The central tank was massive with an abundant array of species. I'm pretty sure kids will love this as it is huge.Generally speaking the walk around the aquarium centered around different views of this tank.There's a rain forest exhibit which is just that, an exhibit for Penguins and birds ( I though the space was pretty small for flying birds) , sea otters which were very cute and plenty of Jellyfish. Overall it was pretty good but I have seen better. They could really do with some staff giving talks or taking questions on the animals on show to keep the kids , and adults alike, occupied. It may become a bit repetitive for kids. I've seen places where they have interaction such as feeding and touching for the kids which is always fun.

Best aquarium ever!. We loved this place - there were 5 adults and 1 toddler and it is a close thing to decide who enjoyed it the most! It is by far and away the best aquarium we have visited, and we've been to quite a few. The whole set up with the main tank is very impressive and the array of animals they have on display in the other tanks around it is phenomenal. When we went, their temporary exhibition was of rescue turtles. They were beautiful and this exhibit would have been worth the entrance fee alone.The best day we had in Lisbon (and we had a great time :-) ).
to much monotony. A bit boring, not so impressive as Loro park in Tenerife. Too much monotony atmosphere, our kids after 1 hour become completely bored :( and tired also.

Very well organized. It is not as big as if you compare it to that of London. However, it is very well organized and detail-oriented. The temporary exhibit is not as satisfying as the permanent. Overall, I would recommend to both adults and children
I felt like a fish. This huge aquarium is definitely the best i've ever seen and I love aquariums. We spent over 3h watching the fish and animals. This is a place not to miss !!!!

Beautiful Oceanarium but abit disappointing..... The creatures,fishes,info and how it is divided up into different parts of the ocean is great but was abit disappointed in the fact that there were not any dolphin or seal shows for some extra entertainment for the children like in other oceanariums I have been to....The area around the oceanarium is beautiful but looks abandonded and they are not maintaining it.

Check it out!. If you love the creatures of the sea and some additional extras, then this is a must-see! The exhibit is divided into the different oceans, and shows the creatures from each part. During my visit, there was a temporary exhibit of sea turtles; it cost a bit extra, but for me, it was worth it. My visit lasted just under 2 hours, but as the oceanario is located at parque das nacoes, maybe consider it a day visit, with the telecabine, science museum and parques/greenery nearby! Be sure to bring a camera, but know that using the flash is strictly forbidden (inside the oceanario!)!

Otter heaven!. Wasn't sure if we'd like to visit here, but went to be able to say we'd done it. Very impressive venue & engineering feat to create such an aquarium. Lots of info on the sealife, habitats & environmental issues. Entrance fee alone was worth it to watch the otters feeding, grooming & interacting with one another. A good 2 hours well spent out of the baking sun.

Worth a Visit. We took the open top tour bus and visited the Oceanario - was worth visiting. It's probably the best one we have been too. There's a huge central tank that you view as you make your way round the attraction. It's quite informative with notice boards scattered around and a lot of different things to see including frogs, insects, sea horses etc. It was easy to walk around. We paid to visit the additional exhibition of turtles but it wasn't worth it as we didn't see any. I wouldn't recommend eating in the cafes outside - not the best of food. The one inside the oceanario looked much nicer.We took the cable car to the other side then boarded the open top bus from there back to the centre.
awesome. This is the awesome oceanario.My children liked very much.We enjoyed there very much. This is located in very good area where you can enjoyed more.

Amazing!. Must see! Even as adults we loved this aquarium, kids defiantly will too! Our stay lasted slightly over two hours. The fish swimming under our feet was pretty cool, glass floors! Highly recommend!
“Recommended”. The Oceanario is very easy to get to and I recommend for all visitors in Lisbon! Good selection and range of creatures to see. I loved watching the otters and penguins swimming around.

better if you have kids. In common with most attractions in lisbon any English descriptions of exhibits is rather grandiose and a bit Victorian ( ungrateful I know as no attractions in the UK describe anything in another language) . Reading the information is hard work and ,dare I say, a tad boring. I wouldn't bother paying the extra 3€ for the turtle exhibition unless you really love turtles and reading stuff about them. The rest of the aquarium was reasonably interesting but unfortunately there were a fair number of school parties so the place seemed a bit over crowded. The cafe served a fixed price meal 9.80€ which was good value and tasty.I think children would really enjoy it ...but only if they are prepared to tear themselves away from their gadgets and enjoy looking and learning.

Ok... The overall experience was ok. There are a few different viewing areas for the main tank that were good such as the sofa with the view above. The entire experience only lasted for about 90 mins, we were expecting longer. Kids did seem to be enjoying it but There was not much originality about this aquarium. We visited the aquarium in Valencia last year which was a much better experience.

Very well done. We visited with our two young children and they loved it. The aquarium is well laid out and the exhibits are very informative. We were less than impressed with the turtle exhibit, but our 10 year old loved it.

Not just for kids :). I have visited quite a few aquariums and this one was definitly worth the visit. Among the highlights for me was the absolutely massive sunfish in the main tank, the axolotl, the puffins, seahorses and cuttlefish. The temporary display had two turtles in a very innovative display (its not often you get to see a turtle swimming over your head!).

Great 2-3 hour visit . Spent a Sunday morning here - it opens at 10am which is great if you want to do another city attraction in afternoon. It's one of the better Aquariums that we have visited - the set up is really clever (exploring the 4 oceans/seas). Plenty to see and it never felt crowded.We added the turtle exhibition to the ticket - family of 4 was £42. For 3 hours of really good entertainment and education - we thought it was a great deal.

No bad for one time trip. I had read a lot of reviews before visiting the Ocenario de Lisboa. Unfortunately, there were more expectations of the place than we actually received. It would be great for the very first time in the similar places. But after visiting some other Oceanariums around the World, the one in Lisbon is not much attractive. There are quite a number of fish species, but still not much attractive. To make the story short, I'll think twice before visiting the place again. Most probably - not.
Brilliant. The whole aquarium was a sight to behold and far cheaper than a small sized sealife centre.Great value, great way to spend time and great place

nice but not as good as Genova. nice aquarium, in the very nice expo area. We visited it ince we were told it's the 2nd biggest in the world.....but Genova is much much nicer and bigger. Plus: a couple of fishes I never saw

SUPERCOOL! Here's why!. Coolest aquarium I've ever been to! It has all types of habitats from around the world. Caribbean, artic, it even has a man made rainforest! I read somewhere it is the onlyaquarium in theworld to have all ecosystems. Some of the floors are made of glass, and the fish swim under your feet! You even get to walk through the rainforest as birds are flying around. Very very cool place for all ages. It is a must see in Lisboa!

One of the best Aquariums in the world. This is easily one of the best aquariums (or oceanariums) in the world, and it is in my top 2 out of all that I have ever been to. I was absolutely thrilled with this place and I would highly recommend it. We spent a little over an hour moving through the aquarium although you could spend a lot more time there if you are with children or if you read all of the descriptions (fortunately the displays are all in English as well as Portuguese). There is one main tank in the centre which you have the opportunity to view again and again. Then there are four additional main tanks on each corner of the building, with 'above-the-water' and 'below-the-water' viewing areas, featuring Sea Otters and a variety of Penguins (amongst other creatures). These represent the 5 oceans. Then there are smaller tanks dotted throughout with additional specimens, from Sea Dragons to Blue Poison Dart Frogs and more. The extra Sea Turtle exhibition was probably not worth the money although it was included in our tickets. The on-site restaurant is fantastic, the food quantities were more than generous and the price was unbelievably cheap. We couldn't believe the bargains we got on two full adult-sized meals with all of the trimmings, desserts, AND drinks. It was the cheapest meal I have ever had at a proper attraction in my entire life. And all of the food was delicious. You can not go wrong with a day out to the Oceanario!!
Nice Aquariam shame about the price. It's good but like everything in Lisbon aimed at families comes with a hefty price tag. Did not visit the temporary exhibit so maybe that makes the difference.
Good Fun. Enjoyed it and it lasted longer than most. Nice restaurant beside it had an all you can eat buffet which i would recommend. Its easy to reach, prepare for queues do.

"Dive" in!. I have been to few aquariums before, but I guess I'm always up for some more. This one is probably the biggest I've visited and loved every inch of it. At the time I went there was a temporary exhibit with sea turtles and even though there were only few left, because after some time, they are being released in their natural habitat, it was worth the additional €3. There are two floors with numerous, smaller and bigger tanks with one huge tank in the middle of the building that spans through both floors, which can be visible from almost every part of Oceanario. Worth a visit, for sure.

Great aquarium. We've been to several aquariums in different cities, and this was among the best ones. The highlight is the enormous tank in the centre of the aquarium that you get different views of as you move around. We also particularly liked the penguin area. It took us a couple of hours to go around the whole place. It's probably worth going fairly early in the day. We first tried to visit on Sunday late afternoon (around 5pm) and the queue was so huge that we decided not to bother. Came back the next day around 11.30am and there was no queue at all.
Definitely worth the visit!. This place was awesome, tons of fish, huge tanks, indoor & outdoor exhibits of all kinds of animals. One of the best aquariums I have seen!
Not just for kids. Was suprised to find this interesting and enjoyable as adults. The turtles are the stars but the sea otters will melt your heart.
Value for money in Lisbon. This is an amazing place. Both the permanent stuff and the aquarium. I have seen a lot. But this takes the grand prize. If in Lisbon with kids then go here!
A must go in Lisboa. Very enjoyable, especially if you are with kids. Not very far from the city center. There are not many options where to eat.

Best Aquarium in Europe. The Sea Turtle special exhibit was terrific. Really up close to all the fish, otters and penguins. The layout was really unique, too. You get to see so many animals from both above and below. There weren't a lot of people there, so you can take as long as you like. Really a lot of fun - and I love aquariums. They really care about the animals and rehabilitation in Lisbon. The aquarium is in the area developed for Expo 98 (I think) and the whole waterfront area is quite nice. Definitely one of the nicest days we've spent on vacation.

A good couple of hours. Lovely big rank, plenty if species clean with all info in English as well as Portuguese. Well thought out and planned with temp exhibits too which were the sea turtles when we visited.

Enjoyable Attraction. We visited the Oceanario, partly on the strength of the reviews here and partly because we generally like these sorts of attractions. We have to say, we weren't disappointed in any way. First port of call was the temporary sea turtle exhibition which is a nice addition to the trip and worth the extra €3 on the entry fee. Then onto the main exhibition area - this is based around a large central tank and there are plenty of large viewing areas to watch the numerous sharks, rays and other fish from. In addition, at each of the four corner there is a themed zone - these contained puffins/guillemots; penguins; sea otters; rain forest/fish from the Indian Ocean. All in all this is a cool place to spend a couple of hours and with the lovely esplanade looking out on the Vasco De Gama bridge and the shopping centre, it's a nice way to spend the day out of the hustle and bustle of the old city.

Great for kids!. I was impressed. Lots of critters to look at. Temporary sea turtle exhibit was fantastic. Loved the "one ocean" theme. My 2-year-old enjoyed seeing the scuba diving tank cleaners. while my husband was delighted with the sharks and rays. Well done. Reasonably priced.

Great place!. The central tank is enormous and full of species ..... a lot of I've never seen before. An living alltogether! Information was great as well as the thematic subareas, making the visit a must in Lisbon!

Kids love Fishes. I and my wife had been at Lisbon Oceanario by 1998 World Fair. Now we returned bringing along our youngest son with his little daughter. It was a great joy watching Lavinia (the grand-daughter) becoming ecstasized with all that Oceans big Fishes (being undewater-like, just protected by the glass). It's a greta place to be with kids. We hope we can come soon again.

Kids will love it.. The best of its kind i have visited. Viewing areas circle huge tank in two stories, so you get a fantastic view of majestetic manta rays gliding by. Separate galleries eith a large variatopn of species from penguins to amebas.

excellent attraction. One of the best oceanariums / aquariums that we have seen (and we've seen quite a few). awesome place to go with kids in lisbon. can easily spend 2-3 hours here. the temporary turtles exhibit was also lovely. must visit place with kids in lisboa.

WOW! Temporary Sea Turtle Exhibit a Must. In comparison to my local 'aquarium' The Deep, in Hull I was prepared to be underwhelmed. However.....If you have visited The Deep, this is a similar concept in that it is a large central tank where you start at the top and experience the Atlantic ocean literally from top to bottom. However, the difference here is you experience many other habitats - Antarctic (complete with penguins and Puffins), the rainforest, an area with sea otters and much, much more. There are currently two entrance fees of 13 euros (main exhibit) or 16 euros for the main exhibit and a temporary exhibit of sea turtles which I thoroughly enjoyed.It is really easily reached by Metro (Oriente station), train, five minutes from the airport by taxi (about 5 euros) and is part of the old 1998 Expo site, so a great place to spend half to a full day either exploring just the Oceanarium or for a full day the other close by attractions (Vasco Da Gama Bridge, cable car, many parks, large shopping centre and much more).

Wonderful!. The Oceanario is so much fun! You can spend the whole day there looking at the exhibits. The fish and animals seem happy and healthy and there's lots of educational stuff happening. I took a billion photographs and had a ball. There's lots of spots to sit down and take a break, really nice outdoor areas surrounding the oceanario also. I usually don't like zoos or places like that, but loved the oceanario.

Outstanding experience. I have visited many aquariums around the world, and this has to be one of the best there is. The sheer impact of the main tank had me staring in awe every time I came across a new viewpoint. I never in my life expected to see a sunfish, let alone one more than two metres across. The main exhibits are based on showing entire habitats, at the surface and then below. Great views of diving penguins, sea otters, puffins as well as a huge variety of fishes. When standing at the ground floor looking up into the main tank it is as if you really are underwater and there is so much to see. If you love aquariums, you must visit. The kids seemed to be having a blast as well ...

excelent choise. Like: the colors, the variery, the organization of the exhibition
Dislike: the ticket a little bit expensive

No children with us but still worth the visit. We were a couple here for a city break and spent a good few hours exploring the exhibits. Not too sure I would want to go during school holidays though as be it gets packed!

Wonderful!. A must visit while in Lisbon. The layout of the Oceanario is fantastic. You will travel the seas of the world and see their native ocean habitants. The center is a constant and offers many places to sit and reflect. A lovely relaxing morning or afternoon.

Between 5th and 10th must-see in Lisbon. A nice place to spend 3-5 hours. If you have kids it is a place you must visit definitely. You may also take a stroll nearby, eat at a restaurant in the area (cheap sushi-yeah!) and visit the mall.

Great. We did not intend to visit the Oceanario,but the weather was horrible so we thought we'd give it a try.So glad we did,as we really enjoyed it.It's beautifully set out and great to see the sea life on different levels.A lovely afternoon on a miserable wet day.Plenty of choices on the top floor of the nearby shopping mall for lunch or just coffee.
Must see. I've seen great oceanarium in Japan and I must say this one is quiet impressive too. Definitely worth seeing. The building itself is very nice.

fantastic and must place to visit. Like: interior, atmosphere, service. good for visit by family, friends, couples, alone.. photo and video records are available, but without flesh. Big aquarium with lots of exotic inhabitants.
A very nice thing to do with children. The oceanario is very well kept. it is interesting and educational. Really worth the visit . Recommended!

Good stop on Yellow Bus Line. We purchased the yellow bus line two day pass and visited the Oceanario de Lisboa as it was one of the stops. It is located in a very upscale area across the street from the modern Vasco da Gama shopping mall. We went to the mall first for lunch at the food court on on the 3rd floor. We ate at Joshua's Grill (next to Haagen Dazs Ice Cream). They have delicious middle eastern salads. We then went to the Oceanario and I must admit, I'm not a fan of aquariums either, but it was worth visiting nonetheless. I enjoyed watching the fish swimming by in schools. Lots of young children were there touring and children will be children - noisy and running around. However, when the schools in Portugal are on break, I assume it is less hectic.

Great time with my family. When the sun is tiring you, and your kids are in "we are bored" mode I recommend to visit Oceanario de Lisboa. I've spent there with four kids more than 3,5 hour having fun and enjoying amazing collection of sea (and water) creatures.The time flies there - what surprised me a lot. After visiting "Oceanario" you can have a walk along the river and taste some local cuisine in the restaurants around. Parking is easy to spot. Even if you have to pay for this - it is rather symbolic than real money.Enjoy!

A great place to spend a couple of hours!. A lovely aquarium, well planned and maintained and lots of fish, er, swimming round! Very close to the cable car so a good idea to combine the two attractions.

Expect huge crowds. But be amazed from the sea life. You can expect a queue for acquiring your tickets. It's not cheap even. But if you're willing to spend a few more €€€ the experience is amazing. The experience is organized as if you were travelling through the globe, from ocean to ocean. Warm waters, Cold waters. Everything is there,Watch the sea life in all it's glory. As if your were in a submerse reality. You are inside the tank. Huge curved windows allow you to see sharks, moon fish, stingrays and many many other creatures. Also you have an area with penguins that delight children and grownups alike.Recommended for families with children. But if you want to cruise around with your loved one, it could be a romantic place providing you can avoid the crowds.

Excellent. Went there on a nice day. We walked by the boardwalk to the North end. Took the cable car one way to the Oceanario. There is extra sea turtle exhibit. ( my daughter favorite ) there are some much to see. Penguins and Otters are so cute. I agreed better than the Aquarium in London England and the new one in Toronto

I'm a huge aquarium lover. This was just ok.. I was expecting far more from this aquarium given the massive size. It was not that impressive and I would've been better served going to a different attraction.
Loved it. That' s it! There are so beautiful animals. It is also very clean. The price is also ok. That's it, if you have the time, go there.

Amazing! . Spent a fascinating couple of hours rambling about the many themed environments! Very impressive array of wildlife as well as sea life and plenty of high quality viewing points. Take your time and make a day if it! The cable cars next door are also a great way to round off a trip to this marvellous aquarium!
Brilliant aquarium. Very reasonable price, fantastic aquarium with an amazing huge tank full of all sorts of fish, very cute sea otters, etc. the kids loved it!
Excellent. Very good , there is lots to see . The cafe was a little disappointing as no toasted sandwiches as advertised or baguettes .

Very good but not amazing. We read all of the glowing reviews and so spent an afternoon here. It is a very good aquarium, but I must say, it was not the mind-blowing experience I had expected. It is very similar to many modern aquariums around the world with it's large 'fish tank' and smaller exhibits. We paid extra to enter the temporary exhibit of the sea turtles, but were disappointed with this part as there was actually very little to see. Overall, it was very enjoyable and worthwhile if you have the time, but I wouldn't prioritise seeing this over other areas of Lisbon
Sweet little (big) aquarium. Big central tank with a few sections for different climates. Noisy with kids, as these things usually are, but still a nice visit.
Rich exhibition. The exhibition is very rich with lots of species and there is the possibility to spend a night over near the aquarium.

Beautiful Aquarium. Oceanario de Lisboa was amazing, there is one massive tank in the middle of the building which you circle as you go from room to room. the lay out of the Aquarium was perfect as you could take in each part at our own pace and we never felt like we were being rushed from part to part. Oceanario de Lisboa is in the far right hand side of the city in a big shopping area so the closest metro stop can be busy but it was easy to find and was a great way to spend an hour or two. It cost €13 for the Aquarium and another €3 for the temporary Sea Turtle exhibit
Nice way to spend a couple of hours. The facility was very modern, well laid-out and "kid-friendly". Exhibitions were pretty common for this type of attraction.

Amazing!. I've been to a lot of aquariums in my time but this was truly wonderful. A beautifully kept aquarium with a great visitor route, dwell time, interpretation and lighting. The water quality was brilliant and the selection of animals was wonderful. I would definitely recommend a visit.

Exceeded all expectations. All the animals were in great condition. You are let approach the whole thing at your own pace. The big tanks are linked together brilliantly with little offshoots for penguins, sea otters and sea birds. Sometimes I find big aquariums can be a little overwhelming and I end up hypnotizing myself to sleep but the variety here kept my girlfriend and I engaged, I would go back again.
A great family event. There are Superb displays for children of all ages 2-92 take your time, don't be tempted to go with the flow.

Perfect for a rainy day. Frankly, we did not fall in love with Lisbon The travel books describe it as another San Francisco, but sadly, it is run- down, filled with bums sleeping permanently in abandoned store-front doorways, and for me, lacked a sense of romance and vibe. If you like San Francisco, go to San Francisco. That said, it was rainy on and off most of our stay, and pouring buckets on the day we went to the aquarium. As our hotel did not inspire us to stay there, we checked on the Internet for things to do in the rain. Fortunately, we selected the aquarium. We have been to other aquariums, but do not put aquariums on our "to do" list when we travel. This aquarium experience was awesome. For some reason, it struck just the right cord. We had a good time. The ticket line moved quickly, and we spent about 10 minutes in line. Tickets were pricey, but everything we did in and around Lisbon seemed outrageously, as in 'you've got to be kidding me', over-priced. Yes, there were several groups of young children. But, they were well-controlled and it was easy to move around and past them. The fish,frogs, penguins, coral, eel, etc. were awesome. Seeing the caretaker enter the tank to feed them was very interesting. I would see the aquarium again if I returned to Lisbon (but I will not return to Lisbon as it is not on my top ten enjoyable cities list). My advice: if you think the aquarium is expensive and do not recommend it on that basis, then do not go to Lisbon at all, as we found everything to be very expensive in Lisbon.

Perfect way of getting familiar with the ocean life. We have travelled the world, but nowhether have we come accross a more beautiful ocean world exhibition. Full of life, gorgeously presented, just stunning! Do not miss it!

Impressive. Enjoyed during our visit to Oceanarium. I recommend permanently exibition - great to relax while sitting in front of big tank full of different types of fishes. Temporary exibition is waste of money. There are couple photos of turtles and one live turtle. Boring and disappointing.

Brilliant.. Me and my girlfriend spent 2-3 hours here one morning and absolutely loved this place. There's a wide assortment of environments and species to see and the place caters well for families. I'd definitely recommend visiting this place as well as the marina area around it. Great way to spend a morning.
nice place great place to saty. great. all were good. the only problem it is not easy acces so the best option to take a taxi. nice area nerby
Great place for kids. We loved the Oceanario/ My 6 year old loved the place . It is definitely a place for families. It is a little bit far from the center of town but worth the trip

Enjoyed the experience. I come from London and our aquarium here is really terrible. I really enjoyed my visit to the Oceanario and would definitely recommend others to go see it. It consists of one turtle exhibition which is temporary and one main tank with 4 smaller sections in the permanent exhibit. It doesn't take long to go through it all but was worth the money in my opinion.

Impressive. We had not been to one of these before and were pleasantly surprised by the experience. We took the Hop on Hop off bus out (the Oceanario is located quite a bit out from the centre of Lisbon, in a very modern area of the city).
