This was a great way to view all kinds of sea life from around the oceans of the world. The various exhibits are very well presented and explained invarious languages. The main central "tank" is very impressive, with a wide variety of species, and viewable from different angles and floor levels.Although busy it wasn't overly crowded and we moved around the various exhibits with relative ease. If the queue management system at the entrance is any indication the Oceanario looks as if it could get very crowded at peak times. There is bright restaurant on site, which was ok - nothing exceptional.All in all a most enjoyable couple of hours

Wasn't planning on spending an afternoon at the aquarium.... ...But when we realized that the tile museum was closed we decided to check it out and quite enjoyed ourselves. The aquarium is well set up so even with dozens of small children swarming about we were able to find time and space to see all the fish. The exhibits were great, although we paid extra for the turtles and they were a bit elusive. Recommended but not if you only have a couple of days in Lisbon.
impressive. We went with our son who is 5,5 and it was a great journey. The big central tank is quite impressive. We've looked a shark in the eye (wow).
Great aquarium. This really was as good as we had been told. So many species of fish in such a large area. Great detail about sealife. Easy to get to on the bus.

Superb. Impossible to be indifferent and just not like any other thing you had seen before. Take the tour, admire the small tanks, the animals but the big tank takes the prize. You can literally stand or seat there for hours admiring through the big glass wall. Really. What a scenario.

Enchanting and extraordinary. The most amazing immersion (and submersion) in the world of the sea, lots of information and educational input for children, but mainly, sheer enchantment and magic at every turn, for all ages.

worth a visit. Worth a visit for the vastness of it and the way it is done from the big tank in the middle to the different oceans represented. The area is also to be seen as it has been built on the expo 98 site. Really well done.
Beautiful please !!!!. A big and beautiful aquarium with lots of beautiful fish. If you visit Lisbon do not miss the Lisbon aquarium . This trip will leave unforgettable experience.

Lisbon Oceanarium. Lisbon's Oceanarium is one of the world's largest aquariums. Designed by American architect Peter Chermeyeff, it rises from the river and is reached by a footbridge. It is a deep-sea diving experience without any of the risks, with about 25,000 fish, seabirds, and mammals in an enormous central tank that is the size of four Olympic-sized swimming pools. Visitors can look into it from different levels for close-ups of the various creatures, including different species of sharks
Impressive. Hopefully your closest encounter ever with a shark or some creepy sea creature. Also, enjoy cute penguins and seals. Great if you have kids.
Excellent !. This was one of the best things we did in Lisbon. the sea-life was amazing and the environment stunning. Recommended.
Fantastic. A wonderful place to visit on a rainy day with your children. Easy accessible even with a stroller. Very friendly staff
Nearly as good as The Deep!. Excellent of its kind. A great place to go in rainy weather .Well stocked and presented. Loved the penguins.If in England , 'The Deep ' in Hull is very similar!

wow. really a wonderful place, we were (me and my friends) astonished wow wow and wow this was one of best days spent in Lisbon and i will visit again for sure all kind of fish frogs turtles ....were there.when you are there you forgot everything i spent a long time sitting in front of the big fish tank basin watching sharks colorful fish.. it worth visiting
Amazing!. My daughter was amazed!Having her smiling all the time we spent in there, i can't think of a better place to be with your children!

Fun. This would indeed be perfect for a rainy day but the coast is lovely when it's nice outside too. Nothing spectacular but great nevertheless. Located in a fun area of Lisboa with the casino, high rise buildings, well-recommended restaurants and even benches for a sit.

Great day out. The Oceanario was one of our favourite days we spent in Lisbon. It's like no other aquarium I've been too - it really is the closest thing to being in the water with the fish! The only downside of our day there was the temporary sea turtle exhibit which we paid for and were disappointed with - saw barely any sea turtles and was a very small exhibit.

Glas we changed our minds!. Before going to Lisbon we had done some research and the Aquarium was a definate no no. The reason being that we thought you can see an Aquarium anywhere, what's the point in going all the way to Portugal to see fish! However, the weather was not that brilliant during our visit and after consulting with the 7 and 11yr old girls, we changed our minds. Sooo glad we did as it turned out to be the best day of our holiday. No cue, not over priced, fairly good cafe and an amazing temporary exhibition as well as the aquarium. Loved it.

Brilliant!. The Oceanario is amazing. I don't think it has the biggest variety of aquariums I've ever seen, but it's very well designed, and the huge aquarium in the middle is breath-taking. They have some very nice scenic areas with penguins and others and such, and it is all very nicely done.At the time I was there, there was a temporary exhibition with sea turtles, which was very impressive as well as educational.This aquarium is definitely a must-see if you like aquariums.

We really liked it. On our way to the airport we stopped at the Oceanarium. We only spent there a very limited time but we really liked it. The tour is nicely organized, you can see a big variety of sea animals and plants. It is a real fun and you learn a lot. Recommended

Great Aquarium. The Oceanariums is impressive. The main attraction is a central tank that is teeming with life and featuring some amazing viewing points. The tank is deep enough to cover 2 full floors and the view from the bottom floor looking up is as close to scuba diving as you can get without a mask. There are some subsidiary tanks for various regions but these were less impressive along wi some specialized tanks on the lower level that were also fairly standard. They have a lot of otter memorabilia and is part of their film of the history of the place but they either do not actually have these animals or I completely missed them. A hint: the line to get in was quite long and no one was using the automated kiosks which worked just fine so I am not sure why no one was using them.

Explore the ocean without diving. Oceanario is a great place to explore creatures of the ocean. We came here and saw several sharks, sting rays, turtles, seahorses, and many other species of fish living below the reef. a huge tank is thier house. and here also have animals living close to the sea and seeking foods from the sea as penguins and some other birds, and beavers, we like beavers. That is a worth excursion

Great to see big fishes!. Despite the long queue to buy our ticket and the numerous groups inside, we had a great time at the Oceanario! you see amazing fishes, like manta rays, sharks, etc. Very impressive!

The kids loved it. It was a couple of years ago so I can't comment on any recent changes , but this is a very well presented and organised oceanarium based around one huge central tank. Several other tanks on the outer parts containing smaller sea creatures. Tip....take the metro to Oriente station and saunter through the shopping centre towards the Ocean. The food court is upstairs if you're feeling peckish. Walk left along the front towards the Vasco da Gama tower and then take the cable car in the opposite direction to the Oceanarium.Ice cream shop near the exit for a treat afterwards.

Best aquarium that I have ever visited. This aquarium is beautifully presented with an excellent range of wildlife. The permanent exhibition is organised around a huge tank containing all sorts of sea creatures, including several sharks and sting rays. Around the periphery are more specialised tanks, including penguins, seahorses, otters, and tropical fish. It was quite crowded on the weekend, but I enjoyed my visit nonetheless and would go back if I return to Lisbon

Definitely worth a visit. This is reported to be the second largest aquarium in the world and I would highly recommend a visit. The beautiful floor to ceiling tanks are filled with stunning marine life, with lots of viewing galleries around the tank and on different levels.The aquarium is marked into different ecosystems, including a rain forest, heavy with humidity and a polar region with seals and penguins. It also has displays from all the oceans of the world.Definitely suitable for adults and children. The aquarium does get busy, even during the week when we went, so we were glad we bought our tickets at the Hotel as it saved a lot of time queuing.

Amazing. Oceanário is an amazing place to visit with childrem and all family. There are several internal zones very well organized with lots of sea's ways of life. Oceanário is localized in one of the most beatiful Lisbon zones, near the Tejo river and with a lot of green places where you can stay, eat and appreciare the good wheather.
very interesting. it was good aqaurium with many fishes and turtles. it is possible to see other aminals then fishes. thet have birds and otter

A Marine Lovers Dream!. Feeling a little fragile following a few nights of enjoying the Lisbon nightlife, we decided to take refuge in the calm indoors of the Lisbon Oceanarium for a day. The beautiful floor to ceiling tanks filled with stunning marine life was just the mellow cure we needed for our hangovers! As aquariums go this one is certainly high class with an impressive array of underwater life on show, particularly the sea turtles, sharks, sting rays and penguins. I'm a big fan of jellyfish myself which they had plenty of. Reasonably priced and a nice activity for a change from the crowded beaches. Get there early to beat the queues on a weekend!
loved it. we loved seeing the puffins and penguins… the variety of fish and and the size of the aquarium is beyond what you can imagine, recommended for all travelers.

Don't Miss IT!. The Oceanario in Portugal, set on the Tagus River, is the best I've ever seen, easily reached by a tram downtown. It is marked into four sections, including a rain forest, heavy with humidity; a polar region with seals and penguins and two others. Walking through each, self-guided, you would swear you were in a distant country. Some of the fish tanks are set in black, so one can see the bountiful types and colors of fish indigenous to various parts of the world. Jellyfish are transparent, and the only way they can be seen are in a tank with black walls. They are graceful and beautiful. A huge tank filled with larger species such as sharks is hard to leave - mesmerizing. One can sit and watch all day. It is the second largest aquarium in the world, accessible downtown by a tram that follows the river. We got lost, and a kind woman actually sat with us past her stop so she could take us back to the right place. We shared photos of our grandchildren and left with hugs. The Portugese may be the friendliest people in all the countries we've visited.
Not to be missed. This is relatively new facility and most of the sea life is there presented. No large sea mammals, though.

Among large common tank aquariums, this is the best. The Oceanario in Lisbon will fascinate you. Find a seat by one of the many locations available to contemplate the large tank and you'll be mesmerized by the diversity of sea life that will cross your line of vision. The sharks are always a hit and the schools of fish swimming in synchronization will always amaze. And when a harbor seal decides to dive down and visit the fish, you'll laugh out loud. Even the penguins get frisky some times. Don't get me wrong, the Oceanario is not just entertaining; there's plenty of opportunity to learn about sea life and many habitats. But who can resist when a sting ray floats close to the glass, does a fast flip, unceremoniously shows you its underside and then "flies" away with its tail "wagging"
Good place to visit. Nice and beautiful place to visit with kids .good variety of fishes.very well kept,tropical garden very pretty .worth a visit
Very educational. Wide selection of tropical fish, beautiful colours, fascinating sea otters, so big! Nothing to dislike!

Being in the ocean without having to dive. Walking around the giant aquarium gives us the impression that we are swimming with the fish and being part of the marine fauna. The feeling of peace and tranquility is something that takes hold of us without without realizing it. The kids love it and the adults enjoy no less.
Wonderful!. If you are visiting Lisbon it's a place not to miss. Great organization and a temple of ocean live!the children and adults love it.

Uauuuuu!. A must go place in Lisbon.
Take, at least, 2 hours.
Great place. Try seating in front of the big tank, and you can watch a never ending movie of live fish.
I've been there several times, and I feel like going again tomorrow!

what a great place and area to visit. The whole area that was created for Expo 98is really lovely. Great wide boardwalk by the water, restaurants, cable car ride, huge mall, lots to see and do. The oceanaro aquarium was spectacular. So much to see and so informative. Well done. Great for kids and adults

The world underneath the waves. Considered one of the best of the world it's a excelent place to visit, even more with your childrens, not only a lesson but a beatifull place. Situated in the area of the world expo 98 wich is one of the places to visit around the city also.

A great Oceanarium. Simply a "must go".. Went to this Oceanarium 3 times already, and in all 3 times, it was a really great experience. The main tank is huge, with lots of different species, and different angles for you to look at them, and the other ecosystems are all well designed and populated. The place has very good areas for the visitors to stay and watch the sea life at your own pace, and depending on the dates, you may have temporary exhibits that give an added value to your oceanarium visit.It is a place you should not miss when you visit Lisbon, as it is an attraction that you cannot find in many places, and is definitively worth your time.

Good Spot to spend some time. It's a unique space to spend an afternoon, the aquarium contains thousands of spices and provides an unique and fun visit.The tickets are not cheap, but that's something you see every day, and i also i thinks they are adjusted to the cost required for maintenance.
Aquarium. Excellent place to visit with child. This is the most beautiful aquarium in the world. Don't miss it while you're in Lisbon!
Really nice. The price for an adult is 14 EUR and worth pay it to visit. There are a lot of species and the staff takes care of them.

Well-organized and very cute penguins!!. This is a place you must visit when you are in Lisbon. This Aquarium is well-organized and there are many sea lives. The penguins and otters are super cute. They all even have names. The location is also great. After your visit you can enjoy the stunning view of the Tagus Rive. This is my favorite Aquarium so far.
One of the best Aquariums in Europe. I am a grown up diver and surfer and never get enough of being just there sitting and seeing all the underwater life passing by.My nephews love it too !
a MUST od Lisbon. it is definitely a good way to of a morning in the midle of all kind of multi species colors fishesyou should go and try . I good place to go alone, with kids or friends

Excelent attraction in Lisbon. No doubt a can't miss attraction in Lisbon. The Oceanario offers amazing sights over a wide range of animals, not only fish, sharks and starfish, but also otters and penguins.
Despite a bit pricey, it is one of the greatest activities to do in Lisbon.
World class aquarium. About the best main tank we've ever seen. Great fish, and many windows to view from that are all different.

The best oceanarium. It's my favourite oceanarium (and I have been in Monterrey and others!) - large, quiet, with many interesting exhibitions reflecting ecosystems in various aquatic ecosystems on Earth. Loved the penguins, the otters and of course gigantic main aquarium. I could just sit there and watch the fish for hours (which I did both times I visited). Don't miss it while you're in Lisbon!

Excellent presentation. One of the best in Europe but living in Australia ours are better eg Mooloolaba or Melbourne. It was handy having a meal at their restaurant after the visit leaving us more time to get back on the hop on bus and see more sites.

Nice aquarium. It's a nice aquarium however left a lot to be desired. Has a 1 big central aquarium and lots of little displays... Got around quite quickly... I think it's slightly over priced... The turtle exhibition was amazing though.

If you like aquariums go and see this!. The building by itself not pretty but interesting design and looks like staying in water. The surranding area is amazing, dated back to 1998, when Lisbon held the World Fair, 3 from the pavilions are still there, the 'garden walk' with water vulcanos and the telecabine. The entrance fee is ?16 for all exhibitions but if you have a Yellow bus ticket it is only ?13,60.The centre tank is amazing, 5million liter of seawater, 100 pieces living in it. As you walk around can see from every angle. On the other sides are interesting as well, pinguins, tropical forest /without animals/, small tanks with many different animals.The temporaly exhibition is good aswell, with all the rescued turtles and other fishes, you can even walk on the aquarium! See for yourself!

Not what I expected. It cost almost $50us for my husband and I to visit the aquarium. It only took us a little more than an hour to see everything, and we were left feeling disappointed and somewhat saddened to see the penguins and otters in relatively small enclosures.

Fantastic aquarium ideal place to go when it's inclement. It was chucking it down so we decided to go to the aquarium. I tell you what.....it's full of fish! We loved it and the staff were helpful. The journey via the turtles and then into the main building can take two or three hours. School children's excitement and noise add to the experience. Only had the urge to use them to feed the sharks once. Actually, they were well behaved and you have the option to let them pass. The massive acrylic windows open up a world that is stunning and can only be replicated if you scuba dive. The otters, penguins and puffins add to the fun. The restaurant and cafe didn't impress.

What a great place!!. Magical aquarium for sure! The central aquarium is breathtaking, you can see the animals for differents points of view and always from very close. It's inside so its a good activity to do when you're getting a little tired from the hot temperature. It's really worth a visit, we LOVED it!
Worth a visit. Though a bit expensive it is definitely one of the best oceanarios we have seen in a long while. Perfect to get away from the city's hustle for a bit.

Just beautiful. An superb place with combination of small and big fish tanks nicely sitted in nice and relaxing area. You can easily walk through and if you want you can sit here and relax by watching of beauty of underwater world...

Absolutely packed on weekends. The Oceanario is a very large aquarium, with some really excellent exhibits. The only downside I can name is that the place is really packed with people on weekends. If you're into photography like me, that makes it a challenge. If you have the option, go on a weekday and save yourself a headache.
Wonderful!. One of the best Aquariums I have ever been in. Located on the former Expo 98 site so lots to see, easy to get to. Tickets for seniors 65+ are 50% off.
You must love it. It is a really big place, full of sea animals, lots of info about the ecosystems. The central tank is just magnificent. Kids just love it... and so the adults!

Just fantastic. Took the two young kids here and they absolutely loved it. There isn't a huge amount to do with young kids in Lisbon, but this is a must. Great exhibits, good size. Not too expensive. Really enjoyed it. If you have kids and are in Lisbon, take them here!
interesting. The place is HUGE and would be suitable for children and adults. So many different kinds of fish and has a real emphasis on conservation.

Truly breathtaking. Words will never some up how amazing this place is. You must go & go now
& experience a breathtaking place with so much to see it will make you forget that you are in a hot amazing city like Lisbon & make you believe you are under water
Fantastic aquarium. Really nice and modern building, massive tank with sharks and shoals of fish, even sea otters and penguins. It is a must see in lisbon.

Amazing, impressing, breath-taking experience. Amazing, huuuge aquarium, with some xxl fishes, inluding sharks. Difficult to photo though.
Penguins are funny and could be observed very closely.
Staff is helpful.

Outstanding Aquarium. The only negative for me was the flies at every entrance and exit - you'll understand when you walk through. Don't bother with the side attractions unless the really interest you - turtles was on my trip - but the main aquarium is spectacular. Such diversity, and visible from many angles. Don't stop at the first sighting of the main aquarium, everyone does and you don't get a decent view, carry on round, and you'll have about 10-15 other unobstructed views of the same. I personally really enjoyed the otters, collecting ice cubes and holding them on their chest, playing with them, awesome.

Fun Trip. There was a really wide variety of sea animals and there was some poetry and other information on the walls. In all honesty I preferred the layout of the oceanarium in St. Malo, France but still this was a great experience as it even had penguins and otters. It was a bit expensive but its one of those things that you don't do often so it's worth it.
La tortuga. Go. It is a wonderful place. Very friendly staff. Great huge tank. Lots of beautiful fish. A nice walk along the shore
Brilliant. We loved it at the oceanarium. It's situated in such a lovely area too - we spent our whole afternoon and some of the evening here. Spoilt for choice for restaurants :) take us back!!

Simply the best!. We often visit a "Sea World" or similar but this was REALLY impressive. Cleverly arranged over several floors and the size of some fish was astounding.....very educational for all ages and we adults could still learn a thing or two about our planet.....70% water after all!

Fun for kids and grown-up. The place embodies a wonderful idea.It's not just an aquarium,there's more to it...like ecology,loving the beauty of this world,being together,being thankful.That's how I felt it and I liked it

Brilliant. I would highly recommend a trip to the Oceanario de Lisboa it has so many creatures of the sea you will send at least a couple of hours there. A highlight for me was probably the penguins and the otters which I wasn't expecting at all. The large 'fish tank' has many viewing points and it is amazing to look at the wide selection that are on display. There was an additional exhibition of sea turtles which we were there which were also amazing. Brilliant for kids and grown ups of all ages!!!!

Not just for children. Although I find that aquariums are usually for families with young children, Oceanario de Lisboa catered for young and old alike. Each exhibit had very informative write-ups in both Portuguese and English and there were lots of fun facts to keep you entertained. It was definitely one of the best aquariums I have been to.
Fantastic. This is a no miss ! We enjoyed it very much and will return when we are back in Lisboa. Recommend to do it with children.

Enjoyed The Turtle Exhibition. Like the layout with the different zones and the main tank was massive. Some 'interesting' fish on display. Really enjoyed the Turtle Exhibition and glad we paid extra to see that.Could perhaps do with more interactive elements for that extra bit of entertainment.
Great place for familly. Fantastic big aquarium with sharks, penguin etc., Not too big with small child, very well organize. Very nice neighborhood.

For kids. This might be fun if you are tasked with entertaining kids, but it's not special, especially for the price, for adults. I've seen this kind of aquarium in malls (like West Edmonton Mall) for significantly less money. It also wasn't terribly informative, but maybe it's the right amount of information for the school kids, which seemed to be the main groups in attendance when we were there.

Just visit it!. Well, if you like to known something more about the oceans, all of them almost at the same time,you have to visit the Oceanário de Lisboa. Get there when you visit Parque das Nações. You will love the modern part of Lisbon, the capital of the discoveries!

One of the best I've ever seen!. I'm not usually a big fan of aquariums, but as my travel companions are - I tend to go to quite a few of them. And the Oceanario de Lisboa was one of my favourites! The variety of all the exhibits was absolutely amazing - and I almost wanted to go back the next day! We nicknamed the Giant Sun Fish, "Sunny" and he kept following us around the aquarium. It was marvelous!

A must.. The best I've been to! . As a family an aquarium is a place we attend in most countries and places and this was by far the best I've ever been to. It's the second largest in the world but that's not all that makes it great! The different sea exhibition areas are simply beautiful! We bought an audio as we were without the small kids and really enjoyed it! You simply must go if going to Lisbon

Great aquarium!. This is a wonderful aquarium! We saw the special exhibit on sea tortoises which was very informative. The huge main tank is fascinating, especially watching the puffins dive to the bottom and forage for food. Could have watched them all day!
a wonderful modern oceanarium!. We have been there three times over the five trips we have made to Lisbon (our son moved here) and have brought friends and family to show them.

Must see in Lisbon.... This is an excellent acquarium and has a good park around it... definitely a must-see attraction in Lisbon... and look out for "Alaskan Sea-otter"... there were couple of them and both of them put on a great show for us... :)

great place for adults or families. good value and lots to see, would be a good place for either adults or families, would have liked to see a bit more on the sea otters as that is one of the things they are known for.

Great for fish lovers!. The large central tank is constantly interesting and can viewed from different angles and levels. Human exhibits alos very entertaining! Different areas for different habitats well done. Particularly enjoyed the sea otters. Queuing system left something to be desired. Hate to think what it is like in high season. Why not more working self service machines? Both were out of order when we were there and we had to queue for ages.
great aquarium. This was a fabulous break from cathedrals, forts and museums...very well done! The exhibition captions were well written, and there was a good amount of information on conservation.
Great Aquarium. Second visit - just had to go back. Arrived about 1700 and had the place virtually to our selves and stayed until they closed.
Very good aquarium, very pleasant neighborhood. World standard aquarium in a very pleasant neighborhood. Good variety of sea wildlife, good abientation.
Awsome aquarium. This aquarium is worth the visit. If you are in the aquarium when the otters are having lunch, go there, it is so funny.

Great day out for kids and adults alike. Lovely aquarium with a temporary exhibits as well as the permanent ones. When we went it was the sea turtles, the cost is 16 euros for both exhibits and it takes a couple of hours to go round it all. The sea otters are a must too

Well worth a visit. We drove to Oceanarium from Cascais which was not a particularly good idea. The tram from Lisbon is most probably a better method. The main tank is huge and a corridor surrounded by smaller tanks meanders around it from top to bottom. It is worth paying the extra to see the turtles. The area surrounding the Oceanarium is devoted to large stadiums and exhibition halls and therefore a bit uninteresting. However, the nearby cable car is well worth a ride.

The stars are the Sea Otters. Really nice to experience. Beatiful big tank in theMiddle and great showcases around the edges.Recomended if you have 2 hours to spend.The 2 Sea Otters are worth the visit alone

Spectacular sun fish!. Go see the rare sun fish. Whilst the sharks are always great to see, and the mantas graceful and daunting, the sun fish stoled the show. It's a huge tank full of lovely animals in a wonderful location.

Perfect for kids and adults. so big, a lot of information, tourists friendly with everything translated in English. the science museum is in the same park, so it is a good idea to plan to go to both of them on the same day. I got my tickets from my hostel so saved me lots of time standing in a row, so try to book online.

Right up there with Vancouver and Maui. Lisbon's aquarium stands alongside then Maui Ocean Center and the Vancouver Aquarium. It does a great job of having lots of species, especially from the Indian Ocean, which the aftforementioned lack. There are no whales, no hands on demonstrations, but a great job of having lots of species to see. It could offer more interpretative information. We didn't get the audio guide so perhaps it was in there. This is not a Sea World or the display in the Mall of America. This is a true to life aquarium experience not an entertainment center.

Interesting. Definitely one of the better ones we have been to. The layout is extremely natural, especially where the penguins were. Loads of ice for them. Dislike was it was very very dark and you can get a bit disoriented

Neat Layout. It is located in the modern district of Lisbon it is kinda of strange it feel like being in a futuristic movie. The Exhibits are set around a central tank that holds the sharks, sun fish, and rays. You are able to walk through seas from all over. Right now there is a temporary exhibit of sea turtles.

Interesting and well organized. Nice experience, both for young and adults. The best part are the different settings (tropical, antarctic, otters, etc).
Not the best aquarium ever (a bit too dark, mind your steps) but interesting, also the surroundings.
Interresting and must. A very nice oceanario with many things from marine life. Sharks and tropical fishes is the best! Highly recommend!
I love this place. Best oceanatium I have visited ever. And the otters or penguins are lovely. Have been there 4 times and never get bored.

Great aquarium. we don't go to aquaria anymore because we are scuba divers and aquaria are almost always disappointing. This one's power is that the way it's designed you deeply get the idea that the oceans are important and that terrestrial existence is in partnership with the sea
Good but was expecting more. The oceanarium came up in everything I read about Lisbon and as an animal lover I was keen to visit. The place is huge however, I was expecting to see more animals.
Visit with or without children. It was crowded with children and schoolclasses, but the place is big so you can always find your own space. Very nice, very interesting.

one of the best. It has a lot of rooms with all kind of sea life. Close to the airport.
A must see in the price of 16euros

Extremely well done.. On a dull Saturday afternoon w walked almost straight to the front of the queue and paid a very reasonable 16e each to include the special exhibit. Turns out it was about sea turtles and it was fabulous, so glad we didn't miss it!Inside the main aquarium, we spent a few hours (there is a lot to see) gazing at all the different tanks and admiring the different creatures - oh the sea otters! - from a variety of angles.The Ocenario is separated into the different 'oceans' and they have really made it feel like separate climates with plantation and climate control, it's incredibly well done.All different age groups present and appearing to enjoy themselves although it's very dark in some areas and some of the displays are at waist height. All info presented in Portuguese and English.
Top of the world. Really one of the most beatiful and awesome aquarium never seen. You will thrilled about it. The main tank is really a full sea complete of each mankind of fish.
Stupendous!. Huge fishes and sweet otters! So many things to see in this labyrinth of fishtanks filled with strange creatures. we did not regret our 13€
Unbelievable!. This aquarium can't be missed by anyone!! This is easily the best aquarium in all of Europe. We will be back!

My best day at Lisbon. Was surprised at how new the place was. Went to permanent exhibit and temporary exhibit. Temp exhibit featured sea turtles which was great. Perm exhibit was even more impressive. Fantastic views from different angles and nice corals which decorated the tank. Classification of aquarium into various oceans made it special. I had a wonderful time. Kids will probably be inspired to be marine biologists. Good job by all staff at the Oceanaria.

Excellent. This is a bit of a journey outside the city centre but it is worth the trip in our opinion. At the time we visited there was a special sea turtle exhibit which was fantastic. The aquarium itself takes about 2 hours to see properly and has a lot to offer. Our favourites was easily the sea otters and the penguins, neither of which were separated by glass like some other aquariums we have visited.

Worth the visit.. One of the best aquarium I have visited. Even better than the newly renovated New England aquarium in Boston, MA. Very organized with lots of animals to see. It was easy to get to using public transportation.
Well worth going. Avoid city tour buses go by metro well worth going - lots to see and on a sunny day nice river view area to visit
Fantastic and amazing. One of the best in Europe, with the real feeling you are close to the sharks, otters, penguins, etc.

It lives up to the hype. This is the second biggest aquarium in Europe, but still, that might not mean anything. It's a really great aquarium. It has a huge central tank with cool fish. But it has displays from all the oceans of the world, and it's really well-laid out. We went because the children we were with demanded it, but it was definitely worth going to.

A different place to visit in Lisbon/local diferente para visitar em Lisboa. For those who want something different in Lisbon, want a cool fresh spot, near the river and so cultural as the centre of Lisbon has to offer, must visit Oceanário.In a zone where you can walk with your friends, take a good meal or a drink with your friends in PArque das Nações, after or before you can enter Oceanarium one of the possible things to do in this place. Ocenarium has several species from fish, to turtles, sharks, octopus, Penguins, Sea-lions and so on. Even when the heat strikes on Lisbon here you will forget the heat cause all the water in the tanks or aquariums sometime will make you think you are in the middle of the ocean or in the middle of the snow. It have a cost to enter but it's totally worth it in my opinionPara quem procura algo diferente em Lisboa daquilo que o centro histórico de Lisboa oferece, tem aqui uma boa alternativa. Numa zona perto do rio, com sombra, relativamente mais fresca que algumas zonas na Baixa Lisboeta. Com cafés, restaurantes por perto, sitios de lazer, já teve mais mas isso é outro tema.No Oceanário paga-se mas todos os tanques e aquários fazem por vezes esquecer o calor da rua nos dias muito quentes e a pessoa sente-se confortavel. Aqui encontra-se desde tubarões, pinguins,tartarugas, Raias, cavalos marinhos, leões marinhos, peixes, entre tantos outros. o Preço que se paga é compensatório e pode sempre no fim comprar lembranças que lembram o tempo ali passado. facilmente se passa nesta zona uma tarde.

Not to be missed!. Definitely not to be missed! For anyone with a passion for water and animals, it is a really beautiful place, where you can easily spend an entire afternoon just looking at the fish and all other sea creatures. Lots of different species, different environments, very well organized and with lots of information. I've been to a few aquariums in different countries, but this is definetly my favourite.

Wow. Fantastic aquarium - huge central tank and interesting corner tanks - especially the otters. Quite a long queue to get in (approx 40 mins), but good value for a family ticket (2 adults plus 2 children up to 12 for just over €30).

Super fun!. I had a great time. Fortunately the temporary exhibit was turtles! I love turtles! There was a lot of information about different species of turtles as well as artwork around the oceanarium. It's really cool watching the crew maintenance the tank and there are a ton of different views of the main tank from all over inside. Loved the penguins - they each are colour coded with a band and have a name! Very cute. A great way to spend a few hours.

Great weekend plan for families. It is a special attraction in Lisbon.Really impressive huge aquarium. Kids will love it.Admission price is a bit on the expensive side (16 euros if I remember correctly) but it is an expensive place to maintain and it is definitely worth it.I had been in 1998 when it opened and now that my daughter is one I finally have a great excuse to go back.It is a must go to place in Lisbon.Parque das Nações is also ideal for a well spent day!
very interestingly and entertaining. great place to go with children, to spend few hours.many strange sea animals of any kind: fish, sea mammals, birds.
Decent walk around but not the best out there. Saw sea turtles. Great large walk around aquarium. Decent hour or so. Around 50 euros for 2 adults and a 5 year old

Great way to spend a couple of hours on a rainy day... Went here last weekend while it was raining. I guess a lot of other people had the same idea as the queue was really long- but it moved along quickly. I got a ticket that included the temporary exhibit of the sea turtles. My only disappointment was that I never saw any of them- maybe they were hiding! The main large tank is amazing- sharks swimming right up close to you. There are a lot of species to see. The crowds make it difficult to get to see some of them but if you're patient to wait eventually you'll get close to the glass to see. It didn't really live up to my expectations but I'm not really sure why. I was expecting something more out of the experience. Maybe something different other than lots of glass tanks to look at (but what I'm not sure- I think my expectations were very high after reading loads of good reviews). Overall I enjoyed it. A small note also, there are also lots of things nearby, including a huge shopping mall with loads of shops and lots of restaurant / food options.

Very enjoyable afternoon especially on a hot day. Very modern aquarium, with plenty to see as you rotate around the main tank in the middle of the impressive building. Plenty of sharks, barracuda, Rays and a giant sunfish along with many other species. Lots to see at the areas shooting off from the main tank as you move around from puffins and birdlife to sea mammals like others. Also lots of information on the exhibits. well worth adding to your trip and would be a great place to chill down on a hot day. If you arrive by Metro Check out the station front as you come out at the Parque das Nacoes which built for expo 98. The station name is Oriente and is quite impressive in it's own right. Also we would recommend the sky ride over the water from the Vasco de Gama Tower at north of the park down to the Oceanario for a great view over the river, bridge and the park itself. A good area to spend an afternoon/evening

Spectacular, over expectations. I was really pleased that we made it to the Oceanario de Lisboa. The structure is very modern and large, there are really many different fish which can be admired for a reasonable price. The central tank is amazing and you can view it from so many different perspectives. The temporary exhibit with the sea turtles was also very impressive.There are lots of interactive spots too and activities for children that visit the facility.It was very cool to visit the penguin areas, which are completely "open" and you can come in contact with the animals (even if it's not allowed to "touch" them).One of the best acquariums I've visited. Also, it permits you to see the Parco de Naçoes in the "new area" of town which is cool to walk through.

Very enjoyable overall. Very interesting place to visit with good information. More emphasis on the importance of conservation and the effects of pollution appear to be needed when doing a stroll along the water after our tour. Plastic bags, discarded plastic chair and other refuse clearly evident :-( It would nice to see more signs reminding people to shut off their flashes on the cameras. Very upsetting to see so many visitors disrespecting the home of so many marine creatures. Monterrey Bay Aquarium near San Francisco comparible.

Child friendly. Was there with my husband. Crowded, with a lot of children everywhere. Not so impressed by it, exept that they had sharks and a giant sun fish. Others that havent seen anything like this before, will probably find it more interesting.

Go there!. I've always wanted to visit the oceanarium and this one in Lisboa was better than in my dreams. If you want to be there don't hesitate and buy a dual ticket for the oceanarium and for the turtles.

Great trip to Oceanário. We really enjoyed the Oceanário de Lisboa experience. With an excellent variety of sea life from all over the world, it was interesting until the end. The kids loved the two mischievous sea otters. The manta ray and ocean sunfish were also highlights. Easy place to get to on the metro.
Simply great!. Very nice place to visit with children. 90 minutes of fun and expericence. The masterpiece when visiting the area.

great afternoon out. Easy to get the underground and get to correct part of Lisbon but not very well sign posted when trying to find the Oceanario.
Great afternoon out for both adults and children lots to see and very interesting.

Amazing aquarium with sharks and other nice sea creatures!. The Ocenario de Lisboa is a great and exiting place to visit for its amazing and very big aquarium, and its recreations of different climates around the earth with some of its species ranging from little fish to sharks, otters and penguins. Most importantly they want to provide a message to everyone about the conservation of the ocean and its species.

Very well kept aquarium. I loved my visit here! the Ocenario is nicely aranged, there are some amazing species there. My favorite were the sea otters and puffins - cute beyond words. We happened to be there when some giant turtles were brought. Their had special tanks you could actually walk over, see the creatures bellow. The main tank was also rather impressive, with the moon fish being the most odd looking there.Overall our visit didn't take longer than 2 hours and the line at the entrance is nothing compared to the Barcelona Ocenarium (that's to say we waited for only 15 mins or so). So it's definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful aquarium. Definitely the best one I've been in, but I still expected more. The main tank was beautiful and large (as were some of the species in it), and the temporary exhibit (sea turtles) was impressive, but I guess I wanted to see even more species displayed.

Great aquarium. If you like watching the ocean creatures you will definitely enjoy visiting the Lisbon Aquarium "Oceanarios de Lisboa"... I have been there with my family a few times and I enjoyed every single time.
Feel the ocean. One of the best aquarium in the world. You can look and see thousands of fishes living in a good environment. And the temporary exibitions are also interesting.
Great experience "under the sea". This whole project is wonderful, from the architecture to the various examples of sea life that can be found and explored. Definitely worth a visit when in Lisbon.
You never get enough. Great time spent at oceanario de Lisboa. Lots of species, big ones and small ones. Really liked the guitar shark and the moon fish!

An useful lesson for knowing more about mother Nature. Located on an excellent place of Lisbon - Parque das Nações -, the Oceanarium is an occasion to get a wonderful lesson about the oceans, the life of the sea animals and a world of fascinating beauty.
Great time. Have a great time at this wonderful place. Suitable for all family with all ages. Great experience! You can also visit the Expo area and surround area

Best aquarium in Europe. It's the largest aquarium in Europe. Has the biggest tank with many species available to watch. On other stories one can see penguins, sea birds and one of our favorites: 2 otters.
Awesome. It is important to visit. The sea and the animals of it are the most important attraction. Also birds can also be seen

oceanario. very very interesting, fantastic location, wonderful fauna, beautiful fishes
worth a visit, attraction for friends, families, children, everybody!

A more comprehensive view of the oceans. Great for acquire more knowledge about the oceans. With a vast exhibits about oceans, fishes, algae, coral, birds and other marine inhabitantes. Great opportunity to see also the second largest oceanarium in the world.

"my oceans". As a portuguese i reccommend it not only for people who aprecciate nature and marine life but specially as an educational activity for kids! And they LOVE IT!!Here you find not only "fishes" but a main aquarium - gigantic!! - divided into the different oceans of the world and its species.In the exterior you will find penguins, turtles, the beautiful otters, several species of birds; and "inside" the aquarium you'll meet sharks, rays, shrimps, sea horses, the most amazing fish, and all the marine life that accompanies it, plants, corals, etc...As a portuguese native, I normally never go more than twice at the same place - "it´s so near and I can go there whenever I fell like it", I say to myself :) - but to this one i went already 4 times and everytime i visit Oceanario i get the feeling somethign was missing! :D so i definitely recommend this one! ;)Also it is pretty damn terapheutic! (for this i reccomend avoiding the weekends as it's normally crowded with children)

Beautiful Aquarium. I absolutely loved the HUGE central tank with the massive curved glass viewing areas- I could have (and, in fact, did) spent an hour just gazing at it, watching the myriad forms of sea life schooling, swimming, gliding by. A great way to spend an afternoon with the kids, or without!
nice to visit. 15 min to get tickets on a Sunday morning. The Oceanario is nice, but could e busy and not easy to see everything. More for kinds than adults! Even the surrounded area is really nice.
If you like fish.... It's simply a must while in Lisbon. It's beautifully done and the big big big tank which is the center piece offers great views of all the fish at the different levels.

pritty cool!. We went to Coimbra, where we rent a car and went to Lisbon. Oceanario was our first destination in Lisbon. It was awesome! Full of wonderful fishes, sharks and turtles. As a students we paid 14,60euro, but was worth that, I definatelly recommend for all of you! After that go and visit colorfull and magic Lisbon.!

Worth a visit. Went along in the morning on the yellow bus. Approx time 1100hrs. Tip buy tickets online as we had to que for 40 mins. Paid extra for the headphones which was worth it for the information it gave you. An enjoyable outing for all ages. Certainly worth going to see. Buses back every 30 mins so very reasonable. Lots of restuarants around the area.

Interesting to visit. Yes, it's one of the most interesting things from Lisbon. You'll see ALL fish species from all over the oceans and seas, herbs, small anatomical parts, etc. In the middle there is a huge aquarium including all species. From time to time some if them are putting there faces in front of tourists.

Nice day for families. The Oceanario was easy to find. Lots of parking in the area, we used the Vasco Da Gama shopping centre and had lunch at the food court there before. It was nice being able to see all the different areas, tropical waters, penguins, sharks, the temporary exhibit of the turtles (though we only saw one turtle). Having a diving background but unable to dive the past few years it was nice seeing the fish underwater again. I did expect a bit more though as we were finished seeing all in just under 2 hours. As a couple we probably got around a bit quicker than a young family would. I can see how it would be a good trip out for children as lots of parts aimed at them too.

Excellent. This aquarium is one of the best I have visited anywhere. Not just swimming creatures - sea otters, sea birds in comfortable, convenient habitats accessible for even the shortest visitor. This is a great attraction for both adults and children.

Dual level viewing - tanks below and terra firma exhibits above. Unique set-up, catorized by the major oceans of the world. For example: For the Arctic Ocean there is a terrific penguin exhibit with ice floats on the top level and below water viewing on the lower level. The Sunfish that is used in the advertising is humungous!! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and found the trip easy to coordinate by subway.
"It was beautiful but i was expecting more". it was good because there were impressive fish. But I was expecting more the visit was very quickly finished .
Wonderful. This place is awesome! A "must see" in Lisboa. Dont lose time in first "wall". There is lot of them after that.

Wonderful. It is a really great aquarium that is around 10 minutes walk from Oriente metro station. Definitely worth a visit when in Lisbon. Spent 4 hours here but could easily spend longer. I would recommend also checking out the temporary exhibit on the turtles- worth the extra €3. While the entry price is pretty steep, if you like fish and animals, it is good value as you will spend a good few hours here. Great for those with kids or on a rainy day. Make sure to check out the sea otters.
Highly recommend a visit. Located in a lovely area, a short walk away from Oriente Metro Station and large shopping centre.. A lovely day trip.

Can't be missed. Myself and my family were really enjoyed our almost 1 hour and half exploring thing in here. The location is a bit way from the central but with what we saw and did it was totally fine for us. My nephew and even myself was open-minded with lots different knowledge about the ocean's creature. Overall like my title this place just can not be missed to see if you ever want to visit Lisbon

I could sit and watch the fish all day. The tanks are huge and fascinating. Great for kids and adults. Even though it is a big building you don't feel like you are on your feet a lot as there are plenty of areas to sit and admire what is going on around you. I particularly like the see-through walkway where you can watch fish and turtles swim under your feet in the temporary exhibition (this is well worth the extra three euros)

A 'must see' if visiting Lisbon. The aquarium is a must see if visiting Lisbon, especially as it's near the chair-lift with its fabulous views over the river and quayside. It is well worth visiting both the temporary and permanent exhibitions to fully appreciate all that is on show. It took us about two hours to walk all around the aquarium with its many photo opportunities. It has to be the best exhibition of its kind that we've ever visited and is clearly adding to the knowledge base of the world's oceans.

Worthwhile making the effort. Outside central Lisbon, but easy to reach on any of the bus tours or the 728 bus. good value, the only negative was that when we visited early April, there was relatively little to do nearby so you could not make a day of it

Highly overpriced. Highly overpriced. Perhaps kids might enjoy this but there is little to keep adults entertained. They show the same tanks over and over again from different angles. Does not represent good value for money.
lovely. Its quit interesting place. Specially this big aquarium with sharks, fishes and etc. But I think it is little bit expensive. And I think one time there is just more than enough.

It is ok when it is raining and you have nothing else to do ... i was not impressed with the aquarium. i read many reviews that recommend it as one of the top attractions in Lisbon, but i did not really enjoy my time there. i went to many aquariums around the world, and believe me this one is not special. The only special the thing about it was the Sunfish. The rest might be interesting for children. As I said in the title, if it is raining and you don’t have anything else to do, then pay it a visit.
just go if you really like fish. Since Im not crazy for animals..it was kind of boring. However, for someone that really like can be nive
Great for a rainy Lisbon day. Spectacular aquarium located at the waterfront. A wonderful way to spend an afternoon when you are museumed out. Everything is in English as well as Portuguese.
2nd largest aquarium in Europe. Spent 3.5 hours in there ... loved, loved, loved the otters. Easy to get there by transit. Lots of other things to see around there also.
If you have kids to entertain. This aquarium is a great place to go if you are travelling with kids. They will be amazed by all the different types of fish it offers

Very impressive. We needed an activity for a rainy day and chose the aquarium - what a pleasant surprise! The aquarium is very well planned & it takes you through many different marine environments - Canadian Atlantic to the Indian Ocean. The central tank is amazing & can be seen throughout the aquarium. There is a lot of educational posters explaining the wildlife & how to save the oceans.The temporary exhibit was on sea turtles and it was also very good.
A great experience for young and old. This is a must see for all ages. Our 19 month old Daughter loved it nearly as much as her 60 year old granddad!

Well worth visit. Visited oceanaria by taking yellow tourist bus and stopping at red route stop 8.Aquarium is 2nd largest in europe and my advice is go early as queues are busy and we went on weekend.There are a variety of things to see such as birds, penguins but there are a wide variety of sea animals to see such as fish, sharks, squids, jellyfish.Ticket cost 13 euros and whole aquarium can be seen in roughly 60-90 minutes.well worth a visit one of the top sites in Lisbon.
enjoyable. It was enjoyable but the one in Barcelona was more impressive, bigger and you could see beautiful fish passing not only on your right and left but also over your head.
for a family---it's a must :). very accessible by bus/metroarea has a casino and a very scenic aerial cable systemworld class aquarium in a great city

Great way to spend a wet morning in Lisboa. Not exactly the easiest place to find - but once you have come out of the metro at Oriente on the red line and turned right and walked along the waterfront behind the shopping mall for about 10 minutes you will find it... follow the cable cars they run from it.It was a lovely way to spend a rather wet morning in Lisbon. The main massive tank was amazing but felt a bit let down by the star attraction and my reason for visiting as there were very few turtles to view....either that or they were hiding along with the sea otters!There are several levels to the Oceanario with many place/alcoves to sit and watch nature up close.. you could spend hours in there just taking it all in.......and don't forget your camera.Vasa de Gama Bridge can also be viewed from here truly a magnificent piece of engineering. Tip don't buy tickets before you go pointless - you still have to queue just the same and with lisboa card you get a discount.

Five Star Definitely. Wonderful Real Palacio Hotel, great service, spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff. We loved Lisbon, all the parks, narrow streets, shops, and the wonderful Portugese people, very friendly. But be very careful of the pickpockets. Wear money belts and keep your pocketbooks in front of you.

An amazing wather world. This is a great experience, we get amazed with all those different forms of live and the way each one is adapted to the diferents, but most impressive is the way each habitat is reproduced here.

Great Aquarium. Not so great temporary exhibit.. The main Aquarium is fantastic. Cost 13euro. As the other reviews say it has a huge main tank in the middle with lots of interesting fish and then around the sides it focuses on the different parts of the worlds oceanic life. The highlight for me was the Sea otters and the devil ray, oh and the Sun fish. Extraordinary!There is an interesting video on the daily routine of running the aquarium and feeding the fish. The only thing I thought could be improved was more informative and interactive activities. A huge disappointment was the sea turtle exhibition. I learnt more about sea turtles by watching 'Finding Nemo' than I did there. You didn't really get to see them either. Nothing interactive or cinematic. The turtles are there for rehabilitation and recovery before going back to there natural habitat. Its not a very comprehensive exhibition and not worth the extra 3 euro in my opinion.

Nice. Nice oceanario. The permanent exhibition is really great, seen many fishes and animals that I didn't even know existed. The main aquarium is HUGE and contains some monsters of animals.I'll go against the grain and say that the temporary exhibition (sea turtles) wasn't really worth it: you barely get to see them, even more because of the many people in a relative small space: when a turtle can be seen (they're sometimes rather "hidden" behind the decor panels and stuff), people immediately flock around it and sometimes keep standing there for minutes, so you can barely get a glimpse.Be aware of a few things:- On their flyers they say "get off at metro station X", so you get the impression that it's nearby, but it's a ten minute walk from the metro station, and the route isn't drawn on the Oceanario flyer. Ask locals for the way: it's not very hard to find but you just need to know in what direction to walk. - We went on a Monday because that's the day when they're feeding most animals. We had created some sort of "schedule" so we would see most feeding sessions based on the timings provided on the flyer. Too bad that in reality, they don't seem to be following those timings very closely, so we missed most of them anyway.

Cute Animals!. Very cute animals - laid out well and interesting. The temporary exhibit wasn't as good - it was sea turtles but there was only one left in the tank - the rest had been released (a good thing!) so I would stick with the main part.The food there isn't the greatest - impossible to find anything vegetarian!

Worth seeing but in the Modern City which is different and interesting.. This aquarium is world class but a bit out of the way. It's very interesting to see the modern section of the city where Expo was, but I prefer all of the old areas. Nice place to walk around, though.

Best aquarium in Europe. As a frequent visitor to zoos and aquaria around the world, I dare to say that this one is the best public aquarium in the whole of Europe. The aquarium has 5 themed areas on two levels, each with it's own marine life. Upon entering, you stumple upon the biggest tank in which you will find a great array of fishes; Ocean sunfish, no less then 7 species of sharks, 3 species of guitarfish, barracudas, groupers and 6 species of ray including the only Devil ray kept in an European collection. This ''Global Ocean'' tank represents all of the worlds oceans and is the park's main attraction. During your visit, you'll get to a view into this tank from multiple huge acryl windows from all four sides.But there's a lot more to see. Sea otters (the only ones in Europe!), Magellanic penguins and different kinds of shore birds all have their home here and they all have a terrestrial viewing on the upper floor and an underwater viewing on the ground floor - and are living alongside sharks! Many smaller aquaria are found on the ground floor and feature a fascinating arrange of species. Jellyfish, giant octopus, cuddlefish, Japanese spider crab, weedy sea dragons, sea horses, anglerfish, flatfish, wolf-eels, 5 species of moray eels and ratfish are just some of the creatures you'll come across here. And ofcourse there is an oustanding coral reef display with the most colourfull of fish. And the best part is, while watching the sea otters, penguins or tropical fish, in the background you might see the inhabitants of the huge tank pass by as the aquaria themself are seperated only by acryl windows!The temporary exhibit ''Sea turtles: The Journey'' is also an amazing piece of art. A circular-shaped aquarium in which you can watch turtles and fish as they swim beside, above or even under you!

Poor value for money attraction. I went to the Lisbon Oceanarium excited at the prospect of seeing a cutting edge Oceanarium full of rare and interesting sea life and also from reading other reviews.The centrepiece is a huge tank with several species of fish and surrounded on two levels by smaller exhibits. The displays were OK but not quite as good as some of the other Oceanarium I have visited around the world. The only memorable item for me was the enormous Sun Fish, which I had never seen before. The entrance fee of 13 Euro was a bit expensive in my view and I felt that I hadn’t had value for my money.

Awesome!. It is a definite must-do, very impressive in all aspects! The price is very reasonable and the staff were really nice and helpful by giving me a safe area to store my suitcase (which wouldn't fit in the lockers), with no cost. You have signs of which path to follow inside, which is very convenient, the number and variety of the exhibits is another pleasant surprise. It is just minutes from the metro station, so it is really easy and cheap to get there. Also, you have lots of things to see around it, as well as some coffee shops and restaurants.

Bigger than expected. We visited the Oceanario on a day when it wasn't very crowded - which was nice. We were there over 2 hours. There is a huge central tank which you can see wherever you are. I also recommend the special Turtle exhibit. It's not huge but informative.

Must see!. A wonderful aquarium situated in a fascinating, open area of Lisbon. The aquarium itself is thoughtfully laid out with expert attention paid to recreating natural environment. Sharks, Turtles, Otters, Penguins...it has it all!

An attraction for all ages!. We visited recently and spent a wonderful three hours gawking at some big and small fishes! The lay out is very good and we spent a great deal of time in front of the massive fish tank and near the penguins. I also loved the section where they have recreated the tropical rain forest. The visit ends typically, at the shop, where we didn't buy anything, since it was a predictable tourist trap. There are lots of restaurants opposite the oceanario, where one can enjoy a good meal. Not to be missed!
Superb experience. Brings together all environmental aspects of the world's oceans. Best aquarium I've ever been to. Located in the fabulous park of nations.

Nice to see. I visited the oceanario with my 9 yo daughter. I personnally had seen bigger aquariums but this one is very nice and very well kept. You can all see it in about 2 hours, and there is a possibility to have an audioguide. We did not have the opportunity to see the temporary exhibition, but we enjoyed the permanent one. Kids will definitely enjoy seeing sharks and rays and other kind of fish, as well as the sea horses, clown fishes, frogs and other... I would recommend it to families visiting Lisbon.
Top class spot. I havn´t many oceanariums in my life biut this is by far the best I know. Great fun for families with kids. The selection of animals is outstanding. We where impressed.
Fab for the Toddler and Fam. We live near the Mystic Aquarium in CT which is considered one of the beast in American and you definitely equal that!
fantastic !. For the people who loves sea and animals... Please go... you will love it! Not necessary to be a child, I recommend for all ages !

Holy Smokes! Fantastic!. Beautiful, clean and amazing. I like it better than the famous aquarium in Baltimore, MD.They had tons of fascinating fish, turtles, and birds--even penguins. Lucky penguins have a few glaciers and a huge area.
Excellet aquarium. An excellent aquarium, lots to see, easily fill an afternoon, particularly good if the weather isn't so great one day
Worth the visit!. Our afternoon at the Oceanario was great! Highly recommend visiting if you are in the area! Enjoyed the chance to visit.
Amazing oceanarium. Lots to see very impressive central tank with sharks, rays and shoals of fish swimming around.Amazing building too.A must see sight when visiting Lisbon
nice building. in the new part of Lisbon, where was tha Mondial 98 Expo, in a wonderful situation, inside we don´t want leave all the fishes and the magnum aquarium, Is a must in the world

One of the finest aquariums in the world. This place is a family favourite. The central tank is absolutely mesmerizing and the other tanks are also full of wonders. Don't miss it, whether or not you have children... you cannot fail to enjoy it!
Well worth the visit. Second time to visit and really enjoyed the experience.Children well behaved and supervised at all times,which helps.

Fancinating place to spend an afternoon. We came across this on our Yellow bus tour. Our tickets allowed us a discount on the entry fee. It's a great place to spend the afternoon. Very impressed with the 4 different open areas with the birds and penguins. The two floors of the main tank were great. There was a very easy to follow route which allowed you time to everything at different angles. Very good indeed.
Really Amazing.. One of the best places to visit in Lisbon, besides de monuments and castle of St. Jorge. They made replicas of different oceans, amazing merchandising list.
Really impressiv!. Is really a nice place! I think it s wonderful for adult but also for children!Just the temporary exhibition disappointe me...
Turtles, jellyfish and penguins. Such a peaceful and fascinating place with so many species, took some fantastic photos too. Good for all age groups

Good for younger kids. We went here as an option on a rainy day. It a nice big aquarium that you essentially walk around in a circle. There is a headset you can rent describing the various stations. I thought overall it was ok and a good option if the weather is not cooperating. Take the subway here.
Fun with family. Super fun with family! Very pacifying place)) Kids were absolutely fascinated by the ambience and the whole experience!

Good visit. The aquarium is a bit out of town, but relatively easy and cheap to by train. the aquarium is well laid out and informative, most of the dispalys are multi-lingual. Eating facilities aren't cheap and not that great, would advise a packed lunch, or save your appetite for somewhere else...

Nothing fishy about this daytrip.... Great place - one of the best!We went as 2 adults and spent about 4 hours there. Even though it was 16 euro's admission, we never felt like we'd paid too much as the return was so rewarding. You can really tell where your admission fee is spent with this place.
Really Interesting. The best aquarium I've ever visited. Informative and very well laid out. Well worth a visit and suitable for all ages.
Fantastic. Fantastic oceanarium. Enthralling from start to finish. Loved sitting in the little nook and watching turtles glide above us.

Fun for all friends of the nature. The only thing really missing here was that the diver in the big tank did not wear a red beanie...
The presentations were good, both. Loved everything minute.
World's Best Aquarium?. Phenomenal!! As an experienced scuba diver I felt that I was "at depth" during the whole wonderful experience.
the biggest in europe. I am not kind of persone who like this things... I only went there becouse of my friends but honestly i dont regret at all ... Amazing view, amazing spent time!
good fun. good educational/evironmental aspect. fun way to spend a morning. really enjoyed it. worth the extra to see the turtle exhibition too

Really Fascinating!!. Spent a good afternoon going around the oceanario. It had so many things to see, and is really well laid out so you are walking around the main tank. If you have any spare time when in Lisbon you should try and go!!

Excellent on a rainy day in Lisbon. This is an excellent place to go when it is raining. There is a lot to see and do for a few hours whilst the rain comes down. It is a long way out of the city centre and the sign posting from the station is not that good.

One of the best aquariums in the world. Was here many years ago, going back next week and the main sight I'm excited about in Lisbon is this aquarium. They even have a sunfish! Do you guys have any idea how HARD those things are to keep in captivity?

An amazing experience. It's an amazing experience that is a must for everyone if you visit lisbon. It has to seperate buildings one with permnent and one with temporary exhibits with fish turtles penguins and many others and the best of course sharks. As for the price it is 16 euros for both exhibits.

An Excellent Attractions. There is something about watching fish in aquariums and what better place to do this than here. Could spend hours with my nose up against the window. Brilliant and with an "Attraction" ticket you get entry into some of the other attractions at the park.

Very nice experience. I went with my hubby here on an outing and loved it :) Nice place to take the kids and just walk around afterwards riverside if the day permits it (the Oceanário borders Rio Tejo)
The exhibits are excellent and there are a variety of ocean life and sea creatures all around. Great way to captivate children!

Fantastic and an absolutely must-go place!. The Oceanario is a mandatory visit if you are in Lisbon, especially with kids. We went on a Tuesday in the winter so it was not too crowded. I'd expect it to be very busy during high season though - so be ready to queue!

Technically Excellent - acessible pricing and a really unique experience. Fabulous venue - excellent engineering, large accessible areas - breathtaking aquarium - beautifully kept, excellent exhibits and an enormous aquarium containing so many varieties of sea creature. A truly unique and well presented experience - perhaps a bit too long for very young children but totally engaging for everyone with a reasonable attention span

Enjoyable visit.. We visited the Oceanarium after getting the metro to Oriente. Admission was pricey but it was worth it alone for the otters. We were lucky enough to be in the Aquarium when the otters were being fed. They were amazingly cute and it was a joy to watch them play with each other and feed. The highlight for us was when one of the otters stood up to take her food with her little paws directly from the lady feeding her. So cute! The main tank is very impressive and the oceanarium is nicely laid out.

Good aquarium. The main tank is impressive, and it suggests a nice concept of "one ocean". The smaller exhibitions are ok, not really impressive. Very little accent on research and conservation though, this is a pity.

Brilliant, the best aquarium I've been to. This oceanarium is amazing. It is not cheap, but wow, it's the best I've been to and I've seen a few! The centre tank is amazing and you get up so close. We paid a bit extra to do the temporary exhibition of the turtles, which although quite small, it was very cool to walk over glass and see turtles float overhead! Well worth it and it's good to know you are helping to support conservation education of some amazing sea life.We spent around 1 1/2 hours in the permanent exhibition, but you could no doubt spend longer gazing at the wonderful fish and other sea life.Oh and staff were more than happy to store our suitcases in the cloakroom, as we were en route to the airport after our visit. There are also lockers on site.

Brilliant day out. Bit of a trek to get to but once you're there can definitely fill your day just watching the huge sunfish waft gracefully passed you every few minutes or so. Great day out no matter what the weather but even better if it's raining.

Pricey, but well worth it.. This was one of the exhibits built for the World Expo hosted in Lisbon in 1998. The exhibits are nicely maintained, and they have an amazing variety of sea life on exhibit. Their main tank, dedicated to Atlantic sea life forms, is just magnificent.
Excellent. Don't miss this place on any visit to Lisbon its as simple as that.....!!!!!!!It's not just an attraction for kids but suitable for all.

Amazing. A great experience whatever your age; not just for families with little children. If you're in Lisbon you should definitely go to visit the oceanarium, but beware since it may consume more time than expected.

fantastic. Amazing day at the Oceanario. We arrived before opening time so didn't have to queue at all. Beautiful variety of creatures. Incredibly memorable - there's something for everyone here. Sea turtle exhibition was amazing but the sea otters were my favourite.

Amazing experience. This is the best aquarium I have ever visited it is well worth the €16 entry fee and can be easily accessed from Metro on the red line. The giant turtles were out of this world as was the giant aquarium which contained so many different species you could spend all day watching them
the otters are brilliant!. It's not cheap, but it's worth the money just to see the wonderful sea otters eating their crabs. Make sure you go at feeding time. Lots of interesting fish too.

"We saw otters and a moonfish!". What an aquarium! It makes the journey to the eastern end of Lisbon well worth it. We saw literally all sorts, and when you finally tear yourself away the water garden outside lets you stand under a waterfall..! P.S. Otters!!

Special Place to visit. The Oceanario was one of our most enjoyable experience. We spent around 3 hours looking around. My kids would love to visit this place again. All directions are clear, you would know where to move next and all the information (which we found very educative) are in English and Portuguese.

The Big Fish Tank. There is just something magical about watching big fish in big tanks filled with water.
The variety of species is impressive. And it always makes for a great visit, alone (reflective) or with others, can be also a very romantic experience for couples.

a gem. went on the open top bus tour, blue line.
The route goes past the aquarium, the whole area is really impressive and well worth a visit....fantastic!
A Great aquarium. Europe's biggest aquarium with lots of fishes from all over the world ! It's worth visiting ! The perfect thing to do when it's rainy outside.

Wonderful afternoon. It wasn't my first visit and, even though I knew every corner of this place, I enjoyed it like it was all new to me! I recommend you to see it, with your friends, family, boyfriend/girlfriend or alone! You'll enjoy it anyway!

Great time with a baby. Firstly, the surroundings of the oceanarium are quite interesting and it is a nice walk. Then, the place itself is impressive, and it was a great excursion with our 17-month old baby. She could sit on the floor, in front of her a huuuge tank with water, sharks, manta rays and other fishes swimming by very close, the tank being as tall as eyes can reach. It may not be an objective review, but we enjoyed ourselves totally, and I am so happy she could see it.
Nice! :). Beautiful. Just nice to spend a couple of hours. Make sure it is not full of noisy children!... or take your own! :p

the best in Lisbon. To compare an aquarium with a cathedral is of course not possible but if I had to choose only one attraction in Lisbon this would be the one. This time they also had an extra exposition about sea turtles. This attraction has somthing for all ages and also enlightens the world problem destruction of environment.. The Lisbon transport community could do better with a map at the metro station and a couple of arrows pointing where to go. Now the first sign came when you already could see it.
A very nice aquarium. Rather impressive, had many types of fish and it was nice to look at.Unfortunately the viewing glass structure (it is curved somewhat) made me rather dizzy after some time.

Amazing!!!. I've already seen many Aquariium and that was the most beautiful that I found. They have so many diferent species. The big tank is very well cared. The building is huge, modern and easy to walk and see all kinds of fish and others animals.I was very impressive. I loved it. It's a must see!!

Tanks for the memories.. This is number one for a reason it is the best attraction in Lisbon,it is huge, lots to see and do for all ages with the massive tank in the centre the main attraction.All sorts of creatures not just fish.It is a little way out of the town but the transport links are first rate and everyone who goes to Lisbon should see it.Fantastic.
Julio Verne would like it. It was like a trip to the deep sea. I have felt like in one of Julio Verne´s books. Basically you will be on a middle of a huge aquarium with fishes all-around.

I could go back everyday!. I was there the first time when I was a child, therefore I never thought that I would be so impressed when coming back. The oceanarium is just amazing! The best part is simply to have a seat in the floor next to the aquarium and enjoy! You really feel like seating underwater. :) I feel like I could go back everyday.
Great start to our Lisbon trip. Well worth a look if you are in the area, an enjoyable afternoon. The temporary turtle exhibit was great too.

Simply astonishing. Must allocate sufficient time.. My 3rd time in as many years visiting this incredible Oceanarium, the most enduring, astounding accomplishment and living legacy of EXPO '98. In terms of sheer size, it's smaller than the one in Osaka (the world's largest), but in terms of contents, vibrancy and beauty, I like the Lisboa Oceanario quite a bit more. Just remember to allocate MORE time than you first estimate because 9 out of 10 friends I know, including Julie and myself this time (even though we've been there before), end up having to cancel some activities for the later part of the day.

Lisbons Sea-Life Centre. Paid extra for the Turtle area. Worth the extra money as you get some really close encounters. Pity they only have 2 left. The others have been re-introduced to the wild.Really enjoyed the main exhibits. Upstairs is used as to display Otters, Penguins and Sea Birds.
