Downstairs is primarily the main tank which is huge with a few exhibits around the outside. Impressed by the way the penguins and Otters share the main tank.

One of the best. I have seen some Oceanariums before and this one was the best. Huge main tank with sharks, mantas and cute sunfish. On the corners 4 theme tanks with different oceans setup and nice Arctic tank with penguins etc. We planned to go there for 2-3h as recommended.... Spent 5h and only being hungry made us to move on...
As good as everybody else had said. Simply exceeded expectations - current turtle exhibition worth a visit - this was a highlight for me. Also particularly enjoyed Puffins.
Nice Day Out. Had a lovely day out at the Oceanario - very nice way of showing the different oceans around the world. The main central tank is amazing!

A must go see. As we went in January there were not many visitors.The center is amazing,well set out & lots of interesting displays & information on the walk around.We really enjoyed it.Good value for money too.

One of the best of Lisbon. If you are in Lisbon, you have to see Jerónimos Monastery and Oceanario.Be prepared that you will stay here at least 4 hours and you will still want more.Everything was said before - it is a must.

Simply stunning. I was stunned with the size of this place which feature special exhibits as well as massive permanent tanks.The sea creatures come in all sizes and a spectrum of colours. Adults and children seemed engaged with the variety so it would make for an excellent visit for both solo and family travelers.You can see that the Oceanario is taken care of to a high degree, I'm glad to have visited and supported their conservation efforts.
Amazing!. I loved the visit to the Oceanario de Lisboa. Amazing place and known better several animals habit through the exhibitions. Nice merchandising shop.
Good destination for adults and children.. Easy to get to via metro or bus. Not too big but excellent facilities. The sea otters are delightful!

Great Exhibit. Easily accessible from the Oriente Metro Station, it's a short pleasant walk to get to this attraction. you can easily spend 2 hours walking around the general exhibition. The main display is huge with quite a variety of sharks, fish and sting rays. The penguins are engaging. They have represented different ocean areas of the world really well. The tropical fish are so colourful. People sat down to watch the variety of species in the main tank at various vantage points as there is so much to see. it is very well set up and I'm sure will not disappoint anyone.

Turtles. There is a temporary turtle exhibition right now. Go! It is amazing. There is a bench where you can sit and watch the turtles and fish swimming over you. At one point the turtle came right to the glass at eye level and looked at us before swimming away! We loved the entire aquarium.

too expensive. nice for kids and your children. To adults doens t worth it.
You pay too much. The sharks and the fishes are very beatifull but inside theres is not to much to see.
The staff were kind but i had to wait 1 hour in the queu line

fantastic side trip. Great for a rainy day; easy to reach off metro and well worth the stop at Orient; well done walk through of oceans and habitats; right on the River and next to major shopping center.
fun. very large and well designed and kept. huge variety. take a taxi, will cost you abt 10 euros from downtown Lisbon.

Amazing. What a place to visit! The whole place is awe inspiring,the thought that went into the building of this attraction is incredible.you can spend hours wandering around as there is so much to see,from tanks that you can sit under and have the fish and turtles swimming over your head to the huge viewing panels with seats to sit down and feel tranquil or watching the otters and penguins playfully splashing around.Probably the best attraction that I have visited in a very long time and very reasonably priced for the amount of things to see.
Must see in Lisbon!. There is nothing I disliked except for the fact we only spent about 2 hours there. One could stay the whole day and still did not see all.

Fantastic. Great place to visit for about 1,5 hours! Huge aquarium with many sharks and fish of all kind. Penguins, turtles, and much more... Easy access by bus, subway and train. Only about half an hour from central lisbon. Just behind the oceanario there is a cable car from where you have a great view of the region. Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing Oceanarium. The Lisbon oceanarium is definitely one of the best oceanarium's I have ever visited (which werent that many btw but oh well). It has lots of awesome fish including some sea otters (my favourite). Definitely recommend.

Speechless!. The Oceanarium is so worth of visit! I and my husband enjoyed it so much we wish we lived in Lisbon or near, so we could visit it more often! Extremely pleasant, educated and uplifting experience! So many amazing creatures to admire and "study"! We left this place with heart filled with gratefulness for our fascinating planet and the Creator! Take time to watch all these beautiful animals, do not hurry, some animals will make a "show" just for you :)

Where the river meets the sea. Located near Tejo river, the Ocenario de Lisboa is a wonderful place where you can find the rarest fishes, sharks, pinguins, sea otters and many other animals. A must...

Fantastic Oceanario. This is a fascinating place for children and adults. You should stay and watch the film as it explains the amount of work by specialists and research that goes into this Oceanario. It is at a great location by the sea. Also by visiting you are making a contribution to saving the oceans.

World-class. Great aquarium, easily accessible by public transportation, we spent four hours here with the kids. Only downside: the sea turtle special exhibit was a) almost devoid of sea turtles (most of the turtles, it seemed, had already been released back to the wild!) and b) a little too focused on exposition for younger kids to get much out of it. But the permanent exhibits were wonderful.

Brilliant. Second visit and just as good s the first! Allow at least 2 hours for your tour and make sure you take a camera with ability to switch off the flash (no mobile noise or flash allowed). Walking around / above / below the huge tanks feels like you are actually in the ocean . Well worth a visit!

Second time there, still the best. This is my second visit to the Lisboa oceanarium. The first one was 13 years ago in 2001. In the meantime I visited a lot of similar ocean parks (Monaco, Atlanta, Singapore, Barcelona, Sydney,..), but in my opinion the Lisboa one is the best. This time I came with kids and they were thrilled.The connected concept with 4 different tanks, from 4 oceans and their own flora and fauna, leading to the one common gigantic tank is nowhere seen. A lot of amusement, scientific things, and great fish to see.Look for the sun fish, the biggest fish in the world, it's amazing. Great sharks, jelly fish,...penguins,...Afford around 2 hours. Have in mind, the Oceanario is in the remote, north-east new part of town, and beside it, there are other nice things to see and do there (cable car, the longest European bridge "Vasco de Gama", the same name enormous shopping mall), so plan from half up to a full day in this part of the city.

One of the best Aquariums in the world. Apart from the long walk from the ticket office to the aquarium this must rank as one of the best aquariums in the world. The whole experience has been well thought through and is both enjoyable and educational. The only drawback were the number of overexcited school children, whose shrieks of delight not only challenged the otherwise peaceful surroundings but also my ear drums!

Simply amazing. This is a simply amazing 'must go' place. The area, the building, and especially the acquariums are amazing. Inside its like being under the ocean, full of these amazing colourful creatures. There are all the characteristics found in all the different seas, every single tank with different temperatures and surround. From Ocean to Indian to all the rest. Even the North pole areas for penguins around is literally very cold to stay near so they could feel home.Wow, I was impressed. Thank you to all the staff on the back of house for keeping such a wonderful place in perfect condition.Keep it up, I will surely return in a couple of yrs may be beforeMark

Very interesting aquarium. This aquarium is interesting in that it is like a journey . You are able to see the main tank from two different levels and many vantage points and this is in the center of the building. On the outside of this are all kinds of exhibits with different types of sea creatures from around the world. They have a gift shop and eating area. Overall a good experience and it can be gone through in 1 to 2 hours.
Good. I think I was expecting it to be bigger, but it's interesting. There's a discount of Lisboa card holders, so do use it.

Amazing, even for adults!. Very Nice place, many species to watch. If you have your kids, don't miss it. Check the schedule for special presentations. With kids it will be very tiring to go to the science museum on the same day.

Great fun for adults as well as children, lots to see.. The Oceanario is incredibly easy to get to from the centre of town - just take the subway. Entrance fee was reasonable given how much there is to see.It takes the form of one incredible central tank with tons of different fish/sharks swimming around and interacting. You wander round this on the lower levels, whilst the upper level is divided into four different areas to reflect different ecosystems. So there's a penguin area (with individually named and tagged penguins throwing themselves in the air), an area with three very friendly sea otters, a humid rainforest area etc...There are also temporary added galleries but we didn't visit them - to be honest the main exhibition felt like enough.Near the Oceanario you can also rent bikes by the half hour or hour to go for a cycle along the coast and see the different parks and buildings. Lovely way to spend 30 mins!
huge variety of fish. went here to kill a few hours, was enormous and well worth the spend , amazing the amount of animals they have here

A must see in Lisbon. One of the best aquariums that I have ever seen. There was only one caveat: while the permanent exhibition is spectacular, I found the transitory exhibit on turtles quite disappointing. (You have the option of paying just to visit the permanent exhibition).

Well planned and informative. All the animals appeared very well cared for in well designed tanks. It is dark inside the building so keep an eye on any younger visitors you have with you. Information about the species, their environment and conservation is given in Portuguese and English. The layout of the exhibits avoids bottlenecks so everyone can see what is going on without queuing. There are lots of viewing windows around the central tank so that animals with different territories can still be seen.

Wow. Nothing to dislike about this fabulous display of ocean life. I could have spend a lot longer watching the jelly fish "performing" what looked almost like a ballet. A bit overwhelming for very small children. After a while a fish is a fish to them.
Just so impressive!. It is difficult to describe what you see here. Just go and enjoy, you will not regret this fantastic inside ocean and the melting with its abundant sea life.

Just GREAT!. I've been to many aquariums around the world and this is one of the best I've seen. It's big, has a huge tank in the center and around are some smaller tanks with lots of different kind of fish. Definitively worth a visit!
Must go!. You should not miss to visit. Take your time. It is a nice place to spent a morning, relaxing and enjoying! Beautifull moments! To return as soon as possible.
EXECLLENTE. I believe its a must in Lisbon! One of the biggest in the world! Its nice to visit it with or Without kids. Though I believe a kid will be thrilled!
Awesome. I have been to this aquarium for 2 times. It is great I love the tourway and they have an amzing variety. I heard it is the second biggest in the world. Definitely worth visiting.

Stunning. The tanks/exhibitions are massive with smaller regional exhibitions. The range of species was fantastic and we happily spent a whole afternoon there - price to get in was reasonable at 16E - look out for the otters

This is a MUST in Lisbon, not only for kids but also for adults. There are penguins, sea otters, corals and small aquariums with all different kinds of fish. BUT: in the middle, there is a huge (and huge might just be a minimalistic word) aquarium with rays, sharks, mantas and others... impressing. Also, the aquarium addresses ecological issues in a good way, suitable for children.
Go There!

Beautiful. I read that the oceanario in lisbon is the best in europe and i decided to visit in a rainy day with my familt. Beautiful plage,huge with sharks etc all unser your feet, while you walk you can see under a glass.don't miss it.
Enjoy the blueness.. We spent four hours enjoying the view of the sea animals. We were especially thrilled otters. Too expensive souvenirs are negative.
Peaceful. Very quiet later in the day. The main exhibition was a bit hypnotic. The sidelines less so, and the turtles were not to be found--save the extra euros
Beautiful. Great even for adults. A must see. Almost therapeutic. Give your self several hours even for just the permanent exhibition.

Best Aquarium!. It was my second time visiting the Oceanarium and it is one of the most beautiful aquariums that I have ever had a chance to visit. Beautiful fish, lovely setting, and seemingly endless.
Ok.... Nice, but not as we imagined. We thought it's bigger and with more diversity. Pretty crowded and expensive.
Loved the sea turtle rehabilitation!. A great spot!! Loved the work to educate and rehabilitate animals in need such as the sea turtles. Worth a visit!

Deserves its place as the best of Lisbon. When I went this was ranked as the number 1 attraction in Lisbon, and its easy to see why. I have been to a few underwater worlds and this is the best. It is really interactive, and you get the impression you are paying to be watched by the fish, they are everywhere!
Very nice. The Oceanário is a very nice place to visit. It is divided in 5 sectors: Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, Antarctica and Deep Ocean.

Wonderful experience. We paid 13 euros per person for the permanent exhibit and they accept credit cards. We did not buy tickets ahead of time so there was a line when we got there, it took us about 35 minutes waiting in line before we were able to buy the tickets and then enter the aquarium. You are allowed to take pictures but no flash or artificial lighting. It was a wonderful experience to feel like you are right inside the tank with the sharks, stingrays, etc. This exhibit is a must see while visiting Lisbon. There were allot of people there but we still had plenty of opportunities to walk right up to the glass and observe. Easy to get there by the metro.

Crowded but well done. Different sections of the main aquarium show animals from different oceans, including penguins and sea otters. We visited during school holiday, queue seemed hopeless but was actually 35 minutes.

A must see!. If you spend some days in Lisabon and you are only a little bit into snorkeling or scuba diving you have to spend the 16 EUR for the visit. Sharks, rays (incl. Manta), mola mola and at the moment sea turtles can be seen.

fun few hours!. This place is a must if heading Lisbon. There is lots to see, when I went they had an exhibition on about turtles, that was really cool to see the large turtles. Bit pricey to get in, but was worth it. Lots of nice buildings to see around the Oceanario as well. If I was heading back to Lisbon I would head back here again.

Wide array of rays!. If you wanna see rays, sharks and groupers in the same habitat without going scuba diving yourself this could be a good place. The volume of 5,000,000 liters of salt water contains all of the above with great views on it from different angles. The extra four habitats around this central bassin are less spectacular but nevertheless a nice add-on. If you are not a diver, please notice that the Oceanario especially stands out because of all the different ray species. Not only sting rays and eagle rays but for instance a manta ray as well. Truely amazing!
too expensive. It is very entertaining, even if you are not a kid...but 16 Euro- are we serious? I wouldn't have paid more than the half of it, because there is really not that much to see.

Great aquarium!. Spent the afternoon here and loved the layout and the experience. Go during the week so you avoid the crowds. We were able to get up close for the penguin and tropical fish feedings. Nice location in Lisbon.

Go!Go!Go!. this review is from a diver, so listen up! Is one of the most complete aquariums in the Europe.You will have the chance to encounter sharks, mantas, stingrays, goliat groupers, pengu's and all the colors you can imagine.guitar sharks are a special bonus!Stay away from the restaurant. That is the only bad thing.

Wow!!!. My kids are getting a little too old for these kinds of activities and were a bit apprehensive about going to an aquarium. But we were all very pleasantly surprised. A great way to spend an afternoon. The cable car ride near the aquarium was a quirky fun thing to try, although it doesn't really lead anywhere.
Nice aquarium. A nice aquarium with a unique and large one tank layout. A nice place to go if the weather is bad. Not the best aquarium I've seen however, that would be Sydney Australia.

Amazing day out!. We loved it here, had a great day. The turtle exhibition was on when we went and seeing them close up was fantastic, I loved the otters and birds so not just marine life to see, amazing day out for couples/ families, all ages,

Go Fish!. I didn't expect so much by visiting this place, just thinking to see another aquarium like many others, but I was wrong. Thanks to a really well organized visit and disposition of tubs and fishponds the experience was unique. Children enjoyed so much...and parents too! Even the outside is really nice and interesting especially if you like architecture.

Good place to visit with family and kids. Located in the "new part" of Lisboa. The Oceanario is a good Aquarium to visit with family and kids. The area in which it is located is very nice to walk around with open spaces and a ocean view. The Aquarium itself is well design with several atractions around a main tank. I recommend the visit.

Expensive but worth it. By Lisbon standards, very high admission charges. However, by the time we left we agreed it was money well spent. In some places, it was a little over-crowded, but we managed to see everything we wanted with a little bit of patience. Overall, a stunning and educational experience
Amazing!. We went for our kids but it was great for the whole family. The kids had to drag us out of there. Sharks, fish, interactive exhibits, this place is awesome. Don’t miss it!

underwater wonders. well this aquarium is out of sight and i have seen quite a bit of other ones. all kinds of sealife which just makes me say...AWESOME! You just have to be there and enjoy the treasures of our sea life from different parts of the world.

Do not miss it!. Magnificent. That was the most beautifull experience we had in Lisbon. Relaxing, exciting, joyfull, all the feelings you can feel! A must do, no doubt. The most remarcable place we visited in this marvelous city!

Fantastic!. A beautiful place to visit alone or with family . You must spend some hours, you will no regret!
You'll see so diferents fishes !

Fascinating. The permanent exposition is amazing, fishes were so strange! Some glasses of the aquarium are very curved and make people sick!
The temporary exposition about tortoises was nice but not so impressive.

The most attractive place in Lisbon. Oceanario is a big aquarium with Oceanic locations, surely one of the best in Europe and the most attractive place to go in Lisbon, especially if the weather is not good.Metro stop is Oriente (red line) and in these days you could join this visit with the temporary exhibition of the Turtles.Cost for both events for a family is 56,5€ but it is money well spent.Pictures and videos are allowed but only without flash.

Interesting and more than meets the eye. When I heard about a single tank Oceanarium, I was a little underwhelmed. How could a single tank be enough to sustain one's interest? Well my concerns were ill founded. Aside from the fact that there are many different tanks including an entirely separate turtle section, the ocean tank is actually several tanks meshed together to give the appearance of one giant tank. Sharks, sun fish, groupers, tuna and a whole load of other fish I don't know all swim together in a huge centre area. Oh, and a Manta Ray. There are 2 floors and about 16 viewing sections, plus outdoor bits with otters, puffins, penguins and the like. Most adorable. My only concern is that some of the smaller indoor tanks are a little too small, and that perhaps the turtles didn't like being walked over, but I guess it's better than being hunted in the name of some non-existent medicinal benefit as seems to befall many of these unfortunate creatures. Worth a visit for sure.

Fantastic. if going to Lisbon, you must visit, its the best sealife exhibition, dont even think Florida could betterit, its amazing, fantastic array of different species,go on cable car ride just outside too,

Fabulous Aquarium!. Really wonderful aquarium. The main attraction is the giant tank with the sharks and the rays, but there are smaller exhibits that were also interesting. We got lucky and watched the otters being fed, which my 3 year old just loved. The special exhibit was nice, but not justified by the price. Must see in Lisbon, especially if you have children.

Nice memories. I went with my son who wanted to see the see dragons. He ended up enjoying each view of the big main aquarium (sharks, mantas...) as well as the two small see dragons.Too bas some anmals were missing, but it was as nice as it can get.There is a permanent and a temporay exhibition, we only visited the permanent one.The in place restaurant was not really good.
Incredible. The oceanario is simply amazing!!!!!You really must visit this place at least once in your life!!!!!

The best place in lisboa. If you judge it by the price of the ticket you won't go. It's definitely the best place in Lisbon. It's not a regular visit but a whole experience inside the ocean. Try visit it during the week, really empty and calm.
wow. Best place EVER/ Everything is just amazing! Reasonable price as everywhere in west Europe! In love with giant tortoise!

Fantastic. The Oceanarium in Lisbon is fabulous. It is the biggest in Europe and has the most magnificent displays. it has one enormous central tank that you walk around from top to bottom in a spiral way. There are numerous smaller displays on the opposite walls as you descend. The fish without exception look healthy and the tanks are spotless. Very interesting and well worth a visit.

Amazing sea life. Absolutely stunning selection of fish and other sea flora and fauna. Great architecture, friendly staff. You can pay by credit card. Lockers / locker room for baggage if needed. Longish walk from metro

Amazing place to visit. Absolutely beautiful. Variety of fish, aquarium, design, information. Just brilliant. Have cute coffee place to rest after tour, audio guide, safety box to keep your stuff secure. Pictures allowed no flash. Souvenir shop. Metro station Orient (which architectural design amazing it's self), few min walk.

excellent way to spend an afternoon. Amazing for both children and adults. The Oceanario has a huge variey of sea creatures and beyond and I have learnt quite a few new things. The visit was supposed to last only a couple of hours, but everything is so interesting and fascinating, that we took our time and spent probably 4-5 hours inside.
fun, water, animals many and surprises.... Yes, this is one of the most interesting places in Lisbon. Good for families and nature lovers. Feel the bottom of the sea and the mysterious life of fish

Fabolous. Truly the greatest and funniest experience I had on my travelling so far, seeing that great aquarium with all the sharks, jelly fishes, fishes, turtles and everything was just incredible, this Oceanario is one of the most amazing things in the world, everybody should see it!

Great experience. Is the best aquarium I ever had! Is beautiful and the kids loved it.
Is in the Nation's Park, where you can find many other great attractions.
Good value!

oceanario. The Lisbon oceanario is one of the biggest in Europe. It has great architecture and it's located in one of the most emblematic parts of lisbon, the "parque das nações". It has huge aquariums, magnificient animals and is just so beautiful to watch. Totally worth it!
Fantastic!. It is worth to visit. The beavers were stars! I still remember how amusing they were. The center aquarium is magnificent and definitely the biggest one i have ever visited. Recommended!

Cruel small enclosures esp for otters and penguins. We arrived after learning that the ranks are 2 storeys tall and were saddened to find that although there is 1 tank of this size, it is very very overcrowded and the large size of some of the sharks & turtles mean they need more space. The otter enclosure is tiny and you can see their bordom. The penguin's not much better. Breaks my heart.

Underwater Gems!. Great place to go, even with your kids and family.There is a huge diversity of animals to enjoy!Sometimes is also available a temporary exposition.A fantastic tour into the world underwater gems!
Oceanario visit. Very well located, it deserves an around trip. Very well conceived in order to get a good experience in marine life observation. Very good diversity representing all the world oceans
Very impressive.. Walk through displays and tanks from the five major oceans, winding around an incredible central tank. Very enjoyable day and will entertain you for hours.
Great for kids and grown ups. Take the opportunity to go with your kids and enjoy the wonderful fish in the aquarium. Don't miss the otters.
Worth the visit. Very good. Impressive collection of fauna, very well maintained, very good reproduction of the habitats.
If visiting Lisbon don't misse it!. Excellent sea life variety on a beautiful building especially made for this purpose and the biggest and most modern of this kind in Europe.

Best Place in town to watch fishes and something more. If you like to see sea animals, this is definetly a most. There are fishes of all the colours you can imagine...and more. There's a special fish that locks like he has been splashed, ironed, he's mouth on the side...well an alien!!!
You will find sharks "walking" around looking scary and at you!!!!

best oceanarium in the world. Fantastic aquarium- the best I have seen. It is one of the most worth-while sights of Lisbon and suitable to everyone of every age. The enormous central aquarium is stunning -how did they manage to enclose all that underwater spectacle- it must be a ginormous, extraordinarily strong glass container. I especially loved the sun fish and those adorable tortoises and penguins

for everyone!. This attraction is undoubtedly dedicated to everybody. The large aquarium is awesome and your kids can learn to feed the fish and can even sleep with the sharks (do not miss, but with reservations).

A deep plunge. Nice to experience if you have small children. Other than that, it's a rather expensive activity, so plan well, so you can experience it intensily - that said, avoid weekends and be ready to spend a few hours appreciating the deep seas.
beautiful sharks and moon fish. unforgettable experience. to repeat. kids love. all very well maintained and treated.Go prepared for it spend 2 hours at the minimum.

Nice place to see on a rainy day. It's not so big, but it's a really good place if you want to see unusual types of fish, and thay also have some penguins. And if it's rainning in Lisbon, it can be a great place to hide from rain :).
Acquarium. One of the best i've ever seen! A lot of different Marine Life. Perfect for kids and family! Over there you can understand the importance of the oceans!

Excellent, especially when visiting with children. I've visited the Oceanário several times over the last few years with 6-month to 7-year olds. They all have enjoyed it immensely. It's also fun for adults and strikes an excellent balance between science and funn

A must to visit. We visited here with friends and 4 children aged 5-12 and everyone enjoyed it immensely. The facilities are well cared for and staff are friendly. There is a lot to look at and plenty of space and opportunity to sit and watch the myriad sea creatures. We would say this is without a doubt one of the best aquarium we've been to as it has a benefit of wonderful educational information that all ages can appreciate. It is worth the fee, although it would be nice to have an option of a 2 day visit so we could spend more time.

Impressive. This oceanium is one of the more spectcular ones we've ever visited around the world. The view from every angle on the central tank is amazing. The variety of creatures in peripheral tanks is huge. Perfect to spend some time on a rainy (but also a sunny) day.

Outstanding Campus. A family of four adults, we arrived mid afternoon. The design of the aquarium and surrounding grounds is worth the visit. Feeding time w the penguins was fun to watch, and we had fun hanging w the otters---what characters they are. We enjoyed sharks, sting rays, and all the exhibits. Stroll through the gift shop -it's quite reasonable. I was disappointed that our admission fee did not include the turtles.

Worth a visit. We paid a visit when in parque de nacoes and it was well worth it. The layout was superb. Spacious so it enabled lots of people to view the fish at any one time. It was well worth the visit and certainly contained the best collection of fish I have ever seen.

Incredible main tank. The whole aquarium is based around a 2 storey central aquarium, with smaller tanks around the edges on each level. Plenty of interactive items for the kids and space to sit and watch the fish in the main tank. Look out for the sunfish and a very large menacing shark!
Great Place to Visit for Half a Day. Reasonably priced Ocenarium and great facilities and very informative. Definitely one of the best Oceanariums in the World. Great Experience
nice!!. great place to visit with children!! funtastic fish!! my son loved the sharks!!! it was a really nice experience

highlight of my trip. great place and was blown away by the experience where you are surrounded by fish behind thick glass. The turtle exhibition was on and that was fantastic watching these graceful creatures swim about you. The restaurant was good value for a museum although cafeteria like I liked the home cooking served up.
I would not visit another one. If you have kids or have never been to an Aquarium it would be better. My wife and I were not impressed.

the best I'we seen. Everything in this aquarium / oceanarium for me was wonderful. For me it was the firs aquarium that I've visited, and I was enchanted. The concept of this aquarium is that the whole world is one big ocean. In the middle is one big aquarium, and as you go around it, you pass through the all oceans of the world. You can see many species, and you can also learn a lot about every one of them. It is very much worth the visit.

Wonderful!. The aquarium is not overly large but has a great assortment of sea life. When I was there they had a sea turtle exhibit that was very nice and informative. A very good way to spend the afternoon for all ages. Make sure to visit the cafe for a mocha latte and a sandwich :)

Enchanting AND educational! Loved it!. As we were only in Lisbon for a few days and this was #1 on a very long list of attractions, we decided we had to spend an afternoon here. We were not disappointed - we saw both the temporary (sea turtles) and permanent exhibits. The scale of the central tank and variety of marine life contained within are enchanting and awe inspiring. I haven't been to an aquarium in a while, but I was amazed by how many species could cohabit peacefully - prey and predator species alike. I absolutely fell in love with the pacific and antarctic displays (penguins and sea otters) - they were so funny and entertaining and being able to see above and below the water was unique and fantastic and I appreciated how much of an effort they went to to enrich the animals' environments and make them as spacious and realistic as possible. Highly, highly recommend spending a few hours here whether you are young or old.
Wonderful place, worth the visit. Organisation of the place, all sorts of fishes that seem at ease and confortable, well taken care of

Oceanario in Lisbon. I've visited many aquariums in Europe before and I don't see anything special in this one. One big aquarium in the middle and you walk around and see still same fish. No tunnel through aquarium. Small aquarium around are more interesting to me as well as penguins or see otters. In 2 hours we were finished with permanent exhibition and we didn't hurry. I expected more when I heard it's the biggest aquarium in Europe.

One of the best aquariums. I have worked in aquariums (Baltimore and Monterey Bay), and been to dozens of others in the US and abroad, but never have I been so impressed! This oceanarium does an incredible job of highlighting some of the most amazing sea creatures while simultaneously emphasizing the threats facing our oceans and species. Our oceans are in trouble and this oceanarium does an excellent job simply outlining the problems and how we can fix it. It is not inexpensive, but it is in line with how much it costs to visit other well-known aquariums. A visit is well worth the time and money in my opinion.

Great activity when it is raining.. During a rainy visit to Lisbon our family of five spent an afternoon at this aquarium. It was really nice and the huge tank was amazing. The whole place is well organized and the traffic flow is orderly. Keep an eye on your kids as it is pretty dark in some areas. It is rather expensive although there is a discount with the Lisboa Card. There is also a family rate, but it only includes two children. The queue to buy tickets was quite long and the computerized ticket kiosks were not working. Plan to spend a couple of hours here.
Great explanations of the ocean's life. Excellent place to visit, beautiful aquarium with lots of insight on the many different species of fishes and other. Definitively worth the visit.

overcrowded but a great attraction. This place is huge! There's definitely a lot to see! and some of very impressive! The only downside is that it is SO crowded and FULL of small children! so It's really difficult to just sit or even stand by the glass and enjoy the view. We passed some of the windows by because there were just way too many people surrounding it. The kids tend to run around and it's possible for them to run into you as it is kinda dark in certain areas. Overall though, I'm glad we went and I do recommend it to anyone who is visiting Lisbon.

Nice, but average. Lisbon ZOO is located on the banks of Tejo river, next to Expo. The setting is really nice, with lots of activities for children.The Aquarium itself is nothing special, it's medium sized, it took us approx 1,5 hours to visit it. The area with penguins is nice (but cold, so bring some extra scarf or sweater for kids), we heard the otters are very funny, but unfortunately they were resting (which was interesting to see) during our visit. Compared to Valencia aquarium there is nothing special to be seen. My kids enjoyed the parks around the aquarium more.
A great day!. A great day to spend with your loved one, your family and friends. I've known more aquariums in Europe and none is like this. I've been here more than once and totaly recommend it.

One of the best aquariums I have visited. Beautifully designed to see different parts of the aquarium and also a tropical fish part. Loved the otters. Doesn't need more than a couple of hours but lovely river walk in the surrounding area.

A beautiful and educational place. The Oceanario was built to be one of the main attractions of Expo 98 and it's still relevant in Lisbon in 2013. It's not the cheapest place of Lisbon in terms of price/quality but it is really such a nice place to go with children. Different aquariums featuring different oceans and a great variety of aquatic creatures! And Parque das Nações, where it is located, it is one of the most beautiful sceneries in Lisbon. You won't be disappointed for sure.

Amazing!!. I have visited this Oceanario de Lisboa twice and cannot wait to go a 3rd time.It is an amazing experience for families and as you move from zone to zone you will see lots of brilliant water creatures. The central tank, that reaches from floor to ceiling is brilliant and is home to some weird and wonderful fish, our favourite is the Moon (or Sun!) fish.Definitely worth a visit and if you have time afterwards you can pop over to the Vasco de Gama shopping centre for a bit of retail therapy!!
I want expend all my day in here!. I loved it! Worth a visit!Amazing entertainment.For go to this place you should go to The Park of the Nations" (Parque das Nacoes) and you need to pay 13,00 fee.
Excellent attraction. It is both child and adult friendly in that the fish etc can be seen by all. Penguins and otters also a delight.Well worth the trip!

Good but expensive. I feel that a visit to a Zoological garden or an aquarium is a must every few years inn ones lifetime to see the various creatures that share our planet and have a mute right to coexistence and survival to adulthood.The oceanario de Lisboa is a very good place to see the aquatic animals, though a bit expensive.the quality of the experience is excellent .Added to that a trip on the cable car which was not crowded in end of October made it worthwhile.The views from the cable car is breathtaking especially those of the Vasco da Gama bridge and tower.Must see.

Very big main tank. It's the only aquarium I can recall where all of the climate zone areas actually share the main tank - only apparent once you get to the lower level and can look up in the corners and see the otters, penguins etc. Apart from a handful of standalone tanks for seahorses, jellies and similar fragile creatures it's one big ecosystem. Reasonable amount of English signage plus various languages available on audio players make it a good international visitor spot. Tickets are ridiculously annoying though - the queue to buy at the box office was enormous, partially because the automated ticket machines only take cash, and only in Euro note denominations of 5, 10, 20. Seriously people - why no credit/debit option? The slots are all present on the machines, just with black duct tape covering them!

Spectacular. We visited Oceanario having arrived in Lisbon on a P&O cruise. We got a public bus from outside the cruise terminal which was very easy, took ten minutes and cost €3.50 each return. The aquarium is housed within a modern and stylish building which was well worth a look in itself. The aquarium was the best I've been to (including Sydney, Cape Town, London, La Coruna) the main tank was breath taking. All the other exhibits were interesting and very well designed. You can see penguins in a rocky sea shore setting and then drop down a level to see them diving down to fish - fantastic. The aquarium has a lovely cafe which was reasonably priced. The surrounding area is also worth a look with water gardens, cable car station and lovely promenade. A great day out - highly recommended . The €16 entrance fee was well worth it.
Excellent experience and great value. The central tank is mesmerising and you could see it from so many different points on your journey through the Aquarium. Would recommend it highly.
Spectacular. If you want to spend a very nice afternoon please do it at the oceanarium. Ther is a huge central aquarium, with a lot of animais inside. This includes a big shark!

Beautiful aquarium, but expensive. The visit of the aquarium was very exciting, both for kids and grown-ups. Everybody can keep looking at the huge tank for hours. But the price seems a bit expensive to me, and it was really hard to find our way from the metro to the museum. You should carefully look on the map before going to know the way.

excellent. this is a great place of interest to visit for all ages, so well laid out and informative.
Will definately visit again

A great option for a rainy day. We don't normally visit this type of attraction but with the torrential rain Lisbon was experiencing we thought we would give it a go. It turned out to be a good decision as there is plenty to see, enough to keep you occupied for at least 2-3 hours.The central tank is amazing, lots of viewing windows at every level so everyone gets the chance to see something. There are also smaller tanks with the most bizarre array of sea anenomes and other weird and wonderful creatures. We particularly enjoyed watching the puffins and otters.We really enjoyed our visit and were pleasantly surprised when we left it had stopped raining which gave us the chance to go on the cable car which is just behind the aquarium. There is quite a bit to do in this area; shops, bars & restaurants and a really nice boardwalk with great views across the river.
the aquarium. A fascinating and well organised experience., although not that esay to get to - especially in torrential rain

Really good aquarium. Having been to some top aquariums before I wasn't expecting this one to stand out, but it was really really good. The main tank was spectacular and we loved watching the manta ray and sea otters.We don't have good Portuguese, but all of the information was in English too. As far as we could tell, once you have left there is no readmittance. You can see the main tank from many different points as you go round, and some of the side tanks you get to see twice - one above the water and once after. Make the most of each as you go round as there's no short cuts back for a second look without walking back round against the flow of people. Also, you're not allowed to eat inside the aquarium, although there are a couple of different cafes available before you go in.

Good for a rainy day. Perhaps especially great for those that have not had a chance to visit a world class aquarium but i was left with a disappointing feeling that - despite some of the amazing creatures - more effort could be put into telling the 'deeper'' story of the worlds oceans and its threatened inhabitants. Some little people were totally enthralled; this would clearly be a great option for families where museums don't capture short attention spans. Decent transit access from central Lisbon, but a bit of a walk from the architecturally bold Oriente station and Vasco Da Gama shopping centre (10 min +). The rest of this newer waterfront neighbourhood (formerly a world Expo project) is a bit bleak.
fantastic !. Otters, Puffins, Skates, Rays, Sharks, Penguins. Do you need anymore than this in beautiful Lisbon ?
oceans. such an easy way to learn about the oceans and all the variety of life within it. saw fish i had never heard of before and will recall that this museum is where i first saw them.
Worth a visit. Very well laid out, huge central tank, loved the sea otters, allow at least an hour and a half to enjoy at a leisurely pace

Best Oceanarium in Europe. We had been told by friends who live in Lisbon that the Oceanario de Lisboa was the best in Europe, but we were skeptical. We live in Chicago and the Shedd is world class. Well, so is this facility. The facility is beautifully situated near the coast. The tanks are huge and have a fantastic selection of aquatic creatures. It was fascinating watching the staff call the penguins by name to feed them. All of the displays are in English and Portuguese making this facility very user-friendly for tourists. A must see.
So beautiful!. Never been on an oceanarium, iit was a first to me. Such a place, so beautiful and peaceful... already recommend it to all my friends! A must see in Lisbon, it’s a go, go, go

Don't miss out on the wild jellies!. We visited on a Saturday in Mid October. The admission price was 16 Euros each. There was no line to get in and it wasn't very crowded which made it a much better experience. Just head toward the ocean from the Oriente train station and you can't miss it. The walk over to the aquarium was amazing as along the waterfront you could see groups of fish as well as huge, mutant, jellyfish everywhere. As far as we know it had nothing to do with the aquarium, they were just floating in the water wild. Once inside everything revolves around a giant central tank, so if the window you are trying to look through is crowded just take a few steps over and there will be another window for viewing. There were a lot of amazing fish in the tank but the giant sunfish was the craziest. They also had penguins, puffins, and sea otters in separate exhibits. Plan at least 2 to 3 hours for a visit.

Theme Oceanarium. Big Oceanarium (first acquarium in Europe) created with the concept of rapresenting five oceans of the world and their ecosystem. Very beautiful for the eye but also for the mind as you can learn lots of things about fauna and flora of our oceans at a reasonable price. Especially good for children.When I went there there was also a temporary turtle exhibition which was worth to visit.
Stunning!. Well-conceived structure, the 13-euro price for the normal ticket is worth the visit. Don't miss it, especially if you travel with kids!

Finest fish viewing. We were very keen to see this aquarium as it had such a good write up. It really is amazing the way it has been set up to appear as a single unit when there are several different parts to it. The penguins, sea otters and small coral fish displays also added to a great day out. Standing on the lower floor at the base of the huge glass windows is awesome.

Really interesting place to visit. I have been to other Aquariums and I did't expect it to be anything special than some fishes in big fish tanks, but it really turned up to be a very interesting place. You will see the wild life in the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian as you are on the cost and underwater, or just sit in front of the huge main tank were you can chill and watch the fishes. You should go and see it by yourself I am sure that you wont regret.

For children and teenagers, a must in Lisbon. If you travel with children or young teenagers, this can be a highlight of your trip. Versatile ocean's creatures are presented here in a small and well-organized place. It's definitely worth to put 3-4 hours for this activity. The level and depth of provided info are good, and watching sunfishes, several types of sharks and devil fishes (amongst others), swimming in one large tank is really astonishing (if it's your first time).

Nice surprise. Didn't know what to expect when going, but was really glad I ventured here. The building itself is unique, but the surprise is when you walk in. There is a HUGE tank in the middle of the building with a variety of fish. Then as you walk around the, on two different floors, you get so see some great wildlife including puffins and penguins. Take metro over there, well worth it.

Extremely informative experience. Excellent. Some parts quite dark and a lot of people just take pictures and move onto the next thing without reading anything. Sea turtles exhibition was fascinating. There are a lot of children running around and the occasional ignorant tourist taking pictures with flash (not allowed) but you can't fault Oceanário for that. Overall a brilliant experience that was really informative

Basic Oceanario. Oceanario was good but not great one if you have seen many of those. Best parts of the Oceanario was the giant turtle exhibition. it was truly great and interesting! Could have been more of that. Other parts of the oceanario was also good, but we got a little bit bored... Good place to visit with children. A bit too expensive tickets for my point of view.

Really Zen Experience. We stayed in the Parque das Nações area and had a couple of hours of free time. We decided to walk along the waterfront and then take the gondola to the Oceanario. We were going to spend a hour maybe too at the aquarium but it draws you in. It's so large with so many different types of fish. I couldn't help but think how much my nephews would have enjoyed going. As two adults the aquarium is really amazing and completely worth going to. It was so relaxing and I think had I been more jetlagged I could have fallen asleep watching the fish.One of the more amazing thing was the constant reminder of conservation of both the ocean and the fish who live there. Considering the overfishing, particularly cod, it was great to see the education about the impacts of not being conscience of what we are doing to our oceans. Only drawback is that it's a bit out of the way but I think worth the metro ride.
Oceanario of Lisbon. Very nice, we don't have kids but went anyways, and I'm lad we did......very nice....it's the third biggest in Europe
THE SEA LINKS US ALL. The "Oceanario de Lisboa" is a cited example of showing that the sea links us all.This attracts childred and adults alike.
Oceanario. i have been to other aquarium. this one was average as the number of species were limited. ofcurse we did not have much time so had to leave soon,
Great attraction!. We enjoyed it as much as our 5 year old daughter. Impressive facilities with a broad collection of species.

Oceanarium in lisbon. great for when you need a break from the sun or the rain. Both for adults and children couples friends or on your own. This oceanarium is very well run and has an amazing selection of fish etc.... including penguins puffin and otters. the downstairs has many varieties of sea creatures. the huge glass window on the central tanks are perfect for viewing with sitting areas that you can stay and imagine you are under the water HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

If you like aquariums this is the one to visit. You need at least 2 hours if you want to see all the exhibits. The size of the main tank is amazing. The way it was done ocean by ocean was really clever.

Amazing experience.. Really worth spending a few hours in this "Ocenario". It is divided into the different seas, so you get the opportunity to see all kinds of fish, big turtles etc. An enormous center basin makes it possible to see sharks, the sunfish and many other fish from all angles.Really to be recommended!

The immensity of the sea in a tank. It's easy to get there using the subway and passing through Vasco de Gamma mall.Tickets were not expensive (16 euros) which included the temporary exposition that during our visit was all aboout turtles.We were able to see a big variety of fish and marine species in this very modern facility.The staff was very kind and happy to help. Within the building you have a very nice view of the oceanThis visit is a must, specially if you have kids, you can also enjoy a nice not-expensive food at the Restaurant inside.
Hungry?. Eat before you go! Choice of food poor and it was lukewarm at best.They had no headsets therefore we missed lots of info.

Wow factor. Visiting from the UK and experiencing our own Aquariums, it was really a case of we really didn't know what to expect. We stayed in Lisbon and got the Metro out, it cost a mere 1.40 euros one way. The cost to get in was 16 euros, what we expected. You can of course get discounts if you take a yellow bus tour etc but we didn't do that. From the moment of walking in we were in total amazement. I would agree with a previous review, the aquarium is set out wonderfully, all based around the huge, and I really mean huge tank in the middle. The centre tank has such a diverse selection of fish, you have a Mola Mola, manta ray, hovering barracuda etc. The exhibits outside of the tank include the penguin area, which had so many nooks and crannies for them and real ice. The favourite exhibit for me, purely for the cuteness sake has to be the sea otters, adorable is the only way you can describe them. When we saw them they were just chilling as they do. However, when you go on the lower level, you get to see them playing under water, just fantastic.We spent a couple of hours at least at the aquarium, and could have gone around again. Included within the 16 euros fee was the temporary exhibit of sea turtles, again totally awesome and well worth of the extra 3 euros. We didn't have children with us but still enjoyed it immensely. If you are in Lisbon, we would highly recommend a trip out to this wonderful place.
Impressive aquarium. THe aquarium was a perfect activity when travelng with a baby. Super fun for adults, too. It was also nice to take the bus from Bairro Alto and see the different neighborhoods

Best oceanarium ever. Spent the best part of 4 hours looking around the oceanarium - it was the best 4 hours ever spent. I took my hubby to Lisbon for his 50th Birthday and this was on our to do list. I wasn't that keen as I've been to the Blue Planet in Wirral and wasn't impressed. Boy was I impressed with this one - absolutely fabulous. Lovely helpful staff too. The Sea otters - 3 of them - were soooo cute! Sharks, rays and all kinds of sea going 'fish' in the biggest tank I've ever seen. Loads of 'bite sized' reading material and it was in English as well as Portugese. Really informative and educational. If you do nothing else - do this. There was also a temporary exhibition of Sea Turtles - think they were sick or injured and they were being brought back to health and then were to be released - well worth the extra few euros. The whole attraction cost less than 20 Euro each (including the turtles)

Excellent for all the family. This is a little way from the metro but it's a great walk and you can go through the shopping centre.The aquarium is set out really well with a large focal around the gigantic tank in the middle of the building, standing up cloche to the glass makes you feel underwater with all the amazing creatures.There are loads of additional tanks and climate areas with penguins etc that are a delight to see playing around. This is definitely one of the best aquariums I have ever been too and I highly recommend for all ages.

Nice Acquarium, but if you've seen one, you've seen them all. The Acquarium is well done, that's for sure. But I've seen the one in Barcelona, in Genova, in Mallorca, in Bangkok (which, by the way, all claim to be the best and the biggest!!)...they're all the same. So my suggestion is: don't go if you've already been to other "top ones". There's nothing new here. And in any case, I still can't help but feel sorry for those fish who swim in circles day after day...

Oceanario de Lisboa well worth a visit. We visited the oceanarium in Lisbon two weeks ago. It is a fascinatingplace, where there is every kind of sea life from sea dragons to a shark.It is very well laid out with one main huge tank and various other smallertanks containing a vast amount of fish and corals. There are even areas for Indian ocean, australia etc and also cute otters and penguins. In the temporary exhibition area we were lucky to see a turtle amongst other sea creatures.We spend a very happy two and half hours there. There is also a short film on the workings of the oceanarium, which is very interesting. When you are tired from walking around there is a cafe on site which is a little pricey. The cost of visiting the oceanarium is 16 euro per adult which includes the temporary exhibition area(worth the extra few euro). Childrens tickets are 11 euro. This is somewhere that people of all ages can enjoy. It is truly an unfogetable experience and has to be one of the best oceanariums in europe. Also the area in which it is build is interesting as it is where expo 98 was held and there are lots of modern glass and steel buildings and a small marina there.The Vasco De Gama bridge is nearby and it an incredible feat of engineering. One of our party has a disability and there were very helpful staff on site who approached us and showed us to the various lifts/elevators for the different levels. Jim/Mary Moloney (Ireland)
Excellent. Very well designed aquarium! Worth a visit to spend a great day. Nice to bring family and children. Loved the otters... :-)

Second largest aquarium in the world - what's not to like?. We have been to several aquariums in the world, including the excellent one in Seattle, but this tops them all. It's a bit of a walk from the Oriente station on the Red line, but well worth it. It's on the site of a 1998 world exhibition, and there are lots of other museums and attractions in the area, but this should be your main focus. The main tank is amazing - you can get mesmerized just watching all the various fish swim by. There are also four side tanks in environments that represent the North Atlantic coast, Antarctica, Pacific Ocean, and the Indian Ocean. In these environments, you can find penguins and sea otters and several types of sea birds. The exhibit tanks on the lower level show you all sorts of exotic ocean species. If you get hungry, the small restaurant serves nice lunches for a very reasonable price.

One of the largest aquariums going. The whole expo site is very impressive as is the modern building that houses the aquarium. Having seen quite a few of these around the world this has to have one of the largest. Very impressive and a thoroughly enjoyable few hours.

Beautiful and educative place. It's an amazing place for people who love the seas, nature and animals. Very well organized, great instalations. Good for kids and adults.
Additionally, it often has some different activities like some night visits or pajama parties for kids. It is a bit costy, but it's worth the visit.
Great. Lots of animals U never see if U dont go terem só enjoy the experiente ehehhe the sharks are unbelieveble, i Love them lol

A must see. Definitely worth a visit! Kids did love the big tank with all the different fish. Every corner a new view... need to consider sufficient amount of time for the visit.
Exhibition on sea turtles provided great views and - as everywhere loads of information (both PT and EN)

Great visit. A nice place to visit in Lisbon!!
The Oceanario give us an idea how is the sea life in different oceans!
I do recommend this visit!!

Beautiful. Take 2,5 hour to see this spectacular undewater world.
Even better than the real thing in Bali, Thailand or Egypt.

Great aquarium. The aquarium is located in orient about 15 minutes west of lisbon central. It is easy to get there by bus or train which stops at the vasco de gama shopping centre. We went when the turtle exhibition was on and it was fantastic. The huge turtles were magnificent. The aquarium is understated with its quiet dark background, which made the experience even more sensory. Really well worth the 13 euros we paid and highly recommended.

Excellent aquarium - well worth a visit. Truly awesome aquarium. I have not seen anything as impressive. I do worry a little over whether having the number of fish that they have is OK, however, from a viewing perspective, it is spectacular. I felt the admission price was good value for money. If you visit do ensure that you have a camera that can take decent pictures without flash assistance. Visiting in September, the area around the Aquarium looked relatively dead. It looked like there was not much else to do, however, this is an attraction that is worth at least a couple of hours spent going around.
Great place. It was the first time our kids went to a place like this.It was a great experiece for them and for us.We love to see them so amazed.The place was great.

...not quite.... Perhaps it was the many school class groups that detracted somewhat - I had anticipated more from reading the Publicity...it was essentially one very large Aquarium that could be viewed from many sides. A visit with fewer noisy groups would probably improve the experience.

Awesome. We went there with a group of 6 guys. Even if you're not a child this Oceanoario is an awesome attraction to visit. The huge aquarium with plenty of different kind of fish is beautiful to watch. You can just sit there and watch for more than an hour. I would definitely recommend to visit this attraction. Try to combine it with the whole Parque das Nacoes and shopping center. There is enough to see, sit down, relax, eat, drink, etc. By taxi it will cost you 10,00/12,50 euro. Departing from the city center.

Turtles my favourites. I visited the oceanarium more or less for the turtles and when I saw that it's just one section for them... I was a little bit disappointed as the ticket is a little bit expensive for what they offer.

You should go. you will love the sea otters, also they have several sea turtles that had been rescued from the ocean worth to see. In the big tank you can see sharks and rays along barracudas just like if they are in the ocean.
Good way to spent a few hours. An enjoyable way to while a few hours. Well divided out into 4 separate ocean habitats with a huge variety of sealife.

Terrific Aquarium. This famous aquarium is well laid-out and informative. It surely is one of the world's great aquariums. We have seen puffins in the wild, and the puffin exhibit in the Oceanaario almost looks like the real habitat. The temporary exhibit was devoted to sea turles, and was designed to make it an intriguing exploration. Clearly not just for kids.Also it is easy to get to from the metro, and is in a very intersting location in Lisbon.

An incursion into the sea life of the all our erathly seas. Amazing aquarium. Really worth seeing it. It is located in the new district of Lisboa with great new architecture viewing Vasco da Gama bridge.
Fabulous Aquarium. This is a must. Arrive early to avoid crowds. Everything is amazingly presented. Great turtle exhibit...rescue turtles.
A good diversion for a half day trip. A very very good facility... well worth a a visit .The otter exhibit is especially appealing.Turtle exhibit was a little extra in cost but well worth doing.
Excellent !!!!!. Excellent day out, really enjoyed the 4 different areas. A must see for everyone who goes to Lisbon.
Awesome!. So awesome! You have to visit it. We visited the temporary exhibition as well - they had turtels and tropical fish, it was sooo cool. You feel like you're really in the ocean :)
An incredible place !. One of the most amazing places I visited. The aquarium visit on two levels. above, with land animals ... and below. Find sharks, beautiful fish ... and otters :)

A Lisbon Exlibris. If you have time, it is worth a visit! Specially if you have kids. It is expensive though!!
Don't stay in the cue, use the automatic lanes for buying tickets, they are not for online pickups...

Brilliant day with the kids. The Oceanario is located in this beautiful and spacious area which meant walking there from the Metro was part of the day out.
The only problem we found was that there were too many adults (probably all the kids back to school) who weren't particularly kind to let the kids in front to see.
September 2013. The best of its kind I've ever been to. Emphasis on conservation and concern for ecology. Spectacular!

Great for all ages!. Absolutely beautiful aquarium! Well laid out and informative - spent the entire afternoon there. Staff were great and even though it's a little pricey we found it well worth the visit. Will go back again just to see the gigantic tank in the centre!
Worth to see!. Very interesting, worth to see. It has a huge area in a building with some place to walk nearby, don't miss if you go to Lisbon!

Biggest fish tank I've ever seen!. Well worth a visit. I'm no Aquarian geek but it was very interesting to see. Also if you get up here there are great views of the bridge and also a pleasant stroll along the river front.

superb experience. i had my tickets bought before arriving in lisbon because this was the one attraction i could not miss. there is not much to be said, all the reviews highlight how beautiful, interesting, educative this place is. for sure you should make time to visit it, i think 2 hours are enough to make the tour while taking photos and admiring the tanks.it's easy to get here with the metro and only 10 min walk distance from the metro station. if you want to buy the tickets from the internet you will pay an extra 2E i think per ticket. when i went there ( around 20th of august) there was only a small crowd waiting to buy tickets.also there was a temporary exhibition with sea turtles, very beautiful again. near the oceanario you can also see the longest bridge in europe, vasco da game bridge, and you can make some shopping at casco da gama shopping center - right next to the metro station, so you can give this place of lisbon half a day of your trip
Oceanarium a must see. Superb and value for money. we spent a happy few hours amongst the varied exhibits. a superb facility, well done Lisbon
Worth the trip. Great experience with lots to see. The area could do with some more good restaurants close to the aquarium. Bit of a trip from the city centre but worth it.

Probably the best in the world. Superlatives are accurate for this aquarium. It is fantastic with a breathtaking collection of creatures that live in the seas. The displays are fantastic. One could spend hours here. It is a real treat and next to the large shopping center Vasco De Gamma.

Fabulous oceanariums and interesting modern architecture. Not cheap to enter but hours of entertainment and great metro and shopping centre designed by Calatrava and the amazing Vasco da gama bridge . Took the cable car one way which was fun. Fair amount of walking but well worth the trip .

Best oceanario in Europe. It's huge, spacious and air conditioned. Clean aquariums. We've seen a lot of different species of fish, turtles, shellfish and marine animals. You need at least two hours to see everything.
Amazing tour. This is a great place to be in Lisboa. The main aquarium is fantastic, full of maritime life and colours. Cost is a bit high, but it is worth every cent.

Big tanks, lots of fish etc., great building, cool area. Have not been to many aquariums so was impressed. Some big tanks with lots of fish and things (sharks, manta rays) swimming around together. That was different and neat for me. Also some nice outdoor areas with pools for penguins, cute sea otters and so on. The area of the aquarium is very modern, very neat architecture, so enjoyed that as well.
Oceanarium. Average exhibits. Skip the turtles and extra charge, and the snack bar. Plus it us a fair distance to the metro stop

Nice day in the modern part of Lisboa. The Ocenario is located in the newer east part of Lisboa in Parque das Nações, which was build in 1998 for the world expo. It's the world second largest aquarium with lots of different fish and animals. It's interesting for everybody and entrance costst €16 for the permanent and temporary exhibition, for just the permanent you pay €13. The temporary exhibition was with big turtles when we were there, it was very special to see them so up close. At the end of the tour there is a video about how the Oceanario is maintained. They are very orientated towards saving the oceans in the world.

Stunning!. Different of everything, this place is stunning! With uncountable water species, including even frogs or penguins, you will discover all the oceans, rocks and forest, full of animals at inches from your face! To children: a dream; to adults: a realized dream! :)

Very good aquarium. It's a relatively big aquarium, which Means there's a lot of room for the animals, and is designed, so that one walks around and can see the various fish, sharks etc. swim around in a natural way, which is a nice experience. There's also a little play/learning area for minor children, which is a good extra feature, when you happen to have small children with you (as I did). The queue for the entrance however was (very) much to slow, i guess it means it's popular, however that's not a nice part of the experience. It's easy to get there with the Metro and the entrance fee seems reasonable. It's definitely worth a visit.
Very interesting and enjoyable. Nice and interesting for all ages beautifully designed Very good size , everybody liked it from the ages 7-75
Fishy Heaven. This is set out very well, great selection of ocean life on display. Its also very close to the cable cars, and it is a lovely trip.
Great place to visit. Very interesting half day visit. Nothing like Sea World in USA but never-the-less worth a visit. Went there in May 2013.

Great Family Attraction. The centrepiece is a huge 'natural' tank with a variety of free-swimming ocean fish and clear views from a number of different viewing areas. The temporary exhibition was ''Sea Turtles: The Journey", with a number of rescued turtles, which was informative and interesting, but crowded and in a dark environment which might have made it difficult for those with poor eyesight or mobility. Other areas contained tropical fish, penguins, sea otters and more. Bit expensive for a family of four at 54 Euros including the temporary exhibition though. Out of the centre of Lisbon, on the bright, open waterfront at Oriente [red line Metro] that's worth a visit on its own. Plenty of food and drink outlets and a big modern shopping mall.

Too far from down town and awful outside perforamnce. The oceanario is not so bad, OK to "kill time", but if you have limit time in Lisbon don't even bother to go there, we spent more time to get there and get out from that area, absolutely terrible way there (dirty areas with full of construction garbage, old houses, and old industrial factories. Everything kills your vacation filling even before you get to oceanario.A lot of free space around the complex, so much space with empty interlocking squares I never saw in my life, everything just like 50 years back as somebody forgot about this part of the city.Inside the oceanario you will find nice small pools in a 2 levels, in a hour and half you will be ready to leave the space even if you will read every sign.Not recommended! Find more positive views in downtown, maybe some shows, maybe some theatre, maybe museum but don't kill you half od the day for this very far, not so big ceanario. Price were 16Euro per person, I wish to spend our 50 we spent on something more interesting and more educated, especially when you get there from 10,000km away for couple days in Lisbon
The Best!. It is an excellent opportunity to see fish and marine fauna from very close. Best transportation: subway red line station parque das Nacoes, and then, walking distance. You must see it!

Waow!. We had a great time watching a large selection of sharks, rays, fishes, 3 lovely marine otters and so on... we were able to learn a lot about them while having fun! fantastic place for kids and grown ups.
Awesome. Vast, well-curated and brilliant. Go! They have a huge manta ray and a sunfish, both of which were amazing to see in real life.

Unforgetable experience. Lisboa has interesting contrasts,classic,historical and in oposit side,surprising modern.The Oceanarium located at Parque das Naçoes,is the biggest we had ever seen.Me and my daughters went there once and will return again,because it's an exciting experience,Modern buildings,wonderful locations,huge aquariums,hundreds of marines flora and fauna,beautiful tropical fishes,sharks,penguins,etc.You'll have typical Oceans nature lives,a great auditorium,restaurant,and everything good for tourists of all ages.
AMAZING!. Truly one of the best things to do in Lisbon. Start right next to the tank on the lower floor and you could be scuba diving.
Amazing. You should not miss this if you visit the city. Aquarium is huge and there are many marine species.I enjoyed as a child!

One of the best places to visit. It's like a fast-track input of amazing data. It takes you in the middle of a live documentary.Amazing experience both for adults and kids.Definitely a must visit in Lisbon.
A unique experience. It is an excellent opportunity to see fish and marine fauna from very close. The colours are bright and the experience is unique. You must see it!

Great!!! One of the best, worldwide. Impressive in all aspects, the oceanariums worth a visit not only due to the aquarium, but clearly due to the overall experience. Located at Parque das Nacoes (formerly EXPO98), this attraction is at the new Lisboa area, where you can explore also the outdoors. Don't hesitate. Best transportation: subway red line station parque das Nacoes, and then, walking distance.

Worth a visit. We were very impressed with this aquarium very large and the animals were adorable. However I wouldn't bother paying the extra 3 euros for the turtles exhibit this part was disappointing.
Cool place in Lisboa. Fantastic, lovely sea animals had a nice 2 hours at the aquariums. If you visit Lisbon, dont hesitate!

Great aquarium! Kids will love it!!. The entire aquarium is beautiful and built on the water. There were so many different types of sea life here. Things I had never even heard off!! Just a really fun experience!
Lots of everything. Was fantastic. have a various range of sea animals Love the otters. could walk all around and loved seeing the massive tank with the rays and sharks
Really nice. Oneof the largest and most beautiful acquariums in the entire world. It is really a must go, even if you are not with children.

Must see in Lisbon. Great attraction, easy to get to by bus, train, car or hop-on-hop-off (at Oriente transport hub).
The second largest facility of its kind in Europe offers quite an entertainment with large water tanks and great variety of species.
Totally recommended, try to avoid the week-ends, quite crowded.

Interesting visit. I visited with my husband and two teenage boys. After a week in Porto (visiting many churches and castles) and a few days of Lisbon sightseeing, it was a nice change of pace. We all appreciated the aquarium. There was a special exhibit on turtles at the time of the visit. We found it a bit expensive but we did not have regrets.

Far better than expected. Ever since I was a kid I was obsessed with animals of almost every kind, I re-watched my Survival VHS-es who knows how many times and there's still a bit of that fascinated kid in me when it comes to nature. Anyway, this is exactly why I was so impressed with both the number of species present at the Oceanario and with the overall organization of the tour. To sum it all up - simply beautiful and hypnotizing.

Simply great. This is the largest, and up to now by far the best aquarium I have ever visited, the main tank houses most probably everything bar whales, and the penguin section is amazing as well.
A must visit if you are in Lisbon.

great for kids and adults. An amazing experience, we also got to see a temporary turtle exhibition. The aquarium has two levels and while you get to see different environments, you revolve around this huge tank in which you can see sharks, stingrays and different species of fish. From there, you can go on a nice, but slightly long walk to the Vasco da Gama Tower and Bridge, along the Tagus/Tejo River. Then you can go inside the Vasco da Gama Shopping Centre, which is also really close to the train and metro station.

An Oceanarium at a level of the best ones in the world. Near da Expo – Parque das Nações you can pick the underground and visit this well conceived and wonderful place – dedicated for all that like the sea and its species. A very big variety in a very big tank all in glass you can nearly touch the water and species like e.g. a shark. After the visit you have restaurants and others attractions nearby

a bit overpriced. It is a big facility, it it has a huge aquarium all around, so whatever you are seeing, you always get that big aquarium with sharks, sintgrays, cod,...It had a temporary turtles aquarium, and they were huge and lovely.But the price was very steep for about 2 hours worth.The area, former Expo, is great. you have the sea all around, you have the science museum, the telepheric and a big shopping centre, Vasco da Gama.

World class!. We were so impressed with this aquarium. We live in California near the Monterey Bay Aquarium and didn't expect it to compare; we were wrong! This is an excellent experience for people of all ages, and the price for entry is far below what we would expect to pay. Don't miss it!

Your Average Aquarium. The Lisbon Oceanario was all right. It wasn't anything to write home about and is probably among the least memorable things I did while in Lisbon. It's situated in a lovely spot right on the water and is easy to get to on the metro, though a bit of a journey depending on where you are staying. I imagine if I had kids this would probably be way higher on my list of things to see. Families with children running around everywhere were definitely the key visitors. It was a little much for me, personally. Maybe I missed it, but other than a running special exhibit, I didn't see any cool shows or talks offered, which is something I usually look forward to at aquariums. Sure, I probably wouldn't have understood most of the narration, but I'll take a good dolphin or beluga whale show anytime.Overall, a neat spot if you're interested in marine life, but not the above-average aquarium it's hyped up to be. Unless you have kids, I wouldn't put it high on the list.

The second biggest aquarium in Europe. According to the official website, this is the second biggest aquarium in Europe. Having seen the Biodome in Montreal/Quebec, we found the Oceanarium a bit smaller, but nevertheless quite interesting.It is amazing to see so may species of fish swimming in front of you and I think that the children are the most delighted.
Amazing. Excelent instalations and great diversity of animal species. Very bad quality food in the Restaurante Tejo.
Very interesting and educative. Amazing place with a lots of information about the oceans, and the central aquarium is breathtaking.

The Sea Life Centre in Birmingham UK was better!!. Our family consisted of a 4 year old up to a 73 year old and 8 others in the middle!! We were captivated for around 3 hours watching sting rays, penguins, the beautiful turtles and a large variety of fish and sea life! However, it was strange walking over the glass floor with the sea life swimming underneath, but I have visited the sea life centre in Birmingham and I must admit the tunnels they have there with the marine life swimming around and above you, was more spectacular!!

amazing aquarium. Some unusual fish in the main tank such as a manta ray and a huge sunfish. The aquarium is very well organized and maintained. A absolute must-visit, even for those not into sealife! And the otters are just too cute....

Worth a day out here. We went by bus to the Parque das Nações and then back by metro to get the full experience. Lots of walking and good site to visit.
