There is walk to the cable car and on the way all the flags of the world are flying with notes on the posts with a brief history. Cable is worth it for the view of the bridge but we were unlucky it was a misty day. Good food court as well
Great for kids of all ages. It was very crowded when I went so go early. I have seen many oceanariums so wasn't overawed, except for the otters which were fantastic, and the weird sun fish.

Very attractive. I visited Oceanario with my family though personally I am nt a great fan of underworld but I enjoyed the visit and learned a lot.Design of building is interesting and there is enough info in English to understand all areas.Great fun for family and kids. Go for it!
Aquarium. very entertaining evening at aquarium, lots to see there, puffins and otters were my favourite! water turtles are huge, lots of colourful fish and weird and wonderful ones as well!
Nice experience. It is the closest you can get to scuba diving with your clothes on :) the enormous tank in the middle is impressive and the number and type of fish in it is also great.
Fabulous collection. A wonderful visit. It was rather expensive at 16 € but great fun. Everyone loved the sea otters and the sun fish is one of the weirdest creatures you'll ever see.
A Must. This is a must for anyone visiting Lisbon, It is a truly wonderful experience and welll worth the money.
Pretty cool, but long!. Really interesting, and a huge amount of fish and aqua life to see, but it was quite long. Loved the sea otters!!
Well done - full of kids. Well presented (all in English & Portuguese) and good displays. Great for kids. Not as good as Monterey Bay, but probably best in Europe.

Great way to spend a hot afternoon. Well laid out aquarium, situated around a massive underwater tank, featuring sharks and so many other types of fish that I forget. Lots of small nooks and crannies in between with plant life, amphibians and other smaller types of fish to interest and entertain. The penguins are great entertainment too.
Great place. This is without doubt the best aquarium we have ever visited . Every thing is well set out & lots of information . If visiting Lisbon with children this is a must

Well worth a visit. Well stocked with excellent variety of fish. Very clear tanks and ample windows to avoid feeling overcrowded.
Food in restaurant was good for this type of location.

Must see this attraction in Lisbon. The Oceanario is located at Expo. Expo is very nice to walk, near de river, with a lot of restaurants around, so going do Oceanario and around, you can be busy all day.
Oceanario has a lot of attrancations, a big aquarium that you can enjoy sitting in various seats available.
I love it there.
Its a lovely experience.

Excelent. Is an amazing tour children love it ,also adults is a real, nice visit
like the varoius fish and the decoration ..

Must see attraction in Lisbon. I have seen Oceanario a couple of times with visiting friends. Both times, I have been impressed by the variety of the exhibitions, the quality of the facility and the knowledgeable staff. Don´t miss it.
Great experience. 3 words to describe it: beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. What a lovely experience we had in Oceanario, pure joy. Deserve a visit.
Great experience. A truly great aquariam! Beside the wide variety of animals, it has a large pool where you can see sharks, fishes and everything that means sea life. Totally worth the money!

Very interesting attraction. It is a little bit smaller than I've expected, but it is very interesting and relaxing to observe the see world. They have a large selection of animals and I would highly recommend this attraction.

A great attraction. A truly great aquarium. Particularly of note was the temporary exhibit - sea turtles, you can stand on a glass floor as they glide beneath you. In the main exhibit the sea otters were amazingly cute.

Not living up to it's price. I expected something more, definitely. There's a moderately large pool filled with sharks and fish in the center, and there are small aquariums and 4 "Atlantic ocean regions" parts, containing birds, otters and penguins, wich look like a zoo. I'ts not that bad in general, but for 13 - 16 euros I expected something more.
One of the best aquariums in the world!!. Very well designed, easy visiting even during rush time... Large selection of animals. very well maintained. To visit absolutely!!!
Remarkable. A must do! great experience. just loved it. enjoyed and would go there again. Definitely would recommend.
Very interesting. The Ocenario de Lisboa is a beautful place with interesting views, mainly to my grand children witch they had a great time

Excellent attraction for the whole family!. I've seen many aquaria around the world - but this one is beautiful, clean, huge, amazing, incredible.... The main aquarium is really deep and huge, sporting all manner of sharks, rays and fish! Really incredible... the whole facility is incredibly clean and neat. How they manage to get their sea otters (as I was told by my young son) to be so laid back and cute I will never know! Along with the REAL ICE/SNOW they manage to maintain in the penguin area .... I'm amazed. Fantastic day out - albeit a little pricey. Another thing - they had lots of well placed toilets throughout the exhibition - so somehow - everytime my little ones whined "mum... i want to go to toilet...." there was one! Spooky!We visited the temporary "turtles" exhibition - which was ok for me... can't say I saw a huge number of turtles... by that time i was a little "fished out"! Still - all incredible and well worth the visit.

Stunning oceanarium in Lisbon. The aquarium has many great exhibits and the main tank is huge! Watch sharks and giant turtles float by at your fingertips. We enjoyed meeting a gregarious octopus who was communicating and playing hide and seek with us. Located in the Park of Nations, on the edge of the Tagus River. Surrounded by restaurants and shopping.

Fantastic attraction. If you want something different than history, or arts, this is a perfect place. One huge central aquarium and many many smaller ones with everything from sea stars to penguins (the penguins rule, of course). Also a perfect place if you have kids.
One of the best in the world!. One of the best in the world, with an amazing selection of fish, frogs, sharks, and everything you can imagine.

Very impressive - a kid's paradise. A lovely collection of sea world creatures from all continents. Very interesting for kids although it was pretty crouded when we visited (August 2013). We saw some rare fish that had never seen before and the concept of a big central acquarium containig fish from all over the world was realy interesting. The gift shop has some very cute things for gifts back home.

Sharks, sharks... Beautiful sharks!. You have the main attraction which is the big water tank and some other tanks with penguins, tropical fish and otters. The main tank has beautiful animals, incluing several types of sharks, stingrays, manta rays and moonfish. My kids love going there and every time me go it's party time!Free entrance until 4 y.o.They have a temporary exhibit with sea turtles which is well worth the extra money! You can see these giant turtles swimming over your head and under your feet.Good time garantied!And the place where the aquarium is located has several places to eat, play and have fun!

Up close and personal .... It is a fabulous place to spend an afternoon. We, two adults and a 6yr old, spent about 3 hours at the Oceanarium and that was just about enough time for us. It's a little pricey; we paid 16$/adult and 11$/child(6yrs old). In addition, they cleverly MAKE you pass through the gift shop as you exit. Cheers :o)

Awesome!. The Oceanarium is by far the best place of this type I've ever been to. It's laid out over two floors around a huge central tank with lots of small and large windows, which means you don't all have to crowd around to get a view. There's also a few outside pools with various penguins and seabirds, which is a nice touch. There was quite a queue for tickets but we got to the ticket office very quickly and efficiently, and the queueing area is shaded. 13 Euro felt like very good value for the amount to see, and the gift shop was better than the usual tat you get at similar UK attractions. Definitely worth a visit.

Cool enough!. Went here on our day off. Hoping to see the "war man", but they didnt have any. The Sun fish was cool, though, and the penguins lazy. Worth a visit if in the area. And the queue is faster than you might think.
Visit Oceanario. An amazing attraction in the city of Lisboa. Certainly when in Lisboa pay a visit to this aqaurium. You will be amazed. The price is acceptable.

Excellent Aquarium. I have been to this very attractive aquarium with my 10yr old son and felt very different from other aquariums. Both temporary and permanent are good and gives knowledge about the life under sea. My son found amazing seeing the tiny Seahorse. I like the way they explained the documentary show which explains how they feed the sea animals and maintain the aquarium's environment. Worth to spend 3-4hours if you are planning to visit to Lisbon in 3days. If you have more time then spend a half day in the surrounding area.
The Aquarium. Amazing ! I saw every kind of marine animal on the planet. It was like being underwater. You have to go here if you are in Lisbon.
Well worth a visit. But the crowds made it a little less to excellent. The sea otters were brilliant! Good value for money though.

Nice Modern Aquarium. Highlighted by a large central tank that offered viewing from several different angles, this is good stop for families in the area. The facility does a nice job of providing the theappropriate balance of education and entertainment. As others have described, it is located in the updated section of Lisbon. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and

Excellent aquarium. Very nice aquarium. The layout is wonderful and there is so much to see. Not too crowded so we could see the exhibits close up. I went at the end of the day so I was too tired to enjoy everything. I wish I had more time to devote to it. I found it was a little bit far of a walk from the bus I took, but maybe I did not go the best way.

Outstanding!. This was probably the best oceanarium we have ever visited. Long queues to enter, 20 / 30 minutes on a busy Saturday. Not too crowded inside, audio guide also available which we didnt get. We spent two hours at the temporary turtle exhibit and the permanent exhibit. Amazing two storey central tank is worth it by itself. Lots of places to sit and observe the fish including sharks, devil fish and sunfish to name a few. Our young kids were enthralled, as were we. Educational and beautiful and they have a successful breeding programme so must be good for the animals too.

Fascinating tour through the world's marine environments. If you want to see a cross section of all the major marine environments in the world then this is it. The Oceanario de Lisboa is organised like the four corners of the earth, showing marine animals and plants from Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, and Antarctic environments. Arranged over two floors, the bottom floors show the world beneath the water line, with the top floor showing the animals that live by the sea. In the centre of the building is one of the most impressive fish tanks in the world, a giant space with a large selection and diverse array of species. As you walk around the building, you get glimpses into the huge tank giving you different and interesting perspectives, and a real appreciation for the undersea world that surrounds us. This is one of the best aquariums that I have visited.

A big and beautiful aquarium surprise in Lisbon. An incredible well maintained huge aquarium and a professionally run place in Europe.There is absolutely no necessity to go to any USA located aquarium.In the midst of the beautiful expo area in the incredible city of Lisbon.I would love to go back there. I will go there again.Really exciting for kids as well.

A bit too pricey. I read here all praises for this place so when I got there I was a bit disappointed (after reading the reviews my expectations got a bit high). The Oceanario is very nice, has a lot of different species but in my opinion the ticket price is a bit too high and that is the reason I didn't give it a 5, but a 4.If you have some extra cash it is worth a visit. You can find a 15% discount coupon on a city map that you get from the tourist bus offices (the yellow and red buses that do tourist tours around the city)

A beautiful aquarium. The Oceanium, located some distance from the city center (it is on the route of the hop-on-hop-off busses though) is a modern, beautiful aquarium, with multiple tanks in varying sizes. The main tank is huge, with an enormous selection of fish and other sea creatures. Initially picked to flee from the 40-degree heat, it proved a nice diversion from cultural Lisbon.

Amazing visit even with no kids!. Really enjoyed this trip to the aquarium, fascinating to see everything so close up & it seems massive! Loved the sea otters, giant turtles and little penguins, and just watching the sharks was captivating. We were a group of 4 adults in 20s and 30s and spent over 2 hours walking around it, could see how kids would love it too!
water temple. a must see, if you think you know the oceans... in parque das nações, the place were in 1998 the world expo on oceans took place, near the river and facing the huge estuary
fantastic!!!!. it was a fantastic experience to be in oceanario de lisboa!!there is a huge variety from all oceans..i would like to go back again and again!!

Best Aquarium ever!!!!!. This was a fantastic day out and really strongly recommended!Your hotel may have a 15% discount voucher to give you but otherwise a family ticket is between 34 - 42 Euros. We paid the higher fee and went to the additional temporary turtle exhibition - but you get the impression that it is permanent and the 'theme' changes regularly.The main aquarium is on two floors, built around a huge central tank. You enter on the top floor, are directed to follow large arrows to take your in an out of additional 'outdoor' exhibits.The central tank is huge and was filled with thousands of fish, too numerous to mention, but included vaious types of sharks and rays.The outdoor exhibits had sea birds, penguin puffins, sea otters as well as a tropical area. The lower floor had many other, smaller 'themed' tanks as well as educational and kids areas.The gift shop was good quality and the coffee shop was perfect to have a sit (rest) in afterwards with seats mainly outside looking at views of the bay and Vasco de Gama bridge.A truly great day - pre-trip i was a little reluctant thinking i would be wasting time going, but it turned out to be one of the trip highlights. don't miss it!

Nice place specially for children. It was nice to see that the 1998 Expo area has been kept well maintained. The oceanario, is quite large compared with other aquariums and it has a wide variety of specimens.

Amazing for all ages. And in any weather, so expect crowds and lines (and very excited children).Tip: if you buy tickets on site and you're a one-time visitor, go straight to the (right side) line to the automated ticket machines (very few people using it) - cash only, full price regular tickets only (I think it was EUR 15 for the regular exhibition and EUR 3 for the temporary turtles exhibition).If you want family tickets, or to pay using debit/credit cards, you might have a long line to the regular ("human") ticket booths.

Superb. I was so looking forward to visit this place and I wasnt disapointed. We especially loved the huge aquarium with sharks. But the cutest animal of all were sea otters!! We spent there all afternoon and it was a lot of fun.
Good aquarium. Pleasant place to visit. Fairly average by aquarium standards but good way to spend an hour or two. Main part is large central tank with sharks etc. Nice location by the sea.
Great for kids all ages. Lots of fishes, turtles, sharks in tanks stretched over several floors which makes the experience worthwhile a couple of hours inside.
Very boring. Not much value for money. Get's boring very quickly. Lisbon Zoo is 100 times better so go there instead.

A must in Lisbon. Beautiful selection of sea animals, well treated and kept in good conditions. The oceanarium contains a permanent and temporary exhibition ... at this time, beautiful sea turtles.
Good for adults and kids most of all.

Very crowded, expensive and overrated. In general, it was a nice little aquarium and I appreciate the effort made for building it. However, if you have been to other similar attractions such as the Monterey Bay Aquarium or the SeaWorld San Diego, there is no need to visit this place, too. It is small, expensive and extremely crowded when compared to the ones in the USA. Besides, this aquarium has really long queues and is full of nagging and whimpering kids. I could not enjoy it much. The gift shop at the exit was the only thing I really liked. Not recommended especially for people without kids.

Oceanario de Lisboa. The Oceanaria (Oceanario de Lisboa) takes you to the deepest world. I never thought I'd love it so much. Depending on what you want to see, you can buy the proper ticket and enter the museum. Dark hallway surrounded by huge aquariums allows you to witness the most interesting and different types of sea life. Fish, frogs, Penguins,...You can also find information boards or LCDs and read information or even listen to the sound of the ocean. A very interesting part is where you will see only sand, but if you pay closer attention you'll find the live creatures moving under the sand.Apart from the museum itself, I personally enjoyed the exterior part a lot. There is a big area in front of the main entrance with palm trees, dancing fountains, restaurants and playing facilities for children and also souvenir shops.If you are in Lisbon, do not lose the chance to experience the ocean :)

Nice. It was a nice oceanarium, and they did a great job. The aquariums were beautiful. And they had an open space for the penguins, sea otters, fish, starfish and a few birds. The birds were flying freely around. That was a nice experience. A lot of different fish-types together, like a real representation of how it would be in the ocean. However I wished it would be bigger.

It is big, beautiful and blue.. In the last 10 years I have visited 6 times. It is always a place I take the people to that visit Portugal with me. It is huge and since Portugals history is so connected to the ocean it even feels different to see the marine life from the different oceans. It is worth the money and the time. Take a good camera and a bit of patience and you'll get amazing pictures.

Fascinating. Visitting the Oceanario is a truly fascinating experience. It consists on a huge main tank full of several types of fish (including sharks), which can be watched for hours without getting bored; four other separate big tanks that represent the different oceans in the world; and many other smaller tanks with fish and animals from all over the world. The stars of the Oceanario are three cute sea otters, which swim around eating or cleaning themselves for the amusment and delightment of visitors. This aquarium is well worth the entrance fee (which isn't cheap), especially if you are travelling with children.

Special visit in rain or shine. There is so much to enjoy here with the marvelous main tank with portals at different levels, as well as the different ecosystems recreated under the domes - loved the sea otters! Although it might seem pricey, it proved to be very good value as the trip was so enjoyable.

I loved this place:). I am not that all big and aquariums and the like, but I really enjoyed this one. There was lots to see and loved the penguin area with the birds flying around. The glass walkway areas was pretty neat to walk and see huge turtles swimming about. It was nice to take ones time seeing all the exhibits and fish:)

Unforgettable Experience For All!. We were there as a family of 5 including my elderly mum. We all enjoyed this great aquarium representing the oceans. Really impressive and fun! It is a must-see if you are visiting Lisbon. This complex is located in the newly-developed part of Lisbon which I found really beautiful and modern. There is a huge shopping center at the back of this aquarium with huge food court. You can pop in there for refreshments and/or food. Highly recommended!
Very good. Very well assembled. Large tank with soo many fishes and more smaller tanks. Theme stage for every ocean with smells, climate, animals... Wonderful.

Magnificent!. Oceanario is advertised as an attraction for kids, but it is equally attractive to anybody, we loved it! It is big, extremely well organized, has fishes from four oceans. On the top of it you can watch a small colony of penguins, and funny trio of sea otters. Also the district there is great, with spectacular modern architecture, and fantastic view on a very, very long bridge. Buy ticket online, since the line there is very long.

relief from the sun!. We went here on the last day of our trip. My friend had 2 sprained ankles, so we wanted to get her a wheelchair. Staff asked us to furnish some sort of doctor note; since we were travelling, she did not go to a doctor. No wheelchair. When we got inside and saw how much walking was involved (her ankles were BAD), I asked another staff member if he could make an exception. After a couple minutes, and consultation with his manager, he agreed. Thank goodness.We spent a good two hours in the aquarium. The otters were probably my favorite. They were adorable, cracking open crabs against the rocks and rolling around in the water. Plenty of fish throughout.
Great Fun, Overpriced. It seemed a little too small for the price tag, but our two-year old had a ball there for about an hour.
Impressive. Different sub-regions recreated and explained.Turtle exhibitions was very interesting and you can see them from very close.

Very enjoyable visit. This place was truly amazing a "must do" when in Lisbon. My favourite part was the room with the full view of the aquarium it was very impressive! Aside from that it has a number of "habitats" which allow you to get very close to the animals which is quite unique - I haven't seen this anywhere else in the world. Also the variety of exhibits is huge.This place is great for families with children as well as adults. The adult price was EUR 16.Perhaps the only negative thing was a group of people taking photos with flash when we were told in 5 different languages not to use flash. If you visit the aquarium is worth seeing Lisbon from the cable car which is located only a few minutes walk from the aquarium within the same general area.Highly recommended.
Great for young children. We went to the aquarium to change our pace and all enjoyed it. Including the teenagers. Great for young children

A great place to visit on a hot day. Were looking for somewhere cool to escape the 40 degree heat so visited the Oceanario. Amazing variety of fish and marine creatures on display. Sea otters were mesmerising. Even though it is not a cheap visit at 16€ you will easily spend a couple of hours there. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Lisbon for more than a couple of days.
Outstanding!!. One of the best oceanarium on the planet. Amazing and extensive place with lots and lots of different habitats to see. A must do when in Lisboa.

fantastic. with children or not you have to see this oceanário! its the biggest aquarium in europe as far as I know it has a fantastic colection and a very pedagogic way of showing things. If you want you can manage for your children to sleep next to the biggest aquarium watching the sharks.its a fantastic experience

It's quite expensive, but it was worth it. There is a lot to see, and the windows are spotless so you really get a good views into all the aquariums. The also have several kinds of penguins and some loverly sea otters which were so cute! Come early if you go on the weekends - after 11h00 the queue can get enormous.
Amazing. It's a must see if you visit Lisboa. Very large and interesting for everyone. Kids will love it. Well designed for both adults and kids to see interesting fish and other water mammals.

All the oceans in the world at one place. This is a must. If you are in Lisbon, you must visit the Oceanário. This amazing aquarium has thousands of fishes swimming on the main water tank, from sharks to mantas.You can learn many great things about sea life. It is a fantastic place to go with children.

lots to see!. great set up, you feel like you are underwater with the fish. Really nice displays!For someone like me who can't swim and will never have the opportunity to feel this close to the underwater world, it was amazing!

Very crowded and expensive. Very big aquarium with a nice selection of species, but very, very full of families and school trips.. Go if you like aquariums, but it's about the most expensive attraction in Lisbon so if you're not that keen on fish and large crowds don't bother.

Worth visiting. Although not a top priority on my list of Lisbon attractions, Oceanario was nice to see. The whole embankment area is well kept, and from Oceanario you can take a lovely cable-car ride to the Myriad hotel.

Excellent tourist attraction. This was well worth the entrance fee although we forgot to produce our bus tour ticket to get the discount. Still worth it. Could have spent all day here. Amazing to see all that sea life under one roof but split into different ocean area's.

Well made (huge) aquarium. I went alone to kill some time and didn't regret it. Even though I'm a scuba diver, this still is nice to see. Now I finally have seen those rays, great white sharks and mola mola which I have never seen on dives yet. Especially suitable for children and also educational.The fish seem to act pretty natural (for as far as that's possible here) and it gives you a good idea about how life is down there.

Its not just fish. I'm not surprised this is rated as the top attraction in Lisbon, its really great. It is about 20 minutes from central Lisbon on the metro near the Oriente station on the red line that goes to the airport. From the metro you need to go through the shopping centre to get to the river front and then turn right and walk about 10 minutes. The entry fee is Euro16, (kids e11) there is a small reduction for students if you ask for it. There is an audioguide available (e2.50) which was OK.The cost includes the temporary exhibit, which is the sea turtles. I thought this was worth the extra few euro because you can actually sit below their tank or stand on top on a glass floor while they swim under your feetThe main exhibit is a massive central tank, with different zones at each corner of the building representing different areas of the world. These contain penguins and puffins and best of all, the sea otters, who were real entertainers.The main tank can be viewed from 2 floors, we sat on the floor at the bottom, and watched for ages, it was kind of hypnotic and soporific. There are lots of small tanks and displays and an activity area. In one of these tanks there were sea dragons which I never knew existed, and were brilliant, so fragile! We also found Nemo, look carefully for him.At the end was a video that was very good, showing how the aquarium is maintained and how each of the types of fish is fed its own individual diet. It is hard work maintaining something so big.It is well worth going out of the way to see this. The area around is attractive and modern and there is a nice walk along the river front or a cable car. There are lots of fast food family eating places in the big shopping centre nearby and some good shopping too.
Aquarium visit.. Sea otters very cute - well set out. Very similar to other large aquariums around the world - the kids enjoyed the break from ruins culture and the sun!

Simply the best. Really the best Oceanarium I had ever visited!!! Don`t miss it! Absolutely different compared with “Sea life” chain. Photos of previous reviewers give an excellent presentation. It seems to be more popular in the morning (our friends saw a great line near the booking office in the morning, but we had visited Oceanarium after 15.00, and there wasn`t any line at all), so probably the good idea is to go there after midday.

A great place to escape the Lisbon heat. This was our second visit here and was just as enjoyable. Very big central tank with large number of fish and penguins, otters and frogs in natural enviroments. One of the best we have seen.

Great aquarium!. The Oceanario is worth the rather pricey (13 EU pp) admission ticket. Nice displays and a huge central tank with many viewing windows so you can get close to the fish! All the information is presented in Portuguese and English. It is in a beautiful part of the city and there is a lovely boardwalk along the water for a stroll. There were several cafes along the waterfront and you can get a decent lunch at a good price.
Love the otters !. Great attraction if you wanna spend a couple hours with sea animals ! The penguins and otters are the best !

Great family outing. This is one of the largest, if not the largest, aquariums in Europe and well worth the visit. As I live near Lisbon I have been there more than once and always enjoy myself and think it is a great attraction especially if you have children. It is well organized with plenty of helpful information. It is also situated in a pleasant area where you can take a stroll after you are done. Do chose your day and time carefully as it can get crowded especially on weekends.

A place to visit. I went to Oceanario de Lisboa with my students two years ago and we had a great time! I recommend it to everyone who likes the sea. After your visit you can stroll along the surrounding area. Surely you'll have good time!

A must while in Lisbon. The Oceanario de Lisboa (you can take the metro, Red Line, drop off at Orient Station) is an amazing place to visit. Many "water species" , well arranged through out the place. And all of them with an understandable explanation for the non specialist person.For a worthwhile visit, do reserve, at least 3 hours and you will not regret.

Ok ...but expected something more. In general there is a one big aquarium with all most exciting fishes in the middle of the building with several very small aquariums around it. Kids liked it, but for adults without kids on a sunny day you probably can find some more interesting attractions. I liked the Zoo much better.

Close to nature!. I live quite next to it and I still feel amazed everytime I visit this place! And of course it is not only me, my little 3 year old dauther loves it even more than I do.A great tip for those who are planning this visit with plenty of time and if travelling with babies is to attend the babies concert. It happens every sunday morning, but since it is very limited space, it is always sold out. Just for the idea: I've just booked today two tickets for november 2013 concerts!...Enjoy!
Great Morning spent with the fish!. We had a lovely morning here and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Go at 10am to see the fish, birds otters etc. being fed. Woth going

Very nice place. It's a very interesting place in a very pleasant environment - near the river with many esplanades and restaurants -.The architecture of the building, the facilities and specially the quality of the aquarium makes a visit, a very good and pleasant option.
Worth visiting. It's a must-see attraction in Lisbon. It's a beautiful and educational place. It's very very clean and the staff is very friendly.

dive in!. The Oceanario is both; a magnificent architectural achievement and an astonishing family of sea animals, the exhibits are carefully designed and it is possible that you end up spending a couple of memorable hours in there. Have fun!

One of the best in the world. Very well located, and a fantastic, place to relax, and see wonderful, sea life. Many of the inhabitants, from all oceans, are absolutely, astonishing, and we can see, in a couple of hours, from all over the world, oceans, and learn, the phases, of tides, and oceans movements.

Interesting, fun for kids. This is a gigantic, modern, educational oceanarium right on the Tagus River in the renovated Expo 98 area. There are many things to do in Lisbon but if you want a relaxing break, specially for kids to enjoy go to the Expo area which is 10 minutes by taxi from Lisbon. There is a huge shopping mall close by and plenty of eating places.

Worth visiting!!! It will be an enchanting experience..... Beautifully set up, the Oceanario is worth a visit, be it for adults or children! The sea world exhibited is enchanting.....the whole place is spotelessly clean and the fish healthy and well looked after!

A wonderful place. Built as one of the main atractions of the Expo 98, it remains one of the must-see places in Lisbon. The whole area where it is planted is stunningly beautiful and worth a visit. As for the Oceanarium itself, its a journey into another dimension. The main tank is absolutely huge, featuring stingrays, barracudas, sunfish and a few diferente species of sharks, among schools of other fish. I could stay here and describe it from top to bottom but this is hardly the place to do that. Let's just say it has been there for the last 15 years and I went there every single one of them. And I don't just go there for my kids.

It is a wonderful place for everybody. Nice Aquarium with big tanks and many diferent species of fishes,including sharks,penguins ,turtles and otters.You can spend hours looking to them almost looking they are in their own habitat.I know they are very well cared and all is very clean and safe too (young children don´t have to be afraid to see the sharks and other big fishes so near through the great glass walls)

Nice place to visit. I´ve been there 4 times and loved all. This place was built for the 98 World Expo and is amazing. The central tank is worth to see. I suggest you try it there.Tickets are a bit expensive.

Beautifully situated. It's probably the best Aquarium in Europe. Situated by the river Tagus with a breathtaking view and near a sightseeing telepheric. Plenty of good restaurants and a shopping mall, close-by.

Those visiting on business or on vacation necessarily have to visit OCEANÁRIO DE LISBOA. Is an exhibition in which people of all ages love to be and can admire the time they want. For the harmony, peace and silence we feel there is an experience not to be missed. We can seat down next We can sit down together to the walls of glass and feel that we are at the bottom of the sea with all kinds of fish and sharks! The Oceanarium is located in an area of great beauty in Lisbon (Parque das Nações) surrounded by the river Tagus, near the Casino Lisboa, cabel car, gardens, a lot of restaurants, a marine and the Vasco da Gama shopping. The Metro station is the red line - Oriente- , the sighteseeing buses have a stop there.
Aquarium Expo98. Beautifully and for the children you have near the Science Pavilion. Some nights, you can sleep with the fish.
Really excellent and worth visiting. Really excellent and worth visiting, I go there whenever possible, particularly with kids of all ages.

A remarkable world sea life perspective. All surround area is quiet new, result of the ingenious recuperation of an old oil industry area into a 1998 world expo and after that in an extraordinary and nice residential area.

Oceanarium. A must ... entertainment for a good 2 hours with a huge tank full of fish including Manta Rays.The otters too are great fun.You can get there by Metro and there are lots of river-front restaurants all around.Mark C.
Oceanario. Really well presented, you walk amongst the fish which are in tanks at your side. A great experience for young and old.
One of the best in Europe. All kinds of species. It's one of the landmarks in Lisbon. A place to go.Giant central main tank with sharks and hundreds of species inside.

Take a seat on the floor, and relax watching the fish pass by. No matter if you are taking the kids, your grilfriend/boyfriend, or just by yourself, the aquarium is a fantastic place to walk around... and relax... seat down, and let the different kind of fishes amuse you while they pass by in their peaceful movements.

A special place for children. And also for sea creaures fans. Outside, the place is an amazing construction and inside we discover a beautiful world.
It's perfect for families, and the surroundings provide a unique day of entertainment.

Oceanário de Lisboa, each visit a new experience. We can spend a lot of time watching the fish. It's quite relaxing.
Don't go ther in a hurry, otherwise you will skip the detaills.
My nepheu love it.
The best it's to go at the sun peak, so you can watch all the museum in a fresh AC place.
After enjoy Parque das nações gardens.

Great for children and adults too!!. Oceanário its a great alternative to spent a nice couple of hours! The building is very well kept , and its a wonderfull way to see several kinds of fishes and other marine animals.It's also a good way to stay away of rain , cold or high temperatures because is covered.Sealions are always a sucess as for children or adults!
Oceanario. A great place to visit, very interesting for kids and adults. The Expo block, where Oceanario is located is very friendly.

Must-see attraction in Lisbon. Lisbon oceanarium is a must to visit: excellent exposition, everything well-presented, cute animals (especially otters and penguins), a relaxing experience when you're too hot on the beach. Children are also welcome!

A must if you visit with children. Lisbon has two aquariums: aquario Vasco da Gama (older) and Oceanario de Lisboa (the one I am reviewing now).Oceanario is a huge aquarium with lot's of different fishes and 4 different additional habitats - if you are in Lisbon with children you should definitely consider visiting Oceanario. Additionally, the area near Oceanario is quite nice. You should avoid the weekends though where it is somewhat crowded. Unfortunately aquario Vasco da Gama is somewhat run down and probably not worth a visit.

A real good dive in the sea. I know this oceanarium sine it opened and honnestly, I visited many times with a lot of visitors, and I can tell you, it always changed for better, one of the rare things whish is still working in this country! Views are nice, lovely animals , it is surprising, it is exceptional. Children are always enthusiastic, and elders are really happy: perfect family tour, do not say NO to your children!

Portuguese investment for life. Specially constructed for the World Expo 1998 the Oceanario is a must. When visiting Lisbon (or even other regions as in Portugal all distances are small) don't Forget to go. Even if you don't like "fish" , this achievement has part of the soul of Portugal. And a big investment.
great. great and wonderful.. tip: don't pay additional for the exhibition which is not always on (like turtles).. and minus- no dolphins :((

Excellent Aquarium. The exhibits here are very different from those at other aquariums: they're huge. The special exhibit that was happened at the time of our visit featured sea turtles which was very cool. There was a plexiglass floor where the fish and turtles would swim right below your feet! The regular exhibits were very good as well, the main tank is enormous and unlike anything I had seen before. It doesn't take too long to go through everything, approx. 1.5 hours but its definitely worth it!

excellent , very clean aquarium well kept with beautiful fish. beautifully built and kept, clean, healthy fish. They do a great job here, very professional. We also liked the otters and the penguins.It is a little way out of the centre but a taxi ride there costs something lijke only 5 euro
Fantastic.. You can get so close to all the fish in the tanks and many hours of enjoyment here. Never seen sea otters before and all t he exhibits are well looked after.

Very entertaining for our whole family to visit. Our family has been to many aquariums and this one would rank near the top with Chicago and a few other ones. We did not pay the extra fee for the temporary sea turtle exhibit since we've seen those at other aquariums. The sea otter and penguin exhibits were definitely the favorites-we got there at feeding time which was a huge benefit and very enjoyable to watch. Easy to get to, although a decent walk from the metro station. It was definitely a great way to spend an afternoon in Lisbon. Our 6 children range between 11-24 and everyone enjoyed it.

Worth visiting!. The exhibition is quite interesting, especially the temporary one - sea turtles at the time of my visit. You can walk on the glass floor and fish were right below your feet. There were many interactive games based on the exhibition. The main exhibition includes lovely, funny and playful otters (20 minutes is not enough to get tired of them), penguins as well as sharks, fish and other fauna divided by different oceans and habits.The location of Oceanarium is nice. You should spend some time wandering in the neighbourhood (oriente, expo). I would recommend that to anyone who likes nature.
Nice time with kids. Wonderful place. Nice attractions for family with kids. You can do it on your own pace. We took 2 hours to cover all the interesting spots.

wow. Amazing place, we've been to different aquariums all over europe but I think this one is the best I ever saw. It's the first time I've heard my brother saying that a place worth more then the price he paid

Bit expensive but worth it. The Oceanarium is in a great area of the city (near Oriente metro station) that is well worth a visit anyway. But even if you're not that big on fish I'd definitely pay it a visit. It's 16 euros to visit the permanent aquarium and the temporary exhibition (it was about sea turtles when we went but not sure how often that changes). You get at least an hour and a half wandering around, and there's a great range of animals, from tiny tropical fish to sea otters, octopus, penguins, and frogs. It's one of the most expensive things we did while in Lisbon but well worth a look.

Absolutely excellent. This is one of the most impressive aquariums we have visited. The tank is enormous and designed so that you walk round two levels - it feels vast. In between are some great side exhibits, such as sea otters (feeding time was so amusing, watching them float on their backs and expertly de-shell the prawns), penguins (separated from visitors by a glass rail, rather than a floor to ceiling glass barrier) and the temporary sea turtle exhibit. Around the acquarium is Parc de Nacoes, so it is worth spending an afternoon here.
Worth visiting. Very good place to visit while staying in Lisbon. Interesting and well kept, clean. It's interesting to see fish and other animals so close (for example sharks - whoo).
Super !. The title says it all... nothing more, nothing less.. (and I don't know more what to say because I have to fill up this 50 obligated characters)

Traveling with a Baby in Lisbon? This is a great place to visit!. My husband and I were in Lisbon on vacation with our 18-month old daughter and visited the Oceanario de Lisboa. It was fantastic. Our daughter loved the permanent exhibit and the temporary exhibit alike, and we spent about 2 hours there in total. I am sure we could have and would have spent longer if our daughter was a bit older, but we loved the time we did spend there. The layout of the Oceanario is well-designed, and it was easy to maneuver even with our large running stroller. A great benefit to the Oceanario is its location. It is located in a large, ocean-side park so there are lots of places for little people to run around and stretch their legs, and enjoy an ice cream cone. I would highly recommend this for families visiting Lisbon with children and babies.
outstanding place!. Great architecture. Fantastic surroundings. Nice people.All the oceans and climates represented and a huge central tank with sharks and lot more...Don't miss!

Excellent. Excellent ... our tour lasted about 2.5 hours ... I've been to many aquariums (eg South Africa in Durban), but this is Definitely one of the best ,if not the best in which I was. beautiful main tank that is accessible from all sides, choice of fish, penguins, a special exhibition with turtles .... definitely to recommend.
Nice place. Good program , specially if you have kids . Do it with time , to take the most of it . MAny species from different parts of the world

Impressive! A great day out for families!. My son loves to visit aquariums, and so we took one day out of our 3-day visit in Lisbon to fulfil his wish, so as to keep him sweet. It was great! It's one of the largest oceanariums in Europe, no doubt (only the aquarium in Palma , Majorca can contest) and we spent easily 4 hours there . It's cleverly designed with a giant tank in the middle, surrounded by habitats and animals in different oceans, i.e. the Atlantic, the Pacific....etc, and so you would always encounter something you missed in the previous sector, as all these sea creatures swim about. We saw the rare sun fish, along with big sharks, rays, barracudas, and so on. If you sit on the floor and look up the glass tank, you could imagine yourself at the bottom of the sea, it's like diving without getting yourself wet! We also visited the temp exhibition on turtles, which was educational. We completed this wonderful experience by having a buffet lunch with all-you-can-eat meat cut at table, at only less than 9 euro per head (half price for kids) at the Chimarrao restaurant (the Brazilian style) just outside the Oceanarium. Note: you can also order set lunch/ dish of the day for 5 euro, if you are not a big eater.

The best I been. It was very good experience for me who is big fun of marine world. If you can avoid sadness of keeping all those animals i captivity, you will have fun cruising few hours through this very well organized and the best oceanarium I been. Even, they were so polite to give me free ticket with my journalist ID.

Fishy afternoon..... A good afternoon out. The main "pool" was very impressive and very large. A range of exhibits to walk round off the main area. There are two ticket prices, one for "both" exhibits (Permanent and Temporary) and one for Permanent only.For both on the day we went, it was €16 for an adult. Traveled to and from by underground which was quick clean and easy to work out where you were heading.

Amazing Oceanario de Lisboa. This was one of the best places i ever been in.Very clean, very exotic animals, a lot of sharks, a giant tank of water, a lot of attractions as films, guide tours, well, unforgetable and romantic visit.
Good but not as good as seaworld. This was good but a lot smaller than expected (compared to SeaWorld in Australia and US that is) very well maintained and everything translated to English
Great aquarium. Great place to spend a couple of hours with children. Sea otters were a top favourite and penguins. Well laid out and worth a visit

Great experience, but we thought it would be bigger. Very good place to see some sealife. Best is the otter. Great pool in the middle with sharks, barracudas, etc..
Top tips: 1. Just sit in front of the big pool on the lower level and admire
2. At least 1.5 hours to visit the main exhibition

Calatrava. If you go to the Ocenario, spend some time looking at the new train station designed by the famous architect Calatrava. The ocenarium is beautiful and well worth the visit especially with children.

Best aquarium anyplace - ever!. WE decided to spend the afternoon and take our 9 year old son to the Oceanrio de Lisboa. DID NOT DISAPPOINT! Easy to get to via the metro from the heart of Lisbon. Easily, the best and finest aquarium anywhere and rivals many zoos! From penguins to sea otters .... I felt like we had been scuba diving but had not gotten wet! Hands down a remarkable place

2nd time around. This is our 2nd time visit to the aquarium. Last time was 2 years ago and the kids were not just old enough to appreciate it, however this time they really enjoyed it, lingering at each exhibit , taking photos and asking questions. If you've never been to an aquarium before try this one, mucho better than the feeble one Boris offers in London ! If you want lunch don't go to the aquarium restaurants , try the food court at the near by shipping centre, (not between 1 and 2).

A novel way to experience sea life. What makes this place so endearing is the architecture. Instead of small to medium sized tanks cramped with one species at a time, the visitor experiences what it might feel like walking the ocean floor, huge glass fronts and quite lovely outside areas of rocks and the like, home to everything from sharks to penguins and otters. A great place and a fantastic day out. The temporary exhibiton was dissapointing, but then again, the place itself is alright.

You can't miss it. Being a worderful experience for everyone, is afordable and it has a great price/earnig ratio.You can see very rare specimens, within one of the best and biggest Oceanário in the world.It is a deep-sea diving experience without any of the risks, with about 25,000 fish, seabirds, and mammals in an enormous central tank that is the size of four Olympic-sized swimming pools.
Oceanario. It's a very nice experience at any age and after you could have a pleasant walk along the waterfront

Great experience, and Not just for kids. Monday afternoon early July, in the middle of the heatwave, we ventured all the way by Metro to Orient station to visit the oceanarium with three teen agers. The center aquarium is definitely worth a view. Do not wait in line to get the first view, there are plenty of opportunities to see it from different angles througout the oceanarium. We were lucky to see two divers in the aquarium with sharks and stingrays cleaning the window from the inside :) Also other sea animals are on display, and we spent around 1 1/2 hours cooled and entertained. The cafeteria serves a very decent lunch menu. It is best to sit outside in the patio, it gets very noisy inside.

Great Afternoon. We visited as a family with our 1 year old son, he enjoyed every minute of watching the fish and sharks. The prices were reasonable and well worth the money, my only negative was the restaurant inside the attraction had a very limited menu at 3pm, if we had been earlier the selection was good.
Nice but Limited. The main tank was great, the rest of the displays were limited at best. Location is great in the park area. Building design a showpiece on it's own merit.

Overrated!. I expected so much more. This was supposed to be very good, but I was very dissapointed. I thought it would be much bigger. They only had one giant fishtank and even that weren't that big. With all the great reviews it'd gotten i'd expect to see whales or squids the size of my house!

Good entertaining couple hours. It was a couple hours well spent! Beautiful sea creatures with a great set up to view. We parked at the mall actoss the street at vasca de gama and it was a 5 minute walk. The turtles section is an extra 5 euro and is pretty short. But the huge turtles were amazing! Highly recomend checking out this aquarium!
Big tanks but a lot of people. It was well kept With beautiful displays. But we went on a saturday. would never do that agian because it was very crouded.
Wonderful.... Perfect for kids and adults. Even after 15 years of building date the Oceanario is an impressive place and really worth a visit.

Oooooh, fishies .... What a great place ... There are two floors of exhibits, based around a huge central aquarium. I believe this is Europe's second biggest aquarium after Istanbul's Turkuazoo, but the main tank at Lisbon is actually more impressive because it is more central in the building, and so can contain larger species, including sand tiger sharks and a devilfish (a *slightly* smaller relative of the manta ray). You can stare at the main tank alone for at least half an hour. Scattered around it are smaller exhibits of species from all over the world, including octopus and cuttlefish, seahorses and sea dragons, clownfish and lionfish, penguins and some adorable sea otters. While we were there, there was a temporary exhibit of turtles, which was well worth the extra admission fee (you can choose just to do the main exhibit if you're short of time/cash). They're huge!
Well worth a visit.. We loved our visit to this aquarium - so interesting and educational. I didn't think I'd ever get my 22 year old daughter away from the sea otters! Great fun.

You have to go there. Being in Lisbon it is a must to visit this place. It doesn’t look so big from outside but you can spend there few hours going around a huge main aquarium. We enjoyed the visit and our son (7 years old) wanted to go back again (which is very unusual for him as he has been to many worldwide places already).
A must do is Lisbon. Its an immense structure that will keep all ages entertained. Cable car and other attractions in close proximity
A must see in Lisbon, regardless of age. Who doesn't enjoy a beautiful aquarium? This one was particularly expansive and we loved the location down at the water. It is a must see.

Excellent. During my trip to Lisbon at the Hotel they advice me to visit Oceanário de Lisboa. We went there in the morning and let me tell you that was really amazing, one of the biggest aquariums in Europe.The aquarium has an amazing decoration and ambient of several oceans, it´s huge the central tank and very nice to walk around. You can easily stop and forward during the path to observe fish, sharks, penguins, among many other species. Lots of information available.

Enormous aquarium with a great selection of marine life.. This is the largest aquarium in Europe and well worth a visit! There are many colourful fish including a sunfish, birds including penguins and puffins and also sea otters.There are also many educational displays.A great day out for all the family:)
turtle lovers paradise. beautifully done, lots of fantastic exhibits, really friendly staff, extremely accommodating otters, just a nice place to hang out for a couple of hours

Excellent!. One of the biggest aquariums in Europe, It's bid and spacious, very nice to walk arround and see the exhibition. It's nicely located by the waterfront with easy access and a lot of praking spaces.

Well worth the visit!!. We're from California, so a visit to an aquarium wasn't really on our list of things to do. But the kids wanted to go, so we went. WOW! Very nice! Similar to other aquariums we had been to, but different species, some I had never seen before. The tickets were purchased through our hotel, so we got a bit of a discount. Cab fare to and from was around 20 Euro. I think we spent around 40 Euro for 1 adult and 2 kids under 13. Afterwards, we walked along the harbor's edge and found lots of great places to eat and visit.

Loved the penguins and the sea others. The exhibits were nice. There was a temporary exhibit of sea turtles that was excellent. But also the permanent exhibits were good. Several exhibits were targeted for kids so it is definitely family friendly.

Brilliant!. Loved this! One of the highlights of my visit to Lisbon. I could've sat all day and watched the sea creatures in the main tank. You actually feel like you're on the bottom of the ocean. Amazing. Really enjoyed the video which explains the inner workings of the Oceanario. We just loved the sea otters. You are remarkably close to them. Prices very reasonable. Nice cafe too. Altogether highly recommended.

An average aquarium. I am a rescue Scuba Diver, and have been to more than my fair share of aquariums and have dove all over the world, so I was expecting much more out of the so called second biggest. The education part was basic, and geared to a small child, and the species selection was good but not great. Decent spot if you haven't been in the water before, but if you've ever even snorkelled, I would give it a miss.

Great Immersion Experience.. We spend a too quick time at the Oceanario due to other commitments, but really enjoyed all of the exhibits. The basic four oceans exhibit was very well done and informative. There was enough to keep an adult entertained and I wished I'd had my grandson with me, he would have a great time.

Good but not great. Nice experience. Interessting facts on the wall and on the speaker guide we payed extra for. Liked the sea oters. A bit dark and cold in some areas. If you are not very enviromently friendly you'll probably leave feeling guilty.

A great family experience. Fun to access with the overhead tram from upriver. This is a very family friendly marine museum. It is well designed, educational, and very fun for kids (and adults). The building wraps around a huge central aquarium with two stories of viewing windows, indoor and outdoor displays, and information in both Portuguese and English. Very user friendly.

Turtles & four oceans. An aquarium with high quality; well maintained. The current turtle exhibition is surely worth seeing (with a combo ticket it makes just a modest additional cost). The regular aquarium consist of a huge central tank/area which is connected to four oceans (from the cold waters to the gentle pacific). Also sea birds of various areas are there too, not only penguins. There is a video/movie show also, where you can see how the fishes are fed, how their medical conditions are treated etc. How about a surgical operation for a fish?! Amazing. The show can be highly recommended. After Aquarium the cable car ride is a must. There is a large selection of cafe shops, sea food restaurants etc at the other end of the cable car connection.

A must see if you have some free time in Lisbon.. Its one of the biggest aquariums in the world! very beautiful and interesting! The oceanario closes at 8pm however last admittance is at 7:00pm, so if you wana visit make sure you are there before 7am. If you are staying in central lisbon, meaning rossio/chiado/av. liberdade, you can take the metro to oriente station (follow the route of the metro, you'll probably need to change lines) - the whole ride is about 15mins. When you get out of the metro head towards the water wherever you see it and then you will view a huge building full of every sea creature you have even dreamed of seeing. Its a major attraction for tourists with kids, kids will have a field day! Entrance fee is reasonable. you can check it out online on http://www.oceanario.pt/.

Fish fish fish. Great place to spend a lazy morning. It's really great to see the sea turtles swimming under you! And the rest of the fish, of course. You'll learn more than you think, they have so many wonderful and rare species from different oceans. Most of the tanks seem to be connected, somehow, and you feel as if you were under water, scuba diving.
Turtles!. LOVED the air con and the turtle exhibition. They have a great selection of animals and the space is well laid out and easy to negotiate.

Worth a visit. We visited here on the way back to the airport (as it's on the way when using the metro). It was worth doing somthing on the last day and was a good way to spend our last few hours in Lisbon. The aquarium is well laid out into different areas surrounding a main tank. There were a number of individual viewing areas for the main tank as you made your way round which was nice plus the other attractions such as the otters and penguins were all well thought out. There were informative exhibits too and the video regarding feeding time and how they look after all the marine life was interesting to watch. Even one of our group who wasn't interested in visiting the aquarium at the start enjoyed it by the end.
Fantastic !. The different oceans with their typical animals , temperatures are really well presented. In some of them you feel like an explorer.

A must for Lisbon. Regardless of age, this place is a work of art in terms of architecture and animal collection.First of all, just getting to this former Expo site is worth the trip, as you will get to see the most modern and developed area of Lisbon. It is the future.Then if you care about the aquarium itself, it is one of the best you will ever find. Huge variety of species, clear information, plenty of space.Don't miss it!
Absolutely Fabulous. The Oceanario is beautifully designed and so easy to wander around. There was so much to see including sea otters and a temporary exhibit of sea turtles.

Ocenario. It was not so big, as we expected, but was interesting. I can't say anything bad about this place. Nice. If you have never been in oceanariums, so I recommend to visit. If you were, there is nothing special, BUT anyway worth to visit.We came by red bus ( hop on, hop off). It's stop exactly near ocenarium

well worth a visit. Loved the sea otters, though the buggers were on nap time when were there. It is quite a large aquarium and opf course has denizens from around the world, well-presented and documented; A pleasant cafeteria all white could begin your visit.
beautiful and interesting. What you see inside is worth the price. It is a beautiful place, you can learn a lot and see well kept animals!
EXCELLENT Aquarium. They have done an amazing job with this aquarium covering all of the oceans and the typical life forms found there. Well worth the visit.

Oceanario de Lisboa. Very good trip here and value for money. Easy to get to by Metro that comes out into a huge Shopping Mall so can combine an afternoon out here with lunch. The Oceanarium's a ten minute walk from the Mall. Best bit was the beaver posing for pictures.

Must visit. I have visited this aquarium twice, and I never felt bored. It is well maintained, with many attractive sea life. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Lisbon. Situated next to Parque Das Nacoes, this can be reached by metro, from the Metro Station Oriente.

One of the most visited places in Lisboa. The Oriental area of Lisbon where took place the Expo 98 is as quarter of futurist arquitecture, drawed by some of the most famous names of the world architecture it's a unique place in the world, the River Tagus (Tejo in Portuguese) is so large form bank to bank that almost seems like the sea... the Lisbon's Oceanarium is an amazing experience, worth to tryal.

Great experience for all ages. We spent a few hours in the afternoon at the Oceanario. It is very well done, with information in Portuguese as well as English. Lots of viewing areas for the huge tank, which I believe is about 3 stories tall. Make sure you stop and watch the short film about how they feed all of the creatures - fascinating! Also don't miss the otters. If you have time, ride the little skytram outside for a great view.

Excellent time out - go there in the mid-day!. Oceanarium is very interesting place both for adults and children. Tour is organised around giant aquarium with lots of side attractions and smaller aquariums. Can easily swamp you for 3-4 hours, not including temporary exposition. We found it great place to shelter from the hot day beween noon and 3 pm. Highly recommended!

Exclusive Oceanarium. We ( family with friends) visited this oceanarium in the limited time available to us before boarding our flight back home to India.The location itself is an attraction and it was quite interesting to read the crispy information seen above as we walk through the small bridge to the oceanario.The permanent exhibit has been developed in the one ocean concept at the centre and we can witness species from the Atlantic, the Indian,the Pacific and the Antarctic oceans in the four corner chambers. The otters and penguins kept in an outdoor atmosphere were a treat to the eyes, especially the otters.The otters were a delight to watch - the twinkling eyes, the little nose,the silken fur and the way they were lying on their backs in water.Ofcourse all the species living in the seas were interesting to watch - watchful Eels hiding inside the sea rocks,jelly fishes glowing in the dark,octopus swaying gently,colourful sea animones looking like Dalia flowers,elegantly moving colourful fishes, scurrying schools of fish,violent sharks-every bit proved to be an wonderful experience.I think we should have taken more than two hours to watch the sealife here. A must visit in Lisbon ,very informative and exciting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great day at the aquarium, on a rainy afternoon.. The Saturday we had free was a gray rainy afternoon, so this was a good place to go and spend time. We did the extra exhibit with the sea turtles that was very well done. The entire aquarium was done very well, even information in English. Really enjoyed the whole complex.

Wonderful experience for every age!. We spent an afternoon at the aquarium. The special exhibit on rescued sea turtles was worth the price of admission. The center tank, where we were able to view from different levels and angles, was informative and engaging. The displays were educational and worth spending time reading. We were there on a day with many school children and families which added to the excitement of everything we observed!

Fantastic Day Out. At 16 Euros each this was a bit pricey but the entire experience was superb, the optional side exhibit with giant turtles and the main exhibit with its giant tank featuring sharks, groupers and manta rays, with otters and penguins in the outdoor areas. There were also vast arrays of smaller tanks with rainbow fish, octopus and giant crabs! Great way to spend a day out in Lisbon.

One of the best. My wife and I took a trip here is April and thoroughly enjoyed our day. There is so much to see all different aspects of sealife. Very informative and at the end there is a gift shop and cafes to enjoy.
Fab. Loved this! Really well designed and interesting with an amazing central tank where you can get up close to huge fish and sharks.
Worth the visit. The permanent exhibition was very interesting and the main aquarium is simply amazing. However the temporary exhibition (this time about turtles) was a huge let down.

Wonderful and special place to go with kids.... One of the best attractions in Lisbon to go with kids. The aquarium is huge. they have a lot of kind of fish. The building is very beautiful. My kids, 6 years old and 11 years old, loved the place.
Excellent!. One of the best aquariums we've ever visited and stood out against a recent visit to the London aquarium.

Positive Recharge. The underwater world is so fascinating!! If you are not a diving person, this Oceanario is definitely the place where you can explore, watch, even learn about the most interesting inhabitants of the ocean.  The whole walk takes 1-2 hours; There is a floor dedicated to turtles, their history, their endangered existence on our planet, and how people exploit them, or save and protect them.  Nice cafeteria - cooked meals.Staff - nice! When we were heading towards the lower floor, he stopped us and asked if we walked on the glass? Then came with us, and showed us, a place , where we did not expect that the exhibit continues; He was right, and attentive, if it was not for him, and his dedication to the job, we would have skipped , the half turtles aquarium.  You can take pictures inside, just without flash. Bus stop is just outside the oceanario. Regular busses, Sightseeing buses, Yellow Busses.Also on 5 mins walk there is a pharmacy, open on Sundays even (just if you forgot your suncream)  As a conclusion, you can enjoy, educate yourselves and get fascinated by how amazing is our Planet in terms of inhabitants, especially the ocean.

Very good attraction but needs more things to do around it. It is a good place to visit with family and kids, even us (couples in late 20s) enjoyed this journey to see all these sea creatures. However, walking here (from Orient Station) is quite a long walk under a hot sunny day. There seem to be lacking of things to do in the surrounding area. We saw some cable car going to another place, but we had no idea what it is and we had to go to our next spot so couldn't really check it out .I saw some people that mentioned there are a lot of restaurants, but we don't see any other than the ones in the Oceanario, food was okay for a quick sandwich or lunch but nothing fancy. If there's more tourist things to do, it would be perfect!And on the day we went there, there was the metro strike, despite the fact that there isn't any metro to take, we had to do 45 mins of the bus and when the bus arrived, it wouldn't stop for us because it's full of people. Another thing about the location and inconvenience of this place :(

Contemplative. A beautiful experience. A great place even for adults with no children. What was the most interesting (and maybe my husband and I were there on an unusual day) was that the atmosphere was quiet and respectful. Almost like a library. Hushed tones of waves and shorebirds playing on the audio system. Darkened hallways. This really presented the exhibits in a meaningful way. Gratefully, the only mammals were the sea otters.

A wonderful place to enjoy. Not a very easy location, metro cannot reach it directly but there is a bus. they have cute sea otters playing and also pinguins,lovely! and everyday working staff will feed the fish in the central colume, also have magic flourecent jellyfish, there are no dolphins or white bears.
Good. It didnt turn out what I was expecting. The do have world 2nd biggest tank but its not much to see. I like the location but unfortunately, not happy with it.

Must see if travelling with kids. It's a no brainer if you are travelling with kids. It's a really nice aquarium. The exhibition is less impressive than the Monterey acquarium, but the building architecture is really interesting.

Otters were amazing. It is great attraction. Well planed aquarium by ocean climates. Otters are really great - I spent about 30 minutes taking pictures and videos of them. I also liked very much big fish illuminated right under the glass I stood.

best Aquarium ever !. very reasonable to get in, the exhibits are on 2 floors, and takes at least 3 hours to see everything. It was really good to be able to get up close to the penguins, and sea otters, which were really cute!
The gift shop was pricey , 4 euros for a fridge magnet !

Fantastic place to go with your kids. Me and my daughter were enchanted with all the diferent species that we saw.
Beautiful place, large, quiet and unforgettable for the young people and for the oldest.
You can leave your childs sleeping there for 1 night to stay watching nature almost in his habitat.
Don't forget to go there.
amazing turtles. the turtle exhibition was great and the massive aquarium with loads of viewing windows was just erfect

Good aquarium, lots of fish!. Was my first real aquarium visit. I was happy with it, although the lighting in the main tank could have been better for pictures and just overall viewing. Side exhibits were good. Price was reasonable. Definitely should go here if you are visiting Lisbon.

Pricey but worth it.. I think we paid 16 euros per person. The visit included what they called the "temporary and permanent" exhibits. The overall walk through took about an hour and we enjoyed it. The gift shop at the end was very overpriced.

I want a sea otter. Really enjoyed this a good few hours spent and good value. Very educational and very interesting. Excellent facilities. Having been to the one in Valencia I found this on a par.
Its well worth a visit especially if you have never seen an ugly fish. Loved the sea otters.

well-done. very good experience in particular if you interest in viewing wildlife in their original environment. from tropical to the poles. very educational and nice to see that the schools use the venue for visits.

excelent !. defnitely put it on your list of sights. take planty of time for it, because it's huge. We only had one hour, and believe me this is not enough for nothing. If you like photography you'll take thousands of pics :)

A real experience. The creators of the Oceanarium have tried to recreate the experience of a giant ocean area populated by a diverse range of fish, and they have more or less succeeded. Ocean Sun fish rub shoulders with Manta Rays and various sharks, while tuna-type things and angel fish mingle with more bizarre animals such as the guitar fish. To the side there are tropical fish tanks and coral reefs, as well as outdoor sections with otters, penguins and guillemots. There is also a temporary exhibit, which at this moment is a fairly interactive turtle tank. The turtles and other fish swim through a lob winding corridor, while you walk on top, underneath and alongside. The whole thing kind of takes your breath away with its sheer scale. The fish and other creatures look happy enough, and there is a sense that everything there is in the best interests of the animals, rather than the public, which is nice from an Eco-conservationist point of view. Not particularly cheap, but definitely worth a visit.

Fantastic!!!. Wow, this place has really left me amazed. We were so close to the animals and especially the otters were worth observing, while they were cleaning themselves in front of us. A little expensive, but aquariums and habitats do cost a lot to maintain. Great experience for kids. Go for it, but make sure you put on warm clothes...it is quite cold!

Awesome. This place is excellent. And we live near the Monterey Bay Aquarium in California, so we know good aquariums. It is a must-do, also the area around it in very cool and modern, very unlike the old part of Lisbon.

Beautifull building. The oceanario was on a perfect location. The exhibition with the seaturtles was great! I loved the sea otters.A tip: go to the shopping mall for lunch and eat it on the doc while watching the building and the river.

A Day at the Oceanarium - Lisbon. Once again, we found it hard to find by driving ourselves.The trip here was great and little Megan was fascinated by the displays there. We paid a little extra for the turtle exhibit before strolling leisurely around the complex. Access to floors via lift as we had a buggy with us and all staff very friendly and helpful. Great for adults and children alike.
the bigest!. wanna see big fish ? or other species ? go ther ! you gonne love it ! they have so many rooms whit animals..its just incredibel

By far the best "aquarium" ever. This is so much more than just an aquarium. The set up allows one to see puffins, penguins, etc. in a fairly natural habitat, close up. This was the hightlight of our 11 year old's trip to Lisbon and Madrid. The Atlantic Puffin in the first room was the happiest-appearing animal I have ever seen (we have film).
Nice place to visit.. Nice place to visit with family, kids, or even alone. They have a good vareity of species. The big turtle is the best......it's worth to visit.

Unexpectedly Enjoyable. Not my choice to go here, as I think of aquariums as somewhere to take children on a wet Sunday afternoon and I had no children with me and it wasn't wet, It is huge, however what swung it for me where the penguins and otters (so very cute), although the rest is very impressive.

very nice!. Loved the oceanarium! It's really nice, has a very good structure! It's built around a central aquarium and then works in regions. They have penguins, otters, manta, sharks,...
Loved it!
great way to spend a morning. This is a fantastic aquarium.Wonderful exhibits and full of families, school kids, seniors and tours-there is something for everyone.
Great place to wisit. Here is so much to see that this Lisbon No 1 Experience You can´t miss! To Oseanario is easy to come by Metro and tram.

Beautiful. Beautiful building, beautiful atmosphere, I liked sea otters, penguins and giant turtles (But the turtles were just in temporary exhibition). You can go along the shore from the Oceanario to the V. D. Gama Bridge. It is a nice quiet walk.

Great aquarium. Best aquarium I've ever visited and not too expensive. Amazing main tank, I could sit and watch it for hours! It's a little bit out of the city but it's nice to be by the water. Sea otters being fed was definitely a highlight, as well as the flat fish!

Good Fun.. The Oceanario is very easy to find and has a vast array of sea specimens, It was a great day out and there is so much to see. The lay out is fantastic and tanks were huge!! the sea turtles were a big plus. Good day out for everyone!
worth a visit. really cheap and great day out! the area around the Aquarium is great too! worth a visit! quite a lot to see and worth a trip there

super!!!. Good experience. Excellent views from the big tank. I love see life so i can spend there hours and hours. You can see lots of sharks and few different creatures from all over the world. Really nice and friendly staff. Def next time when i will be in Lisbon i will back there again.

Aquarium. Awesome time! So much to see and the sea turtles were great, we couldve spent all day just staring into the tanks. The only negative were the millions of toddlers and school kids there that day being incredibly loud.

Don't miss one the best Aquarium's in Europe. Great place to visit, whether with children or not. The main tank is huge and allows for 360º views, since you can walk around it. Also great surroundings for a walk at the Tejo's shore.

Good viewing angles. This is a good way to spend a hot day. Little kids will love it and most big kids too. It's not the biggest or the best aquarium but there are excellent views from all around the big tank and excellent side tanks showing the flora and sea creatures of various regions around the world.
turtle watch. We've visited the oceanario because weather was bad. There was an interesting turtle exhibition. Our two 3 year girls were thrilled seeing all the amazing things.

if you like Sea Life, this is the place to go!. If you like sea life, this is the plave to go. One of the biggest Oceanariuns in Europe, the main thank is just impressive. The sorroundings of the Oceanario are also awesome.

The best aquarium we have visited. A really good outing in Lisbon. The Oceanarium is well set out and the extra temporary exhibition on sea turtles was outstanding. We sat in a booth under the glass roof as a sea turtle swam over us-an amazing experience! The area surrounding the aquarium is well worth a visit too, take the cable car ride and admire the modern architecture.
Amazing. Really amazing, awesome fishs and great place to take some photos and to go with the kids. The kids loved and they just cannont stop talking about it.
An afternoon at Oceanario. Loved the penguins and sea otters.Amazing selection of fish. liked how it was organized by oceans. to get to via the city bus. No dislikes.

Great experience!. It is the biggest aquarium we have ever visited and we enjoyed seeing all the different fish, and a lot of other sea creatures. There are huge tanks, all with most unusual fish and sealife you can imagine. If you are going to Lisbon put that first on your list, especially if you have kids. They will love it!
Great Aquarium. The fish had plenty of space and the tanks were amazing. So many varieites of animals. The penguins, sea otters, and the sunfish were my favorites though.
