Amazing! Bello!. Very well organized. The big tank is amazing! I recomend it to everyone who visit Portugal. The way it was created is fantastic, wit the different continents represented on each side of the building

Not to be missed if you visit Lisbon !. It is unique, a great journey into our different oceans.
Apart the majestic centre tank, you will travel through our planet and its maritime fauna.
Excellent documentation, extremely well kept tanks, the result of a large team of biologists who exceeded all expectations.

Very good. Visited while at a conference at the FIL.This is one of the best aquariums I've been to (though Atlanta still tops the list). It centres around the main tank which you walk around, on various levels to get different perspectives. On the map it looks as though it won't take long to get around it all, but you could easily spend a few hours here, its quite deceptive.
Cool and clean. Its one of the best places in Lisbon. I am not kidding. Tanks are clean and its well worth the ticket.

One of the most complete and fun aquariums!. It worths the shot! A great family place. Be prepared to spend 2-3hours watching see animals ^_^! You have penguins, sharks, nemos... From different areas and properly separated. You can have a guide or just walk and read the infos that are there. The most amazing is that you can sit and watch through a huge glass different animals living together. Beautiful and peaceful.

Very interesting place. Beautiful Oceanarium with interesting views and various species.Enjoyed very much from the temporary turtles exhibition.Worth to visit for 3-4 hours without and especialy with kids.

Stroll with the fishes!. This aquarium is great. The tunnels where the turtles swim under you, the types of fish you see, the exhibits are well done. Every time you turn a corner you see something new and interesting.

A good place to spend time when its raining. The Ocenario is big but not huuuuuge. It is on the outside but seems smaller when you get in. Everything written about the fish is really interesting and short which makes you want to read it all. All in all the Ocenario is a good experience and they have a lot of beautiful and special fish.
Unbelievable. What a great experience. Lets all of your senses come alive and instills a passion for the "Global Ocean" we are a part of. You will not be disappointed.

Very nice visit. We truly enjoyed the aquarium/oceanarium, and found it to be reminiscent of and only slightly less impressive than the National Aquarium in Baltimore. The central feature, the large tank around which the rest of the aquarium is organized, is very impressive. It's a little bit out of town, so prepare yourself for a bit of a time investment or plan to investigate some other sight out that way, such as the cable cars or some of the other more kid-oriented exhibits that were part of the Expo held in Lisbon in 1998.
expensive!. Maybe its a great oceanarium, but the prices are absurd...16,50 euros definetaly is not tolerable...we didn´t enter

Good standard of aquarium. I have been to Barcelona's and Hong Kong's (in the Ocean Park). This is the best of the three. There is plenty of space and not crowded. Barcelona had a moving walk way which forced you to move on. Hong Kong was packed and no where to pause. I guess the other visitors kind of made a difference.
Nice one. Variety of fishes from around the world. Big turtle :) all good take combined tickets so you can visit both

One of the best spots in Lisbon. Truly one of the best spots that Lisbon has to offer. Top quality aquarium. Lots of species. Great to go with kids. Be sure to explore the surrounding area (Expo neighbourhood) which has some nice parks, cafes and restaurants.

Very good. I love visiting sea life centres and this was one of the best. Easy to find on the map and use the red metro line to get to. We paid extra to see the sea turtles-this part was not worth it. Big fish tanks, takes a while to walk around. The sea otters were worth the visit alone! They were amazing! There's a cable car just outside which was cheap and you can chose to only go one way so we caught back to the shopping mall. Lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
Do not miss this. This is the ex-libris of the Oriente area of Lisbon. It is a wonderfull place to visit and spend a couple of hours just sitting and watching those animals.
Great. Great building, great navigation, great collection — both permanent and temporary. And sunfish! Will go again!

Unexpected gem. We ended up at the Oceanario almost by accident: we wanted to see the Lisbon Expo area, and with some time to 'burn', we figured we might head in as well. What a treat we were in for!At the time of our visit, there was a temporary sea turtle exhibition, which was really nice: there's something magical about those slow-moving creatures slowly passing by past the viewing windows. If you're here anytime soon, make sure to visit that exhibition as well!The regular exhibition was outstanding as well: bilingual (English and Portuguese), a dash of conservation message, a brilliantly large fish tank and some pretty happy penguins and sea otters (incredibly cool!). Great 'mood' in the place as well: it's mostly darkened, so the fish and other animals really stand out. It's very popular with locals as well, who bring their kids - and amazingly all those kids seemed to go into a Zen-like state when going inside.So, if you have an afternoon to spend in Lisbon, don't hesitate to go. Metro connections are easy and fast from the center.

Nice enough, but a little disappointed after all that I heard.. Really surprised how small it was. With all the great reviews it received, and being in such a seafaring nation as Portugal, I was expecting a great product but left very disappointed. It is clean and safe and well put together, there just isn't much here. One big tank with mutliple viewing ports is the main attraction. The sea otters were fun to watch.Given that it is so far out of the way for most tourists staying in Lisbon, I would skip it.

Good, but I expected more.. This is my first visit to an aquarium, and maybe I had bigger expectation than I should, it is not easy to get all sorts of fishes and to maintain them in that closed environment, but it was not so special, as I though it should be. I have to say that I live by the sea coast, so I have already seen a number of fishes and other sea creations, so do not take my review so seriously. It was beautiful, and relaxing sitting by the tank and watching all that animals swim, so all you sea lovers should go and visit :)))
Excellent experience. It is worth the expensive ticket. Amazing environment and exhibit set-up. Currently there is a temporary turtle exhibition which is extremely interesting.

Fishy Tales!. This was brilliant! huge tanks full of fish! and such beautful colours. The lonely Giant Sun Fish... i wanted to take him home... and look out for the school of fish with one who has a deformed back

One of the best aquariums in the world. This is one of the best-designed aquariums I've ever seen, with huge glass-walled tanks that you can walk around and get all sorts of different views of the sea-life. Some of the viewing areas curve inwards so it seems as if you're almost inside with the fish. They have an amazing collection, including sunfish, all kinds of rays and sharks, sea turtles, penguins and otters. It's really a wonderful place, not to be missed.

One of a kind. It was a must see. We went there as a couple, and it was very nice. Everyone can go to this aquarium. It was a lot to see. The main aquarium was huge, and it was also a lot of small ones. Cons: I missed more signs. We did not understand when the tour was over, and we had to search for the last room(had to pay extra).

Best Aquarium I have ever visited. My boyfriend and I visited the Oceanarium on our last day in Lisbon and boy am I glad we did. This is easily the best aquarium I have ever visited. The central tank is epic, with such a variety of fish, including fish I had never seen before (and I have been to a good few aquariums). The sea otters are adorable and fascinating and look like they love living there which you don't often see at animal attractions. I could have watched them forever. The penguin enclosure is amazing, huge blocks of ice and a very authentic environment for them to live in. You can get so close too! Throught the attraction there are tanks and tanks of fascinating aquatic creatures, I loved the sea dragons and the different types of jelly fish. The information provided is informative without being too much. The groups of children we saw there looked like they were having a great time. When we went there was a temporary sea turtle exhibition which was just fantastic. They have rescued 4 sea turtles and created them a temporary environment for them to live in to get used to being in a mixed sea again. The sea turtles swim under and over your ahead and I was lucky enough to come face to face with the biggest one. It was my favourite part of the attraction which means it must be good as I loved it all. The entry fee of 16 euros (3euros extra for sea turtles - basic entry is 13 euros) is great value for money, especially compared to the one in London. The gift shop was great too, actually had things you wanted to buy instead of a load of tat. My litlle brother loved his gift from there. We visited on the way back to the airport and they had lockers for our bags which was great as we didnt have to carry them round the exhibit. A must do when visiting Lisbon. Don't miss out!
Awesome!. Well worth the trip over! Got to see some great things! The temporary exhibit had the sea turtles and they were well worth the extra €3 to see them!

cool aquarium. we liked this aquarium a lot, but as we have seen valencia aqaurim two years ago we expected more as they say this one is the biggest in europe. but after all good value for money (fee is 13 euros)

A must to see in Lisbon!. Save at least 2 hours. Move yourself to a different world. Touch a shark, watch a penguin. Have a nice geography and biology lesson. Take your girlfriend and children. A must to see in Lisbon!

Much more than an aquarium. This is much more than your average aquarium, it's more of an experience. All of Lisbon is art and the oceanarium is no exception, from the mosaic sidewalk outside to the whale constructed of cans in the entrance. Subway stop right by. Make a day of it- visit the oceanarium, ride the telecabine, walk back on the pier and by the park.

Beautiful. Great acquarium and one of the biggest ones I have seen! The best part were the temporary exposition about turtles and the otters. Loved the fact that you are able to see the wildlife above and under the water. A wholly different experience!

Great big aquarium in Europe!. This aquarium is located in the newer part of town near the shopping mall. Lovely structure separated into two buildings; one for temporary exhibits (when I visited, they had a huge tank filled with sea turtles) and one for the permanent exhibits which include sharks, rays, penguins and more. Obviously there were quite a number of children running around, but I thought the layout was well organized so that no one felt too crowded at any one time. The tank space looked large enough to make sure the animals felt comfortable.

An experience not to be missed. I loved the way that in the top half of the complex you could see birds and sea beavers (my favourite) on the surface and then downstairs what was in the pool and what going on at the top. I was amazed at the Sun fish - never seen one before.
Not just fish. The Oceanario is a great experience! The area was developed for the Expo 98 and the surroundings are also great whether you like shopping or just a walk along the seaside!

Top of the top!. Well, if I have to suggest something to visit in Lisbon, despite all the beautiful monuments and great places, the Oceanario is simply beautiful. We spent a great morning surrounded by beautiful fishes in a very wide area.

Super. You really have to go and visit the Oceanario, the best & greatest I have ever seen in Europe. The price is a bit high but you might as well skip the see turtles which saves you a few euro, only visit the permanent exhibition.

A must do!. The oceanarium is housed in a cleverly constructed building based on the Expo 98 site which is a fab area to spend time in. Once inside the building there are easy to follow directions to all of the exhibits. Children and adults of all ages will find it interesting and informative. There are also a number of outdoor areas where you can see cute penquins and very entertaining otters. Inside areas have understandably low lighting which emphasizes the movement and beautiful colours of the huge variety of fish. There's also a well stocked souvenir shop and at least one or perhaps 2 cafes. Well worth a visit whatever the weather.

A must-visit in Lisboa. All kind of fish and under-sea creatures, otters, pinguins and turtles - very nice. I also liked the short documentary on the "behind-the-scene" of the oceanarium, screened in a mini-cinema towards the exit of the exhibitions.The park/seaside along the oceanarium is great for walking and relaxing, the nearby shopping mall great for a bit of spending :)
Nice. Not impressive. Well designed interior, perfect for families. Building is not a creative architecture. Very far from everywhere.

Don't miss Lisbon Oceanarium of you have kids - One of the biggest in the world. If you have kids, don't miss a visit to Lisbon Oceanarium.Built for the World Expo´98 in Lisbon, and getting more than 1 million visitors per year, it's a place you should not miss.With more 20.000 sqm and 7.5 million liters, it's the second biggest in the world, with hundreds of species, from sharks to barracudas, rays and much more!It's located in the northern part of Lisbon, with underground/metro connection (Red Line - Oriente).

Here fishy fishy!!. The permanent exhibit was extensive and informative... with an amazing central tank full of beautiful sharks and fish. The temporary visit was nearly magical.If you have an off weather day, just visit the aquarium. Just minutes away by metro and in a beautiful location.

Best Oceanarium Yet. We visited the oceanarium on our last day in Lisbon and we were not dissapointed. It had A LOT to see and everything is well kept including the animals. It's worth the entry fee, GO!
Very cool. If you get tired of churchs, hills and the old town The Oceanário is a good choice, especiaaly if you are with kids. They will love it.

Excellent family fun. Interesting, educational, fun ... A well-organized space so there is no problem with crowd. It could be reached by tourist bus and public transportation. In the complex is a restaurant, and either is far from the center do not have to worry about eating (which is always the problem with young children because they can not wait). Nearby is the Parque das Nações, which also should be visited, so you could easily plan the whole day visit.
Great for Kids. Nice day out with kids, reasonably priced entrance fee, special exhibition with sea turtles was great. Had lunch in the on site restaurant, good value for money.

Amazing underwater world!. Well, this is a must-see in Lisbon! One of the best aquariums I'ver ever visited and with a good entrance fee. The different perspectives of the central aquarium, the variety of water animal species, the interesting scientific remarks and the global conception of Oceanário makes it a living astonishing museum that makes us want to stay there for the night (what you actually can do, buying a specific entrance!!!).

I have seen better ones. I thought it would be better - but is it not as great as the one I have seen in Valencia (which is amazing by the way) or in Barcelona. What I missed were those nice corridors where you can look at the fish which are just above you. Maybe they have a lot of spieces - I don't know- but it didn't impress me much. And for the price (16 EUR) it should have amazed me.

Great place to visit. This was my second time at the Oceanario de Lisboa because i enjoyed it so much the first time a couple of years earlier, If anything the second time was even better. The staff are friendly and the place is clean and there are lots of different things to see and do. Its well worth a visit and dont miss the Sea Otters

Good to visit in family. This is a fun program for a family. There is a good variety of species, the big aquarium is impressive and the pinguins adorable. The best time to go is at lunch time as we may see the animals being feeded.
Good for a family trip.. Well, oceanarium. Quite big and nice. Good for a family trip especially when the weather is not so good. The place around oceanarium also nice to see.
Love fish!. Lovely place to relax and see beautiful fish in giant aquariums.the place is clean and with a nice architecture, the staff, as mostly Portuguese are very nice.
Excelent. Big and not crowded. We enjoyed the visit in our own pace. Very useful hints (and not too long too:) ). The otters are very funny.We liked also to walk in the park.

It's Tripadvisor's number one for a reason.... We were so disappointed with the disorganised "attractions" elsewhere in Lisbon, but the Aquarium was brilliant!If you get there for around 3pm, it's feeding time for most of the residents (we saw otters and penguins).The central tank is very well stocked, interesting, educational and fascinating.You can also visit temporary exhibits, we saw the Turtles which was super.There is an excellent shop where we bought lots of gifts for people back home, surrounding "Oriente" is also worth exploring.
Nice place. Big aquarium is great, has several types of sharks, mantas, skates and a sun fish, but side collection worse than in Barcelona.
fantastic fish. One of the best presented aquariums we've ever been to. The range of fish, the education and the viewing experience is superb. Allow at least 2 hours and you won't be disappointed

The best. This is one of my favourite places in Lisbon, and I try to visit every time I go there.The central aquarium is amazing, and I could spend ages just watching the fish - lots and lots of space.The different areas (divided by geography) show the native species, and I love watching the seals play :)

Fascinating. Very well thought out with a good variety of species including penguins, birds, sea otters, etc. Nice location adjacent to a very large shopping centre with plenty of places to eat outside of the city. The cable car ride on the front was very good.
Beautiful. The ticket is expensive,but when you see all the fishes, you forget about it! I mean it is the second largest ocenarium in the world. You will never see something like this.

Great experience!!. I went to the Oceanario expecting to spend one hour or two of a rainy day. But the experience was so great that I stayed there for more than 4 hours! It is not only fascinating for kids, but also really interesting for adults. Totally recommend it!!

Great Aquarium Visit. Great display, tanks and information, in a modern facility.One of the best aquariums in Europe.It is a 20 min. taxi ride from the center of the city, but worth the trip. Great modern shopping mall nearby.
AMAZING!!. I am a huge fan of aquariums and this is by far the best one I have ever been to. Sea otters, sea turtles, penguins, the most spectacular large tank full of amazing things! Go Go GO!!!

Best Aquarium I've ever seen. The Oceanario is located right on the Rio Tejo and is essentially a giant, cylindrical tank. Its amazing! I was mesmerized by the sheer size of it and the variety of sea life circling around inside. The sea otters were also a highlight.

Excellent Sea Aquarium.. If Lisboa as capital of Portugal has many attraction Ocenaria has many attractions for visitors eyes n sparkle. The way they manage the chemistry of water to maintain flora n faunna of undersea in varied levels is truly praiseworthy. Its worth a visit for every1.

Just must see it if you go to Lisbon. Great place! You see the ocean like you never seen before.
It's not in the center but in the world expo 1997... but just do it.

Great Layout. This is certainly not the largest aquarium, but it's a fantastic aquarium for its size and includes many beautiful fish, as well as sea otters, penguins, enormous rays and sharks. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting this aquarium back in 2000 and brought my boyfriend with me to visit it this year and still loved it as much as I did 13 years ago. I've been to the Atlanta aquarium and favor this one to my experience at that one... Lots of places to sit as you're walking around so you can just watch fish. Definitely recommend making the trip there if you like marine life!
the best!. Likes: The turtle exhibit that was on. Just the tops! well put together. The aquarium was outstanding Dislikes: Almost too big!

Not the best in the world, but still very much worths visiting. Very nice Oceanario, but we were disappointed only to see turtles if you buy additional tickets. Some of the ones we visited had them swimming in them. Which doesnt mean that it's not a spectacular place to visit! Just go for it, people. Nice place and nice area.

Not just another aquarium. Went there with my wife and though we've been to aquarium before, Oceanario will be remembered. Because of the setup, the central aquarium offers new views throughout the visit, providing for new insights and surprises all along. Oceanario is part of a 'modern' neighborhood offering a different Lisboa view and a nice stroll for half a day.
Big fish Tank!. The largest and best Oceanarium we have ever seen. Leave yourself 3-4 hours to enjoy it. Take the Red metro rather than Tourist bus for value.

Stunningly beautiful. One of our best memories of Lisbon, great for young and old alike. A beautiful and diverse view of the wonders of our ocean. The main central aquarium is marvelous and you get to see it from all possible angles.

Ocean and a little more. Nice place, very well organized. Temporary exhibition (turtles) worth to visit. A lot of sea creatures divided into regions (Atlantic, Arctic, Pacific, etc). Depending on preferences (and company) it is possible to spend there from one to three hours. Comparing to other places with oceanarium (e.g. Valencia, Spain) larger but not much better. So if somebody loves sea - see it.If somebody saw other places - think. Great place for children.

Excellent. And I'm not really into oceanariums. I'm not really a fan of these sorts of things. I like to do an occasional dive and would generally prefer to admire wildlife in that setting. My husband was keen to go so I went along and absolutely loved it! This is a very good attraction. I was amazed at the size of the main tank and the enormous variety of species they had. There were so many highlights really but what stood out for me were the turtles, the sharks and the Antarctic habitat. I have a bit of an obsession with sea horses and I was absolutely mesmerised by the sea dragons on show. I could have stared at them for half the day had my husband allowed! Whether you bring kids along or not this is an amazing way to discover the variety in all oceans, without even getting wet! Best attraction we saw in Lisbon. An afternoon well spent.

Simply a must. Even after several times the Oceanario remains fascinating. It is dominated by a gigantic 2-story Aquarium which you can circle on both floors with plenty of space to watch thousands of fishes swim in close to natural souroundings. By cruising around this pool you find yourself in different climatic zones of the global oceans watching all Kind of creatures from pinguins to birds. You will enjoy this place - and if you have kids they will be happy and astonished as Long as you are in. Guidance is given by many explanations in English.

Rather small but beautiful!. It is not inexpensive but especially the main aquarium is a huge thing with lots and lots of creatures to see. You could spend hours just looking at it from various angles. The kids loved it.

Worth your time and money, especially for kids.. It would be hard to overstate how wonderful this place is, both for grown-ups and kids. The ability to see the various sea life from all over the world in different perspective - above, below and beside - makes this aquarium special. There is a separate turtle exhibit that costs a couple of Euros more and is well worth the price.If you are coming to Lisbon, don't miss this place. It's easy to get to - near the Oriente stop on the red line of the Metro.

The best of the best !. The most amazing place in the capitol of Portugal! In my opinion absolutely MUST SEE in Lisbon. You can just sit on the bench and relax by looking at the massive glass walls. Entrance is not expensive, student discounts available.
Impressive!. The Oceanario of Lisboa is impressive! It is very well looked after and it’s very amusing for both kids and adults. Definitely it’s worth seeing while going to Lisbon.
A must. I love Oceanario. Not only it boasts a huge central tank with amazing large fish, as it's divided into the four main oceans. Don't miss the otters and the penguins.
super expencive. is great...but not sooo sooo great for this money...i mean...we had some amazing moments but i wouldnt say is first thing to see in lisbona

Worth a trip if you enjoy aquatic life!. The main water tank with its sharks, rays and even a sunfish was overwhelming! The aquarium shows a lot of different animals, starting from big fishes like Manta rays continuing with sea horses, squids and they even have a penguin colony! All animals are kept in big habitats, there are exhibitions about the ocean pollution, about how to be "greener" and the changes of ocean life in the last century which definitely fitted the main attractions.
Great place to go. Amazing, beautiful and very interesting. We have been there twice. It is a "Must see" in Lisboa for Children as well as Grown ups.

Updated aquarium. From the 1998 Expo, this aquarium is quite nice. The huge central tank which houses thousands of fish, huge and small, has viewing windows placede in differnt areas to give different asspects of the tank.; Many small tanks for othere varieties; as well as an outdoor view of sea birds and otters;; Kids will love it as usual. i

Great trip for the family. This was a great family trip - our young uns really enjoyed it and we spent hours wandering around and learned loads about the oceans, sea turtles etc. etc. etc. It is pretty far from the city centre but worth the trip and is next to a science museum as well as the cable car over the amazing Vasco da Gama Bridge over the River Tagus which makes for a fun filled afternoon for all the family.
not as good as sold. well, it's a big pool. with big fishes. Could be better, it's more suitable for a visit with children, i would say.
Great for everyone!. This is one of the must see Oceanario, very hands on and well laid out.It has been thoughtfully laid out.

Overrrated oceanarium. For the largest in the Europe, it was certainly disappointing. We were here during Easter when all museums and churches were closed on a day with thunderstorms. The lines got huge and thanks to the guard, got us speedy entrance coz of the small kids with us. The Temporary exhibit was boring for the kids. The interiors of the aquarium are too dark except for the penguins and otters. Not a single dolphin or whale here - they have a show at the ZOO. One huge aquarium tank seen from all angles. It was very crowded everywhere and even in the cafeteria - not a place to sit. People were smoking right at the door of the aquarium which made it very difficult for us to breathe right inside. Quite a walk from the station which made it in difficult in the rain and no place to get a taxi almost all the way to the station. Maybe if it wasnt rains or it wasnt Easter, we might have enjoyed it.

Great for adult and kids. We have visited a few aquariums before but this is the best by far. It makes the sealife centre in Birmingham look like a small fish tank in comparision. A must see when in Lisbon - especially with kids. It is not just big, but really well laid out. There is lost to see and just enough information in English on the various information boards. We were staying in Cascais and drive here. There is a multi-storey car park close by. There is a small outdoor qua park with stepping stones etc near the aquarium which was nice but there was not much else of interest in the area.

Beautiful Creatures. The Ozeanario is always worth the Travel. Lots of different Creatures from the ocean, you wont see anywhere else. It can be quite busy, especially on a rainy day. But just combine the visit with a trip to the shopping mall nearby. Perfect plan for bad wether.

Beautiful but abit crowded. Definitely worth a visit. Very nice collection.The whole site (Expo 98) is worth the detour. Try to go during the week, off-season. With our tight schedule we had to go on a Saturday and it was crowded.

Great aquarium!. This is a great aquarium to see regardless if you are young are old. They have a temporary exhibit as well as a permanent exhibit. You turn the corner as you walk around the main aquarium and you do not know what you will find. Each corner has something different to see.

WOW. We have been to lots of aquariums around the world, and this ranks as one of the best. The main two storey tank is spectacular, we were captivated by the ocean sunfish and manta ray, very unusual to see in an aquarium. The airy 'greenhouses' on the upper level were also amazing. Who can resist sea otters? Plus free-flying Inca Tern dive-bombing unsuspecting bystanders. The temporary leatherback turtle exhibition was also brilliant, with these lovely creatures swimming around in glass tunnels beneath your feet.A few areas could be improved. For example, information on the creatures in the main tank is limited to the 'star' attractions, it would have been nice to know more about the supporting cast. But overall, the concept and design works well, as evidenced by its high ratings. Lots of space to move around, though still best enjoyed when not too busy. The entry fee is fair - we have paid the same at places which offer far less. Of course, if you don't appreciate the natural world, then spend your money elsewhere. But this could just be the place to change your mind.We also ate in the Oceanario's self-service cafeteria Tejo, which had nice traditional Portuguese dishes (Arroz de Pato and Bacalhau Dourado), plus toasted sandwiches at reasonable prices.In summary, muito bem!
a good day out. interesting - be there around 3-4pm for sea lion and penguin feeding. Well laid out and easy to engage with. Perfect for a rainy Lisbon day.

Very beautiful experience. We went there with a combined ticket of turtles and permanent exhibition as well as an audio guide. I don't recommend turtle exhibition otherwise you are interested in them then you can save 5€ per person. I also don't recommend audio guides because it's not so interactive and just is a boring audio device. It's not the interactive type that you could find in Louvre museum. Then you can save another 2€s. But the permanent exhibition was perfect and full of colors. The ticket is 11€s. Overally you will enjoy it specially because Vas da gama shopping center and tower is also nearby.

Good visit apart from the adults without children!. We visited here the first morning of our stay in Lisbon due firstly to a 6 year old that 'couldn't wait' and the rain. It was expensive to visit both the permanent and temporary exhibits(42 euro for a family) but we did spend almost 3 hours inside(would probably have been there longer if just adults) so ok in the end. We had only previously visited a very small aquarium (very small!) so this was fantastic. It seemed to be possible to see the big tank(which I believe is actually 3 tanks seemlessly joined?) from all angles and at the temporary exhibition it was possible to stand on a glass floor and watch turtles and fish swim beneath your feet. Apart from the big tank there are also numerous small tanks with various sea-creatures as well as sea-birds, penguins etc. As I said in my title the only thing that ruined the visit was the adults whtat were there without children. At each view of a tank(though the crowds faded as you passed thru the facility) there was a crush to get right up to the glass window to the tank. Any families were taking it in turns to let kids in to see but adults(mainly over 50) that were without kids were rude in the first instance and actually a little reckless also. My 6 year old had to wait (impatiently) at each tank to get in so that she could see(unless a family was moving out and let her in to replace one of their kids) but then she risked being trampled on by another adult pushing in to see. I realise that this is not the fault of the Oceanarium and happens at lots of other attractions also but by posting hopefully people might rethink their next visit(though these people were not local) and think of the smaller visitors who just want to see!

Entertainning. overall a great place to visit, whether by yourself or with kids. the only downfall is in regards to the queing...can take a while to get in.went over when they had the turtle show and i can honestly say that both me, my daughter and friend had an equal amount of good fun - in the sense that it "caters" to all ages.if anybody is lanning to visit i would give it a thumbs up.price is a little high though.
Brilliant Experience!!. Family enjoyed this experience and children found it great fun to watch the show. I would recommend this experience for other families. I would return to see the show again.

Plenty more fish .... A fantastic afternoon spent at this amazing aquarium. Observe sea life from various angles, well thought out and easy to move around and avoid the crowds. Friendly and helpful staff, good explanations in English andPortuguese. Sadly did not have time to see the sea turtles exhibition. Easy access by metro train to Orient. Lovely surrounding area too. The sea otters were a highlight as very friendly and seemed to be posing for us constantly although they were just enjoying themselves. Ate at nearby mall which has a huge variety of food options.
Fantastic !. If you're in Lisbon, don't miss the giant Aquarium. Since it was sunny when I was there I was not really motivated but once inside we all were thrilled by these amazing animals.

Not to be missed!. One fantastic aquarium tank. Delightful to be able to walk around the gigantic tank and see the sea life from all sides. The aquarium is well planned, allowing visitors to view the same big tank from all sides. This means, there is no need to crowd over one window.Explanations were both english and portuguese.My husband and two daughters and I also loved the very informative film of the aquarium's research and care efforts for the animals. There were English subtitles.The temporary exhibition on sea turtles was amazing. We loved the transparent walkway that allows us to have a top view of the swimming turtles.As for food - the cafeteria is sufficient but best to plan a meal elsewhere if you want something more sumptuous.Hop on, hop off buses have nearby stops to the Oceanarium at Plaça da Nações. There are nearby hotels too for those considering to stay close.Oh, one more thing! There is a little park with pedal bikes outside of the Oceanarium so when kids are needing a bit of fresh air, it's pretty easy to find some activities outside.

First thing on your to-do list.. The place is simply INCREDIBLE. It is amazing to see that huge diversity for species all together from so close.You feel like you are literally inside the ocean with all of them. One does not visit portugal with visiting the Oceanário: it is like they say, it's just like going to Rome and not seeing the Pope.
Only went as a rainy day....... ......but it was better than I imagined....massive aquarium.....at the Expo '98 Site....interesting architecture
Wonderful. Huge aquarium, very well organised, beautiful, one of the most beautifull I've seen. A massive central pool with sharks, etc. Temporary exhibit on turtles was really amazing too.

13€ worth to spend!. I was there this week, and I must say that It was one of the most interesting things that I have seen in my life. This is one of the world´s biggest, and the Europe´s biggest Oceanarium. You will have plenty of experiences and see a huge range of sea life that will make you experience good times!Very Very Worth IT
bad service food subpar. service was terrible and way to overpriced! I wouldn't return there ever. They charge for everything under the sun, even the butter! I wouldn't recommened to my worst enemy

Aquarium. If you have children it is good to visit, however it you have been to other good aquariums it is nothing special, there is other things to do in this area like shopping so is good for a day out.

Nice but not a must do in Lisbon. I enjoy all aquariums including this one. This is the first time I see a MOLA MOLA! In general, the exhibits were not as sharp and modern as I would expect from an international quality aquarium. I do recommend it!

Overcrowded, overpriced and overhyped attraction. The Oceanarium does offer a nice experience, but it is not as phenomenal as presented. In particular it is overpriced, when compared to other attractions in town. It requires long waiting in lines, and a massively overcrowded facility, which makes every attempt to observe things a stressful hassle carving one's way through the swarm of people.Unless travelling with children this is one attraction best to avoid.

Disappointing. We were very disappointed, but probably it's our own fault. We shouldn't have come here, since we visited the Oceanografic in Valencia (Spain) last summer. The Oceanografic is much newer and bigger, and there are also dolphins, whales, sealions etc.In Lisbon there are just fish and more fish. The penguins were quite entertaining, as was the temporary sea turtle exhibit, but overall it's just too expensive. They do offer a small discount if you have an international student card.

One of the best. This really is one of the best Aquariums I have ever been. There is such a variety of sea creatures. They appear to be in the same tank, but are not otherwise the sharks would be the only ones left! Well worth the money

Lovely relaxing time. A very relaxing time spent watching the beautiful creatures, the large tank was amazing. The setting is perfect, a stroll along the waterfront. Metro from Lisbon centre to Oriente, walk through the Vasco da Gama shopping Centre, (where there are plenty of fast food restaurants on the top floor) and out onto the waterfront, walk along to the right, the Oceanario is out to the sea. Enjoy!
Nice day out. Lovely day out for family or couples...we spent hours there and loved the concept. Try and buy the ticktes in advance as the lines are massive!
Beautiful.. Antistress therapy. Great experience. Beautiful creatures, could stay there all day watching and enjoying.
Competitive to San Diego CA and others. Nothing to dislike. The city is very well assisted by hotels and entertainment such as Ocenariium and the Shopping fabulous.

good for a rainy day. good for a few hours on a rainy day...
not the easiest place to find from the metro...bady signposted...
but the main tank is truly stunning and the side exhibits quite fun, move away from the main entrance and there are plenty of viewing points.

Quite magic. This was a great experience and probably one of the best in the world. Very modern. the exhibits were in naturalistic settings. Walking over glass with fish swimming under you was rather unsettling but magic.
incredible. well laid out, great viewing areas. easy to get to using the metro, reasonably priced close to expo site and great shopping mall.
Fishtastic. Brilliant! Great aquarium loved by both me and my three year old. Very modern lay out, friendly staff and provided some genuine gasps from all of us. Well worthy of a visit.

4* aquarium, 2* services. Visited on a very wet public holiday so we accepted that it would be very busy, but they should know this too so I can't understand why they would only have 2 counters selling tickets and 2 machines. The queues went right along the outside of the building, past the outside food area with no staff around to ask any questions if needed, this is something they should really try to improve on. But on the plus side, they did offer free entry for having a disability (think there was also free tickets for families with children under 5) but this isn't stated anywhere on their website or the board near the queue for tickets. You do obviously need something to prove your disability, I have found often in Europe they also ask for the % of your disability, for some reason having your disease etc is only worth a free ticket if you have it more than 80%. The aquarium, lots to see, easy to spend all day there if you have children. We were there for around 3 hours and saw quite a bit. They do have a varied amount of species to see such as the big tank with different sharks, sting rays and a big variety of other fish, otters, penguins, jellyfish, sea dragons, star fish.. the list could be very long! Tickets are €13 for the permanent exhibits for adults & there is an option to pay extra for the temporary exhibit. There are toilets dotted throughout the building with some areas to sit down or have something to eat. Glad we went, but don't think it is something I would feel the need to return to on another visit unless I had children. If you liked my review and tips, please click on the helpful vote button below :)
Very Good. Really good, the turtles and otters were fantastic, but not enough Nemo's.A good place to visit especially on a Monday as lots of other attractions are closed.

Great aquarium!. Great visit for those who really like fish and other items from the ocean. We went here because the weather was really bad and this seemed like a good option since we would hide from the rain.Apparently, we were not the only people in Lisbon thinking this. It was super croweded.But as mentioned in the headline. Great if you like marine life. And it cannot be this crowded all the time. Especially if the sun is shining.

An unexpected find for a rainy day. We woke uo to a very rainy day in Lisbon and decided to go to the aquarium. As it turned out this was one of the highlights of our stay. Not only was the aquarium very well done and very large, we also enjoyed the surrounding area which had a number of out door fountains and sculptures.
Plenty to sea (excuse the pun). A good experience. They have a very good policy of trying to work with the natural environments from where the exhibits originate.

One of the largest indeed. I was little bit hesitant to bring my family to this place at first may be because of the fee or may be because I've seen a lot of Aquariums big and small in the US and in Asia. Yet s'all worth it, that gimmick in that turtle section where you walk on a "riverlike thingy" is funtastic - mind/brain being fooled (to walk/step on it or to jump - turtles and fish swimming underneath you). A place to see/watch one giant Sunfish and several matured Sea Dragons - a WOW!!! Another special mention: those giant Otters, my mother feel in love with them, they seemed trained to captivate a guest as they skilfully sample their food/fish lovingly tossed to 'em by their trainer. I can go on and on... ...Oh! this place is close to a lot of interesting places too: the science museum, Vasco de Gama Mall/Tower, etc.

One of the best and largest aquariums in europe.. Presents a great diversity of species, supplemented with very clear and didactic information. The main aquarium is breathtaking, worth "losing" some time to contemplate the scenery.

Spring Break Fun. What do you do with kids on Spring Break when it is raining??? Take them to the Oceanario de Lisboa. The ticket price is a little steep but it is a great aquarium and worth the visit. The holding tanks for the fish are awesome. Around the tank are little benches in these cubby hole things that you can sit and take a break and watch the fish go round and round. It would be very romantic to bring a date here too and sit and watch the fish. We've been to quite a few aquariums and this one is pretty neat. Also having it located in the park surrounded by lots of restaurant options and room for kids to burn out energy is fantastic!
Visited. Very enjoyable and interesting. Worth a visit. It is part of a large park with many other attractions
Amazing. Had 2 good hours here. Admission is only 16€ per adult - worth the money! Must see the 3 otters, sooo cute!

only thing worth visiting. the aquarium is well worth a visit. however there is nothing else worth seeing out here in the Expo 98 Park. A very disappointing trip saved by the fantastic otters and super-cute penguins

Great day out. Loved this day out with friends, worth a visit for everyone of all ages. The otters and penguins are a real highlight and you can spend your time relaxing watching the fish, sharks and ocean wildlife.

Best aquarium in Europe. This aquarium is very well designed with a huge central tank and four additional areas (representing different world oceans) around the edges. Its got loads to see and has a good level of information supporting the exhibits in English. It is in the old World Expo site of 98, so there are loads of cafes and restaurants and a shopping centre too. Very easy to get too on the metro.
Go early to avoid the crowds. Mesmerizing large tanks with a many different fish. Also otters, reptiles and penguins. Good value at 11 Euro for adults

Pretty fun place. Probably would have given a higher rating had I not just visited an aquarium in Dubai. Quite enjoyed the different areas and habitats. Fish were pretty and overall it was a very calming way to spend a morning. Downsides are the crowds and the price. Found it a bit steep for what was on offer.

Wow!. We took a trip out to Parque das Nacoes to mainly visit the Aquarium but we got so much more when we arrived. This is a stunning area to visit and is in stark contrast to the older architecture of Lisbon City. The area was created for the Expo 1998 and its modern architecture tone was set by the impressive Oriente station. The gravity defying Portugal Pavilion has an enormous reinforced concrete roof suspended above its forecourt and makes you a tad nervous to walk beneath it. The cable cars that connect the Torre Vasco da Gama invite you to see the wonderful sights seen from their dizzying heights - I chose to admire them from below! We had lunch in Urizon restaurant along the seafront and we weren't too impressed. They left us waiting for ages for our food and only that we were enjoying the sun we would have complained. Beware when they bring you bread, olives, dips and cheese. These are not free! the plate of 4 slices of cheese was €4 and each pat of butter or tuna spread was 65c... I belive they left us waiting so long so we'd cave and eat them but I had been warned by a tripadvisor review to beware of this tactic...they did however get another beer from us.We then took a stroll down the walkway under the cable cars to the Aquarium....The aquarium is amazing! loads of unusual fish in a large central tank over two floors. They also had birds, frogs and the cutest otters ever! The turtle exhibition was good aswell although very busy, there seemed to be hundreds of teenage groups around but it is a great place for children of all ages - even adult children!Theres also a huge shopping centre, cinema, science museum, exhibition centre and a view to the longest bridge(17km) in Europe which is of course called the Vasco da Gama bridge as is the shopping centre and the tallest building in Lisbon the Torre Vasco da Gama. This area is easily reached by the red metro line that feeds the airport, it took about 20 mins to get there from Lisbon centre, we had to change line once but its very easy to navigate the metro stations.Really worth a days visit even more so if you have children and they've had enough of ancient churches etc.
amazing. The visit was wonderful ! aside from the fishes you can see penguins and sea otters diving and playing from very upclose.A pleasure for children and grownups.
Very nice place to visit. A different way of looking at the sea life with a huge aquarium and lots of animals. A good afternoon at Lisbon

A Must See if you have Children!. Even if you don't have children, the Oceanario de Lisboa is a must! It is a huge aquarium and is a wonderful place to take your children of all ages. We spent a few hours here on a rainy, windy day and had such a wonderful time! There was so much to see and do and the children were so excited to see up close and personal so many wonderful, beautiful ocean animals. Bathrooms and facilities are spotless and staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Take advantage of the nice little cafe as well! The prices are great and the Portuguese lunch was delicious! there are plenty of options for the little ones as well!

Very nice aquarium. My wife and I dad a nice morning exploring the aquarium. worth a stop. right on the water. Justg don't go in January, it rained and was very windy... Everyone said the rain was not unusual but the wind was.

One of the best aquariums in the world. If you like marine life and the underwater world, this is a great experience. Don't miss it. It's not the best aquarium in the world - but it is pretty good and up there with the best. It cost about 22 Euros to get in, which included the special turtle exhibition. It's lovely, takes about 2 hrs to get round and it means you get to see the unique and unusual Mola Mola (sunfish). The main tank is huge and has loads of good stuff including lots of pelagics and rays. In addition to the main fish tanks, there is loads of other stuff to see. penguins, turtles, reptiles, jelly fish, and of course, as others have said, you just can't beat the sea otters. Very cool.I highly recommend it and if you buy the open top bus tour ticket you can get there and back on one of their buses.

Great place to take children.. Its very nice place to visit and take your children.I am against fish in Aquariums better to see them while doing scubba however the living spaces are spacious and recreate marine enviroments.Everyone loves the Oters!
Fishy. Well worth a visit so much to see. The special, temporary exhib of rescued turtles was awesome. We saw species of fish there that we had never seen before.

Not to be missed!. I've visited many of the great aquaria in the US and Europe, and the Oceanario is one of the best I've experienced. A short walk from the Oriente Metro station takes you to the front entrance. I was there in the afternoon, along with dozens of school children, but I was able to get my ticket immediately and enter the building. A temporary exhibit of the rescue of the Kemp's Ridley sea turtles was very good - the design of the structure allows the visitor to watch all the creatures up close. The permanent exhibit is organized around the concept of the World Ocean, with a large central tank shared by hundreds of aquatic creatures, including sharks, rays, and schools of fish. The highlight for me, however, was the penguin exhibit, arguably the best I have ever seen. The visitor can get close enough to this open air area to almost touch the animals, and they are in large enough numbers to give one a great idea of the complexity of their lives. I watched one male build a nest, straw by straw (these are rockhoppers, btw), but I could also easily see others nesting, swimming, waddling around, etc. Be prepared to walk - the exhibit hall is large and can easily take a few hours. Good gift shop, too!

Lots of Walking. This is a wonderful site but it requires lots of walking and ditrections are hard to find. We went into the building and then after climbing up a long ramp had to come all the way back to a ticket booth located at the oppposite end of the building. Its well worth the time but try not to get lost.
Worth a visit. Went here because of other traveller reviews and it was well worth the effort. Very well designed with amazing range of ocean life and very informative. Definitely worth a visit.
Great variety of fish. Very interesting layout. Fish can be viewed at two levels with outside displays at corners showing penguins and otters.
Wooow!. I'm not really use to visit place like that in my home country but i really liked this place. You cannot help being astonished by the huge fishes ! It was a good visit yet a bit expensive

A good place for fish lovers. I had already been to the oceanario some years ago and during this second visit it was exactly as I remembered it. The central aquarium is the core of the Oceanario, with the rest developing around it.Best parts? The central aquarium, the cute nutrias and a variety of corals and tropical fishes.It would have been great to have seen a few changes more throughout the years, but overall I spent a good time there, and would recommend it to everyone!

Nice Experience even better for children.. The oceanario is a great option to know more about the sea and to observe big fish, if you have children don't hesitate and go or if you love nature such as I do also go and appreciate the beautiful fish there.

Great value half day out. Bit of a walk from the metro, but once there this is a really entertaining half day visit. The centre of the oceanarium is a huge water tank filled with a huge variety of fish - small and large. The exhibits surrounding this central tank are also highly entertaining (sea otters were my favourite!).A great place to visdit for adults and kids alike.
UNIQUE. It is really very good.You MUST visit it.It is close with the metro and the Calatrava complex is amazing .
A Must See. This is a unique aquarium and the care they have put into the exhibitions really shows. This is a must see while in Lisbon.
Aquarium. Brilliant - could see fish at so many different angles. Very well organised and good value. 15% reduction if you have already bought a yellow bus ticketRecommend using metro

don't miss the turtles and penguins!. such a big and interesting aquarium. the price is normal and they have %10 discount for students. interior design made me feel like i'm diving in the ocean with all visual things even with smells! you shouldn't miss this place!

Well worth a visit. I have visited many aquariums all over the world but I have to say than none have kept me as enthralled as Oceanario de Lisboa.It is very well planned out with nice airy spaces to allow for lots of people to enjoy the viewing windows. There is plenty to see and we spent about 2.5 hours wandering around. There are lots of unusual fish as well as the expected ones so a good all round balance. The design of how the oceans meet is pretty unique and seeing the open air enclosures on one level and then seeing it underwater is also cool.A couple of small negatives - there are no opportunities to interact really (a plus for Sentosa's aquarium) and the turtle exhibition wasn't as good as I'd hoped. The viewing areas were not as easy as the rest of the aquarium.
Great aquarium. Really well laid out huge aquarium with bilingual information (Portuguese/English).Cafe faciities and child-friendly areas.
Impressive Sea Life Experience. The Ocenario in Lisbon is located at the Expo area and offers a very impressive display of sea life. It is well worth a visit.

Excellent place to visit. Fantastic.... would certainly recommend.Great time spent looking at all the different fish. Loved the glass floor and seeing the turtles underneath our feet. Well laid out. Clean wc's. Lockers. Friendly & helpful staff. Shop / cafe.

Excellent aquarium to visit. Had an amazing time here. Very interesting temporary and permanent exhibitions. Very easy to get around the venue. This place is bigger than you think. The glass tunnels work well so you are close up to the sea life.Recommend this for adults and children alike.

Not a MUST VISIT in Lissabon. It's a good place with a good exposition of fish and turtures.We enjoyed but also came to a conclusion that it wasn't something really exciting.Such places one can find in many cities.Good if you're with children.But if you come to Lissabon I'd suggest to see something more typical.

AMAZING PLACE. I liked it all especially the temporary exhibition with the large turtles. The main aquarium is not as big as others but had lots of more unusual features such as free flying seabirds (be prepared to duck!), diving birds - puffins and razorbills - sea otters and almost all the main tanks gave you the ability to see above and below the waterline. Well worth a visit.

A very enjoyable visit at the Ocenario. We didn't plan to visit the Oceanario but decided to when our sightseeing-bus stopped in front. And I am glad we got off. Having visited a handful aquariums this one definitely ranks as one of the top ones, with a great selection and variety and a very well thought-out design. I can recommend the audio-guide if you have a special interest, but most of the time we were too busy looking around and exploring to bother tapping in the numbers on the device.The Oceanario is part of the World Expo-site from '98, and I would definitely encourage exploring the surrounding area. The site still attracts visitors with its beautiful layout and stylish streamlined green spots. The hangglider is fun to try as well. You will enjoy an amazing view and also see the huge compound that hosted the international pavilions during the Expo, all of which now look somewhat abandoned. Upon seeing this, close your eyes and try to imagine the atmosphere and noise of 10 million people(!) that visited the Expo over it's only 3 months duration.Overall, a very nice afternoon visiting the Oceanario and surrounding area!
Good but seen better.. The show of the turtles was really amazing and being here for half a day makes you froget about daily stresses. Very nice bit pricy though.
Love it. Do not hesitate to take few hours to have a perfect break in this place.... Beautiful fishes, nice and relax atmosphere so do not hesitate to visit it even if the price could be expansive !
Nice place for family with children. Worth to see, if you didn't see ever Oceanario before. Do not miss Temperate Pacific, they are gorgeous :)

vast waterworld. Great place for kids! You'll walk your legs off going round this place. Good value for money with lots to see and do. Set in a great part of Lisbon too with easy transport access and good shops and places to eat very nearby. In the tourist season there's even a little train that will take you around the area. A good day out!

WOW!!. You'll be struck in awe at the size of this place. I don't want to spoil it by telling you too much - but you HAVE to go here (oh, and the cable car, naturally). Say hi to the otters for me (if they're awake!! :)

You have to see it. A pity if you don't go there! The amazing large windows are a sight that you have to see just once in your life. Nearby is a large shoppingmall with large foodcourt, so it's perfect to combine these two.

Simply the best!. What a cool place! Floor to ceiling wall of glass... just one of the best aquariums in the world... better that Monterey! Fun to explore - great message of enviro awareness and sustainable oceans.

Muito interessante!. The visit to the Oceanário was very pleasant. They have a beautiful center aquarium surrounding all the inside of the building and a beautiful collection of colorful fish. They also offer the opportunity to watch a 20-minute video telling the story of the Oceanário and how it works. It's impressive. I loved it!

Wonderful afternoon. My partner and I visited the Oceanarium on our second to last day (of five) in Lisbon, and we absolutely loved it. As others have said it is something very different to do, a change of scene from churches, museums, and monuments. There is a lot to see even if most of the 'viewing' is of the central tank from different angles. We were there on a Monday afternoon and it was not crowded, affording us wonderful, up close & personal views. The area (Parque das Nacoes) is very nice to walk around as well. The only negative thing I can say is to avoid the cafe! There must be better places to eat in the area.
wonderful aquarium.. not expensive and just fascinating. Exhibits were really well done.We spent a whole afternoon on a rainy day.

Sharks and Starfish and Turtles, oh my.... Definitely worthy of part of your day in Lisbon... the 2nd biggest aquarium in the world, stocked with a great variety of marine life, including several different varieties of sharks, rays, and other deep sea fish. Nice recreations of different environments, particularly the arctic (featuring penguins and puffins). The sea turtle exhibit is fascinating, and the sea otters are too cute... Educational programs also available. Be advised, the Oceanarium is quite a walk from the nearest subway (20 minutes-plus), and you will have to walk through a shopping mall to get to it. But definitely worth the walk.

Veryinteresting and well maintained.. The aquarium is very nice with different species. It has different water tanks with sharks, turttles, etc ...The area where the aquarium is located is very nice with a mall full of restaurants. It's a must when visiting Lisbon.
Amazing architecture. Outstanding architecture and interesting content. Interactive exhibits and just a great space. The pool gives a very peaceful atmosphere.

Great experience for all that like or have fish tanks. It was a great experience to be in contact with such a variety of marine life. There are some quite strange fishes around there and, as always, penguins make the whole thing even more interesting. great place to start exploring the Expo area in Lisbon.

Excellent Aquarium. We spent an afternoon here to escape the rain and what a delightful place this is.
Plenty to see in an afternoon.
Lots of viewing room so everyone can get a good look.
Turtles and otters have to be my favourite.

Learned a lot and saw a lot of sea life close-up!. The oceanarium was well worth the price! (13 euro) We skipped the turtle exhibit and just paid for admission to the permanent part. The signs were very informative, in English and in Portugese, and I like how they stressed proper care for the oceans and gave tips on how we can help the oceans. Near the end of our time there, there is a theater area where they show a video on how they feed and care for the fish, and it was fascinating. I saw fishes I had never seen before, like the ocean sunfish. The otters and penguins were so much fun to watch. The main tank was amazing, but make sure you see all the smaller tanks too! Some of the areas were very dark, which I didn't like too much, but that's my only complaint.

Good for adults, too. My wife likes to scuba dive, and I don't, but here you can get a good impression of what it is like to be in (crowded) see: a wide range of fish, floating right by you, as you stand up against the glass wall cruved around in the three story aquarium. And all this not being cold and wet, and not being afraid of the human size shark bearing down on you. They also provide a 15 minute documentary with english subtitles explaining how the aquariam works, how they feed the fish (so the sharks and other large fish aren't always eating the small ones). it is a relaxing place to sit after a four hour walking tour of Lisbon.I like how the center is split into different climate zones: antartica with its penguin family, and otter pond, a warm Indian ocean, and so on. An unique experience (which really has nothing to do with Lisbon, though it does show the quality of Portuguese scientists).

Great experience. My wife and I spent a couple of hours when visiting this interesting place. If you are visiting Lisbon, a visit to the oceanarium is a must see. Reduced price for senior +65. Easy to reach by Metro (red line) to station Oriente. The Oceanarium is within walking distance from the station and with the sun shining a very beautiful tour.The main tank is just great, you walk around and are able to see all the fantastic fish. Beautiful arranged and things divided from the different oceans. Very popular for nursery school's and their enthusiasm may lead to some noise. You may rent an audio guide in deiiferent languages, which will guide you and give informations about the different views you pass by in the Oceanarium. Just press the number on the wall at your audio.If you visit at luch time, they have a nice cafe with a daily lunch offer, and you may sit inside and outside. Finally a souvenir shop with a wide selection of items releated to the oceans.We spent 4 hours in the Oceanarium and the time were well spent.
great place. great place-but too much noise made by lots of kids groups ;(is no possible relax and enjoy peaceful view

Beautiful way to spend a few hours at. If you are in Lisbon for a few days, you should definitely visit the Oceanarium. If possible do it on a Monday, because museums are closed on that day. In its centre there is a huge tank with sharks and other fish from all over the world. They have a permanent and a special exebition. The latter was about sea tourtels. The aquarium has two floors. One can see penguins and many other species. It is great. The aquarium's shop is quite pricey. But the restaurant in the aquarium has a good offer for a reasonable price.

great afternoon. allow yourself an afternoon and comfy footwear for this. Great time to be had by all the family. we went in the afternoon, that just happenend to coincide with feeding time for the otters and penguins- this was the icing on the cake for us.

Decent aquarium not large at all. This aquarium was quite pricey and was honestly not that large. It took us about an hour to go thru it and that was with a small child. It is very pretty but it does not offer anything special. This is one central tank that you basically view from different angles and different floors. I have been to many aquariums like the one in Philly and Baltimore and DC and this one pales in comparison.

Great central tank. The aquarium's two floors are centered around a massive tank with sharks and some crazy looking fish like the giant grouper. It's awesome. I took some great photos. Besides that, the other tanks are just okay. The two I liked the most were the penguins and otters but they are super tiny.

One of the more interesting acqariums. Interesting architecture building and ocean displays from various climate zones, You get very close to the animals. The sea otter family is very funny to watch, Luminescent jellyfish.

Unforgettable experience!. As my first time in a real oceanario, I was very impressive with the size and the number of marine species.
The only bad thing was the big lines to buy the tickets, so I decided to buy directly from the machines with credit card, that´s the best option.

Wonderful selection of underwater habitats from around the globe. Brilliant collection of creatures in their underwater habitats from around the globe despite the eyewatering 16 euro entry fee for chidren aged 12 years and overIt can get a bit crowded especially at feeding time for the cute sea otters.The cafe was very expensive and the cappuccino is really a Nescafe sachet from a vending machine at the till.Otherwise the attraction was great
fantastic. the Oceanario is a great attraction for kids and adults, not to be missed, a bit expensive, but worth it

a great place to see. I have liked very much the Oceanario of Lisbona.It is a great place in the former Exposition site, very well organize with stunning fishes and other animals to see.Is great to visit it with the audioguide because speaces are so many that you run the risk to get lost while visiting.Anyway is a great experience for your eyes to see all this perfectly placed in a great setting.I enjoyed very much also the exibition on turtles that was very interesting to see.The location is easy to reach withnthe metro and, passing through a nice Shopping center, by walking 10 minutesto reach it
nice place. we enjoyed the visit to the oceanarium and to his gardens. strongly recommend this location to be visited

Great Place to Spend an Afternoon.. The aquarium is located at the old Expo 98 fairgrounds. There is not much left of the Expo but a few places to eat and the aquarium. The fair grounds are very spacious and near the water and make for very pleasant walking. The aquarium is very well laid out and quite large. Lots of different sealife. Well worth a look and for a nice walk and lunch as well.

Great way to spend the afternoon. The Oceanário is a really cool place to take kids. There's lots of different species and all the rooms have very good explanation posters with interesting information. The central tank is really nice to just sit down and look at.There was an alternative show about turtles not worth the entry fee. But the main attraction is really good.

Loved the otters. The whole Oceanarium was very beautiful and well administered. I enjoyed it very much. But the otters kept me there for an hour. I got there at feeding time and the whole display they made for us eating and then cleaning themselves as just amazing.

Brilliant.. I used to live in Portugal for ten years, when I was a child. Of all my memories, the most vivid are of the Oceanario. Countless times when we hit up that part of Lisbon (Vasco Da Gama Mall, Parque Das Nacoes, etc.) we would go to the Oceanario. The diversity of animals here is wonderful, prices are not too bad and the enviroment is great, Every once in a while there might be a tour group of school children, but the expanse of the facility lets you distance yourself from them. My most cherished memories are of this wonderful place, and it still retains its magic.

LIKE UNDER THE SEA. We visited Lisbon inJanuary,but for my children OCEANARIO was great experience.In this place ,you can see all oceans on the Earth.They have so many fish,birds,and one part Oceanario is about turtles.The message is -"SAVE THE OCEAN AND SAVE WATER CLEAN".Price -familly ticket-42 Euros.
Loved it!. I loved it very much, it is very well organized and easy to reach, the surroundings are good for a great walk too. I enjoyed it definitely.

underwater beauty. Surelly one of the best underwater Museums we have seen. although without a "tube" under the sharks, like many others have, this one is really well placed, has many different fish species and birds, turtles, etc. It's a 10 to 15 minute walk from the Oriente Metro Station towards the river and right turn. the walk is great with nice weather. Not so nice if its raining. parking is easy as it has many Parks around. After the Oceanarium, I advise a walk towrds the marina or Vasco da Gama bridge, always by the riverwalk.
Lisbon Aquarium. Loved this place. Saw a lot of sea creatures we have not seem before. The otters were a hit. Lots of birds. Tiger sharks. We wanted a change of pace and enjoyed our day here.

Best aquarium ever!. Really enjoyed our visit here! Some great exhibits especially the sea turtle installation, the central tank with sun fish, the otters and the penguins! The focus of the Oceanario on marine conservation and education was really great!

Great experience. as i have already been to many other bigger aquariums in the past, i just wanted to go in and have a quick look...but i ended up spending almost 4 hours!!! during my visit, there was a special theme on turtles and their conservation and it was just fantastic..the place was very well maintained and organized...its one of the few places where you can actually see the sea creatures from a glass panel under your feet...the restaurant inside the oceanarium was also good..highly recommend..

One of the best aquarium in Europe. We visited the Oceanarium of Lisbon and loved it. Wonderful experience, perfect for kids and ocean lovers. The large aquarium makes you feel like you're inside the water swimming with the fish. The park near the river where it is located, where the world exhibit Expo98 was held is also very nice and you can rent bikes along the river. Unforgetable experience.

One of the high points of a trip to Lisbon. I just love it. You can spend up to 3 hours and lose yourself in the deep ocean. The children love it and so will you. A bit expensive but once you are there you forget about the cost!
Well worth the trip. Outstanding Oceanarium, very well designed and maintained to very high standards. Plenty to see, and worth the trip just to see the impossibly cute Sea Otters alone!
One of the best. If you have children, grab a sleepping-bag and put them to sleep in the Oceanário. It will be an amazing experience for them.

Fun!. My partner and I visited Oceanario de Lisboa on November 2012 during our 3-night visit to Lisbon and it was highly enjoyable!Both of us haven't been to an aquarium for a relatively long time so it was refreshing to see that it is still a great and fun place to visit.A large variety of fish and other sea creatures were on show for a reasonable price.Surprisingly, we had the least expensive and best-tasting soup in Lisbon at the cafeteria/dining area of the aquarium.

Truly fascinating!. I'm not really one for aquariums having only ever visited a rather poor example of one in England. We decided to give it a go as we were visiting the Parc Nacoes area and we are glad we did. I am not a nature geek but this was fascinating from the sea turtles, sea otters and penguins to the rather bizarre prehistoric looking sunfish and devil fish. You could spend all day in there quite easily. There are 2 types of tickets a combined ticket which includes the main permanent exhibition and smaller temporary exhibition for 16 euros per adult or a visit to the permanent exhibition only which is slightly cheaper at 13 euros. We decided to get the combined ticket as it mean we could see the sea turtles in the temporary exhibition up close. David Attenborough eat your heart out!We spent a good half day in there and had our lunch in the restaurant which was very nice and reasonable. The admission is a little pricey at 16 euros and we were initially sceptical however it was well worth it as it is very impressive. There are signs in English so you can read about the different species.All in all would recommend for a visit.
Oceanario, don't miss it. Spent 3 hours around one of the biggest aquaria of the world. Interesting and usefull information, just enjoy all the impressions and learn about ocean life.
Top notch!. Not to miss if you have some spare time in Lisbon. There are a lot of places to visit in Lisbon, but if the day is cold or rainy, you should not miss it. Very nice!!

Beautiful!. It has a lot of species and it's huge!It's perfect for a family visit and it's located on a great area of Lisbon where you can walk all day!It's expensive but you will not regret it. It a must visit attraction in Lisbon so don't miss it.

Perfect even for bigger children!. Although it is a bit expensive, it is a really good trip for bringing out the child in you!As well as a reallly impressive two storey main tank, they had penguins, otters, seahorses, sea dragons, turtles etc and we spent a lot longer in here than we anticipated. Give yourself at least 2 hours and try to be there for the feeding times

THE NEW LISBON. Bought for Lisbon's Expo 98, the best atmosphere of the new side of the city, surrounded by mourn condos, hotels and shopping malls. Worth spending an afternoon there, especially for those, like me, haven't visited Lisbon in the past two decades.

Excellent. Amazing place to visit when in Lisbon. Easy to reach with Metro (some 10-15mins walk). I was really surprised how huge the main tank is. Good choice for families with children. Although price is high still worth to see it :)

A fun attraction for a day out. We loved the Oceanarium! A simple concept of 'all of the oceans are one ocean' means that there is one vast central tank adjoined by four others, each of which represents a different ocean. You can walk through first at a height, and then recirculate to see what's going on beneath the surface - esp good for the penguins at feeding time! Plus you get the weird view through the tanks so just behind the penguins you can see the sharks and rays in the central tank! The current temporary exhibition is of turtles - which, again, is brilliantly done so that you can experience them swimming beneath your feet - and then over your head. Kids loved this zone! There's some very good educational messages about recycling and not dumping plastic bags too. At 16 euros each it's not the cheapest attraction but it is one you could easily spend many hours enjoying.
great!. check it out, its huge and has lots of different species, very interesting however the price is a bit too high

Nice place to Visit. My wife and I visited this place back in June 2012. It was the first aquarium that we have been too and it was a great experience. The scenery around the aquarium was good too, we walked around and enjoyed the day. Good place to visit, it was pricy though so check prices before you go if your on a budget.

Very nice aquarium, but at a cost. Having some time off in Lisbon in January, I decided to give the Aquarium a try. It's a bit more expensive, costing 16 euros each (I believe about 10 for the aquarium and 6 for the turtle exhibit, but I could be mistaking). The temporary exhibit was not that special, allthough they had the biggest turtle I've ever seen in my life - the sheer size of the thing was mind blowing.The main aquarium was very pleasant and impressive to watch. They had several species I hadn't seen in other aquariums (such as the ocean sun fish, for example) and some nice habitats with, amongst others, pinguins and sea otters. The habitats looked very high quality.If you like marine life or animals in general, the Oceanario is definitely worth it. It's defnitely more impressive than any other aquarium I've seen - though I would personally recommend to skip the temporary turtle exhibit they've got on at the moment (January 2013) if you're not specifically interested in turtles.

Fun Visit but hot walk. The aquarium was a fun visit. The open water tank is quite large and has many vantage points as you walk though the building. It was a little hard to get to, subway and then a short walk, but the day we went it was obscenely hot and the unshaded walk from the subway station mall to the aquarium was trying even for young people like us.
Nice place. The oceanario was great animals and fishes lovley but the food at the restaurant was horrible.. over cooked meat and dry chips
best aquarium. go you will not be disappointed especially the main tank and the birds and penguins. Watch out for large noisy groups though and get there early
Not only for children. The site is great, with a clever distribution of space. I loved the animals, mainly the lontras and the sharks

A relaxing few hours.. This was my first visit to a large aquarium so maybe I'm more easily impressed than other reviewers but I thought it was the highlight of my trip to Lisboa. I could spend all day sitting in the aquarium (and there are seats for just that) watching the fish go by. There's a huge selection here from sharks to mackerel, penguins to otters and bioluminescent jellyfish. A+
