Great Facility - Fun few hours. We had a day in Lisboa and from all the great review we decided to check out the aquarium. As others reviews told it was a very nice aquarium. English at most displays so we learned a thing or two...The turtle exhibition was on at the time of our visit and it was fun! The area around the aquarium is very nice as well.

Really Interesting. It's worth a visit to the Oceanario de Lisboa. Go with plenty of energy as it's a big place with an amazing number of aquatic creatures to see. At the beginning I thought there wasn't enough information available but as I moved through the exhibits I realised they were "drip feeding" it (no pun intended) along the way so that it was easier to absorb.

Well worth the visit. Travel out on the 728 bus route, we made the mistake of jumping on the 759, which although it got us there it did travel around every possible housing estate en route. 16 euros gets you full entry.

Definitely worth exploring .. Coming from the Indian Ocean island of Mauritius and having already visited numerous aquariums , I still decided to take my family to visit the Lisbon Ocenarium as it was highly rated by Trip Advisor. The size and design of the main tank along with variety of the species made all the difference and the kids loved it. Definitely worth exploring if you are in this part of Lisboa.
Skip this place, expensive ticket. Big tank in the middle...thats basically it.Expensive ticket for 30 mins max to explore the entire venue.
Excellent. Really fancy place for kids and adults also. The coolest ocenario I´ve seen! Here I would come with my kids!

Le Must!. Absolute Le must for everyone!Although I am great fan of aquariums (no zoo) this was absolute revelation. I spent almost 3 hours there, without a second of being bored. Facility is very big, and don't expect to go through in half an hour. Fishes are great to watch in such atmosphere, with dark lights and sounds of nature all around. I was there in January, shot ~200 pics, but I can guess how wonderful it must be to spend here few hours on a hot, summer day. Especially kids will love it.

Don't miss the turtles. Went to the aquarium as it was wet and we had a discount from the tour bus. One of the best aquariums we've been to, good to have all the info in English as well as Portuguese and the whole place is very well laid out with lots of viewing places. Highlight was definitely the turtles exhibit which is well worth the extra few euros.

Nice acquarium. Went here in january, dit not regret this. It was very nice to see the different creatures of our oceans. Main tank was huge, with huge glass walls. Temporary exhibit of the sea turtles was splendid.
One of the best in the world. Its magical, astonishing and breath taking. Wonderful engineering task. Great for kids and adults of any age.

A nice visit. Children and grown ups will love the visit to the Oceanarium. It is very well kept, the place it is situated deserves to be seen and have to be completed with a trip in the cable cars just opposite it.

Lindo. I found it really nice to see an exhibition before, showing the damage pollution is causing on the oceans. The architecture is impressive, and the fact that they have a central and huuuuuuge aquarium for the most part of the fauna, was just great. It seems the animals have really a lot of space to move.There are some hidden windows around it, I just enjoyed sitting quietly there on the floor and admiring the fishes.On you way out, make sure to take the chair lift and go check all this modern side of the city.

very pleasant adventure in the under water world.. To go to the Oceanarium, get the red line metro, to Orient metro station, A Spanish designed station. Have a look at Vasco Da Gama shopping center. Then 10 minutes walk to the Oceanarium. You can get on cable cars after finishing the visit.The building is Very Well designed, that you go along your way very easy. Under water world is represented perfectly. this is the second aquarium in the world ( after the one in Canada ). Kids will love the visit. Amazing photographs could be taken. enjoy the trip. Near by, is the new Lisbon Casino, have a look.
Day out with kids. Take the kids, have some fun, learn about the oceans.Subway available. Sharks are a must. Even my younger - 22 months love itA unique experience.

TOP. Beautiful and full of species. A bit expensive the ticket but in the end it worth the visit. It is located in the Parque das Nações and after you can walk around in a pleasant promenade nearby the river Tejo

Excellent aquarium exhibit. Excellent place to see while waiting for a late flight from Lisbon. Our whole family loved it. The huge aquarium with the broad selection of species. The temporary exhibit of turtles with the glas bridges over water with swimming turtles and fish, all very well organised. It did not feel crowded to walk around there, entrance was affordable as well.

In two words: fantastic and amazing!. I went there to keep the little ones entertained for a while, but I never thought I would like it so much!!From the diversity of the species presented to the whole set up, this magnificent aquarium was definitely worth the trip. The major con is the cost to get in, but it is one of those sites that you have to see! There aren't that many aquariums like this one, and this one is absolutely fantastic!And don't forget your camera at home!! While they don't like you using flash inside, you can definitely get some unforgettable pictures while touring this amazing facility! And by the way... this is suitable for ALL ages

B-e-a-u-tiful!. I went there with my sister (ages 22-24). at first when we got in and so the map, we weren't very impressed.... but the we started walking inside and were amazed by many things we saw! we thought this will take us about 1:30 min, but we were there almost 3 hrs! Try getting there when feeding time (around 3pm if im not mistaken).

Splendid. A huge aquarium at the Parque das Nações. I don't know many aquariums, so all I can say is that it is awesome. You can take pictures (without flash) and you'll find a spectacular display of a very large collection of species. Must see them!!

Fantastic aquarium. It's quite expensive, as there is no discount for teens - but it was worth it. There is a lot to see, and the windows are spotless so you really get a good views into all the aquariums. The also have several kinds of penguins and some loverly sea otters which were so cute! Come early if you go on the weekends - after 1100 the queue can get enormous.

The sea at your fingertips. If you are interested in the sea and its creatures, don't miss this attraction. You will see things you have never seen before including luminescent coral, a fish with fins on the top and bottom (not sides), sea dragons and many types of penguins and sea birds. Because of the way things are done, you can see fish from all angles as they swim over and around you. Children of all ages will like this place. The Oceanario has a temporary and permenant exhibit and you can buy tickets to one or both. Individual, senior, student and family tickets are available. The staff speaks several languages including English. Audio guides are not available but there is adequate signage in several languages.

reserve at least a whole hour!. the most amazing Aquarium i have ever seen. the penguins part was so i teresting! Jaw dropping and fantatic! for kds and adults. tip: spend some time sitting on one of the many benches facing the shark ocean!

Nature and oceans at his best. Fantastic place to visit not just for its beauty but for all the aknowledge that you get about science and Oceans and marine life.The Park of the Nations where it is located is also a must ...
Simply the best. The best Ocean museum I have ever seen. And i have seen several all over the world. My children lovend it. My wife and I thought it was amazing.

Great continent displays with birds and otters. We really enjoyed this aquarium. We were not planning to visit but glad we did. The best part was the displays for various continents including Antartica which had birds and otters really close up and in their natural environment. The aquariums with the fish were well set up as well with lots of variety around the large tank. Seeing penguins swimming towards you underwater was great fun. Got some great photos and videos.
Like you are inside the ocean. Its a good claim to protect the oceans and to save the sea life from the stupidity from men. A real beatyful place.

Nice aquarium. This aquarium has a very big central tank, surrounded by smaller tanks on all sides. It's great for kids [judging from how many there were], a bit noisy if you're looking for something quiet.

OMG the otters had blankies. This was a magnificent day out, wonderfully large exhibition they had a separate turtle exhibition in December with a glass floor you could walk over and see the turtles swimming underneath. The main Oceanario was breathtaking and although im not really a fan of animals in captivity you did get a genuine sense that this was conservation rather than captivity. We spent hours wandering around sitting watching the many species swim about. My all time favourite were the otters which made me feel 5 again one had a white blanky which it would swim with hold and put over its head to amuse its fellow otters and the watching humans, i was crying with laughter. To be able to see the penguins on the surface and on the ground floor swimming underwater was a very special sight. Memories that will remain with me for a long time, i feel spoilt now, aquariums tut tut it has to oceanariums now :-)

Great fun. My favourite attraction in Lisbon, super fun and well kept. Lots of species I haven't seen before. Location makes it a great day out also as you an go for a walk on the docks after and there are loads of restaurants and other activities like cycle hires etc just outside

Excellent spot. It's impossible to remain indifferent to the beauty of this aquarium. Visiting Lisbon, is a mandatory local to visit. It has a great diversity of marine species, with good facilities for children and seniors.

great way to spend a half day. We visited the Oceanario on Christmas Day and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Don't miss otter feeding time--the highlight of our visit! Signs throughout the facility are in both Portuguese and English, so you won't miss out on anything.
Marvelous. This is one of the best aquariums I have visit. The tank was so big, it was not possible to see straight through it.

Definitely worth the visit. Didn't anticipate spending so much time here. They have quite a few tanks but the main tank is massive and what grabs your attention. It is over 2 floors in height and have good collection of sea fish/animals. If you are in to cable cars, there is one just 5 minutes away running along the coast line.

Never Forget!. Amazing! It's a great visit to do with your girl/boyfriend! Spetacular views of the oceans and the opportunity of visit the oceans of the world in a few hours. Recommendation: Prepare your visit to 2/3 hours. Totally worth!

The tragedy affecting our oceans revealed.. I was not particularly bothered about going but came away very impressed and also sad. Impressed by the amount of work they are doing for conservation but sad that so much damage is being done to our oceans and and the wonderful creatures and plants that exist within them. Sad too to see huge fish swimming round and round the giant aquarium. Particularly the giant ocean sunfish. I suppose keeping them captive to impress and educate visitors on conservation may be justified. I hope more visitors join Greenpeace.

Rivals the Vancouver Aquarium!. We love our aquariums and this one does not disappoint with a spectacular central tank filled with a variety of species and several surrounding rooms divided by geographic location. Excellent and well worth the trip.

Breathtaking!. An absolute joy! This attraction puts to shame all the aquariums I have ever seen. Set on the water, it is just spectacular. Imagine seeing these aquatic creatures in a place so close to their natural habitat, just unbelievable. We visited on a Thursday in December, so it was extremely empty and it seemed we had the place to ourselves. The care and love these people have is displayed in the documentary which you should not miss at the aquarium. They make their own saltwater! Creatures you have never seen are here; you must wear your sneakers because there is a lot of walking involved especially if you take the metro. Don't leave Lisbon without a visit.

Perfect for a rainy day in Lisbon. The weather wasn't great so we chose to visit Oceanario de Lisboa and it was excellent. Although I must say I don't think I would like t be there when its really busy! We arrived about lunchtime and there was a small queue and very was to walk around the tanks and different areas. There was a turtle exhibition which we also visited. Fascinating and all the signs are in English too.Appeals to kids and adults and is a great place to spend a few hours. We also stopped off at their cafe afterwards and had a drink and pastry, reasonable prices and edible! The whole area around Oceanario has lots of other things to do including cable cars, shopping centre and lots of restaurants.A great visit and would recommend.

One of the places worth to see in Lisbon. Visiting Oceanario is worth to see, located in newly built EXPO 1998 area. Easy walk through the 4 oceans. The octopus is really good one, if you had chance to spot it.
Excellent!. If you are visiting Lisbon you have to visit the Oceanario. It's good for children and adults. Amazing tanks that will make you feel part of the sea! Great attraction!

MUST - DON'T MISS. At first I thought, well it's just fish. What interesting could there be?It was a wonderful surprise. Although the tickets are a little expensive it totally worth it. It's the best thing in Lisbon.I traveled in all tourist spots in Lisbon and this is definitely a must. There is a huge - 2 floors aquarium with all kinds of nice fish, and also birds and animals. Also from time to time there is a temporary exhibitions. In short - don't miss.Oh, it says that there is a discount on the web, worth trying.
very nice place. A beautiful detour from old town, both for adults and children, in the Expo '98 area. A big central pool is surrounded by smaller pools and the visit goes all around it.

The best Ocean complex I have ever seen. Beautiful 2 floor exhibition to show differences between all the oceans of the world. Perfect design will lead you into deep water the most natural way. I think everybody will find all info they needs. Great also for education of all ages. From kids to seniors. Building is placed in Expo 98 areal, which u will also love, so go and visit!
Perfect Aquarium. Nothing to say much. Just go and have fun. They simulate the four big ocean in this aquarium and all of them are great. One of the best aquariums i have ever been.
Watch and Relax. Four ecological ambients, nice struture, good space and information. Only need more places to stand watching sea life for five or ten minutes.
Loved it!. Seaturtles, beautiful fish and nice animals to watch. Unfortenatel, you can see that the birds suffer under the flashlights of the cameras, so make sure you switch off your flash!

Beyond Words. The Oceanario de Lisboa is a fantastic place for folks of all ages. We enjoyed the beautiful building for its architecture and the encyclopedic array of species. It is a bit of a walk from the Metro Station, so be prepared for a bit of a stroll... especially if it is raining, for there is little cover.
fish adventure. it was a very nice place i had been thr in dec and if your a fish fan you are gona love it and have a time of your life
Interesting facts to experience. Spent a couple of hrs here and learn about marine life.Visit the cafe Tejo and enjoy lunch the cheap way.

Excelent Aquarium!. I totally sugest a visit, they have a lot to see (the all oceans are represented), many species of fish, enough information about it, When i visit they had also a temporary exhibition of turtles! Excelent for children but also to adults too! :)

best i,ve been in.. The turtle display was out of this world and in general the whole adventure was first class. The fact that you were actually in the same area were birds were flying and penguins were walking was great.

One the best I've ever visited. This Aquarium is one of the best I have ever been to - from the layout to the exhibits. It was raining one day and we decided to check it out. It is well worth the visit, every Ocean is represented in this Aquarium and the amount of displays are amazing. You can just sit and watch the main tank for hours. Sharks, manta rays, giant sunfish, massive schools of fish. I have dove all over the world and this is the next best thing. diver, I have , the only way you could be any closer would be to dive. As a di

A good half day visit. The temporary exhibit was great but not as good as the main exhibit. I went early in the day in November and there was no queue. There was no queue when I left at lunchtime.Food was pricey in the cafe. Your route around the exhibits is well organised through ocean areas and is well thought out. It's a lot more than an aquarium! I stopped off here whilst doing one of the bus tours of the city and got a small discount n the entry price.

The idea of water. At this place you will learn about the world wide oceans. And see lots of animals hat live in in it, live! Go there on a rainy day or spend some time in the nearby shoppingarea. Excellent for familys with children. If you have the Lisboacard it´s a good ide to use it on this attraction, ie moneyworth.

First aquarium visit ever!. Loved the Oceanario, the Turtle exhibition was fantastic. So many varieties of fish and great for kids. The exhibits near the exit about the waste that lands on shores in Kenya was very informative and really left me making sure I recycle.

Oceanario de Lisbon. Great, but avoid weekends or holiday season as it gets packed! not easy to find. If coming from the Metro, ask for the right exit and once outside look for the rather boring looking building.

Never gets old. Love this place, so peaceful. The main tank is quite large and there are loads of smaller tanks, so there are enough fish to keep the visit going for at least 2h.The tickets are quite expensive though.

Excellent organization and layout of displays. Our family toured the aquarium and the science center. We loved the way the aquarium is laid out. The sea turtle exhibit was on display and we LOVED that. They are amazing creatures. At the end of the museum was an art exhibit of sculptures made with the floating trash that is recovered from the oceans (flip flops, plastic plastic plastic, car parts, candy wrappers, .... you name it.) Our kids were absolutely affected by this display and it's tangible/visible reminder of our affect on the planet. Well done!
Awesome. The organisation and well thought out exhibits made it a fun and amazing experience. The Sea Turtle exhibit being the best.

Very fishy. One of the best, if not the best aquarium I have ever visited. We were only there for the day so only spent about 3 hours there but you could have spent all day there watching the fish (especially the Mola Mola moon/sun fish), otters, penguins and turtles.
Great fun for everyone. One of the world' leading structures of its kind. A real fun place for all the family. Just take the tube and leave at Oriente Station.

Amazing. I have visited several aquarium but for sure this is one of the best. Majestic and very well cured as for the details and the elements it showes. Great place and really close to the expoBorn2travel
Must see. Impressive facility, outstanding acquarium where you can see many species very close by, along with great information

Magical. We had to queue for a very long time to get into the Oceanario but it was really worth it. An absolutely magical day out. The central aquarium is mesmerising with a huge number of different species on show.We also saw the temporary sea turtle exhibit which was worth paying extra for. The best bit of the whole place is the sea otter enclosure though - they were definitely the cutest animals I have ever seen.

Not to be missed. I own a marine aquarium so I'm very picky about the quality of aquariums for the general public. Often they have nice fishes but poor condition for the corals and other small animals. Not the case on the Oceanario, every display from the huge central aquarium to the species-specific ones are well maintained and the animals doing great. Currently they have a temporary exhibit on the sea turtles that are really worthy. My toddler had a blast with the turtles swimming under him.

Awesome!. Amazing aquarium! The fantastic layout showcases the main tank (sharks, big fish, rays, etc) while giving you a diverse set of smaller exhibits. The staff is friendly and helpful (English friendly). And best yet, the prices are extremely reasonable.For photographers, you'll be very pleased with how clean they keep the viewing glass. Also note, they close the doors to new visitors an hour before closing, so don't wait until the very end to show up.

Excellent!. This attraction it's wonderful, it's big and good value for money.The main area has great views of the fish and you can sit down and watch the fish swimming by.I recommend this place especially if you have children with you.

great aquarium. My kids loved this attraction. It was really unique to have the big tank in the middle as you could see different fish as you went down the levels. The first attraction was the sea turtle exhibit. The favorite there was walking on the glass and having the sea turtle swim underneath your feet. My kids thought it was fun to pretend to ride the sea turtle. Our favorite exhibit would be the sea otter exhibit. Those little guys were adorable. I also liked the exhibit of different fish from around the would, that kept my interest oh and the octopus was really cool to watch once he started to actually move.
GREAT!. fantastic aquarium. best i have ever visited, the different areas are fantastically designed. especially loved the sea otters. Great value and easily accessible by the metro.

Enjoy like a sea otter. The Ocenario is really something special for people who like to be in touch with nature. It has a big tank with some very interesting species of fish, including the moonfish and some small sharks. It also has a section of birds and it covers all the oceans of the world.The sea otters and penguins were also pretty good. The fact that the place is constantly reminding you of the importance of protecting the sea was something that I also liked a lot.It does't take a lot of time to cover the whole place and I actually expected more for the prices they have (students discount exists but is almost nothing).The gift shop has lots of stuffed animals perfect for a souvenir for that special one that was not with you at that time or for the kids.Go to the Oceanario if you're staying for more than two days otherwise, you have more interesting places to go.

Superb!. Every single time that I stop by Lisbon I make a point of going to Oceanario. The atmosphere is incredible. The place itself makes me feel like a small child again. The wonders in here are unending. Highly recomended if you have children with you as they will not forget the experience any time soon.

a Must for those that want to learn about the sea. This is a must for those that want to learn about the sea or are just curious. The environment is suburb and cosy... like as one is submerse in the deep blue.

Impressive aquarium. We visited the aquarium (without kids) and it was a great experience. They had a special turtle exhibit where you could literally sit under some of the exhibits as the turtles swam inches about your head. The main aquarium was nice, with a central tank and four outer sections for different climates. The layout was pretty basic, but lots of informative and interactive components. The location of the aquarium is also nice, as you are right on the boardwalk and can enjoy a relaxing day outside after you leave.
Must-see. The best aquarium that we've ever been to. The massive tanks are so well designed. We particuarly love the Ocean Sunfish!

Great fun for all ages. This attraction is good value for money and you can tour it at your leisure. It has some great views of the fish and we were happy to sit watching for quite a while. Information on the displays is in English and there is an option for an audio guide. You get discount here with your yellow bus tickets or check with your hotel, many of the big hotels have discount agreed.
Not Monterey Aquarium but very good. A very enjoyable experience; not as well laid out as some similar aquaria but well worth the effort.

Impressive aquarium. This is a must see attraction. The second largest of its kind. Our four year old was as entertained and impressed as we were. I had never been so close to many of these fascinating sea creatures. Don't miss the playful otters. They put on a show for the visitors, hamming it up.
Portugal, portuguese and the ocean. This place is all about portugal and the ocean. Possibly the most important 20th century atraction to visit in Portugal!

Nothing like other aquariums. I recommend checking out the Oceanario even if you've been to other aquariums and are starting to feel you've seen enough of them. It is designed in a totally different way, with a central huge tank with all the fish, you feel really immersed. A truly pleasurable experience.

Reminds me of Baltimore. My title is much to the point! This area will remind you to some degree of the Inner Harbor in Baltimore . This is a beautiful first rate Aquarium.The surrounding area , which is a new area, is very interesting.There is a walking promenade by the river and a funicular that travels above the whole area.Also a collection of restaurants and a big mall across the the street.On a nice day , which we had, this is a lovely spot to visit.Go to Oceanario, take the funicular and walk the river , eat and relax.
Worth visiting. Beautiful place... One of the biggest aquariums in the world! You should definitly make a stop, you won't regret it

You must see!. I visited the oceanario with my husband and my 19 years old daugther, and we were surprised in a good way. We just loved! Although it is not huge, the Oceanario is a very complete aquarium, nicely maintained, and very well explored. There is a vast variety of animals and habitats exhibited, with emphasis on a cute family of otters that you can easily stay watching for more than half an hour. Even that Lisbon was full of must be seen attractions, and it is not, it would totally worth spending an afternoon in the Oceanario.
Very impressive. Superb. A "must see". A huge aquarium with sharks, barracudas, sunfish and other rare species. You can spend hours there just gazing at the sea life
recommend. we have visited London Aquarian and Disney. This was better. Variety, turtles, huge central tanka nd adorable sea otters

World class oceanarium. Impressive, large multilevel tank with fine collection of fish, corals, anemone, and many other types of sea life. Many viewing windows at different levels and small side aquariums with unique sea life. Well worth a two hour or more visit. Cost was 13 euro each. Located near Oriente metro stop next to Vasco De Gama Mall. A group of scientists maintain this Oceanarium and conduct research here.

Fun afternoon. Turtles, sea otters, sharks and fish most people didn't know existed. Really fun (and cute!) way to spend an afternoon. or go in the morning to avoid the ticket lines. Once we got inside, the crowds were not bad at all though.
A great day out...even for grown ups. Fascinating the central tank was awe inspiring...I could have sat all day watching...I'm not normally attracted by aquariums...but this is like no other....Go!

Expensive but captivating. Given the number of detailed descriptions of this attraction here on TripAdvisor I won't repeat this information. There is a long queue to get in, we waited probably 40 minutes even in the off season, so I dread to think how long one has to wait in high season. It was also expensive. However, it was definitely one of the highlights for my nine year old and we were all captivated, especially by the otters - we were lucky enough to catch them being fed which is unforgettably cute. The penguin feeding is also a great spectacle, but we're lucky enough to have witnessed this before, so it didn't touch us quite so much. There were loads of other fascinating creatures in the outlying tanks and it was very relaxing just sitting down in front of the main tank and watching the many species from different angles. A great way to spend an afternoon!

Not the best aquarium and totally over crowded. We were there on a weekend, which we should have considered before going. We went because it was a dreary day and it was the end of our trip so we were exhausted. The hop off hop on bus dropped us off right out front. The lines to get tickets were very long and we were cut off several times by rude people. This continued the whole time in the Oceanarium. There was a sea turtle exhibit when we went. The exhibit would have been great but people and kids just camped out on top of the glass viewing area or in front of it. Everytime a turtle came around, a mass of people would rush up. It was difficult to see the turtles.The absolute highlight were the giant sea otters. They were exciting and the area to view them was large enough that a bunch of people could line around the fence and all see them. All in all, it was a good time killer for two exhausted tourists. I would imagine this would be a must for people with children. I typically love Oceanariums, but this was a bit of a let down.

Beautiful experience. The oceanarium consists of one central aquarium which is absolutely unlike anything I have ever seen. Sharks, an entire school of macquerels, manta rays, more fish than I could imagine. Besides that one aquarium, there are also four 'smaller' aquariums, each for a different ocean. The arctic aquarium has pinguins and sealions, for instance, so 'small'is very relative. There are also two floors, from the upper floor you can look down on the water surface and see birds and mammals and from the bottom you can see inside the ocean. There are also numerous individual small aquariums attributed to special fishes, like seahorses and catfish. It is an absolute shame to miss this when you are in Lisbon!

Amazing and Relaxing visit. I have visited the Oceanarium at least 5 times in my life! It is always something new! And I never get tired. It's not very cheap but in my opinion it is worth it! A must see

Great depending on how much time you have. As Oceanariums go, i do not know enough to compare it with others but if you are on a short timed holiday and this is not a favorite thing to see, i say you can skip it.If traveling with kids or this is a personal favorite subject, you will certainly love it, lots of marine life to see and also lots of cute souvenirs to buy after. Recently i'm not sure, but few years back, despite the long queues, you can get in fairly quickly. Besides you don't want it to be too crowded in there.Nearby you can find coffee shop and an ice cream shop, always very crowded in the summer but very good, lots of space for kids to run, a bike rental place and a "cable car" (not sure that is how you say it in English) Very pleasurable area to visit. You can see the webpage here http://www.oceanario.pt

Ok but not great. I like the many exhibits. The gift shop was expensive. Didn't like the que. The school children sat at the display and blocking view it would help if there was more chairs and notices to tell them not to. The many levels allowed to look at the center display at many angles.
Oceanarium. Great experience, though not cheap (16 euros per person). Good variety of creatures presented, and lovely environment

Great place to visit, ever if it's not usually your kind of thing. This is a great place to visit, and not like any other aquarium I've ever been to. The building has been split into four separate areas representing different habitats surrounding a huge central tank full of all sorts of marine life.The sea otters were awesome to watch and it was great to see the penguins so close up. The highlight was the temporary exhibition of sea turtles. To be able to see them so close was really special. They are HUGE.

Amazing -- what else is there to say. I love aquariums and this was a spectacular one. I think it is the 2nd largest in Europe (or was the in the world?) Worth a visit if you like this kind of thing. We took the metro to the nearby stop then headed left out of the metro then south along the river. It was an easy 10 minute walk.

A great alternative to the Churches, palaces etc of Lisbon. There's so much to see and do in Lisbon, but by our third day we were looking for something different and the Oceanario de Lisboa was perfect. The Sea Otters are hilarious to watch especially when they are feeding. There are several large aquariums with numerous fish, penguins, birds to see. One of the best aquariums I have been to. Great for families, but also fun for a couple like us. Well worth it.
Amazing place!. Very clean, modern oceanarium. ideal attraction for family with kids. Big glass walls without twists gives better view than in half tubes type of aquariums.

Very nice, not only for kids!We, adults loved it too!. Even a manta rey swimming in the oceanario, which was a first for me. The big aqaurium is so beautiful, it has so many spots to look from , its amazing.Th nicest I ve seen so far!

Just the same as every other aquarium. What a shame this is exactly the same as every other aquarium. We went to this attraction after seeing it rated so highly on Trip Advisor and seeing the photo I thought it was connected to the sea as it sits right in the water. Sadly I was wrong. The centre tank was simply overcrowded with fish of every sort. Many of these creatures are solitary and unaccustomed to being with so many others. The stress of being at such close quarters with your natural predators must surely cause unnatural behaviours as must being fed. The sight of sea otters being fed lumps of fish was strange as there was a circus aspect to this behaviour - the otters basked and rolled with or for the food. Similarly the penguins were fed dead fish and bits of dead fish littered the tanks. Made me reflect on the sanitised view of sea life we were being fed.... I've become cynical about how we use animals for our entertainment but if this is so high on the list of best things to do in Lisbon what does it say about the rest of the city?
Really wonderful.. It's a great option of tour. The place is wonderful. The penguins are a case apart. Sensacional. The moon fish is out of this word.

Excellent if weather isn't great. I went here 3 years ago and have never really been that into Aquariums. However, the weather was a bit iffy so we went here. I must say it won me over. It is architecturally interesting how you work your way down and the large tank in the middle is awe inspiring.It was clean and modern and an excellent way to spent half a day.

A Highlight of Our Stay in Lisbon. We've been to several oceanariums and several Sea Worlds, but this is unquestionably the best we've ever seen. (Our guide book says it's the second-best in Europe, but the book doesn't say what's number one.) The oceanarium is layed out around a huge, multi-story central tank, with smaller exhibits--otters, jellyfish, penguins and so on--on the side. You start at the top and work your way down a series of ramps. The oceanarium appears to have been part of a World's Fair renewal project in the 1990s. The closest Metro stop, Oriente, was designed by Santiago Calatrava, the well-regarded Spanish architect, and it's worth a look.
Very interesting. This place is beautiful. It is great for children, but also for adults. The aquarium was build very creatively, guarantying many different sights.

5 oceans together. inaugurated during Expo 98, this site brings together the 5 oceans and their biodiversity, in a unique way, with no apparent divisions, the species mix and the visitor makes contact with them ....

Very nice aquarium, one of the best i have visited. Surprisingly good attraction, with a lot of animals and information. I would certainly go back, despite it being a little expensive. Very nice to go at the feeding times.

Great Variety. I have visited a few Oceanariums before but the variety found here is simply astounding. Care has been taken to exhibit species from specific regions and good explanations have also been given. We did without taking the audio guide. You could spend some time post this visit by doing the cable car in front of the expo and a visit to the Vasco Da Gama mall. Closest metro station is Oriente.
Stunning. Great place for kids and adults alike! The main marine ecosystems are represented, in beautiful display. Just avoid peak visiting season.

Fun aquarium with interesting fish... and penguins!. Aquariums abroad are always a good time, and this is no exception. The place resembles an oil rig from the outside, with a massive tank in the center that you revolve around as you explore. There's a couple of really interesting fish inside, with names I can't remember, so I'll call them "sideways flat fish" and "weird yellow fish with chunky teeth". If you go you'll know them when you see them.They also have exhibits with penguins, otters and even a small tropical rainforest. There's a decent amount of variety, and enough to keep adults (as well as kids) occupied for an hour or two.The best part isn't even in the aquarium - it's the open waterfall outside the main entrance where you buy tickets. Water cascades right over the sidewalk, so you can walk through a tunnel of rushing water before you head inside!

Oceanario. We are fish enthusiasts- and this is the best Oceanarium we've been to! Part of the pleasure is the superb setting- the whole site is a joy to explore (don't miss the cable-car!) and architecturally outstanding. The geographically-themed displays are terrific, and the huge central aquarium a recurring stunner (never been this close to Sunfish before...)

Excellent aquarium - Especially loved the otters. We spent a pleasant afternoon exploring the oceanarium. It is much larger than I expected, and has a good range of creatures. The otters were definitely the star for us. It's a good place to spend a few hours out of the sun, and not too expensive. We would return.

Comprehensive and marvelous. We really enjoyed visiting the Oceanarium. It's not just for kids; in fact, it's pretty dark in places to see into the aquariums, so small kids might not like it. However, it's very informative, and we could not believe the number and variety of fish and other sea-based life that seem to be peacefully coexisting in the central main tank (which is huge). There's a video to watch about how they feed and maintain the aquarium that explains a lot about that.Anyway, we enjoyed it immensely. The one thing my husband got a little freaked about was the glass floor over a portion of the aquarium where you feel like you're walking on the water. If you can go to Portugal and especially if you're on a tour and "churched out," try this experience as a great change of subject and pace.

UAU Amazing Oceanario!. Oceanario is one of the best aquariums I ever visited. Lovely habitats, nice people and the animals are really the treasure of this place. Animals are very well treaten. I strongly reccomend it. If you come to Lisbon you need to visit the Oceanario de Lisboa.

Love of all ages. It was raining today so i decided to go to the Oceanario. I love this place. From the entrance, there is information about the ocean provided along the way. The sound system is great. The amount and variety of fishes and other sea-lifes are rich and wonderful. The information is useful and just enough. There I took the audio guide but unless you have great interest in knowing a lot about the Oceanario and plan to spend more than 3 hours there, you wouldn't miss much things by not getting one. Furthermore, inside the Oceanario, it's pretty dark so with the audio guide, you need a bit of attention to look for the guide number on the wall. Therefore, in my opinion, just focus on looking at the fish and spend time sitting beside the tank is the best way to experiencing the place and having a great time.

silence of the oceans... this is by far the most beautiful and relaxing aquirium I have visited.. it had an exhibition about sea turtles which was expertly done, the whole atmosphere was one of silent awe for the animal kingdom of the oceans..
Amazing!. It is absolutely fantastic place and I defenetly recommend to visit it at least once. Paradise for children and their parents!

That fish is really weird!. This aquarium is advertized by the most ugly, weird looking fish and when you see it close up it´s even stranger. The whole thing is interconnected with itself instead of separate tanks which is a cool design idea. There are loads of good places to eat nearby too! For all you Brits who love your curry there is a good Indian Restaurant nearby and there is also a nice sushi bar worth trying which also does hot dishes!
Lisbon with kids. When traveling with kids, you must go to Oceanario de Lisboa. It's wonderful, and kids will love it!

Brilliant aquarium. This was great (even for those without kids to take along). It may not seem like the natural top 5 things to see in Lisbon, but it definitely should be on your list. The main tank was HUGE, and there were multiple opportunities to look into it from different angles. The other areas (Atlantic, Indian, Pacific) are very well done, and make a nice change from the main tank. I went on Saturday morning, and it wasn't too busy. Can easily spend 2-3 hours in here.

A world class exhibit, a must see when in Lisbon. After all the tourist strain of old Lisbon this is a marked contrast and truly stunning!The site is readily accessible by a first class subway from Centro!Don't miss it!

Amazing. Best Oceanario we've been to. Central tank with 4 'scenes' around it, Loved it all. Especially the puffins and the otters. Beware - if you suffer from vertigo you may find the entry challenging as you have to cross from one building to the main oceanaria by a walkway.

Worth the Effort. A first class Aquarium with plenty of opportunities to view the main central tank and it's occupants in relative peace and quiet. The well planed out one way system means you do not miss a thing. The temporary exhibit of rescued turtles was amazing with the ability to view them from the side, below your feet and even above your head! But my favorite were the Otters. Well worth every Euro of the entrance fee.

Great Experience. It was my 3rd visit to this fantastic Aquarium. I went there in 1998, 2007 and now 2012.Nothing really changed since my first visit, but it's always an amazing experience. I could stay there for hours.There is a central large tank, a few smaller ones with different species and you can also be in four different habitats (North Atlantic, the Antarctic, the Pacific Forests and the Tropical Indian coral reefs).You can be there as long as you want but I can tell you that it takes around 2 hours to see everything. The only bad thing about it is the huge amount of visitors. Too crowded during summer.The temporary exhibition about the turtles isn't worth your money. I didn't see any turtles there.In general, it's a good place to relax, to learn about different species and habitats and to spend a good time; it doesn't matter if you're with your partner, kids, family, friends or even alone. You will love it.

Best in Lisbon. The Ocenario is the best place to see in Lisbon.Not the best in Europe but has a lot of specialties.In there you can sea all the ocean animals and watch documentaries about the Oceanrio and how it is being operated.

In one word, Fantastic.. This aquarium is the second largest in the world and is based in the new area specially created for the 1998 World festival. All display information is in Portuguese and English. As the Friday was a public holiday, we visited on the Saturday, crowded but still had plenty of chances to see all the exhibits. Bus service from the town could be better.We used one of the "YellowBus" tours, which stop right outside.

Amazing aquarium. Worth making time for on your trip to Lisbon!. I've traveled to a lot of cities and seen a lot of aquariums. I lived in San Francisco and would go to Monterrey Bay Aquarium a lot.Let me tell you, this is leaps and bounds above Monterrey Bay.You start at the top of the central tank and wind your way down in a spiral. On the way, you traverse continents to see different forms of sea life, always with the central tank beside you.It is beautiful and mesmerizing and there are rarely crowds. I like to make time for this special place whenever we visit Lisbon.

Good oceanarium for adults and kids. My friend and I really like this oceanarium. They had the exhibits broken into four climates and you could see the animals and fish up close. We ran through it somewhat quickly as we only had an hour or so but more time would be better.
beautifulll. Nice large aquarium with some really large fish ;) Temporary exhibition with the large turtles was amazin.

Great aquarium for kids of all ages - 3 to 103!. Fantastic aquarium built around a very large central tank with a number of smaller tanks interlinking with it. Father, mother and son all had a great time being Jacques Cousteau without having to get wet!
Excellent !!. Big location, very well maintained, friendly staff, well organized. We spent about 2+ hours inside, it was mesmerizing. I strongly reccomend it as one of the best attractions in Lisbon.

The ultimate under water experience. Great! Go there! Huge aquarium. The current turtle exposition is also a must see! You walk on top of the water glass botom) and can the turtles from all sides. Even without kids a lovely experienceThe area where the Oceanarium is is modern, nice architecture! It is 'the other side of Lisbon'

Don't take bus 759. First don't take the 759 bus it takes you round the houses to get you there. I paid 16 Euro's to see the turtles and there was not much to see in the temp display not sure how much was the price difference? Some displays were nice and it was much cheaper than the London Aquarium but not that much difference in what can be seen so not worth using valuable holiday time to see something I could see in my home country.

Fantastic!. You need to make time to see this Oceanarium properly. We had a flight to catch so could only stay ± 2 hours - nowhere near enough: so much to see, so well laid out. Very educational. Negative: very badly signposted from the Metro until you were actually there. Too bad. Otherwise, a great day out.
Water life. Excelent variety of species in a beautifull building surrounded by a beautifull environment. The place is so suitable for the species that some of them borned there.

Super centre. A visit to this Marine Centre is a must. Fascinating viewing and explanations of the various exhibits which are cleverly placed so as to give clear views without too much crowding of visitors. The focus on education for protection of species is welcome, whilst the secondary temporary exhibition of turtles was well worth a visit

Beautiful. We loved the Oceanario. It must be one of the best aquariums I've ever seen. Also the temporary exhibition was very interesting to see. I had never seen sea turtles before, so it was amazing to see them!

Good attraction in a great location. For anyone who has not been to a big aquarium / oceanarium before, this is well worth a morning of your time. For those who have, this one won't disappoint.For us, there were a number of highlights : the very cute otters, the majestic giant turtles (which swam right over our heads), the prehistoric-looking sunfish (the largest bony fish in the world), the tropical vivid blue sting-ray, ...The other great thing about this oceanarium is its location at the heart of the "Parque das Nações". Make sure you allow yourself extra time to wander around the fun things outside (water gardens, musical garden, cable car, cafes, ...). To top it off, this is all on the waterfront with impressive views of the Vasco da Gama bridge.Access by car is easy with affordable underground parking on the doorstep.
Great!. Only likes, no dislikes. Oh, the penguins are my favorite. And the big aquarium that you see everywhere in the middle of the oceanario. It is worth a visit in the sorrounding area.

average aquarium. but outside area nice to visit. average aquarium. but outside area nice to visit. nice walk by the beach. impressive long bridge in the water. mid-air gondola for bird's eye view of the city

Loved this place! Don't miss it!. You have a wonderful opportunity to be up close and personal with the underwater world and living organisms of the sea. Turtles swim under your feet, you can sit quietly as fish swim overhead, or you can wend your way through the Oceanario and be amazed... and learn about how humans are polluting this priceless realm. DEFINITE GO!

Fantastic!. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Lisbon. The central tank was impressive, with sharks swimming right in front of us. The temporary exhibit was a little less amazing, but still worth a look-see.

Very good aquarium. Excelent facilities, beautiful setting and very interactive exhibits. The main tank is in the centre and you can view into it from all sides and all floors. There is a lovely area with beavers floating hand in hand on the top and fish below, but watch out for the sea birds flying above, they have a tendency to aim there poop at you!

Enjoyable. They built the Oceanarium when they had their Expo 98, in a redeveloped area of the waterfront. The main tank is very impressive for its huge size and you can see views of it from many different levels. I was impressed by all the sea life swimming together, and I do not understand how the bigger fish, like the sharks, do not eat the smaller fish! They show how each ocean of the world looks like. In a smaller exhibit, you see penguins, which are quite enjoyable to see. It is a bit dark, but one just follows the arrows to see everything. The explanations are very educational and seeing this huge aquarium is very enjoyable for all ages.
nice visit!. we visited during the turtle exhibition... it is worth a visit if you have 203 hrs to spare. just a small tip... do not take the headsets for audio. not much help...

Worth it for the puffins. A good value aquarium. Wide range of sea creatures. If the turtle exhibition is still on its worth visiting. Being able to see puffins up close, without a visit to some far flung island, was the highlight.

Well worth a visit. The Oceanario is well worth time visiting. The large aquarium which takes up the centre of the building is simply amazing and each of the lesser regional tanks are very well done. One of our favourite attractions were the otters who spent the whole time we were there grooming themselves. It's a very informative place and great value for what you get.
The best!. For me, the best aquanarium in Europe. It is worth to see the Sunfish and other big sea fish. It is quite expensive but it's worth

Excellent 'aquarium' - loved the sea turtles. Went hear on a spare afternoon (after our meeting in lisbon finished early). We traveled there by metro ....there could be some better directions from the Metro station to the place but that isn't the oceanario's fault. We bought the ticket which included the turtles and it was definitely worth the 3 extra euros. They were all rescue creatures and so beautiful. The part where they swim under your feet was fantastic. The central (2 floor) aquarium reminded me a little of the London aquarium (another fantastic example). Lots of other animals to see too, such as the puffins, sea otters and frogs/toads. Fantastic way to spend 2-3 hours :)

A Must See.. The Oceanario is everything that a modern zoological establishment should be. It is entertaining whilst still being educational and environmentally aware.The main area is divided into a main display tank plus four smaller tanks representing four major ocean ecosystems. These are divided into a surface and an underwater level.There is also a temporary exhibit area as well which can be visited at an extra cost. Whilst we were there it was an exhibition about sea turtles and contained four turtles that had been rescued.The whole thing is done very well, with the feeling that the animals on display are not there just to amuse us but are well looked after in naturalistic environments.
A great day out for all the family. Clean, efficient and beautifully presented. Reasonable prices and not too busy at this time of year (September). Highly recommended.
best I've been to. Really interesting and beautifully laid out with loads of info and lots to see. Easy to access by bus or metro and plenty of things to see while in that area.
Recommend a visit. Good location and ideal for children. Located at the expo site and would also recommend the cable car journey.
Cool afternoon on a hot day. Nice location and educational displays creative and fun. Central tank was full of a variety of creatures. Suggest having some roving ambassadors to answer questions.
Nice. The oceanario is built around the aquarium. The are arrangement of marine life, some that I have never seen, but interesting.

Good for Families. A bit crowed. Great location near a boardwalk, sky tram and mall. Shark tank was worth the visit. Need to take a cab or subway to get there from the city center. Its worth the trip.
The best oceanarium i've been to.. The care in the layout, the vast aquarium and the temporary exhibition. My only complaint is i wished the temporary exhibit on sea turtles was bigger!.

The moonfish. The Oceanario in Lisbon is interesting to visit. The aquarium in the middle is 2 stories high and you can walk around it to get a different perspective from different angles everytime. The fish varie from sharks to the moonfish also known as the "Mola Mola". This creature is beautiful in his uglyness. For us it was a astonishmentmoment which will be with us. Especially when we tried to imitate the Mola Mola with his distictive open mouth. We enjoyed sitting on banks and just watch the fish and marine mammels swimming on by.But the Oceanario has more to offer. They also gave birds, plants, invirtebrates, aquariums outside and a tropical forrest. Or see the website for more information.
Amazing. Amazing place to visit with everyone! I loved it. Very beautiful, its a nice choice to spend a very good time in your holidays!

The best aquarium I've been to. Lisbon's Oceanarium is designed with a huge central tank two stories high and containing some 5000m cubed of water. This gives the opportunity of seeing fish schooling and a great variety of sea life all together. They also have designed it with concave walls that are well cleaned so your photos come out well. In addition they have some above water levels, with penguins, puffins, sea otters etc. We saw the otters being fed and it was simply wonderful. Our only criticism is that in comparison the temporary exhibit about sea turtles was disappointing. Quite small and not enough actual turtles!

One of the best surprises Lisboa has to offer!. When you are staying longer than 3 days in Lisboa, this will be very high on you to-do list!Tripadvisor rates normally don't lie, so we went to the Oceanarium in Oriente. A very nice location, just strolling around is a very pleasent experience on itself. We decided to go to the temporary (turtles) and permanent exhibition. Both were stunning! The interior, the structures, the view points, it was all constructed to be as close to the water as possible. We stayed for hours and felt sorry to leave. That's how much we enjoyed it! For both young and old it will be an awesome time :)

Wonderful!. The oceanario sits on the Park das Nacoes which was home to Expo 98. It's really easy to get to by metro and a return ticket cost just 3€. Take the red line to Oriente and when you leave the station cross over the busy main road, through the Vasco Da Gama shopping centre towards the water's edge and turn right. It's a huge, impressive building and its main feature is an enormous tank where you can view sharks, rays and other fascinating fish at different levels as you walk around. There are re-creations of the world's ocean ecosystems including the Antartic tank where you can view the characterful penguins and duck the low flying birds circling overhead! The Pacific tank is also a must just watch the adorable otters floating on their backs looking too cute for words. It was 16€ for one adult and that included entry to the temporary display of sea turtles. There's lots of information and it's also in English too. I got there late morning and it was terribly busy which did spoil some of the enjoyment for me. But the answer is get there early to avoid the coach parties and school trips. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from nearby although the onsite cafe was very good too. There is also a good shop if you want to buy a last minute cuddly shark to take home!

Fabulous oceanarium. This is located on the grounds of the 1998 world's fair. It has displays depicting the various habitats of our planet...including the arctic. Love those penguins! It's really quite an incredible place.
Magical. This should be a "Must" stop for anyone with kids visiting Lisbon! Plan to spend some time in the area. Great mall and easy access via Metro. Take your camera.

Must see!. Great way to spend a relaxing few hours. So calming watching the fish in the main tank and seeing the smaller tanks all around. Loved the sea otters!! Informative signs as you walk through and the penguins were very entertaining.

Mind-blowing experience for kids and adults!. A MUST-SEE when in Lisbon!My group of 5 adults ranging from 20-53 years old absolutely loved this experience. The fish and sharks in the main tank were incredible as were the smaller displays of fish and amphibians around the oceanario (glow-in-the-dark jelly fish!!). The information signs were very interesting and helpful as well, I remember wondering about specific aspects of the animals only to have my questions answered by reading the signs.What sets this aquarium apart from the others that I have seen are the Sea Otters! They are the cutest most fascinating animals and I just wanted to jump in the water and hug one! I could have watched them for hours.We went through the whole aquarium in about 2 hours and found that that was the perfect length of time.TIP: the main aquarium is in the center of the oceanario and can be viewed from ALL AROUND. So don't waste your time in the big crowd surrounding the windows at the very beginning. Keep walking and you can get a less crowded view.TIP: buy tickets online before you go to avoid the big lineup!!! We went at 3 and there was a large lineup to buy tickets but because we already had ours, we walked right in.

The best one!. we always visit the aquaria because of our 7 years old daughter; this one is the best one we've been in the last times; walking through the exhibits you can see a stunning display of living creatures in huge windows, we strongly recommend the experience!
Great Fun. This was a great place, a little expensive but worth a visit, does not more than an hour to see and is very nicely set up right on the river in a great area.
AMAZING!!. So so so well worth a visit, was definitely a massive highlight of our trip. It's also well worth spending a bit extra to see the turtles. Worth every cent.

an ocean aquarium. Staff was ok but the display of fishes totally makes up for it. the oceanrium closes early i beleive last entrance is at 7pm make sure to find out times before you go, we didn't and we spent more time waiting for the cabs then to look at the outside kids sculptures. After the tour you should go eat at the Brazilian steakhouse located right next to the Oceanarium. Cheap and still good a must see if you are in town.
Impressive. An impressive aquarium, worth visiting. Close to the metro and train station with its feet in the water of the river Tagus.

A must experience for any body who has not been to an oceanarium /sea worlds before. For me, this was the first time, i experienced the marine life. it is a stunning place, with a lot of species. there is one giant aquarium with sharks stingrays etc in it. and it makes alot of attractionbut it is the smaller aqariiums which house the beauty of nature...i would definitley recommend this, specially if u re visiting with kidsprice is 13€ for adults. kids is less. (permeanent exhibitions only)Permeannet + Ty is 16€

World class facility. The sea turtle temporary exhibit is well worth the extra 3 euros. Set in the middle of the expo grounds, it's the flipside of old Lisbon, ultra modern and well worth the trip on the hop on/off Blue line. Look out for the jelly fish swimming in the water between the temporary exhibit and the main building.

Amazing experience. Fantastically laid out and not overly busy. A great way to spend a few hours. The dragon fish and the giant turtles were just two of the highlights. A family ticket was 42€ which was good value. Would be one of the first things that I would recommend to visitors to Lisbon, particularly those with families.

Who can resist a day out with Otters?. I had really good afternoon here with my son, who loved the penguins and the otters. Plus, it is always exciting (if you are 4 years old) to see the sharks and to 'find' Nemo. Highly recommended as something to do with children in Lisbon.
Nice sight specially for kids. This is a special place, u can watch sharks beside ordinary fish , u can also watch penguins and fur animals, it is really interesting sply if u have kids

It`s a fun park!. The Oceanario is a great place to go! In Lisbon, don`t miss it! Go to the red line of the subway, Oriente station, and enjoy first the modern Parque das Naçoes, and the Vasco da Gama mall. Let a day to go there, and prepare the legs! The Oceanario has 2 expositions, one permanent and other temporary. I went to the temporary because I was tired and its smaller than the other, but it was incredible the same way and I could see how the Oceanario works. If you go there, go rested because you will walk too much. But you`ll see a marvelous place!! Dont iss!
Impressive. Well worth a couple of hours, very modern and the various 'animals' seemsed to have it good. Very impressive ecosystems created for the various 'fish' etc. Great place to take the kids.

Something for every age. My 18 year old son still insist we visit the Oceanario everytime we go to Lisbon. From the central tank holding a wonderful display of fish, to the Penguins and Sea Otters, there is something to keep everybody happy, and you may well learn soemthing as well. Not to be missed

Must-do. All six family members loved this place. We walked in more or less by incident but were all equally stunned by the place. At the main aquarium yoo would want to sit and watch forever. Our favorite animals were the sea otters. Information about the animals is given in a great way and it was the best activity we did on our Lisbon trip!
This is a not miss site!. The facility is magnificent. The fish even better! There is nothing you cannot see with respect to fish life. I loved it and would go back!!

Very nice attraction. We had a nice time in Ocenario de Lisboa. Comparing with the Aquarium in Barcelona, the value for money is much better- the adult ticket is 13 euro. Be sure to get there before 7PM as last tickets are sold until this hour in summer.You will love the penguins and the otters- they were really cute.The most important downside is that the souvenir shop is quite pricey comparing with what you'd expect in Lisbon.

the oceanario. It was a great experience, seeing all the marine world all in one place. I loved everything here. I can't choose one or two. The nemo fish, the seals, the penguins, the jellyfish and there's so many more, the price 16.00 euros.

Fantastic. Very busy in August but still a great day out. The main tank is amazing, paritculalry as you can view it from all angles as you walk round the aquarium. Our children loved it. Wouldnt bother with the extra Turtles section as not many turtles to see and not very big

Awesome, you need to visit. This place is great, we loved it my girlfriend and myself.
The "permanent exposition" is a must-see, however the 6€ temporary expo (about turtles) can be avoided.

Nothing waouh. We've heard so much about the oceanarium that it was a top attraction. I have to say it was a bit of a low down. The 1 hour queue and the crowd inside did not help. But overall it is an ok one but nothing to praise much about.

A bit too much hipe. Advice: last entrance is at 19.00, but you don't have time to see the "Special exibit". I recommend comming before 18.00 so you have time to see both.I'll begin with the best: the sea otters...what a show these playful creatures put on! There are sharks, sting and manta rays, sunfish, jellyfish, etcI was a little bit let down by the fact that the fish were just circling the aquarium like on promenade, and that I didn't see the other expo. On the other hand, the "Parcqe dos Nacoes", which contains the oceanarium, is the best part of Lisbon in my view :)
great. its a wonderful place to visit and take your time. You will not regret it. They are busses from the hotel on city tours that take you there
aquarium. good and worth a visit. buy tickets in advance to avoid lines. plan to spend time in park area it is beautiful with many things to do

A truly unique exhibit, and a great day out for all the family. We toured the oceanarium as part of the blue line tour from Lisbon. We took our time strolling through the exhibition rooms and throroughly enjoyed our visit. The idea behind the aquarium is the one ocean concept, so instead of having invidiual tanks for each species, there is one large wrap around tank for each ocean type. There is an extensive array of fish, sharks and other ocean life and the open air tanks for otters, seals and penguins are beautiful. We visited on a weekend and the queue seemed never ending, so i would definitely recommend going on a weekday.The oceanarium is a full days outing for couples or families. when you are finished in the exhibition there are amazing outdoor spaces to explore, and lovely green areas for a picnic.
Astonishing. The entrence fee isn't the cheapest, but they do a lot with the money. To see fishes and turtles such a close is breath taking

Engaging experience. We toured this amazing aquarium as part of our visit to the Expo area which also offers a skyride, a variety of restaurants and a large shopping mall as well as a metro station so it was easy to get to. The layout is such that as you "wander" from exhibit to exhibit you eventually see everything. There were signs in English which helped us non-Portuguese speakers. We thoroughly enjoyed our time there, viewing a huge variety of fish and other sea creatures from above, below and adjacent. The playful otters were a highlight.

Great Afternoon for all. Fantastic place - we took our time and totally enjoyed 3 hours here. Just enchanting ,so well laid out and fasinating. Beware we arrived at 12pm and had to queue for almost an hour to get in. When we left at 3pm there was no queue. There is a que for electronic tickets - jump in this one - so so so much faster and a staff member waiting to help you use the machine. A little expensive but truely brilliant.

Easily one of the must-sees in Lisbon and that is saying a lot. I had been there in 1998 for the Expo and returned now, 14 years later. It is expensive, but it's worth the price you pay. You think of going because of the kids but then you realise you are there for your own fun. This area of Lisbon is wonderful, the building itself and its immediate surroundings are all the stuff of movies, and then you go in and it's even better. The concept of the visit is smart and very well aligned with the internal architecture. Besides the central tank, which is maybe the single most amazing thing I've ever seen, the several tanks on the corners, representing the world's oceans, give you a feeling of going on a journey over the Earth in just a few hours. Underwater.

World Class. I can’t claim to be a fan of giant fish tanks, but this one is so beautiful, modern and well maintained that it has to be considered world class. Portugal was so wise when it designed the Expo site (which is where you will find this attraction) for its future use, and as a result Lisbon has a modern, popular and very well laid out riverside area. You will be able to see into the water at several levels, and observe some amazing ocean life of all sizes and colours. If you are taking the kids, they will love it; in fact you will probably have a problem to get them to leave.
My first aquarium experience. Nice variety of fish plus a good way to see the modern side of Lisbon. Make sure you spend some time seeing the area around the aquarium

A nice place to visit. I had heard it is the second best oceanarium in the world and maybe my expectations were too high. I was looking forward to seeing a marvelous place, but what I got was just good. I have seen better aquariums in different European zoos, there were not that many species of mammals and birds, but I have to admit the sea otters were too cute to be described in mere words. The bistro is nothing special, the food they serve is just average.

Unexpected gem. I really wasn't expecting to be blown away by an oceanarium but I felt like a kid again wandering about this one. It really is amazing see the different sealife up close to either side or below you.
Great Oceanario.. This is probably one of the great oceanarios of the globo. Take your kids and enjoy it.It is big, has all types of species and has a shopping mall nearby.
Nice center tank. the large aquarium, is incredibly, i could watch it all day without getting bored, no problem .If you are in Lissabon, this is something you must see.
So much fun!!!. Loved it, a little pricy but such a nice thing to do, exhibits are nice, and a lot of fun! One of the highlights of my trip. Also lots of landscape for beautiful pictures around
Worth a visit!. We had a great time with our boys, lovely fish & penguins...would recommend it to anyone visiting, it's in a great area of Lisbon also that has great shopping & other things to do.
Wonderful place. Very well kept place.Many species like sharks, penguins, "Nemo and Dory",and more.Kids loved it,adults too.One big aquarium you could stay hours staring at.

Disappointing. If you are going take the metro as the bus takes forever. Although it is one of the largest in Europe there is no sense of this, the viewing areas seem cramped. I visited a similar place in Australia and we could walk through the middle of the tank in a tunnel so had the fish swimming all around us but with this there are small windows for viewing. It might be good to visit on a quiet morning in the Winter but it was so busy, there were hoards of visitors and children crying, and people bumping into each other in the dark (it was very dark) in an effort to get a viewing point, we couldn't wait to get out!

Excellent. Went to see this as I was there on a Business trip and wanted to fill an otherwise empty evening. The Tank is huge and took me over 2 hours to get around it. The Artic part was really cool and the Otters where just pur class - Go you'll enjoy it. The only bad bad was the Sun fish has died and the one there now is small apart from that it's a great attraction!

Buy a ticket online to save yourself the queue at the ticketron.... Plan a whole day in this area. We did the Oceanario in the morning, lunch at Chimarrao, the Science Center in the early afternoon, Tejobikes in the afternoon right outside the Oceanario, then the cable car ride after.
best aquariam we've been to. Fantastic of families. Massive tank in the middle with loads of different types of fish. Set out over the 5 oceans plus a little penguin colony.

We worth a couple of hours of your time. Based in the Parque de Nacionale the Lisbon Oceanario is a wonderful building where you can get very close to the marine life, very user friendly with loads of viewing windows. We were here in August 2012 and saw the second exhibition of rescued turtles which was a great bonus. Price was 16 euros for an adult and 11 euros for a senior.Please avoid the cafe which is in the main building, poor quality, our toasted sandwiches were put into the sandwich press but it was never switched on so they were merely squashed and served cold.A short walk from the Oceanario are dozens of restaurants for you to choose.

Good for family, kids love it. Very good place to visit and see for family to enjoy. Clever way to educate kids to love the planets and help protect our environment. Great range of sea animals from around the world and mostly are in danger of being extinct.

Such a beauty!. I would only go to Lisbon to watch all fishes and animals in the Oceanario! Sorry but this is a MUST SEE!I've seen the same in Boston (US) some 7 years ago, It was magnificent, well Lisbon is very close to it!Is super maintained, all the glasses are very clean, you feel almost part of the scenery.Organize an afternoon or morning because ther is more to do and visit. Wandering between all the expo infra, buildings and gardens + the Oceanario will fill your day with fantastic souvenirs!
decovery. nice too see all kinds of wateranimals in this archtectural surroundings - a little too expensivehave a coffee at the outside and enjoy the expo site

Largest tank I've seen!. The largest tank and best layout for an aquarium! Friendly, helpful staff. Information was also translated in English. Nice environmental focus as well, with descriptions of species that are kept brief and informative.We could have sat infront of the tank windows (which must be at least 6 meters high) all day.
like mermaids. you feel like a child, even if rooms are a bit too crowded.i loved jellyfish, in their dark tank, like ghosts

3rd time right!. been there 3 times already, end up taking friends to the front door and then... getting in too!!!
Its really great for both adults and children.
Lots of species to check and its really well organised.
The dim light gives it a very misterous feeling too!
Fully Recommended.

Overrated.. This is a truly overrated attraction. Apart small acquarium with some interesting species, it is basically just a single large fish tank. Visitors go around it over two storeys as they face the same fishes just from a different perspective.
Nice area.

Bilhetes online with an ipad o iphone? No way. You can buy tickets online but not with ipad or iphone: it redirects to blueticket.pt that has deep issues eith mobile ticketng... And in front of the place there's a long que... Why? God only knows

wow!! amazing!. excellent! very nice, nicer than the one in Barcelona. i think its the best in Europe. must visit!
Bony Fish, sharks, rays, marine mammals and lots more.
they hare a room where you can see a short movie about the oceanario, how they replicate the water for every specie of fish and other very interesting data's.
Best Aquarium in the World. Spent about 4 hours in here with the family, excellent place and well worth the money. Our third visit since Expo 98, but will return again!!
Oceanario. Set up in zones and with huge central tank. Amazing. Temporary sea turtles exhibit also amazing. Very fast through the cues, easy to get to on the metro and friendly staff.

Expected more. Claimed as the biggest aquarium in Europe or one of the biggest ones in the world? I can't imagine that - actually it's just one big basin crammed with all possible species and around it some outdoor spaces and other basins, but just small.I missed especially animals like whales, dolphins, seals, sea lions! Maybe it's good to go with children, but I was actually disappointed. We spent just a little more than an hour there - too less for an entrance fee of 13 €!!

Good visit. Well set out walking through various 'environments'. Although lots of visitors there was plenty of room and no pressure to move on. Plenty of staff about to provide help/info if necessary.

Well Worth A Visit. Wasn't sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised as different to aquariums we had visited. Outside has plenty of water features to see and play in and large areas perfect to keep children amused for free.

Good fun. The "Oceanário de Lisboa" is a wonderful aquarium. I heard rumors that it is the biggest in Europe and the second biggest in the world, but I'm not sure if that's true.  Anyway, I love aquariums, and as they go, this one was very good. They have a temporary exhibition room, and at the moment it's devoted to sea turtles. You do pay a bit extra for this room, but it's worth it, because the tank is basically a huge ring around the room, and you walk in the middle of it. At the entrance and exit you can walk over it and see the creatures swimming underneath you, and there is also a sofa for six people that goes under it! As well as this, there is a huge wall of information about the different types of sea turtles, and some of the hazards presented to them in the wild. It also has interactive games for children.  Also, you don't feel bad about paying to see captive turtles because they are all rescue turtles, due to be released back into the wild after the exhibition. Even if you decide not to see the temporary exhibition, the permanent one is just as good. There is one huge tank containing loads of different species of fish, including sharks, and around this there are rooms with birds such as puffins and penguins, and more sea life including sea otters. There is detailed information about all the species, and a film about how the animals are cared for.  This aquarium is fun for everyone, young children to older people, and also has a cafe. I recommend it to everyone who goes to Lisbon for more than a day!

Disappointed -- Expected More Based on Reviews. Picture one huge fishbowl with hundreds of fish, including sharks & sting rays and schools of fish, inside. There is an artificial rock built around this fishbowl, with many "windows" where you can look inside. The path takes you 360 degrees around the perimeter of the fishbowl. That's basically all there is to it. There are a couple of rooms off to the side, nothing special, a few penguins in one, lizards & snakes in the other. But really was disappointing to all of us. I have seen better aquariums in Florida. Mind you, it is spotlessly clean and there are a lot of fish to see. So for younger children, it would be amazing and I would recommend it. My daughters, 14 & 16 were interested, but not overly excited. As I said, we've seen better. Found it overpriced for what it was -- and they charge an additional fee if you want to see the "temporary" exhibit which happened to be turtles, which I thought was a rip off. We passed on the turtles.
