Fun for big kids, too. I love visiting aquariums when I travel. I loved this aquarium because it was designed around the four oceans. The selection of waterlife was extensive. I also thoroughly enjoyed the turtle exhibit. They pulled turtles from every continent and provided detailed stories each of the turtles on exhibit. This aquarium pulled the world together in a way I have not seen before and made the world seem small as the various screens showed how each ocean connected to the next.
Really worth visiting. Really worth visitingthe most amazing is the way you pass through the 4 seasons in a couple of minutes, traveling around the world and getting to know very different ecosystems
Very interesting. Fantastic setup with literately thousands of fish in a giant tank to be viewed from all angles + the cutest sea otters you have ever seen
Oceanario beautiful. I loved the Oceanario especially the big aquarium with beaut mantas! Regrets: Go behind the Oceanario and take the Aerial Ropeway it is amazing!

Well, it not bad at all, but the nature of the place makes it very limited. It was open in 1998, and it was meant to be an "as libris" of the ExpoFair of Lisbon, that was about "The oceans an heritage for the future". If you have in mind that you are going to see fishes, penguins and little more, it is okay...very suitable for groups of childrens...

stunning. The oceanario is in the Parque de Nacoes and is easy to get to. Well laid out and at times quite breathtaking. Feeding time is around 3.30 and apparently very busy, we found late afternoon (4.00) a good time.
Great day out. Fantastic - brilliant day out. Fairly expensive, as you'd expect, and it's a 20 min bus ride from central Lisbon, but worth the trip.

Nothing ultra-special, but very nice. The big tank is quite impressive, but it's 90% of what you get actually. They also have some short documentary films running which looked pretty good. It can safely be missed, but it's one of the better aquaria I've been to.

Great place!. It's a very very good place to spend the whole day. The permanent exhibition is always well worth the money you pay, and then they have visiting exhibitions that also use to be excellent. Avoid weekends (big families, lots of kids) and try to go during the summer months (and that way you'll avoid school field trips). It's a very beautiful and calming, relaxing place, and you can take more advantage of the whole experience if you can avoid lots of noisy kids running around.
great half day out for adults and kids. The oceanarium is really well organised and informative. Lots to entertain adults and kids alike. The fish looked happy and content.

Super Cool!. Amazing and captivating aquarium, right amount of written info, lots of interactive bits, entertaining sea otters and lovely views! We really enjoyed it as a cool escape from afternoon heat and would recommend for kids too!

A fun experience, but not the best attraction in Lisbon. This is an aquarium. It is a nice aquarium. It is on par with other large aquariums I have been to (like the Atlanta Aquarium). The otters are adorable, and the birds are fun to look at. The moon fish are truly unique and I had never seen them before. The exhibits are done well and are in English and Portuguese. It's a little expensive, in my opinion, for what you get. It is easily reached by the metro and part of the larger park area, but overall I didn't feel it was so great that it warranted spending half a day there.
Ocenario. I visited 3 years ago.From my point of view is under others in Europe
great to get out the city. if its gettin too hot in the city, head here to Oceanario. Shopping, aquarium and cable car rides. Great.

Moon fish. Very nice with great water basins. The feading of the seaotters was a happening to see. The moonfish I had never seen, was very rare. We took the Metro but the last part we have to take the bus because of Metro works.Nearby very nice shopping area
Plan to stay at least a couple of hours. Visited in August 2008. I loved the big ugly fish and the tiny sharks.

excellent attraction for any age !!. Opened in 1998, the Oceanário was the centerpiece of the XXth Century's last World Fair, themed "The Oceans, a Heritage for the Future", and eternally binds Lisbon to the Oceans. With over one million visitors per year, the Oceanário welcomes the largest number of patrons anywhere in the country.
One of the best aquariums!. Oceanario de lisboa certainly deserves a visit, and definetely not only from ocean lovers..
Impressive tank.. Oceanariums are expensive places to visit because they cost vast sums to run but this one gives lots in return, especially a Mola-Mola!
This is one of the most amazing experiences you can have without getting wet !. the main aquarium is very big and has a huge veriety of fish, big and small.. good time

Fishtastic acquarium. Lisbon Acquarium was fishtastic indeed. This has to be one of the best acquariums I have ever visited. Very cleverly done with the central tank fall of sharks, sting rays, etc. You can also see penguins, puffins, otters and other seabirds in the acquarium. You can also view the fish that lives in the dark and has a light coming from the end of his head never seen before in any other acquarium. I would deffinately visit again if I ever go back to Lisbon.
Worth Visiting. A nice trip for both families, and friends this aquarium is the kind of place where you can idly pass 4 hours of your time without noticing it passing by.
You can't miss it. Great place to visit!Very easy to get there.If you are in Lisbon you must see it.Tickets are reasonably priced
Fantastic, a must for kids and adults. This place is huge, with a great variety of sea life. Great!
good day out. we kept this up our sleave for a rainy day and was a very clever idea (if i do say so myself). kids will love it as well as adults

Amazing place. We've been a few and always loved it. To be nose to nose with a shark with just a few inches between you is a wonderful thing. Our children love it, we love it. The whole place is superbly executed. Ok there is one of those awful gift shops you have to walk though at the end. Apart from that though it is a great experience. Just don't go buying those fluffy sharky things or key rings and stuff.
fantastic!. what a great oceanarium!! this is a must if you are in Lisbon; lots to see and do!

Best oceanario where I have been. I not a ocenarium kind of person usually, but this place is magical. You have the view as you were in the water, some fish passing by so closely that you get almost afraid. The part with penguins family is also cute and the cutest animal in the ocenarium is the otter. I don't remember the exact entrance fee but I think it is worth the price. If you can, go the for at least 4 hours.

Wonderfull!. It was a wide variety of sea life, very enjoyable. I have visited it many times and have enjoyed each. I highly recommend. Also, there are some cards that give discount for the entry (and to other attractions also).
Nice, but pricy. After all the churches and other cultural visits, this was a nice change in scenery. However, it was very pricy, maybe a bit too pricy.
Dont miss .. Very far from city center but worth a visit. It's a sort of an Oasis on an extremely sunny day.
An educational marvel!. Excellent "exhibits" of marine life. The staff is doing real research and presenting some interesting facts about the sea. A visual delight!

A Fishy Treat. We were very fortunate that the temporary exhibition on turtles was so very good. Like the rest of the park, the displays were less about trying to stuff you with information and more about the wonder of nature (and what a loss if we do not take care of it). The 'walking on water' was a sheer genius and the use of sea otters to redefine cuteness was sheer genius.

The big tank will mesmerize you. We really enjoyed checking out the Oceanario in Lisbon. You can see it all in a couple of hours. You can see the sea life in the big tank from numerous vantage points. Bring your camera!

Less exciting than Lisbon Zoo. We went to the Aquarium the same day as we went to the Zoo. A major let down after spending €11 admission in to 1 exhibit. Less interactive than the Zoo. So would probably see the Aquarium beforehand to get most out of the experience.

Nice, but not as big as they advertise. We had a 12h connection in Lisbon so we decided to visit the Oceanarium. If you read their website, you'll expect a huge park with lots of things to see. That is definitely not the case - the Ocenarium is very nice, organized, and sizeable, but it can be seen in just a couple of hours so you'd better plan something else to do nearby if you have a whole day to spend in Lisbon! But, in any case, it is definitely worth the visit.
Fine Aquarium. This aquarium was fine, but nothing amazing. It might have been better if we had kids. I did like the larger dioramas with more animals. It was very dark inside.
Worth the trip. It was about 10 Euro taxi ride from downtown but worth it. Very unique aquarium that has environments of most oceans.
Nice place to visit. Interesting place to visit alone or with your family. Well-appointed by the seaside, in the area of Expo 98.
Take a dive ;). Its amazing this place, you really want just to dive in and join the sharks. I loved it

Awesome!. We went twice - once during the week and once on the weekend. The weekend was much busier, so if you have a choice, I'd say go during the week. The main tank in the middle was fantastic. The special turtles exhibit was also neat (they swim over you and under you).

Very good. I went there yesterday with my family , we had great fun !!! The food was " ok " but good price . In maybe 3 hours you can see the oceanario ( it's really big !! ) . A good place to spend the day , and see all type of fish...
Great Aquarium. The oceanario is in the modern part of town. Suggest visiting if you have an extra day and traveling with kids.
not something unusual. has nothing special compared to the oceanario of Barcelona-Spain or Heraklion Crete- Greece and very expensive ticket

Loved the Oceanarium. I visited the Oceanarium on the same day as the zoo, and it was the highlight of my day. The whole area surrounding the Oceanarium is an architectural marvel, and the cable car past the oceanarium offers great views. The oceanarium itself has one of the best tanks I've ever seen (180,000 cu. ft. tank) which can be seen throughout the most of the walkways. (The sea otters were absolutely adorable!!)

Good not great. First off, avoid the temporary exposition entirely. It was some gimmick about sea turtles geared towards children, and not all that interesting.When we got to the main portion of the aquarium we had a sigh of relief that we hadn't wasted our money. There is a giant tank with a very wide variety of species viewable from all different angles and as you walk around there are different tanks of fish from the different parts of the world. Totally worth the trek, but it is a ways away from the center of Lisbon. No problem on our scooters we rented...
first day. Very expensive not that much there i wouldnt say its the biggest
Wonderfull. It's a nature show! They have lots of marine species, from the 5 continents.
For sure not the second biggest in the world. For kids can be a nice visit, but it doesn't deserve it's money for sure. Just a big glass....

Blue bus route to Expo site. This trip on the blue route open top bus wasnt as good as the red route, it was a long trip all the way around (1 hr 45 mins) and to be honest at the old expo site there wasnt much to see, we didnt wat to get off the bus as the next one along was so infrequent, we were unsure if the bus drivers all stopped for lunch between 1-2 we were not told this but there seemed a lack of buses during this time
Wonderful and rich in species. Wonderful location- Parque das nações; richness in species, architecture, design, shop, others.

Fish Central. The Oceanario was absolutely fantastic. The different sea environments around the central huge tank were brilliant, some even had birds from the area flying around! There were different displays with amazing corals, and even deep sea fish which were in a darkened area where you could only make out the eerie flashes they emitted! There is currently a temporary exhibition of rescued sea turtles which are being cared for at the Oceanarium which was brilliant - there is an area you can sit in and the sea turtles and fish swim right over the top of you!
Fantastic oceanarium !. Great way to spend a 2/ 3 hours to cool off an learn about the oceans
Great aquariam to spend the day there is also a great outdoor facility with cable cars if you want to go for the view.. Liked most of it really no complaints its also kid friendly for sure.

Kids loved it!. Took our teenagers, boy 15 and girl 13. They loved the place! We did too! It is one of the better aquariums that we've been to. The displays and the four habitats were well organized. The sea otter were a hit as were the penguins. Definitely worth a visit.
An delightful afternoon with buy niece.. The Oceanário is just an amazing place to observe natures best aquatic environments.
The ocean in an aquarium. Nice atmosphere. Much better than Valencia's or Boston's Sea Aquariums.
One step away from Snorkling. A very good experience with plenty of interesting things to see, However it is a little pricey!

Well worth a visit. I visited the aquarium with my boyfriend in April. It was quite expensive for Lisbon but it was definitely worth the money. It's well designed and there is a lot to see. We spent a good few hours in there. There is also a lovely shopping centre nearby and a restaurant called bufalo grill which did excellent steak at a very reasonable price round the corner. (It has a big bull on the roof) Worth a visit.
Worth a visit. A really nice place to spend a day, lots of bars and restaurants, great shopping centre and of course the aqaurium to look around. Bike hire, Go Karts and cable car rides.
Beautiful Aquarium. Perfect for a family... lots of fish.. at least 4 hours to take it handy

Nice. Everyone agreed its generally a pleasant few hours to be in any aquarium but that this stands out as even better than the others, good for all ages and any type of person. Its a bit out of town though over on the East side where there is not alot of else to see and its mainly modern architecture, but cabs are very cheap, c.a. 5 euros from town centre! so just get a cab here and come back into the main town afterwards i would say

Four themed areas plus central tank. Loved the four difference areas, each a different ocean. You walked round at the top (above water) level first where there were birds native to the area and, in one area, sea otters! Then you could walk round below water level, where the different species were brought to your attention. Also a big central tank of the usual sharks, mantras etc. A good 3 hours entertainment

Excellent. Wonderful place and loved the otters! It was a bit far out of Lisbon city centre, so quite an expensive taxi ride, but well worth it. We had fund watching the divers inside the central tank cleaning the windows and waving to the watching crowd!!!!
its beutifull. its good value for ur money . show to my wife she loved . good for any ages.
Great day out.. Excellent and good value. Without doubt a Lisbon Highlight.

Fabulous Oceanario. We have been to several aquariums and were somewhat reluctant to spend part of our limited time here. However, it was on our son's wish list so we went. What a great experience! We were delighted with the unique design and marine life, wonderful layout and great experience. So glad we went.

Great display, well woth a visit.. We travelled out from Baixa Chiadro on the metro which is simplicity itself to use. We had bought the Lisbon card which included free metro travel and also a healthy discount at the oceanarium which basically meant we got to see the temporary sea turtles exhibition for virtually nothing.The sea turtles were fascinating, especially walking over clear glass with them swimming underneath and sitting as they swim in a tunnel over you.Then the main attraction, very well designed and operated with plenty to see. It was nice to see some outside displays as well as 'just' fish tanks and the size of the central tank was massive and very impressive. We have seen a few similar displays in our time but this was well worth a visit.Also good for a stroll along the water or perhaps a ride in the cable car which gives you very impressive views of the Vasco da Gama bridge.

One of the best oceanariums I've seen. I've been to few oceanariums in different places, including one in Eilat, Israel and one in London, UK. Compared to what I've seen before, this one in Lisbon is the best! It has one huge aquarium in the center and the visitors walk around it and see different sea species from all over the world. The oceanarium has sections, each dedicated to different oceans. Many similar places I've been to usually stink from the smell of fish, this one has some open areas and the smell is considerably less than in the oceanariums I've seen in Israel and United Kingdom. It will take you maximum 2 hours to see the whole place. The price was somewhere between €10-15. Oceanario de Lisboa is a great place to visit on a rainy day when you can't go to the beach, and you'll see some beautiful fishes in here.

Nice. A visit to the oceanario was nice, but I wouldn't rate it as impressing.The main tank is huge and there are a lot of different kinds of fishes in there, but there's no walking tunnel through the tank, which I have found interesting in several other aquariums. Most of the fishes in the main tank are gray, so it's not as beautiful as some other aquariums.The sea otters are cute and steal attention from the fishes, but I wouldn't go to the oceanario only to see them.We walked through the permanent exhibit in about an hour, which makes me think that the size of the exhibit is just proper.The oceanario is a bit far away from the city, but a visit there gives a good opportunity to visit other parts of the Parque das Nações at the same time. If you want to do shopping, you can do that in the Vasco da Gama shopping center, through which you have to walk from the metro station. Lisbon doesn't have that many top attractions, so if you're spending more than a few days in the city, I would recommend visiting this one as well.

perfect if it's raining!. a little bit expensive, but if it's raining on a whole monday like we had, don't hesitate to live this fun "under the see" experience! the sharks, the skates and the otters are fascinating to watch. The exhibit we've seen on the turtles was a little bit overpriced, but I love turtles so, at the end, we really had a nice time. Do avoid cafeteria there, and prefer the mall next to the metro to have a snack!
My kid had a great time. It's excellent even for small children, My two year old loved it
Well worth a visit!. Caught the metro from Cais do Sodre and spent the PM in this great attraction. You can also tie the visit in with the shopping mall and the good mall restaurants.

Huge. I like the fact that this isn't purely about fish, although they are spectacular enough. The sea otters, puffins, penguins and terns (as well as turtles in a temporary exhibition while we were there) add to the enjoyment. We spent ages walking around.
Amazing!. So cool, you should defenetly go! A lot of species of animals, includin 3 amazing see otters.

Great experience for all age groups!. What a great place! The huge central tank is amazing with numerous viewing points to see the many different types of fish, shark and ray. The coral reefs are also absolutely beautiful. There are other exhibits containing sea otters, penguins and an octopus and all of them are well worth seeing.We also visited the temporary sea turtles exhibition. This was brilliant with some great places to watch them such as the glass walkways (some people may not like this but it is only a couple of steps to get you across to the other side) and the small lounge area where you can sit and just watch the turtles swim over your head. We could have stayed for hours!It's good value for money and very easy to get to, just take the red line to Oriente. This is just a great place for the whole family to visit and enjoy!
Perfect day out with children. Just fantastic. The Aquariam is amazing. The location on the sea front is spectacular.

Sharks and more!. Great aquarium. The central tank has plenty to look at from all angles, including several sharks, TWO ocean sunfish, and some great rays. The side exhibits were also great, from a very active octopus to sea otters and penguins. Good time, could have stayed later if we weren't exhausted.

what a brill place to go. if u like shopping u have the vasco de gama centre , walk along front and through the park lovely u can get the cable car fun for kids but it only is a kilometre long so the walk is healthier.. go along to the end at the marina the whole area is great

For children and grown ups - entertaining, educational and fun. If you come to Lisbon, you HAVE to go there! It's a bit pricy, but totally worth it.Take at least 3 or 4 hours to see most of it - the place is huge. It's entertaining, educational and fun.It has a main tank where you can see so many species together, sharks, moon-fish, morey eels... There are sea otters, penguins, starfish, corals, crabs, squids, and so much more!

A must see.. This was our first stop at Lisbon, little after we landed from a 10 hour flight, and it made us forgot that we were tired. It's a beautiful and huge place. Be sure to have time to see everything (you can easily spent 4+ hours on it), and be ready to walk.There are some non-permanent expositions (there was one on marine turtles, from Brazil's Project Tamar), which are booked separately.It's not cheap, but worth every penny.
Big.. Much to see, very interesting. Tiger sharks are very lively.

A great experience. This aquarium was wonderful. Well laid out, useful information, helpful staff and so many great fish and other creatures (the sea otters were fantastic). It was so impressive to see the main tank with such a variety of fish swimming together. Definitely recommend going out to the aquarium - easy to get to by the cheap, efficient metro system.
Excellent. The aquarium is amazing. Children were amazed. Absolutely a must go and see.

WOW. Reading previous reviews I had this on my list of places to visit whilst in Lisbon and we were not disappointed. We started with the main display and it is really well laid out - loved the sea otters :)You will never go to a Sealife centre again after going here as there is no comparison and it's better than the Aquarium in Hull and that one is very impressive also. This is going to take some beating.The temporary exhibit was really good as well and I wish we had done that first as I went a bit overboard with the camera and ran out of battery :( the turtles are amazing.The cost for a family of four (2+2) was €42 and if we had paid as a 2+1 it would have been €43 so very good value for the additional child if you have one!

A MUST if you have kids!. A truly special place. I'm not sure who enjoyed it more...our baby or us. There is something for everyone. It was also great to see the new Lisbon. Really pretty and very different from the old town.

Beautiful set-up for decent price. Went here while staying the weekend in Lisbon. Saw the temporary exhibit for sea turtles, which was incredibly composed. From all angles, yes even from above (a glass plate you can walk over) and from below (you sit under a glass wall where the turtles pass) you can experience the beauty of these animals.Also the main (permanent) exhibit was terrific. In the center there is one big area of open sea where they exhibit sharks, manta rays and even a Lunar fish. Around the centre tank, there are 8 seperate areas which show all different corners of the earth and its characteristic animals.Great set-up, very educative and good value for the money.
Underwater biodiversity. This oceanarium, built for the expo98, makes the wonders of kids and grown-ups, with sharks, rays, penguins and all sort of aquatic fauna.
oceanario great fun for all ages. i took my child and i think i enjoyed it more than he did. its huge, and is beautifully kept. a must see when in lisbon, specially with children!

The largest Oceanarium in Europe. A trip to the 4 seas ending in the central tank where all species swing together. From small fish to large sharks. Both children and adults became hipootised looking the swimming fishes.

One of the best aquariums in the world. Oceanario de Lisboa sits on the water in the outskirts of Lisbon - on the former site of Expo 98. The building and grounds are spectacular, but nothing compared to the vast and well designed interior. Lighting and displays are gorgeous. The fish are well represented and the sunfish is a rarity in captivity. Do not miss the video in the small theater, which explains the duties and functions of the staff - the feeding, health care, and research being conducted. Well worth a long visit. The many benches for close-up viewing makes the facility comfortable for people with limited mobility or those who just do not like rush, rush, rush.
amazing experience. One of the best in the world, "no further comments need"
Well worth a visit. Second largest aquarium in the world I think! Great views and so many fish species to see. The very odd and very large Sunfish was captivating. Very good value.
children love it. many types of fishes and it´s a different experience

Strike the right chord of interesting and educational. We were actually doubtful that we would like it and went there towards the end of the day and thought that they would be closed at 6 pm. Luckily the ocenarium is open till 8 in the summer months. There was a temporary exhibiton with rescued sea turtles and that was really an extraordinary experience, as we had never been this close to these creatures. you could observe them from the bottom, as they would swim on top of your heads. Also the proper part of the building housed a lot of sea creatures and had a huge aquarium in the middle which you could see from every part of the building. our favourite part was the otters, who seemed to be busy trying to open a tupperware box with food in it. It was a lovely evening and I would definitely recommend it to anyone, even families without kids.
Outstanding. A very nice attraction, formerly part of the EXPO, excellent for adults and children. I think I took 800+ photos!
a good place to visit. well worth a look great trip for all of the family
I love it!. I already went there for 20 times (maybe more) and each time I love it more...It's a special place where you can forget all the rest...Take your family and enjoy that great place!

Great Experience. One of the most touristy things I have done on a City Break so far but thought it was fantastic. I have done a fair amount of diving in the past and could therefore appreciate just how well the Oceanario reefs were designed. The sea life was spectacular - sharks, rays, barracuda and lots of interesting smaller fish - clown fish, butterfly fish etc. The turtle exhibit was wonderful too.All in all a great day out and well worth the 16 Euro entry fee.
Well worth a visit!. Liked the lay-out, atmosphere and location. A bit on the pricy side to get in, but worth your money.

There are better ones. Visited this aquarium which is located at the site were the World expo 1998 took place.Easy to reach with metro or bus, station Oriente.We were impressed by the spacey and modern architectural area, very nice indeed !When you leave the metro station you 're entering the big and beautiful Vasco Da Gama shopping mall.You have to do a (rather long) walk to the oceanarium itself, that is also housed in a futuristic building.After entering you are overwhelmed by a enormous large and deep aquarium with lots of different fish species of which also an amazing sun fish. Quit impressive ! During the visit you walk arround this giant aquarium and after a wile we felt that it looked a Little bit the same from each different corner.When strolling by the other smaller aquariums we found that the lighting in these displays in many cases was too poor to enjoy them completely. Regarding that one of my favorite photo objects are aquariums I can say that the poor light was a disaster to take sharp pictures, even after adjusting my camera with all the different programmes that I could use.Still, we were impressed by the giant aquarium but have to say that there are better ones...eg London aquarium, Artis zoo Amsterdam, Aquatopia in Antwerp !

It is really worth a trip to the Oceanario in Lisbon. The historical buildings are wonderful in Lisbon, but the world expo site from 1998 is equally worth a visit. Whatever you do, especially if you have children, don't miss the Oceanario!

A must see in Lisboa - An underwater dream world. It is hard to compare Lisbon's Oceanário with anything else.The Oceanario was desgined and built during the Expo 98, and since then it has done an amazing job in preserving a lot of marine species, while also doing an outstanding job in teaching its visitors about how to better preserve the ocean.The Oceanario houses species from all the different oceans and has a dedicated section for each of them, all built around a magnificent central tank where you are sure to spend hours on end just contemplating this window to the ocean floor.Recently a new wing was built to house temporary exibitions. These not only add value to the Oceanario,but also make you feel like you're in the middle of a Nat Geo program.If you add the special sleep over programs for kids (search online for this) you have a great variety of interests for all ages.Reserve at least two hours, three you really take your time in getting to now all the Oceanario has to teach you.
The Lisbon Oceanario is something to visit!. It's a brilliant museum in a fabulous space! Lots of different species and very well kept!

Just visit... do it!. If you travel with kids, its mandatory to came here! If you travel solo, it's an amazing experience! Well maintained, the central aquarium is a must. It's another world, an unforgetful experience! Audioguides and guided visits available.It's easy to reach, by train, metro or bus, it's only at a walking distance!

Fascinating. Very carefully planned space, well-cared of aquariums. Loved the penguins and otters, they are the stars there! Also enjoyed the projection of the "behind the scenes" film with English subtitles, it answered lots of questions we had.
Great escape from the City. Lovely Aquarium on the out skirts of town. Take the train or local bus.
One of the highlights of our trip. We went here on our last day and it is one of the best aquariums we have visited. Our son (7 months old) was mesmerised!
Good for kids. Expected more . Good for kids as it is well laid out and some of the side exhibits are worth the extra ticket cost.
great time. superb, well worth it, amazing time had, really can'tt describe it other than that!

One of the best tourist attractions in the world. It's difficult to find enough superlatives to explain how fantastic the Oceanario is. It's easy to get to - just 10 minutes walk from the Oriente station - and although the queue to buy tickets (on a rainy Sunday) was long we were served quickly. We paid €16 each including the temporary exhibition. Once in, we loved the sea turtles, and thought the whole place was just wonderful, with so many species to see. Unusually for a centre like this, the information boards (which were in Portuguese and English) were aimed at an 'intelligent adult' level, not just at kids, and the conservation message, although well expressed, was not 'pushy'. As well as many species of fish, there were penguins, sea birds and the absolute highlight - three stunning sea otters. Allow at least two to three hours in the main exhibition - there is A LOT to see. The cafe was busy so we chose not to eat there, but it seemed to do some good coffee, pastries and snacks. For a heartier lunch, there is a very wide choice of Portuguese and world cuisines (and the usual burger and pizza places) in the food court in the Vasco da Gama shopping centre nearby.

Good aquarium, bound to delight kids. We have visited many Aquariums (Aquaria?) on many occasions as our kids were growing up. Hence, it is hard to avoid drawing comparisons.... The Oceanario is definitely a good aquarium - the large tank is impressive and there are nice exhibits of oddities like Dragonfish, Jellies etc. But, despite being large, it is on a much smaller scale than say Monterey Bay, and missing some of the wow factors you might find elsewhere (like acrylic viewing tunnels). So, don't be taken in by the "largest in Europe" claim - it is surely true, but doesn't really mean anything. Go there just expecting to see a good aquarium and you will not be disappointed.Turtles exhibit is small but nice and worth the 3 EUR extra in my opinion. Overall, however, 60+ EUR for 2 adults and 2 teens felt too expensive.
Fun!!!. Great day out even for those of us that had no kids.

Huge aquarium. Very interesting architecture with one huge aquarium in the middle that can be watched from all sides. different smaller aquariums as well and an interesting and fascinating mix of sea creatures especially in the big baissin. A very good place to go especially with children!

Well worth a visit. The exhibit was well thought out. I did have concerns that some of the tanks are too small for the mental health of the animals - particularly the octopus. This was a great place for kids as several school trips were going through and I could see how they made an effort to eduction on water and ocean conservation. Beautiful displays and very well presented.

half day. One of the best program in Lisbon even it is rainning. Good for kinds to learn about the nature of the ocean. Vasco, Muffins and Amália and her kinds so amazing. Spend at least 3 hours there. (We spent 3,5 hours with the temporary exhibition) it worst

Fabulous experience for the entire family. Definitely one of the more impressive aquariums we have seen in Europe; plenty of things to see for the children. The temporary exhibition about turtles was very good, too. However the experience was, despite the Lisboa Card, on the pricey side with 42 Euros + 1 child extra.
Amazing. The best oceanario ever seen a lot of fishes from all over the world.Give it à couple of hours it's worth it
Amazing!. A huge aquarium with sharks, tunas and several species.

One of the best places I've ever seen. This is one of the best places I've ever seen in my entire life. I was there during my trip to Lisbon and Algarve last year with my girlfriend and, believe me, when we both realized, we stood there with our mouths open in marvel for the first 30 minutes! Everything is very very well keps, it's plenty of sea life and you can even sit for a while relaxing and looking at the fish there swimming.The Oceanario is located in a modern part of Lisbon, in the East side of this wonderful capital and believe it or not, it deserves a visit just to make you feel the same amazement that probably you felt many years ago.
Absoultely Great. Not much to say about this, absoultely must see!!!!!!!!!!!

calm and beautiful. Originally built for the World Expo in 1998, the Oceanário is a a strange looking, yet very interesting building, that fits very well into its surroundings in Parque das Nações.last time I visited there was also a very interesting and cleverly set show on thr life of turtles, including six that have been caught in fishermen's nets and are recovering before being released into the wild again. Inside Oceanário you will have a very interesting experience, showing the different ocean habitats and an amazing huge central tank with hundreds of fish, including sharks and manta. Sitting in the different viewing points around the tank helps you to relax and appreciate all the lively fish in the tank.If you're travelling with children, and especially on a rainy day, this is an experience you should not miss.
Nice. many interesting animals and a nice layout of the place with in- and outside areas.

Tired of beautiful architecture?. After visiting so many churches and monasteries, and other beautiful religious monuments, we were looking for something different to do. The Oceanario provided a much needed departure from the typical Lisbon tourist sites. The place was set up perfectly, allowing for a casual walk through the different oceans of the world. The diversity of exhibits was great, and allowed us to stay away from the Lisbon showers that had been plaguing us all week.

Love the layout!. I really loved how they wrapped the aquarium around one main tank - with each level you get to see the different angles and the fish at the various depths. Really nice. They had the Turtle exhibition at the time of my visit - beautifully done... a nice, beautiful afternoon spent - thank you.

Amazing visit!. It was great to visit this extraordinary aquarium! I hadn't been before to one but I think it must be one of the best oceanariums!I can guess that kids will love it , considering that we were two adults and had a great time there getting to know sea creatures from quite close!

Not the best but cool.... I went to lisbon for 10 days and I cannot believe that this is rank as the first thing to do in Lisbon. It was nice but certainly the most expensive activity I have done during my trip. Worth it if it is raining and it is a nice family activity but not my best in Lisbon.
Exellent. What a nice place to visit whole day. Just like diving yourself in the sea. Best ocenario in my experience.
Very cool!!. Just great!!! Very good with kids!Good infrastructure with subway at the door!!

awesome!. We LOVED this oceanarium! My husband & I spent the day there viewing the exibit as well as the new turtle exibit. It was amazing. Spent 2 hours in the blink of an eye. We totally recommend it to anyone! The area around it is gorgeous & modern and beautiful. Wonderful arcitecture, beautiful gardens & oceanview. A must see.

Very good and excellent value. Very good. We have been to some excellent aquariums in Sydney, Auckland, Seattle and Monterey and this is up there with the best. Very good value. easy to get to as it is close to Oriente station on Lisbon's excellent Metro system
Fish, fish and more. Too many school children to be able to peacefully appreciate the well designed exhibits. Special exhibition on sea turtles was excellent.
Great. I love the ocean and marine life so this place was great for me. The exhibits, including the temporary turtle exhibit, were really good and were well looked after.
Nice program. Beautiful and kids will love it. It is good to go on mondays when every museum and other nice things are closed.

well worth a visit. well laid out
very interesting to see different enviroments/sea life

Must see aquarium when you visit Parque das Nações. Located in the Parque das Nações - "Nations Park " (site of Expo 1998), near Oriente metro station, this aquarium was a delight to visit. We spent almost two hours going through the different levels, around the central huge water tank. There were lots of visitors, including some school groups, so it was a lively and educational experience. The whole "Nations Park" is a nice place to walk around as well and the Vasco da Gama mall is nearby, right outside Oriente station.
Outstanding aquarium. The diversity in the displays, faboulus central fishtank.

Unimpressive and Mediocre at Best. My wife and I absolutely loved our trip to Lisbon, but were quite unimpressed with this aquarium. Billed as the second largest aquarium in the world, I can think of several aquariums that I have visited in recent years that are far better than this oceanario.For an aquarium that is promoted as being so voluminous, the exhibits were quite small and unimpressive. The outdoor exhibits were tiny compared to others I have seen, and the oceanario did not have whales or walruses or other large marine life that one would expect from a first class aquarium. The temporary exhibit on sea turtles was also a huge disappointment, as there seemed to be only two or three of them and the tanks' windows were small and low to the ground, making for poor viewing conditions.I am sure that children would enjoy this aquarium, and it is certainly not a bad place to visit on a rainy day. But given our expectations for the second largest aquarium in the world, the oceanario failed measurably. I cannot for the life of me understand why this is so highly ranked on TripAdvisor.
Fantastic. A great mix of education and spectacle at this fantastic aquarium.Well worth a visit for young and old.

Take your time. This place is HUGE. I did not realize the extent of this Oceanarium, and picked a day to visit that I was limited on time. I would recommend that you plan at least 5 hours, or more, to fully explore this place.I went right to the Sea Otter exhibit. I love watching them play. The Oceanario has wonderful eco-exhibits for kids, and I would love to come back and explore when I have more than 2 hours to spend there.

Great for aquarium enthusiasts. I visited as a person who keeps marine fish tanks at home in Australia. I really loved this place, seeing so many great fish, seeing Otters for the first time and cute penguins that come right up to you! Its really great that the Oceanario puts a large emphasis on protecting what we have and educating kids.
If you like fish, sharks en stingrays.... Than its a must visit! What a big aquarium, unbelievable. Als now showing: turtles

We all really enjoyed the aquarium. 6 adults (45-55) and a 12 year old in our group. We all thought it was brilliant. Best aquarium I have ever been to. Well planned layout and even though it was busy, it was never too crowded so everyone could see everything. Would recommend a visit for all ages.
Turtles were fantastic. Really enjoyed the whole visit. Very well set out and a great place for all the family. One central area and then all the oceans with so much marine life. Great afternoon.

Great fun. A really enjoyable experience - we visited the Oceanario because it was a really wet day in Lisbon, but I'm glad we did! It's huge, with lots of exhibits split into different sections representing different areas of the world's oceans. The layout is great, and I could have spent all day in there. Well worth the trip from the city (actually it doesn't take long on the metro).

Surprisingly good. I went to the Aquarium Finisterrae in Coruña back in 2009 and didn't love it. So this time I was in Lisbon with my parents and bf and said "Aw, lets do everything else first cause the Oceanário will be boring". For my luck I had time on the last day to go there and it was Legendary!

Fantastic!. Make sure you get there i the evening. You will beat the crowds and have the place to yourself.The temporary exhibition is worth visiting and is only €3 more. great experience, definetly one of Lisbon's highlight1
Dont miss it. Excellent but expensive (13 euros). With or without children. Nice shop with variety of gifts.
One of the best (after pier 39 in Frisco). Very large central bassin accesible from various parts, good & large mix of sea biology, aranged by Ocean, located in a smashing modern architectural area.

Not a conventional aquarium. Don't be put off by what acquariums used to be like. This one is fantastic, The main tank is huge and can be viewed from two levels and multiple angles around the building. The side exibits are well thought out and well presented. I particularly liked the mix of fish and sea birds.An easy way to spend a couple of hours while recovering from the previous night's festivities.

A wonderful place.. This is a fantastic place to spend an hour or two. I have been before but was happy to revisit. Amazing to see the fish so close, a great assortment to see. Lots of interest here, such a diverse collection of animals. From sharks to the tiniest frogs, wonderful coral, and of course the otters and penguins. I could go on and on. Be sure to visit.

Sea world!. A must see attraction if travelers are from Australasia. Features many land, sea and air animals that don't inhabit our land like sea otters... Very well set out. Something interesting at every corner or corridoor.

Not just for children!. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the Oceanarium - I believe that it is the second largest in Europe. It can get quite busy, so a visit early in the day is a good idea. The signposting from the nearest Metro station (Oriente) through the Parque das Nações is somewhat inadequate, so it's worth check exactly where to go by map before setting off. The Parque das Nações cable car has the southern of the two stations nearby. The cafe is a bit disappointing, but adequate for a snack and drink.
Worth the Trip. It compares favorably with the best in the USA and we have been to Baltimore, Chicago, Monterey, And Charleston to name a few.

A must do. We spent an amazing afternoon here over Easter. Went to Belem in the morning and got thenumber 28 bus from there directly to the Oceanario.It's brill, especially the very large central area. Fantastic selection of aquatic life. Well worth theEuro 16.00 admission fee, this also included enterance to the temporary exhibition of seaTurtles.

Well worth a visit. This was the first thing we did when visiting Lisbon, being the #1 attraction and it being a rainy day... A brilliant start to the holiday, even though a true tourist attraction.The aquarium has a central tank, and then quadrants coming off of it. It had animals in it which I have never seen in aquariums, such as penguins, birds flying overhead, otters and sea turtles. The temporary "sea turtle" exhibition is worth a look if you don't mind paying the 4 extra euro. Definitely be prepared for hoards of small children...The best bit was finding little secluded benches where you had your own view of the central aquarium. Easy to get to on the metro, which costs about 1.50 euro for a single trip.Make a point of asking for a STUDENT rate if you have a student card.

You can't go to Lisbon and miss this!. Just excellent. Don't think 'I don't like aquariums, it's not for me' - you'll be awe-struck in the majesty of this place. Just ride the red metro line to the Parque de Nacoes and walk over through the mall to get there.Tips - get the discount price from the 'Lisboa card', and try and go first-thing in the morning or last thing in the afternoon to miss the noisy, hyperactive school groups.Don't forget that it's not all about fish - don't miss the otters, penguins, crustaceans, sea horses and rather-scary looking octopus!

a must see under water but not under.... This is a must see if you are visiting Lisbon. This is the location Portugal held its World's Fair 1998, entitled Expo at that time. It is marvelous to see the ocean life while you are walking surrounded by the water tanks, fish and other creatures..beautiful! You can go by Metro (Subway), look around a very large and clean shopping center and then just cross the street and you are at Expo! Take a ride in the cable cars above the ground along the water... beautiful.

Wow!. Blown away by the fish, really, it was gorgeous. had to side step lots of small noisy kids on school tours though!The sea turtle exhibition was well worth visiting, he swam right under my feet, it was awesome

Underwater world.. The Aquarium, is a really great place to spend a day alone or with a family speciallie with if you have children.
On sundays could be very busy.
beautiful. interesting place better than some other like Genoa in Italy but not so beautiful like Sydney

One of the best. Ive been to many aquariums and this was one of the best. The scale and depth of exhibits was first rate. I didn't like the Artic exhibit. Like other reviewers I thought the tanks were cramped and unappealing. The animals, particularly the walruses, seemed stressed.

good for rainy days. When when outside it is great to spend some time indoors. the turtles exhibition was disappointing, very few species. Be careful on your way out... when rainy it is very slippery!
central tank is amazing, as well as the flatfish. does not compete with Florida's (Orlando) marine park.

Amazing central tank and cool exhibits. I love the huge central tank at this aquarium, with invisible partitions so you just look up and down as far as you can see and all the fish and sharks seem to be swimming together. Very, very cool. The special exhibits are great as well. I took off a star only because it is pricey, especially compared to other Lisbon sights. I would suggest using a Lisboa card or other kind of tourist pass, it can save you some on the entrance fees. The neighborhood and surrounding water park, bicycle riding, restaurant row, and the nearby science museum make this a really great place to spend a day with the kids.
I have been to many.... I have been to a lot of Aquariums. I really love them! And this one is one of the best.
Oceanarium. Brilliant,could have spent all day there its an amazing aquarium,from the cold waters to the tropics tiny frogs to huge sharks surely a must visit if in Lisbon

Do this while in Lisbon. We didn't think we'd bother with yet another big-city aquarium, but this one really is different, and well worth the time, money and trek out there. They did a great job at creating a real undersea experience (we are long time divers) and in creating appropriate ecosystems. They did a great job in educating the public about how we are devastating our seas and how this will impact our future. We recommend it highly!
Best aquarium anywhere.. Excellent value for the best aquarium I've ever visited!
excellent. Very rech with fishes, and beautifull. Good organisation.
Fantastic!. Go there! Wheter you like fish or not, you will never regret this visit. The surroundings at the Oriente station is fabulous.
Real experience. It´s a wonderfull journey. Really big and pleasure place. Not only the Oceanario but everything around. You can not miss this place.

magic. a great oceanarium, very well constructed so that even if there are a lot of people it is easy to follow the path and not get lost or miss anything. The spectacular array of fish was marvelous not to mention the information provided in both written and audio form. A must for big and small ;0)
Sea views with some!. fantastic fish-life; great info; worth a visit any day!

Underwater Magic. We went in the late afternoon and stayed 2-3 hours. We didn't have to wait in line and it wasn't too crowded. The huge tanks are fantastic and I really loved the temporary turtle exhibit. You can sit "underwater" and watch the turtles swim over you.

Much fun!. This Oceanario is the second largest in Europe and it shows. There's lots to see for both adults and children so you will not get bored. Lots of seats all around the Oceanario so even the ones who need to sit down every once in a while don't have to worry. Tickets are reasonably priced and for only 16e adults can see the permanent and temporary exhibit.

worth visiting even without kids. A thrilling experience of seeing ocean's big fish very near and even from below! Not too big to get tired and variable enough, they try to give visitors information and tells about conservation. Sea otters are natural born entertainers, and the info provided was helpful, when one is eager to know more about those delightful creatures.

sunfish. go see the sunfish, it looks like they ran out of money when they were trying to make it. fascinating, even for non nature freakssharks are also interesting though a bit scary. not only for kids.go after lunch not before ¡
Every visit a joy. A great place to take visiting friends and family. I've also sent business friends with a guide. Nobody has been disappointed.
Great turtles. Very enjoyable hour. All displays in English which was very helpful. Cafe food was not great. The food court in the shopping centre would've been a better option.
Amazing!. This place is simply mind-blowing, don't miss it, even if it seems a bit our of your way.

Amazing, awesome, and some more amazing!. One of the awesomest things about Lisbon, a must visit. Price is very good, when it’s not crowded, you can spend the whole day there. It’s very well kept, spacious, lots of variety, kids areas that are educational. The place where the Oceanarium is a neat place as well, newer fancy looking buildings, neat fountains.

Good!. Informative and good with a very smart layout.
The shop did not have much interesting stuff though.

nice but was expecting better. Spent there a bit more than 1 hour. The area is new and looked after, the walk on the riverside is relaxing. The Oceanario itself is well made, brings the visitor through different climates and scenarios. However I was expecting something more breathtaking. I wouldn't consider this attraction a priority when visiting Lisbon, but kids might be fascinated indeed.

Fantastic but spendy. The central tank is amazing and the temporary exhibit on sea turtles was wonderful. Our thirteen-year-old loved it. We could have sat next to the large tank for hours watching the sharks and rays. No discount for a family of three, so 48 euros was a bit steep for the afternoon.

Very interesting. I've visited a lot of aquariums during my travels, but this was one of the best. There are some "obligatory" small tanks with tiny reef fish, but the biggest attractions are the huge tank in the center, with sharks, manta rays and other "monsters", and the open rooms with puffins, other birds, and funny, inquisitive sea otters watching tourists just as mych as we watch them.
Big fishy wow.. Outstanding aquarium and attraction. Amazing. Loved the variety and views of the specimens. What's not to like about this outstanding attraction with informative and useful displays.
Amazing building. Maybe a 0little bit expensive but when you have kids you should visit. Our daughter loved it.

Excellent attraction and worth a visit. This isn't cheap - €16 each for an adult if you include both temporary and permanent exhibitions, but is well worth it, in our view. There's a family ticket for 2 adults and 2 kids, but I'm afraid I don't remember the price. We particularly liked the giant turtles in the temporary exhibition. In the permanent exhibition, the exhibits are arranged in climate zones: the sharks are impressive in the central "tank" and, above all, we loved the sea otters.
awesome!. best aquarium ever! I think we took about 300 pictures. Kept getting drawn back to that amazing tank!

A fabulous aquarium. A deeply memorable aquarium well organized and superbly laid out. This is one of the world's great aquariums and a must see for anyone who has even a passing interest in marine life. Schoolchildren are mesmerized by their close proximity to some extraordinary creatures.
OK. Don't do the optional temporary exhibitions which is an extra 6euros.

Worth a visit. Huge central tank with all kinds of fish including big manta rays and sharks, all just on the other side of the glass. With some creative photography (no flash allowed!) you can make it seem there's nothing between you and the sharks ;)There are also other exhibits in the oceanario which are just as much worth the visit, so be sure to see all there is to see, don't just spend hours at the central tank =)

Amazing. For me and my family, it was the best thing to do in Lisbon.Visit Oceanario de Lisboa is a thing that you have to do, don´t matter how much time do you have.This is so interesting that you can do if you are travelling with friends, alone or with children.This is the best and the biggest so far Oceanarium that I have ever seen around the World (you cannnot compare it to Barcelona or Berlin, it´s really impossible).The biggest Aquarium that you see in the middle is amazing, unbelievable how can people do a thing like this.They have a lot of different species beyond those Oceans species. They have one part that is dedicated to reptiles that is incredible. They have frog in almost every color and size that can existe.This Oceanarium is a place that you can relax - so, if you are tired after a long travel to Lisbon, this is the perfect time to visit the Oceanarium. For me, you can easily spend more than 3 hours there, because everything is so big and so amazing that your attention is caught all the time and because of that, when you realize a lot of time has already passed.

Those sea otters. A good place to spend two or three hours marvelling at the sea creatures from all the continents with climates to match. The stars of the show were the sea otters who just were there to please the audience with their paws across their chests floating by.

Lovely place to visit. On our second day in Lisbon we decided to catch the bus out to the Oceanario De Lisboa and spend some time near the water. It cost us 16eu each to get in to both the permanent and the temporary exhibits, however you can find 10% off vouchers in local free guide books. We found the Oceanario to be quite small but still beautiful. There is a huge tank in the middle with different species of fish, rays and sharks inside. You walk around through different exhibits including penguins, frogs, different water climates and my personal favourite - the otters. I guess we are a bit spoilt coming from Australia in that we have some amazing aquariums full of great white sharks, giant loggerhead turtles etc, so the Oceanario was quite small in comparison to us. But all the children there had a great time with their families and we really enjoyed ourselves too. A lovely way to spend part of a day, strolling around and then grabbing a drink and lunch on the water. You can get to the Oceanario from Lisbon by catching a 28 bus, though you will need to go to the metro station first to purchase a day-trip travel pass for 5.50eu.

Excellent family day out. The Lisbon Oceanarium has been open since the world expo98 held in Lisbon. It is an excellent activity for families (don't forget to ask for the family tickets) in this "new" area of Lisbon call Parque das Nações (underground red line). The central tank is one of the best I saw, you can easily seat down and watch it for a long time due to its diversity, around the central tank there's plenty to see with smaller tanks and aquariums together with some children's activities. Even if you don't have kids this is one Lisbon's must see.

Not to be missed. I have visited aquariums in Berlin, Vancouver, and Barcelona, and this has been honestly the best I've seen so far. Smaller than I imagined it would be, I still found the presentation very impressive. I don't have kids, and didn't travel with any, but I would imagine that due to many interactive activities especially in the turtle exhibition, the aquarium is an awesome way to spend an afternoon in Lisbon if you're travelling with kids. The regular adult entry was 13 Euros, we paid 3 extra to also see the temporary turtle exhibition. While this might seem a little bit pricy, I would gladly pay it again. I loved the different overpasses and little tunnels and the presentation of information. There is a cafeteria style restaurant on the first floor, where you can get a soup, main dish, dessert, and drink for under 10 Euros. You can combine the visit to the aquarium with walking around the Parque das Nacoes, the area built for the Lisbon World Exposition.

peaceful and beautiful. it's amazing to see the gigantic aquariums and if you go on a week day, usually there's few people there, so you can make the most of it and just relax, feeling you're actually in the ocean
Exciting turtles, but natural habitat.... Couldn't help but be a little concerned that overall space was lacking...

Excellent!. Even we are in the fourties we really enjoyed to Oceanion de Lisboa. I want to congratulate the institution for the great work that they are doing in promoting the ocean life. The center aquarium is outstanding!

Amazing. When did you had the chance to see and study the behavior of fishes when swimming in a fish skull? Or see happy otters swimming, eating ad playing?
I have been in many aquariums in many different countries, and the Oceanario de Lisboa is still on the top 5 for me.
A visitors joy. The central tank wiht access at two levels gives you a very clear and close up view of the undersea world.

Great place to spend a rainy day!. The Oceanario, a huge aquarium, is a really great place to spend a rainy day. The huge central tank holds sharks, baracudas, tunas, moon fish and many other species of fish. And if the fish and corral fail to impress you, the penguins, puffins and sea otters most certainly will. They are so cute!
So Much Fun. The otters were my favourite, but there was tons to sea. ;)

Superb. Set in a huge park there is a lot to see. As well as fishes there are some cute Sea Otters, Penguins and turtles. The museum is well arranged with one exhibit leading seamlessly into another. Thera is just enough information on each exhibit and as you go round you can see the fishes in the huge centre tank from many different angles. Some parts of the floor are perspex so that as you go round the museum you feel as if you're waling on the water underneath. They have a nice cafe and once you're done with the Oceanarium, there is a cable car nearby from which you can get a great view of the bay
Very busy. It's interesting but be ware of the children! They are everywhere, screaming, crying, running.The collection itself is quite good but similar to other big aquariums.

Not the largest aquarium in Europe but an excellent one.... We spent a fantastic half-day (can visit everything including temporary exhibitions within 5 hours) with our kid... the only little thing are the scholars, well we found scholars in almost every aquarium we visited in the last 3 years... but besides that (we have been kids too!) the "Oceanario" is a great place to go with children.

Worth Price of Entry - Can Get Dark so watch your kids. multiple tanks for different ocean regions. you get to see it from above with puffins or penquins or sea otters and below with the fish. lots of smaller acquariams for individual fish so you can get up close. the open ocean tank is just awesome to sit in front of and watch.it is very dark in there and small children may get scared. it also makes it easy to lose track of them, so pay attention.the turtle exhibit was really cool too. not sure if it was a temporary exhibit or not though.

So good we bought an annual pass. We have three daughters (now ages 7, 7, and 2) and all three love to visit the Oceanario. We enjoyed it so much we bought an annal pass for the family. We are particularly fond of the otters and the penguins. The aquarium is located along a great walking path next to the Tejo River, good shopping and excellent restaurants. It is a great way to spend an entire day!

Better than I thought. This is absolutely an interesting place to visit, also where it is located on teh formet Expo98 grounds with intriguing modern architecture. There is one bassin ( with sharks adn manta's) in the center of the building, and lots of smaller fishtanks with several diiferent species in the corridors on 2 levels. Also two areas with penguins and other seabirds. Kids would really love it!

Great Oceanarium. It's the third time i visit this oceanarium and for sure it's not the last one. Plenty to see here from fishes to mamals and birds from around the world. Gigantic main tank. Impressive. The largest in Europe. Just a "little" expensive so i don't give it 5 stars. And when you're done with the oceanarium take a walk outside in a beautiful area, called the nations park, wIth great restaurants and bars and impressive views if you take the cable car. There's also a nice shopping center, a mega sports&concerts pavillion and a huge expositions pavillion. Don't miss it!

Best aquarium of the world. I have been to many aquariums around the world including the great Baltimore and Monterey Aquariums.This is much better, it is really incredible! One of the best attractions in lovely Lisbon! Do not miss it!! It is a must!
Not the best I have seen. Expected more as I have seen much better oceanario in other parts of the world.

Not to be missed. The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the most spectacular places to visit in Lisbon. A huge central aquarium is filled with sharks, rays and other fish. You can see this at two levels on your journey around the attraction, literally seeing sharks swim within inches of the viewing glass. There are also different zoned areas giving specific information about sea life around the world from the Poles to the tropics. Children will be fascinated and adults will learn a lot. Try to visit when the sea otters are being fed in the early afternoon - they're delightful. I am lucky enough to live in Lisbon but whenever my mother visits we always have to come here. Please remember: if you do visit, respect the rules and don't use flash photography.

well worth the price. Far better than expected. Very clever the way it is set.When you first come in you might think is this it, but once you start walking around it is very entertaining. Kids and adult would like it.

The Dragon is so cool!. I first thought it was a plant!The place is located in the former EXPO 98 area, get there by metro,you' ll arrive in a big mall, walk around the neighborhood to see other museums, restaurants and park

Nice aquarium, but expensive. The aquarium is located in a nice area, where the world expo in 98 was held. You should walk around that area and enjoy the beautiful Tagus river. Regarding the aquarium itself, it's nice, but for the price of the ticket, I was expecting something better. The penguins part was really nice!
The best in Europe. You think you are in the deep blue. I only regret that the "oceanario" is not big enough to have a walle.
amazing underwater world. You get to see all kinds of fish, sharks, sea turtles, sea otters (extremely cute!). Very interesting for adults as well as kids.
Outstanding. Very impressive....we had a good afternoon here. I'd recommend not hurrying thru.

DREAMING UNDER THE OCEAN. This is a beautiful place where to spend a nice afternoon once in Lisbon. You can see all the animals who lives under the sea obviously (turtles, sharks, big fishes... ), but what is beautiful is that it seem that you are swimming with them in those moments. It's not so expensive the ticket and gives u the chance to "make a dream come true in Lisbon".

worth to visit. Well, this place is very nice. we enjoyed it. if you visit it as a group I do not recommend you pay in advance, as they're not prepared for your visit... But the oceanario is worth visiting
Worth a visit. Very nice acquarium, worth the somewhat pricy entrance fee. Great design and interesting not only for kids. Allow 2-3 hours for a visit.

Underwater adventure. Definitely check out the Lisbon Aquarium it's a wonderful day out. I'm not a huge aquarium person but this is well worth your time with countless majestic tanks fully stocked with a huge variety of sea creatures from turtles to fish to sharks and birds. If you have time stop and get lunch at the out door aquarium cafe, the service wasn't great but the food was really delicious
Worth a visit. Wonderful place, great architecture, lovely fish, Otters and penguins.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful places in Lisbon. You can observe different sea life forms in their natural environment. Good to take the children.
Don't miss the aquarium. It was brilliant and we spent more than two hours exploring the exhibits
A must to see. Excellent architectural solution to have quite an impressive overview of the oceans world
Lovely and relaxing. Great to visit the oceanario but all is centred around one large fish tank it seems. Expensive unless you really want to go!
Half a day spent here.. Transported to another world. Well layed out and the turtle exhibit was well worth the extra fee. Lots of fishes to see.

Great Oceanario - Cold and distant neighbourhood. Great the Oceanario itself but the area where it is feels quite cold and distant from everything. The Oceanario is worth the visit - but don't think it's worthwhile to linger in the neighbouring 'attractions'
Great for kids. Very nice, really many things to see. I liked the location.

Another face of Lisbon. There were 2 attractions, the permanent one and a temporarily one on turtles this time.
Audio guide can be skipped, pieces of information provided are no so useful and complete.
The surroundings of the museum are interesting to walk through to discover a more modern face of Lisbon despite a lot of empty areas.

Well worth a visit. The Oceanario is quite fantastic. Although it seems a little out of the way, it is well worth the visit. Currently, there is an exhibition of sea turtles, which allows you to watch them swim beneath you.
The Expo centre is great; spacious, clean and with great views.
Otters & Penguins!. Otters and penguins. Turtles and sea horses. Puffins!

highly recommended. Amazing-90 minutes of pure fun.In the new and modern part of lisbon-oriente metro station.Take a walk along the riverside-have a coffee-a drink or a lunch at one of the restaurants.Go for shopping at the vasco da gama center

Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. The oceanario is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon, I went with my girlfriend and had a great day, not only visiting the exhibits, but the whole EXPO are is beautiful. THe aquarium is enormous on two floors and has plenty of viewing points. Really a Lisbon must
worth a visit. Great for kids and worth a visit once. a little on the expensive side, but worth a go. retired visitors get in for about 9 euros and adults are 13 euros
A place to go when visiting Lisbon!. An amazing place to see fish in their natural environment.
Oceanario. Appreciate an enchanting and unforgettable tour through the different sections of our astounding aquarium!
fantastic. one of the most beautiful places of lisbon,to see sealife!!!
Really enjoyable. Lovely area, not cheap but worth the money of 16euros for the main and temporary exhibits combined
Excellent - maybe one of the best in the World!. The architecture, the different ecosystems, the fish look relaxed, choldren learn a lot and get excited about nature!

What an absolute brilliant day out this was.. Absolute fantsastic place, the massive glass walls inside give you an amazing view as the water is crystal clear. The wife kept losing me as I was just rooted to the spot gawping at the display of fish, especially the sharks, it's not over expensive at 12e and its location is right in the middle of the expo 98 exhibition grounds. which itself is a good day out as well.
1/2 day visit. really wonderful place to see but expensive to get in and you have to pay extra to see the turtles and a audio guide.
Not the biggest, but.... It's not the biggest in the world but you must get time to visit it and you will not be deluded.

Pleasant afternoon out. Spent a nice couple of hours around oriente and the aquarium. The oceanario was pleasant, but nothing special. There is a huge central tank where you can view on two different levels at multiple sites. There are some huuuge fish in there. There were the standard types of fish, penguins, other birds, otters... The bit I found most interesting was a video on the upkeep of the aquarium, feeding, how they made the water in the tanks etc. The walk from the metro station to the oceanario was also very nice. Great views.
Oceanario. Such an experience! so great and rich, we certainly needed more time than we've planed.

Nice visit. There is not much to do in Lisboa, so this Oceanario was kind of a must. Nothing really special, but nice visit anyway. And in a sunny weather you good also spend time in parks etc. nearby.The Oriente area (where Oceanario is) was nice too, and there was little shopping centre as well.

Very interesting. Having gone there with my daughter, who thouroughly enjoyed visiting all the little fish, and the penguins, i have to say it was an afternoon well spent! The only downside was, this was the second time trying to go there, as on the first, there was a line of about 100-150 ppl waiting before us. problems with the ticket office? not enough staff to process entries? I dont know. But i have passed there on several occasions, and seen lines that stretch out a long way!
Beautiful. I loved the spirit of the Oceanarium, really good experience.
The best in Europe!!!!. ....and the biggest one! I suggest it for all the kids.
Very good. Well laid out, lots to look at with plenty of sharks!

Great. Nice building, great central aquarium, great animals.Great for kids and adults.It's a pity the Expo quartier has really only bad touristic restaurants. No traditional Portugueuse kitchen to eat after the Oceanario.
must see. well, that is wonderful opportunity to go to discover oriente district and sealife! it will be absolutely amazing experience to have with children, or just for yourself.
A must see for everybody. The main aquarium is huge and everything is in very good condition. Divers were feeding sharks and stingrays. What a view!
Nice aquarium. I believe it could be really interesting to visit the aquarium with kids. There is a huge tank in the middle and its quite fascinating.
All ages will love. The central aquarium is mesmerizing.  Only issue is the never ending school groups and their LOUD voices.  Children in Portugal are TOO LOUD.

Great for families - kids, preteens, adults. Much to do, easy to reach by "subway", friendly staff, reasonable price. EXCELLENT exhibits -- among the best in the world that we've seen, and we've been to quite a few.

Excellent experience. We visited the Aquarium during a trip out to the Parque das Nacoes. Using the Lisboa Card allowed us to get a reduction on our ticket prices, 43 euros for 4 of us. This included entry to the temporary "Turtle" exhibition which was stunning. Long tanks that would round the site so that you could see the turtles and fish from lots of angles, the best being the glass walkway that you stepped over. A little girl was lying on it watching the turtles eye to eye and I wished that I could do the same!The main area was beautiful, a very large central tank with all manner of creatures in there, including two divers! There were lots of viewing areas and in some places the glass was double height and as it was fairly quiet when we visited, there were times when you could just sit and watch what was going on with no one else around. It felt like you were in there with them. There were also four areas for the different oceans with otters, penguins and different fish found in different parts of the worlds oceans. So much variety and so cleverly set out that there was always something different to see. We spent at least two hours in there, a very good experience that will be long remembered.
A trip in the bottom of oceans. One of the best in my life, even best of acquario di Genova.
amazing!. it was really amazing! i have see a lots of beutiful sights of lissbon
Beautiful!!. Very refreshing to see all the colorful fish! Great for a hot summer day when you want to enjoy some AC.

Varied sealife. The content and layout were good for showing a variety of species which all seemed in good health. Emphasis placed on conservation issues to contradict the captive nature of the species on display.

Fantastic aquarium, one of the best all over the world. To spend three hours, in the middle, of sharks, moon fish, turtles, penguins, Pacific and Indic ocean, fishes, like clown fish, lots of mantas, and thosands of other beautiful, sea life.

big big fish and now... also turtles!. We are divers and we just got amazed with Oceanario. We were there in 1998 and later... now seems better as the fish are much bigger and they had a new building with an exposition about turtles.Definitely a must see in Lisbon!
Wow!. Have been to others but this was the 'bees knees' - was blow away!
Under the ocean..... Interesting, espeicially because I had never been in such an aquarium! I was there during the Expo'98, quite a while ago but it was really worth it!

Fantastic attraction, well worth a visit. Firstly, I should confess I am an amateur aquarium keeper so I get a bit more excited about public aquarium's than the average person but this is an excellent attraction. As well as the main tank which you see at different levels as you go round there are some cold water "habitats" complete with penguins and sea otters in open "surface" displays which you then get to see from underneath later, these are barely fenced off so you feel really up close though the birds are clipped which is a bit uncomfortable. There are some great, informative displays and an environmental message and I personally loved the film about how they maintain it all though I was the only one watching. We also visited the temporary Sea Turtle exhibition which was amazing and there is lots to see in the surrounding area and some good restaurant in an area which feels a bit like London's Canary Wharf.
Bring your diving mask.... At times, it's almost like you were scubadiving...

Oceanario lifts your spirits with an enormous high.. I visited Oceanario with my wife. I have limited mobility and use a walking frame but access was easy and superbly organised. It is set in a newly developed ares set up for expo 98, and the surrounding architecture is exciting.We went to the second floor to see the giant turtles. Both this floor and the floor below was a pageant of beauty and a monument to good care and conservation, so good it was hard to tear ourselves away after almost three hours. The fish and turtles swam so closely and against the backdrop of a kaleidoscope of colour. Every vantage point offered a 3d experience and you could watch the fish with extraordinary clarity at any number of levels. In one instance, we stood on thick glass with turtles swimming underneath. There was great ease of transfer between floors as I had to use a lift. In the permanent exhibition apart from the huge central aquarium, there was a section representing all the oceans in the world and we were thrilled to see penguins swimming underwater at speedThe conservation messages were direct, and uncluttered.

great day out. we took our 3 year old son to the oceanario and really had a brilliant day, the oceanario is really well laid out and an experience not to miss, and there are few things that keep a 3 year old captivated for a hours but this did. The surrounding area had lots to do too including bike/trike rental and trips in cable cars. The only downside if any is it is not a cheap day out for a large family but if you can afford it,do it!!!
amazing to relax. very good place to go between meatings. very nice place to go with family.

Good afternoon's entertainment. We were intrigued to see the variety of ocean life here, and liked the layout, with the enormous tank in the centre, and then the other exhibits around the edge. We thought the sea otters were charming and some of the fish amazing, not just in a pretty way either, one just stayed in one place staring at his audience through the glass! My teenagers were entertained, which is a recommendation in itself.
just fab. don't go to Lisbon without a visit to this whole area - great way to spend half a day and the turtle exhibit is the best
