Excellent. We spent 2 hours in there with my parents & my 6 years old kid who was very excited & as weird as it sounds so were we when we saw the giant aquarium that can be seen all around the place. We only saw the permanent exhibition. The area around the aquarium is very modern & spacious thus very nice for walks. A lot of things to see by the the ocean, really neat place.Do not miss this place especially if you have kids or some free time & you're a nature lover!
Great for kida and adults. Had a nice tour of the Oceanario. Really worth the visit
One of the best in the world. I was nicely surprised by the visit to the Oceanario. Fantastic place and especially if you like architecture.

main aquarium good - special exhibit not. My husband and I are well-traveled nature-lovers and have been to many aquariums around the world - this one is quite good, not as big and impressive as something like San Diego or even Vancouver, but apparently one of the largest in Europe. Climatic zones are reproduced in realistic detail, though I do worry about the total space for some of the animals (i.e. penguins.) Ironically, it is set in the middle of a small bay of water that would be perfect for the larger species that it houses - really a pity to see so many types of fish cooped up together in a central aquatic habitat, but, in the Oceanario's defense, they do take very very good care of their "residents".We paid an extra 4 Euros each for the special turtle exhibit which was a complete waste of money - there were 4 rescued turtles and a few token aquatic exhibits that were mini-versions of the exhibits in the main structure.
A must see. Great Aquarium : lots of different types of fishes and birds, most of them with a little text of explanation. Just too bad it's quiet expensive (about 15 euros)

Good for families. Somehow I think that Barcelona one was better...
But good if you go with family and in a good locaton too...
Price is a bit high tho... so be aware
Must to see in Lisbon. It was really great experience. Spent several hours walking and watching fishes and sea nature. Should not be missed on your visit in Lisbon.
Don't miss it!. Good representation of many ocean species. The main aquarium is amazing!
GREAT !!!. this is the best in europe for sure!!!its really nice and huge!!!

another world. You do not use all this diving stuff.
great experience :)

As aquaria go, this one goes with the best. The permanent exhibit is terrific, a huge round tank several stories high with enough variety of fish to satisfy the most voracious omnivore, only you look, don't eat. Beatifully designed with obvious care given to what's best for the inmates. It is in a very active local. There are concert halls and an overhead tram nearby with a great view of the riverside. A wonderful choice for a day out.
great experience!. You should visit the Oceanario! It is very big and kind of relaxing to see all those animals swimming around and living together!
Magical experience. Beautiful! Very interesting place! I could go there everyday!!!
Familly trip. It is a little far aqay from the city center but you can get the subway. It is beautiful and very well organized. Good for a familly trip.

Beautiful design. The aquarium itself seems to be world class, though not being an expert on such things, I can just say that I learned a lot and found the displays and design of the exhibitions to be amazing. The "temporary" exhibition on sea turtles was well done, but really the main show was the central tank of the permanent exhibit. The architecture of the buildings is the first sign that there was as much care placed into the development of the exhibits as there was the protection of the marine wildlife. The variety of animals as well as the size of the main tank mean that you could spend hours staring at it. Additionally, the lighting is well done minimize glare, leading to some amazing photographs, if you are experienced with no flash relatively low light environments. Even after spending 4 hours in the aquarium I would definitely come back on my next trip, though I might skip the temporary exhibit.

Don't miss your chance to visit. You should not miss your chance to visit the oceanarium, as there is a lot to see and learn about the oceans around the world, with thousands of animals and kinds of fish, natural environment!

If it wasn't for those parents and children.... it would be ideal. Don't get me wrong, I love this oceanarium and go there several times a year.The experience would be complete if it wasn't for those children and parents who bang on the glass or take pictures with flash. Maybethey don't know how to turn it off :)

incredible building. even if you ar enot into aquaria, this one will amaze you. The building alone is a work of art and the huge tank in the middle offers new views on a huge variety of sea creatures all the time. Add to that many different exhibits with speedy penguins, frolicking otters and many more and a "temporary" exhibition on sea turtles which is bigger and better than many premanent aquaria, and you can happily spend a couple of hours in here.
Walk in the Ocean. To be a fish in the sea and discover both climate problems and enjoy the variety of beautiful species

Worth visiting. Very nice place, which is located not far from the airport. It takes just only 10-15 minutes to get there from airport by airbus. If you have free time (2-3 hours) before flight you may go there. In Aquarium the marine life of different parts of the world is represented thoroughly. You can get a real fish idea of sea world and its inhabitants. The price of the ticket is 12 Euro. The place is worth visiting, espeially with children.
under water dream. Fish´s of all kinds, shapes, and sizes. very good to take your children´s, or goo alone. you´re aloud to take pictures. ENJOY
Impossible not to Love. If you love to feel underwater and see the magnificent, this is the place to be.
Beautiful , amazing environment. A place to go and see where we come from , and what damages WE cause to the environment by destroying our own world
Bellissimo!!!. Beautiful!!! Great for the whole family!!! And the location is perfect... You can go visit and then take a nice walk by the shore! Very nice restaurants all around! Fun place!!!

Special experience. Sea otters feeding time around 1pm very sweet!
Currently turtle exhibit - very beautiful

really great aquarium. pretty much the best aquarium i've been to! it was really neat how every habitat seemed open to the rest. and there was a point where i could have grabbed a penguin and snuck off with it if i really wanted to...

Great Ocenario..good afternoon adventure. This is a first rate Ocenario. Lots of great exhibits and lots to learn. The signs are in English as well as Portuguese so easy to read. Really enjoyed the Penguin exhibit, the Water Otters and the huge SUN FISH!

worth it!. Liked: mesmerising displays of sea-life. Different forms of sea animals, rarely seen anywhere else may be easily viewed. Easy to get to if one is taking the metro. We got off at Oriente, crossed the street to Vasco-da-gama shopping centre, went through it to the street beyond & a short walk to the left brought us to the Oceanarium. The cost is 16 euros for adults. We took around 3 hours to view everything at a leisurely pace.
Well designed, few fish. See title. Portugal is not a rich country in cash, but never impoverished in style or spirit.
Excellent day out suits all ages. Thought it was easily accessible and huge viewing areas. Great selection of fish. Enjoyed by all,
Magnificent. Someting that either adults or children should not miss on a Lisbon Visit!
Incredible. One of the good things that stayed for the future after the 98 exhibition. Love to go there.

Rainy day activity. Very impressive oceanarium. Great for a rainy day (or like us, a day when everything else was closed-January1). Within the Park of Nations and across from a large shopping mall and the train station Oriente.

Great!. Really impressive oceanarium split into 4 habitats. Allowed you to get up really close to the animals including penguins and birds. Very impressive central tank. Be nice if they gave a brochure or handout with more info on how the oceanarium works!
Wonderful Layout and Great Displays. We also were lucky enough to see the temporary display with Sea Turtles - was fantastic!
Nice place to visit during ur stay in Lissabon. Nice place to visit during ur stay in Lissabon, Kids love it and we parents too!

excellent excursion from the center. the Lisbon aquarium is quite good. It consists of a huge main tank with an amazing array of animals including a manta ray and several large sharks. It even has penguins. The vistor descends slowly a ramp that winds down the exterior of the tank, affording many different views of the interior. Well worth the 15 euro entrance.To get there, take the Red metro line in the direction of Orient and get off at Orient. Go up the escalators and wend your way thru the mall. At the east entrance of the mall, you'll see a big rusty scuplture. Go on past that for few hundred yards until you hit the bay. The aquarium is right then a bit further to your right. Can't miss it as it is the only building surrounded by water.Tom

Not to miss when visiting the Expo area. State of the art aquarium with a nice variety of creatures. It's very modern and clean. Anyone visiting the Expo area should include this as part of their visit.
I've seen aquariums all over the world and this one is special. The setting on the water, surrounding gardens, and bizarre architecture are part of a memorable visit.
Trop cool!. Magnifique moment passé... des conditions de visite super agréables, très riche et très instructif!
Oceanario. very well laid out and interesting. The theme is preservation and restoration of the oceans and the marine life that inhabit them.

Great attraction and lovely location in a very peaceful part of Lisbon. This 'Oceanario' is excellent, well laid out and thought out and an amazing variety of fish and other ocean wildlife. All descriptions and posters were in English too.Get the Metro - the bus takes ages but it does bring you through some of the less salubrious parts of Lisbon which might interest some. Metro takes half the time is clean and while there is one change is very easy to navigate and cheaper than the bus !When arriving and facing the waterfront the Oceanario is to your far right (not well sign-posted) and its a good walk from one end of the waterfront to the other.
Surprised. Did this on a whim and thought it was very nicely presented. I personally would pass on the combined ticket and just do the permanent exhibit.
Lovely place, Don't miss the feeding time!. The Sun Fish is something you cannot miss and the design is great which make this small aquarium contain BIG!
Great place for both kids and grown ups. Huge and amazing aquarium with lots of big and amazing fishes :-)
Must see!. Very nice for olds and youngs! Save a couple of hours to visit the oceanariun.
Impressed... It's for sure that it is one of the best place in the world to visit. Amazing complex. We visited this place with a group of 300 people in 2010. We all loved the trip. Huge so huge..
The four oceans in one single location. The four oceans in one single location located in a modern area of Lisboa, former industrial area that was recuperated for the international fair Expo98
Excellent. Lovely for both adults and children. Worth of 12 euros (adults) entrance fee.
best aquarium we have ever been to. outstanding variety and very modern...highly recommended even for those, like me, who have been to many of these aquarium attractions...
A must for all ages. A must see for children but also a very good oceanarium for all ages. You will fell underwater..

Fantastic Aquarium. I have seen many aquariums but this one has a unique concave design so you almost feel that you are in amongst the marine life and this is over two floors so there are different viewpoints. There are different sections that replicate different oceans. Highly recommended

Is a must. Is really amazing all the fish/marine species that you can see and if you are lucky you can see the staff feeding the fishes.
My tip don't buy the "combinado" which will give you access to see the turtles.
Excellent aquarium, must see. This is a great place to visit in Lisbon, can't miss the opportunity of visiting the place.
Wonderful. One of the largest oceanario in Europe. Great for kids and adults.

full of fishes. full of fishes from all the oceans
a lot of informations very well organized
but too expensive ticket for not having a tube to walk between the fishes

Fish, otters, penguins, puffins, your average aquarium. Liked : the fish! and otters and sea birds.Good for families. Expect a lot of people and queues during the weekend!It is your average aquarium. not something new or impressive or an innovative way to present the species. Yes I have been in quite a few aquariums so I am not easily impressed anymore, but jellyfish tanks without colours or a current to move them arround?we payed extra to see the temporary excibition, which was a bunch of sea turtles of which we saw ... 3 ... You see more in their natural environment when you go swimming in the Meditterranean.Also no control of people taking pictures using flash. Only someone at the entrance would tell you not to do it. But inside everyone did. Imagine being a species that likes the dark waters in the ocean and having a blinding light appearing in front of you every so often.

Few hours well spent. Main tank is amazing and walking around the place can be really nice with all the little details. Just make sure you go there at time when it's not packed, I bet it won't be as nice when there are too big crowds to handle.

World Class. This might not be as good as Sea World in San Diego but it pretty much beats most other places like this I have been to. I got there at 10:00 on a week-day and pretty much had the place to myself. Great experience!!

A fascinating aquarium. The large center tank is filled with various fish and has numerous viewing points on two levels. Well built exhibits featuring different oceans also on two levels. Especially loved the close-up with penguins and otters.

One of the best attractions in Lisbon. This is a great place to go spend a full afternoon. The Ocenario is a great place to go with your kinds no matter what their age is. See sharks, penguins, and all sorts of sea live.This is located in Expo near the river with great places to walk and have lunch or dinner. The Expo is also known for its great young night live.

Great Aquarium but a little pricey. Well laid out aquarium in a lovely part of town. Easy to get to on the subway. Be advised that the entrance fee does not include the special exhibits.The center tank is awesome. It is clean and the animals and fish all look healthy and well cared for.

What a Great Surprise. We loved the Ocenario -- particularly my daughter. The attraction is large, extremely well maintained and very interesting. The huge aquarium held everyone's attention for a very long period of time. The only negative thing I would say is that the staff seem bored and uninterested -- this seems to be a Lisbon-wide problem.

Escape the heat!. Not cheap - but an enjoyable place to spend a couple of hours. It was nearing 40 degrees when we went, so the darkness and air conditioning was very welcome. The whole area around the Oceanario is worth a decent afternoon's visit - we did the Aquarium and cable car then stopped for a nice cold beer in one of the many bars nearby. A good shopping centre too if that's your thing.

A vview of the life of all of the worlds oceans in one place.. Its a must if yoou have children. We didnt but watched those who were there and their faces were full of delight. I have never seen such an amazing selection of sea life before. My husband was mesmerised. Even if you have no interest in the oceans of the world you should go and see this.

Very good for children. My kids loved it!
If you have children you should go!
Nice place to go with kids. Nice time to spend with the kids and find out cool fings!
Best aquarium in Europe. Liked everything, great variety of fishes and good service
Interesting visit. Really cool Sea Life visit. Good for all ages. Adult cost around €15.
Great aquarium. Really great aquarium but it could be a litle bit less expensive. However it's a great place to visit wen in Lisbon
Super aquarium!. Absolutely, one of the best in the world! Everything is beatiful and clean. I strongly recommend a visit!

Great aquarium.. I've been to most of the major aquariums throughout the US. This rates with the best of them. I especially loved the large manta ray in the central aquarium. It made a great couple of hours in the middle of the day.
Great place to visit with kids. One of the greatest water tanks in the World, where you can see lots of species, and I am shure you and your kids will love it.
great place to see fish. The build itself is wonderful and the inside is great to visit :)
Great 1-2 hours with small kids. my smallest was afraid of the big sharks so prepare the small ones in advance to avoid screams
A sea country. Portugal respects his history. This is a fair contribution to the portuguese conquers over seas.
One of our highligths in lissabon. Great place to spend a few hours, inside the water and fish, but you don't get wet. The surrondings are also very nice and modern.
Beautiful. very good place to visit in Lisbon. It's very big and also have exposures. you can also walk in the neighborhood, that is very beautiful,

One of the very best aquarium in Europe. You are travelling with kids, this a must see place. The place is great and it is located in the well know Parque das Naçoes, a good place to stroll around, have a lunch and look at the River Tejo
Dream over the Ocean. I liked everything, in fact.The building in very beautiful, the way they organize the exposition, the species they have . And the amazing big central aquarium... superb

Great experience. Loved the main tank: its size is quite impressive.
The otters are a must see: they are too cute to be missed. :-)
Sea Spider,etc. Buy the big ticket . In the middle of Oceanarium is a big acvarium with , sharks,a lot of fishes. You can make pictures without blitz. Try it . You will like it .

Big Tanks. Well worth a vist, a massive tank with sharks, stingrays and loads of other fish. Penguins and otters were worth watching. Enough to keep most people occupied for a few hours. Worth seeing the turtles in the temporary exhibit.
Absolutely loved it!. The Oceanario de Lisboa is the best aquarium we have seen. Impressive variety of fishes and great displays of other animals. Very educational and entertaining.

Great Attraction & Value. Spent a half a day here with our 17yr old son waiting for wedding guests to arrive later on in the week, we used the 'not too complicated' Lisbon metro to reach it with just one train change and arrived around 10.30am.The aquarium is planned on 2 floors with the main tank in the centre and 4 different walk through climates at each corner.I was really impressed there was real ice and snow for the Humbolt penguins in the arctic corner, giant otters in the north atlantic corner, the hot humid environment in the rain forest corner.Some great pelagics in the main tank including a manta ray, sand tiger sharks etc. plus lots of other stuff such as interactive areas, video etc. ..... I would recommend this for all ages.

Huge Aquarium. Lisbon Oceanarium is huge and excellent. It was design by Peter Chermayeff one of the most experienced architects in building aquariums. Many things have been said her about the aquarium but I think the highlights are the variety of ecossistems inside, the huge central tank, the otters and most of all the excellent breeding facilities that had led many species, some that hardly breed in captivity to bring light to new born kids.

Great Aquarium. We spent most of an afternoon visiting the "4 Oceans" that are highlights of the exhibits. And the enormous watertank in the center that is filled with everything from sardines to sharks. Accessed from the Oriente station. A bit of a walk through the old 1998 Worlds Fair grounds.
Lovely. Very nice program (if you have kids they will love). Modern Oceanarium, with many choices of fish and sharks.

No Just for the Kiddies!. It was a beautiful location and building. Very kid friendly. It is rather expensive so you should plan to have loads of time to enjoy. I would reccommend seeing the sea turtles-the exhibit is pretty cool. Take time to walk around the area as well-it's lovely and lots to see.
Almost as great as scuba diving!. Be sure to arrive at least an hour before closing!

I like this place.. Right by the river in the old Expo grounds, this is a great place to visit. You will find bigger Oceanriums, but this is the right size, well designed and you can tell that this is a country that understands seas.

Awesome. I had a really great time at the Oceanario. There is no signage inside or outside the Oriente metro station so you will have to ask around. The best thing to do is to exit the mall and then turn right but keep to your left. You will then find a three storey building to your left surrounded by water. The building is not very attractive from the outside but once you get inside you will be thrilled. The coral reefs were the best part for me but there are some very interesting species of fish etc. there. It cost 12 euro and I think that it's well worth the price. It took my husband and I about 3 hours to view the permanent exhibition only but that was because we just sat and absorbed the fish, sharks etc. in the main aquarium for about 45 minutes. If you are not really interested in what can be found in the many oceans of the world, this may be pretty boring for you. It would probably be more exciting for the kids as the ones who were there when I was there seemed to be having a blast!

Never seen a tank that size!. Good points: a huge main aquarium tank that's large enough to allow a lot of fish to act apparently naturally, filled with a good variety of fish. The best penguin display I've ever seen (large flock in a big tank with natural-looking scenery and great underwater viewsNot so good: no cafeteria within the aquarium itself (it's good enough to spend a long time inside!). The special exhibition with the turtles was good, but slightly disappointing in comparison to the main aquarium.

A World Class Aquarium -and in a beautiful part of the city, no less!. I had heard from friends that the Oceanario de Lisboa was "so-so"... but in my experience you either like aquariums or you don't. My family definitely likes them -and the presentation of the various species and the information about them is very nicely laid out here. While I wouldn't rate it quite as high as, say, the Boston Aquarium (which is my favourite one visited to date), it is still an excellent facility and made for a wonderful day out in Lisbon -particularly on a rainy day!Another plus: it brought us out to the Orient area of the city, which is very modern and was a wonderful counterpoint to the historic center of the city that we had been staying in.

Modern and very complete. If you enjoy ocean and sea life, special if you have kids, these is a great spot.
Lots of species to sea - sharks and turtles are the best.
At weekends is very crowded go in a week day if you have that option.
Don´t miss Oceanario!. Don´t miss the Oceanario, a great place! I also recommend the cable car close to the Oceanario.

sea world. Biggest of its typeBe sure to buy a day pass . Includes cross-park return ride by cable car and the learning centreThe kiosk selling these is manned by english-speaking guides who are very friendly and helpfulTHe sea world itself has a wide variety of species. Special treats diring the visit were feeding schedules for the penguins and sealsThe adjoining mall is full of retail outlets and fast food joints in case you get hungry doing all the walkingThe oceanarium is well maintained
A peaceful moment. Nice and quiet surronding in the expo areaTo do and to visit

Well worth a look.. Obviously it's very large. Very relaxing, with welcome seats in quiet areas. Some general information would be appreciated - how tick is the glass, what is the volume, approx no. of fish spieces in the main aqaurium, etc. The smaller climatic zones were very interesting (although the Melbourne aqaurium has a much better penguin enclosure, and jellyfish display). Well worth a trip on the Metro to Oriente, then to wander through the shopping centre and on to the Aquarium. I had lunch at one of the "restaurants" nearby, but wished I had waited and found something back around Rossio!

Worth every minute of your time. One cannot say much else about this venue in Lisbon. It's a wonderful building which houses a fantastic collection of maritime animals and creatures.I've been there several times with my kids and it's always a joy to visit.
Great Aquarium. Nothing to dislike about it. Even the baby loves it.

Beautiful Aquarium. The aquarium itself is well laid out, interesting and not too congested regardless of the high numbers of visitors. The highlight though was the sea turtles exhibit, although not permanent, the layout suggests that future temporary exhibitions would also be worth seeing. Well worth the ticket price.

Amazing!. We were there 4 hours, but could have spent a whole day there! They did a beautiful job with this aquarium, the nicest I've ever seen. The place does get quite crowded, but we visited on a Sunday so possibly a visit on a week day would be better.Also a quick note that it can get quite cool in there so I would bring a sweater or something. The main reason we left after 4 hours was that we were too cold to stay longer.Definitely worth a visit.

Great day out in Lisbon. We spent a relaxing few hours at the Oceanarium - lots of information provided in English. The on-site restaurant is good value. Loved the turtle exhibition. The main tank is fantastic. Allow 2-3 hours for your visit.

beyond expectations. Great central basin full of fishes and fish runs worth hours of observation
Adjacent smaller basins devoted to the different nature zones are interesting as well

half a day well spent. This is a well laid out and well stocked acquarium with imaginative displays of aquatic life big and small. It was a family trip with two teenagers, bith of whom thoroughly enjoyed themselves. It should be high on your list of things to do in Lisbon.

It's a most.. One can see the link between this country and the oceans by visiting this amazing aquarium. The architecture of the place deserves a visit by itself, but inside is the real thing - it has such a huge pool that you feel feel like you are in the seabed surounded by sharks and a countless number of different fishes. Simply Wow.

Worth a visit on a rainy day. We planned our trip so that on the rainiest day (and the day other museums are shut) we could visit the Oceanarium. It is quite pricey but most Zoo's and other similar attractions are of a similar price. The temporary exhibition was a highlight, turtles! You could stand on a glass floor and watch them swim underneath or sit in a small cave-like place and let them fly over your head! The main attraction is well laid out and takes a good few hours to get around. I particularly enjoyed the information pods, the Sea Otters, the Sun fish and the penguins! Each area is themed by location in the world whilst walking around the main tank in the middle. Make sure you check out each window as different fish hide on the outside from the sharks in the middle.
Wonderful. Great value for money, easy to find. One of the finest attractions I've ever been to. A must visit, for the otters if nothing else.

Good program for the kids. Good program to do with the kids.It is not big and it is not one of the best Aquarium’s in Europe or in the world.The main attraction is the huge water tank in the middle of the building.But if your are there in the Parque das Nações, go for it.
Lots to see. An excellent place to go when it is wet - you can spend 3 to 4 hours there easily!

The Under Sea world. Good collection of fishes from all over the world. Maintaining different water temperatures and ideal conditions for different species across the various continents is quite a challenge. The Turtle exhibition is not worth and can be best skipped. The tickets are high priced ,but still worth once in a lifetime visit.

Don't Miss This Experience. Fantastic and fun place for any age. We were blown away and so was a visiting school group that delighted in the activities of the sea otters and penguins. Wish we had this near us. The National Aquarium in Baltimore is fine ... but Lisbon's Oceanario is breathtakingly amazing.
Magical place. It's beautiful. If you are passing by Lisbon, you have to go there!
Exceptional. A brilliant aquarium, well designed with good features abounding.

Most enjoyable, completed in four hours max. Great location (Further from the main hub than we thought) but loads of cheap parking nearby. The price was reasonable and the temporary exhibit was to do with turtles, took 30 mins and v. interesting although not many turtles were spotted in the exhibition.The main exhibit is a huge tank with loads of fish swimming - incredible to see and so many fish; seemingly enjoying themselves. The tour took us around the tank with many (8 I think) viewings as we went round Oceanario. If I'm being honest, it got a bit boring near the end but overall it was thoroughly terrific.
It was nice.. there were 2 section, temp. one was not interesting.

The best time money can buy. It's not the cheapest attraction in Lisbon, but it's sure one of the most valuable ones.If you like animals and nature, here is the place to go.Be sure you have 4/5 hours of free time before you go, because time flys inside this huge aquarium where you can see much from sea life.You have 4 outside (but covered) zones matching the 4 most representative oceanic life, that you can watch both from surfice or underwater (trough glass)Then you have one huge tank, with hundreds of creatures, from the small fishes to the big sharks.all these are divided in two floors.
15 euros. well worth the 15 e's entrance and go shopping at vasca across the road.
Beautiful!. Very informative and located in an nice area of Lisbon. great for kids and everyone else. Just love it.

Interesting place to visit. Takes a couple of hours but be warned the ticket queues were large I think because it was raining! Bit annoying they charge extra for the temporary exhibits as this should be included.Lots of interesesting fish and other animals it should keep adults and children entertained.
You cant miss. A program for couples, families or to go alone. Beautiful and well organized, a real journey under the water (has interactive educational points for children)

Great experience for kids. We went with our grandchildren who really enjoyed it. It is not as large as the ones in Monterey CA or Atlanta GA but well laid out. You are able to get the feeling of being very close to the fish. It has a nice variety of habitats.

Interesting. I have been to Hong Kong's Ocean Park which is larger than Oceanario, and the Monterey (CA, USA) Aquarium which has more species of jellyfish and seahorses. So by comparison, it wasn't quite as impressive as it otherwise would have been. The jellyfish that the Oceanario was quite pretty, as well as their leaf seahorse. The Giant Turtle exhibit was a little overblown, since there were only 4, 2 big and 2 small, and not easy to find. Still, it was an interesting way to spend half a day.

Well deserved No1 sight-seeing attraction in Lisbon. You can spend a couple of hours or a whole day. MUST issue the combo ticket with the temporary acquarium hosting the sea-turtles. Really amazing, either you visit it solo or with family and kids. The lay-out of this aquarium adds to the whole experience.
Amazing place in nice park.. Amazing place, which visit everytime when I'm in Lisbon. This year I saw the new turtle collection.

An amazing aquarium. This is a huge aquarium on two levels. An unusual feature is that on the upper level there are above water level habitats featuring penguins. On the lower level you can see the penguins diving down into the depths. It is probably the best of its kind I have seen.
Great for a full day visit. The fish and turtles were terrific and the Sea otters so amusing

Excellent extra day trip. I love aquariums and this is an excellent one. The set up and flow is very visitor friendly with several different exhibits. The central tank is awesome and I could have spent hours sitting in front of it watching all of the sharks and rays. Worth the trip out if you enjoy going to aquariums!
Best Aquarium I've been to. Well set out and themed. All of the areas were easily accessible. Alll highly informative with a strong emphasis on ecology and conservation.

Great time with children. It´s a great place to visit and expend some time with children or even for those who like ocean and sea life. It´s smaller than the Valencia´s Oceanario (Spain), but if you have some time it´s nice. There is a big central aquarium where fishes & rays & sharks swim together, you can reach it at different moments and levels, and you can seat to observe the sea life.
Amazing experience, not to be misses. Is like diving without getting wet, the best time to visit is early, because there is less people.

not a fan of aquariums, but this one id good!. As well as the huge impressive tank filled with a huge variety of fish they had a penguin enclosure plus - my favourite - three adorable sea otters who were very cute and content!The whole area around the Oceanarium is nice too - plenty of restaurants and a shopping centre
Good way to spend a day. Fantastic area to visit, with this fantastic aquarium , quite different from the city, certainly worth the bus trip, which takes about 15mins

Sea Otters - the coolest animals. The absolute best place to see the sea creatures ever - especially the Sea Otters who just spend the whole time just messing about. The dispalys are magical and the turtles just fly through the water - you can even lie under the tank and see the fish swim over you - almost as good as diving but without having to clear your ears!Beware of the lack of directional signs - Lisbonans don't seem to need them. Tourist can always ask someone!

A must do on a trip to Lisbon. Strangely, it is not signposted from the station - come up from below and carry on walking across the road and through the shopping centre, and you will come out on the large open area at the end, the oceanarium is way over on the right. It is a nice walk over, past some interesting fountains and with good views.As you might expect, it is full of loud and boisterous children, but it's that sort of place. Excellent displays, liked the sharks, sunfish, otters, penguins. The extra display was of turtles, which was very good. If you have any desire to see what is under the water, this is a must see attraction.The cable car outside is worth a trip, but the viewing tower at the end was closed and didn't look like opening in the near future. Good view of the bridge.

A MUST visit while in Lisbon. From the outside the Oceanarium looked like a really ugly building to me, but once inside it is a beautiful place with great exhibits showcasing the marine fauna and flora from around the world. We liked how well organized the exhibits are, but it felt a bit crowded, perhaps it was because we visited on a Sunday afternoon. You definitely want to bring a camera to the Oceanarium, make sure your SD card is empty, as you find yourself wanting to take pictures of everything, especially the sea otters, which are adorable. This is definitely not a short visit, you should allow at least to 2 hours to see most things at at fairly speedy pace; but we think 3-4 hours are just about right, to be able to see everything with the detail it deserves. Needless to say, this is a kids paradise, so if you have children, you must definitely visit the Oceanarium while in Lisbon. And if you don't have kids like us, it's still a must visit in Lisbon.

Sea Otters ftw. What a lovely place! The Temp exhibit we went to had Sea Turtles, the only bad thing was there was far too many people crammed in to what was a relatively small exhibit. A lot of barging was needed. The main exhibit though was wonderful. The sea otters were my favourite, could have watched them all day! We had a whole day to spend here (Oriente) but we were in the aquarium for about 3 hours, and we had to get the train to Faro later on that night so being so close to the train station worked out well. You can also go for a nice walk along the front, there's a big shopping centre too.

Very very nice. This attration is very very good. Here you can see various spimens of fish from all over the world. We can fell the difference of temperatures if you are in the polos or in a big ocean near the equator. You can see sharks and any kind of other specimens of fish.If you visit Lisbon, Portugal don´t lose this attration.

Worth a visit. Metro to Orient and also has a BIG shopping centre next to Oceanario. If you like to see various fish, tropical etc, otters, penguins playing, well worth a visit. After many Restaurant to chose from outside and also good if you fancy some shopping afterwards in the Centre,

Must see and spend at least 2hrs.. Easy to reach by subway nice location well maintained good collection of fishes and birds other marine corals etc. You should enjoy spending some time at each place going through explanations and also seeing documentary where it shows how much care they take looking after them.Enjoyed seeing children sitting in front of it along with parents and teachers and listening carefully about all about them.also liked turtle exhibition which is temporary .

The best Aquarium I´ve been to! Awesome!. Being married to a Biologist and a fan of nature myself, I love to visit aquariums whenever I have the chance. Been to Chicago, San Francisco, Veracruz, Oaxaca, Barcelona, most Seaworlds, among others. This one is just OUTSTANDING! Impressive how they actually breed coral and have many more alive species. Definitely, a MUST during any trip to Lisbon.

Expensive Ticket. There Oceanarium is has two parts (permanent & temporary). The temporary cost 6Euro, only to see live turtles and other exhibits about turtles.Both permanent and temporary cost 15.50 Euro. You can see a lot of live fishes, sharks, sea urchins, anemones. Some are rare ones....amphibians, reptiles and the like. By train take "Alfa pendular", "Intercidades", "Inter-regional" or Regional" will connect "Oriente" to both north and south of the country, as well as the suburban line Lisboa-Azambuja.Not a must see if you don't have enough time in Lisbon. I find the price expensive for the place.

Absolutely fantastic experience!. Oceanarium is located in Parque das Nações. You can get there by subway- station called Oriente. From there just take a 15 minutes walk to Oceanario. This place was trully amazing. I was expecting small aquariums but here you could see a huge tank filled with hundreds of different species including sharks and amazing sunfish. Moreover 25 additional small aquariums show every possible marine organism. Do not miss visiting three adorable sea otters and the temporary exhibition showing the loggerhead sea turtle. You can view him even underneath when he is swimming just above your head! After you have visited the Oceanarium take a walk along the shore or ride the cable car and get a nice view on Lisbon and The Vasco da Gama Bridge. Oceanario- a must when visiting Lisbon!!

Not to be missed.. We took the YellowBus hop-on, hop-on but tour on which the Oceanario is one of the stops. We arrived at about 10.30 and there was only a very short queue. By the time we left three hours later is was much busier.The Oceanario is one of the largest in the world and is set on the edge of the River Tejo. The aquariums are on a huge scale and depict the Atlantic, Indian, Pacific and Artic oceans and their diversity of sea life. You can view from two different levels - the lower level feels like you are under water. The windows are huge and give an uninterrupted view of the sea life.The information signs are in Portuguese and English and provide first class information about the oceans and their fragility without preaching about the environment. This approach is very thought provoking as you can see these beautiful creatures and be reminded how delicate their environment is.On our visit there was a special exhibition of sea turtles on the top floor. Again, not to be missed and very thought provoking. Do take a camera (flash photography is not allowed) although a video camera will give you the best memories to take home.

What a sweet otters and turtles. It is very well organized big aquarium, with many places where you just can sit and contemplate looking at hundred of fishes, sharks and other ocean creatures swimming around. I also saw a creatures that i have never knew that exist like the sweet ocean otter. Also there is an axposition dedicated to the turtles and their survival in the polluted seas. Its worth to visit.

Great place - apart from the hectoring and sanctimonious signage. Fantastic aquarium and despite its distance from the centre quick and easy to get to. Sea otters were the highlight. One piece of advice: ignore the signs accompanying the exhibits/aquariums because their hectoring and sanctimonious tone will irritate you after a short while. I began to feel that I was being singlehandly accused of slaughtering penguins and smashing up the Great Barrier Reef by the end of the visit! I don't object to the educating mission of the Ocenarium but the eco message is laid on with a trowel, to say the least! The message does appear to focus on the West (which is understandable) but I can't remember the last time I hunted a turtle...

Wonderfull for kids (4 & 14), parents & grandparents!. We stayed in Lisbon for 3 day´s in august 2011 and spent one afternoon at the Oceanario. It is not that easy to please the different interests of a family travelling together. But the diversity of the sea shown at the Oceanario has been fascinating for all of us! Also the surrounding area offered many other attractions (water plays, rental bikes, cafe´s...)
Great with kids, out of the way. Out of the way, great for kids, expensive but fun, find out if any special exhibits

FANTASTIC. We took our 2 children here on our 3 day trip to Lisbon and I can honestly say as adults we enjoyed this just as much as our children. I was amazed at the amount of variety of fish also sea otters and penguins. When we visited there was a temporary exhibition which had Giant loggerhead turtles and they were amazing. A fantastic way to spend an afternoon in Lisbon.
Has to be one of the best in the world!. Went with my 8 year old son and had a great time...he loved the penguins, a great place to learn about the oceans....

Fun day out. We saw a long queue to get into the oceanario, but we waited about 10 minutes in the end. The ticket office is highly efficient and the staff was kind.The oceanario was amazing, it was very well presented as well.It was definitely worth visiting, and it was also nice to get a break from climbing up the endless hills of the city.

Great experience to learn about the oceans of the world. The "Oceanário de Lisboa", Europe's second largest sea aquarium, is well worth visiting, for adults as well as for children. It is extremely well done and has every ocean, from the Artic with ice and penguins to the Tropics with rays and sharks with a total of about 8,000 animals living there. It opened to the public in 1998, after the EXPO 98, where it was one of the major attractions. Besides the huge main tank which can be looked at in two levels - near surface and bottom, there are some 25 small aquariums, focussing on special points of interest. You will need at least 2-3hrs (if your kids don't get tired) to stroll through, rest at the large plexiglass windowss and watch the elegant rays, sleek sharks and houndreds of other fish gliding past. Don't miss the slide show just before the end of the tour which tells you a lot about the technical details of managing the huge Aquarium. Sometimes one can see divers feeding the fish or cleaning the rocks or windows. At the end you'll have to go through the Oceanário's souvenir shop. A very useful item to buy is the "Guide OCEANÁRIO de LISBOA" which has a wealth of well done explanations about the oceans of the world and the management of the aquarium. I visited the place the three times, once with my wife to get to know it, then with three of my 15yrs old dive students on a fish identification exercise and this week with my 7 yrs old grand daughter. No restrictions amatuer phographing or filming. It was worth it every time!
Well worth the visit. It's all fish. Tons of species that I've never seen before. Well laid out building. Beautiful grounds and take the cable car over the ocean too. Well worth it.

3 year old loved it!. Lots of fun for kids and adults. Its located next to the water and its a very nice walk along the boardwalk here.Huge aquarium which can be seen from multiple spots on all sides. Sharks, manta rays and tons of other fish can be seen. Another area has penguins and differents types of sea creatures.It's located very close to one of the large shopping malls in Lisbon so you stop there to eat or shop as well.

Great place to visit. The Oceanarium was a wonderfull experience, I loved it.Tickets costs 12 euro, witch I don't find expensive for what they offer you.The main aquarium can be observed from 2 levels, it's big and full of many marine species.Besides that, there are a few environments recreated: tropical, antarctic with penguins, mediterranean and also other smaller aquariums.There I saw for the first time otters. Very cute how they played together.Another thing: there's a room like a cinema with a big screen and chairs where visitors can see how the Oceanarium is working and what tasks are performed by the employees.I strongly recommend it !!!

A great way to spend a Monday.... We ended up at the Oceanario because all the museums that we wanted to visit on our last Monday were closed. We were not really psyched about spending our time and money at a touristy spot like this, but I have to say that we were very impressed. A special sea turtle exhibit was going on with a glass tunnel where the massive turtles swam right over and under us. I think we spent two hours watching all the creatures in the center tank and at the otter ponds. I have attached a photo of the center tank. The tickets were a bit pricy for our wallets, (15.50 each for a combo ticket that was good for the sea turtle exhibit and the regular exhibit). In the end it was money well spent and we had an awesome steak dinner at a restaurant across from the Oceanario but I cant remember the name of the place right now. Will post more when I find the name of this place.

Nice sea aquarium but entrance tickets are expensive. The Oceanario is a very nice sea aquarium. We especially loved the middle part with this huge aquarium. There are a lot of different species to see, from sharks to frogs and pinguins. It's also a place to cool down after a hot summer day in Lisboa.My major complaint about the Oceanario is the entrance price, I thought that 15,50 euros was too high comparing the size and the entertainment level of this attraction, although I know that a sea aquarium like this is very expensive to maintain.

Best One i have ever been to. I normally do not like aquariums i find them very dull, but my wife wanted to go so i went for her. I was completely entranced by the whole experience. If you are in Lisbon do not miss it

Good but not among the best. Over the years of traveling to many places, I attempt to visit aquariums where I can. This one is good but not as extensive as others I have been able to see. It has a nice large aquarium with assortment and plenty of small exhibits. The variety was not significant but reasonable. For example the one in Monterey, California and Sydney are world class and better. It is worth the vist however and is set in a newer area in Lisbon which is alone worth seeing.

SIMPLY AMAZING, HUGE!!!!. The oceanario was perfect, great location! So big and the price is small. They have I believe to different "collections". There is just so much to see, it isn't you're regular aquarium.

we are happy we did it. This was a very nice experience , tropic , north atlantic and subtropic basin and areaswith birds fish and not at least beavers we have never seen beavers before , nicenice big basin with sharks , turtles manta rays and all kind of fish

Great Oceanarium. This is small enough to walk around in an hour or two, depending on how long you spend at each exhibit. You are allowed to get pretty close to some of the animals, which is a nice change. During our visit, their temporary exhibit was turtles and it was great!After the oceanarium, you can take a walk down a looong boardwalk (or take a cable car thing) to the area they built for the world's fair and end up at a great mall (and the metro station!)
Best tip for Lisbon. You must visit this space and also the area. The EXPO 1998 was here and the area isnow a new Lisbon. Spend one or two hours at Ocanario special if it is outside.
Fun time at the aquarium. This aquarium is pretty big and a lot of fun. Lots or varieties of fish and other marine animals. We were there for a couple of hours but the time flew by.

Fantastic aquarium in fun waterfront setting.. Simple excellent from top to bottom. I've been to several very well known aquariums from Genoa to Chicago's Shedd etc and this is a great spot. Great central tank has a large number of different vantage points on multiple levels, along with separate areas dedicated to different corners of the world and their animals, including penguins, otters, and a wide range of fish naturally. Don't miss the little park next door or the series of fountains/wave pools running near the ocean front.

we were lucky to see the otter-feeding. One of the most wonderful places I've ever seen.We spent there the most incredible afternoon, the place is quite big so there is really a lot to see.There are also small places to rest, and some scientific information very interesting.The moon-fish is amazing and we were lucky to see the otter-feeding, it was something special!

Very Nice. The Oceanario is a nice treat to visit while in Lisbon. My girlfriend and I took the metro to the Oriente station. From there we walked across the street and straight through the Vasco Da Gamma Mall. This is a good time to grab something to eat in the food court. Once full, we then continued out the back of the mall, where you face the water front. Make a right, head straight down about 4-5 minutes and you will get to the Oceanario.You can't miss it. The building itself is cube shaped. The fee was around 15-17 Euro's pending if you wanted to go see the temporary exhibit or not. At the time we visited, the temporary exhibit featured "Sea Turtles". The rest of the oceanrium was very well maintained. There is one giant aquarium tank filled with all sorts of fish, sharks, sea-stars etc. As you tour the Oceanarium, you get different vantage points of that same tank, so don't get all stressed out if one window is full of people. Just keep walking and you WILL get about 20 or more chances to see it. There are separate rooms, as well, that feature penguins, pelicans, otters and one that has a tropical rainforest environment. Towards the end of the Oceanarium, there are smaller aquariums. One of them had a huge octopus and another was full of cniderians (jelly-fish)It took us about an hour and a half to visit the whole thing. My girlfriend and I both recommend it, although the price is a bit steep.

do not go if you only have an hour to spare. This aquarium is the best I have ever been to, we expected to be there for an hour and spent hours instead. It represent every ocean with the fish and birds that you would find in the region, the tank is the biggest I have ever seen just teeming with fish even a sun ray................There are even some penguins and birds.There are plenty of viewing windows on two levels and lots of information on the walls of the species you can see plus more on conservation. There is not enough information about this fantastic place on the websites. They only describe it as an aquarium It is another world!!!! In a fantastic area of Lisbon
Must be seen!!. This place allows you to see a lot of interesting species. Great place to go!

a Must see in Lisbon. if you have little ones, you definitely must go. What a blast. I loved the penguins, seeing teh turtles and also walking on 'water' (really it's a very strong glass but I tell you i had to still hold my husbands hand to walk over it!) the otters were fun as were seeing the fishes, sharks, rays etc. Wow.. Lisbon you rock. I never expected to have such a great few hours. Also the area where the Oceanarium is, was the site of the 1998 Expo. Beautiful spots to picnic and sit by the Tagus!

big blue spot. If you love fishes, sharks, puinguins you must go. You may choose to watch the big tank from one angle for a long time or travel from window to window searching for you favoutite species. The florest room and the pinguins are a small trip to tropics or big north.

huge aquarium with interesting species. I am slightly biased because I love watching fish and sea creatures. But this is a very modern structure in the country anyway (located in the 1998 Expo area) so it is different from anything you see in central Lisbon and therefore worth visiting. Bring a camera with you because on a sunny day you will want to take pictures not only of the animals (remember don't use flash) but also the waterfront next to the aquarium. It is very easy to find, takes around 10-15 minutes from the metro station and on the way you will see other relatively new buildings as well. I think you should allow the site to take at least two hours to visit.The permanent exhibition is amazing, with a main tank (about 3 meters tall) in the middle which you will keep surrounding and smaller rooms for species in different parts of the ocean. You will be able to look at some of the animals in a very close distance, like the penguins and birds, as there are no barriars inbetween. Absolutely love the sea otters, and I wasn't the only one because I noticed that people in general stayed to watch them for at least 10 minutes.There is also currently a temporary exhibition of sea turtles, which you pay an extra 3-4 euros to go into. These turtles are big and kids will definitely enjoy watching them.

Relaxing and refreshing oasis. This is a very nice place to go, especially if you have kids. Not only is it interesting for itself, it's also good to see the "new" Lisbon, as opposed to the old town which will be most part of what you'll see during your stay in this city.Make sure not to miss the otters: I could have stayed hours watching them clean up!! So funny and cute!The central tank is very impressive with everything it contains, especially with its sharks swimming around slowly and imperially, like it owns the place. Very impressive!Also try not to pass by the lanternfish tank. It seems like a black window but when you get closer and pay attention, you'll see blinking little lights in the darkness. There's an interesting short video (about 20 to 30 minutes - in Portuguese subtitled in English) showing how the place is kept and cleaned, and the animals fed.If you're lucky, you'll get to see the 2 divers feeding the rays and all the other little fishies following the move.From what I gather, they organize sleep overs for kids: they set up their beds on the floor in front of the main thank. Must be quite a thing to do!! (I would myself!)One of the main purpose of the place is to promote ocean awareness. There's a lot of explanations on how to chose the right fish to eat (if fish you eat), how to spare and save water, sort your waste, etc... all at a child's level so that everyone understands and remembers. A bonus point from me for this!One advice: if you have half a day to spare, go for it!!

Breathtaking. The Oceanarium is an astonishing attraction: informative, educational and entertaining for children and adults.
We visited on a rainy Sunday in February, it wasn't too crowded so it was a very pleasant place to be for a few hours.
The architecture and surroundings are interesting too.

Fascinating trip across 3 oceans. I really enjoyed my visit to the Lisbon Oceanarium. At first, I was a bit terrified by the huge queue at the main entrance, but the ticket stale is organised perfectly and I didn’t have to wait longer than 15 minutes. The whole Oceanarium consists of an enormous aquarium and many separate exhibitions – some are devoted to 3 oceans (Atlantic, Indian and Pacific) while other to different sea creatures. The main aquarium is located in the very centre of the building – during the visit and you walk around it from the top to the very bottom and you have the possibility to watch oceanic life on different levels. I love this idea. What’s more, you can not only stay or sit among the crowd in front of a gigantic window with fish behind it, but you can also hide in the corner or other secret spot (there are plenty of them) and admire the sea life almost privately. ‘Ocean’ exhibitions are numerous aquariums showing fish, other animals and plants living in one of the oceans. There are also ‘mini zoos’ presenting life above an ocean. I especially liked the humid jungle at the shores of the Indian Ocean and freezing air of the Arctic Sea.There’s also a section devoted to ecological issues and I really appreciate it. They give you a lot of simple advice on how to protect oceanic life. Almost all notices are in English. There are also many facilities for disabled people and children – everyone can enjoy this great trip across 3 oceans.In my opinion, the only disadvantage was too many tourists: sometimes I had difficulties watching some parts of exhibition because of the crowd.

One of the tops in Lisbon. Defenitely one of the top attractions of Lisbon. The aquarium is easily accessible on foot from the “Oriente” metro station (about 10 minutes). Normal ticket costs 12 Euro which is fair enough. The best way for seeing the sea creatures is to seat in front of one of the many "windows", so reserve enough time (I spent there 4 hours).The Oceanario provides very broad types of additional activities like guided tors, special lectures and so on".Please note that in Oceanario it is not allowed to take pictures with flash, so take the tripod with you!

Fun, fun, fun. We like oceanariums - we saw quite a few around the world. So this is not a competely objective review, but... it's a great place and you can have lots of fun if you are willing to allow yourself to simply enjoy seeing all the wonderful fish, birds etc.We went there as a couple, no kids (if you don't count us) and had a very enjoyable experience. There were lots of kids around (but also adults) and everybody was having a good time. The central aquarium is really big and amazing from every side, but for us, the highlight was seeing the sea otters at play - we could have looked at them for hours (we definitely spent 20-30 minutes watching them). Beautiful, playful creatures, they just fill your heart with joy.Do yourself a favour - when you get tired of shopping or history or eating, take this enjoyable break.

Out of this world experience. Great place to explore for an afternoon. It has one huge central tank in the centre and lots of small tanks on the side which copy different environments from around the world. I really felt like I was deep sea diving it really was quite magical. There was also different displays of tiny tanks with strange looking ocean creatures that look like they should be on an alien planet. It’s a great day out for adults and kids…and when I say kids I mean lots of them. We went on a Saturday and had to fight shouting kids, and hassled parents. If you are a parent make sure your kid doesn’t bang on the tank, it really stresses the fish. My only complaint about the aquarium was the lack of information on the different species of fish I was looking at and the audio guide I paid for was soooo boring that I gave up trying to listen to it. Staff are not helpful either.

Great Layout. It is not just for kids if you enjoy seeing aquatic life. It is separated by 4 regions of the world with an above water & under water portion with a large center tank with a bunch of sharks & rays. There are a lot of different vantage points to check out all the water life. They even have penguins to see & they were swimming in the water which was really cool to see

message in a bottle. As an animal lover and vegetarian, I tend to feel a bit unsure about zoo-like attractions - however the Oceanarium is fascinating, modern, educational and with a real message - overfishing and pollution is a timebomb - we have to be more considerate!!! It's not just about the fish we eat but about the knock-on effect this has on the whole aquatic ecosystem ie. 'our' world, the planet earth.The central tank is just incredible - you can just spend hours sitting watching... and then there are four ocean environments which you experience from above (with birds and plants) and below - absolutely brilliant

A must if you have children. Yes. I consider that if you hace children this a is a must, it´s good also for adults as this is a very good oceanarium. The building itself is beautiful but that you can see from outside.For adults only I think there is so many others things to see in Lisbon. So it´s worth it IF you have plenty of time

How to Have Fun at the Oceanarium if you are an Adult..... So the Oceanarium is OK. It's a perfectly nice aquarium, but if you live near a fancy aquarium at home, it is probably at least as exciting as the Oceanario. However, if you are looking for something to do in Lisbon, it is well worth a trip to go to the Oceanario in the morning to admire the fish, then take the cable car one way over the pier (not sure exactly where it is supposed to go), get off on the other side, and then walk back towards the Oceanario. When you walk back you will see a series of restaurants in the park along the pier. Have lunch there! I had a fantastic lunch at Senhor Peixe. From there you can walk back to Oriente and take the metro to your hotel, or go shopping in Vasco de Gama mall.

Excellent for small and big kids (adults)!. 3 adults spent a Sunday afternoon here in May. We could have spent longer. It is very well done with 4 different oceans and habitats depicted. Seeing the main tank at different levels as one makes ones way around allows for great views at different depths. The penguins swimming deep was a revelation. The sea otter must come from Hollywood the way he played to the audience. A great afternoon for young or old.
Definately worth a visit if in Lisbon!. Really good aquarium! Loads of different creatures to see! (My favourite being the sea otters!)
Very good for kids. Very good for kids

Good to visit with the Family. We went to the Oceanarium late in the day, around 4:30 and found that 2 hours was plenty of time to see it all. The Oceanarium is a primarly a giant tank that you walk around on 2 floors with many smaller tanks on the sides. There are then open areas that have different climates within - of note is an area where the penguins swim around - kids loved it. There is a gift shop and cafeteria on the ground floor - washrooms are located in here. Parking is easy to find with a garage a block away. Signage is very good to finding the attraction and parking

Well worth a visit. The Oceanarium has many different species all in one tank, with regulated temperatures from arctic to tropical. It was a great experience and fun for both adults and children alike. One thing though, we bought two audio guides and could have done with one or even none between the 2 of us. I think those are a waste of time. Apart from that, highly recommended.
One Word: Awesome!. One Word: Awesome! It was well worth the subway trip to find this place!

Amazing aquarium. The Oceanarium is an amazing site not to miss if you are in Lisbon. It has all kind of different and exotic fish from all over the world. Appreciated by adults and children although it can be a bit tiring for small children has the visit will last at least 2h.

Amazing, magical.. This is a must see place! The central tank is massive and you can see in from many different angles. It has sharks, tuna, and a gigantic sunfish!! He seemed to know he was the star and made many trips passed visitors.Several times, we just sat on the floor right up against the glass and stared at the passing fish. It was mesmorizing. They have a small "behind the scenes" section that explains things like quarenteen and raising the organisms before they go into bigger tanks. They also have a short film on loop about the oceanarium. Unfortunately, there was ZERO info on the sunfish in either the literature, movie, or gift shop. It is a perfect place to spend the hotter parts of the day, and the surrounding area has awesome shopping!

Well worth a visit for a rainy day in Lisbon. During our Easter week 2009 visit to Lisbon, my wife read this was a "must see" place. We took the Metro to Orietnte station on the red line, got off & walked the short distance to it. It is very well done & worth a visit. Especially if you have young children with you, they will enjoy it! Yes, the "Sun Fish" is very impressive! This is not "Sea World" with dolphins doing tricks in large pools. It is a small oceanarium with very interesting tanks of sea animals to view. If you have an interest of marine life & the ecology of the oceans, you will enjoy this attraction.

Magic Place. We offer a trip to Lisbon to my children as one of their Christmas presents (we are from Porto). And of course one of the places they want to after the zoo was the “Oceanário”. We have been there 3 times already but it was the first time to my younger daughter (almost 4 years old). And she “is in love“ with it! She would stay there for the all day if we let her. And for us is always magic to go there! Specially the lower floor with its darkness and sounds (please go to the website to listen the kind of sounds we hear there: the ocean itself!) and how special is to see that animals just near our feet. We feel like we are in the depth of ocean! Also the documentary and the exhibition about how the “Oceanário” works is very pleasant (is spoken in Portuguese but it has sub-titles in English. By-the-way, all of the exhibits have brief but informative explanations in Portuguese and English, most of the time over the aquarium box we are looking at. The central aquarium has also written information on the side walls and because it is a little dark you may not see it right-way). Don’t miss that! Go there!

Fabulous aquarium. This attraction was built as part of Expo 1998 in Lisbon and doesn't seem to get as much attention as it deserves. It is a very special aquarium - the best we've seen -- and should not be missed if you have an extra several hours in Lisbon. The Expo park is a taxi ride from downtown or the Eduardo VII Park area. When the taxi drops you, it still isn't obvious where the Oceanario building is and the signage isn't great. Just walk toward the river and you'll see it to your left. The really neat layout has a very large tank in the center with separate areas in each "corner" of the building representing the major ocean areas of the world. They all come together in the center -- representing the oneness of the world's oceans. All areas are viewed from many vantage points and on two levels. We were just enchanted. It's a wonderful break from cathedrals and museums.
Don;t miss it. We were there last April, 2006. The Oceanarium is great. It is well kept and the exhibitions, specially the penguins and the otters are amazing.

The kids will love this place, young and old.. Having now visited the Oceanarium for the second time, I can honestly say that I enjoyed both trips equally. By the way, the large fish mentioned in a previous review is called a Sun Fish. Not a bad looking fish, just unusual and his numbers a declining quickly in the wild. I'm sure children of all ages would enjoy a trip to the Oeanarium. The little ones will enjoy looking out for 'Nemo'. All of the exhibits have brief but informative explanations and guides (and are occassionally interactive). The penguins and otters can be seen diving/swimming under water from the lower level. The entry fee is ten euros per adult and little ones under three get in for free.
Well worth a visit. If you go to Lisbon make sure you visit the Oceanarium, it is well laid out with plenty to see.

Excellent place to observe marine life. The Oceanarium is easy to reach. Take the metro to Oriente (Red Line), then walk through the huge 'Vasco da Gama' shopping mall (good buffet lunches on top floor - remember that here you pay by weight so don't overload your plate), then turn right and it's 5 minutes' walk. Admission is 9 euros, with a small reduction for students. Well worth it. The huge central tank contains many species of shark, sunfish, manta rays and others, all co-existing in apparent harmony. There are some splended small fry, too, especially the sea-horses and sea-dragons, and the penguins and otters are also very popular. Well-stocked gift-shop and rather modest sandwich bar adjacent.

oceanarium. although this place was really nice it wasnt the biggest as was expected.. it was really great to see animals like sea otters playing and penguins and stuff, the one thing that amazed me tho was this odd looking fish that looked like a no shell turtle on its side, and flippers one on top one on bottom flapping same time as each other, do fish flap??well i still have no idea what its called and no signs for it anywhere so if you go to this place...look out for it in the huge middle tank..price was reasonable E9.00 for adult and the area its in is a nice place to eat and shop and if you get the metro to the oriente its all within walking distance..
